description:
Taco Tuesdays here are fun but a bit hectic. If you get there early enough, you might be able to find a table, otherwise you're stuck competing for standing space close to a bar. 

You get 2 tacos for $7, though this doesn't apply to any of the fish tacos which are definitely worth trying. All of the tacos are pretty large, so two is more than enough. 

The carnitas and carne asada are pretty standard, and definitely benefit from going "Nick's Way", which adds a huge scoop of guac and melty cheese on the tortilla. My favorite taco here though is the pescado, which is a fried fish taco with mayo and slaw. The batter on the fish is crispy and not too greasy. IMO, you really don't need the extra guac or cheese for any of the fish tacos.

Go on Tuesdays for a fun after work activity with friends. If you don't want to eat your tacos in a rowdy club, it's worth going another weeknight, especially if you want to try other things on the menu.
author: Joanna X.

description:
Nick's Crispy Tacos? More like Nick's Soggy Quesadillas.

I attended a catered event here in the evening and the food was pretty substandard. I had a great time though, so the venue is a nice after hours club!
author: Grace O.

description:
Service was great Angelina was nice. I wasn't too hungry so i just got 3 tacos and a side of beans and rice for my daughter and i. The inside looks like a large set of a haunted house. Dim and gothic chandeliers with dark red walls and black furniture.  I noticed a man coming in for a large catering order to pick,  so,  i guess they do pretty well.  My tacos  1. Steak (very dry under seasoned meat)  on a plain warmed tortilla was not great the steak was over cooked chewy and had no flavor beside cow. 
2. Grilled chicken (very dry over cooked meat) again not well seasoned just plain chicken and again a warm plain tortilla. 
3. Shredded chicken with sauce.  Finally very good , cooked perfectly seasoned good although the tortilla is just Warmed plain tortilla.  My beans and rice were fantastic. Very good beans, the flavor was perfect the cheese they use was my fav (jack) .
I personally think they should at least grill the tortillas, not just warm them.  Add some seasoning to the meat and insure it's tender and moist (not dry and chewy)  as far as the salsas they range from mild, med, hot,  and the habanero was killer hot.  The pico was good and the chips were good.  Id come back but id order something else.
author: Rachel D.

description: This place is a block away from my clay studio and I have become addicted to their Fish tacos. Not the grilled but the fried version, done Nick's way, is what I think about when hunger strikes. They fry one of the tortillas so it has a cup shape and the second tortilla they leave soft wrapped over the fried one and I just looooove that crunch! The two sauces on the table are not spicy at all but lends good taste and allows you to pretend like you have taste buds that withstand fiery spices. A little pricey to have a small taco ending up almost $8 (because one is definitely not enough!). Elote was good, but the corn kernel itself was oddly small; perhaps different type of corn than the ones I'm used to? Nevertheless, come. Enjoy the odd ambience of a bar that serves taco during the day. Great place for sport watching on weekends and bring cash. No credit cards.
author: Stephanie L.

description: Very mediocre street taco.  I don't get what the hype is around these tacos, because it tastes pretty average to me.  Street tacos to me means that the tortilla has gotta be dipped animal fat and then put on the plancha to cook!  This looked like it was just taken outta a bag and warmed up.  The meat and salsa that you could add to it wasn't anything to write home about either.  Meh.
author: Carena N.

description: I LOVE ROGUE & NICK'S ESPECIALLY ON TUESDAY NIGHTS! They have a dj and all of the chaqndeliers on the roof and it turns into a huge party. I definitely r4ecommend trying it out, especially if your trying to go out mi-week or have friends in town. Food is great, atmosphere is better.
author: Ellie J.

description:
I'm husband and I can here on taco Tuesday and with as much hype as I read in these reviews, I was thoroughly disappointed for a couple of reasons. 

1. The service was horrible, every employee acts like they hate their lives and does not hide it. 

2. Only take cash but tell you this after you order, kind of inconvenient. When you have to leave, go to the atm, pay a fee and then go stand in the long freaking line again to start all over. 

3. Get ready, all tables are reserved on Tuesday nights; only barstools are open for seating. 

4. It's SO damn loud in this place on Tuesday. Like literally dark, with techno lights and super loud music. It was exactly like a nightclub at 7pm - the worst if you're actually trying to have a conversation with the people you're with.  

5. My husband ordered a beer and they wouldn't let him bring it outside to our table. There were no tables inside, therefore causing him to throw it away. 

6. There are many mentions of the HUGE tacos at this place but don't be fooled, they are basically just full of beans and salsa, VERY LITTLE MEAT and the meat that's on there is basic. 

Probably won't be back. There are better taco Tuesday's in the city.
author: Bethany M.

description:
Very solid for Taco Tuesday. They stuff their tacos and honestly 2 is enough for $7. The meat is a bit dry but with the sauce it balances out. the red sauce is horrid but the green one is quite delicious. We also got the chips and that was a decent deal with all the guac and accompanying veggies.

The beer specials aren`t bad and its definitely a great place to relax with some friends on Tuesday evening. One bad thing is the seating. There`s all these booths that are reserved and everyone else is squished in the smaller tables and bar so that kinda sucks but whatever.
author: Taylor Z.

description:
Lots of hype but in my opinion just another taco place that has a special gimmick! CASH. ONLY. CHECK IN ON YELP FOR FREE FOOD. 

PARKING -- busy street and no lot. 

AMBIANCE -- grungy and dirty feeling in the restaurant but it is a spacious place. Lots of booths. The walls and drapes are all red which I found pretty random. 

SERVICE -- quick, they want to get through the line of people as quickly as possible. Wish they'd take cash! 

FOOD -- as others say, I'd recommend the carne asada taco, done Nicks style. One was enough for me and I got a free chips and salsa for the yelp checkin. WOULD HAVE GOT MORE BUT THIS PLACE WAS CASH ONLY!!! Pretty greasy food but good for a complement to a night out on Polk st area. 

DID I MENTION THEY DONT TAKE CARD?? Cash. Only!!!!
author: RachEl L.

description:
Best taco tuesdays in the city!! :)
I love Nick's and the tacos are just GIGANTIC, seriously.. two is more than enough! They add a looot of meat and beans, and guac and salsa, its the perfect taco to be honest. 
Their margarita pitcher is also delicious and veeery generous... I love their service, Lobo (one of the waiters) is so sweet and the blond girl as well. We always have one of them to get our food order and the other one our drink order, we already know the drill by now. Fourth week in a row doing Taco Tuesdays at Nick's this week and we'll continue to count :)
author: Daffny V.

description: Tried the elote, fish taco and carne asada taco. Ordered through Postmates and it was delivered fast and tasted fresh.
author: Melissa P.

description: Came here for taco Tuesday for the first time and it was not what I was expecting. The deal sounds good enough, sign up on line to subscribe for updates and get a coupon emailed to you for $2 tacos (limit 2) on tuesdays. You can choose from a variety of meats such as carne asada, pollo asada, pollo, carnitas, vegetarian. I tried all but the vegetarian and I was shocked at how crappy the tacos were for how many reviews and how high the average ratings this place has. They don't give you a lot of meat and the beans aren't even fully cooked. I had heard this place was good but after this visit, I don't think I'll return. This place has a good chill vibe but I wouldn't come back for tacos.
author: Alan C.

description:
Made it to one of my bucket list taco places! The crispy part of the taco was amazing! One shell is fried and then wrapped in a soft taco, really does well for texture. I got the chicken asado and the fried chicken. Both were great but fried chicken takes the cake!! The place was busy at lunch hour on a Tuesday, but was able to order fast and find a spot. The place looks like it could be a night club at night. They were showing the World Cup game on several TVs and played the volume when it came to crucial time. 

CASH ONLY: definitely something to remember
author: Brielle W.

description:
Came here after a friend recommended it, and regretted it once we entered. This is literally a club blasting music with a full bar that definitely focuses on the club aspect than the food. I am not sure why they even serve food here. The club is divided into 2 portions, one side being the lavish bar, the other side being a "restaurant". Seat yourself and order at the counter type of place, but you cannot hear a single word the person next to you is saying. Like a club, you literally have to yell to communicate. So the atmosphere was not ideal to eat anything.

The tacos itself are nothing to write home about. Basic flavors and toppings that you can get anywhere. The nachos were decent, in terms of size and flavor. They have 2 salsas, none of which are spicy. The food just was not good, and the atmosphere was just annoying. If I went in wanting the club experience, than it's great. But this place should not bother serving food here.

Also, CASH ONLY. For food and at the bar.
author: Tarun S.

description:
This restaurant has some very interesting decor. Their food is good too. On Fridays they have special offers on food. We tried the cheese quesdilla and it was fantastic. We also tried the veggie burrito , shrimp tacos and veggie tacos. Everything tasted good. 

Overall it's a nice place to hangout with friends and have some drinks with food.
author: Bhawna J.

description:
Despite being an modest fish taco lover and living in the Bay Area for 10+ years, I had never been to Nick's. Sure I'd heard of it and driven by but never tried the food. After an impromptu hike at Land's End, my cousin suggested fish tacos to refuel. 

The inside is pretty clean, large, and spacious with ample seating. Apparently, it turns into (Rouge) a nightclub during the evenings. You order at the counter in the back, (cash only but there is an ATM for a $2.75 fee) take your number, and find a seat. The service was quick, friendly, and efficient.

The food came out relatively quick since it wasn't busy that Sunday afternoon. The chips and guac were average, as well as the horchata. I got the pescado taco and a camarones taco - nick's way made crispy with jack cheese and guac. The food was about a 4/5. The portions were huge (one taco was probably enough) and tasty, but nothing to rave about. Pricing was average. I would probably come back if I was in the area and craving a fish taco.
author: Rachelle Anne J.

description: Tourist trap tacos. Skip this joint. Taco meats were dry, single tortilla on street tacos. Not impressed.
author: W B.

description:
I would say this is more of a club than a restaurant so brave yourself for extremely loud music but some of the best tacos you'll ever have! We walked in and it was beyond packed! Everything is pretty much first come first serve as far as seating goes (aside from a few booths that can be reserved). They have a full bar and pitchers of margaritas that looked yummy but we didn't stay for drinks. 

There's a small area in the back corner where you order food and they give you a stick with a number on it and then someone magically finds you outta nowhere in the crazy crowd with your food. There are little side bars you can stand at and eat, luckily we found an open one. It was happy hour so I stuck with the happy hour options - one carnitas and one steak. The guy said two would be plenty and I didn't wanna believe him but listened and glad I did. They were big tacos and omg so delicious! 

We decided not to stay after we ate as we had just got back from biking around the city and were severely under dressed so the quick service served its purposes because we were starving but we weren't dressed as most were, ready to start their evening out on the town. 

Overall, very good food with quick service but if you don't like loud music or a club type of scene then it's prob not the place for you.
author: Dana N.

description: Mind you the bartender was absolutely amazing.  I got the carne asada nachos and they were not the best I've ever had. The fish tacos which my dinner mates got  were amazing to them. But this is pretty normal tasting food. I will say that the bar side is wonderful. The bartender makes an excellent margarita and there's plenty of TVs for any sports fan. Overall it was a nice time but it was a pretty average experience not to mention for food you should make sure you have cash, they do not take cards. However there is an ATM machine. If I were to visit again I would def go straight to the bar for drinks and a good time.
author: Ashley M.

description:
We got 2 pitchers of margs and a bunch of tacos to try! I ate the fried chicken taco and a pork taco (I believe). They were aiiiiiiight! The atmosphere and vibes were better than the tacos.
The marg wasn't that strong, but hey, we still had a good time!
author: Michael K.

description:
Every time I come here, they push back on every request.  Today I just wanted cheese on my tacos.  He said "no". 
"I'll pay"
"I can give you a side"
"Right! And just put it on the tacos"
"No"

Weird.  Wish there were more taqueria's on the street.  This place needs some competition. 

And the food is average at best.
author: Paul Z.

description: One of the BEST tacos I've ever had. My friend took me to this place and since then I can't stop thinking about it. I always order a Carne Asada Taco Nick's way. It is amazing with their mild green salsa! The shell on the inside is fried and just the crispness of the Taco makes it 10x better. The tacos are pretty big. 2 is filling enough for me. Customer service is great, never fails to get my food in a quick matter of time. Downfalls are that it's CASH ONLY and they're located on a busy street so parking may be hard to find. The place is pretty big & has a bar. Have yet to see it during the nightlife, but I can imagine how great the tacos would be if I was drunk.
author: Kimberly D.

description: "These tacos are bad" was a recurring statement after getting our order. And that's because they were. Small, not crispy at all, and with not much meat (we got the shrimp and pescado). The churro was decent, as was the elote. Prices are relatively high for what you get. Having tried "Nick's way" tacos elsewhere, I was excited to try the original, however came out disappointed. Sad face.
author: Mikey J.

description: Nick's Crispy Taco's is an institution. I've been here a few times. The tacos are okay, but nothing too special. Really, people come here for the atmosphere. After a night of drinking on Polk Street, Nick's is the perfect place to go. You must try it Nick's Way.
author: Joanna S.

description: Tacos are good, service is great (pretty much get your food within minutes of ordering). Not convinced this is the place for best fish tacos in San Francisco (on the hunt to find them) but worth coming to if you are in the area!
author: Nada T.

description:
Was running by and had this bookmarked for awhile. I grabbed the two street tacos for $5 meal. 
-Carnitas
-Steak 

The tacos were very average, not terrible but not worthy of anything greater than a two star rating. That said, it did look to have a lot of patrons so I'm sure I'll give them another shot.


The world needs a San Francisco Taco ranking...so I'm here to provide my humble list/rankings. 

Ranking explained:  #1 (listed at the top) is my favorite/ #?  (listed at the bottom) is my least favorite. 

When I look at reviews sometimes just want to know where to go or how a user compares one venue against another to see if we have similar tastes. If you're curious, I have rankings for Boba, Bakeries and Ramen , Chicken and Waffles as well (random right?)  Follow my profile to see my most recent reviews.  I hope I can be helpful since so many Yelpers have helped me discover new places.  

Rod's SF Taco Rankings:

author: Rod M.

description:
This place is super famous, so I had to check it out after a bunch of my coworkers said how great it was. 

Let's start with the atmosphere: It's got a dive bar feel to it. the restaurant is on the opposite side of the building than the bar, which feels super disjointed. The restaurant side was busy, and they only take cash. There's an ATM, but there's a high fee so bring cash if you can. 

There's barely any staff, which is a little off-putting. It makes getting a drink a little cumbersome. There's little to no decor and a lot of space (it doubles as a nightclub so that makes sense). During the day they have tons of tables moved on to the stage and around the dance floors. 

The tacos were super overpriced for what you get, as are the margaritas. $5 for tiny glass that's 3/4 ice. I drank about three and had to cut myself off due to the cost, not the effect.

The only thing that will keep me coming back is the pico and chips. I literally crave their pico de gallo, it's so fresh and well seasoned. I wish I could find a copycat recipe! The way they serve it is nacho style, so on top of the chips. The chips are crispy enough to not get soggy under the pico, and the pico isn't too watery like some that I have had.

If this place wasn't as expensive and laid out so weird, I'd want to come back for more than chips and salsa. Unfortunately, I only come to the bay once a year so I probably won't be back to this location for a few years.
author: Brittany F.

description: 3.5 stars. Pollo asado taco- nick's style was full of flavor. Beans, cheese, crispy tortilla and perfectly cooked chicken. The Carne asada taco was underwhelming. The meat needed more seasoning and to be fresher. I did appreciate the guacamole overload! The jamica was also the perfect balance of sweetness.
author: Jessica G.

description:
I finally got to try Nick's Crispy Tacos on Taco Tuesday and I must say I was a little disappointed. I think it was because I was expecting better due to all the hype, but I just overall thought it was okay. The best part of the meal was the $2 chips and salsa with guac as a Taco Tuesday special! I also ordered 2 carne asada tacos that were pretty dry, and a Pescado fish Taco in their specialty: "Nick's Way". Nick's way is a crispy tortilla and soft tortilla put together, along with jack cheese and guac. The crispiness was good...however they did not put enough guac for me so I was a little disappointed since Nick's Way is an extra $1.50.

Btw, it is cash only, and it gets really crowded so come early because tables are first come first serve. I had to wait about 30 min to finally get a good seat for me and my boyfriend. So come early, or be prepared to scramble for seats.
author: Amanda C.

description: TACOS!!!! They were amazing!!! Drinks - I didn't care for but the tacos were where it's at! I had two pollo asado tacos and they were actually huge! I didn't expect them to be as big as they were and they were absolutely delicious. I also had the sangria for happy hour which was actually very weird tasting - never had I had a sangria that tasted that bad (don't get the red sangria). the tacos made up for the drinks though! Great customer service all around.
author: Nesha P.

description:
The tacos were only okay. I ordered a tiger shrimp taco, tiger shrimp are normally larger, but these were over-cooked down to nothing and had no flavor other than whatever else they had been cooking on the grill that day. I will say the cabbage, tomatoes, avocado and other veggies were all very fresh. The tacos just didn't have anything special about them. 

They also forgot part of our order. :(
author: Charlie G.

description: Great spot to grab some tacos! I've been here once before a few years ago when visiting SF and I was so excited to go back this time around. It did not disappoint! Make sure to make your taco nicks style (crispy and soft taco with guacamole and jack cheese). Yummy!
author: Shab G.

description: Great place with great food. The staff is always very nice and friendly. Always try to make it for taco tuesday at least twice a month. Drinks are really good. Parking is kind of annoying though but not too bad.
author: Gary R.

description: Stopped by on a Thursday afternoon. The first thing you see when you walk in is the bar. Saw some diners at the bar with tacos so went straight there. Bartender then says food is ordered near the back so went there. Big menu board on the wall and after you order they give you a number and sit anywhere in the bar or restaurant area and they bring it out to you. Remember to check in for free chips and salsa. Each table has 2 bottles of sauces, 1 green and 1 red. Neither are spicy. If the bottles are full becareful when you set it back down on the table or they will spew out. We tried the fried fish, steak, grilled fish and shrimp. Our favorite is the fried fish. Crispy and tender. The others was just okay. For $1.50 more you can get your tortilla crispy with guacamole. The tacos were not that memorable.
author: Vinkin Ken T.

description:
Sicck Tipsy Narcos
there. fixed bijz.

nah jk more like...
Nick(le&dime)'s Crisp(a)y (wheredidmyor)Ta(r)cos

i'm a 20% min tip no matter what kinda man
so why'd i give 10%??
fthat take the other 10 out the drink i paid for but never got plus $ per-item upgrades

+$1.25 per taco for "Nick's Way" (crispy + cheese + guacamole)
+$1.50 per burrito for "Todo" (sour cream + cheese + guacamole)
ACTUALLY REASONABLE lol but adds up

u might say those are optional u don't have to get every taco Nick's Way not every burrito Todo but YES YOU HAVE TO muhfuh. boojyfoodys this is not up for discussion.

(^_^) Pescado Burrito Con Todo $12.25
crispy creamy fried fish

(^_^) Fried Chicken Taco Nick's Way $6
sauce jzd all over the meat #twss #notacomo

(-_-) Camarones Taco Nick's Way $7
shrimp rubbery kinda tough

my burrito + 2 tacos + invisible drink dinner for one was mid $30s gdm
"rounding up" to 4 liked americanized mex would return
author: Dan B.

description:
Setting (gotta grab one of the elevated booths) service, and food are all winners.

One of the easiest reviews when everything clicks:)
author: Greg S.

description: Really tasty, but also really messy. Make sure to wear a bib! : P  The prices are good for the area and the amount of food. The full bar is also nice.
author: Joe F.

description: I visited this restaurant with a bunch of my girl friends and we loved it. It was a meet up location and the best part is that they have enough space for a big crowd like us. They are famous for their nicks special tacos. The best part is that they are open till late night which makes it a great spot after drinking to grab some tacos! Check out this gem of a place.
author: Julia J.

description:
Tried the grilled chicken taco, and a friend had the fried fish. Both were bomb AF (see pic for the chicken taco). Cash only but there's an ATM next to the register in case you're out. The tacos are huge, loaded up with both meat and toppings, and tasty as hell. The meat was flavorful, and the fish was crispy and flaky on the inside. Just what you want, no, just what you need. And we got free chips and salsa... can I live? 

Pros:
Tacos are dope
Cheap
Fast
Service
Ambiance - super low key with a bar nearby and lots of TVs

Cons:
Cash only
author: Vyshak C.

description: Nicks has great Tacos, but all three times I've gone the bouncers out front are rude and basically act like they don't want anyone to come in. After pressing my friends and I about our very legal ID's, they proceeded to flirt and give us trouble about getting in while making us stand in the cold. This hasn't been a one time occurrence either, they looked at all of our ID's for about 5 minutes each.. get a bouncer who knows what a California ID looks like. Otherwise the staff inside was friendly.
author: Bethany L.

description: My boyfriend and I craveeeee Nick's way carne asada tacos! Crunchy tortillas wrapped around carne asada, beans, guacamole and pick de gallo... YUM! If you check in on yelp you get free chips and pico de gallo (dine in only). Chips and pico de gallo are always fresh! The only downside to this place is parking can be tough and it's a little pricy but every once in a while it is totally worth it! You won't be disappointed.
author: Lauren D.

description:
Very, very good spot for tacos! Babe and I decided to stop here since we were around the area. We did have a bit trouble looking for this restaurant since it's combined with a bar! 

Stopped by after work and had to walk to the back- that's where the restaurant is. CASH only! Ordered, grabbed a number and found seats in a booth. 

I ordered the carne asada and fish taco and babe ordered the carne asada and shrimp tacos. Food took longer than expected to arrive. 

I'm a huge fan of tacos (especially fish tacos) and this spot didn't disappoint! Overload of toppings and 2 was enough to fill me up! Babe also thought the tacos were bomb! 

I would give it 5 stars but the price is a bit steep for tacos. Total was $29.00 for 4 tacos...
author: Elaine C.

description: The happy hour tacos weren't bad for its price! I love a simple street taco and this place does the trick! However, happy hour is packed, so I recommend reserving a booth. When I went, there weren't any available tables for us, so they were nice enough to let us sit in a reserved booth. The place looks a bit seedy though...it smells like alcohol and regrets...and it's also loud and packed, so don't even try to have a conversation with your friends.
author: Charissa S.

description:
The tacos here were good for SF, but I do think that they are extremely overrated and overpriced.  Getting any taco Nick's way comes out to $6+ per taco, which is pretty ridiculous - I'm used to getting tacos for $1.25 - $3 each back in LA.  The premium paid isn't really worth it in my opinion, as these tacos weren't better than the ones I've had before.  

If you do decide to stop by for a game or for a meal though, I would definitely recommend the carne asada taco Nick's way, which was probably the tastiest thing I had there.  They also give you free chips and salsa with a Yelp check in, and the staff are really friendly + helpful!  The drinks during happy hour are pretty solid though - we came on Mojito Monday and got a pitcher for $15 pre-tax and tip, which was fantastic.  

Overall, this is a great place for games (lots of TVs), the service is excellent, and the drinks are a great value, but the food is overpriced and not worth what I paid in my opinion.  I'll probably stop by for some drinks with friends again, but I would pass on the food in future visits.
author: Tim L.

description:
On vacation out here in San Fransisco with my family and we were looking for a spot for dinner, we ended up eating here. It was very delicious and the customer service was really good. 

I highly recommend it here, try the carne asada tacos you won't regret it!
author: Luis V.

description:
So Nick's is basically a rented corner of a bar/lounge called Rouge. . And they are cash only. Very important note. But don't let that sway you. We'll, unless you are like me and eating for 1, because man it's lonely in this corner. But I think I'll get back to this. Enter from Nick's on Polk, or Rouge with its corner entrance. It makes no difference.
So I went with the suggestion of the guy behind the counter and their 2 most popular tacos - Asada and pescado. While I wait for my food, I walk over to Rouge and order a monito, as they are the Monday special. I'm no mojito expert, but I'm sure I've had better. I was still impressed to see the bar tender crushing the mint leaves. Seems like a lot of work for a $5 drink. But it's good. And by good, I mean I'll be buzzed by the end of it. Maybe I should have closed my tab, but I'm socially obligated to order at least 1 more drink now lol. My tacos? I mean they're ok. I think getting it Nick's way certainly makes it better, but in the future, I think I'll just get a burrito and save some money. Well unless it's Taco Tuesday. Now I'm headed back to the bar to get that beer and finish my free Yelp check-in chips, whilst pretending to care about the hockey game going on in front of me lol
I forgot to comment on the loneliness of my situation. This seems like a pretty trendy spot, as there is a party going on in one corner, and lots of after work people hanging out. Warriors vs Rockets is about to come on, so I grabbed a bar seat at just the right time. Pretty soon the bar is full, and I'm chatting it up with a local who seems to know her drink spots(chill out, she's much older than I). They seem to know her too. And her knowledge of sports is embarrassing me. I lucked out. I'm no longer the lonely vato in the corner. But I can't stay. This isn't a pleasure trip 
Imabigdeal@yelp.com
author: Tomas A.

description:
You're better off eating at Taco Bell. This place is bland and dirty. Carne asda has no flavor, tasted like it was not fresh. Same goes for the pollo asada. The horchata was gritty and chalky. Also as a Mexican place how can you not have jamaica? I guess I've been spoiled with San Diegan Mexican food and growing up with good food. But as previous yelpers mentioned, the guacamole Is bought in. Bar tenders were eating while making other people's drinks without washing their hands. Big no no. Looked at their health scorecard history and it supports just how dirty this place is.

If the food here was good I would be able to  maybe overlook how dirty this place is. But sadly I cannot. The only reason for a star was the service was ok on the restaurant side.
author: Breeana L.

description:
I feel like people think these tacos are so good because they're usually hammered when they're eating them.  Or maybe all the hype about these being some of the best tacos in the city really impacted how disappointed I was when I finally tried them.  I actually thought they were pretty bland and I needed salsa to make them better, but it didn't help much.  

Also brace yourself when you come here, because it's definitely more of a club that happens to sell tacos than it is a restaurant.  Also, they're cash only so....  Insert side eye emoji here.
author: Cori A.

description:
Nick's is the perfect spot to grab a meal after a night out on Polk (or as a way to fill your stomach before a night of drinks). 

Casual and fun atmosphere with sports playing on the TVs by the bar, it can be tricky to find seating during busy times. 

Delicious food at great prices. I would definitely recommend trying your order "Nick's Way" (extra guacamole and cheese). If you're with a group of friends I'd recommend getting a pitcher of margaritas to share!
author: Chris G.

description:
Stopped in for lunch after a LONG flight from the East Coast because it was right around the corner from our hotel. 

Got the Steak Street Tacos, Wife got the Steak and Cheese Quesadilla, and we split chips and salsa. 

The quesadilla was amazing, the tacos - full of fresh, crisp ingredients. The chips were great, the salsa - VERY fresh.

Worth a quick stop in on the go!
author: Matt M.

description: Definitely get reservations here for a game day or fight night. This place is very classy and upscale for being so casual lol The interior design is spot on. The staff is always friendly and the tacos here are worth getting every week! They take cash only for the tacos but they have an atm here. The bar area is a great setting for happy hour or for a good meal.
author: Angel M.

description:
I have been here a couple of times and had nibbled on friends' orders. I'm not a huge fan of Mexican/Tex-Mex, however, I finally ordered something to-go tonight with a friend! The menu choices can be a bit overwhelming but I settled on the Pollo Burrito and my friend ordered her usual of 2 Pescado Tacos. 

So my burrito was $9.75, but the option of Burrito Con Todo (includes Sour Cream, Cheese, and Guacamole) of $1.50 was added without my knowledge. I was asked if those ingredients were "Okay," so I thought they were included. I mean, it's only $1.50, but at least let me know it's extra and don't sound like everything comes with my order. If you are going to do that, please also let me know I had choice in choosing the type of tortillas, which are Whole Wheat, Spinach, or Tomatoe.   

The 2 Pescado Tacos were $11.59 plus Nick's Way (Make the tacos crispy, and with Jack Cheese and Guacamole) for $2.50. I thought it was funny that you have to add money to make the tacos crispy when the restaurant's name is "Nick's Crispy Tacos." Lol

Anyway, the size of this burrito was pretty big. It's not Chipotle big but was long and nicely wrapped. My OCD liked it. After taking couple bites, I thought the tiny amount of the chicken was dry, has tons of beans, and has a decent amount of rice, but where is the cheese and guacamole? I literally couldn't tell if there was cheese and I only believed there was guacamole after seeing it in my photo. 

So perhaps I ordered wrong and should have followed my friend with getting the Pescado Tacos because those were pretty delicious with a ton of guacamole! 

I guess I was a bit disappointed with this place, if you couldn't tell. Also if you do the Add-ons, this place can get pretty expensive. Since it's also CASH ONLY, make sure you bring enough money, or use the ATM machine they have.
author: Alice L.

description:
Way too overhyped. I ate here for Taco Tuesday and let's just say that if this place were in Texas or SoCal or anywhere with halfway decent Mexican food, it would not survive. 

The food: Being from Texas, I know my Tex Mex. The tacos here loosely qualify as Tex Mex style. I got two tacos Nick's way. They were generous in size but only because they were overfilled with beans. They tasted mediocre at best.

The drinks: Drinks were pretty cheap on Taco Tuesday. We got pitchers for the table, which were pretty strong but a little heavy on the ice.

The atmosphere: The restaurant is very crowded on Tuesdays and I had to wait about half an hour before I could snag a table (I didn't have a reservation). But Taco Tuesday gets lit! The place basically became a club after 6 pm with a DJ playing great music and people dancing.

I would come back on Taco Tuesday but I would eat somewhere else beforehand. Definitely not the best Mexican food in the city.
author: Michelle L.

description:
I swear every tomato I had while on the West coast made me question what I knew tomatoes to be. 

I loved their food so much I came back twice. First of all, there is something endearing about eating a casual food like tacos in a setting that resembles Liberace's dressing room. Deep red walls, gaudy over-sized chandeliers, and velvet booths. 

And the food was ridiculously good. The tomatoes broke my heart. So fresh! So bright! The guy behind the counter told me they're organic, from a local farmers market. You get free chips and pico de gallo when you check in on Yelp, you really need to do this. 

The carnitas tacos are delicious. I'd skip the shrimp (they're not bad, there are just better choices). But the fried fish tacos made me melt. So tender and flaky and moist, they almost fall apart in your mouth when you bite into them. And go ahead and put all their salsas on everything, everything is good.

They have drink specials most days, I remember getting a huge, strong, mojito for $5.
author: Luci B.

description:
A bit pricy but these are some of best tacos you will ever have. Normally I get the grilled fish taco nick's way ($1.25 extra). When you get it nick's way, it comes with a crispy shell on the inside of a soft corn tortilla with jack cheese and guacamole. High recommend that taco. I've had the carnitas taco and felt that it had too much bean and the meat was under seasoned because it tasted like it was just boiled. I'm just going to stick to the fish taco.

CHECK-IN to get free chips and salsa. 

I've yet to try anything else and at this time I see no reason to. 

TIP: NEVER go to The Taco Shop At Underdog's who claim to have these crispy taco's. Theirs is not as good as these.

ORDERING: Don't sit down and order, walk to the back of the restaurant you will see a cashier where you can order your food.

VIBE: Nice place to grab drinks and watch sports on TV
author: Andrew T.

description: Amazing tacos! For $5, you get one taco that is stuffed with meat of your choice and salsa! One taco here counts as two mini tacos for sure! I got the carne Asada Nick's way! It is a nice twist to a soft taco! They make it crispy with jack cheese and guacamole! The carne Asada meat was tender and had a great flavor. I haven't had really good carne asada here but this place is great.
author: Ellen V.

description:
You can easily get confused as you walk in to Nick's Tacos as it's connected to a Moulin Rouge type lounge with red velvet seats and funky chandeliers. 

I ordered the Carne Asada tacos. It was a huge taco. Tons of beans and guac. I don't think I was a fan of the "crispy" tacos, but it was interesting.
author: Rashid M.

description:
1 Pescado Taco ($5.75): Wasn't good. It's a whatever taco. Nothing special, nothing tasty and just lame and less than medicore. 

Wouldn't recommend this place to anyone it's THAT bad.

Why does this place have high reviews? I don't know.. people must not know what good tacos should be but it's definitely not for me. I am leaving this place sad!!!
author: Daisy M.

description: A San Francisco staple. Get the taco nicks way. Large tacos. Lots of variety. Packed with flavor. Definitely returning ASAP!
author: Jeff S.

description:
Nick's Crispy Tacos are honestly some of the BEST tacos that I've ever had. I came here with a friend who had just finishing showing me around Lombard Street. We decided to come here because I've heard rave reviews about this place and I certainly wasn't disappointed. 

I had the Carne Asada (steak taco) and the Pescado (fried fish) and I can say that these two tacos were absolutely filled to the top with of the freshest ingredients. There is also this delicious green avocado sauce that goes great on your tacos - a must try! And to top things off, there is an amazing Yelp check-in offer for free chips and salsa (one per person so we had two altogether!)

The place is self-serve so if you are lucky definitely try to grab one of the booth seats. They're usually full but we were pretty lucky to snag one not long after we arrived at the restaurant. The interior is a bit weird as others have mentioned, its a cross between a pub and a club - but hey - its the tacos that matter right?

Overall, an amazing place - the tacos are just stellar! I will definitely be back whenever I come to visit San Francisco!
author: Justin K.

description:
Welp, if the poop on the floor (yes, you read that right, poop on the floor) wasn't enough to taint my opinion of this place, the utter lack of flavor and "meh" ness of the food sure did.

I was forced into Nick's because of a going away party for a friend- I've always walked by but have been told it's super loud (and yep, it was BUMPING at 8 pm on a Friday so loud you had to shout to your neighbor) and that the food is really only good when you're utterly wasted.

But, when you're in a group you go with the flow right? I came in and headed to the bathroom, only to find human poop blocking my way to the bathroom. The smell..... I'm not sure what happened but it took another 10 minutes for a staff member to clean it up, and then things just reeked of bleach.

My boyfriend told me to take a chill pill and that the food would make up for things, but sadly the nachos lacked any sort of flavor and the tacos were just sad. They weren't even hot? My friends had this issue too where their quesadilla was straight up cold in the middle.

Just don't.....
author: Elliott W.

description: Nick's is great when eating at restaurant, but delivery seems to always fall short. Once again I ordered "Nick's Way" and they arrived not at all crispy and missing cheese. Bummer.
author: Jaime J.

description: I love this place. It is very good, with especially good atmosphere. I want to go here a lot. I want to go here every time. Last time I came here was in 2013. I like there crispy tacos a lot.
author: Thomas D.

description:
Nick's truly was a nicepleasant surprise and the very best part of the experience was the friendly and attentive staff. Seriously, I'm tempted to give 5 Stars just based on service.

Anyhow, in terms of food, we had jalapeño poppers as well as chips and salsa with a side of nacho cheese as starters. The poppers were piping hot and had the right amount of spice. The salsa was fresh and seasoned just right. 

For my main, I went with the pescado burrito. Crispy fried fish with lime mayo, cilantro, and cabbage. In a word: delicious. Strongly recommend.
author: Steve S.

description:
THE FRIED FISH TACO IS OUT OF THIS WORLD CRAZY GOOD. I had expectations that this restaurant would be good from all of the yelp reviews, but the food exceeded all of my expectations. Best fish taco I've ever had. I also tried the shrimp taco which was tasty, but if I could go back I would have gotten two fried fish tacos nick's way.  If I'm ever back in San Fransisco I will most definitely go back! Go there and eat all the fish tacos you can for me!  
UGH SO FREAKING GOOD
author: Layla S.

description: Great place, great tacos, friendly waiters, and gentle on the wallet - what's not to like?
author: Raúl T.

description:
Great service and food. Will be back next week
Great prices and cleanliness. I loved the steak tacos
author: Arthur W.

description:
Cash-only Mexican restaurant and sometimes late-night club with sports bar-sized TVs in a spacious, chandelier-filled, overly-velvety bar.

If that doesn't interest you, please leave San Francisco immediately.
author: Nick K.

description: This will be a short review, but I just wanted to say I love this place and wish Nob Hill had more spots like it (good vibe and good value)The street tacos are delicious and a great deal (3 for $7). Also, every time I've gone there the employees are really, really friendly. Happy hour is also solid. Definitely a great neighborhood spot.
author: Michael R.

description:
Only two stars for a good stake . Other than that 
nothing special. First time and the last time here
Everything taste like was cooked yesterday
author: Piotr K.

description:
An interesting venue that has Nick's on one side, which consists of an ordering counter and lots of tables and booths with vinyl tablecloths, and Rouge on the other side, which tries to go for a slightly swankier chandeliered ambience. Given the Russian Hill location near the Marina, this often makes for a fresh-out-of-college yuppie madhouse.

Insufferable atmosphere aside, the namesake tacos are simply OK. The camarones had a decent amount of shrimp to them, while the carne asada was rather conventional. As for the pescado (fried fish), in my opinion it's hard to get anything fried wrong, but even here I felt that the fish was just a bit excessively fried, perhaps in a batch of stale oil.

So, overall, it's an OK experience just for the food - if only you can find a seat in this musical-chairs environment, amidst the messes and chaos that others have left behind.
author: Vincent L.

description:
Tried this place out for a quick snack and ended up pretty full and satisfied. The cashier advised me the move was to get the Pescado taco 'Nick's way' and he wasn't wrong. The fish was perfectly cooked and Nick's way is a hard taco shell covering a tortilla with cheese and guac -delicious. The cashier also hooked us up with chips & salsa to get us started. Quite the afternoon snack, check it out! 


Tip: cash-only, but there is an ATM inside.
author: Chandani D.

description:
Terrible. You're paying for cabbage. 
I grew up a block away from here and have always heard how they're supposed to have amazing tacos. Tacos/burritos same thing different outfit right? I could not be more wrong. I placed an order through DoorDash for burritos for my family including 2 young kids under 5. The description just states "Grilled Fish" (and shrimp) does not say they're spicy. I even specified that the burrito should not be spicy bc it was for kids. It was so spicy that it was inedible even to the adults. What am I paying $12 for? All the burritos barely had protein, little to no beans and no rice. Just fiery cabbage. Carne asada burrito does not hold a candle to any other burrito place you might want to try. 2 stars for service because they tried to compensate for one of the burritos that was left out of the original order.
author: Paula Y.

description:
Good luck ordering via GrubHub. Nick's never received the order and weren't particularly fast at remedying the situation. They seemed to think I was just going to shrug it off and walk away, having already paid for the order via Grub Hub. 

They finally did make the order for me, only to get it wrong. Shrimp tacos were packed up and much to our dismay, were carnitas. Of course, we figured this out at home so it was too late then to do anything about it. The burritos were just mediocre.

Even waiting in the restaurant for the food was awful as the music was painfully loud. I can't imagine trying to eat in there, let alone try to hold a conversation.

What a disappointing bust. Never again on both Grub Hub and Nick's.
author: ellen m.

description:
3.5

Definitely get your tacos Nick's way (though I mean, it's Nick's crispy tacos...shouldn't they automatically come that way??)
Pescado was delicious. Nice big pieces of fish fried perfectly.
Carnitas was okay. A little dry, and I like my carnitas to have more flavor (to be fair I usually almost double the seasoning when I make my own).
It's a place in SF that you can get a full meal for less than $15; that in and of itself is a wonderful thing.
author: Kari E.

description:
Sooo good! I love the Pollo Asado (grilled chicken) and Pescado (fried fish). You can count on these tacos to be overflowing with protein and fresh mixins. 

The decor is kinda strange, but the booths are cozy and a great place to grab a bite when you're in the area. Definitely a great way to treat yourself after hiking through the city, or checking out Lombard Street with your out-of-town friends. 

The Yelp checkin offer is probably the best I've ever used - the free chips and salsa is delicious. The pico is really refreshing and addicting!
author: Heather N.

description: The service here is terrible. The food is average at best. I don't think I would pay the regular price for it. The bartenders seem racist. They'll ignore you if you're not white.
author: James K.

description: Good selection on the menu, and base in mind it is cash only. They have tiny water glasses, and they ran out of water, and with only 2 tables in at the time I thought that they'd be relatively quick in filling it up, but alas no. The meat was dry, but if you get anything in the menu, get the taco Nicky style, that is definitely a 5 star dish. But the nachos were... well, it seemed like they used canned cheese, canned jalapeños and canned black beans. Definitely not worth the $11.00 atmosphere 1 star, everything but the Nicky style taco 1 star as well.
author: Travis L.

description:
I'm pretty bummed that I wasted my time eating here while on vacation. The salsa is basically pick de gallo slathered directly on to your chips. They nickle and dime for ever ingredient ($0.75 for a bit of sour cream, $2 for limited chips.)

The service here is seat yourself, and you will be brought your food, but that's where it ends.

The quessdilla was burnt and falling apart. It lacked flavor.
author: Tanya D.

description:
Are the tacos crispy? Yes. Are they anything to rave about? ...No.

I had heard great things about Nick's from a few people and even read some great reviews about this place. A friend and I were looking for a place to eat in the city and decided to stop by. Nick's Crispy Tacos is located inside of Rouge Nightclub and Lounge in the Russian Hill district. We walked inside, got a few drinks from the bar, and then headed to the other side of the lounge to get our tacos.

Since it was my first time here, I asked the cashier for suggestions. She recommended that I try one steak and one fish taco and to get them "Nick's Way" (which consists of making them crispy and adding guacamole and jack cheese). I ordered one fish and one steak taco and my friend ordered one steak and one fried chicken taco and the spicy Elote (Mexican corn on the cob). Chips and salsa weren't complimentary, but I was able to redeem a Yelp check in offer for a free basket of chips and salsa. The salsa was pretty good but it definitely wasn't fresh and the chips tasted like they came out of a bag. The price point here is also a little on the high side for tacos. For twos tacos alone, it costed over $10. We took our numbers and then headed back to our booth.

Our food arrived and was delivered to our table. I first noticed the massive amount of guacamole that was compiled on top. Although I am a lover of guac, I felt that this was just entirely too much and it definitely overpowered the taste of everything else on the taco. To top it off, the guac tasted like it was days old. Definitely wasn't fresh to say the least. The steak was dry and tasted like it wasn't seasoned at all. I couldn't even taste the jack cheese and doubted if they even put any on the taco in the first place. My friend liked her Elote and said that her fried chicken taco was decent but nothing special. I noticed recently that Yelp has placed a warning message on their Yelp profile to notify people that they have a poor food safety score. I will most likely not come back here again in the future.
author: Shayla B.

description:
Finally tried this place after seeing the famous "Nick's way" on social media. 

Nick's way is a hard taco shell wrapped inside a tortilla with cheese and guac. I believe there is a card minimum here so come with cash or be prepared to Venmo a friend.

Order at the counter, grab a number, and seat yourself. Margaritas are pretty bomb too.

I believe you can get free chips and salsa or something like that with a Yelp check in. 

Door handle of the restroom is pretty unique. They have a lever for you to step and pull the door out to keep your hands clean for the finger food. 

Street parking!
author: Danae L.

description:
Nice Place, good food for a excellent Price!
The mango juice is a good one!
Would go there again!
author: T. B.

description: Service 1 star food quality and taste 3.5 stars. They need to get a system together because everything right now is confusing. Cash only... order at the front... figure somehow out that it's self seating... the owner should invest into a food truck instead of a restaurant.
author: Nick J.

description:
I feel like the proximity to Rouge has more to do with Nick's popularity than the actual quality of the food. I've been here a few times and I am pretty convinced that the main audience for Nick's is the built-in one supplied by sharing a space with a bar.

Food-wise I think Nick's is a bit subpar. Their tacos are definitely not as good as other taquerias in say, the Mission, and despite claiming to use high quality sources, the food doesn't have the quality of nearby upscale Mexican spots. The crispy tacos ("Nick's way") are also extremely sloppy, and near impossible to eat without covering your face and hands in sour cream.

I think someone also needs to mention the lines. If you try to get food here at dinner, well, good luck, because it's going to suck. First, the place is crowded, so you might not even have a seat to eat at. Given how messy the tacos are, this means you essentially can't eat them until someone moves, which takes forever. Second, the wait times are agonizing. I've spent almost 30 minutes waiting for 2 tacos here, which really sucks as there is never anywhere to sit and rarely even a place to stand.

So here's my breakdown: if you want to go to a bar, Rouge is overcrowded and full of "Marina people" anyway, so unless you're looking to score a pretentious frat boy you should go somewhere else anyway. Nick's serves subpar food, slowly, and you'll have no place to eat it, so you should go someplace else.

So why would you go here? You wouldn't. And shouldn't.
author: Sm L.

description:
Nick's way tacos are the way to go. Ordered the carne asada and pescado tacos. Both were really delicious, although I did like the pescado one a bit more. Just after eating one, I was already full. Only downside with this place is that they accept cash only, so make sure to have some before coming here. 

Also, free chips and salsa with a check in! :)
author: Annie H.

description: I love the idea of this place. Good food GREAT happy hour deals... BUT... service at the bar.... took nearly 20 minutes for a bartender to acknowledge us. Our whole side of the bar didn't receive any attention for 20 minutes! And I'm not a fan of the fact you have to get up and walk to a different part of the bar and order food. It's just a weird concept. I would go back to this place for the environment but it's NOT organized very well....
author: Madison R.

description:
If you drive here, good luck finding parking. I would just Uber.

There is no wait staff here. Order your food as soon as you enter, then go find a place to sit, your food will be brought to your table. There are tonsa booths available and you can see TVs from all the seats. Pretty good placements of TVs for game nights.

I got the pescado taco. The large fish is crispy and golden brown. The combination of pan fried hard taco on the inside with the soft taco on the outside gives a unique texture to the dish.

There is nothing mind blowing about the tacos except for the hard n soft taco combo. Its a fun place to check out on taco Tuesdays for sure!
author: Sujeesha V.

description:
COME HERE FOR TACO TUESDAY! 

I would recommend reserving a booth so you get service and don't have to wait in a long line.

Their tacos are SO good and don't cost too much especially on taco Tuesday. 

I can't wait to come back for another Taco Tuesday!
author: Allyson L.

description:
I ordered the Vegetariano Burrito ($7.95) with Sour Cream ($0.75) through Amazon Restaurants. The food prices on Amazon Restaurants are cheaper than the Nick's Crispy Tacos menu on Yelp. I am not sure why, but you do have to pay the delivery fee.

My meal came with two types of sauces (looked green and red) in their own containers. I am not sure what they were but they tasted ok and were a little spicy. The green one was spicier than the red one. 

My burrito was about 8.5 inches in length and contained tons of vegetables and too many beans. When I took a bite, I found the burrito to be super crunchy probably due to the purple cabbage and red onions. The cabbage pieces and red onions were shredded but they looked to be more on the bigger side. At other burrito places I have been to, sour cream was typically free. Here, it costed 75 cents extra. I was glad I was given a decent scoop of sour cream. Lastly, the tortilla was very moist and soft. It contrasted with the crunchiness inside the burrito and was more on the plain side. 

Overall, this place was decent. There is a good chance I will come back.
author: Kristina M.

description:
I have to sadly say that this place is overhyped....I was really excited to finally try the famous fish taco here at Nick's but it didn't deliver....

I took a couple of tourists to have the fish tacos.. hubby ordered carne asada burito, WET....it was HUGE.

We had the fish tacos both in Nick's way (with crispy shell) and regular. The tacos were good BUT there were way too much lettuce fillers than the fish..It was also not a cheap taco so I really wish there were more fish. I frequent another fish taco place in Palo Alto (Sancho's) that charge same price but yet were extremely generous with the fish. The salsa was also forgettable and lets not forget that they CHARGE for chips..... I understand that it's SF, but their price point is not low... why not throw in free chips!!!

Though, I have to mention that I checked in on yelp and got a small plate of chips for free....it should be free for everyone else though...

Anyway.. it's a nice, NOT a hole in the wall mexican restaurant...there is a nice full bar and the bathrooms are super clean. But definitely NOT the typical authentic mexican food or one with the most awesome flavors.
author: Yun C.

description: A very Hot spot in San Fran . It's pack literally a hour after opening. Food is good, music is Clubby and it isn't very pricey.
author: Jeff And Rachyl E.

description:
Food: Delicious tacos! Try pretty much any of them. My favorite is the carne asada though. Get them with the crunchy taco. If you don't want to wait for a seat, there's always take out, it's super convenient and fast. Sometimes the line can be really long and they give out free salsa and chips.

Atmosphere: it's partially a bar and has a dance floor. Don't eat in if you want a quiet meal. But overall cool for a Friday night out.
author: Janice M.

description:
Wow! 3000+ reviews with 4 stars?  Read all the great reviews and was excited to try but was sorely disappointed. Pictures are deceiving! 

Thumbs down, y'all. 

1. It looks fancy from the outside and fake chandeliers everywhere but this is not a sit down place. You order your food from the side counter and then sit down with a number. No waiter service.
2. Red velvet covered booths are SUPER gross. Looks like they've never been cleaned.
3. Food looks better than it tastes. Mediocre at best. Fried crispy taco was semi-crunchy like it had been fried and sitting out for hours before they prepare your order. You can tell they don't make it fresh.
4. Only 2 options for hot sauce: red or green
 
My advice: just don't. There are so many other good options around.

Please don't bring your date here.
author: Song C.

description:
YES! I am so happy I ended up here with my friend. We were on our way to get boba from Teaspoon and I saw a sign that said tacos. I looked at the menu, my friend gave the OK, and we walked inside this bar/dancefloor/restaurant looking place. We came around 4 pm and placed our order at the bar. I ordered the carne asada taco (Nick's way) and the fried fish taco, which were both amazing! Squeeze a bit of lime on both and it really solidifies everything. I can see this place being a favorite. Will be coming back to bring the bf. 

I've been to Tijuana before and for some reason, this place sort of reminds me of the clubs/bars in Tijuana. The red colors of walls, booths, the chandeliers, and the Mexican music blaring on the stereos. 

Check in on Yelp! You get free chips and salsa..and they give you A LOT.
author: Emily F.

description: Steak Quesadilla was delicious, definitely recommend. It's Cash Only and the drinks were just OK which is why I'm giving it 4 stars.
author: Kate M.

description:
Came here for taco Tuesday after hearing a lot of hoopla about the place. To be honest i wasn't the biggest fan. 

The margaritas were extremely salty (the bartender didn't ask if we wanted salt). If I could have a do-over I'd most definitely order a margarita without salt. 

I ordered a chicken taco and a pork taco (pollo and carnitas) both Nick's way. There was nothing that really set these tacos apart from your run of the mill tacos. Sure the guacamole was nice, but the meat wasn't flavorful. 

It just wasn't enough to keep me coming back. I'll stick to the mission for my mexican food in the future.
author: Nick D.

description: Was extremely disappointed after reading such positive reviews. Was welcomed very nicely by the host but the service at the ordering counter was some of the worst I've experienced. They were not listening at all to our order as we were rushed along and not to our surprise the food came out incorrect. We attempted to tell them the order was messed up but they did not try to fix it. When the rest of the food came out there were several errors which led us to leave and find somewhere else. Hopefully someone else has better luck at this mediocre establishment.
author: Dillon R.

description:
I came here on accident during super bowl. Crowded, loud, and rowdy, which according to friends, is quite normal for this place.

Ordered tacos, and some things to know are, cash only and bring lots of cash! Got 4 tacos "Nick's way" and the total came out to $30 total. Nick's definitely takes the cake for most expensive tacos I've ever had!

The food came out, and the tacos looked big and delicious.... until you bite into it. Carne asada was mediocre, guacamole tasted like.. nothing? Hot sauces on the table tasted like water. The fried fish and fried chicken tacos were better.

Bottom line, better tacos can be had elsewhere. Save your money and you eat drums and go elsewhere!
author: Emily T.

description:
This place was just okay. The food is tasty and ok if you're craving crispy fish tacos. Presentation is a little under the average mark for San Francisco dining. I think it's a fun spot and their bar is pretty big and you can apparently reserve it for private parties.

The flavors, textures and presentation have a bit less wow-factor than other comprable small bite establishments in the city, so you might want to shop around a bit. It is great if you're in a hurry for stuff served in  a red basket with paper/cash only /pay at counter, but if you're looking for a nice sit down experience probably best to shop around.

Overall it's good but not best in class - 3/5.
author: Chris R.

description:
All tacos should be made Nick's way. A solid Nob Hill neighborhood spot with great tacos. Cash only or LevelUp (payment app). They had $5 strawberry margs on Cinco de Mayo which is an easy way to my heart.

UPDATE: I was just informed $5 strawberry margs are a thing EVERY Monday-Friday during happy hour...thanks Nick's!
author: Emily F.

description: These tacos are okay, they're massive, I'll give them that. But they're also pretty pricey. The nice thing is the amount of guac they throw on their super tacos. But I don't like that they have beans in their tacos. I felt like this took away from the flavor of the taco. I think they can definitely step it up flavor wise, because I think street tacos pack a little more punch than Nick's tacos.
author: Eva C.

description:
I agree with other reviewers, all tacos should be made "Nick's Way" I thought it's weird that they up-charge for that. Tacos were pretty damn good! Smothered in guac, hard shell inside of a soft tortilla looked a bit odd at first but I actually liked it a lot, it adds a nice crunch. Full bar inside, very red and dark, kinda wish I ate on one of the tables outside. 

I would say the two tacos I got weighed about a pound so easily a meal for most people.
author: Tony D.

description:
Atmosphere was a cool vibe and definitely a good location. 

Pretty annoying you can only use cash to order food. The ATM charges you almost $3 to take cash out. Bar, you can use your card. Not sure why they don't do it for the food as well. 

Tacos were alright. A lot of cilantro and pico (good if you like). 

Overall would return.
author: Sarah G.

description: Nick Fasanella is a fascinating Mexican food chef. My friend says his friend dated him. I like this recipe for Mexican food. The tacos, quesadillas, and burritos are awesome. I have been to Tacoshop at Underdog's on Irving many many times. This was my first time to Nick's Crispy Tacos at Rouge. We watched the Warriors vs. Cavaliers game 1 and it was a great place to watch it at. The space at Rouge is spacious. Get there early to get some seats. There's a good crowd here. Bar is busy. I had a pollo and a baja fish taco. I also checked in and got the free chips and salsa later on in the night when I was hungry again. I had horchata too:) This is a good spot to hang out at and if you are into Nick's Way then you'll like this. The Tacoshop at Underdog's has a funkier menu with California and cheeseburger burritos, but it's pretty much the same food. Here's to Nick's Way!
author: Denise C.

description: First of all the name is misleading. There are no crispy tacos on the menu board. Everything is soft tortillas. Second, they had 2 bottles of beer available when I visited. As usual for San Francisco the only reason for the high number of reviews is due to being located in a highly walkable area, not for the food quality. It is just as bad as all the other SFO style Mexican food places. Stale hard chips, grade D quality meats and no indication anything made fresh onsite. $30 for a regular burrito and regular nachos a dos xx and a diabetes inducing horchata. Unless your 18, skip this extremely basic hole.
author: Stanley J.

description:
Busy neighborhood gem. Nick knows tacos and how to keep the hungry happy.  Floated in on a day after walking like it seemed for hours.  We ordered food at the counter and asked for the tacos Nick's way which included fresh guac and salsa.  Warm chips and pico de gallo were also added to our tab.  I opted for the taco salad with fresh grilled fish (huge portion).

Food came fast and furious.  Giants game on tv and yes, they were losing.  That's where the beer came in handy.
author: Susan C.

description:
Great place for a nap! The booths are nice to lay down in after eating tons of tacos. The ceiling is very red and has a lot of chandeliers distributed in a seemingly adhoc fashion.

My friend apparently takes his hiking v seriously and brings along two liters of Soda. I think that's gross but what do you think, dear reader?

4 stars - good move is getting boba next door afterwards.
author: Andrew C.

description:
There's this yelp schmelp named J.T. who writes pretty average Yelp reviews.  The photos he posts are almost as average as his reviews.

But man oh man can this guy set you on the path to taco salvation.  J.T. recommended that I try Nick's Crispy Tacos when I was in San Francisco.  He specified that the fish tacos were the best on the menu.

J.T. does not lie or exaggerate.  The fish tacos I had were perfect in every way a taco can be perfect.  I was at Nick's Crispy Taco's on the Sunday after Thanksgiving and just coming out of a food coma....but these tacos were so good that they cured my food coma.

Cash only.
author: Bill J.

description:
Le bf and I came here for Taco Tuesday around 5:30pm. 

Le bf got in line while I scoped out a table. It took a bit of time before I was able to find a free table, and the employees were too busy to bust any of the tables. In general, I thought that the place could have been cleaner. The floor was definitely coated in something and nothing seemed particularly clean. There was a water station for those who wanted to only drink water.

We ordered:
1. 2 portions of the small chips with salsa and guac ($2)
2. 4 soft tacos (all Nick's way) ($19)
3. 1 cheese quesadilla ($2.75)

When you have a taco Nick's way, it just means that the taco is made crispy with jack cheese and guacamole. 

I thought that having my tacos Nick's way made them a bit too salty, but I am also more sensitive to salt than other people. I only really ever get carne asada tacos and it tasted pretty good. After seeing all the food we got, we quickly realized that we only needed to order 1 portion of the small chips. It was enough for the 2 of us. We ended up with a lot of leftovers. Le bf blames me, says that I have eyes bigger than my stomach. I think the real all star of the meal was the cheese quesadilla. That thing was HUGE. It was a simple quesadilla that tasted really, really good. Le bf would give his gigantic quesadilla 6 out of 5 stars.

It was hard to find a table to sit at, especially during Taco Tuesday. The line to order only got longer the later it got. the place wasn't exactly clean.  I thought that for the price we paid, we got a lot of food. 

I would come back again for Taco Tuesday. I would make sure to arrive early to avoid the huge crowd and lines and would probably only get 1 taco, 1 cheese quesadilla and 1 order of the chips for myself. If you are a large party, 6 or more people (I think), you can make reservation and get a booth.
author: Carolyn Z.

description:
Nicks Crispy Taco pollo style. Guacamole filled and certainly a handful. 2 tacos substantial enough however 3 would have just been a little too much. The food lived up to reputation and standard expected.
My only complaint was the standard of service. I found the server at the order point to be very rude and unhelpful. The odd thing was that this venue was not busy at the time and there was nobody behind me when I was placing my order. If it was not for the tacos, I would most likely not return to put up with that standard of service. 
The rating is a food rating NOT a service rating of 1.
N.B returned the following day had a completely different customer service experience. Angelene was most pleasant, helpful and positive.
Tacos Carnitas and seasoned chicken nachos.
author: Wayne C.

description: Not the same as before. "Nick's Way" tacos were way better before. The tacos (Nick's Way) we ordered were soggy and not crispy at all. I told the staff but they don't want to replace them. Just disappointing. I even bragged about this place to my coworkers yesterday. Will not recommend them anymore and this will be my last. No wonder they're giving out discounts because they're not as busy as they used to be.
author: Lara Lee V.

description:
I go there every week. The tacos are world famous! I like all the staff and and the energy in the place. Taco Tuesday is a staple in my week. They have a DJ, the place is crowded and fun. 

I recently celebrated by birthday there and Marlow the manager made it awesome! Nick the doorman is the best dressed doorman in SF! Lobo and Jordan are two of our favorite servers.

Get the Carne Asada Tacos Nick's way and chips and guacamole.
author: Chris L.

description:
NIck's was nearby so tried their tacos. yelp check-in gets u free chips and salsa. passed. counting calories.

ordered/paid at counter. food came minutes after.

eats: pescado taco (5.75)
-single piece of fried fish, nothing wrong, just tasteless. surrounded by mayo, rojo salsa, lime, 
cilantro, cabbage, onions.

service friendly, quick, informative...lots of flatscreens around.
author: Victor G.

description:
The food here was anything but fresh and "crispy". By far the worse Mexican food I've had in ages. The food that was delivered looks NOTHING like that pictures on their page. Also, the food arrived COLD.  I mean not just warm but ice cold and oily... It was so bad I would never order from here again. Maybe it's better at the restaurant... I'll never know because this was so bad I'll never be trying it again. 

The strange thing is that the nachos are only $2 and were a large portion of some very cold cheese and hard chips. 

Hope they make some improvements to this place...
author: Delilah W.

description: First time coming here and got the beef nachos but they gave us steak instead. The nachos themselves were good, huge portion and very filling. They take cash only. We got margaritas as well which were very strong but at least you get your money's worth that way. They take card at the bar. Very interesting decor but good place overall.
author: Michaela O.

description:
This place is really awesome! It's part of Rouge so there's a full bar in addition to tacos. It's tons of fun for pretty cheap.

To get into details, the big pluses are:

+ Delicious and huge tacos that come in a great selection at a great price (2 for $7 or $2.75 for a huge cheese quesadilla)

+ The BEST margarita pitchers ever. Perfectly sweet and boozy

+ Awesome ambiance. Plenty of seating and the best modern throwback hits ever

This place is so much fun! I'd come here again and again.
author: Amy G.

description:
So my family and I are in SF for family vacation. We wanted some good Mexican food. Using the power of Yelp, we found Nick's crispy tacos. 

Looking at the menu and the reviews, we decided to try this place out. We walked in and I thought I just took my four year old to a strip club based on the elevated red seating. My 8 year old son for some reason busted out his Washington's. Am I missing something?

Anyways back to the food. Place is pretty pricey with one taco almost being five bucks. Hey we are on family vacation, let's take the ride. I ordered a fried chicken taco and a carne asada burrito. The taco comes with a lime mayo sauce. Figured it would be good. 

My food comes out and it did not have any of the sauce. I asked for the lime mayo but the employee said it comes with a chipotle sauce. I pointed to his menu and told him it said lime Mayo, he said it's wrong. If it's wrong then change it right?  I ordered my daughter a kid bean burrito.  I did not realize that was a five dollar burrito. The crispy chicken taco did not have a crispy taco shell. This place is known for its crispy tacos right?  

In the end, it was just ok Mexican food. Myself being Mexican, I do not know all the hype about this place. It was merely over priced just ok could have gotten better Mexican food.
author: C Q.

description:
I ordered beef nachos carne Asada tacos and a grilled chicken quesadilla off Postmates. 
The nachos were average. The toppings are in the center and not properly distributed. The cheese on the nachos was the best part. The tacos are HUGE AND I MEAN HUGE. it was the best thing, only because of their guacamole. Their guacamole is what made the tacos. The quesadilla was way too oily, and too small to be honest.
author: Natalie K.

description:
I went with a group of 7 on a Monday night. There were not that many people and we got a big table. The waiter was really nice and we started with a couple pitchers of Mojito. I am not big fan of Mojito because of the sweetness but my friends all liked it. 

We ordered our food from our table. I guess because they didn't have that many customers in the restaurant that night so we got a bit lucky.

Here are some items we ordered:
--Nick's Way Carnitas (braised shredded pork)
--Nick's Way Carne Asado (grilled steak)
--Cheese Quesadilla 
--Pollo Asado Quesadilla (grilled chicken)
--Camarones Burrito (grilled shrimp)
--Steak salad 
--Guacamole with chips & salsa

Have to say, their guacamole is AMAZING. We ordered three of them in total because it was too good to resist. I personally also really liked the nick's way carnitas. Unlike many tacos I have had, Nick's tacos are huge so don't order too much at first in case you can't finish all.
author: Clare L.

description: Food was good, service was fast. The place clearly turns into a club for some nightlife later in the evening. This place only accepts cash for food, but they accept cards at the bar. Says kid friendly but not a place I would take children, the bar is the focal point for sure. The place was a little dusty but nice overall.
author: Raegina R.

description:
Location: It's located on the corner of Polk so parking is basically non-existent. It gets pretty packed on Tuesdays and on weekends so be sure to come early in order to get a table or seat at the bar. 

Service: You don't have a waiter. You have to order food at the counter when you first walk in and then they bring it to your table. They have quite a few booths and tables in god sight of all the TVs they have in the location. 

Food: GET THE FISH TACOS NICKS WAY. The only way to go. The carne asada tacos are good as well. If you get them nick's way they're overloaded with guac and an extra crispy tortilla wrapped around it so I can always find myself getting full off 2 tacos. 

Drinks: Great happy hour menu/strong margaritas! They pair well with the tacos so why not get them?
author: Keizzel C.

description:
Last night, I randomly ended up at Nick's Crispy Tacos for a late dinner. The last time I stepped foot in this place was probably five or six years ago so, I wanted to see how it was holding up. In short, it's not. I used to be a big fan of these burritos/tacos but, something has gone terrible wrong and the "soul" is gone. It's pretty disappointing because this place used to have a line out the door every night and people went crazy for this food. 

I ordered the shredded chicken burrito which was an old staple of mine. This time around the chicken was dry, the beans...miserable and I couldn't find the guacamole anywhere. When I referred to "soul" earlier, I meant it. The burrito lacked flavor and love! 

To be fair, the staff was super nice and noticed they had made a mistake with the order (adding rice) but, that's not a big deal to me...first world problems. Solid guys behind the counter and the only reason this isn't a one star review. So long Nick's Crispy Tacos, you had a good run.
author: Benjamin F.

description: Incredible service. Came to San Fran for the weekend and to watch the World Cup finals! Nick's hosted an early morning World Cup final event that was AMAZING! Thank you for taking such good care of us and providing great food!
author: Amber M.

description:
I've been here a few times now, and so far I haven't had some of the negative experiences fellow yelper have had. My most recent trip here was on a Tuesday for, duh, Taco Tuesdays. I brought my friend that had never had a crispy taco and was used to the smaller tacos near his place. At first he thought the prices were high, until he saw the size of the tacos. We ordered 4 tacos total, Nick's way. I thoroughly enjoy eating here and even taking it to go when I'm in the area.

We had arrived a little before 6p to avoid the crowd, but we were too late, there was not a seat in sight! I wouldn't say it was crowded, but everyone pretty much found a seat, even near the bar; however, there were many reserved booths that were empty.

Food: 9/10
Staff: 8/10
Atmosphere: 9/10
Value: 7/10
Overall: 8.25/10
author: Evan K.

description:
The tacos were not all that cracked up to be. I ordered 2 tacos & a small drink. My order total was $20. I had 1 Camerones Taco & 1 Grilled Fish Taco. Eehh. I was looking for more. More flavor. More sauce. More spice. More cheese. 
I will say that the portion size is huge & pretty filling. I could've done just one Taco.
If I come back... heavy on the IFFF ! 
I will only get one Taco.
Although I really think they deserve 3 stars... their service was on point & pretty quick considering how busy it was & on a Saturday night ! Plus the ambiance was pretty coo. So it deserves an extra star for that ! 
Overall - The food was good & the service was nice.
author: Desirae P.

description: Good. Thought it was good,  but the vibe was only meh to me. Plus parking was a bit of a challenge.  Eventually, we found a space not too far away. So it can be done.
author: Keriena T.

description: Street tacos didn't had any flavor...and so so dry. Fish tacos where good but not as the people tell. Salsa was good tho.
author: Ariana R.
