description: My new favorite taco Tuesday spot! I love the atmosphere. Chandeliers and red walls! Keep in mind that you do have to call ahead or put your name in for a booth. There are tables setup for first come first serve and the bar is always a good idea. You go up to a counter and order your food and you'll get a number with your food dropped off. Super simple. The margaritas are alriiiiiight but too sweet in my opinion. Quesadilla's and tacos are BOMB! I have yet to try a burrito. Awesome music and young crowd.
author: Sahar N.

description:
We love this place! It's very low-key during the week, but the fish tacos are TO DO FOR, and if you go during taco Tuesday, you are definitely in for a treat. I also recommend checking in on Yelp, as they offer a check in deal.
Highly recommend!
author: Sabra M.

description: First off they put beans in their tacos. Who puts beans in tacos?  The beans are basically the base of the tacos and thus you paid for a half beans and half meat taco. Horchata was SUPER GRAINY. I love horchata and this was the worst horchata I've ever tasted.
author: Hieu D.

description:
Taco Tuesday and a Warriors playoff game?! What more could a girl ask for? 

It was the Monday afternoon and we decided to meet up for taco Tuesday. I checked for reservations and to my luck there was just one reservation for a part of 5. 

Game started at 6, reservation was for 6:15pm - got there at 6 and was seated right away in the booth. The corner booth didn't have the best center view of the tvs but it was sufficient. 

There are two different servers one for the food and one of the drinks. Food is cash only or they use the app level up. Happy hour for drinks is till 7:30pm. $12-$14 for a pitcher (not bad). 

The servers were super attentive. It did get more and more crowded as the night wore on but we were lucky because we still got to keep our booth even though we were past the 120 minutes. :) 

The tacos aren't the best tacos you'll ever eat but they're decently good and when its Taco Tuesday (2 for $7) you really can't complain too much especially when the Warriors get a win.
author: Stephanie W.

description:
I always thought it was called Nick's Crispy TacoS, but it's Taco... singular. Just one? Well I'm gonna need to have more than one. Thankfully, I've never had a problem ordering multiple tacos before. 

I pretty much only like tacos crunchy, so I'll always go for tacos done Nick's Way with a crispy tortilla pan fried with jack cheese & guacamole, and wrapped in a second soft tortilla, for an extra $1.25. How you can say no to cheese & guac?

The one I like most is probably the Pescado taco - Baja style fried fish w/ salsa, lime mayo, cilantro, cabbage & onions. The large fish filet is fried to a crispy and golden brown. The guac not only adds creaminess but sort of acts as the glue that holds it all together. A little squeeze of lime to cut through some of the heaviness and that's a tasty taco. 

I've also tried their Elote, corn on the cob with grated cheese and chili powder. You can't go wrong with Mexican style corn, but elote is becoming a ubiquitous trend that you can find anywhere these days. 

I'll stick to the tacos, which are a little pricey, starting around $4-$5, but they are pretty big tacos, and they don't skimp on the filling. They're all pretty good, but pace yourself. I think most people find themselves surprisingly full after about 1.5 tacos. 

Now there may be a certain appeal to eating a taco in a lounge under a chandelier, but I'd rather order for delivery. Rouge feels more dingy and dated than it does dark and mysterious. Plus, the appeal of stuffing myself with fried foods in the comfort of my sweats is tough to top.
author: Joy W.

description: Great place in Polk Gulch to grab a taco (Nick's way) or two. Highly recommend the elote and the nachos (add chicken/steak for extra deliciousness).
author: Sarah N.

description: Street taco special = a different kind of (smaller, drier and not necessarily warm) taco than their normal soft taco. The latter are waaay better and cost just a little bit more. I like to get the chicken and battered fish soft tacos when there.
author: Dennis W.

description: We ordered 2 tacos carne asada and quesadilla. For a $5 taco it's a VERY small. Flavor was not there either.
author: Vadim T.

description: I had the fajita beef tacos!!! They were AMAZING!! The minute I bit into my taco, it made me think of the many wonderful street tacos I've had throughout my life in Texas.  I love food that taste authentic and not always the cookie cutter restaurant style entrees you get most of the time.  I was on vacation and stopped in for a quick bite.  It was right after they opened so it wasn't crowded at all but there were many people in and out.
author: Erica L.

description: Tasteless! We ordered 4 fish tacos, a buritto, and nachos. Everything was tasteless and bland. It wasn't even salty. We were sooo disappointed. There was no sense of direction too, we came in around 5pm and sat at a table. No one told us that we had to go order and no one guided us. ALSO it was CASH ONLY!!! WTH ... We don't know what's the hype about this place but the only positive thing is the cashier was really nice. Maybe we came in on an off day but for sure we are never going back.
author: Minna H.

description:
Love their **Fried Fish Taco, Nick's Way! Best fish taco in the city. It's huge and yummy! You won't go wrong by order that. Also their NACHOS with steak, delicious! When you order chips and salad, its loaded, genuineness. FYI underdogs does not taste as good. 

Taco Tuesdays are crazy. Lines are super long and you might have to stand and eat. The place is huge tho because its turns into a night club, Rouge. 

The food is good but I don't think its the best place to watch a game. Well at least not for a warriors game. People wasn't even cheering. BOO!! no sports bar atmosphere when they are trying to be. 

Cash only for the FOOD but at the Bar credit card accepted. $20 pitcher for margaritas!
author: Sandy B.

description: I have been going to Nick's for over 10 years. Guessing I visit 1-2 times per week. I am sensitive to overly salty foods - I suspect restaurants do this to compensate for cheap and tasteless ingredients. Nick's food uses fresh ingredients, and is rarely over salted. I usually get a burrito, and find them better than those "mission" burritos that people rave about. Really...Nick's is much better. Also, a friendly staff. Just don't go on Taco Tuesday nights....too many youngin's.
author: Jon I.

description:
Make a reservation ahead of time!! We learned the hard way. The first time we came for taco Tuesday my friends and I circled like Hawks to find a table, chair, garbage can, or anywhere to put our food down and eat. We ended up having to eat standing up in the midst of the large crowd. This time however we made reservations and got two huge booths! What's nice about having a table is that the waiter actually orders and brings you the food so you don't have to go to the back and wait in line. What's weird is they take your food order but they won't order you drinks. We ordered two pitchers of margaritas, chips and salsa, a bunch of tacos, nicks way of course, and I thought the fish was the best out of them all. 

Taco Tuesdays. Go.
author: Linz C.

description:
I went here based on the Yelp reviews. It was to the side of a larger restaurant which was odd, but the servers were very friendly. 

Tried a couple of the tacos, which were delicious and had many toppings. I wish they had a topping bar so you can add more!

My favorite thing was actually the horchata drink...it was very rich and perfect with the tacos!
author: Amelia J.

description:
Dropped by for lunch on a weekend and there was plenty of space to sit.

I ordered two tacos here. The carne asada taco and the carnitas taco. There is a harder taco wrapped in a soft taco, which added a very nice texture.

I added the guac and cheese for the carne asada taco, which was very worth it. There is so much meat on just one taco. For the carnitas taco I opted for regular, which tasted quite dry without the guac. The flavor was good

Free side of chips with Yelp checkin. Huge amount of chips, with plenty of mild salsa.
author: Edward W.

description:
Cash only. ATM on site. 

Ok, I've been in the City for 3 years and I still can't get over the price of these damn tacos! Tacos range from $4.25-5.25 - granted they are pretty dang big. A side of guac though, costs $1.50 and its the size of a small sauce/salsa container. For $1.50 I can get a whole damn avocado!!  Tons of seating, and self serve setting. Probably not the most authentic or as good as the ones in the Mission, but for the area, its a pretty solid Mexican joint.

Ordered: 
Elote - YUM. Do yourself a favor, and get one or two. Perfectly seasoned, and cooked. Kernels are soft and juicy and the amount of butter, cheese and spices blend perfectly in your mouth. 
Fish Tacos - Delicious. Fish was fried to a crispy golden brown and the meat itself was still juicy and not overcooked. 
Carnitas - DRY. They also filled the taco with  peppers and pinto beans. Huh? Maybe I should have read the descriptions more clearly, but whole beans (really, any beans) in my meat taco is a no no. 

Overall, I think this place is pricey for what it is. The elote and fish tacos are the way to go. Their taco Tuesdays seem like a pretty good deal ... $6 for two tacos. Maybe that's the way to do it!
author: Michelle C.

description:
Yum. This place is tasty. Nick's is technically inside a very very divey bar (Rouge) that I'm told gets pretty trashy once it gets too late at night. The SO and I came for an early dinner one day so the bar wasn't too crazy yet. But anyways, this place is cash only and serves up some awesome tacos. The most salient thing you need to know about Nick's is the Nick's Way tacos, which is basically like... a hard shell taco wrapped inside a soft shell taco with jack cheese and guac. Pretty dope. You should have at least one of your tacos Nick's Way. 

Basic concept here is to order at the counter, grab a number, and then try to grab a seat. Seats aren't exactly limited, but aren't that plentiful either. We found the table and booth seats pretty rare, but a ton of space at a side bar in Rouge. 

We got the fish tacos, carnitas, and and pollo. Overall, the fish tacos were actually the best. The chicken was dry and unmemorable, and the carnitas weren't all that juicy and tasty either. But the fish man, the fish were delicious. Nick's Way is also great, though I personally thought that Nick's Way was a bit overwhelming for me since I'm more of a pico de gallo kind of girl. Anyways, 3 tacos split between two was actually a pretty good portion size for us since the tacos are fairly large.

If you check in on Yelp, you get free chips and salsa! So definitely remember to do that. I really liked their pico de gallo.

tldr; not exactly cheap, but definitely delicious Mexican food -- great place for a chill meal
author: Jasmine X.

description: Below average! Don't be fooled by the reviews on this place! Burrito sucked tacos sucked they want to pound off all their old tomatoes on all their food! Don't even eat here!!
author: Alexandra P.

description: We wlaked for 2 miles up to the hill to get here for a quick lunch. It deserved the long walk. Try the peacado taco with guacamole! Great price 20$ for 2 big tacos and 2 cokes came with free salsa and chips. We will come for sure!
author: Alice B.

description:
Very cool spot right on Polk street. I never imagined having tacos at a lounge/nightclub during the middle of the afternoon. But it worked out well!

I ordered the pescado and carne asada tacos (about $5 each), with a side of free chips and salsa with check in. My meal came out quickly--within just a few minutes. The chips/salsa was great--large chunks of tomato/onions and thick chips. The pescado taco was good too-- lightly crispy fish in a double tortilla with lime on the side. The carne asada could have been more tender, but was acceptable after smothered with some hot sauce.

The ambiance was certainly unique: techno music playing in the background, ornate metal chandeliers hang from the red ceiling and you're surrounded by everything bright red, the wall, the flooring, the curtains, the booths--all red. There's a portrait of a female dancer with a cigarette in her hand by the bar as well. Adds a nice touch.

Altogether, a fun experience and a must if you're looking for good fish tacos in the city.

Make sure to have cash or Level Up. Credit cards not accepted.
author: Behnam S.

description:
This place is really fun on Taco Tuesday. Great deals on food and drinks. How can you beat a $10 pitcher of margarita and $1 enchiladas?! You can't. 

Go with your friends, get a bunch of food, a couple of pitchers, and just have a good time. 

Do not expect super delicious margs or anything high quality, though. You get what you pay for. Also, be warned about the post-7pm crowd. It gets unusually rowdy on a weekday and tends to smell like a club at 3am....
author: Karen N.

description: Taco Tuesdays are LITTT! Be sure to head there with CASH and order the Fish Tacos Nick's way! The tacos can get a little pricey and it does add up, but it's WORTH IT!
author: Erika D.

description:
Came here for dinner with my boyfriend on a Saturday night. Pretty packed, but thank God we found a table. You order in the front and get a number and find a seat.

We ordered:
Corn on cob: YUM, loved it so much! It had a white creamy sauce sprinkled with some hot peppers. 
Fish Taco: OK, fish was kinda cold, wasn't too impressed, but crispy! 
Carne Asada Taco: Pretty good, meat was tender. 

Overall, I felt the tacos could of been more hot, it was kinda cold, wasn't feeling it. Make sure you get Nick's style for the extra crispy! Check in yelp and get free chips and salsa!
author: Natalie L.

description: I love tacos and this place makes a mean taco-especially when you get it Nick's way. We got a beef taco, chicken taco, and a fish taco Nick's way. The fish taco was the best with the guac, the crispy fish, the taco shells...it was just mouthwateringly good. Check this place out if you happen to be in the area!
author: Jessy I.

description:
I wanted to love this place but I don't. Went for taco Tuesday and the place was packed by 7pm. I suggest coming early (5:30) if you want to snag a table or make reservations. 

Ordered the special: carnitas & carne asada taco Nick's way. As everyone says, the Nick's way makes it better. Crispier second tortilla with a generous amount of guac. However overall I wasn't too impressed. Being in San Diego for the past few years, I couldn't help but compare the flavor and meat with down south. Yes, they're generous with the meat here (well they should be considering the $$) but it was lacking something special. The meat got tired after awhile. If you're going to try I'd go for carnitas. 

Couldn't be too harsh on the ratings because SF isn't known for tacos so this place is alright
author: Carissa G.

description:
Hype. Alll the hype. I've been here twice now on taco tuesday and here's what I've notice:

1. It's loud & stressful - there's a DJ, which is funny
2. The food comes out very quick - too quick to find a table
3. It's crowded. Good luck finding a table (unless you sit outside, but no alcohol outside)
4. Cash only - but cheap!
5. The tacos are tacos.

What do I mean about #5? I mean they're good and large but I don't find the meat all that great. I've had better flavored meat/tacos at taquerias, where tacos are cheap regardless of what day of the week it is. 

I like the guac. I actually did not care for "nicks way" The crispiness dried out the taco, even with the cheese and guac added to it.

Will I be back? Probably at some point, but not rushing back.
author: Kelly G.

description: My husband and I were really disappointed  we got 4 tacos (Nick's way) and 2 street tacos and waters and the bill was close to $40! The shrimp were cold and pretty insipid and the rest was just not great.
author: Linda R.

description: Love this place! If you're watching a basketball game with a crew this is your place. The drinks are very reasonably priced. The tacos are also delicious.
author: Sara L.

description: not only is the food amazing here, the customer service is unmatched. we were welcomed in as soon as we arrived. while looking over the menu one of the workers was bringing food to another table and stopped by us and showed us what the tacos looked like so we had an idea. despite ordering and paying at the counter we were still checked on when we seated ourselves. the tacos were so delicious and tasted authentic. can't say enough good things about this place! great food and even greater service.
author: Alla P.

description: Worst establishment in the city. Horrible service, horrible payment system, the ticket stub thing through text is a scam. I hate everything about this place.
author: Dexter H.

description: Here's the thing - I've lived in this neighborhood for years and I love Nick's. I've taken multiple out of town guests here to rave about having taco's Nick's Way - "Any taco made crispy with jack cheese and guacamole." I ordered some tacos after coming home from a trip, and just asked to leave off the giant leaves of cilantro that get added to the fish related tacos. I'm indifferent to cilantro mostly, but sometimes I get tired of trying to pick giant stems out of the taco when it's thick with guacamole and salsa since it does taste a little soap-like to me in too big quantities. I asked to not include the extra cilantro leaves that garnish on the taco. This apparently confused the restaurant beyond understanding. My shrimp taco Nick's way is supposed to have "tomatillo, cilantro, pico de gallo salsas, cilantro, cabbage & onion" along with guacamole and jack cheese. They instead put plain sliced avocado, some unmelted jack cheese on the bottom of the soft tortilla, and plain diced tomatoes. There were no onions, no tomatillo, no guacamole, and no pico de gallo. I understand there might be some cilantro in those garnishes so maybe the intention was to remove all traces of cilantro forever but really I just didn't want the extra leaves. My BF who bought the food called back and said they didn't really do things the "Nick's way" the extra price calls for, and the restaurant said they'd make a new order. My BF's non Nick's way tacos he also noticed were also missing the pico de gallo, but he was willing to let it go. For the extra price of my tacos though, no guacamole and no salas was a deal breaker. When he arrived, the server at the restaurant fought what was told to him on the phone. They said we needed to bring the offending tacos back and prove they were made wrong. I found this so needlessly confrontational. I've been a regular customer for almost 10 years now and I'm questioning going back. If you're going to charge extra for guacamole and crisping the taco with melted cheese, you should actually deliver. If your customer has a request you don't understand, you can just ask or say no. I don't get trying to fight your customer over it. Avoid this place until they get their lives back on track.
author: Alissa L.

description: Best place for taco Tuesday I've found that has great music and a young/club vibe. Margaritas are strong and veggie tacos nicks way are fantastic!
author: Niaz N.

description:
Love ordering through Yelp! Yes, I know I am late to the party, but better late than never. Nick's delivery is generous and delicious.  Having had a little too much fun with friends at Flores the night before, and not in the mood to cook, and with every type of menu stirring up nausea -  especially anything heavy and saucy; Nick's food came to mind as the panacea. 

The fresh black bean and grilled corn taco salad was a remedy. A crunchy sweet spicy buttery Elote was light and fresh (clearly I was having a corn craving) -- and one 'lightly' fried fish taco (not fishy or greasy!) was just enough. 

Nick's is the fix! Muy bueno! Thanks Nick's. Me siento mejor!
author: F C.

description: Saw the 3000+ reviews and gave it a shot. The 3 star is for the good service and not for quality of the food. Still confused on why this place is so famous - sorry maybe San Diego has better Mexican food. Tacos were responsible but 3k reviews is a bit much.
author: Tariq M.

description:
Taco Tuesdays will never be the same...

2 Coronas or 2 Dos Equis bottles for $7 was just the tip of the iceberg. There was also the cheap ass tacos and chips, guac, and salsa deals going on. Best of all, are the 2 tacos for $6, and most definitely pay the extra $1.25 to get it Nick's way.

The extra cost turns it into a high-quality cheesy gordita/crunchwrap supreme/whatever the hell else Taco Bell has turned into a gimmick. It's a really thick, crunchy taco, with a tortilla wrapped on the outside cradling the hard taco, and topped with a giant helping of guac. I got it with carnitas, and the result was divine. 

This place started getting pretty packed by the time we left around 10:30pm - wish I could've stayed just as this place was really turning up, but ice cream was calling to my friends :)
author: Matthew L.

description:
There's something extremely gross about this location. Sorry to be harsh, but I mean it: it starts with all the dirty messy tables that haven't been cleared when you walk in, to the sticky seats and tables when you sit down, and there's something damp and musky in the air or something... It makes it hard to enjoy your food. 

We came on a weeknight, and it's a bit strange that you get seated, and there are menus at the table, but you have to order at the counter. 

As for the actual food- The tacos are good, and portions are huge. Not mind blowing, but satisfying. Even just one fills me up. Nick's way is the way to go... a crispy taco inside a soft taco. 

Unfortunately though, the food doesn't make up for the environment. I probably won't be back, and I'll be going elsewhere for Taco Tuesdays.
author: Ashley S.

description: I've been living in the neighborhood for many years and this place is continuing to go downhill fast. The prices have gone up but the service and food has not. I ordered some food online today and asked for green salsa. I spent $30 on food and Nick's provided one little plastic container of salsa. They are getting cheaper by the minute. I won't be frequenting this place anymore. It's sad that the owner is not taking accountability for it's failings. Do not recommend.
author: Anne R.

description:
Came here for lunch for taco tuesday for a company event. They were generous enough to offer the taco tuesday menu for lunch since we had such a large group. Some of the photos on Yelp are very old!! The taco tuesday prices are $3.5 each as of June 2017.

The tacos are pretty big - like two fists put together - if you get it nick's style (and that's really the only style) since they give you like half a cup of guac on top. Taco tuesday does not include their supposedly heavenly fish tacos!

Gotta come back to try those
author: Grace P.

description: Nick's is so good! One of my favorite places to go with a group. Only thing they need is a Ford GoBike station nearby so we can go there more often! It's hard to get to (we live a mile away).
author: Patrick T.

description: I am filled with such regret every time I come here. I know it's going to be bad and yet when faced with some hunger induced desperation I willingly deceive myself into giving this place another shot. $14 for a god damn shi**ty burrito! I will never do this to myself again. I dated a girl that really loved this place so I've been here more times than I am willing to admit. This is a great first date spot--if she loves this place she will ruin your life. Trust me.
author: Joe A.

description:
Wow! This place blew me away. Probably the best tacos I've ever had. 

I read about Nick's Crispy Tacos on a couple of San Francisco travel blogs and knew I had to bookmark it. My mom and I walked over here from the Fisherman's Wharf area. It was a long walk but so worth it. 

We were immediately greeted by the lady behind the counter. She explained the process to us (order at the counter, take a seat with a number) and gave us her recommendations. She let us know that most people ordered the carne asada taco Nick's Way (taco made crispy and topped with guacamole). She also recommended the pescado (beer battered fried fish) taco. I of course had to get both. My mom got the pescado and the vegetariano taco.    I also got a small cup of Horchata. 

The food came out super quick. We got our chips and salsa that came with the Yelp check-in immediately. The tacos were soon to follow. Literally everything we tried was amazing!!! My absolute favorite was the pescado taco. Good God the flavor!! My mom literally could not put it down. I was able to put it down because I wanted to move on the carne asada taco so that I could save the pescado for last.  

Mmmmmm I'm still dreaming of that meal. It was so filling and fantastic. It was also inexpensive- $23 for everything we ordered. I highly recommend!!
author: Elizabeth C.

description: Very enjoyable experience. Kind of a strange combo of night club and street tacos. Great pitchers of mojitos and super fresh tacos with excellent quality ingredients. My only disappointment was that they do not have flour tortillas for the tacos. Personally I just don't like corn tortillas. I settled for a burrito but I was not disappointed at all.
author: Lena L.

description:
I ordered a burrito for delivery tonight and it was honestly one of the worst burritos I've ever had. It came room temperature, with a horribly soggy tortilla that didn't seem to be warmed up at all beforehand. The ingredients in the burrito were in that awful layering where you only get a bite of guac, then a bite of rice, etc. It was DRENCHED in sour cream and therefore lost a lot of its flavor.

I also ordered a cup of horchata and it was way thicker than it should have been and almost tasted powdery. It's an agua fresca, not a leche fresca.

I've heard great things about this place and I found it to be extremely subpar. I hope their tacos are better than their burritos, and even then that wouldn't be saying much.
author: Hannah G.

description: Gross soggy tacos. Really packed and overrated. I'm not sure how it became so popular but in my opinion (and my roommates) it really lacked flavor, freshness and spice. Emphasis on the sogginess.
author: Gina B.

description: Ordered take-out on Monday 5/30. My shrimp taco(s) was a cabbage taco with one shrimp cut in half. Disappointing sad shrimp . Nick's crispy tacos at underdogs actually puts 3-4 whole shrimp in their tacos. While obviously across town, there is zero comparison.
author: Nikolette S.

description: Probably the best fried fish taco I've ever had. You have to order it Nick's style. This place is cash only but there's an ATM right by the register. I'll definitely come back here next time I'm in SF.
author: Graham K.

description:
Great tacos found here! I was expecting a small run down taco joint, but Nick's is actually a sit down restaurant full of red booths and seating. At night, this place turns into a full bar and dance area. We stopped by just for tacos, which you order at the back counter. 

Nick's way = inside corn tortilla is crispy and in between the two tortillas is a layer of jack cheese. Reminiscent of Taco Bell anyone? ;) My boyfriend got this with the carne asada, a good mix. I chose the grilled fish and opted to get regular soft tortillas instead. The flavor was good though I wish the fish was a bit bigger (I paid $5.25 for this!). Still in terms of tacos I've had, these were definitely in the top five!
author: Helen Z.

description:
Came here with a group of friends to celebrate a birthday dinner! The margaritas are SO GOOD and 
The Fish taco was bomb!! The Quesadilla fill you up and the chips and salsa were amazing! 
Definitely recommend this place for all Mexican food lovers!
author: Justin S.

description:
Is it cash-only so the waitstaff can more easily swipe your wallet from the table? First time a burrito cost me $60...

Theft aside, the food was okay.
author: Travis K.

description: I am trying to figure out who gave this place four stars?  The food is cold and commercial......STOP IT!!!
author: Andre D.

description:
I really loved these tacos!   And the booths, lighting fixtures and ombiance were really kitchy
Free chips and salsa with my Yelp checkin.
The tacos were gigantic!  It took me some strategy on how to get the first bite in my mouth... super fresh salsa, really savory and tender meat, brilliant green guac and the right amount of cheese.  We each ordered 1/2 regular soft and 1/2 crispy tacos; I loved them both.   Four tacos was way too much each, but we stuffed them in anyway!  Too good to leave behind.
author: Lisa E.

description: Drool. Crispy tacos loaded with guac. Get them Nick's way of course. You can't go wrong and you'll be stuffed. All the meats are delicious. Love this place!
author: Dana J.

description:
Loved the crispy tacos! Tried the Pescado & Pollo. Yummy. My grandma had the Sopa de Tortilla. Also very good. Loved the salsa music playing in the background & the service was above & beyond. Will be returning soon. 
Kid friendly.
author: R E.

description: I love Nick's. I usually order two vegetarian tacos Nick's way (hard + soft shell taco) and that is usually a decently filling meal. They put cabbage in their veggie tacos / burritos which is a hit or miss with some people, but I like it. They overload on the guac which is amazing and have delicious sauces at the table, so don't miss those! Not the highest quality food, but definitely a good quick meal or something to keep you going while drinking :)
author: Nidhi M.

description: Must try the fish tacos (Nick's way) at least once! Bring cash.
author: Olivia H.

description:
Super fun, chill environment with super awesome tacos! Perfect for large parties. I came with a group of 20 people and there was plenty of space for everyone. 

I ordered the Carne Asada Taco and it was deeeelicious! I still can't believe how enormous their tacos are. Definitely enough to stand as a meal! I love how they pair the soft tortilla with a super crunchy taco inside--adds an awesome texture. 

Check in deal is sweeeeet. Possibly the best pico de gallo I've ever had. Pro tip: add guac on top! But it'll bring the price up another $3. The guac paired with their salsa is bomb.com though so it's super worth it.
author: Carolyn L.

description: Grilled fish taco regular style was 2.5-3 stars. Carne asada Nick's style was 3.5-4 stars. Interior design was easily 4 stars. Want to feel like Tony Montana? Slide into one of the elevated booths and feast like a boss.
author: Shoole S.

description: The first night we went to Nick's it was AMAZING. The woman at the counter gave us great suggestions. We ended up trying a few tacos-carnitas, fried chicken, carne asada, and fish (mostly nick's way). Carnitas were a bit dry but fried chicken was the BEST. I also had to try the elote which was spicy but still good. Overall, we were so impressed that we went back the next day during taco Tuesday. Their menu is extremely limited during that promotion. It's a little cheaper but not worth the few dollars you are saving. The tacos were definitely not as good as the day before. Not as flavorful and the tortillas were stale. Disappointing. Wish we just went that first day!
author: Michelle B.

description: Tasty and wonderful food with large portions. And the staff is incredibly kind and friendly. Definitely worth a visit.
author: Leo J.

description: They look better on pictures that they really are. The tacos are in deed large but they are a bit dry and tough to eat. Not as fresh normal tacos.
author: Jess ..

description:
1) This place is shared with a bar/lounge.

2) Spacious, with plenty of seating. 

3) Try getting the pescado tacos having it Nick's way. 

What a genius place to have inside a bar/lounge. When you're drunk, you want the munchies! Cheers!
author: Owie N.

description: This place is so good, food is on point, place gets busy so get in early but reasonably priced and atmosphere is great with good dj's playing great music.
author: Cory E.

description: The tacos were very tasty! However, our food was cold-which took away from the experience. The pico de Gallo wasn't as fresh as expected. Overall, the tacos were great! Pescado taco ( Nicks way) was definitely the best.
author: Chere G.

description: Nicks on taco Tuesday night is a San Francisco legend. Got the carnitas, chicken, and carne Asada tacos "Nicks way" with guac and cheese- delicious and super filling. I shared 1.5 with a girlfriend but totally could've just had one. $7 for 2 tacos (plus 1.25 for nicks way) and $7 for 2 coronas all night. Missed the happy hour margaritas but they're $4 and looked super yummy. If you don't have a reservation make sure to get there early or be prepared to ask friendly looking people to share their table. The lines are long but totally worth the tacos and beers! DJ is awesome too, it's like a Tuesday night club atmosphere and great place to start before walking down Polk street for more fun!
author: Lisa H.

description: I was so surprised by Nicks. The decor is money in the bank. The food is cheap and plentiful. The drinks were good. We sat in a banquet and had a good view of 5 TVs. Perfect for a lazy afternoon.
author: Vern S.

description:
Well kinda bland, for Mexican food. However it is called Nicks.
Soft tortillas still have to be cooked a bit. Mine were right out of the package.
Dinner plate delivered to hotel with no forks.
Delivery was on motorcycle. Opened box food everywhere 20% tip ahead of time. 
Well is wasn't expensive and we had been traveling. We were desperate for food delivered
author: ken a.

description: Wow I came here expecting the same tacos I'm used to getting at the taco shop (underdogs on Irving), and man was I surprised. First off the inside of this place is dirty. Second the "guacamole" was that pre-packaged bullshit you get from Safeway.  Not sure what the deal is with this place but it's weak and expensive, oh and cash only with an ATM that charges 3 bills. Stay away from this spot unless you like a bad time.
author: dan m.

description: Not sure what the hype is about. Had the chicken, shrimp and fish tacos and everything was quite underwhelming, especially the chicken, which was extremely dry.
author: Mahak R.

description:
Had the guacamole chops an pick very good...on recommendation had carne Asafa Nicks way awesome... only complaint is the bar .... which has nothing to do with Nicks....unfriendly and warm beer WTF I'm not in Europe or England or Ireland I like my beer a chilly 40 or below theirs was not even cold to the touch on pint glass ....will return to do fish tacos! 

Oh yeah affordable as hell!
author: Paul D.

description: Excellent food, generous amounts too. I liked the interior decor, very different. The carne asada tacos tasted great accompanied by strawberry agua fresca.
author: Claudia C.

description: The tacos are OK. The bar for tacos is pretty high in the city and this one just falls below it.
author: Hemant J.

description: Pescado tacos, fried chicken and asada tacos were the bomb. We have eaten many tacos in our travels, and Nick's ranks amongs the best. Tip- ask for Nick's Way and 2-3 tacos should be plenty.
author: Fido M.

description:
Taco Tuesday. SOOO crowded, but for some amazingly delicious and inexpensive tacos and quesadillas. Every Tuesday evening is crazy packed inside. Most likely, you're not going to get a table unless you arrive before Happy Hour begins or if you made a reservation at least a week prior. People tend to stay in their seats for a long, long time because they are so scarce. When I went this past Tuesday, my crew and I just stood the whole time we were there. But the crowdedness is definitely the sole downside of my entire experience.

You get some pretty darn good tacos for 2 for $5. I had the veggie tacos, which were smothered in delicious guacamole and were prepared Nick's Way. I'm a little conflicted as for whether having your tacos Nick's Way is worth the money or not. I loved the addition of the cheese and guacamole, but having two layers of tortilla was a little too much for me, especially because the "crispy" layer wasn't especially crispy. I'm glad that the veggie taco came Nick's Way automatically so that I didn't have to pay extra and still got to try it.

In terms of the flavor, my friends and I all thought that the tacos were great. Generous portions of meats and veggies to the point that the tacos are falling apart (get your fork ready!). I also got the cheese quesadilla for $2 on Taco Tuesday, and it's weird to say, but this was one of the best quesadillas I've ever had... and all that was inside was cheese! I don't know how, but Nick's was able to add so much flavor into a quesadilla without too many ingredients. The portions are huge as well. If you love just regular cheese quesadillas, this one is to die for.

Drinks are pretty cheap on Tuesdays as well. My friends and I shared a nicely-sized pitcher (served 4-5 people with one glass each) of margarita for $20.

Cash only for tacos unless you have the LevelUp app to pay, which I highly recommend. LevelUp is just a payments app that's very easy to use and connect a card to. I believe you save $2 on your first visit if you use LevelUp to pay!

I doubt that I will come back to Nick's other than for the Taco Tuesday deals, and next time I'll definitely make a reservation far in advance so the crowd doesn't become as much of a problem as it was this last visit.
author: Sheila D.

description:
I came in the middle of the day on a Sunday. I've been to their location on Irving St. at The Taco Shop at Underdog's so I was curious how this would compare. You walk in and order from the food counter, not the bar. They give you a number and bring the food to you. I only ordered one pescado taco Nick's way and I'm glad I only ordered the one. It was huge! Love that they make the tortilla just a little crispy but not crispy enough that it becomes a hard shell. A little pricey - $10 for one taco and a small horchata but I was full afterwards. I also utilized the free chips and salsa (it's pico de gallo over chips) Yelp check-in offer which added to my fullness. In case you were wondering what the consistency of the horchata is like as my bf always inquires, it is quite chalky and not too creamy. 

Friendly service and I like the big booths along the walls. It's quite a large space, I'd like to come here at night to see what it's like as a club. Here's a con: the bathroom smelled really bad and wasn't clean even in the middle of the day.
author: Liz R.

description: I thought the food was pretty good. Tacos were well prepared and tasty. I'm glad I went. The one thing I mark them down on is cash only aspect. It amazes me there are still businesses that practice this to avoid taxes. Then they have an ATM literally next to the ordering booth. Well at least the service was good.
author: Max R.

description:
My fiancé and I arrived for lunch a few hours ago, it was a seemingly decent meal. He had a carne asada quesadilla and I had 3 pescado tacos. And even we shared their nachos. Everything was pretty tasty, especially the quesadilla; I had a small taste. 

CASH ONLY, by the way. 

Soon after we left, my stomach started to hurt, I assumed I had just over eaten, but the pain gradually got worse and I grew really nauseous -- long story short, I ended up vomiting everything...

I believe in giving most places second chances, but ... I don't know... I probably won't be coming back after that experience..
author: Aiko H.

description: I don't order delivery often, but when I do it's usually the fish burrito (nick's way) from Nick's! The tacos are good but honestly nothing satisfies like the fish burrito. I usually eat about half until I'm full and then I keep eating until I hate myself a little - that's how good it is!
author: Estelle C.

description:
The place was quick to provide us food and provided us a lot of good food for a decent price. I don't believe the tacos were all that special but I would definitely recommend nicks way. I think I liked the nicks way tacos at Tacko better.

Making it a plate I think is worth it as it's not much extra and it adds a lot of food.

It would be really cool if they had a huge selection of hot sauces like Tacko does too.
author: Neil P.

description:
It's really my fault for ordering food from a place with a substandard health score(69 of 100), but I didn't think to check when ordering through caviar's delivery service. I was hungry and needed sustenance and a chicken asada burrito seemed enticing.

The burrito arrived within 15 minutes of ordering, which was quite impressive. However, the flavor was definitely a far cry from the city's numerous amazing burrito spots. There also wasn't much guacamole in it either. 

Regardless, I'd give the place 3 stars if it weren't for the gut bomb this burrito gave me. I'll save you the dirty details from the end of my experience. Just know that these burritos probably will do you bad.
author: Zachary T.

description: The food was underwhelming, sadly. With all the great reviews we went out of our way to find this place - Uber'd it around town- only to be disappointed. I can only speak for the burritos - bland, tex-mex style, didn't feel authentic (should've probably known based on the name of the restaurant,) and were a little too soggy for my taste. This wasn't my type of Mexican restaurant, but if you're into the Tex-Mex taste, you might like it.
author: Eva B.

description: My friend and I walked in and there was no one to attend us or even tell us we could sit anywhere. We asked the bartender and she said we could sit anywhere, so we did. We waited about ten minutes and no one came to assist us. I definitely will not be going back again. Really poor customer service.
author: Lisabet Z.

description:
I like this place a lot... it's an above average Americanized taco/burrito location. They do great.

But they sold me a side of guac for $1.50 that I've literally had on more than a single chip.

C'mon man.
author: Ninja R.

description:
GREAT quality tacos, possibly the best tacos I've had in San Francisco. I got a couple chicken tacos (one is not enough for a full meal) and they're overloaded with meat/veggies/sauce to the point of potentially falling all over you as you try to bite in.

The only downside is the location, the inside of Rouge (in the day time) is a bit dirty/dusty and that's a bit of a put off.
author: Brendan M.

description:
Steak taco - 3/5
Fried chicken taco - 3/5
Fried fish taco - 3/5
Carnitas taco - 2/5 - Dry meat
Chips and salsa - 2/5 - It's not salsa, it's Pico de gallo.
(Nick's way) - 4/5 - Crispy with decent guacamole makes all of the tacos better.

Overall, "A-OK."
author: Mark O.

description:
I've had Nick's tacos many times throughout the years at Underdog's. I've also been to Rouge numerous times to dance the night away. But having Nick's tacos at Rouge? I've never had that experience. Even now, I'm actually too lazy to go to Nick's, but I decided to finally try tacos from this location when I saw them on Caviar. Ordered delivery on Sunday, July 5th around 11:45am.

*Carne asada taco: grilled steak in corn tortilla with pico de gallo, no beans ($4.10); Nick's way: made crispy with jack cheese and guacamole (+$1.30)
Nick's way is the way to go! I love crunchy tacos, so I actually ate the tortillas since they were nice and crispy.

*Elote: corn on the cob with grated cheese and chili powder ($4.10)
My favorite dish! The corn was sweet and perfectly cooked.

*Grilled fish taco: seasonal fresh fish served with tomatillo and pico de gallo salsas, cilantro, cabbage & onions in a corn tortilla ($5.15)
The fish got a little soggy from the trip, but nice flavors.

*Camarones taco: grilled tiger prawns with tomatillo and pico de gallo salsas, cilantro, cabbage & onions in a corn tortilla ($5.15)
This was awful. The shrimp were rubbery and just looked old and shriveled.

*Carnitas burrito: braised shredded pork rolled in a flour tortilla with pico de gallo & pinto beans ($8.85), add Guacamole (+$1.50)
The roommate ordered this. I thought the carnitas were okay. A little dry.

*Pescado burrito: Baja style fried fish rolled in a flour tortilla with Baja salsas, cilantro, cabbage & onions ($9.60)
This was way better than the other burrito. The fish was nice and crunchy. Like having a huge fish taco wrapped up in a flour tortilla.

If you order through Caviar, they don't really have much of a markup. Averages about 4% more on Caviar than from what's listed on Nick's online menu. It was also great that our driver packed up sides of salsas since I love pouring salsa a whole container per taco.

If it wasn't for the awful Camarones taco, I'd give Nick's 4 stars. But that was a waste of money and a sorry excuse for a shrimp taco. Next time, I'll stick to the fish and carne asada tacos. Nick's way of course! And their delicious elote!
author: Elena N.

description:
Nicks crispy taco was hella crowded for taco Tuesday. This place was definitely not what I expected. The decor is awesome and the food definitely hit the spot.  We order 3 tacos "nicks way" and chips and salsa/guac to share. They don't accept the yelp check ins for free chips and salsa/guac during taco tuesdays! 

Their tacos are pretty unique with the crispy taco between soft taco shells - was not actually expecting to be full after eating 1 taco and some chips. Next time I go, I'm definitely ordering the fish taco.
author: Stella S.

description: We had spent the day touring San Francisco and wanted to end the day with some great margaritas and that is what we got!  Food was good and staff was awesome.  Thanks!!
author: Kristie B.

description: The food is excellent. The bar and the food ordering are separate entities. Essentially, you will order at counter in the far right side of the entrance. Definitely worth a visit!
author: Colton S.

description:
Not impressed. The food was greasy and lacked any flavor. Also, a bit pricey for what you get $5.75 a taco + 1.75 if you want it "Nicks way". Which is a dollop of guacamole. 

The nacho cheese tasted like it was straight out of a can. I tried to like it since I was craving nachos but couldn't come to terms with it. 

Aside from them bringing your food out, there isn't any service here... 
I won't be back.
author: Judith V.

description:
Food never arrived after 2+ hours. Bad attitude from the employees when I tried to call. 

There's much better Mexican food in San Francisco that isn't nearly as overpriced. Skip this place.
author: Colin M.

description:
I have been here many nights, but this is the first time I've been at Rouge when the sun was still up. And honestly I'm pretty disappointed I waited this long! As a SoCal girl, I have a pretty high standard for good Mexican food that the bay just doesn't meet very often. These tacos though, are everything I was missing. I went for the Crispy Tacos (how could you not, when they're the name sake?), one carne asada and one carnitas. Now I hate being charged like $2 for someone making my taco a little fancier with avocado, but the move is 100% justified here. For one, they pile on that guacamole (thank god), and having the taco shell crispy is the glue that holds it all together.
Now, this taco is insanely messy-only come here with loved ones you don't mind seeing you eat with your fingers. But damn is it worth every last bite. Now none of my friends branched out and tried anything but the tacos, so I can't say if the rest of the menu is equally delicious, but I can say this is the PERFECT start to a nigh out on Polk Street.
author: Sophia B.

description:
Taco Tuesday died.  

Prices increased 20% and selections narrowed (excludes pescado and etc).  Get ready to shell out $5 for one Taco Tuesday discounted taco Nick's way.  Considering the food quality and volume to cash ratio, it's expensive for SF.  The cash-only inconvenience is a little ridic too...even food trucks take credit cards now!
author: Amy J.

description:
I ordered a carne asada burrito here. It was just okay. There wasn't enough meat in it and the tortilla was soggy. 

Service was good, they offered complimentary chips and salsa. Make sure you bring cash because they don't take card (:
author: Cindy Q.

description:
I tried "Nick's Way Taco" at the Underdog Taco Shop on Irving and I loved it so much that I was beyond excited for the mouthwatering tacos that I had there. I hate to say it, but the original tacos here...were not that good. *gasp*  Maybe I came on a bad day but here's a brief overview:

LOCATION: This place is on Russian hill.. street parking is hard, even though there are free residential parking around, it would still be hard to find an open spot. It was also a little confusing to find this place because it is located inside a bar.

FOOD:
-Nick's Way Taco: (Basically a regular taco with a crunchy layer + guach) The crunchy layer... was soggy. Now now, I know it's expected that tacos get soggy after a while but the ones that I had at Underdog was crispy and perfect, while the ones I got here... were not. Save your money and get the regular taco *sigh*
-Regular taco: just what you expected. Nothing extraordinary about these but nothing to complain either :)
- Elote: Mmmm... drenched in butter goodness. It is a little pricey in comparison to the places that sell these on a cart, but still good regardless. 
- Chips and Salse: FREE with yelp check in. What gets better than free?
-Horchata: One word to describe it? Sandy. The whole drink was thick and had the seed mash was not mixed well. 

SERVICE: 
Me and my friend was basically ignored by the girl waitresses the whole time, and probably because we weren't looking to order drinks from the bar.. which in my opinion is a little rude. Me and my friend had no seats and was just standing at the table eating (while ignored by the girl waitresses..haha thanks) when out of nowhere the guy worker came and grabbed us some seats. Huge thanks to you and I don't even know if you're a waiter!
author: Jenny N.

description: Tasty Mexican food and a big bang for your buck. Stopped in for a Friday lunch and service was fast and food was plentiful and tasty.
author: David F.

description: Catch me at this place every Taco Tuesday because there special is fuego!! Love the tacos Nick's way with the hard shell wrapped in a tortilla smothered with guacamole and salsa, yum! Best taco hands down in the Polk area.
author: Kafilat Y.

description:
Nicks Crispy Tacos is the place to go on Tuesday nights. They have delicious tacos(huge), and great deals for taco tuesday and their happy hour. Unfortunately, it seems like they only have 1 server for food and 1 server for drinks during the time which means you're often left ignored and thirsty. I would switch up how they do the tables on Tuesday. 

However, they made it work and all was great!
author: Cheyenne H.

description:
Woohoo! I had a great team happy hour here. I was a little worried the tacos would be meager in size given the great price point but they were very generous! I love how it's two tacos but one of the layers is crispy. I LOVED that. The fried fish one is where it's at. Margaritas are only $4 during happy hour so you really can't beat that. 

The seating is spacious but ... not great for more than 6 or so-ish people. There are also TVs so you can definitely catch the game or what not if you so desire. The environment is kind of odd since it's like a French/red lounge-ish sort of place? Not sure quite how to describe it but it does not read "after work tacos"

MUST GO IN SF.
author: Cindy W.

description: Only thing good about this place is Lisa B. Devon at the door had an issue with any out of state ID and the GM accused out of staters as being "wasted" after questions were raised, Lisa B to the rescue, told us how things work and gave us some free taco coupons. thank god for Lisa B. Heard the tacos are good but definitely not a night scene for anyone without gray hair unless you want to argue with Devon at the door. Hate to see it. Thanks Lisa B.
author: Kara O.

description:
This review is just for their fish tacos, done Nick's way - tortillas made crispy with cheese and dolloped with guacamole. The fish is huge, fresh, and crispy. The price is a little steep for fish tacos, but I really enjoyed it. Would definitely come here again.

I've read reviews about taco Tuesdays and how crazy it gets. I came here on a Friday afternoon, around 1pm, and it wasn't busy at all. Perfect!
author: Janis A.

description:
It was my my first time here and my BF's second, but it's been years.  We walked in through what looked like the main entrance and waited a while to get greeted, but that never happened.  There were customers seated there, but no employees in site.  We walked out and walked into a smaller, less main entrance looking like door, and it turns out you order at the counter, which is way in the corner.  Not being greeted or told what to do was kinda an annoying ordeal, but their food sorta, kinda made up for it.  

My BF ordered one carne asada taco, one carnitas taco, and a modelo and I ordered their pescado taco, Nick's way, and nachos to share.  My pescado taco was amazing.  Fish was perfectly battered and fried and all the fixings were perfectly complemented.  My BF also really liked his tacos.  Nachos were good, but nothing amazing.  I'll pass on them next time.

Another gripe was that the food was kinda expensive.  Our bill came out to be $34, not sure if it was worth it though.  On their website, I saw that there were daily specials, but nothing was advertised at the place.
author: Samantha C.

description: Left me on hold for 10 minutes never even got to say a word. They Obviously don't have a hold button because I was able to hear multiple personal conversation between coworkers which I found incredibly rude. I called back several times, automatically decided. Why, because the left the phone hanging. Worst customer service, and I haven't even entered the restaurant.
author: Nica I.

description:
Consistency is key and I expected the same great food and work especially on Cinco De Mayo.

I told my friends how good Nick's was and this time around the kitchen was super-sloppy.

Ordered carne asada tacos, Nick's way and carne asada quesadilla, Nick's way.
Mind you it is busy since it is a Tuesday and it also Cinco De Mayo, but I've been here when it was even busier. 

If they had just taken the time to read the order properly, this would not have happened and I also should have noticed that there was no guac and sour cream in my quesadilla, but I'll take the L. Paid for Nick's way and not receiving it is a bummer. 
The tacos that I ordered also came in a soft taco without guac and the jack cheese. 

I really do like Nick's a lot but I can't be pleased when things get sloppy.
author: Sam K.

description:
I can't believe this is my first review of Nick's, but after 20+ visits.... I'll hit you with a pros and cons list

Pros:
- so reasonable for taco tuesday and even everyday, it's crazy
- two tacos will definitely fill you up
- tvs everywhere, super fun place to watch a game
- reservations are worth it for taco tuesday & game days
- breakfast burritos are bangin'!!

Cons:
- rude staff
- mediocre bartenders
- a bit smelly

A few weeks before my boyfriend's surprise birthday party, I called and made a Taco Tuesday reservation at Nick's. When I arrived, they had lost our reservation and therefore screwed up the entire surprise (we went to Bullit instead). The manager emailed me, offering me a Taco Tuesday on her. 

I took her up on the offer a few months later for a Warriors playoff game. She was really thoughtful, placed us in a booth as so it wasn't crowded and we could bring tons of friends around. She comped the first round of beers, and told us we could take our bucket home (which they later removed from our table and we couldn't take home). They also comped the food, so all in all it was a fantastic apology for  surprise birthday party reservation gone wrong.

Unfortunately, she didn't seem completely honest in her intentions. She kept telling us she was going to take care of us, give us a deal, etc in a strange way. She was very out of her way nice to us... until later in the evening. It got busy and a friend of mine tried to order at the bar. She coincidentally ended up speaking to the manager who assisted her at the bar. When my friend tried to ask about the tequilas (top shelf v. standard), the woman scoffed at her "I'm not your cocktail waitress."
author: Kerry G.

description:
A very odd place that's a bar and a taco joint at the same time. Well the taco joint is hidden in the side, but it's cool regardless. Cash only!!!
I was wondering what type of person comes to this place at night, but whatever, I was there at 2 on a Saturday. I got the BBQ pork special and grilled fish taco, fiancee got veggie tacos and we shared poppers. There was enough food where we didn't need the poppers, or we didn't need to each get 2 tacos. The tacos were lavishly appointed with all sorts of good toppings, depending on the type. The poppers were good, but nothing to write home about. 
The drinks sounded tasty, but I was trying to be good about not drinking too much. I definitely will return to this place if I'm ever back in the area.
author: Samir K.

description:
Ridiculous that you can't order online/app after 8pm. Even called the restaurant and they said to go online, get your shit straight if your gonna tell a customer what to do! 
Looks like more piles of shit on the floor.
author: Victor D.

description:
Went here with my ex girlfriend on a visit to SFO and was happy with the tacos and nachos. The place had a bros and sorority girls vibe on a football weekend but the "Nick's Way" crispy tacos were off the charts good. It is a hard shell wrapped in a soft shell and two will do for most people. A yummy taco experience to be sure.

Note: tell the bartender you got food for a discount on mimosas!
author: Marc R.

description:
I ordered through Postmates and got the pescado taco and elote. I didn't know what to expect, but I always heard good things about this place.

I never had a fish taco before, I've always gotten a carne asada taco from taco places. But, it did not disappoint. There was a huge piece of fish and they gave me sides of guacamole, pico de gallo, and some other sauce (not sure what it was, but it was good). I only ordered 1 of these and it was more than enough.

The elote was greatttt. A little cold (probably from the delivery), but I didn't mind. I've always been a fan of elote. I don't remember much because I ate it super fast.

I will be ordering again from here and next time, order something different to try the different kinds of tacos they have!
author: Sunny O.

description: Such a great taco place. The fish tacos were perfectly cooked and so flavorful! Good service as well.
author: Adrian Z.

description: Giving 3 stars only because of the food being so bland it definitely wasn't worth the price 2 burritos and 2 cans of soda was $30. However the customer was great very friendly staff too bad the food didn't match.
author: Michelle H.

description:
Excellent spot for cheap tacos. They have 2 for $5 tacos on Tuesdays and Sundays. Otherwise, each taco is priced at $4-$5. I started out with chips and salsa. The chips were crispy and served fresh out of the fryer. They gave a generous amount of chunky salsa with real cubes of tomatoes. It's a great free dish for their Yelp check-in offer. Also had the carne asada soft taco that had grilled steak with pico de gallo and pinto beans. The meat was tender and juicy.

Don't expect a classy ambiance here. It looks like a nightclub mixed with sports bar mixed with Fuddruckers. Note that they're cash only. Sit at the bar at Rogue next door where you can enjoy some drinks with your tacos.
author: Helen C.

description:
Lovee Nicks! One of the best taco's I've tried in the city. They also have a sister restaurant called Tako in the marina as well. During Taco Tuesday, it definitely gets pretty busy and there will always be a line if you come anytime after 8ish or so. If you want to reserve a booth, call and ask for Rebecca. It's so much better to reserve a booth and enjoy your drinks and tacos at peace instead of standing all day. Another great time to come here is when there's a game on too. 

You'll never go wrong with any tacos you get here. I always get their tacos either pollo and carne asada but whatever you get I'm sure you won't be disappointed. What I love about their tacos is that its two layered tortillas and one is soft and the other is crunch. It has that perfect crunch-soft texture.
author: Jenn L.

description:
Came to Nick's for lunch while visiting SF. It was midday during the week and was not particularly busy. The interior has an interesting look, and resembles an out-dated nightclub, with red leather couches and a central bar. 

For 3 of us we ordered 5 crispy fish tacos. For 5.50 each the tacos were sizable, with 1-2 being enough for each. The fish was perfectly battered, crisp, and had a soft interior. The taco had a soft outer shell and a crispy inner shell. The guacamole on top was also delicious. Overall, one of the best tacos I've ever had.
author: Aaron C.

description: The taco is huge but its a bit expensive. It's cash only so u might wanna bring a lot of cash. Besides that, food is really good, the environment is good for two or a group of people. Fancy inside though
author: 海庆

description: I ordered delivery through eat24. Our order came 3 hours later, we got one taco out of a $45 order, and the one taco we got had a bite missing. It's actually funny retrospectively for being so ridiculous, but at the time it was very frustrating because after 3 hours of waiting we ended up walking to pizza hut to find any food that was still open. Anyways, I spit on Nick's tacos and pss on eat24 for this experience and then followed by their lack of customer service.
author: Nolan M.

description: My boyfriend and I ordered delivery from Nick's a few nights ago. The food was great. My boyfriend ordered a carne asada burrito, I had the fish taco, fried chicken taco, and the carnitas taco. It was way too much food, so the value was good for the price. The flavors were great and I thought the tortillas were really good. The major downside was how long delivery took through Eat24 - food arrived cold and 45 mins past the estimated delivery time. Thank goodness for a microwave!
author: Kim A.

description: Been to a bunch of places similiar with better food and service. Also staff is not customer service friendly. Why have a check in bonus that doesn't apply to everyone? Yelp you need to check that!
author: Johnny B.

description:
Fridays are the new Tuesdays... said no one ever. But I'm saying it now and I'll explain why. 

If you want to avoid massive lines on Taco Tuesdays I would totally recommend getting here for happy hour on Friday. I'm talkin' BIG tacos for REAL cheap.

I got two massive tacos for 8 dollars (cash only or ... some payment app) because I got them nick's way, but otherwise it's a two (select) items for $5 deal. 

My friend got one taco and one thing of nachos for $5. Her nachos were amazing, I would recommend getting that for sure.
author: Kat T.

description: Ordered carne asada and Pescadero tacos Nick's way. JJ ordered fish taco , Nick's way. Still trying to figure out if there was any cheese. Presentation is good, beans, greens, guacamole, onions but lacking in flavor. Somewhat saved by the included lime slice. Salsa with chips good and fresh but not a whole lot of flavor.
author: L J.

description: First of all. I have to say that their food is good and people are nice. Service is quick but you probably wonder why the two stars?? My dear friend. I am one of those people that don't get all icky about hair in my food. I ordered 2 carnitas taco and I took a bite twice to find a hair. Not a big deal ...tossed it. Even though it is a pricey taco. Well...got into another one. The fourth bites...yup...another hair...what can you say to the first..and then now the second one. Tossed my lunch and hope to God that their Salsa and Chips got no hair. And hope to God it's not pube....
author: S F.

description:
Mmm... I've had Nick's a few years ago when I visited SF, but this time it was just as memorable and messy to eat.

I ordered two tacos: one of them was the carne asada (Nick's way) and the other was the fried fish taco. Both were very tasty, but super messy to eat so grab lots of napkins! Nick's way includes lots of guacamole and a fried soft tortilla.

The place is cash only, and if you check into Yelp and show it to the cashier, you get free chips and salsa which is a huge score!
author: Nina H.

description:
As a guy from the East Coast, I've heard many things about the food on the West Coast, specifically in California. "California has freshest food."..."California has food that explodes with taste"..."Cali food is clean and locally produced." Now, in no way am I refuting those opinions or mocking California food. I just think that there are great places to eat in every state. This place, however, was not an amazing representation of Cali food. It's exactly what 2 stars mean- it was "meh." 

My brothers and I visited Nick's Crispy Tacos sometime around 8-11pm on a Saturday night and when we arrived, the place seemed like it had just been the venue of a high school party. There were empty booths but dirty tables, a shiny walkway but sticky floors, several trashcans yet all of which were overflowing. But, it was in the middle of the night, perhaps reaching closing time, and I didn't think too much of it. We got to the counter and were greeted by 2 cordial women. They took our order and were happy to redeem our yelp voucher for free chips and salsa. The chips were crispy but plain and the salsa tasted watered down. But I wasn't there for the chips; I wanted to try some of the tacos that people were raving about. After around 15-18 minutes, we got our bag of tacos and went to town. My first impression of the tacos were their size. Imagine a chipotle burrito and then cut that burrito into 3-4 even pieces and comparably, thats how small the tacos were. After finishing the steak and fish tacos in 2-3 bites, I was not impressed. Sure, I tasted the fresh ingredients of a family owned restaurant and enjoyed tender steak. However, the tacos did not live up to the hype. 

I suppose it's only fair to say that the tacos were reasonably priced (maybe a bit expensive for a taco with the circumference of a beer coasters). But the flavors of the tacos, chips, and salsa were disenchanting. The presentation of the venue was unattractive. And if it wasn't for those two cheerful workers/cash registers, I might've given this restaurant 1 star. For those of you wondering why I might be a bit harsh, no, it's not because of some East side-West side beef. I may have caught the restaurant on a bad day, but the food and venue really were just underwhelming.
author: Kenneth C.

description:
Food is alright but definitely pricey. About ten bucks for a burrito and 4.25 per taco! So yeah...

Bar tenders however are awesome and very friendly/helpful. In my opinion you are paying for the bar/bartenders here. Pints are  $6 a pop.

Also, you order at the counter then seat yourself (I'd recommend sitting at the bar, those guys will take care of you more than the wait staff).

I would sum this place up as American Bar style mexican food.
author: Patrick S.

description: Best tacos in San Francisco. Definitely get them "nicks way". I have been going to Nicks Crispy Tacos for years and I still find them the best tacos around!!
author: Della P.

description: Disappointing. I have seen many good reviews and wanted to give it a shot. I ordered a vegetarian quesadilla (I know my fault already for not getting tacos), it came out fairly quickly. However I wish it had stayed in the kitchen longer as it was cold. The cheese was barely melted, rice was still hard, and overall not enjoyable to eat.
author: Abie W.

description: Very nice place and they serve delicious food. We love the  Pollo Asado (grilled chicken) and Pescado (fried fish).
author: Team M S.

description: Found hair in my burrito, and I was half way done with eating it. DISGUSTING. Never coming back. I almost threw up when I discovered it was someone's bright red hair. My hair is dark brown.
author: Katrina A.

description:
LOVE the food here.  The fish tacos are my favorite....so tender, tasty, fresh, and lovely.  These cannot be beat.  I have learned, however, to avoid adding the guacamole into the taco; the flavor tends to overtake the fish.
Cheers, Nick's.  Live long and prosper!!
author: janice s.

description:
I get it. Nick's is super fun! It's in the back of a bar! You can get more cheese on your orders! But at the end of the day, the tacos are aight and that's the only way to my taco loving heart.

Ordered the two most popular items on the menu: the pescado, deep fried Baja fish taco goodness, and the carne asada "Nick's way" which is basically with two tortillas, the inside one grilled crunchy with a layer of cheese in between. The tacos aren't bad, just poorly constructed and crammed with too much miscellaneous stuff. More salt! My fingers are not bloated enough for being on vacation.

Plus five stars for the horchata though since it actually tastes like rice and goes great with a shot of rum
author: Angela C.

description:
Amazing Nick's way tacos. They're very big so one goes a long way :)
One of my absolute favorites for Tacos. Do not live in SF or visit without a stop here. You will be sorry you missed it.
author: Kimia R.

description: Went here for taco Tuesday but trying to find a table was very difficult as there were four of us. Also not a fan of lining up for everything and the cash only tacos. But 4 stars as the food came really fast and the food was delicious! It definitely gets a little ratchet at night with the club music and disco ball but it all depends on what type of vibe you want. For a fun good time (get ready to yell over the music) come here
author: Kaitna S.

description: This place was great! Very friendly staff and reasonably priced food. The tacos were delish, definitely recommend the Nick style. My only gripe is that they used a TON of cilantro! Luckily I don't hate cilantro, so it didn't ruin it for me, but the tacos and salsa had so much it was almost overpowering of the other flavors.
author: Ana M.

description: Very spacious interior. Got 2 tacos for takeout. Both were pretty destroyed but maybe that's what I get for getting takeout.
author: Lukas F.

description:
The city flagged this place with "High risk vermin infestation". 

I will pay twice as much for a taco that tastes twice as less (or half, you do the math) compared to the Taquerias in Mission, and it will still have health risk when I dine here. Hah, never again.
author: Gokhan T.

description: LITERALLY THE BEST TACOS I HAVE EVER HAD!!!! The fish tacos are phenomenal and they aren't filling so you always want more!!!! LOVE IT!!!!!
author: Clare J.

description: Great food!  We ordered the vegan quesadillas, vegetation (no cheese for us) tacos, and our free chips and salsa.  Everything was hot, fresh, and just as ordered!  Will definitely be back!
author: Sharon J.

description:
Ah Nick's.  It is my luxury taco stop in San Francisco.   Maybe sometimes I'm too lazy to look for parking, but as I was finishing some shopping errands for the holidays, the car parked in front of Nick's Crispy Tacos pulled out in front of me. IT WAS A SIGN!!!

I put my signal on and parked.  I was hungry!  A Nick's Taco will cost you $3.95 and then when you do it Nick's WAY (add Guac and beans with the Hard and soft shell) you get a meal.  One should be enough.  I hadn't eaten breakfast so I had a Carne Asada and a Pollo along with a Mexican Bottled Coke!   

Your order at the register (cash only, but there is an ATM right there behind you if your eyes get too big and you order more than your wallet can handle). I was given my number and found a nice red velvet window booth.  Nick's owner, Pete, also has a club called Rouge (Red) that shares the space. It becomes more of a bar/club scene at night.

Wait, did I say Pete and not Nick?  Is Pete's dad's name Nick?  Nope. Uncle? Nope. Son? Nope.  Was he a fan of Nick van Exel? Nope.  Nick was the first cook until he was fired for stealing money!  Ohhhhh, then why not Pete's Crispy Taco's or at least Pedro's Crispy Tacos?  Who knows, perhaps it makes a better story this way.

Anyway, my two tacos arrive in a matter of 5 minutes and I devour them in the same amount of time! Oh boy!  I can't believe I ate the whole thing.  The guac was excellent, the tortilla was crispy and not greasy.  The meat was tender!  Bueno!  Dang, the bar doesn't even look open! Should I deduct a star for that?  Nah.  

If you want a good vibe, cool food, cheap date, come here.  Yeah, it might be a while before I come back, but not because I don't like it, I just don't like the parking situation.  I guess I just will have to keep waiting for my sign to get back in there and have another taco

Oh they have quesadillas and Burritos too.  Just get the tacos the first time.  They have Monday Night football night as well as Taco Tuesdays.
author: Erik H.

description: Good tacos and quesadillas, had it delivered. Nice red & green sauces, nicely spiced. Hit the spot and showed up quickly, a nice plus.
author: William M.

description: I am from LA and these tacos are a whole another take!  Wow it is like eating a steak!  These tacos will fill you up especially if you get them Nick's way!  The ambiance is pretty cool. You have to reserve tables to eat otherwise your grabbing the taco bar and eating at bar. Not kid friendly!   Will have to come back and try other varieties.
author: Kim H.

description:
There's a lot of Mexican food options in San Francisco and I'm usually pretty loyal to El Farolito or Taqueria Cancun. I wanted to try something new when a friend was in town and Nick's was high up on my list. It was good, but to be honest I think it was overrated. We ordered fish tacos and carne asada Nick's way. The fish tacos were totally lacking flavor and I wouldn't order again. The carne asada was very good and I loved that it came with beans and a big scoop of guac although I will say they blend the guac way too much so it's lacking texture. 
To me, good Mexican food in SF should be at a dirty hole in the wall somewhere on Mission or Valencia St. I thought this place was overrated and the atmosphere didn't match the food at all which sounds weird but it mattered.
author: Sophie S.

description: worst tacos and margitas ever! we came here because by looking at the pictures everything looked good! not at all.
author: Veronica C.

description: It's good. But be sure you have cash. No credit card can be used. They do have an ATM at the register if you forget.
author: Sonya F.

description: Whoa! Nick's is the spot, a true diamond in the rough. I absolutely love the set up tables and layout of the venue. DJ is great, it's a nice sized dance floor. There is a pitcher drink that was really good. The carne asada and fish tacos Nick's way are simply AMAZING! If you took away the bar and dance floor and left the tacos Nick's would still be a thriving business. Come on tuesdays or during a Giants, Warriors, or 49er game is a for sure win. This place is perfect for going out with friends or on a date. Trust me you will enjoy yourself! You're welcome.
author: Rubin S.

description: Delicious and wonderful food with great portions. The vegan options were dense, filling, and fresh. And the staff is wonderful kind and friendly!
author: Willow C.

description: My sis loves this place and eats here every time she's in SF. I got the nachos and she got two chicken tacos. If there is such a thing as taco envy, I was experiencing it. Those tacos looked so delicious and they tasted just as good. They were topped off with guacamole. Yummy! The nachos were good too, but tacos were better. It's a big spot with bar and DJ. Kinda disappointed the DJ wasn't that good. For a Saturday night it wasn't even close to packed with dancers. My advice go and get as many tacos as you can because they are super bomb. Then head somewhere else to dance it all off.
author: Kristal G.

description: Fun place to grab drinks with friend. Especially m, tuesdays can get pretty lit here for taco Tuesday. Nicks is a great time.  Check it out!!
author: Ross S.

description: Pescado tacos are the best here! Especially when the fish is freshly fried and you hit with some lime. Mmm sooo good! Also their elotes are delicious as well. I wish they would take card so I could order some more food! So make sure to bring enough cash if you want to avoid paying for an atm fee if you user their atm.
author: Lisa H.

description:
A couple of friends and I came here last week for Taco Tuesday. We arrived around 7pm and it was super crowded.

You order at the register and they give you a number so they can bring it out to you. It took about 10 mins on a busy night to come out which was pretty quick in my opinion. I expected  a longer time for it to come out.

Tacos are 2 for $5. They are big for tacos, so don't over order! I ordered a carne asada one and a carnitas one. Both are good, although i don't see anything special with them. Compared to other places, they taste just "good" for me. 

I also ordered a margarita. My friends and I didn't realized there are pitchers for $20. We would've totally got that instead since they are huge.
 
I don't think i would come back on a tuesday night especially if it is this packed every week. There is no room to sit or stand. You have to reserve the booths to sit there, but there are other open tables but they are packed. I would like to have a seat to eat my tacos instead of having people pushing me here and there and dropping toppings on myself.
author: Allie Y.

description:
Affectionately known in the hood as Crispy Nick's, these guys have been feeding Russian Hill gringo Mex forever.  I appreciate the concept of fully utilizing a space that is otherwise rarely used (Rouge), but it's still weird sitting inside.  

If a joint has awesome salsa, we're going to get along famously.  Salsa is one of my favorite things.
Their salsa is mediocre, & this sets the standard for the whole experience here.  Bland & watery, lately I've found that its best to stick w the green salsa, at least for consistency.

I used to love their tacos, but unfortunately the quality has gone down, along w flavor.  Whatever you order, you're really taking a gamble on dryness & blandness.  Que paso?  

It's pretty scattered & reliably unclean too.  No bueno.

All the way around, Underdog's is way superior.

I have to give them props for service.  It's always friendly & efficient.  Even when they're busy, I've never had to wait too long for my order.  

Overall?

2 & 1/2 stars.
author: Veronica M.

description:
Whoa this place is random! Taco place by day and Night Club by night!

//AMBIANCE//
This place is super interesting. Its very dark inside. There are these elevated round red velvet booths.
