There is a bar in the middle and tables on the other side next to the wall with the super big mirrors. Sit anywhere you want. There were TVs everywhere, great place to watch the game! We came in around 2:30 and people were still coming in to eat, which means that this place has something special!

//FOOD//
Chips and Salsa: 
FREE W/ YELP CHECK IN. Yes, please. The salsa is actually pico de gallo, which I think is even better! Fresh tomatoes and onions are way better than the pureed version that could have been sitting out for awhile.

Nachos with Carne Asada: 
Super yummy, with black beans, meat, and cheese. I have to admit that the cheese was a weird consistency, but still very tasty! It was more of a cream that was broken leading to a grainy texture. My one complaint is that sour cream did not already come with the nachos and we had to order it as a side. Boo :(

Fried Chicken Taco, Nick's Way:
If you are going to come to Nick's Crispy Tacos, you better get Nick's Crispy Tacos. Its a no-brainer! Nick's way adds guacamole and a crispy taco inside of your taco. That extra crunch really makes a difference! The chicken was crispy, but a little salty. The guac was fabulous. 

//SERVICE//
Order at the register, get a number, sit anywhere, grab your own napkins and utensils, and get your own water. The food comes out quickly. But, there can be a line at the register because that's the only way to put in orders. You can even ask to change the TV channels which is awesome! The clean up of tables can be a little slow, but the wait staff is super nice.

//NEXT TIME//
I saw three agua frescas I really wanted to try! I really want to come here for Taco Tuesdays, I just can't say no to a deal! Until next time, Nick's!
author: Vivian C.

description: on a recent trip to san francisco, my friend and i came in here after walking around and exploring a few hours. we were hungry but didn't want to spend a bunch of money on a small meal (the restaurants out in the bay area can get very very pricey compared to restaurants I'm used to in texas). the food was definitely cheap ($7 for two items) but not very good. i picked nachos and a taco as my two options. the taco lacked much depth, it had pinto beans, meat, and pico on it. no onions or cilantro or lime or any salsa. it was just alright. the nachos tasted like carnival nachos aka fake cheese. not very good at all. i'm certainly glad we didn't spend a fortune on our meal seeing as we wanted something budget friendly, but it just wasn't that great.
author: Lilly S.

description: This place is great! The food was awesome and the set up is pretty cool! I would recommend this place to anyone in the SF area!
author: Felicia O.

description: Nick's Crispy Tacos are the bomb!  Some great combinations and a large selection.  The Fish and Crispy Fish are two of my favorite.  The fish was flavorful and moist.  The prices sneak up on you since you need to pay extra to have them "crispy" which is a shame.  Also keep in mind they are cash only establishment unless you use the LevelUp App.  There is a bar which does take credit cards which is good to wash down the tacos.
author: Kevin F.

description:
I'm very confused about the ambience of this place. It's like some sort of divey Mexican bar/lounge that's trying to be fancy or classy with chandeliers but with red leather booth seating that reminds me of old school diners.

That aside, the food here is pretty legit. Or maybe I just really enjoyed the food because I was drunk, in which case it's still amazing drunk food.

My group and I ordered a bunch of tacos, burritos and nachos to share amongst the 7 of us. I had a POLLO TACO ($3.95), which was a soft corn tortilla with salsa, pinto beans and tender pulled chicken. The tacos are pretty sizable. I definitely thought each was half a burrito when they were first brought to our table. The NACHOS ($8.95) were topped with cheese, salsa, guac and pulled chicken. I LOVED these. Could not stop eating them! The cheese was warm and melted, and the chips were generously topped with everything, even the meat. Huge portion, and even better when you can get 2 giant piles of nachos for $5 on Fridays!

I generally never really want Mexican food in particular, and yes, everyone else raves about the tacos, but I can't get over those nachos!
author: Jessie L.

description: No one greeted us when we walked in or explained we needed to order at the counter so we stood at the door looking lost for several minutes before we noticed the counter in the corner. The bartender even looked right at us and didn't acknowledge us. Only accepts cash. Overpriced tacos were just okay. We were very underwhelmed by our whole experience.
author: Ashlee B.

description: Nick's is great! Their happy hour 5-7:30PM is the best time to go ($20 margarita pitchers and they're pretty strong). Definitely get the tacos Nick's way (fried chicken taco is amazing). Whether you go for drinks or food or both you'll have a good time!
author: Jorgen A.

description:
Anytime a business name has the words crispy and tacos in it, I expect them to throw down.

Nick, did not.

I ordered the veggie tacos. Two corn tortillas, the inner one fried and semi-crispy. Semi, that's right. The outer, soft. Who does that? The beans, cabbage, and cheese made up for a boring mix. It needed something interesting added to it, like chipotle sauce. The guacamole tasted like it'd been sitting there for a minute. 

The red and green salsa was ok. 

The watermelon agua fresca tasted old, so I returned it.

The Mexican corn on the cob was good.

Look, if you want legit tacos, just head to the Mission. I effed up, and assumed Nick could prepare a basic taco. I was wrong. Head to El Farolito, Cancun, Puerto Allegre, or El Toro. You won't be disappointed.

I'm Mexican, I'm a taco expert, take my word.
author: Gabriela W.

description:
They have a great happy hour but if you can't get there for happy hour, at least relish in the fact that you can get a seat! Order your food at the counter, then select a table at one of the swanky red booths (it turns into a nightclub at night). 

Get the taco's & make sure to get them "Nick's Way" which comes with crispy cheese. Both the carnitas and the carne asada were both really good! The burritos are also good. Make sure you get a pitcher of mojitos to wash them down!
author: Kari G.

description: Love this place the tacos are very good chill vibe and there's a cool bar in the same area....highly recommended
author: Sean T.

description: My vegetarian brothers and sisters, this is the spot! Crispy veggie tacos.. look no further! BEST VEGGIE TACOS EVER! Don't care for the indoor seating.. too dark. That's the only thing I'd change.. decor.
author: Anum M.

description: I really enjoyed this place! It was me and sisters 1st time there, and we both loved it. They feed your, butt!! Not stingy with any meats and especially for their nachos, or just regular chips, salsa and guacamole. I will definitely come back here.
author: Tasi A.

description:
Service: 3/5 

Walked in and waited a minute or two to be greeted. The host/waiter invited us to sit wherever we'd like so we did. And we continued sitting without being helped. Then we noticed at the back of the restaurant there's a counter where you can order your food. Thanks for letting us know! At least the cashier was friendly in that fake "I hate customers" type of way. 

Food: 2/5

Our food came out quickly. Well, almost all of it did. The corn I ordered showed up a good 5 minutes after we finished eating. I almost forgot I ordered it and considered asking for a refund. Besides the elote, we tried the pescado, carne asada, carnitas, and bean/cheese tacos. All tacos besides the bean/cheese were "Nick's way". We also got a side of nacho cheese sauce because cravings. 

Let's just say we weren't impressed. The pescado taco was the best, but it was good but nowhere near great. The carne asada and carnitas we're just okay. Three nacho cheese sauce was trash. Like, I've had better out of a crock pot at a highschool sporting event. Do not order the nachos.

Overall: 2/5

The venue is dirty. I guess it's also a nightclub since there's a DJ Noth to complement the cheesey dusty red velvet seats and chandeliers that make up the decor. We didn't receive any apology for receiving the corn after the meal. I found the entire experience awkward and unwelcoming. Coupled with the mediocre food I'll be passing on a repeat visit.
author: Dorian P.

description: Nah. Don't believe the hype. Came here yesterday and while it is a cute place, I found the tacos to be subpar. I ordered 1 grilled fish taco and 1 fried chicken taco and both were 95% lettuce, cheese and guacamole, barely any fish. Only 1 piece of fried chicken in the other taco and it was mostly batter and VERY greasy. Chips and guacamole were good but who can't make tortilla chips and guac?! Cash only which still annoys me being that it's 2017 and you have to order food and drinks in 2 different areas. Don't see myself coming back here
author: Andreea M.

description:
The tacos here did not live up to all the hype I heard about. The place is shared with a bar. It is also Cash Only. Tacos are just soft tacos but when you order Nick's way it is made crispy with jack cheese and guacamole.

Carne asada taco Nick's way. The crispy part was not that crispy at all. They just grill the soft corn tortillas so it gets a little crispy. The one thing I like about Nick's way was the amount of guac loaded on. I was really surprised when I took my first bite because I wasn't expecting beans in a taco. That's new to me but I should had just opt out for beans. Not too impressed with the asada.

Fish taco - I got this Nick's way as well. The fish itself was big and very flaky. I'm glad this doesn't come with beans.

Carnitas quesadilla - I really liked this. It was pretty basic but had a ton of tasty pork and cheese. 

Overall I was not too impressed with the tacos here especially being the second most reviewed place for tacos. The tacos itself were a bit pricey for what you get.
author: Michael C.

description:
Tacos are A-MAZE-ING. Get them Nick's way (I highly recommend Carne Asada) or be filled with regret. And I love that it's actually affordable and in good location! 

You'll need to get there early if you want a table for Taco Tuesdays, but don't let that deter you from going-- Taco Tuesdays are a blast and a half.
author: Hannah B.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised and have heard/read rave reviews, but I am a skeptic myself.

Its a little confusing how the seating and ordering works, otherwise I would give five stars. My friend and I wandered in looking for someone to help us and it took a couple minutes before we could flag down a food runner and have her clear off a table in one of the booths for us. The inside decor is really interesting, that of a lounge, which threw us off as well. But nice to look at, anyway.

Upon checking in at Nick's I received the offer via Yelp for free chips and salsa. I love me some chips and salsa and these chips were EXCELLENT! Nice and thick, house made, not overly salted. And the salsa/pico was very fresh and tasty in tandem with the two other salsas available (roasted and green) in bottles on the table.

You have to go up to the counter in the corner where the register is located to order, so I ordered the grilled fish taco and camarones,  but forgot to ask to have them crispy (which, in my opinion, should be standard since the place is called "Nick's CRISPY Tacos" but whatever). So I received my double tortilla tacos and they were pretty darn tasty with that green salsa. They don't skimp on the filling either so two tacos, plus the chips, left me pretty full. My friend ordered the same but "Nick's style" which includes guacamole and sour cream, for I believe an extra $1.50. The crispy shell was actually covered by the outer soft tortilla, interesting. Reminded me of a double decker taco from Taco Bell, but way more tasty-looking.

We were lucky to get a table in the early evening on Sunday but I have heard there are lines out the door, so I guess its best to go at non-peak times if you're tummy is grumbling!
author: Malika H.

description: The Fish taco was good...Carne Asada tacos, rice, beans, and everything else was just OK....the food seemed to lack flavor..Music playing was GOOD......and don't forget CASH ONLY...if you come...
author: Denice B.

description:
Cash Only.

Dear Nick's Crispy Tacos,
Thank you so much for being there for me before I go out drinking and the day after I have been drinking too much. You are one of my favorite hangover cures and why I have a hard time staying on track with my diet. 

I absolutely love this place and have tried just about everything on their menu. My favorite things to order are their pescado tacos ("nicks way": crispy with jack cheese and guacamole), their pescado burrito, carne asada burrito, and poppers. I hate it when places skimp out on their guacamole, they don't do that here. 

We have also been coming here recently to watch the Warriors games. There are plenty of TV's here, however you need to call ahead of time to reserve a table. The awesome thing is that they do not charge your group a minimum to reserve a table during big games like other places do. 

I look forward to many more magical moments at Nick's.
author: Denise J.

description: Yuck.  Don't bother ordering delivery.  I have not been to the storefront, and not planning on it now.  I have been a resident in this neighborhood for almost 20 years.  Not once have I had anyone recommend this place or met up with friends there like we do at so many other local spots.  After one delivery order, I understand why it's not on the radar.
author: Brian D.

description:
Welcome to fratlandia. This place is just like your college bar, without the sticky floors. 

Pros:
(+) tacos, nick's way.
ridiculously stuffed tacos. get two and you will be set for the night. add in a corona or a modelo especial and viola, perfect dinner.
(+) atmosphere. 
the frat scene isn't for everyone, and if it isn't for you, it's understandable, but this bar clearly caters to that crowd and it does it well.
(+) 2 tacos for $5 fridays + taco tuesdays
what else needs to be said?
(+) large screen TV.
keep up with the game while getting your drink on.
(+) lounge area/ booths.
Good for groups, a nice alternative to crowding around the bar. 

Cons:
(-) guys on the prowl, college style.
get a new pick up line, you have a job now.
(-) long lines, no tables.
for all you Cal alumni out there (go bears!), think Cafe Durant + Taco Tuesdays.
author: Patricia K.

description:
Came here for lunch on a Sunday with friends. 

Parking - A lot of street parking available. 

Seating - Plenty of seats available around noon, but the booths filled up quickly. Booths were a little small. We were a party of 6 and it was almost too cramped. 

Decor - Very red. Tons of silver chandeliers as well. A little gaudy. 

Food - They gave us a free basket of chips and salsa when we sat down. The chips were very crispy and fresh; the salsa was fresh as well. Based on the waitresses recommendation, we ordered the pescado, pollo and carne asada tacos all Nick's way, which is $1.25 more per taco for jack cheese and guacamole. The pescado was amazing! Definitely the best, then the pollo. I wasn't a fan of the carne asada; the meat wasn't too flavorful. I liked how the tacos had a nice crunch because they were made with both a soft and hard shell. The portions are also quite big, which is probably why the tacos are $4-5 each. Unless you have a monster appetite, I wouldn't order more than 2.

Drinks - A lot of people were doing the bottomless mimosas, which is $15/person, but you need to spend at least $10 on food. We also got a watermelon aqua fresca, which wasn't too sweet and quite refreshing. 

Service - The waitress/hostess/cashier and bartender were both very nice. You order food at the counter and drinks at the bar. Food is cash only, but the bar takes card, which is quite odd.

Tl;dr - Pescado taco Nick's way. Food is cash only. Bottomless mimosas are $15/person. Bar takes card.
author: Emily W.

description: I am not sure but I believe this is one of the original place's for nick's way tacos. A must have if you're in sf. The food here is really good, and inside they got chandeliers (iiiiiii wanna swiiiiiing from the chandelier).
author: Kanoa U.

description:
This is a San Francisco MUST! The chips/nachos are fantastic, and the tacos are money. You have to get them "Nick's Way" - which is when they add a crispy shell stuck to a flour tortilla with melted cheese in between, and then add a generous amount of guacamole on top. They are big, so one should fill you up if you are also splitting an order of nachos.

Also, the mimosa brunch is a steal. We didn't partake in it, but I think it is something like $15 for unlimited mimosas from 11am-3pm. This is a great taco spot for a quick meal, brunch, or late night eats.
author: Jaclyn T.

description:
Omg!! Best tacos ever!! After my sister introduced me to this place, whenever I visit the city, I always always always have to make a stop here! 

I'm normally not a seafood eater, but the fish tacos.. Drooool! Super delicious! (I have only tried it fried) You have to get them Nick's way and with guacamole. I still think it's so funny that there's an amazing taco place inside of a bar/club lol the best of both worlds! 

Parking is all metered and the streets are busy, but you can normally find good parking around the corner.
author: Pang cha H.

description: I've eaten here twice and both times the food was blahh...I don't understand what all the hype is about??!  Casual and cool spot to chill but the food isn't the best quality. Carne asada, chicken, Nick's way tacos were all average. The chips and guacamole were good but needed more guacamole. Overall, just OK...
author: Noor S.

description:
Now I know NOT to go to a taco place to get a burrito. 

I ordered a carne asada burrito assuming that it would be decent, especially for it being around 12 BUCKS (w/ everything). Big mistake. It came out to my table about 20 minutes later! Does it really take that long to roll up ingredients into a tortilla?!? The place wasn't packed with people.  On top of that, the tortilla was cold, the carne asada was cold, and there was very little carne asada in the burrito in general.  That burrito may be worth $4, for the cost of materials and that's it.  I should have got tried the Tacos. But, it's gonna be hard for me to go back and take that chance again.
author: Alex C.

description:
FINALLY made it to my first ever Nick's Taco Tuesday and thank god I did because those tacos were some of the best (and the cheapest) i've had in the city so far (you gotta order them Nick's Way - crispy with guac - $1.50 extra but SO worth it). This place was jam packed and I was actually very surprised. I had no idea what I was in for when I asked my friend who had just moved to Berkeley a few days ago to grab some dinner and a drink or two. 

We got there around 7:30pm and it was absolute madness. We were also there until 10pm and the madness did not end. There was a consistently long line for the tacos the entire time (which are $2 by the way so I can understand why). The coronas and dos xx are also 2 for $7 which is great as well - also other drink specials i believe - beer pitchers and marg pitchers. We got to the front of the line to order food which was a quick and smooth process (CASH ONLY) - i have no idea how the servers find everyone's numbers in that place. Stressful doesn't even begin to cover it i'm sure. 

The only "complaint" I have is that it is really difficult to find a spot to sit/stand/set your food down so you can eat and drink and not have to juggle everything at once. Totally understandable though because this is the place to be on a Tuesday. Just a little frustrating when you're hungry and all you want is a place to set down your chips and guac/salsa (also $2) so you can eat your taco and drink your beer. 

Don't let that stop you from going to Nick's though, I know it won't stop me from going back. If you're looking for a fun, college-y environment with good music for young people on a Tuesday, THIS. IS. YOUR. PLACE. 

Definitely making a reservation for a table next time. You might wanna do the same :)
author: Ilana B.

description: This place has that weird charm. Great for when you want to grab beers on Taco Tuesdays. Otherwise, it wouldn't be my first choice for Mexican.
author: Joe S.

description:
never fails when i want a naughty fish taco. 

i get them deep fried with guac. nick's is a bit far from us so we generally get it delivered. which makes it more expensive for tacos. but so worth it. 

i also love their rice. i mix the salsas with it and eat it on the side :)
author: Taylor N.

description:
For as many reviews as this place has, I expected it to be better. But then again, I feel like I have high expectations for tacos. We came in for taco Tuesday and got the 2 for $6 tacos. Still a little pricey for a taco Tuesday I think, considering you can get some pretty darn good tacos for ~2. The tacos were pretty big in proportions so I guess that makes up for the price. We also got a pitcher of margarita and it was very sweet, didn't really like it all too much.  

The atmosphere was a bit loud, there was a lot of people, but makes sense since beer was like 2 for $7 and it was taco Tuesday. I say 3.5 stars for this place, but there's no option for that so...3 stars because I didn't think it was a 4.
author: Vicki L.

description: We stumbled across this place and it has some amazing tacos and quesadillas, especially when crispy. Def recommend this place.
author: Chandni P.

description: Best crispy tacos in SF! Turns into Rouge night club at night but worth it if you can stop by.
author: Natasha L.

description:
Great customer service!!
Lisa was so sweet and helpful!
Great place for group events: clean and spacious!
Prices are reasonable!
There's no parking but is easy to access through public transport!!
author: Enrique R.

description: I went there a few days ago and was actually disappointed with the crispy tacos. Been there several times but as of lately I've noticed a change in the quality of the food. Honestly you guys have wonderful staff but the food quality and taste has become questionable. Please go back to the original crispy tacos you one had. I love this place and no one else makes it Nicks way so let's get back to basics. And don't change the recipe
author: Sandy C.

description:
The WORST quesadilla I've ever had in my life. It's not hard to fuck up a quesadilla, but Nick did. Don't know why the reviews recommended the quesadilla - it was terrible. The carne asada was shitty, the bit of cheese in it tasted off, and the whole quesadilla was falling apart. It was like eating imitation cheese and tortilla - the two couldn't stick together to make a legit quesadilla. And, adding insult to injury, it was $9.25. DON'T EVER get the quesadilla.

Had Nick's tacos a few times a few years ago - they were pretty good.
author: Ai N.

description:
Haven't been here in years and friends suggested this place for dinner. Now I know why I've forgotten about this place. 

Ingredients are not particularly fresh, tacos aren't great even though that's part of the name of the business, and the tacky red interior hurts my eyes.
author: Bonnie L.

description: Cash only, very limited tables first come first serve basis. You might end up end up with food in your hands and still standing.
author: Sam S.

description: The tacos were stale/soggy and another time I ordered to-go and they totally got my order wrong when I got home and opened it. No reason for me to return after being disappointed and annoyed every single experience I've had.
author: Sandy T.

description: The fish burrito was delicious!!! A super good portion and packed with all the goods. The chips and salsa were good, nothing out of the ordinary. The tortilla soup was delicious as well and the bowl was really big, much bigger than I expected. Service was great, but it's sucks that they only take cash.
author: Aya O.

description: Nick's is a destination for our family when visiting SF.  Tucked away in a sleepy corner of a nightclub, this gem doesn't disappoint.  Great tacos and chips.
author: Rick R.

description: Since I checked in on Yelp, I got free chips and salsa. I was glad it was free. It wasn't really what I would consider salsa more like chopped tomatoes and onions spread all over a pile of chips with no seasoning. And it made the chips soggy. As for the tacos, they were just ok. I would recommend to skip this place and save your money for one of the many places in this town that actually has decent Mexican food.
author: Sarah R.

description:
This was a toughy.

This review is strictly for TACO TUESDAY.

PROS:

The ambiance was amazing. I came in thinking it would be a typical Taco Tuesday spot but when I stepped inside I felt like I was at a club (possibly a frat party as groups of "bros" scattered the place taking group photos of them chugging beer from pitchers). Don't let this scare you. On average, people looked to be in their mid-twenties.

The music was loud and the DJ had a great assortment of techno/hip hop songs. Don't come in here thinking you can a deep conversation with a friend. You'll be shouting to hear each other (which comes easy when you're three drinks in).

The place was packed yet our order got to us in less than 5 minutes.

CONS:

The tacos are...OK. Nothing to rave about but not bad either. The chips and salsa/guac are delicious. 

Chances are you'll spend the whole night standing. There are very few tables and hundreds of people. 


OVERALL, I LOVE this place and will be returning for future Taco Tuesdays!
author: Zohra A.

description:
Spent a random day in the city and decided to finally cross this of my places to eat. I have no idea why it took me this long to eat here but glad I finally made it! We came on a Saturday afternoon for a late lunch and it wasn't too crowded. I was surprised to see it attached to a lounge - kind of cool for an evening thing but also kind of odd at 3 PM. Never thought I'd be eating tacos in a very red room surrounded by so many bros. 

Anyways, on to the tacos! I got 2 vegetarian tacos and shared the jalapeño poppers. The food came out pretty quickly. I was pleasantly surprised with the amount of guacamole they add. Definitely a major bonus point! I also was surprised at the crispy taco shell within the taco but I guess it is called Nicks CRISPY Taco. Added a nice crunch to the overall taco. 2 was very filling even though they appear small. They stuff it with beans, cabbage, onion, cheese, and guacamole. The jalapeño poppers were okay, nothing too special. I would recommend against them and instead trying another taco if you're hungry. 

Didn't try any of the drinks but there appears to be a lot of specials so wouldn't mind coming back to check those out. It's cash only so something to keep in mind.
author: Krishna S.

description:
Came for taco tuesday and their tacos were only 2 for $5!! I wanted mine to be "Nicks way" which comes with add ons (guac and cheese) but also an extra charge, but for me it was definitely worth it! Adding guac to anything makes such a big difference haha

I got the carne asada and fish, and both were delicious! The fish was crispy, like it was right out of the frier! But what surprised me the most was the free chips and salsa when you check in!! They give you a super generous amount and the salsa was super fresh w/ ACTUAL tomato chunks! I also got a glass of sangria (cause I was feeling fancy) for only $5! 

One downside is that it is cash only, so make sure you head to the ATM ahead of time!
author: Carrie L.

description: My girlfriend and I go here quite a bit. I love The "Nick's Way" version of their tacos, and we always order the elote (corn on the cobb). The workers are usually really friendly too.
author: Preferred C.

description:
$2 for tacos and cheese quesadillas.  Tasty and good but not the best.  And for $2 it's definitely a deal.  The portions are fairly large, too. 

The place can get a but crowded and stuffy (poor ventilation)
author: Angelica C.

description:
I have heard great things about this place, so had high expectations when I tried it for the first time yesterday. On Fridays they have the 2 for $7 deal, which can't be beat! Everything we ate was delicious: the nachos, quesadillas and chicken and carne asada soft tacos. And a churro of course. 

I will definitely be back to Nicks and recommend!
author: Sarah K.

description: Love this place ! Went on a Saturday for lunch and they had chill reggae music, great tacos and the bartender was really nice. $10 mimosa carafes too!
author: Marcela F.

description:
This place should only be visited when your shit face drunk. Otherwise you will notice how filthy this place gets and how yerrible the staff is. The first time i went it was recommended by friend. I should of left after i saw the bathrooms, the smell was terrible. And also notice yelp had a warning for this place, a health hazard unsanitary warning. I should went with my gut but my gut suffered later. Non of it tasted fresh but i was starving and a lit buzz. The second time i came, it was during the day. We drop a friend off in sf and decided to give the place another try.It was way past lunch time so it wasn't busy. There was a bunch of the staff at the counter as soon as we walk in every one dispersed to the back, very weird. There was guy to the right of the counter. All he did was stare at us holding his cell phone. Some one finally came to take our order. They did not offer any chips and salsa we eventually had to ask. We got our chips but no salsa (frustrating). So i went to the counter were the guy was standing on his cell phone to ask for some sauce. He just stared at me and grab me one hot sauce. Very awkward! He  gave me the hottest one even though i asked for a mild sauce. This place is full of young jerk staff. And i dont drink like i use too, so I will never go again.   
!
author: Mushi Mushi G.

description:
Damn good tacos. 

But it's also the most money I've ever paid for tacos. Did the taste outweigh the cost? Ehhhh not sure. 

Interesting set up. When I first walked in and saw the chandeliers and velvet booths, I wasn't sure if I was in the right restaurant. 

Decent happy hour. And this place gets packed for football games! 

Bummer that tacos are cash only, but bar accepts credit card.
author: Noelle H.

description:
The reason this place got 2 stars instead of 1 are the tacos. Whoever makes them is doing a phenomenal job... Keep it up. 

My issue with Nicks is the bar. I opened a tab, bought a couple of rounds, and when I go to close out, my card and ID have somehow vanished into thin air. After briefly looking for my card and ID, the bar tender (The same one who I gave my card to) says, "Your card is not back here, you need to figure out who is paying for the 2 buckets you bought." I asked to see if my card was closed out by someone else. Another bartender told me they don't even have the ability to see that. I asked for the manager, who came over, and said he would look for my card but then went over and started poring drinks for other people. 

After 30 minutes of me hounding the bartender to keep looking for my card. She finally found it. 

I completely understand that mistakes happen. What I didn't appreciate, and the reason I am taking the time to write this was the attitude I got from the bartender when she realized she made a mistake. After basically accusing me of trying to get out of paying for 30 minutes and putting me through the trauma of thinking I had no credit card or ID, she gave me an insincere "sorry" and offered to give  me a shot. I asked if she could get the friend I was with one and she said no. I don't do shots by myself, so I told her don't bother. She shrugged and went back to serving drinks.

I left with a sour taste in my mouth. It's ashamed because the place has a great atmosphere and great tacos.
author: Hunter M.

description:
Excellent food!
All the fish tacos, shrimp, are super good, get them nicks way!
the Mexican corn is great, although I wish it was grilled a little to add some extra flavor
the quesadillas have amazing flavor.
Everything has great flavor, and very consistent
the staff are also all very friendly and helpful
author: nathan w.

description:
FOOD: got steak and fish tacos but very disappointed in the size and amount of filling. If you wanted salsa and guac it was extra. The Taco only came with the meat which made no sense to me. Too pricey for the quality and lack of portion size. Taste was not amazing either, the fish taco was greasy and didn't have much flavor and the steak was burnt and chewy. 
ENVIRONMENT: it's cash only which is annoying, you will need to go to Walgreens across the street to get cash back. It's more of a fast food place, you order at counter and sit whenever you like. The inside decor is very random and seems more like a sit down restaurant. 
SERVICE: you order at counter, the guy at the register just wants you to order and move the line along, doesn't like when you ask questions and keeps suggesting to get the extra topping to make it taste better for extra $!
author: Vicky C.

description:
Friendly/helpful staff. We came during the day so it was pretty empty. Checked in on yelp and we got the free nachos, but since those only have tomatoes/salsa, we ordered one with everything on it. That portion was HUGE. Had two tacos prepared Nick's way. 

Tables could have been cleaned a bit more, as it felt sort of sticky to me.
author: Helen L.

description:
I've been meaning to post about this place for a while!  

So Nicks Tacos is an SF staple.  I always order their watermelon aquas Fresca (so yummy!) and two tacos.  My friend can get full off of one, but I like to order two just in case lol.

I order one crispy fish and one carnitas and I always leave happy and satisfied.

The service is order at the counter, shark for a table if it is busy, and then they will deliver. Self serve water is available.  

The ambiance is a bar outside of club hours.  Sometimes it smells like the day after a party unfortunately.  But that's only happened twice of the handful of times I've been there.
author: irene u.

description: Love this place. Fun atmosphere. Great tacos that are full to the brim and good margaritas and great size margaritas. They don't skimp here
author: Caitlin M.

description:
I'm not much of a bar fly. But if every bar had an awesome taco place in the corner, I would spend ALL my time in bars.

We were at Nick's by day, so we didn't see how it overlaps (does it?) with Rouge at night. But at 2 pm on a Friday afternoon I thought I'd died and gone to heaven when I ate my fish taco "Nick-style" -- i.e. with a crispy cheese layer on the inside. It wasn't as cheesy (or crispy) as the name and description led me to expect, but it was every bit as delicious!

In terms of value for dollar, this was probably the best meal we had in two weeks in San Francisco. Super delicious, and super cheap.
author: Alexandra S.

description:
This was on our second stop that night and we were hungry. When we entered the place I was a bit confused. I didn't expect a live band playing awesome rock/blues in a Taco place ;-).

One half of our group went to order food while the other half got two Pitchers of Margarita. You see what type of night this was going to be. 

The margarita was done really good. I can recommend it :-).
I got a fish taco which was delicious and tasty. It you're really hungry get a second one.
author: Dario S.

description: One of the worst tacos I've had. $5.75 for a fish taco with a tiny bit of fish. Really terrible. Great for drinks but definitely do not recommend the food here. So many better options are available around the area.
author: Minks M.

description:
Pros:
Warm and Crispy Tacos
Open late
Inside a club/bar setting (if you see Rogue, you're at the right place).
Wrapped perfectly
Sauces in a squeeze bottle
Drinks available
Great location

Cons:
I'm salivating while typing this review
I'm not there now

Nick's Crispy Tacos is a great place to grab a taco before, during, and after your night out. The tacos taste great and are stuffed and topped with stuffings and toppings to the brim but it doesn't ooze out because they wrap the back neatly like a food diaper. Okay, that doesn't sound too appetizing but it's truly good. The tacos have both a soft and a crispy shell and the meats are cooked well. Even though the tacos are basically overflowing, I still find a way to squeeze the salsa verde on top. I can't live without that green-green-goodness.
author: Jerry Y.

description: Loved it! Fish taco was so good that I'm salivating thinking about it again. Food is cash only. Bar takes cards. Also, I'm convinced this place used to be a cabaret bar by its decor and the way it's set up! :)!
author: Rob M.

description: After an amazing brunch at Mymy, the squad and I were in search of a spot to continue our mimosa filled Sunday morning. As we Yelped, we came across this spot. Upon arrival we asked the hostess if we could just order single mimosas because we didn't have time to stay for the bottomless option. She of course said yes and so we went on in. Fast forward to the bartender and as we asked for single mimosas he rudely stated that "who told you we can make single mimosas?!" Umm the hostess at front dude. Anyways he was rude and we were thirsty so we ended up sharing a pitcher of margaritas. That pitcher was so not worth  $30 and it definitely didn't taste right. Overall, if you're in the area and seeking out single mimosas then be prepared to be rudely turned away or forced to buy the bottomless option.
author: Cristal C.

description:
This venue is one of the best places to get tacos and probably the best late night food in town. The line to order tacos are separate from the bar so make sure you order before you grab a seat at the bar area.  They do have occasional drink specials such as "2 beers for $7" so make sure you look at what's offered before ordering.

As for the tacos, they were larger and very delicious.  Their fish tacos (either the Baja or grilled) are one of their more popular offerings, but the fried chicken as well as  shrimp tacos are very tasty too. Order it "Nick's style" which comes with large amounts of guacamole for an extra $1.25 per taco.
author: Nick A.

description:
Taco Tuesdays all day here. Second time here, I honestly think they have the best tacos in the city. I got one grilled chicken and one shrimp. Both were on point with guacamole and cheese. 
It's not too busy during lunch hours but I know they get busy in the evening.
author: Marcela M.

description:
Nick's Crispy Taco shares a space with a bar and it made it really strange walking in. It was really dark inside and there was loud club music playing in the middle of the day. The space felt divey and not super clean; there was a lot of trash around the front door (maybe it was from the large crowds from bay to breakers).

We ordered the pescado burrito (deep fried fish), 3 chicken tacos, got free salsa and chips with the yelp check-in offer, and it was all really delicious. It was definitely more than enough for 2-3 people. 

The food was great (but the prices are a little on the expensive side), but the loud party/club music made our lunch experience less enjoyable. We'll probably order food to-go next time.
author: Monica T.

description: Place is awesome. I used to come here on Tuesdays for taco Tuesday. Good/cheap food and drinks. Also a good spot to start out on a Friday night or Saturday.
author: Jeremy B.

description:
"CLUB GOING UP, ON A TUESDAY"

I think my taco obsession started after I had Nicks Crispy's. It was one of the first times I had a fish taco and I loved it!! The veggie tacos is my fav!!

One thing you should know if you havent been is this is really the biggest taco Tuesday place in the city, so it gets very rowdy and packed but if youre looking for a fun Tuesday evening check it out! Im not sure if its as busy on the days of the week bc Ive only been for Taco Tuesday. If youre looking for cute or romantic date spot this prob wouldn't be your place, although I came here for a 2nd or 3rd date and had a great time haha. 

If you like spicy I recommend asking for the habanero suace, the stuff is good!!! I am a very spicy eater and that sauce had be sweating!
author: Hetal P.

description: I used to love their burritos and it was a weekly thing for several years. Having recently returned after several++ months, I'm sadly disappointed they're following the now typical cost-cutting approach of too many SF restaurants. My simple chicken and been burrito with added guacamole came with a teeny tiny, barely noticeable smear of guac, like a deli would would add light amount of mayo to your sandwich. For that extra $1.50 to add guac, I expect to get at least some. $12 for a basic burrito is already ridiculous. At least, make it real. Pathetic.
author: Mike S.

description:
This place is amazing! The food is great the location awesome and the decor is fun. I did only five 4 out of 5 star because they don't take credit cards
 :( besides that this is an awesome place
author: Romain D.

description:
In a nutshell Nick's Crispy Tacos are bae.

The perfect guac, the perfect amount of toppings, and the perfect inner crispy shell. I had the veggie tacos and I'm pretty confidant in saying that they're some of the best tacos I have ever consumed.
author: Janine J.

description: Went on Taco Tuesday when they have the special of two select tacos for $7. We got the pollo asado and carnitas. Both very very good and fresh as they we covered in fresh tomato, onion, and cilantro. Counter service was great as the guy was very friendly! Highly recommended for your taco cravings!
author: Tranor V.

description: Taco Tuesday is super hyped up. Came here for the tacos and $5 margs. Only a few tacos are discounted. Order your tacos nicks way for a scoop of guac on top. This place is super crowded. It's a mixed crowd of people trying to have a chill time, but the drunk basics stumbling around ruin the experience. They charge $1 per taco you want to box up and take home. Not a good enough experience for me to return.
author: Amanda M.

description:
My good friend and her fiancé in San Fran RAVED about nicks crispy tacos! They we're pretty amazing but but not life changing like everyone talks about. 

The bar it's self is located inside rouge night club... It's a little odd that Nicks doesn't accept credit cards and your forced to use their fee charging ATM if your without cash. 

I ordered a Pescado taco and a carnitas taco both nicks way (guac and jack cheese) and an order of their elote. The elote was spicy and full of flavor and honestly the true standout. The Pescado was crispy and yummy. The carnitas was dry and had zero flavor, carnitas is supposed to be moist and flavorful! 

The bar next door was impossible to get a drink at, it took us forever to get service. And seating was impossible to find.
author: Roxy H.

description:
Nicks way carne tacos are the truth!! Not your traditional/ authentic taco but  nonetheless. Nicks way tacos are pretty good sized tacos, so two usually hold me down. 

The spot is attached to a bar, so their are plenty of seats/booths if you want to bring the whole crew. Plenty of tv's if you're looking to catch a game.The bar has a couple mean strongaritas on the menu that can catch up to you fast.What more could you ask for??
author: Kenny S.

description:
Nick's is quite possibly my favorite taco joint and sports bar in San Francisco! They serve a variety of what I think are some of the tastiest tacos in the city and offer a good selection of beers on tap. A nice beer selection and tasty tacos, in addition to half a dozen large, wide-screen TVs throughout the bar, Nick's Crispy Tacos always delivers for loyal Giants and 49ers fans that are in search for good eats and a fun, lively venue to catch the game.

Notwithstanding the myriad of excellent taquerías I used to eat at in the Mission District, whenever I am now in town for a visit, I am craving the huge, tasty tacos here at Nick's.

Nick's Tacos are all jumbo sized tacos and packed with juicy, flavorful meats that are seasoned just right and pinto beans that are cooked to near perfection on either a crispy corn shell or two layers of warm, moist flour tortilla, topped with pico de gallo and shredded cheese. Two tacos are substantial enough to satisfy the heartiest of appetites.

I would recommend the two choices I tried: Carne Asada - grilled steak in corn tortilla with pico de gallo & pinto beans, $3.25 and Pollo - seasoned, simmered chicken in corn tortilla with pico de gallo & pinto beans, $3.25. 

The steak is not overly seasoned and grilled perfectly, juicy and oozing with flavor. The simmered chicken is very moist and infused with the zesty broth and ingredients the meat has been cooking in. I suggest trying either one served up 'Nick's Way,' with jack cheese and smothered with their creamy guacamole for an extra $0.95. Simple, no-frills preparation but still delicious. I am hard-pressed to try anything else here.

A cool sports bar with a lively crowd and tasty, humongous tacos that really rock! A great place to catch a Giants or Niners game!

NOTE: located in Nob Hill on 1500 Broadway, finding a nearby parking spot can be quite a challenge. A very popular and crowded venue, expect a wait for seating to dine-in or a line at the counter to order tacos for takeout. Stays open late (until 10pm). CASH ONLY!
author: Andrew K.

description:
Try as I may -- I have yet to find crispy fried fish tacos anywhere as good as Nicks! A crispy taco with a soft taco on the outside holding together the concoction of the most deliciously fried fish. Have this "Nick's Way" with the guac and cheese. Check-in for the free chips and salsa. Pay extra for a side of jalapenos. It's a little expensive as far as tacos-around-the-city goes, but it is sooooo worth it. This is my go-to cheat meal. Bless you Nick's -- for your pescado taco and loveable staff! 

Also, ask to sample the fresh fruit juices. Then buy some! Awwww yes.
author: tee v.

description:
I've been here twice now and I don't know why I even came back. If you're looking to dine on below average bar food and spotty service, this is your spot. 
I had a take out order consisting of elote, black bean and grilled corn salad, shredded chicken burrito, chips and salsa, and horchata. The horchata was absolutely disgusting. Chalky, gritty, and tasted like watered down mush. My boyfriend took two bites of his chicken burrito and said it tasted like nothing and wasn't interested in finishing it. My "taco salad" was horrendous, full of the ends of every vegetable and strips of stale chips - didn't bother to finish that either. The elote was dripping in mayo.. Which I think is nasty.. But maybe that's just me? 
I keep accidentally ordering food here and I'm finally writing a review to stop myself from doing it again!!!
author: Emma G.

description:
This place was a huge disappointment after being on my to do list for so many years.  Crunchy tacos are one of my favorite foods but this place does NOT serve hard shell tacos.  Instead Nick's Way is burning an inner tortilla, attempting to "crisp" it up enough to be crunchy, then wrap a regular soft tortilla on the outside.  The result is a soggy chewy double tortilla with burnt edges.  My jaw started aching after half of the pollo asado Nick's Way taco.  I tried two bites of my camarones taco, also Nick's Way, before switching to a spoon to scoop out the content.  I only had two shrimps in my second taco which is BS for $5.25 each taco.

And Cash Only in 2016?  Automatic negative star.  This place gets 3/5 for lackluster "crispy" tacos and not taking plastic but I really want to leave 2.5/5 stars because this place was more meh than neutral.
author: Kirstin K.

description: This place was disgusting. If you are from Southern California and you know what real Mexican food taste like you will be extremely disappointed. There was no flavor to any of the food. I'm pretty sure they don't even carry salt and pepper. They don't even have salsa what they call Salsa is Pico Di Gallo thrown on top of a basket of chips. The only thing that they had that was tasty we're strong drinks that cost an arm and a leg. Steer clear !
author: Shanta M.

description: I didn't like the taste of tacos here.we ordered crispy tacos but one was fried and the other soft.There was no taste in tacos. Had to add sauces to eat them. I don't think I will come again here.
author: Prerna M.

description: Probably one of the worst tacos I've ever had. So why the two stars? Service was good and fairly quick. The portion size is pretty good but that does not justify what these tacos lack - a litttle bit of everything (by everything I really just mean well seasoned meat) Had the Carne Asada and Fried Chicken tacos and was sorely disappointed. My advice is to skip this place, there are far better places for a more reasonable price (these are not worth the $4.75 they're asking for. Take your money elsewhere.
author: Mariel L.

description:
Used to come here all the time on Tuesdays for taco Tuesday at night time- for the tacos and drinks. Will never com back. The management is incredibly rude. As a 21 year old, I have been here numerous times. The bouncer questioned my ID; I'm assuming it's because I'm from a different state and I am out here for school. He asked for another photo ID, but I only had credit cards and debit cards etc on me, no photo ID (left my school ID at home) I asked to see the manager thinking she'd understand, but I was utterly surprised. She was very rude and basically told me if he questions it, he questions it. She did not take one look at my ID. 

I've never been treated this way from management at a bar or restaurant and definitely won't be returning back.  


We went to the blue light instead - so much fun! $1 tacos and $2 beers. Service was also way better - I'd definitely recommend.
author: Liz B.

description: Have tried the tacos on taco Tuesdays and they have always been great. The place is always crowded and is a bit too loud. So a good place for a party but not for a quiet conversation.
author: Harshad M.

description: Basic AF and no flavor. I just can't. I was disappointed with the tacos. I don't even know what else to say besides it's all a hype and not worth your time. It's cash only. A positive is that there is plenty of seating.
author: Adriana R.

description: It's worth the $1.25 to get your tacos Nick style with the crispy shell and guacamole. It adds a nice layer of yummy.
author: Sean D.

description:
Hands down favorite place to eat in SF. Best fish tacos I've ever had, get them fried and served nicks way. You will not regret it. 
Whenever I'm stressed or in a bad mood, this is my pick me up place to stop. 
The weird atmosphere and the amazing food always takes away the shitty feelings.
author: Sari S.

description: I liked the pescado and carne asada tacos with just a crispy shell taco. Not a big fan of the shell wrapped in the soft tortilla- Nick's way, it's too carby for me. The guacamole is a great plentiful additional which makes it hearty. I'll give the tacos 3 stars but what really urked me was the service. The hostess barely made an effort to communicate or even smile. Our group sat ourselves. Lastly, the lounge, bar area reaked like the bathrooms. It was pretty bad, we had to move away to get away from the bathroom stench.
author: Briget P.

description:
The food is incredible! We had tortilla soup, carne asada quesadilla and guacamole. All three were so good. Best guac I've ever had! 
The setup is a little weird. You have to order the food at a counter in the back and there are no waiters/waitresses. It's worth it though.
author: Amy S.

description:
~~~~~*****100th REVIEW*****~~~~~

In the city for the weekend. Hungry for brunch, and this place was close by. It was SIMPLY AMAZING.  You gotta order your tacos "Nick's WAY" (any taco made crispy with jack cheese and guacamole) if you want them crispy. I got two and the tacos were so ginormous, that I had to box the 2nd one to go. But then again, I did also order jalapeno poppers, so we had a lot of food. I kept saying to my friend, "wow" and "OMG."  I mean, these were just tacos, right? But they ended up being the BEST tacos I have ever had.  They are wrapped cone-style, which allows them to really pack in the ingredients and make them so big. I remarked to my friend that I was really surprised that there wasn't a line outside the door (and, BTW, the inside is HUGE because it also houses  the full bar, ROUGE). He replied that sometimes there is a line outside the door. I can't wait to return.
author: Smudge T.

description: These things are huge! You will not need to order multiple tacos to satisfy your cravings. Although you may want to try them all! Even take away these tacos are excellent. Definitely in competition (if not better!) with my neighborhood taqueria. Go with the beef, you won't regret it!
author: Briana A.

description:
Once you enter Rouge Lounge make your way through the red carpet interior, pass the well-equipped bar (tempting, but we have priorities here) on to a shiny little corner at the very end of the establishment - welcome to Nick's Tacos.

It's really just a mini kitchen and a counter - but Nick's is doing one thing right: siiiize. Think of your regular Mexican taco, just enhanced. Two of those monsters and you'll be full. Sebastian Guarantee.

Taste is good (my favorite: fried fish taco, cheese, guac, in a crispy shell). You might wait for your order quite some time and may not find seating so make sure to get your order in a paper bag. 

Keep it up, Nick. Your tacos are legit. Your Sebastian.
author: Sebastian F.

description: Came here because of Yelp reviews, and there was nothing reviewing the wet burritos. We ordered carne Asada burrito, my husband got it with guac and mines had avocado. My burrito had a uncooked bean..... His was pretty good and had more flavor, as for mine was plain and bland.... I didn't like the red sauce they put on it. But honestly the Horchata was really good and tasted authentic. The agua de Sandra was really good. And the TACO DE PESCADO NICKS STYLE WAS AMAZING!!!!!! Will be back only for tacos though. And the Horchata.
author: Alejandra C.

description: This place so fly omg. Get the mimosas and feeeeel good. The tacos are in between good and great because of the pinto beans - I prefer black. The chips are really really hard. Overall, love love love.
author: James K.

description: Seriously not good. Their "famous" fish tacos were not even as good as any fast food Americanized Mexican restaurant. I wouldn't bother coming here!
author: Jen B.

description:
Some of the best tacos in the city and during happy hour so cheap!!! A great place to come for a beer and tacos to watch a game or hang out with friends. 

The food is consistently good, portions large (given that they are more the street taco style-they are HUGE for street tacos), and service friendly.
author: Marilyn M.

description: Experience and atmosphere, that has to be the reason people come here. The food is nothing special and expensive. Was here for the Warriors playoff game and it was a fun experience. If you want some tacos or Mexican food, just go anywhere in the mission. The fish tacos was tiny in the amount of fish. The shrimp burritos had tiny shrimp pieces that seemed overcooked.
author: Victor D.

description:
Tasty food for sure, but why is it absorbed into a dark sports bar with a kind of restaurant layout (Rouge)???? That's my one question. This is NOT a place you can sit down and enjoy your food, and if there does happen to be seating you feel the sports bar vibes heavy with the low lighting, the bar and blasting TVs everywhere. I noticed that most of Nicks food was consumed by either the people already at the sports bar for drinks that got hungry or people picking up the food at a tiny window on the side and dashing out of that place. 

Ambience: loud, dark sports bar 
Food: good but nothing to holler about
Prices: comparable to other Mexican food places
author: Tamara S.

description:
Came here last week and had the shrimp burrito which had great flavor and ingredients but the shrimp was slightly over cooked. I also had the nachos with pico de gallo from their yelp deal which had a generous portion and was equally tasty. ( surprising considering it's free ) 

Overall experience and food was great, but it does have the same drawback as many other restaurants...

CASH ONLY -____-
author: Marco M.

description:
Tacos goin' UP  on a Tuesday...
Any taco nicks way. You can't go wrong. You   LITERALLY can't even. Cash only tho so keep that in mind.
author: Thielson D.

description: Great tasting food but I just witnessed your bartender leave the bar unattended to walk outside to what looked like smoke a cigarette and it didn't end there. As he walked back in straight from being outside he started making drinks WITHOUT washing his hands! Absolutely disgusting.
author: Gianni H.

description:
After seeing the popularity of this place on yelp, my boyfriend and I came here on a Saturday for lunch. You have to pay and ordered at the counter before grabbing a seat with your order number. When I checked in on yelp, I got a free side of chips and pico de gallo. My boyfriend and I decided to share 4 tacos. We ordered the Carne Asada, Pollo, Carnitas, and Pescado. We also ordered a large Watermelon Agua Fresca and 2 Elotes to share.

Chips & Pico de Galo: There was about enough salsa for 10 chips, but can't really complain since it was free. 

Tacos: My boyfriend and I both agreed that the Pescado taco was the best of the four and even then we weren't that impressed. Maybe we have been spoiled by the great Mexican food in San Deigo that the tacos here were underwhelming. 

Elotes: These are a must get. The only thing I didn't like about it was the price, which I could get 3 of the same thing off a cart on the street and it would taste just as good. 

Watermelon Agua Fresca: Pretty refreshing. 

Overall, I didn't enjoy the tacos that much, even though that's what this place is known for. I probably wouldn't come here again just because the tacos were too pricey and not delicious enough.
author: Melanie H.

description:
We (my husband & I) made our first visit here and are sure to go back sometime. We went on a Friday around 6:30pm, and there was a pleasant number of people there - not super-packed or particularly loud, and a few booths were open. We ordered (no line) and got food in less than 5 minutes - extremely fast & very friendly service! Happy Hour goes all the way till 10pm, so we got a couple rounds of drinks too. The food was really delicious - my husband got the carne asada, which he heartily enjoyed and tasted amazing. I got the Nick's-style vegetarian taco, which was also very good. The tacos are pretty big, so even just ordering 1 can fill you!

Overall, a great option for a nice, simple, reasonably-priced, impromptu date night.
author: Sweta A.

description:
After being on an airplane for 7 hours, waking up at 4am and generally traveling all day the carne asada burrito was f--king amazing.

My wife and I both had one - all the way with sour cream, cheese and guac.

One kid had a quesadilla and one had a couple chicken tacos.

They also brought out some chips and pico on the house.

The food was so good. They either make their own flour tortillas or get them locally because they were legit. None of that cardboardy garbage you get at the other burrito places. 

Nicks is the best.
author: Jimmy M.

description:
Honestly not sure what the hype is all about. Yes, they're tacos; yes, they're good. But are they sooooooo good? Nah.

Maybe it's because I lived in LA and SD, but these tacos are mediocre even by non-authentic standards. **I love Chipotle and would rather eat their tacos any day. 

Food: I ordered the pescado and fried chicken tacos "Nick's Way" (this just means they add cheese and guacamole for a dollar more). They were tasty and by no means inedible, it's just that they were simply okay. 

Environment: The restaurant has a neat and fun, albeit confusing, feel. Sports bar (lots of TVs) + night club accents (red velvet seating booths that look made for bottle service) + a dash of old school glamour (lots of chandeliers). Good for large groups!
author: Yanni L.

description: This place is on fire. Whatever you do, make sure you order their elote and horchata. Will absolutely not regret it. For tacos I got the grilled fish and shrimp. The shrimp was definitely my favorite, grilled and flavorful. I tried one regular style and the other nick's style. Great tacos either way you get them. I also tried my friend's nachos which were absolutely delicious. The only complaint I have about this is that they only took cash during game day.
author: Carly H.

description:
Taco Tuesday! My friends and I came here to celebrate taco Tuesday. I recommend making a reservation for a booth because this place gets packed. Reservations are 1.5 hours per booth. They had us jamming to hip hop all night.

The specials are 2 huge tacos for $5. Add an extra $2 for Nick's special. The must have quesadilla $2. Don't forget those margaritas... A pitcher can fill about 6-7 cups.

Very great tacos and a fun place to hang with friends.
author: Annie V.

description:
One of the best, if not the best fish tacos I've had in my life. This place is a bit unusual, as the decor is a throwback to the 1979s with the red booths and chandeliers , paired with customers ordering and paying at the counter. That being said, I personally enjoyed it! It's really different, very reasonable, and the food / drinks are great!

Note - they prefer cash :)
author: Danette C.

description:
Said "tacos" are a travesty of cultural appropriation. If you don't like spicy food, eat a fucking baloney sandwich or something, but quit shitting on one of the world's greatest cuisines ever.

Sincerely,
A Mexican
author: Joe V.

description:
Why on earth does this place have 4 Stars with so many reviews? I can't say I had a good experience with this venue...

To start off we sat at the bar, everything seemed fine at first, the menus came and we were told we had to order food from the other side. Then it was time to get drinks. I asked the bartender what he had on tap. One of the choice mentioned was Negro Modelo...Ok, so I asked him if I could sample it. He replied "I can't!" REALLY?! Last I checked we were at a bar...and you are telling me I can't sample a beer that I am potentially going to buy! WOW I was in the industry and I NEVER heard that!

OK...fine! Can't let his tool ruin my night, so I get it anyways. Next I proceed  to order food other side. I get the special 2 items for $5. Got 4 items...my total is now over $15! Um...what?! How did that happen?! Well there are taxes and Nick's way is an extra $1.90! OK, maybe you could have told me that when I ordered....common courtesy! Whatever...I give him my Card. We only take CASH!!! WTF? I just paid for the f#*(!^g beer at the bar with my Credit Card...are you kidding?! 

Then there are the taxes...SF Health Care Tax? SF HC Tax? on top of Sales Tax?! 
OK Then...

The food itself is decent, a bit above average. Got 3 tacos and Nachos.
 
This place doesn't have $#!7 on San Diego...such a disappointment
author: Michael C.

description:
Went on taco Tuesday  ... It was delicious with great deals. Just $2 tacos, $2 quesadillas, and $2 chips with Guac and salsa. Can't beat the bang for your buck here. However, make sure you get here early or reserve a table or you'll be waiting a while. Would recommend it to anyone looking for great tacos and cheap drinks 

Food: yummy
Bang for buck: well worth it
Atmosphere: busy and younger
Back for moreness: count me in
author: Steven S.

description: ohhhhkayyy food. Will keep it as an option if i am absolutely starving and no options around
author: Abhishek D.

description:
I've probably come here almost every Tuesday for "Taco Tuesday" with friends. It was a great place to watch the Warriors Play in the NBA finals/ Championships as well as watch the Olympics. 
I have eaten here a few times and enjoyed my quesadilla. The drinks are good, and they have a two for $7 deal on Corna's which is nice. The bar can often get crowded though so I'd advise showing up a bit early, or making a reservation to have a place to sit down. Overall great ambiance, fun music and place to start Taco Tuesday's!
author: Ronni M.

description:
I don't get it.  I ordered 4 tacos with Guac and it was almost $5 a taco, total came out to be $24 and some change.  Sure they are larger than your avg mexican street tacos but i'm not sure if the quality is really there.  Carne Asada tacos came with beans in it, the Carnitas was meaty but super dry and their most popular, the fried fish was probably the best, not much complaint about it.  
The biggest gripe is actually the "crispy" part of the taco.  They basically fry one of the tortillas and use it as a wrap however it was executed poorly for all 4 of my tacos.  They were like stale oily chips and super hard to chew.  I ended up pulling them out because my jaw started to get tired of chewing them by the third taco.

Another negative side of it all is that it's cash only but they conveniently placed an ATM right by the bar where you order your tacos so they can make a few extra bucks off of your order.
author: Mike K.

description: I loved Nick's Crispy Tacos! The food is good and the staff is friendly. You won't regret coming here!
author: Julia S.

description:
One word: YUMMY! 

There are no other words to describe their carne asada quesadillas! You have the option to add guac and sourcream for an extra $2, do it! It makes it 10X better! I also ordered their carne asada tacos which were HUGE! The tacos at any other Mexican restaurant are at least half the size. 

Carne asada quesadilla and two carne asada tacos ended up to be $21, which isn't too bad. Plus we got free chips and salsa for checking in on yelp! 

The environment is a sports bar theme, so it's a perfect place to come after a night out around the bars on Polk street. However the seatings is a little annoying since it's seat yourself so everyone's fighting over the nice tables booths. 

All and all, awesome place! Highly recommended!
author: Sabrina L.

description:
Day 22/25:

Nick's Crispy Tacos. Tacos that are crispy...and that belong to Nick.

Good tacos. Good, good tacos. Good flavor and good crispness. We ended up taking them to go so I can't say much for the interior or the service.

I can say that parking around here can be bad. We were lucky to find a space right out front (this was also late night, and the place was nearly empty).

And I am running out of steam right now so that's all you get. They are good tacos. Eat here. Do it.
author: Tim O.

description:
The tacos here are wonderful -- they fry the soft tortillas until they're crispy, yum! Word of warning: eat them while they're hot or else they'll just start tasting stale. Nick's has some delicious sauce (both the red and green are amazing), and they definitely don't skimp on the guac -- it's unfortunately hard to find places like these in the city sometimes. Who can resist $2 tacos on Taco Tuesday? 

Sadly, as with all great restaurants, this place gets incredibly crowded (especially because of the Rouge bar/lounge in the same space), especially on Taco Tuesday. If you're claustrophobic, AVOID this place. If you're okay with occasionally rubbing up against happy drunks, then this might be the place for you. 

The atmosphere here is not what you think of when you think of a taco place -- it's strangely classy, with large red booths located around the room and chandeliers hanging from the ceiling. Rouge is next door if you want something else to drink besides beer/margaritas. 

I still had a good time because I don't really mind crowds. My experience only got better when some guys offered my friend and me half a pitcher of beer because they had to drive home and couldn't finish it. Hooray for free beer and nice people! 

Overall, Nick's is in a location with a great (albeit huge) crowd, friendly workers, and delicious (cheap!) food. I'd come here again, but much earlier so that I can snag a seat in one of the awesome booths. 

**TIP** CASH ONLY. They have an ATM located right next to where you order.
author: Christine L.

description:
I came here for Taco Tuesday for the first time and did not expect their ambiance. First off, I did not look at yelp before coming here so for some reason, I imagined a more authentic Mexican Restaurant when my friend said, "Let's grab some tacos at Nick's..." This place was not that LOL This place looked like a fancy bar but with college kids running around ahaha when I walked in all 21 to 28 year olds grabbing tacos and booze, music clamoring loudly, and sports playing on T.V. Not really a place you'd expect good tacos.

This place gets packed real quick on a Tuesday. The red comfortable seats that you see in the pictures...  Well make sure to make a reservation if you want to sit on those. Each booth were reserved by the hour. So there is a reservation at 6 then another at 7 then another at 8 and so on, you get the point. No reservation? Then you have to find a table in the middle or the bar, which is very very limited due to how packed it gets..

The TACOs were pretty good (I am from socal, so I have pretty high expectations for DELICIOUS tacos)  but the proportions were large! I tried the Carnitas and the Carne Asada, 2 for $5. I have to say their Carne Asadas were A LOT better! 

Overall, the place was cheap, good, and FILLING. 4 stars!
author: John L.

description:
Love/hate relationship with this place that has officially gone sour.  It's across the street from my favorite bar, so I always seem to end up back here, regardless of how much I disliked the last experience. 

I'll say this: They're probably among the 3 best taquerias north of Broadway, from a food perspective. Small sample size, I know. But if you live in the area and don't want to travel far (the Mission), it's one of the better ones.

However, the problems with this place are twofold.  First of all, the attached bar/lounge/douche museum is always obnoxiously packed.  On any given night, especially if there's a game worth watching, there's a line out front like it's the hottest nightclub in town.  From the (relative) comfort of Shanghai Kelly's, I witnessed people missing the entirety of Warriors-Cavs Game 6 because they refused to give up on the line for this place.  The clientele are not sane/logical people. So yeah, dining in is not ideal.

Second, and most infuriatingly, I have ordered delivery from this place maybe 4 times and last night, for the second time, I was called after 45 minutes or more and was told that the restaurant had just decided to cancel my order with absolutely no explanation, whatsoever. Just "The restaurant has cancelled the order and you'll get refunded in 5 business days."  Imagine being at a restaurant, paying for your food, waiting 45+ minutes, then have them say "Nah, nevermind, you don't get any food, go somewhere else. Your money? I mean... we'll refund you in a few days."  That's essentially the experience I've had 50% of the times that I've ordered delivery from this place.

In summary: Dining in = Bad. Delivery = Bad. Food = Pretty good.

I'd say I'll never come back again, but basketball season is starting soon, so I'm bound to drunkenly stumble in there eventually.
author: Barry B.

description:
Had another great lunch at Nick's. I've been coming here regularly for years and always go for the tacos ( Nick's way of course!) which are awesome, but lately I've been getting the quesadillas which are equally addictive and good. I could eat here every day and not get tired of it. I have to say the staff are exceptional, like I said I come here regularly and all the staff are super friendly and always accommodating. I can't think of another casual food place where all the staff are just on the ball and just plain nice people. 

They accept levelup which is helpful and has a rewards program.
author: Elzabeth G.

description: The tacos here were really good. I went here for happy hour and it was really crowded. I was with a large group of 15 people, so going to this place during happy hour was not the best idea because finding seats was really difficult (even though we had a reservation). I would come back for more tacos and drinks during happy hour, but next time I won't go with a large group. A group of 3 or 4 friends would suffice and we would fit a lot more comfortably.
author: Lynn T.

description: Tacos were really yummy! Stopped by here since it's so raved about, and we were not let down. I definitely recommend trying a chicken or steak taco Nicks way. Fish taco tasted great just the way it's prepared, cheese would of been a little weird, for me personally. The guacamole has a great flavor. FYI bring cash.. It's cash only, there's an ATM like a block away though so no worries if you didn't. Bar accepts card. We got the free chips and salsa with the check in. The salsa (pico de gallo) is served on top so make sure to eat them quick.. Will get soggy!
author: Susan P.

description:
RIP. OFF. Definitely Overrated.  Overpriced and nothing spicy here except one habanero salsa you have to ask for separately. The rice and beans tasted like what I imagine the inside of a vacuum cleaner bag full of dust would taste like. The place is dirty and a tourist trap.  

Oh yeah! Cash only? There an ATM but come on...can the technology be any more outdated? 

Service was as expected given the rest of the situation. Totally forgettable. 

Will not return.
author: Erin N.

description:
I have had Nick's about three or four times now, mostly delivered to my place, but I have also been to the actual location too. It is pretty much located inside of a bar, and has it's own counter etc. Delivery has always been pretty quick and the food has always came well prepared and packaged. Almost everything on the menu has been delicious, especially the fried chicken tacos. The bar it is located in can get a little crowded at night on the weekends, but thats pretty normal everywhere. The prices are also pretty good and not too expensive. Give it a try!

PROS
- Delicious food
- Good prices
- Great for delivery

CONS
- None
author: Steven S.

description:
Pretty decent taco place! Came here for a friends bday at the nightclub but we were a bit too early, so we decided to grab a late dinner. Nicks tacos is located inside rouge nightclub, which is strange. They had tables out when we got there, but started moving them out when the club part of the business started up. 

We didn't eat too much, I had carnitas taco, which was HUGE. For $4, it definitely filled me up. They did charge an extra dollar for guac, but that's typical. I also tried the carne asada taco, which was really good as we'll. Both tacos had a significant amount of meat, and they didn't skimp on the guac. ^^
author: Kay A.

description: When you walk in, it's not what you'd expect for a taco joint. almost feels like a strip club, but tucked in the back is the counter to order from. I got the pescado (fried fish), the carne asada, and carnitas. And child and salsa, and a churro, and the strawberry aqua fresca. The pescado was good, nice batter and sauce. I asked for it Nick style and it also came with a good chunk of guac which I ate with the chips. The meat in the carne asada and carnitas was dry and flavorless. The chips and salsa were ok, churro was fantastic, wish I ordered more of those instead, and the strawberry aqua fresca was way too sweet.
author: Nina S.

description:
With a restaurant that has the name "taco" in it, you better hope that the "tacos" live up to it's name.
And in my opinion, they definitely do!

My all-time favorite fish tacos can be found here- Nick's Way. (Which translates to a crispy shell with jack cheese and guacamole.) 
Whenever I come here, you'll find me getting 2 of their pescado tacos. (I love them fried, as opposed to grilled.) The deep fried fish isn't overly battered and has a crispy outside with a flaky inside. There's a good amount of fish and guacamole per taco but, sometimes can find it's way onto my shirt. Haha! It comes with lime mayo (so delish!), cabbage, salsa, and cilantro. I also love their bottled green salsa. I feel like I can finish half the bottle!
On my last visit, I decided to venture out and get their carne asada taco. So not the same!  I'll stick to the pescado tacos from now on.

You can't go wrong with the chips and guacamole either.

I'm definitely a fan!
author: Mimie L.

description:
4.5 stars

This is probably the nicest taco place that I've been to. I was surprised by all the bling-y chandeliers and plush red seating. A weirdly nice atmosphere to eat tacos...

I didn't come for just any taco - I had to try it Nick's way which had a crispy and a soft taco shell. I got the fish taco and a watermelon agua fresca and that was actually really filling considering I just had lunch about 3 hours beforehand. I think normally, 2 tacos would be good enough since they're bigger than street tacos. The fish taco was good. The fish was good and wasn't too over-fried. It was also loaded with guac and really good fresh pico de gallo. The agua fresca was made with real watermelon which was good. We also checked on yelp and got a huge plate of chips and pico de gallo which was really good and also helped fill us up. 

Overall, it was a good taco. A tad on the pricey side. This isn't your 99 cent fish taco from a taqueria, but I would definitely come back to have it Nick's way.
author: Sophia Y.

description: Fun atmosphere, really good quesadillas, and very filling tacos. But you cannot take anything to go. Margaritas are also a must.
author: Fernilla S.

description:
If you happen to be a taco lover, chances are, you'll also love Nick's. 

Nestled in the cozy confines of Nob Hill, Nick's isn't as fancy as the rest of the establishments on the street nor is it as authentic as any of the Mexican places in Mission. But the tacos are tasty, popular, and certainly one of the top choices in the hood for a fun and simple meal.

Fish tacos are all the rage in southern California and it's fitting a couple of decent versions can be had here. The pescado tacos are San Diego worthy Baja style pescado fritos, doused in lime mayo and garnished with cabbage and cilantro, which are mighty tasty. The fish can be grilled as well, typically served with tomatillo and pico de gallo and is my favorite of the two. Though most of the tacos are served in corn tortillas, one has the option to get some Taco Bell nostalgia and go 'dorado with crispy shells and all.

In terms of taco meats, I can vouch for their carnitas, pollo asado, and dare I say the camerones, aka shrimp. Everything is seasoned well and served in abundance enough not to feel jipped. For the non-taco variety, beware of the jalapeno "poppers" which have been known to light up tastebuds on occasion. I love the Elote, or buttered up / cheesed up corn on the cob, even if it's $3 each.
