And that's the one thing that keeps Nick's from achieving immortal taco greatness are those prices. While it's *relatively* affordable, but feels pricey for taco land. Every taco is $3+ and even an extra side of cheese + guacamole is an extra $2+. This wouldn't be a big deal if they took credit cards, but alas they are cash only.

Lastly, I miss Miss Bubbles. Gracias for the taco memories and then some.
author: Jando S.

description:
The chicken burrito is good, but the price is too high and the portions are too small.
This is not a real Mexican own restaurant its Asian own that's why everything is so small I ordered a burrito and they told me that the regular size only comes with beans and if I want rice is extra.
For a $10.00 burrito I expected to a super burrito I end up buying a slide of pizza next door because the burrito was too small, and I don't eat too much I'm only 160 lbs.
That was my first and last time here in that place.!
author: Sandy V.

description: Late night tacos!  They serve tacos/burritos/quesadillas/chips/etc. On top of that they have a full bar. Their happy hour deals are great for drinks. It can get crowded at night so keep that in mind, but other than that there's nothing to complain about. It is self seating, but the staff will bring your food to you.
author: Justin Y.

description: Ordered carry out from Nicks on a visit to San Fran and was not disappointed! I got 2 veggie tacos without cheese, but could've been easily filled up with 1. The guacamole is excellent and I will definitely order again when I am back in the area!
author: Erica G.

description: The tacos were pretty bland. Nicks Way was okay. The nachos made me and my girlfriend sick! Literally!!! And to top it all off I paid $40 for this mediocre meal of 4 tacos and nachos
author: Diego A.

description:
Went here and for some reason didn't get the crispy tacos. Got a burrito instead. Anyway, it was solid. Nothing special, but solid. It's dark and not super clean and can be loud, so ambiance is meh.

I would give them 3 stars but not taking credit cards in this day and age? Come on, man. In fact, they have a bar in there and I seriously doubt they don't accept credit cards. Just nonsense. Get a Square at the very least, for God's sake.
author: Benny L.

description:
Yelp has an offer for free chips & salsa w/ a purchase, if you "check in" to yelp at this place, so that's cool. The chips are really nice & crispy. That's a plus.

I have been here during the nightclub hours, and now the day time for the food. I must say, it is actually quite worth it. Spending time here with friends during both hours day, or night, is a good experience.

Comfy booths & always somewhere to sit, that's really a plus, especially during night club hours.

The only thing I don't like is that it's cash only. They have an ATM machine, which is convenient though, but if you need cash and you're there in the daytime, you might as well go across the street to Walgreens to get cash back, rather than getting a fee from the ATM machine at Nick's.
author: Jocelyn C.

description: We are from out of town. This place was mentioned by a few people. I wasn't exceptionally pleased......Fish taco didn't have much taste. Steak was a little over cooked. The "salsa" is basically just tomatoes with some cilantro added. I'd say the tacos in Cincinnati are 100% better!
author: Taylor C.

description: Some of the best tacos I've ever had! This place is so random because it's inside this bar. You can get two tacos for $5, which is a great deal because they are huge and super filling. They have some other options like getting chips & salsa instead of a taco to sub as one of the two items. I got a chicken taco and a carne asada taco. Get the tacos Nick's way because you get another layer of tortilla that is crispy. And it comes with guac and cheese...what more do you really want in a taco, honestly. The chips basket is huge, and the salsa is smothered all over the chips - also worth it.
author: Steph V.

description:
Clean, refreshing, and light Mexican fare. Love that they didn't go heavy on the salt or cilantro. Definitely would come back, as it's a quick and easy bite. I don't know that I'd sit down to eat though, as the decor has a tacky lounge vibe to it... kind of like Valentine's Day gone wrong.

*CASH ONLY*
author: Diana K.

description:
As others said, make a reservation or be prepared to wait. The happy hour is awesome (I think it went to 7:30 or 8 on a Friday night) and the food is cheap for SF and amazingly good. This is the same guy who opened Taco Shop at Underdogs--another one of my favorite places in the city. 

The design is a little weird but fun and the bartenders were super attentive.
author: Lauren C.

description:
A solid place in the neighborhood for food and dranks. They have drink and food specials daily. I've yet to go there for taco Tuesday cuz it looks way insane every time but Friday's, their two for $5 deal can't be beat. I couldn't believe how cheap their food was. 

Go for nicks style carnitas tacos! Mmmmmm im salivating
author: Alexis P.

description: I'm not sure what the rave reviews are for. It seems like you could get much better tacos elsewhere in Norcal and probably for cheaper as well. We order four; carne asade, pollo, grilled fish and carnitas. All were done "Nick's way", which translates into a big dab of guacamole on half the taco and the inside taco being fried. At roughly 25 dollars, I felt a little ripped off to be honest.
author: Quoc N.

description: The tacos were fantastic, I ordered the fried chicken taco (made crispy) and it was huge, super filling. The chips and salsa were good too, not too salty. The space is a little dead though, it seems like most people just do take out from here.
author: R N.

description:
Not sure why their rating is so high. I got the carne asada tacos and checked in for a free chips and salsa. I was disappointed with the tacos; it had too many beans and the meat was SO dry. The salsa was bland as well; it consisted entirely of tomato and cilantro. The chips were the only part of the meal I liked, but it'd be hard to mess up chips!

Does not even begin to compare to Mexican food in LA. I'd maybe come back for Taco Tuesday, but most likely not. Seating is first come first serve, so it's probably not worth the hassle.
author: Evelyn C.

description: I've been coming here for years and by far the best tacos in SF. Margaritas are really good as well, great to watch sports games too!
author: Ian E.

description: This place is RAVED about so maybe I had to much expectations going in, but lets be honest.... Its not THAT good. Sure, they have relatively cheap Mexican food but what makes this place nice is more the interior than the grub or alcohol. Don't come here expecting 5 star worthy food. Food is ok, but the big booths and velvet decor is what makes this a go-to spot for groups.
author: Brittini S.

description:
Nick's is really fun! I've never been on a Taco Tuesday because.... Why would I put myself through that stress. But it is VERY good and fun on a Sunday for the brunching hour. When you order food, you can get a stamp that gets you a discounted bottomless mimosas! That is the real way to go! 

The bar area has great round booth seating and TV screens that typically play games if they are on. Food is not the best I've EVER had, but its good and consistent.
author: Jon V.

description: If I had known they failed their health inspection and are in the bottom 5% in SF, I definitely wouldn't have ordered from there. The burrito was not good - no flavor, not a lot of meat, filled w black beans, and the tortilla wasn't cooked. It was soft and sticky as if they heated it up in the microwave. As I'm writing this, I think I'm going to be sick. Possible food poisoning. Being in SF, there are tons of Mexican food restaurants around the area. Don't eat here!!
author: Christina B.

description: Yes. Yes. Yes!!! All tacos  are super good with perfect crispy shells. The flavor is on point.  The atmosphere is casual and comfy. This is a MUST bookmark place in the city!  They should consider complementary chips and salsa for orders exceeding $20. Lastly - GO THERE!!!! You won't regret it.
author: Jason S.

description:
The  Shrimp tacos were good. The bar was not open at 1pm...odd..so no Margarita with lunch I guess. 
Kind of dark inside but that's ok. The decor is all red with Chandeliers.
I would eat here again.
author: Sherri E.

description:
I'll make it simple. Not worth the hype at all. I just don't get it.

I came to Nick's with pretty high expectations. Considering the fact that they have 4 stars and almost 2,800 reviews, you would think this place is pretty damn tasty! Wrong. It was so sub-par I wanted to cry!

I ordered the carne asada tacos, "nick's way" which came out to $11 and some change. Two tacos for $11... These better be good.

Here are the facts:
1. the taco size is decent, bigger than most. 
2. the carne asada was tough, bland, and hard to chew.
3. the "crispy" was so awful and not what I expected at all. it was essentially a taco wrapped in a hard fried tortilla shell AND wrapped again in a regular cold soft corn tortilla. the texture was so off, I felt like the tortilla shell was tearing up the roof of my mouth.
4. the only saving grace to these tacos was the guac, beans, and cheese. even with those 3 components, the tacos were still just eh.

If you're looking for amazing tacos that are actually "cheap" (i'm seeing a lot of reviews saying this place is cheap, not the case) head to the mission! Taqueria Guadalajara will hook you up real nice. 

Maybe it was the fact that I showed up on a Sunday an hour before closing. Maybe the food had been sitting out. Maybe the cooks were exhausted, it happens. Maybe this is just one of those "fun to drink places." Maybe I'll come back another time when forced by a friend and have a lovely experience. It just didn't happen for me this time.
author: Monique T.

description:
Mediocre food, tacos are ok. Nick's way is the only way to order them. Nothing like authentic Mission district mexican food.  Nachos are bland and overpriced.

Interesting vibe, as it's a nightclub at night.  Haven't been here in years, but probably won't be back.
author: Kim W.

description:
I've come here for plain, simple, cheese, beef burrito WTF?! did I think this place was Nick's crispy burrito?! 

Anyways, the burrito I've ordered from them was nothing out of the ordinary, it tasted decent I can't complain. The portion of the burrito wasn't all the big though. You probably get this choice anywhere else at a authentic Mexican restaurant. 

The ambience here is loud! it is like a club when we got here at night, spacious sports bar and big screens to watch sports. The lighting in here if I remember correctly was like a strip club. 

My last visit here they had a Yelp check-in offer and they would give you free complimentary nachos...Boooooo! they don't now! 

I would come back here to get drunk and stuff myself with Nick's Tacos and to see what they are about till then.
author: Jon B.

description:
I think I overestimated how many tacos I could eat.

I got about 5 tacos--all nick's way. they were good, but I think that I should have only gotten 3 or 4.

I particularly liked the fried fish tacos. suuuuper fresh and crispy.
author: David Z.

description:
So its called Crispy Tacos - and yet all the tacos are written on the board as soft tacos - you have to add $$ if you want it crispy.  WTF?
When I received them, they were crispy tacos inside a soft taco shell -  I pulled  the utterly useless soft tortilla off both tacos.    I'm not sure what is so unclear here about the word CRISPY.  The fried chicken taco was very tasty but the carnitas was meh.   I doubt I'd go back.
author: Suzy Q.

description:
Nick's Way Fish Taco - $4.95

Street parking.

Nick's is located inside of a Rouge Lounge in the corner. It is a little bar area that has the menu.

I was expecting a lot out of this taco because where I am from, 5 bucks can get me 5 bomb fish tacos. The fish was crispy and well cooked. The toppings were good. But I cannot justify spending 5 bucks it. It was good but anything fried is good. I was not blown away.
author: Kevin W.

description:
I've gone twice on Tuesdays.  Incredibly crowded,  long waits for everything. Waitress forgot my order and never returned.  

Tacos are just okay
author: Michael R.

description:
Tacos at its best! Nick's crispy tacos offers many different choices and customizations to your taco while providing a lightly battered, crispy shell that distinguishes it from other tacos. It is not too oily and flavors are on point. Great area to come for lunch or even dinner, I usually get two tacos and would be full. Definitely a must try if you want to experience tacos with a slight twist!

Parking can be difficult around the area since the area is pretty busy and almost all the streets are metered parking.
author: Wendy Z.

description:
So, I was stricken with the "bottle flu" the day I ate at Nick's, which made my experience less than it should be and not everything it could be.
I'm going to put that aside and review this place as if I was feeling 100%.
As others have said, get your tacos "Nick's way." Don't ask for any more details, just do it! I had 1 carne asada and 1 fish taco. Both were excellent. They're crispy on the outside, but soft and perfect on the inside. The meat could have used more seasoning, but it was excellent quality and flavor was good. They were loaded with just the right amount of toppings and the two different salsas on the table were yummy!
The prices are very reasonable for the amount of food you get and you usually get a freebie from checking in on Yelp.
The beer was on the warm side, but I guess that's the bars' fault, so I won't fault Nick for that.
I felt a lot better after my tacos, than I did before. 
Next time I'm in town, Nick's is on my DO IT AGAIN list for sure.
author: Charles S.

description:
The best thing about the place are the pork tacos nicks way, which means you pay a dollar extra for the crispy shell. This is a great place to end the night when you have had enough drinks! 

We had the chicken tacos the regular way and meh I didn't like it. It took two bites and had my boyfriend finish it, the chicken was dry. 

I thought I was walking into an old red leather strip club, lol.
author: Charlie C.

description:
2 Chicken tacos Nick's way without Beans! And basket of chips! Yum! You must have cash and they do have an ATM machine but some times not working. PLUS you don't want to pass the line to use it then get into what will many times be a long line.
Today I'd say two Carne Asada tacos because those are great too! Carnitas, Fish!  They all are Muy Bueno. 
Nick's way has one crispy and one soft Corn tortilla wrapping your meat! ;D plus Guac and Beans ( i say no to beans 'cause it's just too filling) Then, go run and snatch one of the booths if you can. At the table you will find one Red & one Green Tomatillo sauce of theirs that you will squeeze onto your tacos the whole meal thru, trying to decide which is the better...I still can't decide. I always run out of tacos!
But it is so DELICIOUS to figure it out each time!

*If you can't find parking and you use the Walgreens across the way, you've got to make that purchase of Gum before you head on over of you will be towed or ticketed. Someone must be watching. :-D
author: Lisa H.

description: yummy sauces. KILLER taco salad (seriously). Big burritos. Great chips and guac. The ambiance is pretty interesting too, kind of weird but charming. Order at the counter, then look for a red velvet clamshell booth to claim your own and eat your tacos in. The place is just a little dark inside so it's very moody even at 2pm -- not really the type of decor and atmosphere I typically find in these quick casual Mexican places. Cash only
author: Cathy J.

description:
I'm from Sj and have been wanting to try this place for a long time. 

The fish tacos, hands down, is the best I've ever had! So juicy! But you have to get it Nick's style with the jack cheese and guacamole. It pairs well with tequila.

This is a spot I wish existed in Sj. Will be coming back!
author: Nick L.

description:
Must get:

Nachos
Fried Fish Tacos- Nick's Way
Guacamole and chips
Agua Fresca!!

I will always love Nick's. Always crowded on Taco Tuesdays and HH but the food is worth the wait/crowd.
author: Katie Anne N.

description:
Wouldn't touch this place again with a ten foot pole. The tacos weren't fresh and imagined they would be after paying around $6 (Nick's way) for one taco. Don't get me wrong, the tacos come out fat with hella food, but they leave the seasoning in the kitchen. Their pescado fish taco was all crunch batter and failed to deliver any sort of taste. The carnitas were whatever and the carne asada pinged fairly low on my scale. 

Cash only.

If you enjoy the slightest authentic Mexican food I would go somewhere else.
author: Christopher A.

description: Tried their fish crispy tacos with guacamole and also tried their fish burrito with nick style.  Wow awesome food.  I have not had any burrito like Nick's. I will definitely go back again.
author: Zohaib K.

description:
The ambience of a 80's strip club turned bar. Great place if you're an overweight sports fan with gynecomastia. Great if you enjoy high fives & ass slaps with other men while partaking in bottomless mimosas. Skip leg day wear your best reflective workout gear and come enjoy tacos and beer. 


Have fun yelpers. 

Only thing holding this place together is their food. Sublime taste I felt like a gladiator.
author: Spend A.

description:
Ok the food is great but this location sucks. Go to Tacko or to Underdogs - used to be same ownership but still basically has same menu. The serving/food staff is amazing and very attentive here at Nicks, but their management and bar staff is horrendous. As I ordered I asked the service staff if the bar was open and they said absolutely. The Bartenders however  (Tuesday, sept 20 4:28 pm) told me when I politely asked if I could order a few beers and a pitcher barked at me and pointed at her watch "we ARENT OPEN FOR ANOTHER 2 minutes" like oh sorry excuse me let me go kindly f*** myself, so sorry for inquiring (while I am one of maybe 4 patrons in the whole establishment) to bother you 2 minutes early for a beer
Manager (or who I assume was the manager by his button up) then came to our table and told us we had to move because the table was reserved at 6:30 which I considered odd as that was 2 hours away. We ended up being there until about 6 pm and watched maybe 2 or 3 different parties sit at the same table we were kicked from and eat their meals. 
+forgot to add that I worked in the bar industry for years and always have a high tolerance (bc I get it) but this was another story
author: Sabina T.

description:
I have a love/hate relationship with Nick's Crispy Tacos. they aren't the best or most authentic tacos i've had, but they do hit a craving every once in a while. and i do like the fact that it's situated inside a bar.
I like to get the pescado tacos, Nick's Way. Nick's Way translated for non SFers means "the way that will make you fat". that's a good thing.
a couple notes: the tacos are relatively large. 2 will make me full, whereas with normal tacos that you find in mexico, i can stuff 4-5 of them into my face and still be ok. also, bring cash. don't go on tuesdays, because that's when the restless natives come - you won't be able to get a seat for sure.
author: Xander C.

description: I like tacko better. This place is a counter top inside a Broy bar which is annoying. They also messed up my 2 taco order which was disappointing. If I had to choose this around the corner, or a 15 minute walk to tacko, I'd choose tacko.
author: Peter T.

description: Went on a Thursday night. Cash only for the food, but the bar accepts credit card. I got a grilled fish taco and a shrimp taco. The grilled fish taco was fine, but nothing out of this world. The shrimp was terribly overcooked, rubbery, and chewy. I also got a sangria at the bar, which was scooped out of a large container. It tasted...stale. Probably won't go back if I have a choice.
author: Annie L.

description: Excellent grilled fish tacos. One is enough for a meal; especially when combined with the complimentary nachos that come with a heavy garnish of fresh guacamole and diced tomatoes.  Service by friendly Omar was awesome!
author: Roy A.

description:
Meaty, too much without guacamole.

Pricey but biggish.

Taco not actually crispy.

Cash only.

Fish nice and crispy.

Lots of guacamole.

Verdict: would come back for more
author: Kailin H.

description:
Womp womp womp........

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=1ytCEuuW2_A

Major disappointment. It wasn't so much that these tacos were bad, they just weren't that special and they didn't live up to the hype around them. 

I was even warned before I ventured off to this place that they had fallen from grace awhile ago. Maybe they were better back in the day.

When I walk in, the place is super odd. As I learn the place also doubles as a nightclub. Super weird place to be eating my tacos. It was dark and a little divey. Not a sun in your face, friendly, come here and eat some taco vibe.

As I approached the register, they were offering some free samples. This did give them points. I took a piece of a quesadilla. Not bad, nothing too special. 

I ordered two tacos. The Carne Asada and the Carnitas, both Nick's Way (crispy with jack cheese and guacamole) A big shocker is how expensive these tacos are. I don't mind paying for good food, but it's pretty expensive for tacos.

I sit down and begin to feast. These are not normal sized tacos, and for how much they were they should be big. There is a soft shell with cheese inside and then another crispy shell with all the works on the inside of that. Lots going on in here. After having two meals earlier in the day, it was going to be labor getting these two tacos down. I was up for the challenge.

They didn't make it easy, because the tacos themselves weren't that good as a mentioned. The Cane Asada was arlight. Giant pieces of steak with beans. It was standard, and could fill someone up quite well. The Carnitas however was a major bummer. The pork was dry and of poor quality. I didn't enjoy it at all. 

In the end I think I would have given this place and experience two stars due to the venue, price and quality of food. It did get another star due to the free samples and actual size of tacos. 

In the end, one taco should be suffice but I think you have better options out there.
author: Mitch E.

description:
Came here for the $2 taco tuesdays.  Great deal for $2 as the tacos are stuffed with meat and fillings.  Your really can't go wrong of the price and quantity of food you get.  It might not be the greatest tacos in the world, but its good and filling.  You can also order drinks from the Rouge bar, pitchers of Margaritas being the most popular.  

The place gets crowded fast so I suggest making a reservation or coming early.  There are only a few non reserved bar seats around as all the booths and the normal tables are reservations.  I honestly think there should be less reservation booths, cause there are a lot of people just wandering around eating tacos and spilling margaritas.  Having less reservations actually gives people a chance to sit if they came early.  

Protip:  The Pitcher of Margaritas is about $20, and serves about 5 glasses.  The HH glass of margarita is $3.   Do the math...
author: Veasna H.

description: Decent place and I see why its popular. Its a cool spot to chill, hangout and catch up but the food didn't impress me. Got them carna asada and fish tacos but it was nothing special. Anything with guacamole is good! This place gets crowded so good luck finding a place to sit!
author: Juan F.

description:
I didn't know why there are so many good reviews on a yelp. I came here and expect to continue the good dining experiences like other customers did, however, it disappointed me. We ordered two tacos, tiger prawn and carnitas. No better than the ones I could get from the corner near my apartment. The "best" food I had is free chips and salsa after checked in on Yelp. Very disappointed for sure. 
I give two stars purely because the generous amount of free chips I got as a check-in gift.
author: Cindy L.

description: Came here to catch up with highschool friends. It was Taco Tuesday. I thought the tacos on specials were just alright but they are huge portions. The fish taco (fried) is really really good but that's not on special, go figure. I believe I got them all nick style. The beer specials is definitely worth it. The chandeliers and the music were a great touch. Maybe I gave it a 5 stars because enjoyed my company as well.
author: Ruben T.

description: I've been living in the 'hood for many years & came upon this Tacko's on Fillmore Street.  At first I thought just another trendy place as they all come & go so quickly!  I love the Nautical theme and the absolute cleanliness of this place.  Be prepared though as they get very busy in a hurry.  I love their fish taco's (Nick's style) the best with the Carne Asada coming a close second. Also, be prepared to wait a bit until your food arrives.  Worth the wait & now I'm an occasional regular.  Their prices are a bit high but the food is so good........
author: Lisa D.

description:
When you think about San Francisco, Mexican food, especially the taco will rise to the top as the signature food item. Naturally, one will presume that the Mission district is the go to taco destination. Without a doubt, you'll find some of the best Mexican cuisine in the city in this hipster district.

If you go to Russian Hill, consider this taco shop/lounge/sports bar as a viable, excellent taco joint. Yes, it is hipster looking and not a venue that you would suspect produces tacos. In fact, this joint harkens back to taco shops you'd find in Austin. Funky, flavorful and a little unconventional.

The carne asada taco is excellent. Juicy and crispy at the same time. I was more impressed by the fish taco which is baja style. It can hang with the top taco joints in San Diego. Fried fish rolled up "Nick's style" is the way to do it. Actually, every taco you try there should be Nick's style.

I have many more taco shops to try in the city, but this is a keeper for sure.
author: Patrick Gabriel L.

description:
Tacos? Solid. TV's? Big. Vibe? Legit. 

But if you're looking for a place to watch the game, this place has lost all of its sports bar credibility. The manager refused to put Chris Heston's no-hitter on the smallest TV in the house that no one was watching (everyone had their eyes glued to basketball game on the big TV next to it) -- that's right, the hometown San Francisco Giants were throwing a NO-HITTER, and the manager here would NOT put the game on the smallest TV in the corner despite the fact that multiple paying customers asked him to do just that for only 5 minutes (the ninth inning). I couldn't believe my eyes/ears. Anyway, Nick's may do well in other facets, but there are much better places in SF to catch a game, starting with Taps next door, Greens around the corner, or the San Francisco Athletic Club out on Divisadero.
author: David L.

description:
Lettuce be honest with ourselves here: nicks crispy tacos aka Rouge SF has an identity crisis of sorts. 
Come on "Nick", are you a taco joint? A swanky club? A lounge? Sports bar? Chandelier outlet?!? We all are dying to know.

The plus side about nicks is their drinks, food and phenomenal service during brunch/dinner hours. (I can't speak for the club/lounge part as I haven't partied there since MAYBE 2008?)
The first time I have come here as of late, I met with some friends for a few beers around 9pm. We were shocked to see open booths, huge TVs and a nice interior. 
We took a seat and a waitress came over to take our order. Everything was A-OK... until we saw the happy hour menu:

Wed. & Thu. 5-10pm; Fri. 2-2am. Yes, literally all night.
Well drinks/cocktails: $3
Bud and Bud light bottles: $3
Margaritas: $3
Margarita Pitchers: $18
Pints of draft beer: $4
Pitchers of beers: $10

WUT?

Immediately I knew we hit jackpot because a) this is polk street on a Friday and b) these are damn good specials. 
There is a separate area for ordering food that can be brought over to the lounge area. My friends ordered 3 burritos, nachos and some tacos and devoured them as if there was a shortage of Mexican food in the US.
Our waitress was really on top of her game: attentive, nice and ensured our drinks stayed filled along with our bellies.

Fast forward to this past Sunday: we hit polk street to watch the saints and niners game. We pop into bullitt to catch the first saints game. The bartender regretfully tells us that all screens are occupied and they weren't playing the game; bummer. We check out greens sports bar; too packed and too grimy. As a last ditch effort  to give polk a solid chance, we trek over to find good ol nicks. Ample standing room, a few places at the bar and EVERY GAME PLAYING INCLUDING OUR SAINTS. In that moment, the GF was happy... which makes me happy.

The deal of the day was brunch, but since we had already eaten we "settled" for bottomless mimosas ($10 with food order, $15 without); beyond reasonable. 
The crowd slowly built as time grew nearer to the niners game. This is your typical polk crowd amped up on mimosas and jager bombs... which was fine seeing as there were no colts fans.
Our server kept our carafes filled and was one of the friendliest bartenders we have had the pleasure of working with.

Before you know it, we had new friends (#allnewfriends) and a booth to share while watching the game. Although busy for a game day/brunch, there was plenty of standing room and wasn't uncomfortably packed like others on the block. 

Conclusion: don't be fooled by the reputation or the identity crisis; nicks is your solid go-to for a drink, a game or some damn good food.

Tips: I am not sure what the rule on animals are, but we saw a few dogs in the bar area. Which is great for us as the girlfriend and I hate leaving our pup in his crate.
Also, they're "known" for their taco Tuesdays; same specials as above except 2 Dos XX for $6, 2 corona for $6 and I do believe they have taco specials (aka nicks way from underdogs... amazing)
They also have Monday night football specials as well. This wouldn't be my go-to for games, but this past Sunday has swayed my opinion.

Nicks/rougeSF/chandelier expo, you wow'd the girlfriend and I and I am a fan. A true fan.
author: Ryan L.

description: The bouncer Nicholas Aaron Wilson kicked us out of the establishment for having an ADA service animal. With an extremely rude attitude. Very disappointed in the management's response as well. We will be following up with the owners.
author: Nicholas H.

description:
I love this place!!! 

Two tacos for $5 and it is huge! Not skimpy on the ingredients at all. I almost wanted to down the whole bottle of salsa too. 

Cash only! One ATM inside the store & another outside.
author: Tina C.

description:
It's been a fairly desperate search for any decent Mexican food in NorCal after spending a large chunk of time in San Diego.  So far, it's been disappointment after disappointment.  And needing to recover after watching the epic fail that was the NFC Championship game, my friends and I stopped by here...mainly because I kept demanding we get Mexican food for the better part of 30 minutes.

The tacos were good, but not really worth the hefty cost.  A carne asada taco and a pescado taco, both done Nick's Way (which quite frankly should be standard and not optional) ran me $13.  Nothing particularly special about either taco aside from replacing a regular tortilla with a fried tortilla.  For all the hype of the reviews, I really expected more.  Especially considering how much it was.

Additionally, some of the other stuff just frustrated the hell out me.  You're churning out tacos at an insane rate, but cash only?  I can understand it if we're dealing with a hole in the wall place, but this is prime City territory on Broadway!  The sheer amount of customer volume should be enough to justify covering the CC fees.  Service was also virtually nonexistent.  And seriously, one register that's CASH ONLY even though you have a long ass line of people waiting to order?  Don't even get me started on the disaster of trying to find an open seat in here during peak times.

If it were simply a matter of the food being overpriced, i would probably just deal with it.  But that with everything else on top is just too much for me to bear.
author: Alexander Y.

description:
A SF necessity!

Large menu for any palette! The inside decoration may sketch some people out, but trust me, you should go! The maroon velvet and mirrors and gaudy chandeliers are key components of the atmosphere. Get a big booth with friends, order a couple pitchers of margaritas, and order the grilled fish burrito. 

Cons: Way too much salt on the glasses for the margaritas-we were plowing the salt off onto the ground! Tequila shots were served with a bunch of salt at the bottom, which ended up being really aggressive/too strong. We reserved a table for 8, and they placed us in a booth that really can only fit 5-6 adults comfortably as the tables are very small, hard to fit all the drinks/food at once. 

The price is right, location is ideal, and a chill atmosphere with lots of TVs to watch sports and enjoy with friends.
author: Michaela C.

description:
Hmm gourmet tacos - interesting.

Stopped by here before drumming practice, and was initially taken aback by the indoor decor. It was like half club, quarter restaurant, and a quarter color. Upon asking what would be best for me to order, the cashier helped me select two tacos to be paired with each other - the carne asada and the grilled fish. Since I do like the beef, I was expecting a lot from the carne asada, however it was the grilled fish that opened up my eyes to the joy of seafood tacos. The carne asada was a little tough, but was still good. But the grilled fish mixed with the sauce that they provide was superb. Great choice. I also got the free chips and salsa courtesy of the yelp check-in, which, combined with the two tacos filled me up quite nicely.

Overall, a little bit on the expensive side for tacos, but you should definitely try the tacos, and it seems like a cool place to chill also because of the environment indoors.
author: Brandon Y.

description:
Came here for a late lunch with my bf so the place was pretty empty. You walk in the lounge and go to the right corner bar where you'll see the menu on the wall! An employee greeted us and was really nice with explaining what people normally get and how many tacos someone usually eats.

We ordered 4 carne asada tacos ($4 each), and 2 of those were made Nick's way, which includes guac + cheese (+$1.25 each), and free chips with salsa with a yelp check in. The check in is awesome because you actually get a large amount of chips, and the tomato salsa on top is delicious, so definitely remember to check in!

The 4 tacos came out a few minutes after and we were so impressed by the size!! I noticed that these look like Underdog's tacos that are "Nick's way" as well and after reading yelp reviews, I realized it's probably the same Nick--so if you love underdogs, you'll love Nick's crispy tacos as well! We ate the Nick's way tacos first and they were so tasty!! They don't skimp on the guac here, and it makes the taco so much better! And for nick's way, they have a crispy shell and a soft shell... YUM!! Also remember to add the sauces on the side--the green/salsa verde is zesty but creamy and the brown/red one is kinda smokey and adds a spicy kick! The meat here was also really good, the carne asada was so tender and I loved that they give a hefty portion. Sometimes I find that places overcook carne asada but here it was perfectly cooked! I was STUFFED by the end of the meal and I like to brag that I can eat a lot... 2 tacos was enough for me!

Overall, service was quick and friendly and the food was awesome! If i'm ever in the area craving tacos, I know where to go!
author: Tara A.

description: The two stars are for the elote only. It was delicious, perfectly cooked, and just the right amount of cheese and spicy. The tacos were awful. The chips were greasy and on the stale side. It was also expensive. There are tons of other places in SF to get reasonably priced and delicious tacos, this is not one of them. Raw onion should not be the most prevalent ingredient in a taco. $13 for a taco, elote, and watered down aqua fresca (that was warm). It's also cash only.
author: J Z.

description:
I had really high expectations of Nick's Crispy Tacos after hearing about it from a fellow yelper. The ambiance threw me off to start and I was super confused as to whether there was waiter service or if it was self serve. The drinks are super cheap during happy hour and the food was just ok. We had a couple carne asada tacos, quesadilla, and carnitas nachos. Carnitas nachos were AMAZING while the tacos were so so and the quesadilla would have been yummy if it wasn't soggy from being filled with too much meat and cheese. 

Something I felt was really strange was one of the employees coming over at us at 5pm to tell us there was a reservation for a table at 7:30 which was extremely unwelcoming.
author: Courtney C.

description: Staff is SO RUDE to the point where they are harassing customers. They wouldn't let us in the door for 20 minutes and then harassed us and rechecked our ids 3 times. We're in our mid to late 20s. The bouncer or manager or whatever he is has a power trip. Save yourself money and a headache and go literally anywhere else for tacos.
author: Alec B.

description: Stumbled across this little place as we were starving looking for food. The order taker was very helpful and recommended the fried chicken taco, "nicks way" Great choice! Turned out to be our favorite!
author: Cherisse T.

description:
This place is most definitely a guy's bar. Very sporty and very casual. On a recent SF trip, our lovely hostess brought us here with her hype on the crispy tacos which is like a chalupa at Taco Bell but much more better in quality as it has real meat rather than mystery meat. 

So we went in (after a brunch) and ordered one taco, Nick's style, with the green and red salsa at the bar. While waiting for our tacos, the bartender was nice enough to give us water as we sat around and watched a bunch of locals chill on a weekend afternoon. 

When our taco came we were out the door rushing to our next venture but stopped outside our car to get a taste of this taco. Sure enough, it was crispy and with a drizzle of the green sauce, it was heavenly. 

For a quite bite in the area, Nick's a good choice to try.
author: Binh T.

description:
Tacos: Yes.
Breakfast Burrito: Yes!!
Lunch Burrito: NO!!!!!! Not even a little bit!
I'll keep it short and simple... If you want to eat a raw onion with sour cream and crappy guacamole go here. Also why aren't there more bean options?? Why only pinto beans!?! Anyway I've had better burritos at Taco Bell. Enough said.
author: Maria P.

description:
Heading over to see a friend who's been doing the "great north salmon fishing" to "euro trip", I wasn't sure if we were meeting at the Rouge or Nick's Crispy Taco.

Oh well, it looks like they're practically under the same roof; you get in to one, and you end up in the other too!

I had the pollo asada taco (grilled chicken), the grilled fish taco, and the camarones taco; pass the cheese, and throw in the guac! I was a little hesitant in ordering them "crispy" as they most often meant "deep fried tortillas," but I decided to take the plunge as most people seemed to recommend it.

They give you a number for your table (or bar table) and they somehow always find you in spite of the crowd --- on a Tuesday night no less; what's wrong with people??? Don't people have to work the next day? Rouge was packed like a Friday night!

Coming back to the tacos, I was really glad to find that the crispy tacos were made thus by roasting them as opposed to deep frying them. And I can see why people prefer it that way. 

The tacos were pretty good but there was nothing remarkable about them; it wasn't bad, it wasn't great. I'd eat them again, but at almost five bucks (4.95 I think) apiece, I will not be rushing out anytime soon to stand in line (which moves pretty quick, thankfully) for an encore.

PS: The drinks at the Rouge were pretty good. The happy hour is till 9pm and the margaritas are three bucks each.
author: Umesh T.

description:
This is the place to be on Tuesdays. $2 tacos + cheap drinks + bougie atmosphere. It can get pretty crowded so come early and steak out one of the booths. 

The tacos are delicious, I try to mimic their tacos at home! They double layer the tortillas- one crispy shell and one soft flour tortilla. 

The have a funky atmosphere... night club, meet tacos. Red velvet booths, lots of TVs and of course a hole-in-the-wall taco shop.
author: Caroline L.

description:
We decided to check out this place to watch the Niners game and a couple of other football games. 

First off, the bar/restaurant itself has an odd look to it--almost like an old-style night club. However, the place gets packed and has a cool vibe to it during football days.

We grabbed a huge booth with our party and sat down and enjoyed some of their famous tacos and bottomless mimosas. Our waitress was very friendly and kept the mimosas full. She even warned us when the mimosa time was about to expire and refreshed our pitchers.

Overall, this is a great spot to gather with friends to watch a football game or otherwise and enjoy some tacos and mimosas in SF.
author: Ryan R.

description:
I should be pretty partial to this place since we share a name and everything. I had passed by this place several times before stopping in and it turned out to be worth the wait. Nick's is attached to Rogue which is the bar section. 

When you enter there is a bar with tvs and seating if you are just in for drinks. If you want food you head all the way to the back. A couple things to remember. This is cash only so bring your cash before you head in. There are ATM's in the back as well. 

Once in the back there is a huge selection of tacos and burritos and pretty much must mexican food options. The taco I had wasn't that great but I was only able to try one kind. I did get the Nick's way which is a lot going on in a taco but it is different which earns some points. 

Once you get used to the idea of a crispy taco inside a soft taco it is actually pretty good. I am going to chalk it up to a one time thing that my taco wasn't the best. The cushy seating and amazing velvet decor make this place worth returning to with friends. If you are up this far on polk street and its late and you have the munchies this is a way better choice than your closest Taco Bell.
author: Nick R.

description: Not a very good meal, The Mexican street corn was tasty but the nachos were not that good. And the ordering process is a little out of the ordinary.
author: Brian B.

description: Super good food! The tacos the nachos the quesadillas, everything is super tasty! Taco Tuesday is always super packed but going in any other day there are good deals and pretty good service! I recommend getting all tacos nicks way and realizing they are bigger then normal street tacos!
author: Jazlyn H.

description:
OMG, my friend and I parked our car on the corner of Polk and Broadway and we totally overlooked Nick's! We walked up and down Broadway (between Van Ness and Hyde) for a good ten minutes until we realized that they were right across the street from where we parked our car! Nick's is located inside Rouge nightclub, so instead of looking for a "Nick's" sign, make sure you look for "Rouge."

Once inside, the setting was very cheap and low maintenance. Orders were taken at the cashier in the corner. Patrons are given numbers, they seat themselves, and then a server brings out their food shortly after. Skimming through the reviews, I had prepared myself for a long wait, but it was Saturday afternoon and there was no wait at all. Score!

We ordered two fried tacos de pescado (fish), one grilled tacos de pescado, and one tacos de camarones (prawns)--all Nicks' Way (addition of jack cheese and guacamole). I still have not found amazing seafood tacos, but Nick's fish tacos are mighty tasty. The fried fish had a nice cajun taste and was perfectly battered and crispy. Two tortillas were used for each taco and my favorite part was that the "inside" tortilla was fried with jack cheese--it added a very nice crispy texture! People complain about the steep prices, but for the amount of seafood you get, I think it's fairly priced.
author: Lien T.

description:
Title: Needy crowded place - not worth coming here
Will never be coming to this place. 
Had to give my credit card info to reserve a reservation, which is fine. The only pro was that the food came very fast. 
Reason 1 for not coming: during the meal, they really wanted my email address and came back to get it after the meal - why do they need my email? The worker had no good reason and kept saying "they want it"... Who is "they"? 
Reason 2 for not coming: we ordered 6 tacos (2 carne asada, 1 carnitas, 2 veggies & 1 pescado). They charged us for 9. However, I had to give up trying to even get our money back because other than the fact the food came fast, every other service was SUPER slow. It came to a point where waiting 30 mins for $7 was not worth it. 
Reason 3 for not coming: why is there a photographer taking our picture while we are eating dinner? This is not a club. 
Reason 4 for not coming: It was cash only, but they still wanted our credit card and id to hold... Weird. 
Final thought: WOULD NOT COME BACK, don't waste your time coming here, there are better tacos elsewhere
author: Cindy C.

description:
$2 tacos. Pay with cash or Level Up in the kitchen line. Saturdays nights are PACKED when there's a game on!

I didn't look at the pictures when I yelped this place, so when I walked in and saw the sign for reservations, I got a little worried! Luckily one o ye bartenders was really nice and answered my questions about seating - apparently, Nick's turns into a dance club at night?

I want to go to there. 

Saturdays at 10ish. 

Need to watch a football game? Nick's has giant flat-screens and surround sound. 

The mirrored walls and non-sticky floors makes this sports bar pretty nice! 

My suggestion? Definitely come here with a group so you can be in line AND save seats for your party. 

I will be returning here to check things out.
author: Shanika H.

description: We  just ate here this past weekend and the quality of food is great as ever.  We had the chips and salsa AND guacamole which takes it to the next level!  I have never raved about chips and salsa but their's is the bomb especially with guacamole. Best mexican food north of LA!  I wish there were more Mexican places as good as this one in the bay area.
author: MJ W.

description:
The start of my night here was not ideal, but the food made up for it. My boyfriend and I sat at the bar waiting for our friends to join us. We are from out of town so we were unaware that they have happy hour specials on Thursday night (we are from Boston where happy hour drink discounts are illegal). We ordered 2 margaritas from the menu. The summer cucumber one was my favorite as it was not overwhelmingly tequila tasting. I was really disappointed to find out that for a cheaper price that two margaritas, we could have bought a pitcher. The bartender failed to even mention this to us when we ordered. I thought that was poor service. 

That said, the tacos were phenomenal. You have to order at the bar in the back of the place and then sit with your number. The waitress will not serve your table outside of filling your drinks and delivering your food after ordering at the bar. They are much larger than I'm used to in Boston, so 2 of them were plenty. I chose the carnitas and fish tacos. The fish one was a little dry but tasty, and the carnitas was juicy with a little spice. 

The atmosphere was hilarious. Restaurant by day, club by night characterized by the cheesey crystal chandeliers and red velvet half moon booths. I didn't stay to see what shenanigans unravel at night, but I imagine it gets really rowdy and fun. 

I would go back.
author: Brittany O.

description: Delightfully weird location.   Leaning towards hipster-ville, but I'll stand behind a guy with a man-bun to get a good fish taco!   Be sure to order them "Nick's Way" with guacamole.   A tad unorthodox perhaps, but tasty nonetheless.
author: Robert B.

description:
Rouge lounge offers a beautiful environment but I really can't give more than 2 stars for this place. It is a bit overrated. 

From years of eating great California Mexican food, I was a bit disappointed. I guess Russian hill isn't somewhere you for Mexican food anyways. 

Been to this place about 6 to 8 times, tried the vegetarian crispy taco, fish burrito, vegetarian burrito, chips and salsa, nachos, and etc. not sure why they put so much raw onions and purple lettuces in everything. It tastes bitter! The salsa is tasteless but chips are good.I do like the spinach tortilla though. PS This place is cash only.
author: Sophia S.

description: I don't get it.  Place was dirty.  Bartenders were rude and slow.  Food was well below average.  Looks like a place that's trying to be cool and smells like "bad bar".  Not going back.
author: Chris n.

description:
My husband, two teenagers and I grabbed a late dinner at Nick's on a Friday night. Location was a bit hard to find if you haven't been before as the building isn't obviously marked, could also be that we came at night in an uber. We stuck with the name sake and ordered a slew of Nick's style tacos; pescado, cammorones, carne asada and fried chicken. The tacos were delish although on one of mine the inner fried tortilla was a bit over done and hard to chew. My husband LOVED the friend chicken and my fav was the fried fish. Our kids went with the carnitas taco Nick's way, bean and cheese burrito (2 for $5 Friday special) and a carne asada burrito con todo which was all amazeballs. Our son tried the horchata which was heavy on the cinnamon but tasty and my husband and I ordered vodka soda and crown on the rocks both of which tasted very watered down which is what lost them a star. 

Please take note that it is cash only and you order drinks at the bar and food at the counter. Great service and chill atmosphere, we would definitely come back next time we are in the city.
author: Jennifer W.

description:
Warning, Nick's may cause excessive superlative use.

Disclaimer: I did delivery, so any comments on ambiance will relate solely to my house. (There is no tequila here.) 

These tacos put almost every attempt at fish and vegetarian tacos to shame. I will not speak of these other attempts, only of the REAL ULTIMATE POWER of Nick's INCREDIBLY CRISPY (well unless you let them sit in the bag too long, then it's more along the lines of Nick's MOSTLY CRISPY) tacos. 

I say REAL ULTIMATE POWER because these tacos will make you think you are a ninja who must consume many, many tacos to save the emperor... or at least to finish the red sauce because it's pure smokey pepper amphetamine-grade delicious. Not that amphetamines are delicious. Don't do drugs. 

... unless they are covered in the red sauce. That's a separate ethical dilemma. 

Beyond that, I can recommend these for:

- Likeable roommates who talk just a leeetle too much. These tacos will silence them for at least 15 minutes. Enough time to get a good, solid meditation in. 

- Candidates for public office. These tacos cause such resolution of conflict between crispy and soft that any bipartisan bilateral biplane committee will fly their pants off to unilateral agreement that these tacos are, in fact, unable to be classified as crispy or soft, and yet are both. As such they deserve equal taco rights... and extra red sauce. 

For real though, these are delicious. Pardon me, I have to go protect the taco emperor.
author: David C.

description: Great taco. Never come on Santa run. Love the taxis here. Limited spots when busy。 great drinks and good vibes. Located in great area. Come bar hop here on Polk. Mimosa pitchers and bottomless ones are great. It's a club at night. Once went to a private event here. Nice vibes. Limited parking. But everything walkable.
author: Amy Y.

description:
The WORST tacos I've ever eaten. I'm not sure what all these Bay Area people are used to but the tacos SUCK. Absolutely no flavor....except for the excessive amount of beans they use. The salsa is bland. The guys working the counter were SUPER nice!

Side note: the bartender (Tuesday 11/15/2017) at 5pm) was a complete bitch! She clearly needs to find a new profession that doesn't involve people.
author: Kevin K.

description: Super popping place on Tuesdays. I haven't been on any other day of the week, but on Tuesdays they are so crowded! The tacos are pretty good and the margaritas are too!
author: Lisa N.

description:
A happening place, great food, nice margarita and light on pocket, I had to give this place a 5 star! I was here with my girlfriends for some Friday evening snacking and drinks and we found a nice big spot for all 9 of us, saying that, this place is great for big groups! I just love their tacos and love the fact that they home deliver! Their veggie taco is bomb!

As you can already imagine, this place gets really packed by evening so plan on getting here a bit early to avoid waiting in a queue to grab your place! Also, parking would be a tough luck but hey! its Russian Hill! I prefer to uber instead of driving when I am in this area.
author: Pratibha S.

description:
This is just a GREAT place for a cheap and casual happy hour, either on Tuesdays or Fridays - to enjoy the good deals.
The food will not be the tastiest, most delicious, flavorful, Mexican food you will ever have, that is for sure. BUT. it's good enough, definitely filling, big and cheap. The drinks are just as good as any other bar, and the ambiance is very friendly and casual. I basically had a great time going to Nick's taco Tuesday!

Do not hesitate to hit the spot whenever you are looking to have a good, relaxing time after work. Mind one thing: the free chips deal you get when you check in on Yelp is not available on Deals days (i.e. Tues and Friday). So come on a regular priced day if you wish to enjoy the free chips. I guess that's fair! 

See you very soon, Nick.
author: Sev G.

description: This has been a go-to for solid tacos, good chips & salsa and a quick bite when needed. Today was the last straw for customer service, though. Second time in a row that a delivery order was missing items, and when I called about it, the manager on duty first tried to tell me that I was wrong, then suggested that contacting Caviar was my only option. Caviar customer service was prompt, but I'm still stuck with a botched order for the 2nd time in a row. Might have been o.k. with an apology on Nick's part and an attempt to fix it. Instead, I got push back and no help. Lame. I should have just quit Nick's with the first messed up order.
author: Lisa R.

description: Heads-up they worked UP to a 69 recently. It used to be in the bottom 15% of health scores on Yelp. That said, you knew it wasn't clean, but you didn't care because it's freaking delicious. Like Angelenos make a point of coming here. If you get lucky you'll score a swank booth and BOGO beer/tequila/margarita from the bar. I still love you Nicks but 69? Really? Someone needs to be eagle-eyeing all 20 feet of the place all day every day. And if I could possibly not have to work for everything, that would be great. Imagine sitting down and saying 1 beer 2 tacos and a glass of water. Here is my card. Also charging roughly 40% extra for avocado on a taco is ridiculous, but I still suck it up because it's that good.
author: Smelly S.

description: I don't hesitate to declare these the best tacos in SF. A girlfriend introduced me to this place on a night out and it was so tasty that I took my husband out there within a week. There is open seating, but it can often be filled up. If possible, a reservation is the way to go. There is no table service and the restaurant counter is separate than the bar. The bar accepts cards but the taco stand is cash or you can order through an app that I can't recall the name of right now. I personally love the spicy elote (corn on the cob) and making any of the tacos Nick'a way. The red salsa on the tables is fantastic. Both my husband and friend spoke very highly of the taco with fried fish in it.
author: Jessica J.

description:
Nick's Crispy Tacos has a great location on Polk Street inside the nightclub Rouge.  While I did eat at the bar with a friend, I saw many people take their food to go.  I found it to be reasonably priced.  For the two of us, it was about $30 total.  But word to the wise - bring cash - Nick's Crispy Tacos does not take cards, and if you end up having to use the atm there it will charge you a ridiculously high service fee. (About $5)

We ordered the crispy chicken tacos, which were awesome!  And chips & salsa with guacamole.  The guac is super tasty.  I highly recommend both.  The service was really fast, and the food was brought to us at the bar.  I found everyone working there to be really friendly and customer service oriented.  I'll definitely be back to try more items on the menu.
author: Stephanie V.

description: Ordered the nachos and took one bite and had to send it back.  My friend ordered them too and did the same thing.  Their cheese is disgusting.  It reminds me of the huge can of fake cheese you can get from Costco.  I decided to get the simple and safe chicken quesadilla.  I shouldn't have done that.  I'm not sure how they cook it but it look at tasted like it was deep fried only without it being oily.   At this point I was super hungry and took my first bit and it had absolutely no flavor.  And then there is the bar.  It took me over 10 minutes and the bartender walking right past me 4 times to even say "I'll be with you in a minute.  It was NOT packed at all.  I like the atmosphere of the place but the food and bar are not worth my time when there are so many better places.
author: Jason S.

description: Good tacos for a great price. It's hard to find, at first, because it is in the Rouge nightclub, and does not have its own store front. However, the tacos and burritos are worth it. Plus, if you check in on Yelp, you get a healthy serving of chips and fresh salsa for free.
author: Daisy W.

description:
Nick's Crispy Taco, you did not disappoint. Your scrumptious Pescado Tacos deserve multiple songs to be written in your honor. I have had fish tacos from many places and they usually disappoint me but not Nick's. The deep fried fish was situated on top of a shredded cabbage mix and had guacamole slathered on top. There was a soft outer shell and a crispy inner one, giving you a crunch and the carbs in one bite. Nick's does such a nice job with the cabbage that I did not feel the urge to pick out the normally bitter red cabbage. The only drawback is that the taco gets messy. But Nick's anticipated this so every table has its own napkin holder and two kinds of salsa in squeeze bottles. Nick's you have thought of almost everything. 

We tried the Pescado taco, Pescado burrito and Carne Asada burrito. That was overkill. I should have stopped after I ate a taco and half the fish burrito. I think the stomach pain and aftermath food coma were worth it. Personally, I enjoyed the burrito more than the taco because the burrito offers the same flavors with less mess. 

What I recommend: 

Pescado Taco or Burrito
author: Andrew W.

description: I thought my tacos were really tasty for SF. I'm used to SoCal mexican...I ordered in, but next time I'll try to go there. Good portion of guac. I had the pescado and carne asada. Maybe I'll try something else next time. I also got the jalapeño poppers, which had cheddar in the inside. Haven't had those in a while.
author: Stella H.

description: Food was great. Had the two types of fish tacos, since that's my go-to and a barometer for quality. They did not disappoint. The adjacent bar was packed, so I recommend avoiding during peak drinking hours, unless you crave drunken tacos (and let's face it, who hasn't?).
author: Nate B.

description:
Nick's Way is the only way. There is no other.

The pescado is a go everytime. Lightly fried fish, shredded cheese and a hearty smear of guac tucked in a double wrap of semi-fried tort and a fiercely crunchy inner layer. It's part hard, part soft, all fatty and incredible. It's crispy, yo. Check the name.

$5 for a taco may seem a bit steep, until you see one. A sandwich in its own right, only the ravenous should opt for two. Pair it with a well-spiced elote and a large agua fresca for a serious meal at just over $10, or swap the corn for chips and salsa and a Hamilton's got you covered.

With red leather booths, opulent drapery and an uhn-tiss-uhn-tiss vibe, you'll likely hear a True Blood reference from your dining companions, muddled by the sounds of taco devouring. Small price to pay for your new addiction, lunch, dinner or late night.

Oh, and Nick, bring back the free chips and salsa check in offer. It was the best!
author: Damien S.

description:
The fish tacos were the best! It wasn't saggy, perfectly fried, well priced.

Parking was ok - not too difficult.
It wasn't too loud (if you sit inside).
author: Ryan H.

description:
Taco Tuesday....
Looooong line at food order counter.
Generous portions.
Fare prices.
Noise level so high it was almost impossible to have a conversation.
Food? Sorry to say it was very bland.
Doubt that I'll return.
author: Jim T.

description: Very fun, energetic vibe! The food was really good! Cute chandeliers and a bold red color scheme that makes this place unique. Overall I would totally recommend. The only reason I'm not giving it five stars is because the music was a bit too loud and I could hardly have a conversation with the people directly next to me. Although I know that is part of the experience and fun, I also thought it would have had the same energy but been more enjoyable if it was not quite so painfully loud. But overall a really fun spot!
author: Ellie J.

description: Delicious tacos! They are a good size. Must try the tacos, "Nicks Way"  which adds guacamole and cheese. Very good!
author: Citlali G.

description:
Nick's on a Sunday afternoon is absolutely buzzing. As you step into the restaurant, you wonder if you stumbled into the wrong place, because it almost seems like a sports bar rather than a Mexican restaurant. Yet, as you venture further in, little booths and good food await you.

I got a carne asada taco and a pollo taco. The carne asada was flavorful and well grilled, and I enjoyed the taco very much. Unfortunately, the chicken was a little dry. My friends got the pescado taco (got great reviews) and burritos (hefty portion). 

This place is also easy on the wallet, which isn't the case for most places in the city. Definitely check in on Yelp to get chips and salsa on the house!
author: Julia N.

description:
I know that some businesses need to stave off those horrid merchant fees when accepting debit and credit cards but I still find it annoying when it's a cash only place like this establishment.

I didn't eat here having had a green tea prior and was full. My friend on the other hand was about to pass out from low blood sugar so I tagged along. He ordered a chicken taco and shrimp taco I believe. It looked and smelled good but according to him it was sooooo messy. Also they do their tacos in a soft shell so how is it crispy again??

The surroundings were ok. At night it turns into a nightclub and I am sure I wouldn't want to be there at night. All in all the place was clean and somewhat comfy. I don't think I'd go back though as I don't see a need.
author: Steven G.

description:
$5 for nachos and a taco? (4pm to 8pm happy hour)

A smoking hot bartender.

A seat at the bar while watching locals enjoy so much about their fine city of San Francisco.

Heck yeah. I can't wait to go back.

Get there SUPER early if you want to enjoy Taco Tuesdays. The place gets packed. I had to go back on Friday.

For what I paid I thought the food was pretty darn good.
author: Xerxes N.

description: They should rename this place "nicks room tempature tacos that aren't at all crispy". Staff was burned out or didn't  give shit. The food runner handed me my food and I told him I ordered crispy tacos. He said they were and walked away. Very disappointed. Will not return. The girl bartending was the only person that exhibited any professionalism.
author: Daniel F.

description: To be honest, I was hesitant to enter the place. Is it really serving Mexican??? I'm glad I trusted Yelp and tried it. Their tacos are nice size, lots of texture (crispy tortilla and soft tortilla, cabbage, etc). Both watermelon and pineapple drink are not overly sweet as some other Mexican placed. Enjoyed eating at the booth!
author: Sayuri W.

description:
This place has cool decor! Came here on a sunny Saturday afternoon and got the grilled fish taco the Nick's way. Line was kind of long and I was a bit lost in the chandelier filled room. But the taco was very good! Fresh, crispy shell with one soft shell, fish was grilled just right. It's not very authentic Mexican but it's good! I will come back!

Downside: I feel that the price is a bit high for tacos. Also the crowd felt a bit too Marina-y which was a bit of a turn off too.
author: Wendy K.

description: Love the Steak and Fried Fish Tacos, Nick's Way!! Go on Tuesday for Taco Specials!!
author: Candace F.

description:
After hearing Nick's Crispy Tacos this and Nick's Crispy Tacos that, I knew I had the pay a visit. Sooner the better.
So, a bunch of us ended up checking out Nick's Crispy Tacos since we were in the neighborhood. And man, this is the best Mexican joint, ever!

We placed a massive order of fish tacos, fish burritos, veggie burritos, nachos and well, the list goes on. And I have to tell you, none of the orders were disappointing.
The chicken was perfectly seasoned, the fish was fresh, the rice and beans were perfectly cooked and the cripy taco itself warrant a whole star. The salsas were fresh and the guac too. We didn't order any cocktails. But I cannot wait to come back and try out the margaritas. 
The food was cheap. Which is always a win!

The ambiance at Rouge (within wihich, Nick's is located) will take you back to another time, when red was the color to decorate a disco :) They kept the theme, which I personally loved. 

The only person disappointed was my husband - Their spiciest salsa did not trigger even a single sniffle.
author: Ranjani S.

description: I've been to Nick's numerous times for their happy hour, but everyone who's visited before knows it can get pretty packed.  I've tried their nachos, quesadillas, carne asada tacos, chicken tacos, and fish tacos in their ever so popular "Nick's Way" which is an extra charge.  To be completely honest their food is just ok.  Nothing to ooo and ahh about in my opinion.  If you're looking for anything close to authentic Mexican food this isn't it.  Their nachos are topped off with nacho cheese....not a bad thing, just not my thing. Their tacos are generously loaded with guacamole  They only accept cash.
author: Christine D.

description: Hands down the worst Mexican food in the bay. The mind boggles as to how Saturday evenings are.
author: Mark M.

description: When I first walked in, I was confused because this place looks like a club. Spacious. Pretty good pescado tacos. Cash only for the food, but the bar (for drinks) takes cards. Bottomless mimosas on weekends. Good for groups. Check in on yelp and get free chips! Awesome! I definitely want to come back.
author: Annie S.

description: Really really meh. Lived in San Diego for 8 years. The crispy tacos weren't good at all, and who puts beans in their tacos? Yuck!!! The cheese quesadilla was awful too...tasted stale
author: Annie K.

description:
Picked up a veggie burrito from Nicks tonight for dinner. Was super filling without feeling heavy. Ingredients were really fresh and healthy tasting.

Will definitely be back to try more food/have drinks.

Only bummer was it is cash only. Had to use their ATM and got charged $2.95 plus a fee from my bank. Ended up being like a $12 burrito. Def will have cash on me next time.
author: Christine E.

description:
Damn these tacos were big. I ordered 3, and in retrospect, 2 would have been perfect, but I was gonna finish those tacos if that meant I was gonna be rolled home. We also got a couple of pitcher of margaritas, more than we actually needed, but we were determined to finish our drinks. Will definitely come back. And will definitely stick with 2 tacos. Fish tacos were good. Stay with the fried fish instead of grilled. Grilled was good, but a bite of the fried one and I regretted my order. 
Tables are hard to come by and some are for 4 or more, so keep that in mind when you go. You might wait awhile for a table. And the line for food can get a little long. But its definitely worth a try.
I'll be back here at some point.
author: Lizz K.

description:
Ok.. the grilled and fried fish tacos, Nick's way.. pretty amazing on this second try. Much better than I remember. Second best fish tacos I've had (The Taco Guys still trumps all at #1).

Maybe it's that I didn't get the carnitas to ruin the experience?
author: Ziyan C.

description:
My brother and sister-in-law, a native San Franciscan, brought me here because they claimed it was very San Franciscan. I've heard good things about Mexican food in California and would expect it to be better than it is in New York, so I was excited.

From the exterior, I did not expect this place to be a taco joint. As I walked in, it was a huge space with chandeliers, dark red walls, and velour booths. I thought we were in the wrong place. Frankly, I thought the decor was gaudy and outdated. My sister-in-law mentioned that it's Nick's Crispy Tacos by day, and Rouge Nightclub & Lounge by night. Mind blown.

As you head to the back room, there stands the counter for Nick's Crispy Tacos. We ordered 3 carne asada tacos, 1 pollo asado taco (all Nick's way -- made crispy with jack cheese & guacamole for $0.95 extra each), a strawberry agua fresca, and horchata.

Friendly reminder: CASH ONLY

The tacos came out, and they were much larger than I expected! None of those measly Taco Bell tacos -- imagine more like the size of a choco taco! They were double lined with tortillas, but instead of the taco being crispy as described on the menu, it was more like a middle ground between soft & crunchy, slightly resembling being stale. I'm all about textures when I'm eating food, so this was a big issue for me.

Other than the tortilla, I had no issues with the contents of the taco. The steak wasn't overly salty, and the guacamole was very smooth and creamy. Each of the tables had bottles of red salsa and a salsa verde, which had a slight spice to it. The tacos were tasty on their own without the sauces, but if you want your tacos to have a kick to it, add the salsas. 

The strawberry agua fresca was very refreshing. I could actually taste real strawberry as opposed to strawberry syrup. The horchata, which is one of my favorite drinks, was actually rather disappointing. I kept hyping it up to my brother, but this was not the best I've had. It was overly sweet and felt like it coated my mouth because it was thicker than I was used to.

Unfortunately, they messed up my brother's order and gave him a pescado taco instead of the pollo asado taco. He ended up just eating it anyway instead of sending it back, but that was a setback on the experience. 

Two tacos would definitely be enough for a meal, so it would be a very affordable option if you're looking to dine on a budget.
author: Erica L.

description: Just ok in my opinion. Shells like thin paper, soggy fish tacos. Too many other real Mexican restaurants in SF - that are really good. We ate here maybe twice and moved on... Sorry NCT
author: Kirk M.

description:
Nice place, especially on Tuesdays nights!! 

Best Taco Tuesday in the city
author: Alberto M.

description:
Nick's Crispy Tacos is an institution. Surprisingly I've never been before even though I've been to SF more times than I can remember. Even though I haven't been to Nick's, I've definitely had tacos Nick's Way before. Plenty of places in SF try to do this and there's not really a trick to it so plenty to places do it damn well. 

I came here finally for Taco Tuesday! Ole!

Suuuuper crowded but we just ate off the bar area. I had a girls elbow in my back and  another chick's hair in my food the whole time. No complaints here, I still had a pretty good time with yummy tacos.
author: Qui C.

description:
-Stale or uncooked hard taco shells for decent food
-Poor/rude service from bartender
-Cheap/Inconvenience of cash only payment
-Confusing setup for ordering drinks and food
-Same nachos could've been made at home

This all maybe fine for neighborhood locals but don't recommend for business travelers and tourists!!
author: Vandana A.

description: I went here for tacos on Taco Tuesday. However I was disappointed to find out that it was only after 5pm and dine in only. I decided to get food anyways and I did enjoy the carnitas. I got it Nicks way which is totally the way to go. I'd go again but the price is super hefty.
author: Charlotte A.

description: My favorite neighborhood burrito place. Good quality food every time. Also great on the weekends with bottomless mimosas. My only complaint here is the customer service when things are busy - some of the servers can be very rude. But other than that, this is one of my go-to's.
author: Aryn V.

description:
I come to Nick's quite a bit! It is close to my house and always a good time. On Tuesday it gets pretty hectic because it is the 'spot' for Taco Tuesday.

As far as drinks specials I'd say its one of the better places in the city, They have different specials every night and obviously Tuesday special is pretty great. The venue is a little funky with the the chandeliers but I don't mind it. The have big TV's, so its actually a great place to watch games! It gets crowded during big games aka Warriors, Giants, Niners playoff games!

The reason why I went with 4 instead of 5 is the price of the food! It is like 11 something for a burrito. The food is good but not that good! Besides that though, love coming here!
author: Justin P.

description:
Amazing unique tacos that are double layered crispy and fried on the outside, and soft on the inside. Sort of like the Taco bell double decker taco, but a bajillion times better and safer to eat. 

The $4 range tacos are worth every penny and you should get 2 (or 3 max if you're starving), they're very filling. 

Service is  bad though. They ignored me and a large group for a while, no idea why. I'd give it 5 if the servers were more pleasant and said hello.
author: Chuck N.

description: BEST fish tacos I have tasted during my trip to San Francisco. MAKE SURE to make ALL your tacos the "Nick's Special". It is WORTH the money that you pay for and will definitely get you stuffed. This place is located on the inside of a bar, so for parking, either find street parking or park in the lot of the Walgreens, but make sure you DO NOT park in the Walgreens parking spot or else they might ticket you. CASH ONLY for those who do not like to carry cash. Ambience is very calm and chill, or at least during the time that I went, which was around lunch time, on a weekday and when they barely opened. Service was GREAT even though it is not a sit down type of restaurant. They provide water, utensils and other kitchenware needed for your meal.
author: Chazmine D.

description: Amazing chips and salsa.Go for the salsa trio. However, the tacos leave a bit to be desired. Slightly muddled flavor and flour tortillas on "street" style tacos were a let down.
author: Jane F.

description:
EYE CANDY on Taco Tuesday's!! 

Neck snapped back and forth at all the shirt & ties. YUM. WASSUP!!!!

Oh yeah, the tacos are amaze balls. That's a definite plus. I had an amazing time for Happy Hour here and cannot wait to come back. 

Taco Tuesday anyone???
author: Lily M.

description: Fun vibes. Taco Tuesday is a pop off. Best quesadilla in San Francisco. Tacos are great too. A fun spot.. Must visit for new locals and SF tourists.
author: Parker W.

description: I've had tacos ranging from Mexico, all the way up to Washington and these are by far the best tacos I've ever had!
author: Nima K.

description: Awesome food. Came in place is clean and well staffed. Saw the Bs advisory and after visiting. Realized someone was really hating this places success. Great fresh made food with lots of turn over. Wouldn't be surprised if they were bringing in all fresh ingredients on the daily.
author: LEON S.

description:
The pollo tacos, nick's way, were fantastic! 

As another review stated, the salsa for the chips is not salsa, but pico de gallo. However, there are salsas offered on the table.
author: Deanna C.

description: Great food and super friendly and helpful staff, I order some food online last week and called to make sure it was vegetarian(since the website I ordered from didn't have that option) and the sweet guy I talk to not only made sure it will be vegetarian he also refunded me $2 since the veggie option was cheaper, I didn't even realize or asked for the refund! I'm a happy customer and will return very soon!
author: Ladywolf M.

description: YUM!!! I had the fish tacos made Nick's way and free chips for checking in on yelp. My boyfriend got the prawn burrito and they really didn't skimp on the prawns! Flavor was on point. Docking a star for cash only and the weird vibes going on when it is not peak hours.
author: Jane H.

description: All of the tacos are great but definitely try the pescado and pollo asado Nick's way.
author: Tony S.

description: It was pretty good. Had a Carne Asada burrito which was delicious. It looks like an old bought over night club inside, and the chips and salsa aren't chips and salsa.. it's more like chips and chopped vegetables.
author: Lucas B.

description:
John F Kennedy once said, "its not what your country can do for you, it's what you can do for your country"

Last night i ate at Nick's Crispy Tacos and thought to myself.. the best thing that I can currently do for my country is to get this piece of shit establishment shut down for sanitary issues.

Seeing as it's mid-term election time in the US, I thought I would provide a political angle to this review. Nick's Crispy Tacos could only be compared to a lying, cheating, stealing, scum-bag politician that lies through his teeth for your vote. And then when he gets your vote, takes a proverbial diarrhea (which i had multiple times after this meal) right on your fucking head.

I was lured in here by a promotional offer that promised free margaritas with a $10 purchase. Not only was that a blatant lie, I had to purchase both 10$ an additional margarita to receive the free margarita offer.
