I didn't come here planning on getting wasted, however, I believe that this bait and switch was intentional so that you would get wasted enough to at least temporarily tolerate that which could only be described as sub-standard human waste; not real food.

I ordered a fish taco which tasted like purely of mercury (I am currently consulting with a physician to preemptively combat the symptoms of mercury poisoning). The salsa that this fish taco was drowned in was clearly from sub-par tomatoes, over-ripe and extremely wet, causing the crispiness of the fried fish to disappear, turning it into a soggy, mercury-ridden piece of white fish. A sorry excuse for a fish taco in my opinion.

The margarita (the one i paid for) was basically all tequila. Again, i believe they try to get you drunk so that their "food" will be more tolerable. And the second margarita (the "free" offering) was devoid of all alcohol. 

A word you hear a lot in the GOOD restaurant business is "consistency" to which Nick's Crispy Tacos exhibited none, and made my dining out experience more like a nightmare from a Freddy Crougar film directed by Wes Craven. 

My experience here was in a word; terrifying. Terrifying for my personal health seeing as I may have ingested unhealthy portions of Mercury. Terrifying in terms of the service (non-existant, devoid of manners), decor (cheesy Mexican murals lined the walls of this try-hard establishment) , and atmosphere (terrifying in terms of the amount of tattoos and 2 year college degrees that each patron had). 

But most of all this experience was terrifying because it was crowded. This was terrifying because it really makes me question the sophistication, taste, and overall merit of San Francisco, a city that I have lived in and loved for almost a decade. 

May God have mercy on this restaurant and everyone who enjoys it souls.

Thanks,

Michael Stern
author: Michael S.

description:
I've been a patron of Nick's for a number of years.  It started as a fledgling taco operation during 'off' times for the Rouge nightclub on Polk & Broadway, and it has blossomed into a bubbling and busy Taco spot which sometimes gets so extremely packed it can be frustrating.  This place is just a few blocks away from me, and I have tried a large percentage of the items over the years- and their food is great overall. But there are a few 'must haves' which I almost always find myself ordering these days.

I love their 'Pescado' burritos- they make Fried or Grilled fish, stuffed with chopped cabbage, onions, cilantro, a tangy mildly spicy sauce, and you can add rice, guac, or other items.  I usually order the fried version (adds a nice crunch!) and I  believe they use either Mahi Mahi or Snapper. To me, this is the top item on the menu and distinguishes their otherwise good menu from the selections at most taco & burrito joints.  Also, I am a big fan of their spicy gooey cheesy 'elote' corn- I find this item delicious as well.m  My wife swears by the carnitas quesadilla....

A few quick pointers- Nick's does take out, and sometimes when I go and the line is super long, rather than wait in line, sometimes I call and place a take-out order instead.  And sometimes they don't answer their phone.  When I do have takeout- catch someone's attention behind the counter and you can usually grab your takeout without enduring the line just to pay.  Remember Nick's only takes cash!

Nick's started off being 'the only' option for Mexican in the general area, and it got my business for that reason. However, I can solidly call their fish burritos a 'selection of choice' which draws me there from time to time over their competitors that I patronize from time to time, and NOT just because it is close to my home.  Please give it a try and I hope you enjoy!
author: Andy S.

description:
Saw this on CP, start watching at 9:05 http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=XkLn0lY_pxk. I could never pay regular price for one of these tacos, they are EXPENSIVE!!!!!! I was thrilled to find a deal from Buywithme. $10 for $20 worth of Nick's Crispy Tacos, YESSSSS!!!!!!

While we were in line, I saw someone order $3.50  Chips with Guacamole & Salsa and it sure looked good so I got it too.

We ordered:

http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=CAveDmi9tYg3Gbs9VVnm2Q&select=ujvxEqq_CrTd6893JHOBRg
- $2 small Jamaica Aqua Fresca: delish, I want this now. I wonder how I can make my own. I would need some dried hibiscus, sugar, water...

- $3.50  Chips with Guacamole & Salsa: I'm glad I got this, I wasn't originally going to get this because Yelpers mentioned how the chips get stale but it was lunch time and chips were not stale YET.

http://www.yelp.com/user_local_photos?userid=CAveDmi9tYg3Gbs9VVnm2Q&select=45HkFVbtla0_wmsgmcoXdg
- $4.95 Pescado Taco (add $.95 for Nick's Way): THE BEST FISH TACO!!!! but SIX DOLLARS to have it done Nick's Way which is the only way to go.

- $3.50 Carne Asada Taco (add $.95 for Nick's Way): tastes like any other Carne Asada.

- $3.50 Pollo Taco (add $.95 for Nick's Way): Good but not memorable like the fish taco.

- $3.50 Carnitas Taco (add $.95 for Nick's Way): I think having anything done Nick's Way makes it all better.

All tacos should be done Nick's Way, they shouldn't make you pay more for it.

I would come back if I had another deal or during Taco Tuesday but fish tacos are regular price during Taco Tuesday at Nick's. It is too expensive to come on a regular day without a deal.

It was a little under $30 including tax for TACOS!!!! Crazy considering we split a drink & chips and eat person had 2 tacos. I must find a cheaper place for fish tacos like this OR just wait for another deal.
author: Kylie L.

description:
Went on Friday night with my boyfriend and felt completely RIPPED OFF...

1. Super RUDE cashier who added extra toppings on our tacos without telling us just so he could overcharge us

2.  $33 for 5 tacos...SERIOUSLY?! 

3. The tacos were decent but I would much rather spend $33 on an actual 3 course meal 

For an establishment that prides themselves on having the so-called "best" tacos in the city I am extremely disappointed. I also showed the yelp coupon to the cashier who completely ignored it because he was more concerned with overcharging me with toppings I did not ask for. 

Nicks Tacos get it together! I did not come here to be treated like crap and get overcharged for damn tacos! Clearly not going to ever come back here. I can get better tacos for a quarter of the price in mission all while receiving good service.
author: Jacqueline C.

description: Not really sure what everyone is on about this place being great. I came in for a quick lunch after seeing the great reviews and got the prawn tacos. Taco came out looking very full but with only 3 small prawns on it, halfway through it, i was still hopeful that there might be more hidden in all the cabbage they had stuffed....but to my disappointment there were none  It was more like a vegetarian taco with lots of cabbage & salsa. Meh!
author: Maria W.

description:
Being a California Native finding the best fish taco can be both a challenge and tasty quest. San Francisco, being renowned for its fresh seafood and matching cuisine, was obviously my first destination.
  After searching and reading reviews we decided Nicks Crispy Taco looked promising. The location was pretty decently located off the freeway so we thought why not! Wow what a gold mine. We both opted for the grilled pescado taco and one crispy fish taco "Nicks way", which means they deep fry the fish and top with this killer fresh quac. So bomb. The venue was pretty cool too.. taco joint by day and chic nightclub by night. Seems like a strange combo but somehow worked! Would most definitely return!
author: Ashley J.

description:
Me and the boys wanted to eat before seeing Need To Breathe at the Masonic.  Not only did we find convenient street parking nearby but we also found AWESOME tacos and DELICIOUS burritos.  

Yes, they give you a free order of Chips and Salsa when you check in with YELP! and it was a righteous order, not a cheapskate portion.  It was fresh and tasty.

I had the fish burrito and it was downright fantastic.  I used the green sauce on the table to spice it up and it was great.  

My son had the Fried Chicken taco, regular and he can't stop talking about it.  He also had the Carnitas taco Nick's way and loved it.  

Friendly staff, quick service and a really cool room that makes you want to hear the walls talk.  

Quintessential San Francisco taco experience.  Bravo!

This is a definite repeat and my new favorite cool little place in SF.
author: Mike W.

description: Came here for taco Tuesday 2 for $6 certain tacos dine in only and was pleasantly surprised.  Ordered the carne asana and the carnitas and both meats were simmered to perfection!  The salsa was fresh and service impeccable.  Would come here again if I was in the area.
author: Haley Z.

description:
I've ventured to Nick's a while back, but I still remember how yummy the food was! CASH ONLY. There is this dinky ATM outside of the store though.

Atmosphere: It's funny how fancy shmancy the place looks inside. From what I read, it turns into a night club during later hours. Chandeliers line the ceiling, and there are a good amount of seats.

Food: I ordered the carne asada taco and the fish taco. The carne asada was delicious, and I love that they put a ton of guacamole on it. Beware, it can get messy. The fish taco was also really tasty -it was nicely breaded and it didn't feel to heavy eating it even though it was fried (even though I'm sure there's a ton of fat in both those tacos). The crispy shells are probably the great thing about these tacos (ergo the name).  The fish one was in a soft tortilla, which is good though because I would've probably had a heart attack if it was in a crispy shell. Prices aren't too shabby either, unless you're ordering a bagillion things off the menu. I spent a little less than ten dollars on my tacos and a drink.

Service: Order at the front and it gets delivered to your table. Service is average.

If you're craving yummy crispy tacos, this is the place to go.
author: Tiffany O.

description:
Went to this place for Taco Tuesday with a couple of friends! My friend was not kidding when she said this place fills up quick. We got there about 30 minutes before the place was standing room only!

We ordered basically everything you can get Taco Tuesday special-wise. Carne Asada and Pollo tacos Nick's way, as well as the chips and guacamole and quesadillas with the works. A few pitchers of the margaritas didn't hurt at all either. 

I would definitely recommend getting there early around 5:30-6pm if you want to get there before the rush on Tuesday. Besides a tiny mixup with our order the place was great and the crowd was pretty friendly.
author: Isaiah W.

description: They have bomb tacos and amazing bloody Mary's here! Definitely the place to get a good meal and your drink on. Sunday's they have a special of bottomless mimosas! 16 dollars if you ordered food and 19 dollars if you didn't.
author: Isabella D.

description: It was just ok - fine. Burritos were the same as any other place, nothing special. Loud, big TVs. Friendly staff.
author: John S.

description:
I love Nick's tacos! My friend showed me this place after a hike one day and I'm glad she did! 

Parking here can be a pain in the ass but I don't expect much being in the city...

I was surprised to find that it's a taco stop/bar. Seems like a cool place to chill with some drinks but I only come here to eat =p

I came here a couple of times and was able to try the carne asada, pollo, carnitas and both fish tacos (all nick's way of course) and they were all really good! Tender flavorful and satisfying. I liked that the tortilla was crispy but not greasy, nice little twist... but what really made me love this place was their salsas! They make some of the best salsa in the bay area... I wish they sold it because I would totally buy them.

If you're in the city and looking for some non traditional but still very yummy tacos I would suggest you check this place out!
author: Melissa C.

description:
Horrible service and since we were forced out of our table mid meal food ducked too since it was cold by time we got home. 

Let me explain the situation, celebrating our daughters 21st birthday and wife and daughter we advised that table had reservation for 430 but since the party was late we could use the table and eat our meal. Well the tune changed when we were half way thru the meal and waitress comes to our table (blonde curly hair with bad attitude) and advises us at 500 that the party showed up and they want their table. We were not done eating and she actually asked if we would like our food to go, rather than let us finish. I have never felt so belittled in my life by a restaurant and the waitress new all the guys checking in by name so obviously they were friends. 

Worst part the guys were talking crap why we were taking so long to get out of their table, for fear of being arrested I did not throw my food at the jack asses. 

Happy 21st to my daughter, time to go celebrate at a friends pizzeria Tonys North Beach and get great service. 

If you are the owner of this crappy taco establishment sorry but you need to screen your employees better and maybe train them how to be friendly to patrons.
author: Mike S.

description: So a long time ago My mangaer brought me a taco from Nick's and i fell in love. So when i went for breakfast it was a great  time to see  for my self the hype. I love there sausgage breakfast burrito  big fulling and taste great. The location was hard to find at first but now i know how to get there. I would recommend there taco's and there  Burrito's.
author: Elizabeth G.

description:
I came in around 1pm on a Tuesday. Ordered a few things to try.

Grilled corn & black bean salad
 -Romain lettuce, tomatoes, red onion, guacamole, corn tortilla strips, salsa vinaigrette. (Option to add meat/seafood)

Vegetarian Taco
-included generous amount of guacamole

Grilled Fish Taco
-ever so slightly dry, but nothing a little squirt of lime or salsa didn't fix....and honestly I kinda preferred it that way rather than dripping down my arms like most fish tacos!

Atmosphere was really nice,  round booths in floor to ceiling red with black accents and tons of sparkly chandliers
author: Jessica R.

description: Do not order delivery from this place. They have all these photos of nachos to be delivered with their specialty sauce. I got mine and it was suppose to be melted jack cheese. But my cheese was hardly melted. And it was not no special sauce as they described and pictured. It looks like something my daughter made. Also it was suppose to be topped with the pico, guac, sour cream. Nope I got a little tomato and beans. My food is in the oven getting the cheese melted and I also had to add my own cheese. When I read special sauce and saw photos I was so excited and even asked for extra. But instead I got Not melted jack cheese. Where they didn't even cover my chips and I added more. Such a awful delivery.
author: A Nicole M.

description: I came here for Taco Tuesday and it was packed! There was a long line to order food, but it moved relatively fast (maybe because I don't tend to do lines while sipping on a margarita). If you want to sit down to eat you may want to make a table reservation. Important information : Tacos are bomb AND 2 for 5 $ on Tuesdays, Coronas are 2 for 7$, and you will be surrounded by chandeliers!
author: Victoria L.

description: No doubt the best taco Tuesday spot!! Great tunes!!! Yummy tacos!!! Good vibe! Party crowd , it gets real busy so have that in mind, really cool tho ! Don't miss out
author: Lindsey S.

description:
This place is pretty good, I like the hard tacos and the amount of meat they put in there. But I docked it down a star because while the quality is decent, it's not really worth it for the cash-only price of $6 or so per taco, especially in SF where you can get a perfectly good one for $1-2. 

There is a nice area to sit down and chill, and sometimes they have live music, so it's not too bad. Also, free chips and salsa with a yelp checkin:)
author: Nancy W.

description:
This was so far from where we were staying while in the city, but oh so worth it! The tacos were freaking amazing! The tortillas were just so right with a little bit of crunch and enough meat. I also appreciated how they were wrapped up making it easy to eat. 

My daughter devoured the burrito and still talks about how good it was. And we live in LA, so that's saying a lot. The corn was also so good. 

There was a line that goes very quickly and it seems like a great place to grab some happy hour drinks and enjoy the tacos. 

Nick's crispy tacos is definitely worth the stop.
author: Jessica R.

description: Their Taco Tuesday is one of the best I've had since moving to SF. The food is great and the drink specials are legit! It is kinda ridiculous that the food purchases are cash only but if you can get over that it's a pretty fun place! It gets picked early on Tuesdays!
author: Kevin M.

description: Great little taqueria spot.  The food was really good and pretty reasonably priced ($10 for a carnitas burrito with guacamole).
author: Eli S.

description:
With friends in town from the east coast, we decided to hit up a different neighborhood and head to Nick's Crispy on Polk.

Sadly, the food was just okay by our SF foodie standards. The best thing of the night was the mouth watering elote (corn on the cob) which was smothered in butter, chile (and maybe other spices) and lime juice. Our couple of tacos were eh, fairly average. We had both nick's way (think normal soft shell taco within a hard shell taco with loads of guacamole and extras piled on top). Despite all the extras, the tacos themselves were fairly bland flavorwise and we had to add heaps of the table sauces to each bite. Our pescado taco (breaded fish) was also way over fried and not very fresh tasting and the other meat tacos were fairly forgettable.

Overall a 2.5 star meal (if we use 2 stars=average)
author: Amy D.

description:
Don't go to Nick's for the cracked leather booths, cheap chandeliers, and poor lighting. Go for the delicious fat, crispy tacos and make sure you get them Nick's way.

The quesadilla is also ridiculously buttery, crispy, and cheesy, and perfect washed down with a pitcher on a Sunday afternoon. 

Nick's is a super casual place. You get in line, order your food, and grab a table. Pick up your tray when it's ready and dig in.
author: Jonelle T.

description:
Let's be honest, at some point in your experience/lifetime here in SF, you've had a run in with Nick's Taco Tuesday.  Sometimes it ends with you shamelessly eating tacos in the corner next to the swarm of gingham shirts that showed up from the Marina, other times it ends with you sitting in a booth next to a group of die-hard Giants fans that are just trying to watch the game in peace.  

I've not been to Taco Tuesday since moving out of the area, and I forget how fast the whole place fills up after 6:30.  The tacos themselves are delicious.  These tacos are definitely filling, and you certainly get your money's worth out of them.  I had two carne asada tacos, both done Nick's way, which means it gets loaded with cheese, guacamole, and sour cream - SO WORTH IT.  These tacos do require that you wait in a line that has potential to be 30 minutes long, and will also require you to run to an ATM for cash if you don't have any.  The crispy part of this is what gets me pumped, and the amount of meat you get is definitely generous. I'll be back to hang out here hopefully some time in the near future!
author: Lisa I.

description: I would have given Nick's 5 stars but the shitty service of the bartender make it a place I rather just order and take out then stay and drink !! Don't go on Sunday early evening !!
author: Cheryl H.

description:
Nick's is AMAZING! Great food? Check. Fast service? Check. Inexpensive? Check.

Whenever I have friends or family visiting me in SF, I always bring them to Nick's. No other place in the city makes tacos that can even come close to comparing. The chips and guac is incredible too! And after a late night, their breakfast burrito is great for a quick brunch.
author: Rachael B.

description: Yummy burritos good chill spot to drink and eat. Who doesn't want to get drunk and then eat tacos!
author: Tatiana M.

description: I took advantage of the $3 burrito during last weeks burrito wars and you definitely get what you pay for. I got the pollo asada. It came with black beans and pico de gallo. This burrito is boring. You're gonna want to add guacamole or sour cream just to add some flavor. I can honestly say that I won't be back, but I gave 3 stars because it wasn't the absolute worst burrito that I have ever eaten.
author: Emily L.

description:
Nick's answers the age old question "Por que no los dos?"

Now you can have both crunchy and soft taco shells in one. Thank you Nick's.

Taco Tuesday 5pm to 10pm
$2 Tacos (carne asada, pollo asado, pollo, carnitas, vegetarian)(excludes seafood)
$2 Cheese Quesadilla
$2 Chips / Salsa and Guacamole

Dine In Only
author: Augusto M.

description:
oh man, an improvement on the design. 
Subtle innovation in crispy/soft shell and great ingredients make for tacos I go out of my way for.
author: Mike K.

description: Pescado taco, Nick's way... Nothing else! It's delicious, consistent and filling. I've had the burritos here too and they're pretty underwhelming compared to the tacos. I was on a Nick's diet for the first couple of months I moved to the neighborhood so I've got plenty experience.
author: Nate R.

description:
Delicious. 

Having lived in SoCal, I've had my fair share of tacos from LA to the IE to SD. I've yet to come across great Mexican food in the Bay Area that compares to that from SoCal, but Nick's Crispy Tacos are pretty.damn.delish. 

My favorites are the Carne Asada and Grilled Fish Taco. $4 for a single taco may be stiff, but if you order it "Nick's Way", it comes fully loaded with jack cheese and large dollop of guacamole. 2 tacos and I'm already full. And yes, the tacos really are crispy!!

Tip: Regardless of which kind of taco you order, definitely order it Nick's Way. It won't disappoint.
author: Helen W.

description:
Foods good but it's massive - one taco and some chips and guacamole would have been plenty. No one greets you or directs you when you come in so you're on your own to find out where to order and sit. Cash only for tacos and the bar is seperate. We paid $24 for 4 tacos and chips and salsa. 

My hubby was a little bummed he got
Soft tacos - I explained you had to special request crunchy (which is odd considering the name is Nicks Crispy tacos) 

Atmosphere was cool
author: Rachel Z.

description:
Tacos here are great!  And quite inexpensive on Taco Tuesday (but watch out for huge crowds on that day). 

If you can find a table/place to stand and eat, this is a great spot to hang out with friends over some tacos and beer.  They sell Coronas by the bucket (along with a full bar).  It can take a bit to place an order when it's crowded (naturally) but other than that this is a great place to go if you're craving some tacos and beer.
author: Keith C.

description:
Nick's has been on my San Francisco hit list for some time now. Unfortunately, the experience didn't live up to the anticipation.

Tucked into a corner of Rouge, Nick's seemed to be more of a destination than the main attraction; maybe it was because it was relatively early on a Monday evening, but Nick's had a steady stream of people keeping the line at least four deep.

For dinner, I ordered the shrimp taco (regular), the veggie taco (crispy) and one of Nick's margaritas. I found it strange that Nick's way isn't the default way tacos are served; meaning most are soft, not crispy by default. The guy who rang me up was nice, but I wish he liked fish and could've steered me toward what I believe may have been better choices.

On paper my shrimp taco was a winner; to taste it was fine, but pretty unremarkable. The veggie taco was a waste of my time, bland and boring I've had much better veggie tacos. I'm also not sure I love my tacos Nick's way where a soft tortilla covers the crispy one holding all of the ingredients; the overall result is a sort of crispy taco. The highlight of my meal - and one thing that didn't feel oversold - was the margarita. I was glad I opted for it and bummed at the idea of braving the line for another.

This place is a solid 3 stars; maybe I'm spoiled by the tacos back home because while decent, it's not a destination in my book.

TIP: You can get drinks at Rouge and take advantage of their specials.

* Cash or Level Up only
author: Mary T.

description: I was here on vacation and decided to stop here based on Yelp reviews...Best fried chicken taco done the Nick's way/style! Delicious! Wish they would take credit cards though...I don't always carry cash with me!
author: Chantal F.

description:
Oh Nick's...how I love your corn and tacos. I was in SF for a business trip and one of my friends told me I HAD to try this place out. I'm so happy I did. 
The tacos tasted so fresh and were amazing, but what was best about the tacos is getting it Nick's way. They give you 2 shells a crispy shell and a soft taco shell with each taco. It's like the double decker from taco bell, BUT wayyyyyy better. The combination of the crunch with the fresh pico and perfectly cooked meat.....oh good lawwwwwd. 

So remember the movie Nacho Libre with Jack Black? Well remember how his little friend eats corn on the cob alllll the time? They have this corn here. The Elote is the greatest thing ever to happen. I loved eating this magnificent thing that had grated cheese and chili powder on it.

I wish I lived closer so I can eat here all the time.
author: Richard C.

description:
So, I'm conflicted. I really wanted to love the food, but it was honestly just okay.   I don't eat dairy, so I can't speak to  getting the tacos "Nicks Way", but in my opinion good tacos don't need cheese.  They were OK. Best taco's I've had in SF outside of the Mission? 100%.  Great tacos? Notttt really. 

I like that it's inside Rouge, so it's easy access when you're hungry mid-game & a  convenient spot to meet up and hang out with friends.  Happy hour is great & it turns into a huge scene on Tuesday nights, but that's more attributed to the bar than the tacos.
author: Raina D.

description: Great local place, we were visiting on vacation and found this place on Yelp. Just what we were looking for! Good for both adults and kids, everyone at the table thoroughly enjoyed what they ordered. We would come back!
author: Maryanne L.

description: The customer service sucks. My friend got her iD questioned but she was actually 22 years old(which is fine they have every reason to) BUT when he called the manager... She was so condescending and didn't even look at my friends ID. Terrible way of handling the situation. I am so disappointed in how the management handled this because I really do like Nick's. I am never coming back here again.
author: Karina G.

description:
After a long day of shopping, we went to this place to get some tacos and drinks. This is one of two places that I went to and it was really good because of the toppings that came with it. I loved the fresh guacamole and cheese in the taco and I personally liked the carne asada taco better than the pescado (the fish batter wasn't that flavorful). The place was super crowded and we just got a table before the dinner rush. 

It is like a sports bar, with a whole bunch of people coming after work for Happy Hour's and watching the games. The drinks are decently priced and the tacos are off the chain. Def. another visit worthy!
author: Julianne Z.

description:
So good! We're in town from DC and wanted a good taco place. This was it! Their fish taco - definitely one of the best I've ever had (and it's my go to item whenever we eat tacos). We also had the fried chicken taco - it was good but the hubs wldnt order it again  - just one of those things you try once and that's it.    

their green/red sauces - heavenly!!

It's located in a cool bar/club enviro. Wld come back the next time we're in town.
author: Kitty M.

description: Decent tacos. I felt like they were overrated. I tried the fried chicken and the grilled fish "mike's way." The chicken was pretty dry. Nothing super special. The inner taco shell was hard and the outer one was soft.. I was into that juxtaposition. The grilled fish was better and more flavorful. Getting it "Mike's Way" meant they added guacamole and cheese. Not bad but I wouldn't go out of my way to come back before trying others out there
author: Sarah B.

description:
Among the best areas to day drink the city. Start with a breakfast burrito and unlimited mimosas! You watch as they pour an entire bottle of champaign and also a dash of juice into a craft for every person...

Additionally ideal for catering or enormous groups. We get it delivered to the office once a month and have a make your own taco bar complete with guacamole (made from 50 avocados I'm sure), chicken, carnitas, beans, lettuce etc! Definite crowd pleaser if you're able to remember ;)
author: James C.

description:
This is a pretty cool spot. 

Let me start off by saying, when you come in don't expect to be seated. Seat yourself. And don't expect to be waited, you have to go order directly on the other side of the building. My friend and I sat there wondering what was going on for a good ten minutes. Once we ordered, the food came out pretty quick, probably about a ten minute wait.

Aside from that, I visited on a Friday afternoon and it was pretty cool. It wasn't too loud, it was a nice vibe. There's specials on food, you get 2 options for $5 like nachos and a quesadilla, or nachos and a taco. We had the nachos (pretty good, no meat but didn't need meat!) and tacos (really good carnitas). Drinks are really well priced. You can get a good margarita pitcher for $20 and it doesn't taste like juice with a splash of tequila. Or two beers for $7, or a beer & a shot for $7. They have a lot honestly.

I would come back. Very chill, very cool, good food, nice staff.
author: Victor G.

description: This place is great. Good food, good prices. The quesadillas and fish tacos are phenomenal. So are the margaritas. The burritos are nothing special though- I wouldn't recommend them. The next time I come back (yes, it's good enough to come back), I will definitely be getting the quesadillas. Overall, it was great!
author: Priscilla L.

description: Wasn't all that busy around 6:30 pm. Being new to sf and originally being from NYC I don't get too much Mexican. Refreshing, yummy, Saucy, cheap club like/bar like atmosphere. Tons of options. Went with the carne asada as recommended by other yelpers. Just what I was looking for soft shell on the outside crunchy on the inside. Add Guac/ sour cream/spicy sauce. You'll be back for more!
author: Jeanette K.

description:
I came for Taco Tuesday and I was not disappointed! $2 tacos that were enormous--2 tacos was more than enough to be full. I had the carnitas and the pollo asado, and both were delicious, though I definitely preferred the carnitas.

Although you have to stand in a line to order the food, the tacos arrived about 5 seconds after we found a place to sit. We sat outdoors, since the inside was pretty full even at 6:15. I noticed many people sitting in comfy, padded red booths that they had reserved in the main seating area. It looks like an ideal spot for a group if you have a reservation. I'd say the large booths could fit up to 8 people. I'm definitely adding this to my list of places to go for affordable, tasty Mexican food!
author: Rachel S.

description: Best Taco Tuesday in San Fran! Get there early or be prepared to wait for a while!!
author: Angela P.

description:
I've been wanting to try this place because the last time I visited on a Tuesday, it was way too cramped with people, so I decided to come back when they didnt have Taco Tuesday specials. Came back on a Wednesday and as I had hoped, it was pretty empty. We ordered our tacos at the back and went to the bar to order our drinks and wait for our food.

I ordered the carne asada taco and the fried fish taco both Nick's way. Nick's way added a crispy taco as well as guac and cheese. The fried fish taco was incredible with the lime mayo and had the perfect flavors and consistency. My friend ordered the fried chicken taco which I thought was an awesome concept and it was also very delicious. In general, the tacos were flavorful and more unique than your typical taqueria. However, they are also 3 times the price of a taco you'd get at a hole in the wall in the mission at about $5 for one taco. 

Margaritas were decent, not the best I've had. And the complimentary nachos that came if you check in on Yelp were just decent, kind of bland. Service was also just decent, which is why they got knocked down to 4 stars. This may be closer to a 3.5 stars though.
author: Isabella L.

description: $6 for ONE Taco (Nick's Way) seems a bit excessive, but the taco's tortilla is barely able to contain everything inside. Ultimately, the taco is good, but didn't really blow me away. My coworker said Nick's Crispy Tacos is a "must try" in SF. I told him he better check himself before he wrecks himself.
author: Mark C.

description:
Om nom nom nom!

Weird location (turns into a club at night?!) but sorta awesome if you think ab post partying food ;)
Cheap. Approx $10/2 tacos
2 tacos is enough
Carne asada? Solid. Pescado? Solid.
They have elote!!!

Authentic. Delicious. Wallet friendly. I'll be back.

Also, 1st time customers get free nachos. Sweet.
author: Sam W.

description: The service at the bar is terrible and unacceptable. If I was 80 years old it would be fine but I'm not and I can't wait over 45 minutes to get a drink. P.s. I'm not an alcoholic
author: Lataia M.

description:
3.5 stars.

Came here and got some tacos (duh, hehe) and a pitcher of margaritas.

Although I had a bite of several different tacos, most of them were underwhelming, and the crispy taco was not very good in my opinion.  However, there was a star amongst the sea of ordinary tacos (apologies for the mixing of metaphors :P): the pescado taco.  The fish was fried to perfection and was topped with a refreshing salsa, onions, and cabbage.

The margaritas were cheap (I think because of happy hour -- they have some great deals here!), but strong.

A random I'd also like to note was the decor -- the ordering of the tacos was juxtaposed with a lounge area with interesting velvety red couches and chandeliers everywhere.

Would I be back?  Perhaps if I were close by and I wanted some of their happy hour specials or a fish taco.  Otherwise, I will get my taco fix elsewhere.
author: Alice M.

description: Food is horrible, ordered a wet burrito, chicken pinto beans and cheese, that's it. Got chicken, black beans and horrible red sauce on top...where's my cheese and pinto beans. I think the best is when the bartender to our plates she never asked what was wrong, I left about 85% of the burrito, my partner did the same. Food is just gross, and the place was empty so NO excuse for crappy food. Never again.
author: Joy P.

description: The fish taco is the best option on the menu. Guacamole was very good as well. The atmosphere is not what you would expect, but very interesting.
author: Chris P.

description:
Burrito is 7.25
With tax, at 8.75% in SF that should be 63 cents in tax. 
Add that together and the total should be 7.88. 
So then why are you charging me 8.29? 

I asked the cashier this, telling him on the spot that the math didn't add up and I'm being overcharged. He showed me his screen, which showed the 7.25 and 8.29 total and shrugged, so I left.

Are you overcharging for everything?

As for the burrito it's quite amazing. I just wish it didn't have a gross night club feel inside.
author: Captain B.

description: Tacos are fabulous. Get them Nick's Way for a ton of guacamole and cheese. Band was playing jazz music which was fun. Wasn't too crowded at 8 pm.
author: Jordan L.

description: I absolutely LOVE this place!  My husband and I never go into the city without stopping here and getting some chips and salsa :)  Its a nice casual place and the tacos are always delicious.  Just make sure you have cash on you because they don't take cards.
author: Rachel S.

description:
Magical tacos. Nick's style.

I loved the fish tacos, as well as the carne asada tacos. Everything was cooked perfectly, came out hot and ready to be devoured, but not before being drenched in the most delicious red and green hot sauces north of East Los Angeles.

Thank you for having watermelon agua fresca with more watermelon in the agua than I have ever tasted.

My only concern was the elote, which everyone seems to be raving about, but I found that the overload of acid combined with cheese and chili powder produced an almost rotten, sulfuric taste. Maybe it is an acquired taste... :/ but I ended up wiping off all of the cheese off the corn. I've had elote from street carts in Mexico before, and I think the type of cheese and amount of lime juice here might be what put me off - BUT despite that, everything else knocked it out of the ballpark. 

I've found my favorite taco spot in SF.
author: Fiona Y.

description: This review is to highlight the exceptionally polite and friendly service I received at Nick's tonight. I just picked up a to go order - nothing special - but two members of the staff, one who greeted me and complemented my dog, the other who made sure by order was wrapped properly and that I got plenty of salsa, gave off a super positive vibe. The tacos were great as always, but the people there motivated this review.
author: Nick C.

description:
This review is for the food only. As I am writing this I am completely aware Nick's isn't popular for the food, but for the atmosphere/drinks/dancing portion. 

My friends from out of town picked this place for an early-ish Friday night dinner. I ordered the shrimp burrito. They got my order wrong at  first, but that was quickly fixed. I have no complaints about the service whatsoever, even though they were super busy. I actually tried to receive a free side after checking in, even though the offer was not for that day, the girl behind the counter gave it to me anyway. 

As for the food, if you want an actually good mexican meal, this shouldn't be your first choice. If you want pre or post drunk munchies, great. This city/state has much better mexican fare to offer. 

The music had us all bobbing our heads though!
author: Zahra K.

description:
Awesome fish tacos and great for happy hours!

Nick's is a chill place to hang out for dinner - there is lots of seating (but come early if you can because it is very popular!) and a huge bar area to watch games at. The tacos go for about $4-5 each, but just 2 will definitely fill you up. I want to come back and try all the different types! I've only had the fried fish and fried chicken. I would get the fish again but the chicken was a little dry. You can have your taco's "Nick's way" by paying an extra $1 for guac and cheese, but the tacos also taste good without it. 

Check in on your Yelp app for a hearty serving of free chips and salsa.
author: Jenny M.

description:
Went there for Taco Tuesday. Love me some tacos.... Fish were good but carne asada were average. If I come back it would only be for the pescado!


However LOVED the actual location and ambiance of the place.
author: Maureen M.

description: Nick's has a very cool atmosphere and vibe to go along with the food. Tacos are a good size, same with burritos. VERY good Agua Fresca, get the Tutti Fruitti! Definitely recommend!
author: Taylor F.

description:
a: I love this place

b: this place has worse health inspection grade than any other mexican place I checked.  And I am saying as I am about to go there, because, fish tacos and chandeliers.  

Nick, if you are a an actual person, can we please fix this?  I will eat there anyhow since I think it is important to expose my digestive system to adversity, but not everyone is that adventurous.
author: Lucy Z.

description:
Extremely disappointed. I also cannot justify spending $5 on a taco that was so blehh and gave me a tummy ache. Last time I checked, crispy meant fried to a crunch, not submerged in hot oil for an awkward stale bread chew. Came in a Tuesday afternoon, truly expecting what 2500+ people say is an average 4*s, and I'm kinda mad at you Yelpers ;) . Flavors were sort of all there, though not very fresh tasting. How long ago was that slaw made, or those shells "fried", or that guac mashed? 

I could see how awesome this place coulda/shoulda/woulda/mighta be if I was sipping on cervezas all night at a lounge and wanting some drunchies. But let's be honest, I never make good decisions when I'm drunk anyways. Methinks, I shall not return.
author: Rachelle F.

description:
These tacos are 'meh' at best. I'm just taco spoiled being from southern California. 
The meat was bland & the tortillas were rather stiff like they were keep outside in a breeze.
author: Jeff C.

description:
Came in on a Sunday afternoon. Not overly crowded but there were customers there. Typical sf street parking.

There's a bar, tvs and awesome booths. These tacos are unlike any I've had. I ordered the pollo taco and something else ( fish taco but I forgot the name ) Soo good! The food came quick and I loved the environment. Will definitely be back. Check it out!
author: Neek W.

description: Place is pretty good , not so much a family place , I paid 50 dollars and expected chips and salsa and had to pay extra for the chips and salsa , the actual food was fresh and delicious
author: Benny B.

description:
I'm a fan of Nick's Tacos!! For those who can remember this spot used to be the old Johnny Love's back in the day. Now it's is a Taco restaurant that turns into a club after 10p. After hours the club spot is called Rouge. The place has an old shabby sheik kind of feel. I think it's because the booths are lined with maroon velvet and they have old school chandeliers hanging. 

Back to the food: Yes cheap and ooohhh good! I always order the Camarones tacos and chips & salsa. They even have Happy hour every day from 5-9pm and on Sunday all day? I remember a glass of wine was $2.00, now where in SF can you get that? They pretty much have everything @ Nick's tacos. 

As for the nightlife @ Rouge, I guess it depends who is the promoter that holds the party. One time I went and I was not feeling the music or crowd. The alcoholic drinks become regular priced at $9.00. The location sucks, because parking is hard to find and it's not close to downtown.
author: Kathy V.

description:
Nightclub turned sports bar turned taqueria. You don't go to Nick's for the food, you go cuz it's the divey neighborhood spot of the russian hill scene.

Bleh for food, bleh for hipster pretentiousness from servers, bleh for being cash only, bleh for eating in a place that still reeks of nightclub nastiness.

Yay for big bar, ballin' table service booths with your burritos, and a delightfully hipster frat dive that I can happily roll into, snarf a burrito, and get my jiggy on too come Rouge time.

"Hey baby, wanna join our table? I got some nachos still"
author: Tim K.

description:
Nice busy atmosphere with an intersting decor, went there on a Wednesday night to get some food to go for family staying at nearby hotel.  

Burritos were mediocre family had Vegetarian ones that were bland but they did provide lots of salsa and had some intersting cabbage.  I had a carnitas burrito which was OK a step above the last chevron Aztec burrito I had.  

Cashier did not honor yelp offer of free chips and salsa.    Looks like it might be a better night club then Mexican restaurant. 

Prices are decent.  Might try some other dishes.
author: Garth E.

description:
Nick's is the go-to place on Tuesday nights. From 5 pm till late, they have a variety of good options for $2: cheese quesadillas, chips + guac & salsa, and tacos. The tacos are made with corn tortillas, and are packed full of veggies, beans, and meat (I'm vegetarian, but there are several different meat options that I don't remember). You can get your tacos Nick's way for $1 more, which means they come with guac and jack cheese, plus the tortilla is crispy. The veggie tacos generally come with guac and cheese anyway, but others tell me its a good value.

While baseball season was going on, the place was always PACKED on Tuesdays starting around 6 pm - you had to get there before, or you'd have to wait 30-40 minutes for food. But now its a lot more relaxed, it's still hard to find a seat after 6 but you can definitely get your food relatively quickly.

Besides Tuesday nights, this place isn't really worth the price - everything is about twice as expensive, and paying $4 for a veggie taco seems a bit unnecessary.

Also - Taco Tuesdays deals are only good for eating in.
author: Amaresh S.

description:
Grilled fish taco salad.  FIT GIRL THUMBS UP!  There are approximately 2 ounces of tilapia, 1/2 cup of beans, shredded lettuce and healthy fats in the form of avocado in the guacamole (about 3 oz, so you have to just judge based upon the amount of fat you want) .  It is actually a pretty decent meal for someone  cutting (but still needs an extra serving of tilapia and to measure and scoop out guac and beans) and bulking (needs more protein - so, you can add chicken& beef).

OBVIOUSLY, it is MUCH less expensive by prepping your own meal at home.  Yet, if you want to be social, you can find a balance.  It might be easier on "off-season".  Yay for female athletes!
author: Hiromi N.

description:
Oh, how I underestimated the size of these tacos. I ordered 3...and downed them all. Mostly because I felt a brief moment of "Well, children are starving in the world. I can't waste a carne asada, a fish taco, and a chicken taco..."

I felt on the verge of exploding after 3 tacos, Nick's Way (a flash of crispiness), but Good God, I loved every bite. The fish taco was by far my favorite: perfectly savory, with a kick of Que Sabroso! 

Love.
author: Ellie W.

description: Not one of the best places to get quesadillas or nachos. The quesadilla bread was burnt and hard, so where the nacho chips. The extra sour cream that we asked for came as coin-sized! The meat (and the shrimp on the nachos) tasted good, but the taste of burned bread just offsets everything. I guess i went there on a wrong day.
author: Fatema M.

description: Incredible quesadilla and tacos and food in general. Good service. Good ambiance. I want to go back to San Fran just for this place.
author: Samantha O.

description:
My girlfriends and I always try to get together once every few months... And this is the place we do it! 

While they go for the Taco Tuesday specials, I always get the tacos that are not on special. The grilled fish tacos Nick's way are my absolute favorite, especially after adding both of the table hot sauces. 

$10 pitchers of beer are also a plus.

Rouge itself has some incredibly slow service on the cocktail waitress end, but I wouldn't hold that against Nicks.
author: Stevi B.

description: Finally made our way to this place. And I CAN NOT believe those tacos are what people rave about. First, if your name has "crispy" in it, don't you think the tacos should actually be crispy? The only thing crispy in this joint are the people eating there... no one's complaining because they are too drunk or hung over to notice. In a land with so many amazing taco places, this is definitely the worst I've been to in SF. I'd rather have Chipotle and that's saying something. Stay away.
author: L. M.

description:
I came with a group of 11 and each of us ordered separately. My order came out completely wrong. I sent it back and waited for my order to be corrected while the rest of my party ate away.

I got a carne asada burrito and was so disappointed.. The meat was bland and skimpy. I had as much onions as I did meat! There's a water dispenser with cups on a table in the back. My group was drinking from it the entire time. I actually poured the last (half) cup of water left and noticed a fly in my cup after already drinking it.. If the fly was at the bottom of the HUGE water dispenser, who knows how long it'd been sitting in there? It completely killed my already ruined appetite.

My craving for authentic Mexican food was not satisfied.
author: Justine V.

description:
Taco Tuesdays are overrated. SERIOUSLY, you can come here every day of the week and leave feeling like a champ. 
 
As you can tell, I'm a bit indifferent on telling you when it's my favorite time to come here. Game days, late night, quick lunch, filling dinner -- it's really whatever your heart desires. Nicks will fulfill your every wish. 

Their interior decor (light chandeliers, red sofa booths) suggests that this place can be a lounge, but their tvs says otherwise. Game days are PACKED (can't blame 'em since they have practically every game on). If you're planning to watch a game here, simply come earlier! Otherwise, there's plenty of standing space and it's a really fun atmosphere to meet people. 

++ FOOOD
Don't even dare leaving without ordering their baja fish tacos! Pay the additional $1 to have it Nick's way (FAT PORTION OF GUAC + cheese). Strong believer that guac makes everything better. Their batter is light and crunchy; no need to worry about oil-drenched fish tacos. Although I always intend to enjoy every bite, I always somehow gulf these tacos down because they're just so damn good! 

This place is clutch for just about anything fun alongside good food and drinks.
author: Regina C.

description: My buddy took me here for an NFL sunday and tacos.  Fantastic tacos- fried fish and carnitas were both great.  Nick's Style is the way to go too.  The habanero sauce is super spicy also.
author: Shalin P.

description:
Love the fish tacos. yummy, big, and well priced. 
Although my sister believes the place reeks of vomit, college kids, and a frat house the morning after a big party, I don't think it's so bad without the large crowds on Tuesdays.
author: Siv L.

description: Fully satisfying. Fried or grilled fish tacos Nick's way are the highlights. Chips, salsa, guacamole a must order. Leave full and satisfied.
author: Alexander T.

description:
Super bland tasting tacos. Stumbled in here on a Friday night looking for some cheap grub. Noticed that they had a 2 for $5 deal on their tacos, which isn't too bad. Guy at the counter quickly asks if I wanted cheese and guac, things that are usually standard on a taco, but charges an extra $1.25/taco.

And all this for a crispy mess of the most plain taco I've ever had. Maybe this is what the locals like (I'm from toronto), but cmon, add a lil salsa to the bloody thing. 

Tl;dr: not a bad deal is super hungry and drunk; don't bother if you want something that, well, tastes like something.
author: Adil K.

description:
I'm a taco person. In college, Taco Tuesday was like religion for me. As time goes by and we all got busy with work, Taco Tuesday became nothing but a nostalgic memory. So recently, me and my friends decided "why not bring back Taco Tuesday," and do it all the way. We talked with our co-workers and foodies, and this establishment kept arising. And so, we went...

WOW! We were blown away. Full of flavor and truly satisfying. None of the greasy junk food you get at other, shall we say, highly suspicious "authentic" Mexican joints. The texture and  quality of ingredients and spices has all but destroyed my memory of the tacos we'd get in college. I find myself craving these badly throughout the week, especially after a night of drinking. Only reason I'm not giving 5-stars is because the mixed drinks didn't suit my taste.
author: Mackenzie C.

description:
I honestly don't know how this place has 4 stars. 
First....I couldn't even tell this was the place. You walk in and it's a bar. The ordering station is way in the back.
Second......the fish tacos while being ok, are NOT amazing! 
Third......drunk girls screaming in your ear, which of course makes you move to the other side of the bar. 
However, the staff was friendly, and if you just wanna hang in a fairly nice bar, then this is the place. But I won't be back
author: Kelley H.

description: I went here today for lunch with my kids and a couple friends. Eating there was great, service was awesome. What disappointed me was when I open my togo order when I got home. All I see is beans! I ordered Nick's way and didn't receive any guacamole maybe meat enough for one taco but not two 1/4 meat and 3/4 BEAN. It's a shame that I drove all the way from Pinole to eat at this place and ordered togo so my husband can try this place and all I received was a big fat disappointment and the hubs did not approve so I guess we won't be going here for lunch whenever we bring my girls to the city. 5 stars for great service at the restaurants but since my togo order was such a disaster I have to bring it down to a two stars
author: Koy C S.

description:
My friends and I came here for brunch on a Sunday. We definitely enjoyed the bottomless mimosas (and a pitcher of margarita); both drinks really strong, so they're worth the price. 

I ordered the carne asada (regular soft tacos) and pescado (nick's way). I enjoyed the pescado way more than the asada. The fish was breaded perfectly and the tortilla crisped perfectly with cheese. I'd definitely return just for the fish tacos, nick's way!
author: Faye F.

description:
I'd heard a lot about this place from friends and on Yelp and it's been bookmarked on my profile for many months now.  I was SO excited to finally have a chance to come here last week.

My girlfriend and I made the mistake of coming here during a Saints/Eagles playoffs game so it was completely packed and nobody was moving.  Our food came out mere minutes after we ordered so holding our food and looking for seats, we were worried that we wouldn't be able to sit down and eat.  Luckily we were able to spot one group that just left and snagged their table

Ambiance:
The décor is a little confusing in here.  The walls are painted a rust color, which reminds me something an authentic Mexican restaurant would have. On the flip side, they also have glass chandeliers, red curtains, colorful table cloths and red vinyl stools/booths.  If I were to describe it, the word would be "eccentric".

Food:
THE BEST FISH TACOS I'VE EVER HAD!  We weren't that hungry so we ordered a Pescado taco (fried fish) and a Grilled fish taco to share.  The green sauce, I think it's salsa verde, which sits on the table is a delicious addition to the taco.  Although the fish was fried, it was very crispy yet tender.  The meat melted with every bite.  I also enjoyed the grilled fish but not as much as the Pescado.

I hear the carne asada is good here so I'm definitely going to try that next time.  Additionally for brunch they have bottomless mimosas, that's also on my list!
author: Michelle W.

description: Not bad at all.  I came here in the morning.  I expected the portion to be a bit bigger but I was satisfied.  The free salsa check in was a plus too!
author: Leo Y.

description:
Glad I finally got to check this place out, but was displeased by the bouncers at the door. They rejected my friend's real New York ID claiming that it was a fake and despite our efforts, did not agree to stamp him. 

Once we were inside, I was more impressed by the flashy, cool rouge interior + ambiance rather than the actual tacos. (Note: We didn't actually come here for the famed Taco Tuesday, but as part of a Halloween Barcrawl). Unfortunately, my crispy taco was oddly soggy and there was very little and disproportionately spread chicken. For the price and the hype, I really wasn't satisfied :(  

I did however like the mixed drinks (tried the Spicy Horchata) and look forward to trying the other unique drinks on their menu.

I'll probably come back again for the funky environment and to give the tacos another try. Hope the food (and the bouncers!) do not disappoint next time!
author: Arushi S.

description: Alright, I've had my fair share of taco Tuesday's now. Tacolicous, underdog, blue light, etc. this is the winner, FOR SURE. They smother the hell out of your taco with guac. 2 for $5?? Yes!! Reserve a table, my friends luckily did, shout out to those who take care of business. $20pitcher of margaritas. This place is solid. It seriously gets crowded. I know this place is a club at night, which I've been to, but I seriously doubt it gets as packed for tacos than it does for booty.
author: Elton F.

description:
Delicious tacos! There are a ridiculous amount reviews already saying what I absolutely loved about this place: Ambiance, big red booths, delicious tacos, delicious NICK'S STYLE tacos, creamy flavorful guacamole, yummy and strong margaritas, and a good time. So I'll just leave a few tips!

Tips:
+Get here early on Taco Tuesday! The line gets unbearably long and the later it got, the meaner our bouncer was to the rest of our party arriving at different times. 
+GET NICK'S STYLE! Guac & cheese mmmm. If you're vegetarian however, Nick's style is free ;) 
+If you bring a big group, be prepared to stand because the booths get taken very very quickly! 

I want to come back on another night just to enjoy the establishment and more than just 1 taco/margarita. Can't wait to be here again!
author: Anu P.

description:
This was the perfect meal after our 12 mile hike/walk around the city. Don't be turned off by the night club interior, these tacos are the real deal.

I went for the grilled fish tacos "Nick's Way." That means they add a crispy taco and tons of guac on top, a must do!

I come here every time I'm in San Francisco and it never disappoints.
author: Bridget M.

description: You must order your food in the back side of the restaurant, take a number, sit anywhere in the bar, and they bring the food to you. Drinks, however, can be ordered anywhere. The chips and guac were good, yummy thick tortilla chips. We ordered beef nachos, quesadillas, and an assortment of tacos. Everything was pretty good, my favorites were the crispy chicken nachos and the shrimp nachos, yum!
author: Kristine N.

description: the Fish Taco, Nick's style** (make sure you get it nick's style!)  is the way to go! Love the generous guac they slab on top. I also had the shrimp which was good. First time having a "crispy" taco, which is unique. My friend & I also had an elote to share, which is mexican style corn. This didn't wow me. I wish they used a tapatio or hot sauce of some sort, and wish their corn was grilled rather than just boiled to give off more of a smokey flavor. I would just stick to their tacos.
author: Elise T.

description: We visited here on our last night in town and it was a great find. I had 2 of the Ensenada style fish tacos that were as close as you get to the Baja taste anywhere. My wife had the nachos and she loved them. We came here a bit later in the evening and really enjoyed the lounge feel to the dinner.
author: Manny F.

description:
Pros:
1. Always a busy scene with lots of liquored-up conversationalists.
2. Prime location.
3. Deceiving lure of "cheap" tacos in preparation for the drunchies.
4. GREAT MUSIC -- I live nearby, so it helps to drown out the drunk patrons.

Cons:
1. There are a million better places for actually good-tasting tacos in SF.
2. Everything is obnoxiously overpriced.
3. I almost always have a problem with my order -- how can you eff up a taco? hahaha
4. The margarita pitcher is laughably awful. Better tequila (and more of it) would be a step in the right direction -- but that's not this place's goal at all.

Pro/Con:
1. This is a 100% straight bar.
author: Cameron G.

description:
Chips and Guacamole amazing!

I had fish burrito. It was good.  We had to sit outside since there was Sunday night football and no seating inside.  The street was not the most pleasant place to enjoy our food, but it was still good.
author: Caitlin S.

description: Good tacos however it's open seating so you're not necessarily guaranteed a seat. My friends and I ended up eating our food while we all huddled in a corner. Also, cash only!
author: Ektaa P.

description:
Mexican food is inexpensive and delicious. 
Can get margaritas by the glass or pitcher. 
Super fun atmosphere. 
Great for groups. 
Gets a little crowded at night.
author: Dana D.

description: It's simply not good. Sorry. If you are drunk off your a** and don't care what to eat, maybe it will taste good to you, but overall, the quality at Nick's Tacos is subpar. You should really look elsewhere for a good meal.
author: Anton G.

description:
I hate to do this to ya Nick, especially so soon after my love for you just blossomed, but.. your tacos were a little leathery the last visit. It was odd. 

Also, my margarita was hella sour and not pleasing at all.
We ended up next door at the Buccaneer just to finish enjoying cocktails because the ones here were hella weak.

I must have just been super hungry the first time we came here, or maybe there were bad cooks in the kitchen last weekend. But, I tell ya, I won't be rushing back here any time soon. I really was bummed out and felt like someone punched me in the taco.
author: T C.

description: Omgg. Ok. This was my first experience and all I have to say is WOW. I ordered one Pescado taco and one Grilled Fish Taco. My hunt for the perfect fish taco is complete! Flavors were great! I asked for the salsa on the side and was glad I did! I had to walk back to work so it would've left my tacos soggy lol and I must say for being Mexican I'm not a salsa girl BUT this red salsa was YUMMM! Can't wait to try these Nick's Way next!^_^  The interior was immaculate! Tho I didn't get to sit and eat it looked very clean! The decor was FABULOUS! Red and chandeliers?? Yess please! Tacos in a FABULOUS setting? CHECK!:)
author: Stephanie C.

description:
Yes, I'll concede the tacos are HUGE, but they better be for nearly $4/taco plus an extra $1/taco if you want it prepared Nicky's Crispy style (made "crispy" with jack cheese and guac).

After getting over the sticker shock of the size and price for the tacos, I had to get over the fact that there were beans in the tacos.  I don't like beans, and I've ever had tacos with beans inside . . . Then, to top it all off, there was nothing crispy about the taco.  Apparently, they deep fry one of the two tortillas to make it crispy, but I didn't notice any crispy.  I think it's a bit of a misnomer to call the tacos crispy, but for there to be no noticeable crispy element . . .

We got there a bit early, so the $3 happy hour margaritas provided by Rouge kinda sorta made up for my taco disappointment.
author: Christina L.

description: Had the fish tacos coming from a Latino family they were okay service was nice. the place was big and a little dark and cold ambiance my tortillas were a little chewy I have a bad jaw though so that was a little painful for me. Overall pretty good! Came back and ordered something fridge rent they've redeemed themselves! Very delicious and fast service!
author: Lidoshka G.

description:
This place is actually a combination of Nick's Cripsy Tacos and Rouge (which I guess is the night club section?). It's one big room with high ceilings, chandeliers, big screen TVs, a peninsula-like bar (there's seating on 3-sides of the bar), and very very red walls. There's a separate cash register and waitresses for Nick's Tacos and for Rouge. You can only buy food from Nick's Tacos and you can only buy drinks from Rouge. And it's CASH ONLY.

The food was really good and really filling! I was expecting a small quesadilla and small tacos, but the quesadilla was huge and the tacos were stuffed! And since Taco Tuesday (and happy hour) lasts from 5-10pm, I didn't feel rushed to get to the place before Taco Tuesday was over! And with $2 chips and salsa, tacos (+0.95$ for Nick's way; Totally worth it!), or cheese quesadilla, how can it get any better?

It was pretty crowded during taco Tuesday night and you run the risk of having to eat while standing up (tables are reservation only, which I recommend doing), but over all, it was a fun and lively crowd.

Note: The line for food can get pretty long, so get there early, if you can!
author: Nirel R.

description:
The things people will do for a $2 taco....

If I offered you $4 to wait in line for an hour and then eat dinner standing up with no table, would you do it?  Probably not.  For $2? Definitely not. 

Nick's is delicious don't get me wrong, but that's what you do here if you come for the infamous "Taco Tuesday".  If I get them "nicks way" (which you absolutely should) I can never eat more than one - so it's a cheap dinner on any night.  Tuesdays are a really good time, especially if you're looking for a fun scene, but it does get a bit crowded for my little self.  Either way, these are my favorite tacos in the city hands down, so the hype is merited :)

Need a new way to save the $2?  Walk here versus the bus or an Uber and you can now afford tacos any night of the week!
author: Lindsey G.

description: AMAZING TACOS. Very unique experience. I'm born and raised in Las Vegas and this place is so fun! A MUST SEE, EAT
author: Douglas B.

description: This place is authentic Californian Mexican food. Always hits the Mexican spot!! Can go wrong and it is a fun sports bar too!
author: Ann K.

description:
SUH GOOD. like REALLY REALLY REALLY good mexican food. I can imagine being super hungry and then coming here and being very satisfied.

Tacos: their carne asada and Pescado taco do not disappoint. Please please please get it "Nick's way" because there's no other way to get it. Their tacos are huge and filled with guac, meat, beans, cheese. Comes with 2 tortilla, one more soft and one more crispy. The pescado is a fried fish filet in a taco, and it was the best fish taco i've ever eaten. So crispy and warm. Absolutely perfect

Quesadilla: best quesadilla hands down. Crispy tortilla and filled with cheese and meat and guac. It was amazing!

Check in on Yelp and get free chips and salsa!
author: Carmen C.

description:
I'm a fan, especially on Taco Tuesdays! Delicious crispy tacos. Love that you can make reservations because it gets incredibly busy. 

...IF you can handle the stench of alcohol seeping into every inch of this place and that it reminds you of every bad decision you made as a 23 year old.
author: Mel L.

description: Russian hill prices, but big, loaded tacos. Nicks way means with all the fixings,  and a crispy outside, which is overall very tasty. One taco would probably have been fine, like a big snack; two was a pretty filling meal for me. The setting is funny, all red and club-like, and feels a little silly during the day.
author: Mira S.

description:
Good: Tacos (Nick's way), environment, staff
Bad: Crowded, cash only/level up

I like this place. The tacos are delicious (definitely get them Nick's way), the staff is reasonably friendly/attentive, and the environment is pretty fun. It can get really crowded, though (especially on Tuesday nights), making it difficult to find a table to eat/hang out.
author: Brandon C.

description:
Went there on Tuesday. They had taco Tuesday specials, which was awesome! The tacos we ordered were pretty good. I didn't like cheese quesadilla as much, it was too oily for me;( 
The only thing I didn't like is the fact that they are cash only... I feel like now it's the time when business must accept cards, cash only is not cool anymore.
author: Aya J.

description:
Have not been here on Taco tuesday so when I came here there was no lines and plenty of spaces to sit. 

My friend and I stopped off here for tacos and to watch a bit of the march madness. They have 4 or 5 big screen tvs and a full bar so its perfect to chill out and watch some sportsball.

Back to the tacos, love their tacos and have to have it nicks way! Any of the options are delish especially the fish tacos! Don't forget to order the spicy corn with cheese. Its messy but oh so delicious!

Oh and grab drinks at Rouge's bar - supppper cheap drinks! $3.50 sangria? Yeahhh I'll be coming back here more often :)
author: Christine W.

description: 2 stars because service was horrible on a Sunday, surprisingly a very slow day, but we had stopped by this place to grab some beers and watch some Sunday football.  Hostess had a b*tchy-resting face, like come on now. I wouldn't allow any attitude like that in my restaurant, but anyways.  Tacos are good as usual.  Ordered IPA's which tasted watered down.  Didn't want to bother finishing the pitcher. Would gave a 3 star, but I just wasn't feeling the service.
author: Joane B.

description: Grilled fish tacos were delish! (nick crispy style) I only needed 2 because they were so huge but totally worth it and pretty inexpensive. It is also a good place to watch sports if you are interested in that and it is also good for larger groups. I would definitely come back here.
author: Samantha J.

description:
Ahhh how memories of undergrad came flashing back during my clubbing days at Rouge. It's literally inside Rouge, I even got to sit at one of the velvet tables more known for bottle service when it turns into a club at night time.

I wasn't sure how big are the tacos, so I decided to order 3 of them. Once I got my order, I immediately regret getting that many tacos because they were prepared very generously. I got fish taco and 2 of the shrimps - all made Nick's Way. The tacos tasted amazing! I was glad I got it made Nick's way because that guacamole on top of each taco just seem to hit the right spot. I definitely recommend the fish and shrimp tacos, you won't regret it!

The only downside about this place - cash only. Fortunately, I had cash, otherwise it would have been an unfruitful food trip.
author: Patrick B.

description:
Loved the fried chicken taco - crispy. Super messy so I used quite a few napkins. But I would head back for a return trip. Just to try some of the others. We tried the carnitas quesadilla too. While it was good, I preferred the tacos. 

Margaritas from the bar next door washed them down!
author: Nora B.

description:
This review isn't inspired by any specific event that occurred here. Instead, it's been slowly building over the course of several years. You see, I pass this spot every day for one reason or another. It says Mexican food. It serves "Mexican" fast food (tacos, burritos, elote, etc.), but there's nothing about it that implies any Mexican influence. In fact, for whatever reasons, I hear the words "SO WHITE" screaming in my head every time I pass. It's an unfair basis for a review, but it somehow has gotten under my skin over the years.

Maybe it's the polar word-of-mouth reviews I hear almost every time I walk by. Love it or hate it, it just feels improper to me. It's a nightclub that serves Mexican food. Sounds like a great idea, and kudos to them for that. I've stopped a couple of times and left unimpressed, nothing good or bad enough to warrant the comments I hear from someone EVERY SINGLE TIME I walk past. In fact, as I type this, I hear a group of four (stereotypically white) people walking past. One of them suggested Nick's, and another said, "You want to go here for a taco? What are you doing?!" And you know what? They just went inside anyway.

I think that's it. I have nothing against the place. I just don't understand the people that hate it and go in anyway. It's like a Bermuda Triangle of opinion on Polk Street. It defies all logic and still thrives. Go there if you hate it.

Oh, they have huge screens for sports. Go team.
author: Nick W.

description:
What a trip this place is. Imagine a wannabe-fancy steakhouse with big gaudy chandeliers, bright red wallpaper, and pleather booths. Then imagine that place serving tacos in plastic baskets to long lines of rowdy late-night grubbers, taking a number and chilling with a stiff margarita. 

Trippy, right? Yeah, endearingly so. 

After hanging at a trunk show with my fabulous designer pal, we decided to check out Nick's for a quick bite and some serious girl talk. This was the perfect spot. The line was pretty crazy at 8pm, but in about 20 minutes we made it to the front and were thoroughly charmed by our Latino order-taker. We went with some fish, chicken, and prawn tacos "Nick's style" (w/ avocado and an awkward slice of jack cheese. Sliced, not shredded. Weird.) Tacos range from about $3-5, which is totally worth the setting you get to consume them in.

Mr. Charmer talked us into getting the "real" margaritas from him, vs. the weaker ones they serve at the bar in the main dining room (apparently they are separate businesses? There are lots of confusing quirks about this place). Oooooh, he did us well. The margaritas came up fast: simple and strong, with a salty rim. The tacos, of course, would require more waiting...

We took our number and plopped into one of the plastic-y red booths admiring the abandoned steakhouse atmosphere, and the lively cantina energy that now defined the place. The tacos arrived and between two of us, 3 was plenty. There are squeeze tubes of sauces, but we didn't mess with those. Nick's style was fancy enough for us. 

So yeah...if you like tacos and margaritas and the color red, you really gotta see this place! Viva la Nick's (or something gringa-esque like that).
author: Nique F.

description: Outstanding tacos. Always a line, but moves fast.  Cash only.  Know what you want before you approach counter, otherwise you may see frowns.  Seating is a huge challenge here, and you will be sitting in a crusty bar, that is challenged to keep up with the traffic.  Would be super awesome to add servers to clean tables more quickly.
author: Molly C.

description: I got the veg burrito and it was good. They put cabbage in it, which I thought was strange at first but realized it was good. I liked the salsas too. Only strange part was that it looks like a former strip club from the outside and inside too.
author: Teja K.

description:
They don't take credit or debit cards! Huge downside for people traveling from over cities.

Aside of that, they have really good and big burritos.
2 chicken burritos & 2 large drinks, paid $27.00 not a big fan of the price.
author: Cynthia G.

description:
Great Tacos, especially the fried fish and steak! 
Wouldn't recommend delivery though; by the time it gets to you it's usually cold and no longer looks fresh and appetizing.
author: Monica R B.

description: I never thought I could have tacos that were mind blowing, but sure enough, Nick's Tacos proved me wrong. Soo good!! And the prices had me ordering like I was at a buffet. Definitely my new spot. Also, get it Nick's way. You won't regret it!
author: Farisha J.

description:
Amazing grilled fish tacos. You must get them Nick's way- they are oozing with Guacamole and deliciousness. The lines are long and it's standing room only some nights but it's well worth it.

I've been here ten plus times and have never ordered anything else from the menu. Eat, enjoy, and don't wear a white shirt.
author: Igor K.

description:
Taco Tuesdays with red velvet looking walls and giant chandeliers hanging from the ceiling? Sign me up for that!

Yup, they have $2 tacos on Tuesdays here, and it is so  popular that you pretty much need a table reservation in order to have somewhere to sit, unless you get here early enough to grab a spot at the bar. They are 2 hour reservations, so if you are smart, have one person reserve one table for 2 hours and then a second person reserve another table, and you have one one full taco tuesday fiesta. But be sure to order your tacos earlier rather than later, because there is a separate taco order line that gets really long really really quickly. And if you get your tacos nicks style one tortilla is crispy fried inside the other and it is topped with a mountain of guacamole. Mmmm that taco full of that chicken and the other one I got full of their asada was super tasty.  Brought taco tuesday to a whole new level. 

But watch out--if you stay too long here, I was told this place turns into one mean 18 and over club!
author: Sarah G.

description: Their tacos are sooo worth it during Taco Tuesdays! Otherwise pricey. Bartenders make good drinks too! Crunchy chicken taco is the bomb! Don't forget to ask for extra sauce.
author: Miguel Y.

description:
Perfect for happy hour and taco Tuesday. 

Got the carnitas nicks way.. Wasn't overwhelmed with happiness but tasty nonetheless. The pescado taco (nicks ways) was sooo good. Definitely recommend!!! 
Also had the pitcher. Get there early to grab a table or reserve your table ahead of time! Remember CASH ONLY. Overall, normal sf trendy eatery
author: Mimi D.

description:
Truly the best fish tacos I've had! I had 'em 'Nick's way'.

Parking is an issue...you want to be prepared OR walk :) For you local peeps, you know the deal with parking in SF...for visitors-use the public transport :)

This is a happy place with lots of happy, alcohol influenced individuals...so you may or may not end up with taco sauce on your clothing. But since it's not a fancy pants attire, it's all good. 
Groups: great choice, the flashy red boots are cool & cozy.

Enjoy! (Definitely give it a try!)

PS: There is Sunday brunch :)
author: Matea F.

description:
I came here because it is one of the most reviewed restaurants in San Francisco.

I have to say, with all honesty, that this joint serves the best taco I have ever tasted. My eating partner was from Mexico and she said that it was very authentic tasting and loved what she got.

We ordered:
1) Elote - Corn with Parmesan cheese and chili powder: Too hot for me, but it's worth trying for sure
2) Carne Asada Taco Nick's Way: MUST-HAVE, damn
3) Fried Fish Taco Nick's Way: ALSO MUST-HAVE, w00t

You MUST get your taco "Nick's Way," it is too good to miss out on.
It basically means that you get guacamole and jack cheese on it.

The environment was great: dim lighting, random chandeliers, full bar. It's an ideal place for a celebration of something.

I'm coming back for sure, maybe next week. I want to try the quesadillas. Lastly, I like the location since it's not in an area that's too busy.
author: Marlon T.

description:
The tacos are good but the service was terrible. We got there 10 minutes before our reservation, and even though we could see the table open, the hostess told us to "come back at 6:14". When we came back, she proceeded to seat us in the open table we had been standing next to for 10 minutes.

The waiter took 15 mins to come to our table, told us that it was our fault, and then messed up someone's order.

The manager tried to give us $5 off, and then the waiter came back and told us that he had charged us correctly, not understanding that the manager gave us $5 off because he had messed up.

Its a funky setup with credit card payments for Rouge and a separate waitress, and cash only with a different wait team for the tacos.

Its also super loud and you can barely hear someone standing right next to you.
author: Jake L.

description:
I woke up with a Google Offer to Nick's Crispy Tacos - $10 for $20 worth of food. I couldn't pass up the deal, especially with the great reviews. However, I'm going against the majority by saying I don't see the big deal.
