1) Parking is a bitch. I headed over to Nick's from the Mission District and parking took about 15-20 minutes to find. I'm a patient person, but it was getting frustrating not being able to find a spot in the area.

2) Douchebag central. Granted, it was 5p.m. on a Sunday and it was a madhouse. I hate when I forget there's a football game. I would avoided the bar/lounge/taco house had I known a game was going on.

I was a little confused on the ordering process as there's no sign or hostess to point you in a direction. A bar area with a counter and a menu on the wall is located immediately to the right.  The menu includes a few starters, such as nachos, chips and salsa, jalapeno poppers, etc.  As for the main entrees, you have a variety of tacos, both regular or Nick's Way, burritos, quesadillas, and a kid's menu.

I ordered two carne asada tacos, one regular and one Nick's Way, which is served crispy with Jack cheese and lots of guacamole. Additionally, I ordered a pollo taco and my +1 ordered the chicken nachos.  The total came to $26 with all said items and two soft drinks.  The voucher redemption was simple and painless.  We received our order number and sat ourselves.  Fortunately, the game was over and we found a booth.

The food came out and my tacos looked great, but the nachos looked less than appetizing in my opinion. The chicken taco was okay, far from special and pretty bland all around.  Tacos are served with two tortillas, which is a bit of overkill as they are pretty thick.  Up next was the carne asada taco, Nick's Way, which was a little better due to the guac.  The melted Jack was a bit much for me and there's was nothing "crispy" about it. I stomached the third taco out of sheer hunger, but was pretty disappointed. The nachos were okay, but far from memorable and felt like movie theater nachos.

Overall, I was pretty disappointed. Did I order the right item? Am I bias because I'm Mexican? Am I spoiled by home cooked Mexican and real SF/East Bay taquerias? Nick's was okay, but if I can't find a parking spot next time, I'll keep on driving.

Ambiance: 3 Stars (out of 5)
Food: 3 Stars (out of 5)
Service: 3 Stars (out of 5)
Price: $ (out of 4)
Overall: 3 Stars (out of 5)
author: Alexander E.

description:
I came here on a Monday afternoon and had a burrito. This burrito was pretty good, but not the best burrito I've ever had. 

I was disappointed to see so many white people here. My theory is: if white people are at a taco joint and own the taco place, the tacos ain't gonna be good. But then again, the only Mexicans I saw in SF were construction workers.

Overall, the ambience was nice and the lady with glasses working the cash register seemed rude at first, but then she gave me a free refill! That made my day! :)
author: Sophia P.

description: Calling all cabbage lovers! I found myself really enjoying the Pescado burrito con todo. The Baja style fish was light and crispy. The burrito was heavy on the cabbage, but there was plenty of fish and the cabbage brought a nice extra crunch. Add the salsa for a nice burst of flavor. The music gets fun late at night.
author: Mal C.

description:
Cheap tacos and cheap pitchers for Taco Tuesday. Friends and I drank a couple pitchers before lucking out and snagging a table; perfect timing since we had just ordered our food.

I got pollo and carne asada, Nick's way. Is it bad that I couldn't taste any major differences between the two? The guac was the star of the show in either case, but sadly, neither of my tacos were "crispy." It seemed like they just deep fried old, stale tacos, ha.

I'd come here again if my friends wanted to. Cash only (they have an ATM inside if you forget).
author: Michele P.

description:
Wooohooo!!!!!!! Unlike the tiny tacos which are ubiquitous in California, Nick's Crispy Tacos can be a full meal by themselves.  I got the fish tacos and the fish filets are thick enough so that you can REALLY enjoy how crunchy the outside is while still having a very juicy interior.  The warm flour tortilla on the outside serves as protection when you crunch into it and the inside crunchy shell breaks apart. And OOHHH YESSSS when you get it Nick's way they load it so full of guac it's oozing everywhere whenever you take a bite.  I'm salivating right now and kicking myself for living so far away from this place.  

The ambiance at this place is hilarious. It looks like what may have been an old dance/strip club that is converted to a taco restaurant. When you walk in, there is very clearly a place to collect 'cover charge' and all nice private eating booths along the wall are obviously 'VIP areas'.  There is an old 'DJ booth' next to where you get the water and I'm sure the ordering counter where you get your tacos used to be a bar.  I like to fantasize that each chandelier is covering the spot of an old stripper pole and that's why there are so many.

Apparently on weekend nights this place has Nick's Saturdays or something. If this place turns into a legit club you can bet your ass I'm gonna be there in a maternity cocktail dress.  Hey, don't judge, after you see this place you'd want to get your eat and your crunk on too.
author: Daisy Z.

description:
I love Nick's Taco, especially the taco salad. It's so convenient especially if you want to get a drink at the bar and watch a game during the weekend or weekdays.

The soup is good too.
author: Ronak P.

description:
I'll have to concur with a previous reviewer... it was mediocre.

Add the mediocrity to the long wait on a Tuesday night and you get a recipe for a 1 star experience.

If you were to go on a regular night, it wouldn't be worth paying full price, so I'm guessing that would also be a 1-2 star experience.

We got a chicken taco, a beef taco, a pescado taco, a quesadilla, and chips & salsa. Nothing memorable in the bunch.

Basically, I'd probably pass if this was free and delivered right to my hands.
author: Nadeem A.

description:
Been here a couple of times with friends for drinks and tacos and most recently to watch a game. If you are planning to watch the game make sure you get there super early to secure a table because this place gets packed and when I say packed I mean packed full! The tacos are okay but you should order them all at once because you have to wait in line for the order and then find your seat. So going to group so you all can tag team for seats and food. The prices are to be expected I guess.

The crowd is pretty diverse which is always nice but once in awhile you do get the handful of douchey guys that can't handle their alcohol or women too.

Parking can be a hassle... but it San Francisco and should be expected. It's a nice place to hang out and meet up with friends for cheap tacos and beer. A lot of people come here after work and for happy hour ...it's a really well known spot.

I'm sure I'll be back at some point in the future.
author: Krystal T.

description: Nothing to crazy to rave about here. There are definitely better tacos elsewhere. If you're looking for authentic Mexican tacos this is not the place to go to. They're more like large Americanized tacos. But hey, some people like those kinds. Not my preference. It's in a cool neighborhood though.
author: Dara S.

description: For all that rave about the food, you have no idea what real Mexican food tastes like. This stuff is terrible! Who uses a cheese sauce on nachos? Can you add more pico de gallo? Not possible, how about something that is remotely spicy? Nope the place is insanely overrated. I will even overlook the complete lack of service because it was Super Bowl.
author: Steve E.

description:
3.5 stars.

Good tacos. I was expecting crispy tacos from a place called Nick's Crispy Tacos. I got something that was only kinda crispy? It was a bit of a letdown in that respect.

However, the carne asada was flavorful, the guac was creamy and delicious, and the slaw brought the whole taco together. I was a pretty happy camper.

Note: I didn't dine in so I didn't get the entire experience, but I have to say, the ambience was really weird. I was pretty confused by the whole nightclub/tacostand dichotomy.
author: Amanda L.

description: Substantial and tasty carnitas and carne asada tacos "Nick's Way" (so about $6 each) and the free chips & salsa from Yelp check in FTW. Swank red velvet round banquettes and crystal chandeliers while TVs showed football and boxers bloodying themselves. Not busy at 7 pm Sunday, friendly counter/bar service. Check it out if nearby and a good place for cheap eats and/or small groups of friends (many tables for 4-8 to gather). The 2 for $5 taco nights (Tues/Fri?) would make it a true bargain, but it was better to have a chill environment and to sit in one of the many velvet banquettes available on a quieter night.
author: Nancy H.

description:
Not the best taco's i've ever had but pretty damn close. I come here on average once a week for a quick reasonably priced dinner or for take out. Everyone raves about Taco Tuesday because most taco's are $2 instead of $3.95, but the crowds can get crazy and I dont care how good the Tacos are, I'm not waiting 30 min in line for a place that is 3 blocks away from me. If you want a deal, come on Friday night when they have pick 2 for $5 which includes veggie and meat tacos, churros, chips and salsa, and the cheese quesadilla (which I will salivate over later in this post).

Tacos are filling (usually 2 nicks way are good for me). If you are getting tacos, Nicks way is a must. They add an extra tortilla, some jack cheese, and throw some guac on top. I used to strictly go with the carnitas and carne asada but I've been on a Pollo asada (grilled chicken) kick lately. All the meat is juicy and the tacos are crispy (would be a let down if they weren't given the name).

If you eat there, the green sauce they have is some of the best salsa I've ever had. Not sure what it is exactly and the guys behind the counter just laugh when I ask them what it is. I recommend dousing everything you eat with that gold. Although the tacos are exceptional, the cheese quesadilla is to die for. Its really simple, just cheese in a crispy tortilla but add a bit of the aforementioned green sauce and it is literally heaven in a basket.

This is a must stop for anyone on polk street looking for a quick bite at a good price. And don't forget their happy hour drink specials (through Rougue) that they have every day.
author: Steven G.

description:
I see what the hype is all about.  Their fish tacos, Nick's way, is pretty bomb.  Get one and you're satisfied.  Get two and you'll be really full (I'm a girl, so don't need to eat that much, especially with 2 pitchers of margarita on the way).  Tried ordering their tortilla soup and corn, but they were both sold out!   How can you be sold out of your best selling items when it's Taco Tuesday??  Got free chips and salsa with a Yelp check in!

Food came super quick, but not our drinks.  The waitress always answered our questions with other questions - basically got no answer out of it and got us confused of our requests.  On another note, food is from Nick's, but seating and drinks are from Rouge. 

Our group of 4 had a reservation made for 6:30 and it has a 2 hour limit.  Arrived at 6:45, and our table wasn't even ready yet.  It was all good as long as we get to have it for a 2 full hour.  By 8:25, there was a group of people standing in front of our booth, drinks in their hands, staring at us as if we were in their spots.  It did nothing but give us a sense of guiltiness that it was time for us to get out and leave, but our bill wasn't even there yet.   On the other hand, the host should not have let the next group come to the booth in the first place.
author: Nancy S.

description:
Nick know how to make some tacos! 

Be sure to get your done "Nicks Way" and you'll discover a crispy outer shell that has been blessed by the gods themselves. 

Wicked cool little spot.
author: Thomas H.

description:
I always love amazing tacos with a ton of guacamole. Their Carne Asada and carnitas tacos were delicious! I couldn't believe how fast I ate them.

I know that there is a bottomless mimosas deal that I've done here before...I don't remember much if that day, which basically says it was a great visit! 

The only reason I'm giving 4 stars is because they don't take credit cards. It's all cash, and I can't stand using an ATM that has a service fee.
author: Raymond G.

description: I had a Carnitas taco for $3.50. It was the best taco I ever had in my life (and I am Mexican)! Very casual inside. For a drink the Moscow mule will cost you $9. Only a few bartenders to be prepared to wait but the food came out really quick. Will come back of ever in the area.
author: Sophia V.

description: The establishment is pretty cool, but the tacos were kind of so-so.  Got 3 tacos "Nick's way" (crispy shell + cheese).  I got a fish taco just to try since I don't like fish, but had heard that's the way to go.  Also got pollo asado and carne asada tacos in anticipation of not loving the fish.  Turns out I liked the fish taco most (it actually was pretty good and mostly just tasted like butter/fried).  The other 2 were pretty boring.
author: Brian B.

description: Cheap beer and yummy tacos. Tacos were pretty big, definitely justified the price. They had awesome live music and it was pretty easy to snag a table for 8.  Would definitely come back, I heard taco Tuesday is kickass
author: Karen S.

description:
Counting down the minutes to the Friday 5PM Taco Happy Hour is torture.. literally.

Happy Hour is closing but I was patient and was only the second person in line to place my order at 5 sharp! (while my girlfriend secured a booth).

The hour has finally struck, HOWEVER, the attendant at the register decides to balance the register AT THIS TIME (he couldn't break a 20 dollar bill) while more and more patrons walk in.. 

[Your aggravating me off, Nick..]

About 5:07PM now; the attendant finishes counting all the cash and decides to finally ring up the first customer.. HOLD UP! seems like the the register interface JUST MAGICALLY went on the fritz.. and all [dozen+] customers could hear was.. "Does anybody know the code? Do you know how to work this? Is ____ here? No, he left.."

5:14PM now and still no tacos at hand.. but the register is back to life! FINALLY. I placed my order, and keep in mind that I'm starving and pissed off, for the 2 for $5 [Carne Asade] Regular Tacos and a Large Horchata to share. Because of their "register not being able to accept more than one 2 for $5 deals", I had to place a second order for another pair of tacos for my girlfriend.. 

So after I paid for the first transaction, I ordered another 2 for $5 [Carnita] Regular Tacos, but this time, he asked me if I wanted them "Nick's Way"? Sure, whatever. (How come you didn't ask me that a second ago?) Despite the Friday $5 deal, this second transaction was actually close to $8.. I didn't even care about the Free Chips & Salsa check-in offer at this point.. 


So after all that chaos, about 5:30PM now, and having to refeed the meter again, we finally dug into our 2 very troublesome tacos. [http://s3-media3.px.yelpcdn.com/bphoto/SJxr6AsurCkPFQ88m4nfYw/l.jpg] 

Meh. The tacos were okay at best. The Carnita Taco (Nick's Way) was a disappointment. One crispy shell inside and some guac topped off is hardly worth the extra buck per.. no jalapenos either.. The Horchata was good though; it's tough finding a Mexican joint that actually serves it, so kudos. 

But really, on a regular day, your gonna shell out about $5 per for a small taco with guacamole, which is absurd! Maybe they get some intoxicated help from Rogue.. or maybe that's just Nick's way of business..
author: Albert L.

description:
Who the Hell is Nick?

I got to meet this cat cus he makes some killer tacos.  Let me get this straight.....a taco inside a crunch taco?  That's fucking genius!  What's next?  A quesadilla inside a burrito? (I trade marked that one so don't steal it!)

Minus one star for the lack of seating but this is a true grub hall on Polk!
author: Brian S.

description:
two words: Taco Tuesdays.

Taco tuesday on deck! This is THE spot for taco tuesdays. you gotta spend that extra few cents for Nick's way or else you losing out.

Even BETTER cuz it's march madness right now. They also have beer on tap for like $14 pitchers. If you aint ever been here, you missing out!
author: Kenny L.

description: Overall, not impressed with anything from this place. Firstly, the decor is odd- it's like a nightclub/ lounge, yet there is no table service, you have to go to the counter to order. Fine, I can deal. However, the tacos are a little pricey for what you get, at least in San Francisco standards. They do have quite a good selection of options, but in general, the tacos aren't good enough to warrant the $3 each price tag. Probably wouldn't recommend to others; there are better and cheaper taco options in the city.
author: Morgan T.

description:
I usually frequent the Irving location at Underdogs, but lately that place is packed full of college students, so much that you can't even get in.

Although the prices are a tad higher at this original location, the Grilled Fish taco is much better here. You get two good sized filets, perfectly grilled. I remember the Irving location chopped up their grilled fish, after overcooking them, so I stopped ordering it there.

Ask for the habanero salsa!
author: Derrick V.

description:
You know what's cruel and unusual punishment?

Falling in love with a pescado burrito, full of crispy, warm, buttery fish... sweet and spicy salsa... crunchy cabbage and onions... tangy lime... all rolled up in a fresh, soft tortilla.

And then moving away from San Francisco (and said pescado burrito).

And then visiting FOUR YEARS LATER and driving right by Nick's on Broadway and not being able to stop because traffic sucks and you have a plane to catch.

And then deciding SCREW THE PLANE, making an illegal U-turn (almost killing pedestrians), and stopping to get a pescado burrito anyway!!!!!  And then driving like a bat out of hell to get to SFO (exhilarating!) only to encounter a line at security that is longer than a mall entrance on Black Friday.

And then thinking security is going to confiscate your pescado burrito when they pull you out of the security line to examine your carry on.  And then running like a banshee onto the plane right before the gate closes.

And then finally sitting down on the plane, opening that glorious, shiny wrapper and taking a bite of soft, fluffy tortilla....

ONLY TO REALIZE THEY GAVE YOU SOMEONE ELSE'S ORDER.  That's ok.  I ate the veggie burrito anyway.  And it was delicious.  But that pescado burrito.... All I have are memories.  *Tears*
author: Christy L.

description:
Gross overpriced tacos. Careful if you go for Taco Tuesday cause that "deal" is only during certain hours. I recommend the Super Burrito Down Polk St.  

The owner Nick has also been a vocal opponent of proposed safety changes to Polk St. Booooo
author: Matthew M.

description: I am always going to nicks crispy tacos for taco tuesday. Always a great atmosphere and crowd every week. The food is not too bad and is worth the price for $2. Reservations are for 4 or more pepe which is understandable and the lounges seat about that.
author: Marian P.

description: Great tacos, relaxed decor, bring a group of 4-8 and take one of the communal booths; very nice!
author: Chris C.

description:
Within category (the much prized - cheap eat, non-authentic taco category) this has to be the award winner every time. The fried fish Taco, Nick's style (double taco, one crispy one not) just hits the spot - boom!

Since I've given it 5 stars for the food, I feel I need to flag some annoyances with the overall experience for balance:

- The lines are often long
- The tables are often not bussed promptly, so can be a bit grimy
- The dining experience is much better in a booth, rather than at a table
- Rouge (the venue) does tend to attract some crazies from the neighborhood

That said, try it if you haven't yet been.
author: Matt G.

description:
Steak tacos=awesome. Get two with everything.  There is always a line and people saying, "...well, you've been here now."  These tacos are excellent, big and sloppy. 

The cashier was very unfriendly and did not take the time to make eye contact. 
The server when he brought my amazing tacos said, "Oh! Here you are." in a slightly agitated voice, as he gave me my food. 

I will be back but not soon and I hope the employees find a better attitude.
author: Justin S.

description: Nicks tacos was definitely tasty - but with all the super high ratings I must say, don't believe the hype.  They were good don't get me wrong.  Service was okay, they only accept cash so that was a bummer, however there is an ATM machine in the restaurant.
author: Tricia G.

description: Tacos were so so... I feel like the tacos needed hot sauce.   They were a little bland and could've used some additional flavor.  The chips and salsa were fresh.   The lounge area is different from the restaurant and if you want food you have to go order it from the restaurant.   It's a good place to watch sports. I probably wouldn't partake in the food part again as there are better Mexican options in the area.  I was a little disappointed given all that high reviews here ... I ordered the carne asada taco nick style, fried fish taco with chips and salsa.  This place does not take credit card and is cash only.
author: D J.

description:
I got to come to this place for my third time! This time it was much later and much busier! It was great as I expected.  Just a couple things to add-

1. The pico de gallo salsa is amazing. Get chips and salsa to snack on. The chips are warm and the salsa is super fresh!!

2. The service is great! We wanted the sharks game on and they put it on right away! So happy!  Also, i ordered a vodka drink at the bar and was accidentally poured whiskey. One of my guy friends went to ask for a new drink and we all rolled our eyes and scoffed because most bars could care less. However, much to our surprise and pleasure, he poured me a second, correct drink with very few questions! 

All of my friends were there for their first time and were very pleased. Still love the place!
author: Erin D.

description: Nicks is absolutely delicious, the only reason i would give it 4 stars instead of 5 was that its was cash only... and I dont carry cash. There is an atm right next to it and the food is incredible. It also helps that it is cheaper than everywhere in the immediate area. Good price, great quality, would definitely recommend.
author: Jon U.

description:
This is where I fell in love with my first Horchata!  Forget the Crispy Taco...ok, let's go back to those, because they were great too....but the Horchata!!  

For those who haven't shared in the Horchata love, it's a delicious Mexican drink made from rice, almonds and cinnamon.  The secret to it tasting so amazing I'll never know, but I'm happy to indulge in it over and over again.  The hunt for the perfect Horchata in my hometown of Pittsburgh is ON!

BACK to Crispy Tacos.  They were equally as fantastic.  I ordered one of my favorite tacos, the crispy fish tacos.  I absolutely loved how they wrapped the soft shell around the hard shell and stuffed in all the goodies.  The fried fish was, in fact, crispy.  Bonus points for the generous serving of guacamole on top.  

I also had an order of Elote, corn on the cob with grated cheese and chili powder.  The mix of sweet corn and cheese was awesome, even though I was coughing my way through the chili powder (I'm a light weight, what can I say?).  

I ordered two fish tacos and they were HUGE.  I only ended up eating the one since it was such a big serving.  One with an order of Elote would have been perfect.  Too much of a good thing is....not a bad thing in food terms....but save the mola for another trip to Nicks!
author: Rachel C.

description:
2 dollar tacos (minus the seafood tacos) on Tuesday! Great vibe for taco tuesday and great service. Yay for margarita pitchers after a long day!! 

Tacos were a very good size for 2 dollars. Check out the pictures. Remember, the food is cash only but the drinks you can use credit card.

No parking around, should take public transportation.
author: Patricia P.

description:
Good Mexican eats by day and club Rouge with a big bar in a red room of chandeliers by night!  This place is known for the crispy taco shell inside a soft taco with the option of extra guacamole and cheese a la Nick's style.  Plus, the burritos come with the option of tortillas in tomato, spinach and original.  Some noteworthy sides include the corn on cob with a chili powder and cheese as well as the freshly squeezed juices that come in a variety of flavors, such as watermelon, strawberry, honey dew, mango and horchata.

Parking on the street is tough.  Be prepared for lines at the counter to order especially on Taco Tuesday deal nights for dining in.  The service is fast and friendly, but mainly self-serve.
author: Jenny L.

description:
Ahh...the ever famous Nick's Crispy Tacos...but does Nick still work there?  I heard Nick has moved on to the Taco Shop at Underdog, but the place still bears his name?  Well, if he has moved on, he should feel good knowing that they're keeping things the same...for the most part.

The first time I had Nick's was years ago, back when most people hadn't heard about it yet, Yelp hadn't hit its prime, and when a "7x7" probably had more to do with the size of an In N Out burger than a famous list.  Boy have things changed.  Back then, only a small section of Rouge was open for seating, but now the whole place is available, and the bar is open for service as well.

The menu is still the same as before (and the same as Underdog's), so I went with my usual Pescado (fish taco) Nick's way (cheese and guacamole) and added a Pollo Asado.  The Pescado is a solid taco, though my pieces of fish weren't as nice as what I've been accustomed to getting at Underdog.  I'm assuming it was just this one time that I got some shorter pieces, since I've usually been pretty happy with it, but at least it still tasted good.  The batter is nice and crispy, and the fish is flavorful without being too "fishy".  The pollo asado was something I had yet to try, so I was hopeful that it would be pretty good.  I liked the flavor (somewhat like its beefy cousin) and I thought it was seasoned nicely, but the meat was pretty dried out and it took away a bit from the taco.

It seems there's usually a bit of a line regardless of the day, but it moves pretty quickly, so it's not too bad of a wait.  For whatever reason, the tacos didn't seem quite as good as the ones over at Underdog, and not quite as good as what I remember.  Maybe Nick's needs to come back in, but still not too shabby overall.
author: Mike L.

description:
There's something slightly different about the famous Pescado Taco, Baja style and Nick's way from the Taco Shop at Underdog's. Too much red cabbage, habanero salsa was lacking kick, the guac was kind of bland - I don't know what it is but just not the same. 

Positives were that the fish was really crispy, service was quick and efficient and when you check-in on YELP you receive free chips and salsa.  

Maybe because I enjoy the crowd, the scene, the diversity  and parking in the laid back  inner sunset area; Polk just makes me annoyed. If it wasn't for the popsugar coupon I probably wouldn't have gone to that hood and I have no immediate plans to go back; unlike my standing Monday visits to Underdog's.

That isn't NCT fault, just my preference, but if I was in the hood, someone else was driving and I wasn't craving some bomb ass Chinese food on the other side of the Broadway tunnel I could see myself chillin' here before heading to the next spot.
author: Jade W.

description:
The place is a lounge/club not your ordinary taco/burrito restaurant. 

CASH ONLY::::

The fish taco is AWESOME! Make sure you get it nick's way. The battered fish is tender and crispy and a good size serving. I love their guacamole very creamy and flavorful. I also got the elote ehhhh! it's ok nothing really special.
author: KaeAnne D.

description:
It's Nick's way or the highway!  

* wink, wink *

I had not one, but TWO Baja-style fish tacos, which comes in a soft taco with fried fish, salsa, cabbage, onions and lime mayo.  THAT is enough to stand up on its own, but your taste buds are elevated to the next level when you do it Nick's way:  crispy shell, jack cheese and guacamole.  The flavors altogether --  ! ay caramba !

I'm so excited to check off #10 on 7 X 7 Big Eats SF list!

Service here is quick and efficient, even though the place filled up fast.  Since we were there for happy hour, (Mon-Fri  5pm-9pm)  we scored on $2 beers and $3 'Ritas.  My 'Rita was a bit too sour and barely had alcohol in it, but that won't stop me from coming back and getting the fish tacos again!

Nick's way,  of course.
author: Janice C.

description: The vibe in here is downright creepy. This really isn't a restaurant, it's a low budget club that serves food during the day. Really dirty floors, smells awful, just not the kind of place I want to order food.
author: Cam H.

description: Pretty solid food all around, especially the famous crispy tacos. Taco Tuesdays can get sh**showy, but the crowd is always fun to watch as you chow down on food and drink the HH specials. Skews towards the younger side, so can get rowdy, but can be extremely fun and tacos worth it.
author: Anthony D.

description: Best service! Omar was our waiter. Not only did we get fresh homemade chips and salsa we also were brought delicious nacho cheese . The crispy tacos de camarones were incredible and so was the homemade horchata! Definitely a place I'll come back to again. Try the elote!
author: Ali A.

description:
A rare occasion for me to picked up my wife from work and took her to $2.00 Taco night at Nick's for an early dinner. "I'm a CHEAP-DATE, am I?"

With no surprise, the long was long for the Happy Hour special from 5pm-9pm. But it's definitely worth the wait. We get a choice four fillings in each of taco: Chicken, Carnitas, Carne Asada or Vegetarian. I took Chicken and Carnitas and she took a Carne Asada. Our respective taco had the choice of meat, Lettuce, Cheese, Salsa, Whole beans and Sour Cream blanketed in a warm Corn Tortilla. Chips with Salsa and Guacamole toppings was also part of the $2.00 Tuesday special and we split one of those. Something about the taco makes it very tasty and yummy. 

The bar, which is located in the middle and separate from the food stand, also have two bottles of Corona for $5.00. Our imported beer was chilled and topped off with a slice of lime wedge. We did two rounds of beers, while wife had three of them with $5.00 shots of Silver Patron Tequila with each beer. Yeah, you can tell she was "BUZZED", but stable!"

Cash only for the restaurant, but the bar takes credit cards.
author: Matt G.

description: From the outside its not clear what this place is or is trying to be (bar? Taco joint? Night club), and having been there I'm not sure though the food is solid. Friday's means specials on tacos (2 for $7). As vegetarians we actually thought the vegetarian quesadilla was the best and what we would order next time. Nachos were standard and not great. Cheese quesadilla had a crispy fried tortilla but was otherwise nothing specials. Taco was big and well stuffed but bland. We may be back on a Friday.
author: T K.

description: I love this place!  I don't get to come here often since I don't live in the city, but it's an adorable place to grab drinks and tacos and catch up with friends. It's located inside Rouge, so the decor definitely has a nighttime vibe. The service has always been super friendly, and they usually have really good deals for drinks. Every time I have been here, we always walk out full and happy. My favorite things here are the vegetariano tacos and the nachos. And of course the margaritas. Highly recommend for anyone in the area craving mexican food! I have never been able to recreate the crispy taco at home :(
author: Shilpa Y.

description:
Came here for an early lunch. I love the atmosphere of this place...they have beautiful decor (it is inside of Rouge nightclub). Ordered the Pescado taco, Carnitas taco and the jalapeño poppers. I came here last year and the poppers were stuffed with cream cheese (which was so unique and delicious!) but
today they were made with cheddar. :( A little
disappointing because I loved them so much before, but they were still good. The tacos were delicious - always order Nick's way!
author: Tara J.

description: Time we got to San Francisco we told about this place, when you step into this place its like you just step back in time, red step up booths, red velvet drapes, chandeliers, plush décor. this is a Rouge club/ Bar on some nights and weekend....so you go to the back and ordered your food they give you an number to place on your table, we got 3 Pollo Asado tacos,1 Camarones taco, 1 bean and rice burrito, chips and salsa, the food was good and pricey $3.95 per tacos and $4.95 for the camarones, this is what come on most of the tacos pinto beans, cabbage, pico de gallo, jack cheese, cilantro, and onions.The best time to go here is on Taco Tuesday $2.00 tacos and on Fridays any two Items $5.00 on both of there days you can't get it to go, no substitution, any add on additional, Sat.and Sun. is brunch / breakfast with only 4 Items burrito, quesadilla, tacos, and huevos rancheros, in my opinion I have tasted better street tacos in L.A.
author: Tommy M.

description:
Get their fried shrimp taco! My BF and I got to try 5 different tacos and definitely the shrimp one was a winner. 

I was a bit disappointed that everything else was just mediocre but it was worth trying their crispy tacos. Seating is self serve so you have a bunch of people hawking over you when the places gets crowded :(
author: Maggie C.

description: My boss treated me to lunch from Nick's and ordered the Pescado; this fried fish taco is a highly recommended and be sure to get it "Nick's Way".  Note: you'll need to walk into a bar to get to this taco shop/bar.
author: Jessica S.

description:
Over priced and way over rated. 

I came in craving some tasty tacos but instead I got a crowded nightclub/sports bar that happens to serve less than mediocre tacos.

5 dollar tacos?! I'm pretty sure I was just ripped off. Unless you like getting full on guac and cheese. Not my idea of a taco.

Cash only?! Good thing there is an ATM close by. Make sure you pull at least 40 bucks for a table for two. Yep, 40 bucks for tacos and a couple of beers. 

If you are looking for a cool little clicky spot to watch the Warriors basketball game and listen to a DJ spin mashups then this place is for you.

But, if you are looking for authentic tacos the way they should be made then SF is your oyster. You deserve better.

Do I have high standards? Hell yes I do! I am Mexican and I've been eating this stuff since I was two!
author: Miguel E.

description:
Came here last Saturday after work and the Polk St. Pub Crawl was going on at the same time... it was so packed!  I felt that the restaurant was prepared for a large turnout as my food came out quickly but a little on the cold side.  I had ordered 2 pescado tacos, Nick's style, and a carne asada con todo burrito to go.  The fish tasted like it was fried hours ago--a little crispy yet a little soggy.  Not the most palatable and definitely up to the high standards they set in my books during the last many visits I came here when it was less busy.  I understand that the restaurant has to make a lot of food to accommodate the expected large number of guests, but at the expense of quality just doesn't cut it.  Frankly, when drunk, I'm sure all food (both good and bad) tastes good - so I'm not sure if the pub crawlers could tell that the food was cold or soggy!

Lastly, the restaurant seems to charge an extra surcharge every single time I go there.  I think it's the Healthy SF surcharge or sit-in-tax, but I'm not sure.  For example, when I get a pescado taco (not nick's way) it's normally $4.50, but when I pay, I have to pay $5.50.  With tax, it should no more than $5 dollars.  I'm surprised out of all the reviews on yelp, nobody has mentioned this.  Most restaurants in the city will notify customers of extra surcharges (especially for Healthy SF), but as far as I've experienced, I haven't seen any notification at Nick's since the last 2 years I've been coming here.  A little shady on their end. 

All in all, Nick's is good if you come at an off-time (i.e. between lunch and dinner is a good time) so that you can get a table and can have fresher (not soggy or as soggy) food.  Taco Tuesdays are ALWAYS packed (so come early, otherwise you won't get a seat).  Going on days when there are pub crawls is JUST as packed.  

This place is still cash only, so bring cash!  You will also get charged extra for some unknown fee, so don't be surprised when your total comes out to be $1-2 extra (after 9.50% tax).  It would be nice to know what that extra unknown surcharge is though, but I guess it'll remain unknown in their shady books.
author: Matthew L.

description: A great spot for happy hour -- I reccommend the margaritas and carnitas tacos, Nick's Way.
author: Lauren L.

description:
Tasty stuff.  I ordered the carne asada taco and shrimp taco.  Yes, the tacos weren't crispy at all, but they were tasty.  I liked how the shrimp taco was packed with cabbage and other veggies -- both were very good.  The venue itself is a little funny -- I didn't realize the entire venue doubles as Rouge nightclub after hours, but there you have it.

A good taco spot to hit up in Nob/Russian Hill.
author: Mel G.

description:
I AM IN LOVE WITH THIS PLACE. BEST TACOS EVER. I could eat Nick's Crispy Tacos at any time of the day: breakfast, lunch, or dinner. Sometimes, after lunch or dinner, I even crave the crispy tacos as my dessert over any kind of ice cream, cookies, cake, etc. No joke peoples.

Wow, even writing this review right now is making me excited. Where do I begin? I pretty much always order all my tacos Nick's way cause you gotta. Comes with a crispy corn tortilla within a soft one that delivers extra crunch. And it also includes all the good stuff: a CRAP TON of yummy guac and some jack cheese. My go-to's are the camarones (shrimp) and grilled fish. I can't express to you how EFFFING GOOD these tacos are. Love all the salsa, lime, cabbage, cilantro, and onions that come with it, and the whole taco is just a piece of heaven with all the ingredients they load in it. 2 tacos usually fill me up, but sometimes I crave a 3rd just to top it all off... The chips and salsa are also really good here. 

Seating can often be a pain in the ass because it's a bar-type of atmosphere, and people are always running around trying to save tables for friends. But dude, it's so worth it. I've come here on Taco Tuesdays once, and it was SUPER crowded; perhaps it's because I showed up pretty late (9pm?). Although tacos are cheaper on these days, I'd actually rather come on a less crowded day and pay more because they're just that good; I want to be able to get my tacos quickly and enjoy these divine tacos in peace.

My bfs go-to's are usually the carne asada and pescado tacos (Nick's way of course). Those are also damn good but just a bit more on the fattier side. But who am I kidding? All these tacos are probably loaded with a crap ton of calories, but I'd gladly gain all the weight in the world to eat these tacos.

As for price, yeah yeah, they're more expensive than Mexican street tacos. But they're also WAY LARGER AND SO DELICIOUS. And you figure, for a lunch/dinner in SF, to pay $10-$12 for 2 tacos and be pretty full, that's one hell of a deal. Sometimes, Yelp or Google Offers has deals for this place, but if you ever see it sold out, sorry, it's because my bf and I probably bought like 10 million vouchers. Ok... must end review now before I get too hungry....
author: Jennifer L.

description:
So we came here on a recommendation and coming from Texas I've had better tacos.The entrance is facing Polk, not Broadway and its across from a Thai restaurant. I checked in to get their free chips and salsa. Ehhhhh I've had better but it's free so I'm not really going to complain about it.  It's the chunky salsa, which isn't my cup of tea.

We ordered 1 grilled & 1 fried fish taco and the carnitas taco. I only had the grilled fished taco, so I can't really go much into the other two. I do admit that that I like their grilled fish taco and it's one of the better ones that I've had.  I think the best fish taco I've ever had is in Cozumel, so I compare every fish taco to that one. 

On Sundays, they have a bottomless mimosa for $7 - everyone at the restaurant had a pitcher of mimosa.  When we came it was pretty busy, so there isn't a lot of tables either. 

Reason why I gave it a two star is because of the decor and it took us a while to find the place because there was no signs on Broadway. Yeah it's cool that the decor is like a cabaret place, but it's pretty run down in my opinion. The cheap tables with the fancy chandeliers just doesn't go. Or maybe it is a cabaret/night club but in the day time it's a taco joint - seriously I don't know what's the theme is.  Also, the taco isn't cheap... it's pretty pricy in my opinion.
author: Karen C.

description:
I went to Nick's to grab a to go dinner after my first full day in San Francisco.  After using yelp early in the morning to find an AWESOME brunch spot a short cab ride from my hotel; I was really confident in the reviews for Nick's Crispy Tacos.  Also, this restuarant was in walking distance from my hotel.... Bonus, right!?!?!

Wrong!  I walked past the place at first due mostly to my own unfamiliarity with San Fran but also due to confusing signage that has the adjoining club name listed first and the taco joint trailing after.  The signage did not deter me one bit however going into the club entrance and being greeted by the standing room only crowd was not at all what expected at 6:30 pm on a Saturday night.  Apparently, college football was happening.  

So, I went back out and finally found the "entrance" to Nick's. I waited 30 mins in line to place an order of 2 fish tacos with cheese and chips with guacamole.   10 additional minutes and 17 bucks later I found myself the proud owner of two bland, lukewarm, cabbage laden tacos and guacamole so weirdly green it was off-putting.  

The chips however were great
author: Jen W.

description:
If you've ever seen my check-ins, you're familiar with my late-nite dining habit. Breakfast usually doesn't happen til 11am, if at all. My preference of eating meals later than normal is most problematic at lunch because so many restaurants close between 2-5pm in preparation for dinner. Luckily, Nick's Crispy Tacos keeps its doors open all day. They were quite busy when my lunch partner & I walked in at 2:45pm. 

NCT's is located inside Rouge (is this even used as a club anymore?) What a fun contradiction to eat tacos in the middle of the day with chandeliers overhead & a massive bar just a foot from your burgundy velvet booth. Such casual food for such ornate (gaudy) diggs. 

I filled up on their super-thick chips, pico de gallo & guac ($3.50.) The salsa lacked acidity. I'd ordered a pollo asado taco (grilled chicken, $3.50) nick's way (extra $0.95) but packed it up to-go. Well-seasoned white meat chicken & black beans gave this heavy, fried Mexi-Cali concoction a slightly healthier quality. Their strawberry agua fresca was watered down ($2.75 for a large.) 

Very friendly ordertakers, but I do prefer the atmosphere & salsa at The Taco Shop @ Underdog's in the Outer Sunset (they accept credit cards, whereas NCT is cash only.)
author: Fancypants X.

description: Tasty tacos. Highly recommend that "Nicks Way" style be ordered - jack cheese + guacamole. Heavenly.  Tacos are about $4 and an extra $1 for the guac and cheese.  The chicken pollo was very tender.  Larger than your average tacos, so order sparingly, or order more for the next day (they are still good by then)
author: Patty O.

description:
Date & Time:  Wednesday March 11, 2009 @ 5:30pm Happy Hour-  $3 Taquito Wednesdays
Location:  Rouge @ 10pm 
Company:  Michael
Crowd:  Neighborhood Couples & Groups in North Face Vests & Seven Wide-Legged Jeans
Vibe:  Energetic & Chill
Decor:  Side Entrance to Old Night Club w/ The Lights On.  Worn Red Velvet Booths, Patio Tables for Deux & Make-Shift Communal Tables w/ Plastic Fiesta TableCloths, Bar.
Service:  Friendly & Efficient
Imbibe:  Margarita w/ Fresh Lime, Hornitos, Triple Sec.  Agua Fresca- Flavors of The Day- Lime, Strawberry, Horchata
Devour:  Nachos Topped w/ Cheese, Meat, Guacamole, Pico de Gallo, Elote(Corn on The Cob w/ Grated Cheese & Chili Powder), Nick's Way Crispy Taco w/ Jack Cheese, Guacamole w/ Choice of Meat & Burrito Con Todo(Make your Own Burrito w/ Sour Cream, Guacamole & Queso
Total:  $30.63
author: Genevieve Y.

description:
Nick, Oh Nick, your crispy tacos are so crispy and divine. I had you bookmarked for years ever since I saw a photo of you through Jonas T. but never got the chance to try it out till now. Two crispy tacos, Nick's way can cost you nearly 7 dollars or even 8 if you get extra toppings. I got the carnitas which is basically a shredded pork taco. It was very good and I can see if you don't eat it quick, the crispy shell taco can get soggy and stale. Also, their regular carne asada soft taco is nothing to talk about. It is boring and plain tasting.

Definitely come here for the Tuesday special after 5pm because you save yourself a few bucks literally. The line can be long but it's worth the wait cause you can lounge around for awhile. I am thinking about their tacos as I am writing this. Who wants to come back with me? Definitely one of the most interesting yet one of the best tacos I have had.
author: Danster L.

description:
One of my favorite taco places into San Francisco. I normally get the carne asada tacos, but I've tried the carnitas & fish tacos, as well. Get the tacos Nick's way - you won't regret it!

Be warned. It's always crowded here & it smells like sweat & beer.  I have to dock off a star for that. But the tacos get 4 stars!
author: Grace C.

description:
Came here for a friend's birthday party around 8PM. After we got caught up with our lives, I decided to order some tacos for the birthday boy as well as appetizers for the table. The chips and salsa were a big hit with everyone so I just kept those coming.

The line can get quite long at times and the wait isn't much better, but everything came out around the same time. The menu is pretty extensive to the untrained eye.

The fish tacos were great! Too bad it wasn't during a special day so I could grab a few more for less. The citrus really gives the fish a nice kick. The batter was just right and made the fish still crispy despite the amount of lemon/lime I added on.

The area where this place falls short is the steak on both the tacos and burrito. They looked fine, the steak on the other hand didn't taste fine at all. It was so dry and tasteless. One of my friends agreed with me and we both decided to chuck them away to get some fish tacos. More bad news, the kitchen already closed! 
Guess I'm stuck with getting a proper burrito/taco in the Mission or grabbing a slice of pie next door.
author: George Z.

description: I love Nick's... But I feel like we need more than one bartender on football Sunday... That's all I'm saying.
author: Angelic S.

description:
The only fish taco I've ever had was at Rubio's but say no more, I'll only get it here. I've been to this joint a few times and it's usually for happy hour. You walk in, order your food to the right, pay and take your number with you to your seat. Be mindful that it is cash only. No cash, no problem as there's an ATM inside. If I remember correctly. 
Anyway, I'm not a big fan of margaritas but if you are, then order it cause they are definitely cheap here. Order the fish tacos too, Nick's way and we'll call it a day!
author: Anna P.

description: Last week was my very first Taco Tuesday as an official resident of San Fran and I wanted to do it right. I did some research, ended up at Nick's and I was pleasantly surprised. The tacos and margaritas were dirt cheap and hit the spot! My favorite part of the meal had to be the chips and salsa/guac. I love the club vibe and will definitely be going back again!
author: Jennifer P.

description: Amazing tacos and burritos. My sister hates mexican food and has fallen in love with nick's.  Get the fish tacos Nick's Way.
author: Bartek R.

description: I ate here in August. I understand people come here for exactly what it is...which doesn't happen to be my taste. They don't accept credit cards for payment, you order your food at one counter then have to order your drink at the bar (more about that later) on the other side of the room, food was mediocre at best, and bartender lacked motivation and friendliness. I also understand that it used to be two separate places, but the owner(s) made it one - but the POS' still operate separately. Again, people come here for the experience and atmosphere - both are not impressive to me. Yep, they definitely don't want people like me coming in there as it will lead to dissatisfaction.
author: Natitude A.

description:
This place is awesome for viewing sports, love to come here for football games. It great for groups, although you can barely hear each other because of the noise level. 
the bottomless mimosas on sunday brunches are strong. Food wise i love the nachos and the Fish burrito, probably one of the best fish burritos i have had in a while.  

I love going here with a bunch of friends and watch the game. they have an amazing number of tv's and the bar and kitchen are very fast with your drinks and food. 

Go here on sunday and enjoy the game. you might want to reserve a table cause it does get busy esp on sunday brunches.
author: Anuj C.

description:
Love it here!  Tacky decor, yummy tacos, great prices, and a great atmosphere of people.

Went for game 7 of the World Series, and it was AMAZING.
author: Amanda B.

description:
Kids say the darndest things. Such boundless imaginations.

Once my nephew picked up a conch shell and said, "I hear the waves, I hear a jet ski!"

Just before coming to Nick's, all I could hear was my death knell. I had almost od'ed on coffee at Philz and then took a tortuous bus ride on the 49-Van Ness from the Mission to meet my friend, and I was jittered out beyond even a kid's imagination. 

So I needed food stat as I had one foot in the grave, gravely disabled as I was. My friend kept texting that he was almost "at Nicky's" as he kept calling it, having troubles of his own with the 1-Cali. You could not imagine a more cracked out scene than me waiting outside, my hunger pangs bellowing out to all four corners.

Once inside, I felt like I was in a strip club with a taqueria facade, or was it just my imagination that those tacos were giving lap dances? We got down and dirty in one of the booths, with tableside service when the tacos were ready. They weren't very crispy, but they did hit the spot for my undiscerning palate that night. Carnitas and carne asada were my favorites; I like a good chunk of meat on my tacos. They're large and in charge tacos to boot. If you get "Nicky's style" as my friend continued to say, it comes with guacamole and possibly other fixings for a buck extra. This provided a literal lap dance when oozing out onto my lap, but I wasn't one to care at the time.

Came with a starving stomach and a Yelp Deals! voucher, left with a belly full, fuller wallet, and no holds barred imagination on how lascivious a taco can be if the setting is right.
author: Joanna M.

description:
Let me start off by saying that they got our order ALL WRONG. Pollo instead of Carne Asada, Nick's way, no Nick's way. For my boyfriend and I's first time at Nick's Crispy Tacos.. we were definitely confused!

I came here on a Tuesday at around 4:10pm with my boyfriend. The restaurant is poorly lit, tacky, and just an awkward place to enjoy some tacos because every table was reserved. The cashier told us that if we come back at 5pm, the tacos are $2. Taco Tuesdays? Hell yeah! My boyfriend and I strolled around Polk Street before coming back at 5pm. There was already a line at 5pm, but thankfully it went by quickly. I ordered the cantaloupe fresca, a pollo taco Nick's way, a carne asada taco Nick's way while my boyfriend got a Mexican Coke, a carne asada Nick's way and a Fish Taco Nick's way. We both shared a Carne Asada nacho plate. The total came out to be $28 and some change which was a bit pricy in my opinion.

The wait wasn't that bad considering how many people were there. When our order arrived, I was definitely confused. All of our tacos were Nick's way which meant all of them were supposed to have guacamole. 3 out of the 4 tacos had guacamole on them. Our nachos, which were supposed to be Carne Asada, had pollo. Both of my tacos were carne asada when I clearly ordered a pollo one. My boyfriend had a pollo one when he clearly ordered a carne asada one. Too bad we didn't realize it till after we ate our meal. :( Everything was just all wrong.

So why the 4 stars? Because everything we had, regardless if the order was wrong, was so damn good! It was seriously finger licking good and at $3 a taco (a dollar more for Nick's way) I was definitely pleased! Guac was good, beans were good.. and I don't even care for guac or beans! The meat was tender and flavorful, the chips and tacos shells were delicious and the fresca was refreshing. Yesyesyes I'll be back!
author: Joyce E.

description:
Nick's Taco's are pretty bomb. I like their Baja fish taco, because its fried to perfect, and the batter makes a great contrast to the flaky fish and the rest of the taco. Always pay the extra dollar to get it Nick's way (which makes it a crispy taco with guac and salsa).  

I don't like the $2 taco tuesday hours. The place gets packed pretty quickly and people swoop your seat. I'm sorry, but there's a way to eye peoples tables without being so damn obvious.  Plus, during the taco hours, I think they pre-make taco's. I got a Nick's way taco that was soggy...even though it had a crispy shell. Meaning my taco had been sitting there for at least 15 minutes. ICK.

Taco Tuesdays is for any non-seafood taco for $2.  On any other day from 3-5 they have $1 off non-seafood tacos. Guess the theme is that seafood will never be discounted (boo). 

Atmosphere is ok, but not great. You go in from the side door and order at the counter. They'll give you a number and you go get a seat and wait for them.  Water and utensils are off to the side (either in the center of the room by the pillars or in the back).  I'm always a little iffy about sitting on their booths, because I've been here at night when it's Rogue and its really...gross. I mean, think about it. People...getting trashed...in a dark corner.  There has to be some fluids there that I don't want to touch. Eww.

For the price, service and the food, its a great place to go. Just be aware of the time and look before you sit down. =)
author: Lily W.

description:
Nick's Crispy Tacos..

Soooooooooooo finger licking good! That's all I could say about their tacos. Also, I tried their elote (corn on the cob with cheese and some other stuff):   Amazing!!!!!
author: Y. Abigail H.

description:
Sooo good. Our new favorite casual dining place, here's why:

-Crispy tacos!! Done the right way - it's a real tortilla, hand fried, with an extra non-fried tortilla on the outside to sop everything up - WIN.
-A metric ton of guacamole - WIN.
-Red cabbage instead of lettuce - WIN.
-Relatively cheap - right around or less than $5 for a burrito & way cheaper for tacos - MEGA WIN.
-Dude, they have jalepeno poppers - with cheddar & not cream cheese - WIN.
author: Amber K.

description:
YAY!!! Tacos! Beer! Fun!

Ive been here atleast 3-4 times. They do have a good google offer here and there. 

Happy hour is great with 2$ tacos, and paying more for nicks way grants you a hefty taco. Even the salsas and fresh chips are great. I realy enjoy coming here and, make sure to get here early as seats fill up fast, and the line gets soooo long. 

It turns into a club later, which is a hit or miss. sometimes its Douche C so watch out!
author: Benjamin B.

description:
3.5* 

PRICE: About $10-$15/person.
CHANCE OF RETURNING: 65%

TIP: Get it Nick's Way. ;-)
___________________________________


I don't usually like crispy tacos, but these were mmgoot. 

Was a bit skeptical about the pescado tacos as I usually prefer carne asada, but these fish tacos were just perfectly fried, with a very light batter that had a slight crunch, but fell apart in your mouth.

I've also tried the quesadilla and the carne asada burrito. Pretty good!

The salsas are a bit weak, so I usually use a little bit of Tabasco (which I carry in my purse) to help kick it up a notch.

Don't come here expecting authentic tacos. Get those at Los Gemelos in Redwood City, instead.
author: Asha S.

description: Great tacos and great value.  Tacos Nicks way have great ingredients and two of them will fill you up.  Atmosphere is fun and good for big groups.  Bar gets rowdy during games.  Location on Polk is convenient.
author: Tom F.

description: Love tacos here. Been eating almost every Tuesday for 3-4 months. We always get polo assado and veggie taco.
author: Garima K.

description: Very happy to have discovered Nick's. We had two types of fish tacos, shrimp tacos, chicken tacos, and quesadilla.  All were very tasty.  An especially nice treat is the Mexican corn - grilled corn-on-the-cob with chili powder and cream.  Will be having that again and again!
author: Alex C.

description: This place was not as good as the hype made it seem. I walked in and felt like I was in a 70's porno studio. I went there for Taco Tuesday and it was super crowded and took forever to get my food. The food is very ok and it the true flavor just masked my guacamole, I love guacamole don't get me wrong but I feel like they use it to cover up the basic flavor of their tacos.  If you want real Mexican go to the mission, this is subpar American Mexican food.
author: Mike B.

description: I love Nicks!  I try to make a stop every time that I'm in town.  I always get my tacos "Nicks Way" which is crispy and delicious.  I like cheese on my tacos & they don't put cheese on them here though.  Last time I ordered cheese and just got a slice of melted cheese; maybe next time I'll ask for shredded (?).  The shredded chicken is amazing and so is the carnitas but the beef is just mediocre.  Regardless of the cheese, I love this place!
author: Christina K.

description:
"Wow! It's alot bigger than I thought it would be." (insert pun here)

I am, of course, referring to the monstrous size of Nick's crispy tacos. I've had my fare share of tacos, but never like this. About the size of 1/2 a burrito, these crispy taco shells are filled to the brim with juicy and savory carne asada, chicken, fish or shrimp. And if you have it "Nick's Way" for an extra 95 cents, they'll slather it with guacamole...all sexy-like.

Ooooh yeah, you know what mama likes. *food porn music plays in background* Bow chicka wow!

I opted for one shrimp and one chicken taco. The chicken was tender and marinated in juices, along with pico de gallo and pinto beans. The shrimp taco was light and fresh, bundled with cabbage, onions and cilantro. The chips and salsa with guacamole was BOMB - they did not skimp on the guac. I only wish I had a second stomach, like cows do. Dammit.

Wash it all down with an agua fresca (fresa/strawberry is my fave) and you've got yourself a multi-dimensional, meaty, crispy, crunchy, juicy meal that'll make you eat and lick your fingers like no one is watching. And as much as I wanted a $6 margarita, I was on my lunch hour so I did the grown-up thing and passed. 

The place gave me a feeling of deja-vu as I wondered, "Have I danced on that bar before?". Then, I realized Nick's is located inside Rouge nightclub. Oooh! It's all makes sense now.

Sitting in the elevated red booths was an unexpected surprise, and a huge departure from the decor of a "traditional" Mexican taqueria - a decor which generally consists of posters of scantily clad Latinas in the arms of a muscular Aztec, Thalia album covers, and Modelo beer ads.

If I lived closer and parking wasn't such a raging beeyotch, I'd come here more often.

Nick's: Thanks for reinventing tacos in the most awesome way.
author: Mariela D.

description:
Good, not great. Margaritas are too sugary. 

Taco Tuesdays are pretty hectic in there but it usually ends up being a good time. Wish they had some healthier options as well.
author: Jay G.

description:
I've heard about the infamous tacos from Nick's Crispy Tacos and can't believe i didn't try them earlier.. i've been missing out! I made sure to carry cash because they don't take card. There was a never ending line but completely worth the wait. The restaurant is huge and they have a bar in the middle of the room.

The pescado tacos done Nick's Way (made crispy with jack cheese and guacamole) is one of the best tacos i've ever had. Oh and don't forget to pour their green sauce and habanero sauce all over them! The habanero sauce is no joke. The watermelon juice was just refreshing enough to slow down the burn. I can only imagine how great this would be at like 3am after a long night of drunken shenanigans.  My friends and i came real hungry and bought $67 worth of food!? We did damage for three girls.

Pescado Tacos + Nick's Way: MUST ORDER
Cheese Quesadilla: Simple, greasy, goooood
Carne asada Quesadilla: Good, big portion, but the simple queso quesadilla was better
Carnitas Nachos: MUST ORDER + jalapenos
Watermelon juice: Love!

La Taqueria in the mission also offers a crispy style taco that's to die for just fyi. Go to La Taqueria for a crispy meat taco and Nick's for a crispy fish taco.
author: Samantha L.

description:
EAT MY FAT DOUBLE LAYERED TACO!!!!
(4 stars)

Remember those double-layer tacos from tacobell back in the early 90's... well this is like the new age version of it. 

- Food, crackin
- Price, worth the portions
- Service, pretty good
- Ambiance, looks small on the outside, spacious on the inside

Group of my friends and i participated in SantaCon 2011 and Polk street had a few thousand santas. We by passed a few of the overly packed bar and came to Nick's Crispy Tacos to eat. Service was pretty quick and after few hundred Santas trickled in, service was still hella quick (food and bar). Especially with 1 bartender at the bar, she rocked. Santas, shots, and tacos... that is all you need.

HEFFER STYLE STATUS

CHICKEN TACOS - I really dont know how much they were. one of my friends bought out beef and chicken tacos for the entire group. Just ate the chicken taco and it was OFF THE CHAINS. The order was this, soft taco, crunchy ass taco, loads of chicken and cheese. The portions were filling, worth it.

Will I be back? FUCK YAH!

JABA APPROVED... Until the next review...
author: Jane A.

description:
We were really surprised to see that Nick's Crispy Tacos was actually INSIDE Rouge Nightclub, but even with the odd setting, the tacos were delicious.

Before we got tacos, we ordered a pitcher of margaritas ($10 during HH) and they were good, but not great...about what you can expect for 10 bucks.

On to the tacos...2 fried fish tacos for my boyfriend, and 1 carne asada and 1 fried fish taco for me. Of course, we got them all "Nick's way." The food was brought to our table quickly, and I was really surprised at how tasty they were! Going to school in San Diego really brought our Mexican food standards up and usually NorCal restaurants can't meet our expectations. We were happy to discover that the fish was super crispy and the guacamole was plentiful.

The downside is the price. If you get a fish taco Nick's way it is pushing $6 per taco, but luckily you will only need a couple to fill you up.
author: Annaliese D.

description:
These things are great.  The key differences here relative to any other tacos, are that they make the bottom of the taco rectangular to fit all the stuff in it, the outer tortilla is soft while the inner tortilla is crispy - giving a unique and fun texture, the pocket of cheese at the bottom, and that they pile on fresh ingredients on top.  They then display that pile of ingredients proudly on the front of the taco to get you excited.  All of this leads to a very satisfying and memorable taco that I'll probably be craving for a while.

The meats themselves are not out of this world, but they are certainly good.  The carnitas had a good spice flavor going for it.  Want to try the fish ones, which look good in the pictures here.
author: Mike L.

description:
Cash only! Great Tacos and comedy nights Love the breakfast burritos and cheap mimosa combo on a lazy Sunday afternoon. Also, the fresh juice is so tasty if you prefer a non-alcoholic drink. Doesn't kill the wallet and the vibe is laid back. I always have great time here. 

It's no Mission Mexican, but Nicks has their own style that is worth wrapping your mouth around.
author: Krystle L.

description:
This is a weird weird place. It's in a nightclub, the kind that has red upholstery, circular booths and chandeliers, where you can get $300 bottles of Grey Goose. You just go up to the bar and order your tacos. They're nice! But it's still weird.

Anyway, the conceit behind Nick's is the "Nick's way" taco which, instead of having a double layer of soft corn tortillas, is constructed with one fried tortilla nestled inside one soft one, then filled with the taco innards. People in SF love Nick's way. I've had it twice and can't really get into it. The internal crispy layer is greasy and not quite crunchy. Give me traditional soft shell.

The tacos themselves are pretty good. I really love the perfectly fried and seasoned pescado. But I prefer Tacko in the Marina, also Nick-owned, which is a normal taqueria without the club vibe, and where the food seems a bit fresher.
author: Cecilia L.

description:
I feel like this place is pretty overrated. Their tacos where okay, had a lot of meat but were pretty mediocre for street tacos. They use the term "crispy" pretty loosely. I ordered mine crispy (which I think I was charged extra for), but my SO didn't. They came with the inner corn tortilla slightly crunchy and the outer rather soggy, so it defeated all purpose of frying the first one. On top of that, ALL of them came this way even the "soft tacos". 

Their elote is horribly disappointing. If you are looking for traditional elote, this is not the place. They do not use mayo, parkey or Parmesan. The horchada is incredibly thick almost like a milkshake. If you're into that cool, just not my thing.

Quite overrated in my opinion.
author: Erica E.

description:
A friend took me here one day for lunch claiming they had "the best taco's in the City." I should have known as soon as she uttered those words that this was not going to be a pleasant experience. Anytime a place claims they have the best anything, they are trying to make up for what they lack. And that is a paraphrased quote directly from Gordon Ramsey.

My first impression of the inside was one of horror. It looks like a seedy nightclub/strip bar that had the bright idea to try and sell "Mexican" food one day. Oh, wait, it is!! That is precisely what it is. A couple weeks ago (and years after I went there for tacos) I was misled into going to that club without knowing it was at Nick's. What a turn off. I'm sorry, but I just don't want to eat in a place that seconds as a gross city club that plays terrible music. 

The tacos are greasy, soggy, over-filled pockets of bland food that are WAY overpriced. And I have had a fish taco in Ensenada. Maybe that's my problem. But I kind of doubt it. There are plenty of other respectable taquerias in the city that serve amazing and actual Mexican food. 

I think Nick's is best for certain people who are too afraid to venture into the Mission for authentic food. Such a tourist trap and waste of money!
author: Nikki G.

description: Good atmos, tacos are basic but fun place if you're under 30 - would Noor come again? Hmmm maybe if my arm was twisted
author: Noor A.

description: Nick, you're not what you used to be. I still enjoy your carne asada nachos but my last visit left me wondering what had become of you. Your tacos lack the joy-inducing properties they once swelled with. And despite living so near, you're far from my first choice.
author: Miriam W.

description:
About a decade ago, I had a couple of friends who raved about this place, but I just did not like Nick's Crispy Tacos, so I avoided them at all costs. It was just the other week that I decided to be open-minded and try Nick's again.

Since I'm not a huge chicken/beef taco kind of person (which is what I normally would've gotten), I noticed Nick's offered fish tacos. I swore the heavens opened at the moment, so I ordered a pescado, Nick's way. 

The fish taco was excellent. It was fresh, crispy, and the fish was light and flakey, despite it being deep-fried. The guacamole, as I remembered, was still on point, as well as the pico de gallo. The chips, which seemed homemade, were nice and thick - SO good. 

And now I am constantly craving their fish tacos.
author: K. E.

description: Best Damn Tacos in Sf! I Could live off the Pescado tacos nicks way.
author: Brittany C.

description:
Omg. My stomach is so happy right now because of Nick's Crispy Tacos. 
A friend suggested this place to visit in San Fran and from the name I was expecting a dumpy Mexican place with cheesy furniture. Ahh big surprise. Nick's Crispy Tacos looks like a fancy lounge where people should be eating filet mignon instead of stuffing giant burritos into their mouths. 

There are these awesome velvety red plush booths situated around the restaurant and pretty twinkly chandeliers hanging from the ceiling. Yes, chandeliers in a taco joint. 

Not sure if this is a regular thing but the night I went they had $3 margaritas. So cheap! Cocktails under $5 are hard to find! By the time my food came I was definitely more than a little drunk and ready to chow down. 

Our food order came surprisingly quickly. I'd been craving real fish tacos since I left California 2 years ago so ordered the pescado burrito to satiate my craving. Baja mayonnaise, crispy fried fish, cabbage and lime= foodgasm. Best fried fish I've had in a while. The flavor combinations were !!!! And my burritio was gigantic! When the waitress brought it out it looked like this huge phallic object wrapped in foil. Couldn't finish the whole thing so ate the rest for lunch the next day and came back a day later because the burritio was so good I wanted another one. Technically it's big enough where you shouldn't be eating the whole thing for one meal...

Both times I came to Nick's the vibe was really good. The bar was closed when I came in the daytime so the atmosphere was more laid back. I hear it gets busy on weekends but I'd def recommend waiting to eat at one of the red plush booths. It makes pigging out on Mexican food so much classier. I doubt I'll ever stuff a humongous burrito in mouth in a classier setting. 

Nick's is very versatile. It's a great afterhours spot, pregame spot, and a great place just to eat some good Mexican with friend. I would love to come back to Nick's if I didn't live 3000 miles away. Def my fave place in San Fran to eat! Giving it an extra star just because of the pescado burrito
author: Yoshi K.

description:
On a late night hunt for food, my friend and I stumbled upon here because we wanted to try some fish tacos that we've heard so much about. The place is cute in a very relaxed/bar-like environment. The staff were all very friendly.

To start we've ordered nachos, which was house made chips topped with cheese sauce, gauc and pico de gallo. The gauc was amazing, maybe because I have been deprived from ripe avocados grown from California and had always been eating imported ones. We had ordered a Pescado taco, which is baja style fried fish in a corn tortilla with salsa, lime mayonnaise, cilantro, cabbage & onions. One of these tacos were pretty big and tasty as a matter of fact! The fish taco was truly amazing and it's not just a myth that I've been hearing all this time. I wish NYC make some amazing fish tacos like this. We've also tried the Pescado burrito, which is the same as the taco version, only this was in burrito form. However, the taco was no doubt better than the burrito. Since I'm at a Mexican restaurant, it's a must to order an elote (grill corn) with grated cheese and chilli powder. The corn was good, but honestly I had better back in NYC.

Overall, I loved the food here, especially the fish taco. Darn, wish I was in this part of town right now, just so I can experience the fresh guac and fish taco again. I guess I'll go out and get some NY style thin crust pizza instead, which is something that I didn't find in California =)
author: Sandy C.

description: This place is really great if you want a relatively quiet place to go, in the middle of the day, to grab some great food and watch a game, the ambiance is something you'd only find in San Francisco.
author: Adrienne L.

description:
OMFG ANOTHER MISSING REVIEW.

To recap:
-You want a taco, Nick's way. Thus, Nick's Crispy Tacos
-Skip on the frescas
-Get there too late and it turns into a bar/lounge 
-Ordering can be confusing if you don't know where to go or how to get things.
-Parking in the area may seem suspicious
-Cash only 
-The only thing that would make these tacos better would be some La Vic's hot sauce.
author: Grace Y.

description:
Rude and subpar service. I live in the neighborhood and have heard and read great things about this place. I am a taco fiend, plus I work in the service industry and bring a lot of superbly tipping people to spots. We walked in 5 mins before their Monday night happy hour ended for $9 margarita pitchers and $5 drafts. The girl at the bar saw us walk in, my sister goes to order some tacos and I stood at the bar to get the drinks. The tender was putting away bottles and I did not want to be rude, so I waited until she was done to order. 

We did not know they close at 10 and no one informed us. Then the bartender turns around to let us know that since it was 10 pm, after I waited 3+ minutes to have her attention, our pitcher would be twenty something and everything was the full price "since the POS system switches back automatically." My sister had a similar experience when trying to get us tacos; they mumbled something about someone coming into clean at 9:30. 

It was rude and horrible practice as far as customer service goes. So we said thanks, but no thanks, and took our business elsewhere. It's one thing to work at a business that is consistently busy, and have people walk in 5 mins before closing, but at least have the sense to let the guests know the deal. Rather than giving shit service with a bad attitude. Not too eager to try again, but I will update if it happens.  

I gotta say, in this area the service goes downhill as you go uphill.
author: Marina M.

description:
MOST EXPENSIVE TACOS OF MY LIFE. 

Ordered 2 fish tacos and a horchata. 2 tacos came out to be $10. 
No doubt, they were really good fish tacos, and the horchata is definitely one of the best I've had... buuuuut I definitely would prefer going to the mission to get my taco grub on instead. 

Definitely give this place a try if you haven't been, but I do prefer different taqueria joints in the mission a lot more. I'd probably come back for brunch and their $10 bottomless mimosas though.
author: Tiffany S.

description: After growing up in Southern California and going to college in San Diego it's been a real challenge to find a good taco Tuesday place in SF. I'll admit my taco and burrito standards are extremely high. That being said, the only thing worth getting here is a taco nicks way. Burritos, nachos, quesadillas, etc are all extremely disappointing and lack flavor and substance. A taco nicks way, preferably carne asada over chicken since the chicken tends to be dry, is flavorful with plentyyyyy of guac. The place is always packed, so that's a big downside because you'll probably end up eating standing up.
author: Victoria W.

description: Yum! Fab food. Pretty crowded. It's a scene. If you don't mind fighting for a table it's worth it.
author: Elizabeth K.

description: I have been coming here ever since they merged with Underdogs (see review).  But this is our favorite for big local sports events (especially away games) and the staff is awesome (and not because I went to high school with some of them). The place is narrow and lined by televisions which means that you are never far from a screen (or the bar).  It works well and doesn't get so crowded that you can't enjoy the game.  But the tacos really step it up to a different level. We're making this our Tuesday Taco night tradition after yoga and climbing at planet granite.
author: Mike V.

description: We live in the area and I don't know what all of the hype is about. The food is never fresh and they are typically stingy with the protein. The burritos are packed with too many beans. I usually order to go. They are quick and convenient.
author: H K.

description:
This is a review for Nick's Taco Tuesday.

Our large party (about 10-15 people) confirmed reservations for 7:30pm to celebrate a birthday. This was an absolutely must, since Nick's is infamous for their lack of seating and long lines.

After accepting the carpeted ceilings and Marina-style crowd that I had encountered here several times before, we headed to our table.

Lo and behold, a group of girls had taken our *reserved* table. So, we hailed the floor manager, who unapologetically explained to us that even though we had reservations, the new group was allowed to take our table. And, that "unfortunately," the decision was above her. 

When asked if some higher-up was sleeping with, dating, or somehow involved with a girl in that group, the floor manager said, "yes."

I'm sorry, what just happened?? 

So, all 10-15 of us were sent to a table suitable for 5. After 45 minutes of fitting 5 pitchers, a huge group of people, and a truckload of food on that puny table, the floor manager informed us that she had convinced the group of girls to swap with us.

At that point, we were so peeved and disappointed that, although we took the offer, it didn't really make up for the lack of professionalism and customer service.

So, that's what the two stars are for. Awful, awful handling of a ridiculous situation. And, you've been warned: TAKE YOUR RESERVATIONS WITH A GRAIN OF SALT. 

As for the food, here you go:

Pescado taco, Nick's Way ($5.95): Two corn tortillas are flash fried, then filled with lettuce, pico de gallo, fried fish, guacamole, and jack cheese. Super yummy, and very filling.

Nachos (~$6): Thick tortilla chips slathered with nacho cheese, pico de gallo, guacamole, and your meat of choice.

Quesadilla ($2): This was a part of the TT deal. A simple quesadilla with jack cheese. No frills, but damn was that tortilla flaky and delicious.
