Yes, the food is good. Yes, the waiters are nice and attentive. But after an experience like that, I can't recommend getting a reservation at Nick's.
author: Sharon V.

description: If I could give a zero, I would.  Food arrived cold and order was all wrong.  When we called to get replacements, they only resent the two things they did right - incl a bottle of water.   Called again and they said too busy to find all the orders.  We did eat one bite of what arrived and may have been the worst food I have ever eaten.  Place is disgusting.   Save your dollars and stomach.  Pitched it all and even the rats ran away.
author: Brian M.

description:
They have really good tacos! I think they are kinda overpriced though. Also I didn't know the right amount to order; I think I ended up ordering 3 because I thought they were really tiny, but they were bigger than I expected.

Order them Nick's way for sure - yummy! 

I'm not the biggest fan of the ambiance of this place in the daytime. It looks like the place was designed more for the evening/night time in terms of decor- kinda dramatic. You probably have the chance to have a lot of privacy here in the day though, the place seemed kinda empty (and was very large) when I went there.
author: Olivia C.

description:
Sensational tacos. The spot in SF for quintessential "baja" style fish tacos with a funky atmosphere. The carne asada burrito is also very good, but you could get a better one in the mission so stick with the tacos. They do serve corona light, but feel free to grab any beverage of your liking from the adjacent bar in the red lounge. One of the best guacamoles I have had as well, get it on your taco. 

Other trendier taqueria's in the city may have better atmospheres but they cannot match these tacos. Whether you are looking for a quick bite, or an extended dinner with drinks Nick's is the place to be.
author: Cash S.

description:
The only thing I order are any of their tacos Nick's way!!  Makes my mouth happy.  I drool just thinking of their tacos. mmm

p.s. I can never get a seat inside. :/
author: Caitlyn C.

description:
Took us almost a year to redeem our Yelp coupon here.  Husband and I came on a nice day so we were able to enjoy our food outside.  
This place was crackin' when we came here Sunday lunchtime.  Line was quite long, but it moved steady.  
Now on to the food.  I got the fish and shrimp tacos Nick's way.  My husband got carnitas and chicken tacos.  We both agreed Nick's way is better.  It is pretty pricey for a taco when I can get a $1 taco near my house.  But as I was waiting for our food, I read that they serve local goods...I'm all for that good job!  
Their watermelon fresca was good, still had the chunks and now overly sweet.  Would come back when around the hood.  

Nick's way all the way!
author: Claire J.

description: They screwed up my order twice and they were rude about it. Do I need to say anymore? I'll just go to the one in the Avenues, they seem to have better food and service.
author: Barney E.

description: I love Nick's. It reminds me of my years in SF. This place was a staple in my diet for 5 years. And so returning for the first time in nearly two years, provided me with endless joy. Their chips, salsa, and guacamole are fantastic. The chips are crispy and hold up to the chunky salsa and guacamole. I also ordered my usual: a vegetarian taco Nick's way and a grilled fish taco. And, upon checking in, I got a yelp check-in offer for a free chips and salsa. Awesome! Of course this place is busy. It's never not busy. But the line moves quickly and it's usually fairly easy to find a spot. And they have a full bar at Rouge so it's the perfect place to get a drink while eating your delicious tacos (or burritos or quesadilla). I know that this isn't exactly Mexican food, but it is delicious food and that's kind of all I care about.
author: Michelle E.

description:
Can't believe I've never been here before! This place is definitely another good one in the city. They have tons of different types of tacos. Each going for about $3ish a piece. Chicken, fish, carnitas...you name it they have it. They have a crispy corn tortilla wrapped with a soft corn tortilla and each one is huge.  Got a side of beans and rice and both were some of the better beans and rice that I've had. 

$3 margaritas (not so good) and a full bar (they transform into a night club called Rogue at a certain hour). Also had live music while we were there. The seating is definitely nightclub-esque...and small parties take the booths leaving the bigger groups to share a tiny round table. 

For the celiac/gluten intolerant- I asked about their ingredients. The guy at the counter said that the chips are fried in the same oil as the fish and the fish is breaded. 

CASH only! They have an ATM ,was told it charges a $5 fee.
author: Lily K.

description:
Tacos Nicks Way - it's the only way.
Tortilla Soup and the salad are also favorites, but you can't go wrong with the tacos!
author: Ben N.

description:
The guy and I came here on a Friday night because my spoiled ass wanted Fish Tacos sooooo bad. I'm so happy that he suggested this place. The tacos were deeeelish!!!! I also ordered Sopa De Tortilla to go and that was also really good. YUMMERS!! We ordered Margaritas which could have went back to the bar!!! I'm not a lush, but I also don't believe in paying for a watered down drink either!! 

The only down fall to this place, was how SUPER busy it was, finding a place to sit was like being a stalker!!! You have to watch people eat to see if they are almost done eating and pretty much hover over them just to get in the booth or seat before they leave the table. 

Overall I enjoyed my dinner and company. The drinks and being a stalker for 10 minutes were the reasons for 4 stars. 

BUT

I will go back though because the food was well worth it!!!
author: C D.

description:
The three stars are for their "line-caught" seafood and shrimp offerings. Not sure if a critter whose short lifespan was bathed in ambient Pacific radiation is preferable to a critter that spent its entire life cycle in a shit-filled mangrove puddle, but for what it's worth, the shrimps are super-tasty and fat.

Rachelle F., I totally hear you on the crispy tacos (and yes, as a policy, you should be angered by our collective stupidity). I am not sure what to expect from a crispy taco around these parts, as so few places serve such a thing. But yeah, whenever I get one of these (on a poorly thought out whim, usually), that layer of cheese always seems like it's been sitting there for a good hour, nonchalantly congealing. Maybe these are better as "sit-in" fare. I must also clamor against the guacamole - several times I have tasted what is clearly Old Guac, which is totally unacceptable for the price they are charging. 

The regular tacos are better and cheaper. Burritos are tasty, although definitely $1-$2 pricier than any of the authentic Mexican joints that are currently keeping themselves afloat in the Mission.

However, unless you are really desperate for Mexican food and do not have an extra half an hour to get to any part of town other than the north side of Polk, there's no point. Pancho's, only a few blocks south, is just as good - if not better for certain items. Definitely more "authentic". (The only thing authentic about Nick's is its inconvenience of being a CASH ONLY establishment.)

Speaking of which, I don't mean to gripe about lame and irrelevant BS like this, but it doesn't help that Nick's feels like it's a perma-popup in some skanky nightclurb. I am not a clurber, and I look with black disdain upon the popped-collar fools who line the streets to get into these sad places, loudly projecting their uninteresting presence and stinking up the air with cologne that smells of false consumerist promises... (May your cologne render you sterile, philistines!) So this is pretty much never a "sit-in" location for me, even though it's mostly families there in the afternoons... 

Anyway, come for the fancy seafood, and s...well, don't stay. Leave and eat yer food elsewhere, if you have any taste in decor.
author: Manfred D.

description:
When I want to bro out with some OK tacos and bros, I come to this chandelier be-decked neighborhood bar/taco place/sports lounge. 

The mister is obsessed with their tacos Nick's style, which comes with a large pat of guac and other fixins. I find the food consistently good, but on the bland side, but I can never tell how much of my enjoyment is from all the guac. 

Service-wise, I've only been here once where they didn't somehow mess up our order, and they can be cocky. Also, they're cash only - do not grok.
author: Selina K.

description:
prob my favorite place to go! shrimp tacos, fish tacos, bottomless mimosas!! im not from SF but everytime i visit my friend i end up going here and having a happy full belly. Keep up the good work guys.

also order nick's style or way worth the .95 cents
author: Stanley C.

description:
We were visiting San Francisco and ended up walking a mile to get to this place. However, we are out of shape mid westerners so this walk, mostly uphill, just about killed us!

But... TOTALLY WORTH IT! 

In ohio I mostly hate Mexican food now. The majority of the dump tons of salt in their food. 

Nick's was perfect! Oh and the green sauce on the table? Magic in a bottle.
author: Tony M.

description: Had a vegetarian and a chicken taco. Not the best or the worst I've had--I'd say just about average. The pico de gallo salsa a top of the chips did not taste that fresh, so I ate around it. We wanted to get drinks with our tacos, but you have to go to the bar and order those separately. Food came while my husband was still at the bar waiting to order drinks. The bar wasn't even that crowded. 10 mins later....he's still waiting. Eventually he gives up. Long story short--not a good system if you want to actually drink a beer with your taco. The ambience was kinda nice, but  would never go back.
author: G F.

description:
I ordered the vegetarian taco and LOVED it. Pinto beans, cheese, cabbage, salsa and a mound of guacamole. They are so generous with the guacamole. It came in 2 soft tortillas, but the inner tortilla had crunchy parts. I'm not sure if that was on purpose, but it was great. 

And our order was out within 5 minutes of sitting down, even though it was a crowded Saturday night. Really good tacos. Super speedy service.
author: Maleenee B.

description:
Fratty, hip and cheap drinks during happy hour. Sounds like the perfect combination for a post-work expedition. I'm a huge fan of the $3 margaritas and beer pitchers. 

However, when it comes to the tacos (which represents a third of the title the restaurant boats), I'm always left a bit disappointed and stoic. The tacos are very ordinary and a bit too soggy for my preference - even the extra guac can't save it. I much prefer Don Pisto's or Tacolicious for my taco-related cravings. 

But having said that, Nick's makes for a fun post-work spot. If you view it predominantly as a bar with taco-based bar food, I'd give this a much higher rating.
author: Priya S.

description: Nick's taco are just the best. I have been going there almost all day now for my lunch break. They are very addicting and I just adore all the staff there. They are very kind and friendly. I am a big niner fan so I always love spots that breeds sports Atmosphere.
author: Franny A.

description:
Get it done Nicks way with the shrimp... FANTASTIC! 

I will make sure I stop by Nick's every time I come to SF now!
author: Matt R.

description:
Fabulous tacos! I tried the pulled chicken taco the regular way (as opposed to "Nick's way," which I tried over at Tacko). It was a solid chicken taco! LOVE this place.

The nachos are pretty solid, too. Fresh and tasty chips!

Nick's is the perfect place to grab some tacos, beers, and chill in neighboring Rouge on a weekend afternoon!
author: Mansi A.

description:
Holy poo poo, oh my god.  

The tacos here are BRILLIANT.  I ordered a grilled fish taco and a pescado (fried fish) taco, both Nick's way, which means they add guac and cheese in it.  The crispy inner shell/soft outer shell combo is GENIUS.  I was completely shocked after my first bite because the texture was THAT good.  As for the fish itself, you get very hearty and fresh pieces.  They are super generous with the fish, which I appreciated.  The grilled fish was tender and cooked well.  The fried fish pieces were also huge and delicious.  The veggies, cilantro, and lime were great complements too.  

And also, dare I say it?  Yes, I will.  If you order it Nick's way, they put waaaaaay too much guac on your taco.  Which I guess really isn't a problem, and I should probably be slapped for whining about anybody giving you too much guac.  But...yeah, there's a lot of guac on those tacos, and that's an understatement. 

These tacos are also GINORMOUS.  When I was about to order, I was debating getting three tacos because I like to eat, but the guy taking our order was like, "If you're hungry, eat two."  I was like, "Hmm...I'm REALLY hungry.  How about 3?"  He looked at me and was like, "No."  And he had this deadpan, serious look when he said that - like, seriously, NO, three tacos = no bueno!  

He was right.  After two of those monster-sized tacos, I felt 100% stuffed.  Maybe even 110% stuffed.  I have never encountered such HUGE tacos, so loaded with plenty fish and lots of toppings.  Yes, if you're hungry, get two.  Although, my friend was also hungry, and he said he felt like he could eat another one after he had his two tacos.  So maybe you may be able to eat three if you're ravenous.

The decor here is also extremely odd.  I did not expect a place that does Mexican food to have chandeliers.  And these crazy-looking elevated red booths.  The entire place kind of reminded me of a Moulin Rouge cabaret scene.  Just...very odd.  But oh well.  

The tacos are also more expensive than we're used to.  Most are about $4.50, and if you get it Nick's way, then that's another 95 cents, so expect to pay $10-11 for a meal, if you just eat tacos.  Le expensive for tacos, but oh so totally worth.  

In conclusion: Nick's Crispy Tacos are a mouthful of awesome sauce!
author: Vivian C.

description: It's ok. I'm from florida and we don't have great mexican food, but we are a lot further away. Honestly kinda bland, nothing special and this should have $$ under price, over $6 for one taco "Nick's way". Not impressed.
author: Kevin K.

description:
Nick's Way or the Highway 

I had to try this place do to the fact, it bears my name. Of course, it was great. I have been here 3-4 times and each time, it taste better than before. I'm really a big fanatic of Crispy tacos. Love to hear that crunch when you bite into it. "Waking Up from my Taco dream" 

The Tacos are filled with meat, cheese and guacamole along with there house salsa and their Green and Red salsa. The red sauce is the BOMB. I almost "borrowed" the Red salsa bottle. Damn that stuff is good. 

During Happy Hour, you can't go wrong with $3 margaritas, yea that's right $3. Left there feeling good. Looking forward to going back....
author: Nic C.

description:
I love their street tacos and the steak salad. There are 2 corn tortilla
with each taco, so u can actually get 6 tacos instead of 3. Their squeeze bottle salsa are great.I like there free carbonated water. Tortilla soup is  fresh and has homemade quality to it.
author: LQ W.

description:
Good fish taco
Bad seating except for booths
Plastic cups of beer that's overpriced
author: David F.

description:
Love me some Nick's!
Generous with the guac (you do pay extra for it, so why shouldn't they be). The Baja fish burrito is my favorite fat kid treat (fried fish in a burrito = double healthy!).
Get the margarita at Nick's and not the nasty/sugary/cheap ones at the bar.
2 pieces of advice: 
1. don't think of this as "real taqueria food" -- it is definitely americanized, that doesn't make it less tasty, though. However, if you go in thinking you're going to get a good old mission style burrito, you'll be disappointed.
2. eat it hot! If you take it to go, it's nowhere near as good, if you let it get lukewarm.
author: Lisa B.

description:
We were walking on Russian Hill and we were looking for a mexican restaurant/burrito sort of thing.
we looked up Yelp since we trust people so much! My daughter just entered in this very dark night club looking place and we followed her and we loved so much the idea of turning  a night club into a Taco place.Most of it we really loved the TACOS!!!!!!So rich and yummie and very fresh! We tried the double tortilla, soft outside and soft inside and it was just the best taco I have ever had!
Will certainly return
author: elena l.

description: This place is pretty low key, however serves a more refined version of a cheesy gordita crunch from Taco Bell. You order any taco "crispy" and it's a hard shell on the inside with a soft shell on the outside. The type of place where you order at the counter and it appeared to be some sort of nightclub at night, which was strange. Overall, I would come back here and check out something else on the menu, all of which looked great!
author: Domenick F.

description:
Surprisingly excellent fish tacos. 2 were enough for hungry and 3 would be too much. Good service. Excellent horchata as well. Booths were a little sticky. 

The prices were a little much, and I was kinda hoping for more authentic street tacos for sure. but it's cool to order and sit and have a bevy, 

no alcohol for me that day,  thank you, too much pride. no really i had too much at pride, psh like I have dignity at all. 

I keep ordering fish tacos trying to find one that's comparable but alas...

So it worth going there for a nosh and some gossip. we got there about 11 I believe and the line was short, that changed in about 30 min, it was out the door.
author: Orian I.

description: The best place for Mexican food in the area. Their tacos are delicious, and so are their chips. Try your tacos "Nick's way".
author: Natalia M.

description:
Coming from a pretty ghetto part of queens, I can say I know authentic tacos. So when I come out to SF, I decided to skip Mission and try this place out for something different. This place is a nice in-between fancy and authentic. You enter a giant dining hall decorated in ornate red chandeliers and big red velvet booths. You order off to the corner your choice of cerveza and tacos. I had to get a Baja taco as they don't sell good ones in NYC. The batter was crispy and perfectly tasty. I was in heaven. 
The mexican corn on cob was also a treat as they were not skimpy on the cheese and lime. It also has a nice little kick to make that beer work even harder.

This place is really fun to go with friends and super spacious so it's great for large parties as well.
author: Rae F.

description:
I can say that I love this place...on a Tuesday. Truthfully, I only come here on Tuesdays. Why? They have a bomb Taco Tuesday.

Tacos are two dollars on tuesdays. They are loaded and absolutely delicious! They also have cheap quesadillas, chips and nachos. All very yummy. They have drink specials at the bar with 2-for-$6 coronas and XX and either $3 or $4 (i cant remember which) well drinks. The only problem is that getting to the bar is pretty hard. Getting a seat is even harder on a Tuesday night- unfortunately you may be eating your taco standing up if you didnt reserve a table.

This place is very fun and trendy. They have a dj playing top 40 and EDM mixed. Its for the "youngsters" I would say.
author: Viktoriya Z.

description:
Carnitas tacos done Nick's Way and an elote. I wouldn't come here for anything else. 

Reasons:

1. Carnitas are hella delicious. 
2. I like the combination a taco with a crunchy tortilla and soft tortilla
3. Corn is hella yummy and fun to eat on a stick
4. The stuff they slather on the corn makes it yummier, and thus is that much more fun to eat on a stick
5. Super reasonably priced. Just these 3 little things and I was set for the night.
author: Loli L.

description: This is the best place this side of town to get a good authentic taco. I recommend the crispy way, and who doesn't love a corn on the cobb with all the Mexican fixins... yummy! Fresh food, fun atmosphere and great service. This place is awesome!
author: Ada L.

description:
Newsflash, brothers: it's not "rude" when a server tells you something you don't want to hear, or enforces a policy you don't like.  It's only "rude" when it is, in fact, said or done in an uncivil, offensive manner.  

The folks at this weird taco venue have never been "rude" in my experience.  They're just a bunch of quirky mo-fos who don't really fit in in Russian Hill.  Call me cray, but I dig it.  Plus, they get super swamped with a bunch of waspy kids on one weeknight where them waspy kids are ticked and toasted by the time they are supposed to order because they've been... waiting.  Chill you guys. 

As for the Taco Tuesday madness itself: young people of SF, you don't really need to come here to be seen standing in line for what are not aksh $2.00 tacos.  Experiencing FOMO on this matter is not necessary.  Then again, you don't really need to come here any other day ending in y and spend more any way on these tacos.  Attend once if you must (buy a pitcher with your amigos while standing in line - that is worth it), but maybe desist after that slash... if you reach a certain age.  On this night of all nights, don't be that lost, old guy holding a table number looking for somewhere to sit in a crowded sea of overdressed brown haired boys and girls. 

tl;dr? Let me serve it to you another way. "Keek's Way": 

1. You're attending a $2.00 taco cluster fuck.  
2. Check your expectations at the door accordingly.  
3. [Semi-generous glob of guac goes here]

In conclusion, here's a picture of a "taco" for you: ({})
author: Keeks K.

description:
Meh....a taco bar that turns into a club @ night..what did I expect? We came here on a lazy Saturday for some tacos and ordered a few off the menu (nick's style) as well as some nachos. 

Pros: 
Nick's style fish taco-tasty, best thing we had there 

Cons: 
*Tacos are pricey @ 3.50-4.50 each 
*Place is not the cleanest; there's no salsa bar; the little squeeze containers of sauces don't look the most hygienic 
*The tacos were just not that flavorful-had no sense of the authenticity that I would get @ the taco trucks or even in the Mission 
*Nachos-whatever that cheese sauce is that they throw on there is definitely not edible 

Not horrible but would not be eating here again next time we are in this neighborhood.
author: Betty C.

description:
Pros:
The Pescado Taco here is the BOMB! Perfect crispyness, combination of guacamole, cabage, and crispy tortilla (nick's way). 

Cons:
- Chips and salsa
Chips is good and has the perfect crispyness, but it's not salty enough for me. The salsa tastes just ok as well. 
- Pollo taco is meh as. And it's filled with pinto beans as well, which makes it more like a burrito than a taco.

If you enter thru the main entrance of Rouge, turn right and you need to follow the line to order the tacos.

And if there's someone offering you to buy a drink while you're in line, they're from Rouge, not from Nick's. Don't order your $3 diet coke from them.
author: Novalina N.

description:
Okay, I didn't know what all the hype was about this place until I'd lived in the 'hood for a couple years, and tried it a half dozen times. That was until I ordered their fish tacos. Now I get it... 

Don't bother with anything else.
author: Christina S.

description: Great place to grab a taco when the mission is out of reach.
author: Reid H.

description:
3.5

FOOD:
1.) Quesedilla = I dunno, $10 for a quesedilla that came out cold and I didn't even like? uh no thanks.
2.) Tacos or chips = Haven't really been satisfied by any of the other times I've come here to eat. 

SERVICE:
Workers here are nice

ATMOSPHERE
Extra star only for convenience & the fact that it's inside Rouge.
author: Angela L.

description:
This place is seriously hoppin'. I can't think of a reason to give it anything less than 5 stars, and here's why:

Going to Nick's Crispy Tacos is an *experience.* You don't casually go there alone for the Tuesday special because that would be... lame. You go with friends, drink beers while you wait in the hour-long line, and then devour your $2 or ($3 fancy) tacos while you stand, smashed up against the table you squeezed into.
author: Andrew L.

description: ahhh, love / hate relationship. i actually dont think taco tuesday is that great of a deal, buttt its pretty delicious, and the margaritas are strong.  beers are cold and cheap, although the service is so slow - hard for them to focus on customers at the bar, perhaps? ive actually havent tried their tacos yet - but their chips are crispy and the guac is so fresh! i will be back for the tacos promiseee :)
author: Christina L.

description:
Had the grilled fish taco, Nick style (crispy with guac). 
The taco was decent, if WAY overpriced (-1 star). 
Nothing excuses the cockiness of the ripped guy behind the counter (-1), who just oozed arrogant condescension. Blech.
author: Noam S.

description: I'm sorry this place is a little confusing and the food is completely flavorless. I brought my dad here for his bday and it was quite upsetting to taste (or in this case NOT taste) the food. The entire meal was bland and lacked any kind of flavor! What's funny is that this place is called a Mexican food place but plays Puerto Rican salsa! Wake up owner not all Latina are the same. The staff is sweet and try to axioms date but when you have to get up and place the order yourself you might as well call this place a bar and not a lounge or restaurant. It lacks a lot. But let's start with adding flavor and workout emery from there..
author: Mike P.

description: Used to be a pretty good place for fish tacos and burritos, but the quality of food has noticeably declined this year. Not sure what's going on, but a store called "Tacko" further up in Cow Hollow serves Nick's entire menu and they do it right. Especially for the price, I wouldn't really recommend Nick's unless yer stone drunk.
author: Chris Y.

description:
Tacos were great! A little confusing on how it works, but we went on a Sunday and no real wait staff on that day. You order tacos at the taco bar (cash only) and then your alcohol from a different bar. 

Nick's way on the tacos was the way to go! Sauce on the table was pretty good but I'd recommend the hot sauce at the taco bar.
author: Dena M.

description:
Amazing vegetarian Mexican food! We shared their vegetarian soft tacos, burrito, corn on the cob and fresh pineapple juice for lunch. All of the food was delicious and their salsas were perfect additions. We didn't try any of their meat menu items but saw some of the others in the restaurant enjoying it. Definitely recommend Nick's for fresh, quick, authentic and delicious food. 

Bonus- it's a great place to watch sports especially during march madness!
author: G S.

description:
Bomb.com

It's the best when it's Taco Tuesday... $2 for huge, fully loaded tacos but I can't stand the lines and waiting around to find a table. Try to go early.
author: Debra T.

description: I am a huge fish taco fan, and while I thought Nick's was alright, I wasn't completely blown away. My Nick's way pescado taco came out over-fried, but I did enjoy the generous scoop of guacamole on top and the double-layered tortilla. If you go, be sure to give the elote a try!
author: Kelly R.

description:
Decent tacos but an awesome atmosphere. The atmosphere may sell me completely on this place as it offers good
Food, good beer and lots of tvs - all of course with red velvet booths and classy chandeliers. Always a good time.
author: Derek S.

description:
I thought I had committed a cardinal sin. I went to a place named for a specific item (crispy tacos) and did not order said item. Usually this leads nowhere good, but I was surprisingly let off the hook this time with my very delicious black bean and roasted corn salad topped with pork.

Perhaps it was because the tortilla strips that covered the top made it crispy anyway. Perhaps it was because the pork was so very good. Perhaps it was the dressing, which was also delicious. But, more than likely it was a combination of all of this.

The line looks intimidating, but it isn't that bad so don't be afraid to wait. And then once you have your food in your hands feel free to take a table or take it to go. Either way it'll be a meal you'll enjoy!
author: Tiffany N.

description:
Four stars? Seriously?
If ya'll think this is 4 stars, you are seriously overdue for a trip to San Diego, home of the REAL best fish/anything tacos in California. 

The fish tacos are alright, but the carne asada/pollo asada tacos are an absolutely disappointment. The meat was completely overcooked, dry and chewy, and the guacamole was bland. Not much else to the taco than these two things. And according to the name, the crispy taco shell wrapped with a normal shell is apparently the big selling point of the food, but I did not think it was special at all. Reminded me of Taco Bell's crunchwrap, and comparing to Taco Bell is never a good thing. 

Also, upon entering, the restaurant/lounge seemed to have plenty of open seats, but after looking, most tables were "reserved", even though the signs indicated that most of the parties for which they were reserved were not going to show up for another few hours.
Come on San Francisco, you can definitely do better.
author: Jessica C.

description:
So confused why so many claim that this place has the best tacos around. Really? Compared to Taco Bell perhaps. 

The food is low quality and the Margaritas are more Sour Mix then anything else. Tuesdays  are an absolute scene of Marina cronies elbow to elbow spilling the aforementioned beverage everywhere.

The only redeeming features of this place are the quantity of large TVs, spacious interior, and great happy hour beer pitcher specials making this place good for sports viewing with large groups.
author: David F.

description:
REBECCA is the manager/hostess that you'll probably see there on a given weeknight. 

Hands down, the most blatantly disrespectful, unprofessional, tacky employee at that establishment. My group and I literally were astonished at how disgustingly rude she was.

First: we arrive and had no reservation, so we were told to put our name on the Waiting List. Did that. On the tables, you see the times that respective parties are due to come in. It is known that you have 15 minutes to arrive before your reservation is surrendered. My friend went up to her to let her know the party was a no-show. She literally made every uncomfortable face imaginable telling him that she's "waiting" on them. ANOTHER 15 min. go by. Mind you, the next party wasn't due to arrive for another 1.5 hour. Then I go up to her. She's hard to catch because she now starts ripping & running for no noticeable reason as it was a slower night. I finally catch her and she feeds me bullsh-- about us having to wait even more until the party comes. Which one? The one not due for another 1.5 hour? Other people there noticed her blatant attitude and laughed because she was making 0 sense.

We tell her we are going to sit down because that's what the restaurant rules call for at that point. She tells us to go ahead. THEN, she tells us we have to walk to the other side to order because we didn't have a reservation. Oh? I tap the others next to us who also didn't have a reservation and put a name on the waiting list what the deal was; YES, a server does come to your table. No, you don't have to "walk over to order at the register."

Long story short, REBECCA is complete trash. She needs to go. I can't even justifiably put into words how UP FRONT her attitude and disrespect was. Even the STAFF and other manager agreed that people have complained about her. Why is she still working there? Telling everyone I know to never patron that place.
author: L. B.

description: So so good. Seriously... So good. That is really all that needs to be said. Great accidental find. Awesome interior. Good service. Bring cash. Did I mention they have a fried chicken taco. Portions and presentation are great. Fish burrito was awesome. This is our go too in sf.
author: Danielle C.

description:
Fair warning, Nick's is NOT your typical taqueria taco, but it will be one of the top 5 tacos you put in your mouth. 

I should mention that Nick's does a bottomless mimosa brunch. If you don't know what that means, you haven't lived in SF long enough. 

I'll admit, operating out of a nightclub during the day makes good business sense for the club owner. It's weird in reality. The whole place gives this vibe that you should be grinding on a stranger, but you're sitting down eating with friends. 

That being said, it is very, very good. Get the fish taco. Drink 3 or 4 too many mimosas. And you'll have a great time.
author: C. Nikole S.

description:
I can see why people love or hate this place. Basically, the tacos here can really hit the spot late at night when you're starving or just want something greasy. The nachos are also a crowd pleaser. However, no one will say the food here is authentic or really good Mexican food. It's altogether just great fast food.

What I dislike the most about this place though is the smell. It basically smells like "spilled alcohol on floor" all the time. Occasionally, it can have a hint of vomit or cleaning agent attempting to mask it. This shouldn't be surprising cause the venue doubles as a night club.
author: Victor W.

description: Good tacos. Wtf with salsa and guacamole ON the chips? Soggy mess of yuck in less than 10. Bartender was literally the worst, took way too long to take our order, messed up our drinks (2 of the house specials) and was rude. Ugh tacos weren't good enough to make up for the rest.
author: Krista I.

description:
Solid place. I went here and split a taco salad, tacos, and a quesadilla. (Yes that's a lot of food, we were stuffed) Everything was very good. The tacos nicks way was very unique and delish. I recommend getting it that way if you go here, because hey, its nicks crispy tacos! The quesadilla was very solid. I love hearty quesadillas because you get all the ingredients to gel together really well and give you a really wonderful flavor. The taco salad was unique, with many tacos strips rest on top of the salad, and while it was pretty good, it was difficult to eat with out making a huge mess.

Which brings me to my next point, and my only major knock on Nicks. It was kinda dirty. They share space with a bar and the booth we sat at did not exactly look inviting or really clean. I realize that much of their food is messy, and it is a bar, so things will spill, but it just wasn't a really nice place to sit. Some places the food will cover for this by being a cant miss item. However, Nicks doesn't have that good of food. I mean its great and if I was drunk I would love this place because I wouldn't care that the table was dirty or the seats had bits of lettuce and salsa on them. But I wasn't drunk, so I did care.
 
Food is solid, 3.5 stars, but place is dingy. So balance out with a 3.
author: Tom O.

description: Definitely don't come here if you are looking for good Mexican food. The Carne Asada wasn't even marinated, not to mention my friends didn't care too much for their burritos either, they got fish and carnitas. The mojito wasn't very good either. There were good vibes to watch the basketball game and to drink...but our waiter was pretty rude and wasn't very good about customer service skills. She came over to tell me that I couldn't put my dog on the seat and after countless times attempting to tell her why (which was leading to "but I didn't know, sorry" she kept cutting me off and it made me not want to apologize after all because she wasn't letting me finish. Then I asked her to leave because she was just hovering over me and my dog when I was trying to undo the leash but also, hold my dog so she didn't run away, and it was triggering anxiety because she was towering over me. She gave me attitude and said she was going to put the chair away with a rude tone so I naturally got angry and said to leave again because her hovering was crowding my personal space and making me extremely anxious. I don't think I need to explain myself to people especially when I said I would move the chair myself (it belonged to my table anyway, not a different area) and asked to leave the first time. But she kept saying "I'll do it" in an annoying and rude tone and loud volume, borderline yelling. She kept giving me dirty looks throughout the night not letting me feel comfortable as I ate and three of my other friends noticed this rude behavior as well. She wouldn't let me have my tiny dog on my lap either, saying it was against the policy which is weird because she originally said she couldn't be on her own chair. My dog is really small and I was worried she was going to get stepped on with all these people walking around. I think if she was nicer I wouldn't be so upset because I know there are rules about such things. It's not what she said but how she said it and how she continued to behave. Unprofessional, why did they hire her? Never again. Huge buzzkill. Don't go for the burritos or good customer service skills that's for damn sure.
author: Hana K.

description: Really delicious carnitas burrito - large amount of food for the price. Flavorful food and a nice atmosphere!
author: Megan M.

description:
Note that happy hour ends at 9:30pm on Tuesdays, although you can get the tacos to go until 10pm. After 9:30 on Tuesdays, the tacos are full priced, and you can only buy them to go. The tacos just aren't as good once they are wrapped in foil and placed in a paper bag. They are probably crispiest fresh out of the fryer and put into a basket.  

That said, the tacos Nick's way are an awesome idea. Tons of avocado on a crispy shell packed with meat can definitely make my day. Just be sure you get there before 9:30pm in order to get $2 regular tacos and $3 Nick's way tacos.
author: Audrey L.

description: Great place. House margaritas were $4. Tacos were great. Got carne asada and camarones Nick style..hard shell, jack cheese, and guacamole. Nice lounge seating and Giants on TV.
author: dylan d.

description: One of San Francisco Foodies' favorite taco shops in town, second only to Tacolicous.
author: SF F.

description:
The fish taco here is pretty damn good.  While I was eating it, my friend, who is a huge fan, kept asking me what I thought of it.  I thought it was okay.  I said I wouldn't go back.

But the past few times I've driven past, I've thought about the taco and wanted to eat it.  I haven't been back yet, but I would definitely go back!  So I lied.  It was pretty good after all.
author: Erika C.

description: It was my 1st time in the city, I was hungry and knew I wanted Mexican food. I saw the 2k reviews on Yelp and thought I'd give it a try. I ordered the bacon breakfast burrito and my wife ordered a fish and carne asada taco. The burrito tasted like the ingredients was made hours earlier and the carne asada was tasteless and dry.  The fish taco was exceptional but nothing amazing. We did pay the extra $1.25 per taco to which seemed like only toasting the tortilla over the stove.  I will definitely not return if I was looking for good Mexican food
author: Jed W.

description:
A good friend is one who knows exactly what to recommend when you call up at lunchtime after having landed into SFO after an hour-long delay and are starving. DK suggested Nick's Crispy Tacos on Polk and Broadway without hesitation. He didn't even ask what I felt like eating or where I was in the city. It didn't matter. Because he knows I love a good taco and awesome pico de gallo. Which is exactly what we found at Nick's Crispy Tacos. When your friend tells you, "You'll like it," that's a pretty confident statement. Especially to me. 

We parked at a meter at $2/hour, with a 1 hour limit. Stupid SF meters. You can enter from the corner, or through their "main" entrance under the name of the restaurant. You walk in and there's a counter to your right and a menu above that. There's usually a line (it never died down the entire hour we were there), but it moves fast because the people there know what they're doing. I ordered a carne asada taco (Nick's style which comes with a crispy shell layer and cheese) and a grilled fish taco. They were about $4/each, not cheap for tacos. We also got a large watermelon agua fresca $4 and a salsa and chips with guacamole $4. They hand you your drink and chips right there as you pay. CASH ONLY. Total bill for 4 tacos, chips and drink came out to about $27. 

You look around and there is red decor with semi-circle booths, tables scattered and a huge bar in the adjacent room. I went to the bathroom and it was super creepy, with doors falling off the hinges and you can just tell that this is a place where either murders happen or people barf after drinking too much. Found out it was the latter since this place turns into a lounge at night (no tacos!). 

You get a number and they bring out your food fairly quickly. The tacos were pretty substantial, but I wasn't really into Nick's style. The crispy shell didn't do anything for me, but the filling was good. Next time I'll know to get it without beans because that just takes away from the flavor of the meat. The carne asada was tasty and filling. The grilled fish was pretty good too and the piece of fish was generous. 

Best thing was the chips and salsa with a scoop of guacamole. I would've been happy with more guac, but for $4, you really can't complain. The pico de gallo was piled high on thick chips. I couldn't stop stuffing my face with them. One person in our group got the quesadilla, which was the biggest quesadilla I've ever seen, and I'm not just saying that to be polite. Someone else got chicken tacos, which she liked. And GL got baja style fish and carnitas. He said he didn't really like the flavor of the carnitas, but it also could've been because it was Nick's way too. That just wasn't a favorite at our table.

Great experience, friendly service and I'm still thinking about the chips and salsa. That night, I saw Nick's listed as a favorite in 7x7 magazine in the hotel room. Good friends don't steer you wrong.
author: Ming-Jou C.

description:
I always get the same thing whenever I have Nick's Crispy Tacos: the Pescado Taco Nick's Way. This is the best taco I've ever had. I usually always get two of these. 

The fish is fried and super delicious. Having it Nick's Way (fried with guacamole) is the best way to have the tacos. This does make each taco pretty expensive but I think the taste is really worth it. I've had this delivered before. Nick's Way is just okay if it's delivered but definitely get it if you eat it fresh at the restaurant.

Overall, Nick's Crispy Tacos is one of the best tacos I've had but can get pretty pricey.

Pros:
-Amazing Pescado Taco (Nick's Way)
-Did I mention I normally get 2x Pescado Tacos since it's so tasty?

Cons:
-Taco + Nick's Way can get pretty pricey for tacos
author: Paul U.

description: Yum! Great delivery Mexican food, usually pretty speedy. Would give five stars but they forgot one of my items last time (first time) - refunded me when I called though.
author: Taylor A.

description: The tacos here were pretty good especially if you get them "nick's way". I only gave them 4 stars because they are cash only and carne asada was pretty dry. Other than that, amazing ambience with a live band playing.
author: Michael H.

description: This is my go-to place for tacos or burritos in the city. Between friends and I we've had chicken, beef, pork, and fish...all good. If you get tacos, be sure to get them Nick's way! Great place to watch a big sports game!
author: Janelle G.

description:
This place is OK. I suppose it doesn't help that I was here on a Friday night when it was filled with IDIOTS, and the queue was some forty people deep for tacos, and getting a table was harder than obtaining a work visa. The atmosphere is somehow both cafeteria-ish and rococo. I did not care for it, sir.

The tacos are cheap ($3) and you need to pay cash. I don't remember paying at all, but I do remember my fried fish taco falling apart in my mouth, and some sorry-looking girls with smudgy mascara giving me cut-eye. The taco was passable, but not worth tweeting home about. (That's what the kids say now, gramps. Get used to it.)

Surely there are better options for drinky-tacos in the city.

Obligatory Title Pun: The Velvet TACO-ground and NICK-O.

Menu Readability: I dunno, brah.

Need to mention: I counted some eighteen chandeliers in this place. What the moose. 

What this place teaches me about myself: Don't look at ME like that with your scuffed up face, girl. Sheeeeeeeit.
author: Vivek S.

description: Love this place. Tacos are awesome and so are the drinks. You can dress casually or in bar attire to enjoy a night out with the girls. If you haven't been you def need to try it out!
author: Victoria A.

description: Good food, excellent service! Came in on a Monday afternoon, and the staff patiently answered all our questions. Ordered two tacos Nick's style and it did not disappoint. Five stars especially for the gentleman who ran after us and returned my wallet!
author: Mari X.

description:
I love this place.  The tacos are very good. They are crispy and delightful.  And when you order nicks way, it's very filling. Nicks way is basically the works that includes a hefty dose of guac, pinto beans, and cheese.  They also have burritos that are very good, however the quality of the burrito tortilla is not great.  I've been to a number of Mexican restaurants that have really good tortillas and that is what makes the burrito great.  These tortillas are soft and grewy, almost wet.  If they had different tortillas That were thinner and a little bit crispy, the burritos could take it to the next level.  It's a cash only establishment so that is something to remember.

Nicks is attached to a bar that are 2 separate business entities.  The cool thing about the place is that the bar allows you to sit at the bar and eat when you order some food.  They make pretty stuff margaritas which go we'll with the Mexican food from nicks.

The crowd is younger, to where you may or may not run into somebody puking in the toilet...I did!
author: Jeremy E.

description: Tried ordering three times before they called me and told me my house is out of delivery range even though my neighbor across the street ordered from them two weeks ago...
author: Ed C.

description:
This was defintely a top 3 taco experience for me off all time!

Came here on a monday night with some friends (had reserved a booth - wasnt necessary) and had an amazing experience. The bartender hooked us up and was super sexy, but the highliught of the night were the tacos. Each one of us got three tacos (more than enough for 3 bigger guys), but we ate every morsel of food. We all got them "Nick's Way" (or the only way you should get them) and it was like eating something that came down from heaven. My personal favorite was the pescado, but the carne asado wasnt far behind. Next time I'm back in the bay area this will be the first place i stop!
author: Eric L.

description:
Luckily I got Nick's Way on my Carne Asada taco. The guacamole definitely does make all things better. The carne asada was rough and lacked a strong flavor. The crispy flour tortilla is a nice touch but doesn't make the taco to die for. 

Also ordered the 2 for $5 special with Churro (1) and Chips and Salsa. The chips were very crispy and weren't made by Tostitos. The salsa was also fresh. Add some guacamole in there and you'll be in heaven. The Churro was as expected; sweet, sugary dough goodness.

Decent place to check out but not on my bucket list.
author: Kathy W.

description:
The tacos are still expensive but I like this location better then the Sunset location

5 stars for the happy hour specials at rouge before it becomes a night club! $10 pitchers of beer and $18 pitchers of margarita to go with your delicious tacos yummm

Their tacos I would say taste better then Underdogs but this place puts less guac then Underdogs. 

Nachos here WAYYYY better! They use cheese sauce (which I think all nachos should consider using)

Usually I only go to Nick's/Underdogs to have their tacos but someone recommended that I try the quesdilia and SWORE I would not regret it. They were right. It is really DEEP FRIED to perfection :) 

I'm definitely a fan of this location and would come back again and the quesdilia is a definite must to go along with your tacos
author: Annie L.

description: The fish tacos are great. They are loaded with all the goods and not to spendy at all. Flavorful and filling lunch.
author: Ronald B.

description:
Nicks Crispy Tacos just might be my favorite spot for the famous crispy fish taco. I came here with a few buddies on a Tuesday and it wasnt anything close to what i expected. the line was out the door and the place was jam packed. this place was crackin'..

Nicks is basically a small portion of the venue in the corner. it shares the same venue with the lounge/ nightclub Rouge. this place was huge but with barely any room to walk. 

We ordered a bunch of tacos and nachos. The other tacos were ok but  the most favored is definitely the fish. and these tacos arent your ordinary small tacos. they were some big boys in my opinion. two will do you good, but one is just perfect. 

i agree with some of the yelpers with the price but personally, i think its worth it. its pretty damn good.  and luckily we came on a tuesday because it was $2 tacos for all except the fish taco! the fish taco was $4.95 plus .95 cents to make it "Nicks Way"

Basically, Nicks is the place to be at, especially on a Tuesday! Cheers to beer and fish tacos.
author: Rudy R.

description:
GREAT margarita's!!!!!  And they are very generous with the tequila!  I ordered the burrito.  I'm pretty sure that thing was 10 pounds!  It's totally big enough for 2 people.  The guacamole was amazing!!  There is nothing better than really good guacamole!

The only problem was trying to find a table.  It is not the easiest thing to do.  It takes a little teamwork and some creeping.  Also, it did take a while for me to get my food.  We all ordered on the same ticket but mine came 15 minutes after everyone else got theirs.  I was holding up the whole table because I hadn't eaten yet.
author: Sarah F.

description:
Seriously?  To die. 

A work buddy of mine took my team out to Nick's Crispy Tacos after we hit up a wine joint around the corner.  

I'm excited to write this review because the experience was so unique.  This taco joint is literally in the corner of a night club (photo: goo.gl/GdGc0)  that is fully lit during the early evening.  It kind of feels like that time when they turned the lights on at 2am but you were still dancing?!

You've got to order your taco "Nick's way." (menu: goo.gl/PyxTY) 

Cheap, funky, and delicious.  GO! GO! GO!
author: Nick S.

description:
1. Go here with a bunch of friends at 11 a.m. 
2. Get yourself some amazing burrito or breakfast quesadilla at Nick's and 
3. Take a seat with a few pitchers of mimosas near the bar
4. Have the time of your life wasting the day away.

Worth the memories.
author: Emily R.

description:
I like tacos, who doesn't like a good taco...

Having lived in Phoenix for 8 years I wouldn't say Nick's has the best taco's but I will say they're decent. I'm pretty sure I could find a place in Mission that has better food but hey when in Russian Hill...

I had the Camarone taco and a Pollo Asado taco but done Nicks way. The prawns were a bit over cooked and the guacamole had a bit too much salt in it but the Pollo Asado taco made up for it.

Service was good. It's cash only, counter style and probably one of the cheaper places to eat in Russian Hill which is always appreciated.

Decor...interesting...I kinda like the idea of eating in a nightclub by night and restaurant by day...
author: Leanne S.

description:
First things first:  CASH ONLY.

Secondly, I have been trying to find a good fish taco up here but have failed for one year.  Well, my time came when I found this gem!  Growing up in SoCal and being so close to Baja, I can say the best tacos are either found in San Diego or LA.  BUT!  Nicks fulfills my fish taco needs like I'm not a 10+ hour drive from the border.  Service is always nice and the fish taco is consistent and TO. DIE. FOR.  Great value in one little fish taco :-) One's enough but two is better!
author: Alex T.

description: The best taco Tuesday! Rebekah and her staff take care of everyone. Call ahead a few days in advance for a table reservation. Get a fun crew of friends together for a nice night of margaritas and delicious tacos--always Nicks way
author: Rachel S.

description: Hate the loudness and drinking culture in nicks so I always get something to go. The burritos are amaze and so are their tacos. If you get their super spicy hot sauce be prepared for a truly hot experience. Cash only. They do have an arm.
author: Alissa M.

description:
Nick, whoever you are, have you patented your idea? Just sayin'. Anyway, I can't hate. Why? I love fried anything. What you did, genius!!! Read on....
This is NOT your typical "Mission" type of taqueria. Don't come here expecting to bite into an authentic cooked taco. The reason, Nick does it different. FRIED and cooked to a taste of perfection. Crispy-deep fried tortilla with your choice of poultry. Albeit, pollo, pollo asado, carne asada, carnitas, pescado, etc. And topped with cheese, salsa, and guacamole. Hence the coined term, "Nick's Way." My favorites: Pescado (baja-style) and Pollo Asado tacos, Nick's Way. Oh, if you check-in through Yelp, you get a free basket of chips and salsa.
Depending on the days that you drop in for that taco, don't do Taco Tuesdays. I'm not up for it at all because it gets packed. I can wait another day for it. Best time for arrival? Doesn't matter. The line doesn't move that slow. Food comes out pretty quick. Roomy booths, tables and TV screens to watch sports are cool points for me. FYI...they do turn this place into Rouge Lounge for late night after hours of drinking.
Would I come back? Yes!
author: Fraulein C.

description:
It's located inside a dive club/sports bar where the interior is painted red.  Even the ladies bathroom is lit with a dim red lightbulb. So who would have thought the food would not only be good but pretty darn amazing!?!?! 

My favs:

Fried fish taco - Nick's way

Carne Asada Quesadilla 

Nachos topped with stewed chicken, sour cream, guacamole and jalapeños 

Elote - Best Mexican corn on the cob. 

If I can stuff myself with all of what I listed above in one seating and not gain an inch I would....almost everyday! Yes, it's really that good!!
author: Chelsea V.

description: Taco Tuesday deal used to be an actual deal... They've upped the prices recently to essentially just a buck or two less then full menu price. Not the deal it used to be. Many in our group were disappointed. There are other spots for taco Tuesdays.
author: Sean D.

description:
Good taco's overall, the namesake crispy taco's stand out. Tried grilled chicken & carnitas, both were good. Price wise it's a little more expensive than Mission taco's but... you're far from the Mission so consider the price a transportation fee. 

Have to mention the venue. Nick's crispy is essentially a taco stand located in a bar. First time I went I thought I had the wrong place. Overall the atmosphere is nice. Seating is hard to come by. Alcohol & food are ordered in two separate locations.
author: Paul K.

description:
Taco Tuesday! $2...Taco Tuesday! $2...What does this mean?! :P

When it comes to tacos,  I get really picky because I grew up in a hometown full of authentic Mexican tacos in LA and San Diego.  I was a little thrown by the name of this place...Nick's Crispy Tacos.  Who is Nick?  What does it mean tacos are crispy?  HmMmMm?  Thought Bubbles were surrounding my head. * Bloop-Bloop*

Because it was my first time coming here, I was not expecting the place to be bumping like it was a Friday night.   Everyone was watching the baseball game, DJ mixing music, drinking margaritas/beers, eating tacos and having a good time.  

My friend and I stood in line that was long as the length of the building.  While we were waiting, we saw basket full of tacos swinging by us that looked full, juicy and tasty.  

Finally, it was our turn to order.  A group of 4 of us got the following tacos for $2 each. (We got Nick's way for a $1: guacamole, cheese and lettuce)

2 - Vegetarian
2- Chicken
3 - Beef
1 - Carnitas 

And of course, a pitcher of margarita on the rocks.  

I have to say that it tasted really good as it looked when I was waiting in line.  It was on a fuller side, but you can't say no to meat.  It was pretty close to what I get from home.  I have to say, "Kudo's, Mr. Nick."  After grubbing down, we left the place with satisfied stomachs.  

I'll be back for some more $2 tacos on Taco Tuesday! :P
author: Deborah C.

description: Amazing crispy tacos with creamy avocado. Bottomless mimosas for $15 was just what I needed on a 90 degree day in the city.
author: Terry B.

description: Great crispy fish tacos! Their taco Tuesday is too busy for me , but I would suggest someone check it out if they want a good deal on regular tacos and a social environment.
author: Natalie B.

description:
On food alone, it's pretty close 4.5 stars.  Granted i've only ever had the fish tacos.  Baja and Pescado...but there's a reason it's on the SF 7x7 Mag 100 must things to eat in SF list.

Too bad it's freaking expensive.

Get charged extra Nick's way.

Base charge of the tacos are pretty close to $4.  Pretty absurd for 1 taco.

Raised prices of fish tacos after BP oil spill...bet they won't bring this back down either.

Cash Only

The wait in line....too long.  Chop chop!!

I know these are all negatives, but those tacos are so damn good.  I'll be back, because in the end...i'm a sucker for Nick's.
author: Kyle W.

description:
The baja-style fish tacos are the best tacos -- fish or otherwise -- that I've ever tasted. The fish tacos also are quite filling, which makes them a pretty good calorie-to-cost value too.  And, if you are particularly hungry, the elote is delicious, if a little messy. 

The only downside is being at Nick's. The restaurant is also a lounge that is filled with lots of "bros" and the ingrained grit of thousands of spilled drinks, stubbed out cigarettes, and generously applied perfume/cologne.
author: S E.

description:
I've been to Nick's countless times, at all times of the day, and can't find anything worth complaining about.

Such a fun place to watch sports, grab casual drinks, or satisfy a taco craving.  For the price point, this place is a steal.  They always have great specials going on, the vibe is upbeat and fun, overall Nick's just offers up consistent good times.

Don't forget to order you tacos Nick's way :)
author: Brianna M.

description: Not bad, not great.  Bar staff could be friendlier.  Bathroom could be cleaner.  Fun environment for a cocktail and some yummy nachos.  I'm never blown away by Nick's, but I always have a good time.
author: Melanie K.

description: The pescado and grilled fish tacos ordered Nick's way were solid but the venue is way too noisy and caters more to a party crowd than the foodie.
author: Jim S.

description:
I lived about 3 blocks from Nick's Crispy Tacos, and this definitely became my Tuesday night spot - Taco Tuesdays, of course. Make sure to get here early with a group of friends, or even make a reservation beforehand! A lot of people don't know about this, but you can reserve one of those comfy round table booths ahead of time. If you end up coming at primetime, like 8pm or so, you'll find yourself waiting in like for about 30 minutes and will likely have to stand while eating. Oh also, when you're waiting in line, you can order a pitcher of margaritas from the bar side of the restaurant.

I would recommend that when you get your tacos, get them "Nick's Way" - this comes with guac, cheese, sour cream, etc. And I LOVE the green sauce that's inside bottles on all the tables. I usually just need 2 tacos to fill me up! Boys usually need 3. 

I've never been, but Nick's has bottomless mimosas on weekends, so keep that in mind and make sure to check that out at some point.
author: Priya G.

description: Awesome awesome tacos... you HAVE to get it nick's way which is kind of messy but so worth it! the nachos are also very delicious. Been here three times...one time during happy hour and you literally have to stalk people as they eat so you can swoop in before they even lift their butts so that you can take their seat... another time the restaurant was closed for a private event but we were able to order take out and there were a few tables out side to quickly inhale your tacos... and the last time I was there we had just gotten there shortly after they had opened and right before the lunch rush and it made the experience so much more stress free and delightful, the place filled up rather quickly after that though.
author: Beanne N.

description: So delicious! I got 2 fish tacos (fried not the filled ones) and really enjoyed them! They were crispy as promised. And so fresh! The guacamole was honestly the best party. They're not skimpy with their guac as so many other places are. The restaurant turns into a club at night so it's kinda interesting to be there during the day with all the lights on and club decor. Brought a friend from out of town for lunch here and she absolutely loved it. She wants to come back to the bay just for more tacos!
author: Nicole S.

description:
As far as I can tell this place has the best taco's in town. Don't miss Happy Hour on Tuesday,  not only the tacos are still great, but it's pretty packed and is a good opportunity to socialize. 
Food is cash only, bar accepts credit cards.
author: Steve E.

description:
After hearing about Nicks Crispy Tacos for like forever, and after driving by the place weekly for years, I finally ventured into the place.
This is no ordinary taco shack. In fact, it's a lounge. And the tacos? They were ok. 
With a moniker that includes the words "crispy tacos", I was surprised it cost extra to get 'em that way! Anyhow, Just tack on that extra $1.45, or whatever it was, and you've got their namesake taco.
The shells were cool, kind of a wide mouth shape,  with plenty of filling, but that shape makes them tough to eat, too. The carne asada was tasty. The chicken, unfortunately, was kinda bland. As for crispy? More of a chewy crunch, like a home fried taco shell thats been warmed up in the microwave oven.
My wife tried the elote, but she said too much chili powder didn't allow her to enjoy it fully. I liked it though. 
The staff was great, ambiance super cool, and even if the tacos weren't as mind blowing as my lady's home made ones, Nicks was a cool change up... so would I go back? Definitely.
author: Jesse M.

description:
I'm not a fan of fish. But, I tried their fish taco because my bestie loves that stuff and just can't shut up about it.
I wasn't a fan...of the fish, itself. BUT, I loved that crispy taco on the outside. Weird cuz it's just a taco but, hey...that's what I liked about the taco.

LOVED THE ELOTE!!!! And that's the only reason I'm giving this place 3 stars. The spices, mayo, butter on the corn was DELICIOUS together. And it was spicy. SO spicy that after munching on it a couple times, my lips burned. Alas, I loved that corn (elote) so much that I finished it. AND that ear of corn was huge. Like, ridiculously huge. In a good way, mind you.
author: Laurie V.

description:
Gah this place was crowded! I mean we did visit on taco Tuesday during an NBA finals game but still...geeze. Luckily we showed up early and got about 5 or 6 seats at the bar. I wish I had known that we could reserve booths. Service was pretty slow but enough to get me buzzing. Despite this I can still say I enjoyed my time. My tacos were huge and packed full but definitely a challenge to eat standing up.

I would visit again.
author: Dustin R.

description: This place came with a solid reputation and I must say that it lived up to that. Their vegetarian tacos are the best ones I've had in the city till now. These are your just your regular soft-shell tacos except that the edges are delightfully crispy. While the contents are fairly standard (beans, pico de gallo, guacamole, lettuce etc), the proportion is just right, making for a tasty and wholesome taco. The taqueria is part of a larger sports bar with your standard drinks menu and multiple big screens. Watching the champions league final as you trash-talk your buddies supporting the other team with a mouth full of guacamole...ah, perfect. I'm hoping that they continue to screen soccer matches. `Coz if they do, I'm gonna be there.
author: Srivatsan S.

description:
My friend and I took 3 buses to get here from SFSU... because I got us lost. Yep.

Since Ike's Place was having a power outage (sadface), we decided on eating at another place. We had been starving the entire day and we're ready to become cannibals ): (ahaha...... eh.) He said he felt like eating something cheap and local, so my iPhone pointed us here.

The decor of this place is really cool! Chandeliers and dim lighting, definitely my kind of place. It's also very spacious and clean. The workers are very friendly and sharp, the guy got my (extremely) precise order correctly! Woot!

I ordered a fish burrito and my friend ordered the pollo asado burrito. The total was supposed to be $13 plus tax, but it somehow ended up to be $19?? What the heck? MINUS ONE STAR! D:

We got our burritos after about five minutes and man were they huge! After carrying them for awhile, it started feeling like carrying the flour baby from 7th grade science class... Geebus! My forearm was actually really sore by the time we got back to his dorm, it was crazy!

The burritos were filled with tons of stuff, and they didn't fall apart!! This is the first place where I've gotten such a big burrito without having it fall apart, coolio! The tortilla was really thin and was stretched out a lot, so we were very confused on how it stayed in tact... Chemicals, maybe?

Oh well, it left us full with half the burritos left. I went through a whole container of green sauce... Awesomeness.
author: Elaine N.

description:
The best for Taco Tuesday! I was so surprised by the prices of the drinks ($2 Margs) and tacos ($2-$3). It is crazy to me the quality and price of food. 

Rouge can be a hit or miss but I come here on Saturday night sometimes.
author: Elizabeth N.

description: The cash only is a deal breaker. It really is an bad move by the management here that they can't invest in an a square account.
author: Steve T.

description:
I got the Fish Taco and the Carnitas, they were okay. Not bad but not great either. The Fish taco was better than the Carnitas taco. I liked that the place is in Rouge, and we went on a Taco Tuesday so we grabbed a few margaritas and tacos for a pretty good price. 

Unfortunately, because it was a Tuesday and there was a game going on, the place was just way to packed and crowded and you had to talk really loud even to the people right next to you. I'm thinking this place might be worth 4 stars if you go on a not so crowded night.
author: Yishian Y.

description:
Pescado taco Nick's Way.  Do it.

The people at the counter are super friendly and chill, and the food is out of this world.  The booths are huge, the tacos are tasty, and everything is red.

... ok, maybe get two pescado tacos Nick's Way.  They're that good.
author: Tamara N.

description: Delicious, magical, and cheap. This is a Russian Hill gem. This is the food I would want if I came out of a four year long coma. Drinks aren't magical, but the food might cure cancer.
author: Kip K.

description:
OMG...seriously the best taco I've ever had!!! I've lived in Tucson for nearly 20 years now so I know what a great taco tastes like! I can't make a great taco....this place is SPECTACULAR!

We were visiting SF for a few days and decided to find something near our hotel to eat. We took our order to go. Fish taco's galore. EXCELLENT guacamole. The taco's were a bit messy, but every good taco is. The only complaint I really had was the price. I didn't realize tacos could cost that friggin much! Honestly though, next time I'm there I'd do it all over again!
author: Cheryl M.

description: Good burritos and tacos in a funky SF lounge/bar. Its a cool place with lots of TV's for sports games too.
author: Scott S.

description:
My husband and I are doing an experiment right now.  We are trying to not spend a single penny on food this week.  The plan is to only eat food we have at home.  It's been about 6 hours....and 

All I can think of is Nick's Crispy Tacos!

Those amazing taco shells.  Guac.  Meat.  Fish.  Beans.  Chips.  Margaritas.

Uh oh.  How will we make it a week??
author: Amy N.

description: Went here for my friend's birthday a while ago. Our tacos were legit and the sangria was sooo good. Plus, the feel of the place is really fun. Friendly staff, fair prices. Overall, we had an awesome time. Thanks Nick's!!
author: Steph L.

description: Great place, we tried the vegetarian taco and it was really tasty. Also good price, will definitely dine again.  Try the watermelon drink -superb.
author: Mor D.

description: While I thought the burrito I got was at least average, and the service even better, none of this can make up for the gastrointestinal armegeddon that took place later that day. Beware of the crispy (actually soft) taco!
author: Robert M.

description:
Did you say Niman Ranch Beef? Yeah- Niman Ranch Beef! In Nick's Crispy Tacos?! With almost 1300 Yelp reviews for Nicks only a hand full of Yelp reviews mention this... 

I went to Nick's a few weeks ago expecting some yummy street style tacos- What I ordered was definitely a gourmet interpretation! For my Girlfriend and I- Four tacos, a small horchatta, and one order of chicken Nachos came out to over $30! A bit more than the single '$' sign on Yelp led me to believe. 

The Tacos were good- Picture:http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ziVej4oW2JpUConTE_Y_mg?select=sSdT9qPUu2CXxzXIZuIN0A I really enjoyed the guacamole. My Girlfriend got her tacos 'Nick's Way' so we could experience the crispy tacos everyone raves about(which is an extra charge)- but they tasted the same as my tacos did. There was either a small difference that we couldn't really notice, or they forgot to make them 'Nick's Way' because they tasted exactly the same- no crispiness :(

However, I really enjoyed the Nachos. I like when restaurants use nacho cheese instead of melted shredded cheese- Nick's uses a very mild spicy nacho cheese! Nice! Look at the ooey gooey cheese lol http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ziVej4oW2JpUConTE_Y_mg?userid=-4BEUkLvHQntN6qPfKJP2w  

One thing that sucks is Nick's is CASH ONLY- I had to run across the street to Walgreens and pull out $40. For me, 3 stars is a positive review- I liked Nick's. Be prepared to drop between $4-5 per taco, but definitely order the nachos!
author: Greg G.

description: EDIT: FYI, the bar with water beds, I recently found out, is actually a porn shop. So not exactly the best place to end up after Nick's...
author: Alyssa R.

description:
It's been a couple of years since I've been to Nicks, though I live in the neighborhood. Their tacos used to be so much better! I went recently only to be totally disappointed. I found that the "crispy" part of the taco (Nick's Way) was soggy and the meat and filling was totally bland. 

If you just want to sit in a bar and have access to Haoli Mexican food, this could be perfect...For me...I like a little more spice and flavor! Kick it up a notch, Nick!
author: Hana B.

description:
I have been going to Nick's for some time now.  Every time I go here they turn out great Tacos!  I would recommend getting your Tacos "Nicks Way" .  If you like fish tacos you should try them nicks way...SO GOOD.  All in all it is a fun place to go.  Definitely on the higher end of the taco scale.  It is among one of my favorite places to eat tacos in the City.  If you are on Polk make sure you check this place out.

MAKE SURE YOU BRING CASH
author: George K.

description:
Awesome Tacos! Freaking Awesome! 
They remind me of a mini open face burrito, with a crispy inside shell as well as a soft outside shell. SO DELICIOUS! Great Prices, too!

Plus at night they turn the place into a nightclub and STILL serve tacos!

Hey, stop in a least for 1 taco, it will be filling, delicious, fast, affordable, and HOLY FREAKING COW, A-MAY-ZING!


p.s. The home-made hot sauce on the tables, aren't that hot, but dam. They Are Good, so be generous with them.
author: Erika P.

description:
This place was on crack the first time I went. Apparently, it was taco Tuesday, and the line went right thru the entire restaurant. 
I liked the vibe and every one was very friendly. They have a full bar in there too, which is nice. 
I got 2 fish tacos Nick's way, and let me tell you... it was pretty BOMB.
So bomb, that you have to try it.
author: Navy C.

description: Must-go on TUESDAYS. $2 tacos. Great music, fun crowd, photographer, dancing, can you ask for a better tuesday night? I think not.
author: Alice Z.

description: Loved the vibe and the shrimp taco was amazing! Would definitely go again with a group of friends
author: Veronica R.

description:
Came here for brunch a few weeks ago and it was fantastic. We got there about 2 hours before brunch was over, and it wasn't super crowded at all. I ordered the breakfast quesadilla, and took out a few things to make it slightly more healthy. It was DELICIOUS. Absolutely amazing. 

Then there are the bottomless mimosas. With the purchase of an entree you can tack on bottomless (if you're trying to be cheap, a taco does count as an entree). With bottomless, you're given a wristband that you can use at your table to get drinks. Our waitress did a great job of making sure our glasses were never empty, and even gave us a caraffe to set at our table. Baseball games were on while we ate which was great, and it never got over-crowded. I'll definitely be back.
author: Lauren D.

description: Really want to like the place its on my way home from work but been there twice got grilled fish tacos paid 10 bucks for a fist full of cabbage and a 2 bites of fish. Im still hungry!!!!
author: Michael S.

description:
The BEST fish tacos I've had so far in my search for Baja fish tacos in the Bay Area.  

While not 100% like the fish tacos I fell in love with in Ensenada, these are the closest I've had since I've been there.

If you've ever been in the Baja region of Mexico, you know (fried) fish tacos are lightly battered, huge piece of fish with cabbage, salsa, red and white sauce.  

Here at Nicks, the batter is a bit on the darker and heavier side.  The cabbage is there, but the red and white sauce is missing.  Instead, Nicks has their own green avocado and salsa sauce.  Different, but delicious none the less!

Like others have said, the tacos are super packed!

I have to come back for the carne asada tacos!
author: Bobby L.

description:
Annnnnnnd were done!!

This place truly exemplifies the art of a Taco Tuesday!

The meat is tender and spicy and the pico de gallo. The tortias are perfect and dont break apart!!!!

And then the beer is cold and smooth ....what a place!
author: Brad G.

description: I think this place is a bit more hype than it's worth. I have had way better tacos actually at tacolicious. They were fresh but lacked a bit of flavor. My friend and I got takeout, which the speed gains them points here. We walked in, saw a huge line, decided to order through yelp and grab a glass of champs at the bar. It was a busy sunday and by the time we got the bartenders attention our food was ready (don't think they are that fast it was still 20 minutes). The ambiance is pretty cool though and I think I will have to stop back to enjoy the scene but likely eat ahead a time or just hit up the chips and guac :)
author: Michelle R.

description: Nice friendly staff.  Salsa was very good (used yelp check in for free chips and salsa). Fried chicken taco was exceptionally good. Other chicken tacos were mediocre. Would return.
author: heather j.

description: Walked a mile in the rain while 5 months pregnant to try these tacos. I was not disappointed.
author: Sarah M.

description:
I'll keep it short and simple.  Fun place to go and grab a drink and some tacos.  I mostly go on taco tuesday, which is super crowded (I'm fine with that because I know it's going to be crowded).  The tacos are good if you get them Nick's way, but they end up costing alot for what you get.  I've had better food at many mexican restaurants for 1/2 the price.

It's worth going if you're looking for a social crowd and some margaritas more than going for the food.  That being said, go and check it out and see if it's worth it to you.
author: Chris L.

description: Fantastic.  The only night I avoid is taco Tuesday ($2 tacos) because it's such a madhouse.  Nick's food is priced so reasonably to begin with!  What turns our $27 dollar dinner for 2 people at Nick's into $90 quickly is the bar at Rouge (connected to Nick's).  2 rounds at Rouge (4 premium drinks) is easily $60.
author: Ana M.

description:
I love tacos.  I love fish.

I ended up ordering 3 tacos to try: grilled fish, fried fish, and shrimp with all of them crispy.  So what does it mean to get crispy tacos?  All tacos they give you two tortilla, but for crispy, they fry one of the tortilla leaving the other same, so you get this great contrast in texture.  They also add this huge huge glob of guac on top.  Delicious.

My favorite turned out to be the fried fish taco.  Great large piece of fried fish with a really light and refreshing cream sauce.  Add some of their house salsa and I'm in taco heaven.  Don't know if it's beer battered but man that fish batter was good.  As for the grilled, definitely the healthier option and really good too.

The shrimp was a little forgetful just because the fish tacos were so outstanding.  Nevertheless, lots of shrimp in the taco and I would suggest not adding salsa first to really taste the shrimp, cause the flavors might get covered up by the salsas.

If you get it crispy, it'll be around $4-6 per taco.  Expensive in the world of tacos but these tacos are bigger than usual and are piled up.

Heard the quesedillas are out of this world so must try next time.

Grab a Mexican Coke or cerveza, a few tacos, and enjoy :]


PS apparently it's a club/lounge at night so the place can feel a little groggy and sticky...
author: Duke C.

description:
I crave the Nick's Taco's from five years ago!

But this shop has slid way down a steep San Francisco Hill.
Every time I give into the craving I am sorely disappointed and regret the decision.... especially since 2 shrimp taco's, Nick's way are $14. 

So bland and far from the freshness I used to love.... the night club most certainly has something to do with this... Fresh Pico de gallo and a dark linoleum, red pleather, stale beer bar don't mix
author: Beebe J.

description:
