We were driving around this last Tuesday and saw the sign for Nick's. It looked so enticing (especially after reading the reviews), my husband and I went back on Friday afternoon around lunchtime to grab a few before skirting south to the airport to catch our flight. 

The young lady that took the order/rang us up was really nice. They had the food ready super quick, which is great b/c we also had a rental car to return. 

On the way to the airport, my husband bit into his pork taco. He said it was just OK, needed more seasoning, but the ingredients were fresh. He then moved on to his taco salad-- which had shreds of tortilla on top of the salad, rather than in the crispy bowl that apparently us who live on the east-side of the US have grown accustomed to. He dug his fork into a piece of chicken and came up with a nice, healthy piece of human hair at the end of his fork, perched atop his chicken. Needless to say, we BOTH lost our appetite and decided to focus our energies elsewhere. 

I'm quite sure this place has brought a lot of smiles to plenty of faces, but cleanliness AND speedy service should always go hand in hand.
author: Gabrielle J.

description: What a great little find. The Baja fish tacos are delicious and completely stuffed with toppings! Mmmm. The chips and guac are also tasty. Their chips are some of my favorite, just the right amount of crispity crunch. Ordering online was fast and easy and definitely the way to go.
author: Kristin K.

description: I really don't understand all the great reviews! What's going on here? To all the people who gave this place 4 or 5 stars, have you guys ever had tacos before??? The tacos were horrible! The "crispy"tortilla were stale and the carne asada was incredibly dry, and worst of all the guacamole was anything but fresh!!! It was actually the worse guacamole I've ever had! It was just disgusting. I'm so very disappointed. Oh and the service? The place was filled with grumpy, no smiles workers. Seemed like the workers hated working there. There was a tip jar at the counter where you order food and guess what happens when you feel like being nice and tipping? You get a dirty look! Bad tacos + rude service = Will never ever  go back here again!
author: elizabeth t.

description:
So I'm reviewing both Nick's and Rogue here.

Popped in last Saturday night after walking past hundreds of times and seeing it packed. People must flock here for sports, or brunch, or just to get incredibly wasted on pitchers of cheap beer. The decor looks like a 1920's Bourbon St. brothel, ugly chandeliers and fading red paint and stained velvet couches.
   The place was only half full at 11 on a Saturday night, so we managed to get a booth. There was only ONE waitress covering the entire floor, and she seemed like she was either working her last night there, or just plan didn't care. We order 2 margaritas (which were served in a Ball's jar, because....?) and a couple beers. We went to order some tacos,  and a completely different counter inside the "lounge". We sat back down and the waitress brought us our drinks and inexplicably our closed tab. Even though we clearly had food coming indicated by those obnoxious order number signs.

The food: A step down from Chipotle. The carne asada was the only even moderately edible component to my burrito. The tortilla was barely cooked, the rice was old and mushy, and the chips had obviously been overcooked and left under a heat lamp. The pico de gallo was under-seasoned and the salsa (which were in squeeze bottles on every table) came in 2 flavors: green goo and red mayo-something? I asked for some hot sauce or picante and what I got was a habanero version of the cream based red sauce on the table - still no heat.

Ordered another round of drinks and received the wrong beer. Couldn't track down the waitress to get it corrected so we just left. Doubt we'll ever be back.
author: Jon M.

description: The salsa bottle never touched the table while we ate. Yum!  I could drink that stuff. Everything was awesome including the service.
author: Mark W.

description:
Nick's Crispy Tacos! The first stop on our SF foodie trip :)

I'm a lover of fish tacos so I have been dyyying to try the famous pescado taco "Nick's Way". I ordered one of those along with an order of elote (mexican corn). Yum! The pescado was nicely fried with a light batter which was great with the guacamole. HOLY MOLY guacamole! They really pile it on here (I'm not complaining) and the flavor was pretty spot on. What surprised me the most was just how flakey the fish was. You could still taste the flavor of it unlike some other fish tacos I've had. But the best thing about the taco was the *crispy* tortilla. It added the perfect crunch to each bite.

Although the pescado taco was great, I was a bit let down by the elote. I'm also a huge fan of corn and it felt like the cotija was a bit heavy handed. The horchata was just okaaay too. 

The table shared a basket of chips with guac & salsa which we got as soon as we ordered. It was was nice to munch on as we waited for the rest of our food to come. The next time I'm up here I'll skip the elote and order some carne asada or even the pescado burrito. 

BTW, we came around 1:30pm on a Saturday and had to wait in line for about 10 min and easily scored a table. Not baaaaad.
author: Faye G.

description:
Some insight ...

Nick's Crispy Tacos is NOT a restaurant (well not in the traditional sense). It's just a couple people making tacos in a nightclub during the day. There is no sign, just some window paint. You'll have to eat tacos at fold out tables or raised couches, up in da club. 

With that said, let's focus on the food ...

You might as well turn around and go home if you don't plan to order your tacos 'Nick's Style' The generous smear of guacamole and the the crunchy taco shell are so so worth it. 

I noticed right off the bat that Nick is a serious limon lover. The creamy sauce on the fish tacos is sharp with sour citrus flavors, so is the guacamole, and even the salsas are mostly lime. Which is fine by me, I eat lemons plain, but other folks should be warned. 

I'm always on the lookout for fun order-up restaurants around this area and Nick's fit the bill.
author: Colleen J.

description: The ambiance is interesting.  It's like a sports bar and ball room mixture.  It works.  The carne asada tacos may have been the best I have ever had.  The pulled pork tacos were solid, but not as god as the carne asada tacos.  I asked for some sauce to put on top of my tacos and I was given an orange looking sauce that was fantastic.  I liked the salsa that came with the chips.
author: Bob B.

description: The fried fish taco....deal Lord Almighty (gotta get it "Nick's Way")! Absolutely delicious. Fresh, crispy, flavorful...my taste buds were blessed.
author: Michael J.

description: Chips and queso were bland. Fish tacos were only ok. Cash only is kind of bizarre. Would not recommend.
author: Tracy R.

description: I came to visit San Francisco from Atlanta and I was super excited to eat tacos in California. Unfortunately, Nick's Crispy Tacos was a major disappointment. Literally the worst taco I've ever had. You can make a better taco with a pack of Wal-Mart ground beef and an Old El Paso taco kit! The tortillas were stale, the beef (I got carne asada) was dry and bland, and the pico had very little flavor. Huge disappointment, I have no idea why they have 4 out of 5 stars.  Maybe I just came on the wrong day...
author: Amelia C.

description:
The first thing you notice is that Nick's is in a bar (or the bar is in the tacqueria). There are plenty of tvs everywhere (b/c it's in a bar) and was awesome b/c I came the night that the Sugar bowl was on and I didn't wanna miss Florida getting upset by Louisville. 

Anyway, back to the review. 

The tacos are really good! I ordered three carne asada tacos and that was plenty of food. 3 tacos also cost me $9 and I think that's a reasonable price to pay for what should be very tasty street food that's served in a restaurant. I'm looking forward to coming back here the next time I'm in the neighborhood!

By the way, I just looked at their drinks menu. I don't drink but by the looks of it, that is one expensive habit! $500 for a bottle of alcohol? WTF.
author: shoaib a.

description: We came here for our friend's going away party as she is moving to Amsterdam. We called on Monday to make a reservation for 6 people. They let us know that big booths were only available at 5pm, and we told them that was too early. So they made out reservation for 6:45pm. The next day, Tuesday, we tried to change our reservation to 8 people, and they let us know it was no problem. They later notified us that we had called to change our reservation to 5pm - we NEVER changed our reservation! We had only set the reservation for 6:45pm and then tried to add more people. Clearly the hostess is incompetent, and tried to put the blame on us like it was our fault. They then failed to accommodate our party and had us stand around for 3 hours while we waited for a table. I think management really needs to reevaluate their hostesses as this is a popular spot and need people who can stay on top of scheduling and not mess up guests' reservations.
author: Rebecca C.

description:
If you want something a little different in a taco - try Nick's.  The crispy/chewy shell combo with queso between is really satisfying.  We tried the pescado (super!), carnitas (sabroso!) and shrimp (smoky!) tacos.  Chips with really tasty chopped tomatoes and onions on top, with flavorful red and green salsas.   Tacos are generously dressed, the guacamole is very good.   A very enjoyable alternative to mission style tacos (no disrespect!).

Very friendly owner was tidying up the outside while we ate, dog in tow.  Good to get a little history with the comida.   

Yes, Meebo is a big fan, too!
author: Bob K.

description:
The tacos here are sooooooo delicious. I ordered a steak taco done "Nick's Way," which basically means a soft taco wrapped around a hard taco with guacamole spread in the middle. 

-1 for being expensive
author: Margaret R.

description:
Wtf? I really was excited for this place. Waited about a year.
$5.50 for a semi-crispy, somewhat soggy tortilla wrapped around some whitish chicken meat with some yellow cheese and iceberg lettuce with some avo? Wtf?

Maybe I wasn't drunk, but a real disappointment here. I was expecting a crispy taco to rival those found in the Mexican diaspora of LA--a fully legit regional cuisine of the greater Mexican food universe. Instead I found mediocrity aligned with the other ubiquitous "I-need-to-be drunk" places that infest the city.

Please, someone take a 1-minute walk beyond the border in TJ, passed the one-way turnstile into Mexico, and try the first taco place you can find. Can someone please replicate this here? Please?

As for SF, the best crispy taco I've found is at the unfriendly El Faro, but they have their own set of issues that make the dining there lame, like bad customer service and the tendency to nickel-n-dime you for every ingredient add-on, and go further to charge you for salsa and chip. So avoid that place as well.

Best crispy I've found north of LA is in Alameda, at Juanita's Restaurant, but note, this was at 2:30am after a few rounds at the legendary Forbidden Island. Still, this place rivals LA. Viva lard.
author: Brian J.

description:
I have this bad habit of not eating anything when I travel. It doesn't matter whether I am on a plane, train or automobile, if I am mobile, I am not eating anything. So, add this quirk to several hours of consciousness and enough beer to make a college coed feel nauseous and you can tell that I was in trouble. I needed tacos. I don't know why I fixated on tacos as opposed to pizza, kebabs or any one of a number of street foods. But, I needed tacos and I needed them now.

Chicago has a rather large Mexican population so, as a Chicagoan, I am fortunate to have my choice of Mexican fare whenever and whatever. Coming to San Francisco, I thought there'd be an embarrassment of riches when it came to Mexican food. Maybe...but I didn't find them here. Perhaps it was my bad. I didn't order a taco. After all my Veruca Salting, I ordered a burrito. Here's my thinking. The tacos here cost about as much as a baby on the black market. If I am going to expend that kinda cash, I figure I might as well go for the big portion ticket. You know. So, I ordered a chicken burrito with guac, cheese and all the fixins. I put the order in, I wept at the price, I received the food, I smiled at the heft of the burrito (heavy) and I tore in. 

Eh. It was ai'ight. Even in my drunken starving stupor, I wasn't that impressed with the food. I didn't taste anything crispy or crunchy. Maybe that's reserved for tacos only. The meat was a little charred. The guac didn't have much taste and my cheese was more 'pug' than 'chihuahua.' I didn't get it. I should have been in the target demo for this place (drunken dumb@ss) and I wasn't getting it. I ate the burrito. I was hungry and needed the assist to sobriety, but I have definitely had better in Chicago. Honestly, I was a little shocked. Better luck next time?
author: Johnny T.

description: Although Nick's burritos and tacos are tasty and relatively cheap, they never seem to be able to get orders correctly. Half the time my burritos are missing guac and sour cream, which I always ask for.
author: Vitaliy D.

description: Always nice when you say "no beans", your receipt says "no beans", then you bite into your burrito and it's filled with beans. That was $12 wasted. Thanks.
author: Jeff T.

description: Fabulous fish tacos for the price !
author: Virginia T.

description: Stop in while we were in town on our honeymoon. Place was packed because of the Western Conference Finals. But placed a takeout order and got it within 5 minutes. Tacos we're good and the chips and salsa we're a nice bonus.
author: Matthew M.

description:
I've only ever had delivery from here, but my experiences have been awesome!

The portions for everything I've ordered have been massive and well worth the price on the menu.

Shrimp Burrito has huge shrimp and plenty of them. The ingredients taste so fresh - onions, cabbage cilantro, avocado, soooo good!

A great alternative to other delivery options in the area for sure!
author: Lizette C.

description:
Amazing pescado (fried fish) tacos, especially if you get them Nick's way (fried tortillas shell + guacamole) and add the slightly spicy green sauce that comes at the table.  Any time I've ordered something other than the fish tacos, I've been a little disappointed - not because it was bad, but just because the fish tacos are so fantastic.  :)  Definitely worth a trip from the East Bay.  

I also really like the agua frescas (rotating flavors) to drink, or they have bottomless mimosas on the weekend (totally worth it!)
author: Sara C.

description:
I don't know if I like anything on this earth better than a perfectly spiced, flavorful, delicious taco. Especially when there are shrimp, fish and veggie options. I think what really cinched this flavor fest for me was the fresh guacamole and salsa. I'm a sucker for food that is really, ya know, food, like where it is still in its true form, just smaller pieces. To me that makes food so much more flavorful and it really did the trick for me at Nicks. 

I didn't give 5 stars because the tacos were a little pricey compared to what I'm used to ($4.50 each I think), so I need to come back earlier in the day to try the 2 for 1 deal. Also, it will give my palette another chance to taste them sans my friend Alchy Hall getting in the mix. That guy always messes with my taste buds.
author: Shira O.

description:
Came here for lunch on a weekend... Pretty big spot as I think they combined the business with the bar they're attached to.. large red half circle booths along one wall n plenty of tables.. place was pretty filled but not crazy, nice vibe.

Tried a few things on the menu, liked all of it but the Pescado tacos were ridiculous!  Somewhat soft, somewhat crispy with the layered shells, fish was lightly battered n fried perfectly.. I've been craving em ever since we came here.. unfortunately haven't found anything like this in my home state.. DEF coming back here next time I'm in SF!
author: Ajay B.

description:
I'm a creature of habit - sort of. At least when it comes to food. But, I know what I like. 

I'm so ashamed. I tried to stop at one but no...two crispy fish tacos...and two beers.  I actually plan flights around when Nick's stops selling tacos (9PM or so).  Then I have to do the rat dance for parking. I am so envious of those who don't have cars in this town. 

Oh well, I feel good about myself because the Dos Equis were 2 for 5 bucks and I knew I wouldn't drink the third one (ordered #1 at the bar), so I gave it away. My good deed for the day.

Nick's is great.
author: J T.

description:
I've been here twice. Decent, but quite overhyped in my opinion. I've had the carne asada, the grilled fish taco, and a date had the carne asada quesadilla. Good but in my opinion a bit pricy for what you get (both quality and quantity). Everything was sopped in guac and sour cream; usually a good thing, but it was to the point where it drowned out any subtlety of flavor. Not terrible by any means, but I think I could get better tacos at any random Mexican place in the Mission.

I got the pineapple agua fresca. Ok and home-made, but I've had better.

This could be fabulous drunk late-night food, but unfortunately they're not open late enough for that.

I would definitely chow down on a Taco Tuesday (2 for $5), but at full pop for $4 a taco, I think it's a little steep for what you get.
author: David C.

description: I thought this place was definitely over hyped. It's just americanized mexican food. I ordered the fried chicken taco and the shrimp taco. Both were mediocre at best, and came with a hefty price tag. Their agua frescas was bland and might be one of the worst drinks I've sampled. I honestly would rather eat at like alberto's or La vics in SJ.
author: Edward H.

description:
Every time I come here I order a taco or burrito and then remember that I actually don't care much for their vegetarian taco or burrito offerings. I dig the cabbage but not a lot of the other fillings, and I don't like "Nick's Way" - just a personal preference.

The horchata is dynamite and goes well with the real star of the show at Nick's: the elote. The corn on the cob here is outrageously good and comes with a thick handle stabbed into its side, perfect for one-handed eating. Whenever I have a craving for grilled corn on the cob (read: almost daily), Nick's is top of mind!
author: Kat F.

description:
Eh. I don't get all the hype about Nick's. The staff is cool, yes, but I think it's weird that I get to order tacos out of the back door of one of the most random bars that I previously haunted in a Polk Street Pub Crawl several years back. Totally unmemorable night, totally unmemorable place.

Perhaps you think I'm being to harsh? Let's stack up the comparison to my favorite - La Taqueria.

+ variety and selection on menu
+serves hard alcohol - namely margaritas needed to go with your tacos.
-flavorless guacamole
-Nick's style doesn't do "El Dorado" style with a layer of cheese between the crispy and soft shell
-hot sauce isn't hot enough
-don't have chorizo as a meat option
-don't get to feel Elite by ordering to off menu, secret items
-not next door to Mission Pie Co. (ok ok this is kinda harsh, but seriously, banana cream pie after tacos is AWESOME!)
-overall flavor doesn't have the ka-pow factor
-burlesque decor that doesn't set the ambiance for Mexican food

Sorry everyone, but Nick's isn't all it's cracked up to be. It doesn't suck, and it is good, especially if you're roaming drunk around Polk. But loyalties lie with La Taqueria in the Mission. Can't help it, I'm Mexican.
author: Alita M.

description: Nick's way is the best way to go here with the tacos. Cool casual vibe but with a lounge twist. Good value and generous portions.
author: Kunal K.

description:
Yum! Yum! Yum!  I love the crispy tacos, the ambiance, the gorgeous chandeliers, the red interior, and the $10 bottomless mimosas on sundays! I can't wait o come back.

Don't forget your CASH to pay for your tacos!
author: Vanessa L.

description: My boyfriend brought me to Nick's for lunch and I love the environment! The decor rocks! I like the set up, ordered my food n it was out in a couple minutes. I ordered the grilled chicken tacos and they were awesome! I will definitely be back.
author: Valerie C.

description:
The Baja fish tacos are awesome. I have tried other tacos but now the Baja are the only thing I order. 

Nicks way is the only way!
author: Troy K.

description:
The tacos are soo good! 
I hate this place for being so yummy & tempting! 
The food is very fatty (&deep fried) yet what do you expect out of fast mex food...

IThe tacos have one soft and one crispy shell, which give them the original "Nick's" texture & taste. 

Make sure to order the guacamole (for everything!) It will be worth the extra buck!

Oh and if you get here during happy hour, the drinks are really reasonably priced!
author: Nina M.

description:
I dream about this place. If I was a person who walked in their sleep, you would probably find me here at weird hours. 

I think it's the guacamole to taco ratio that makes my heart go pitter-patter and my mouth fill with drool. Oh, and the corn on the cob COVERED in cotija cheese is sinful. And spicy! I wish Nick's would open a place in the South Bay. Taco Bell just doesn't cut it even if they DO have the Doritos taco. 

Margs are solid -- I once smiled at the bartender and he made mine extra strong. Ha!
author: Christine N.

description:
Dined in April 2012.
I love this joint. hands down the best tacos I ever had.  Thus far.
The ambiance is pretty cool since it's also a night club - named Rouge appropriately as it's all velvety and wine colored.
The fact there is a crispy and soft shell makes it fun to bite into, ingredients fresh and plenty of it.. I was full after one taco.. can't say that for other places I've been I usually need at least two.. and if you go midday.. it's quiet and it's just the perfect lunch meal.
author: Lucie T.

description:
Get each taco "Nick's way" (Basically consists of two taco shells: a hard taco shell wrapped in a soft one to give it a nice soft crunchiness). Bf and I basically went nuts here--letting our stomachs do all the ordering. We ordered about $40 worth of food for lunch (thank G we had enough cash since this place is CASH ONLY!) We ordered the nachos with chicken, two carne asada tacos (Nick's way), two fish tacos (Nick's way), watermelon aqua fresca, and the elote (corn).

We came on a Sunday during the football game, so it was a bit hard to find a table but as long as you have sharp eyes and ninja-style table grabbing skills, it isn't so bad. The tables are on a first come first serve basis.
author: Lily Z.

description:
My mouth is watering thinking of the pescado taco, Nick's way. 

The best time to come here is during a weekday when it's not crowded. Get a booth with a couple of friends and don't be afraid to get messy. Taco Tuesdays are a bargain, but those tacos get pretty messy when you're eating them standing up. 

Also love the jalapeno poppers and the limey creamy sauce that comes with them.
author: Jade S.

description: Tacos are garbage. First time here and last time as well. Depressing atmosphere too. Best tacos in SF are at La Taqueria on 24th and mission.
author: Yung C.

description:
I will say that the decor and choice of music is somewhat confusing, but the specials at nick's crispy tacos are SO hard to beat! They have happy hour pretty much any hour you would go here, it's incredible!

The food is good and accompanied by 2 for $5 dos equis or a $5 shot and a pint is unreal. I haven't been for taco tuesday but I hear it is a clusterfu** so I will opt for all other days as they have many the same specials regardless.
author: Raina B.

description: Really good crispy tacos.  I had a asada and a carnitas taco. Meat has Good flavor and the beans in the taco adds a good mix. The horchata was nasty.  Stick with a beer or soda. They got one taco incorrect but they fixed it with no attitude. Very fun environment. The chandeliers add a lot of character. Would highly recommend.  The front sign has changed to Rouge nicks crispy taco. Couldn't find it at first. Looks more like a bar from the outside at night.
author: R L.

description: Refused to honor deal advertised on Yelp. It was just free chips but said wont honor in Tuesday. Good tacos, good space. stupid, insulting rules that are against credit card company policy. They actually expect you to leave an id with your credit card to open a tab at the bar. No way I'm leaving my id with a busy bar-keep. Lost credit cards like that so won't take the risk with ID. If I cared enough I'd report to visa, I'm certain they are breaking rules with this policy.
author: Ohhh Y.

description:
Best crispy taco i ever had.

The crisp is not like a chips crisp. Little crisp. wonderful taste.

tried 4 different dishes and liked all of them.
author: Kumar G.

description:
Taco, taco, burrito, burrito, taco, horchata ( singing whilst drooling) 
From dangling chandeliers to velvety couches, red walls and lavish drapery- this is not your typical taqueria. Lightly battered and perfectly fried fish with fresh cilantro, chunk of guac in some delicious tortilla.mmm, how can i not drool? though it's 1230 AM now :( 
Be sure to bring at least 20 bucks in cash as they don't take cards. I always forget about that and i always find myself running to the Walgreens across the street to get some cash back when i go there.
author: Anu O.

description: It's rare to eat at the same restaurant during a 3 day vacation but we did.  The vegetarian automatically comes Nick's Way and it is awesome.  I didn't love the atmosphere but the food is amazing so who cares.
author: Jackie K.

description:
Coming from LA, it's hard to like a crispy taco (unless it comes from Titos!). This double decker (crispy wrapped in a soft tortilla) was overloaded with guac and unfortunately masked the pretty good carnitas that were inside. Grilled fish taco was floppy and ok to pass on.  What saved the day was huge plate of nachos and a ridiculous good habanero salsa ... spicy!

Not a bad place, but not my kind of taco.
author: Vivi T.

description:
The tacos here are SO good!!  My favorite is their shrimp taco, which you cannot get for the Happy Hour price during H.H. ... but it's worth the $$.  But you've gotta get 'Nick's Way'.

The prices can seem a bit steep, but you have to realize that you are paying for quality.  This place doesn't just use any kind of garbage meat or ingredients.  They use organic, local, and fresh line caught ingredients.  This makes every single penny worth it!

The place is a bit dirty, since it is Rouge at night ... but other then that there's nothing else to complain about.

P.S.  You've gotta try their hot sauce.  It is the kicker.
author: Pia V.

description:
Came here on a Monday night with my family. It was okay. We were there during the happy hour. 2 glasses of wine and a beer came out to about $12. Great price. Ordered two tacos, burrito, a plain quesadilla and a loaded quesadilla (forgot what was in it) and nachos (those weren't so good to be honest) and the food came out to be around $30. Cash only for the food, drinks took card.

It was a pretty nice place, though not sure I'd return for the food. Drinks during happy hour I would.
author: Ash I.

description:
I don't know why this place has such good reviews.  We came here on Taco Tuesday $2 tacos, which is a great deal, but as a first time dining experience... it was awful. In my defense, I didn't know it was taco tuesday.  I was in the area and just yelped Tacos and I saw this was listed as #1 2012 SF taco spot and thought, hell yea! We have to try it! Wished I didn't. 

Huge crowds, due to the fact this place becomes a nightclub after 7pm or something.  Seating is impossible and the lines to order can be utterly ridiculous after 7pm.  It's an order at the register and pick a table affair.  Drinks OR food, yes, there are separate lines for each though a waitress does walk the line sometimes and take orders for drinks. CASH ONLY.

So my boyfriend and I arrive, we wait in the perilously long line for food and order tacos, yay! We go outside and find outdoor seating, but we had to chug our drinks, because at THIS venue, you can't drink outside even though there are tables. hah.


The food:

Every single meat taco we got (pork, beef, chicken) was SUPER dry. The shrimp taco was pretty much tasteless, except for the guacamole I had slathered on it.  The cheese quesadilla was the only highlight of the meal, and we ordered 6 tacos to boot.  

I had tried to order more guacamole for our nachos (didn't come with nearly enough) and some more drinks (until I found out I couldn't), but it was impossible. The line was already 20+ people deep. 

Service: Terrible. They forgot my side of sour cream and side of rice and beans.  I understood they were slammed and it actually didn't bother me until I got back to the counter and told them they forgot my sides (nicely!) The guy behind the counter rolled his eyes, went back to the kitchen for a few minutes then handed it to me with a blank face.  That didn't make me feel to great about taking food from someone who clearly thought my requesting the food I ordered was tedious.  What else did he put in there other than disdain?

There are about 6 outdoor tables, each with two chairs. Now what REALLY destroyed the experience here was the fact that it's first come first serve.  Let me explain.  Three heifers were were taking up a table outside and grabbed one seat from another table, leaving it with just one.  Fine, first come first serve.  BUT, they were finished eating and just lingered for 40 minutes longer while we sat right next to them eating, minus one chair. Same story with the couple next to us, finished eating when we sat down and just stayed there for even longer.  They were still there when we left! My boyfriend stood the entire time, refusing to alternate with me. 

C'mon, Management...MANAGE! Just put a time limit outside, it's just 6 tables! Since no one can have alcohol outside, and you bet NO ONE is going to wait in line twice for more food,  there's no reason to linger other than someone being a cheap @$$hole. Make them go inside and booze it up if they want to stay. Or, be smart and instead of tables, fill the damn place with counters. Way less space and better height if 40% of the people are going to be standing when they eat their food. 

Crowd: Lame. Lots of eyeballing and some attitudes flying left and right that left me with a less than favorable opinion of the neighborhood. Maybe I'm just too humanl, but if I saw someone trying to eat dinner and I had the extra chair I snagged from the table, I'd offer to move the party elsewhere. Plus, why would I sit outside in a clearly slammed place after I'm done with my meal, where people are eating out of plastic baskets standing up when I could just move down the block to another cafe, bar, parking lot, whatever! 

As far as I'm concerned, there's nothing worth going back for.  

Unless you're a dude on the prowl.  I did notice a multitude of young, blonde and beautiful girls (I can't say how beautiful they are on the inside) but a lot of older and somewhat conservative males.  I was too hungry to explore the why's.
author: Annie W.

description:
I love love love their crispy (fried) fish taco and burrito.
I gave only 4 stars because its a bit on the pricey side. $5/taco and $10/burrito.

The tacos are exploding with guac and a huge piece of fried white fish. with tons of green salsa.

The first time I tried it I went back for 4 days straight.

Love the food but not the price!
author: Ash R.

description:
Nick's tacos is one of my favorite spots. I always get the chicken tacos, nicks way. 

We usually go to rouge (the connected bar) and order drinks as well. They always have great happy hour deals. The only problems are long lines and sometimes there aren't any seats, but hey, it's because the place is amazing!
author: Robyn M.

description: Tasty! Interesting location since it is in a bar. (I love a double use for space that would typically be empty during the day.) The food is great.  I loved the sauces and the homemade chips.  The price is just right, but cash only so come prepared.
author: Christy L.

description:
Nick's Crispy Tacos are awesome! I went here for the first time this week and I have never had a fish taco that good. The only reason why I didn't give them five stars is that I have only gone once. I plan to return many times in the future. 

I ordered two crispy fish tacos with all the fixings. It was a loaded taco, almost too hard to eat. But it was delicious. The margaritas are also quite good... not too strong, not too weak. 

It is a good atmosphere to meet up with a friend in a social setting. Not too loud so you can still have conversation, but enough going on. 

There is a full bar and live games to watch in the bar area. 

Last comment... it is cash only! Good to remember.
author: Joi P.

description: Nicks is one of my favorite taco places in SF.  This place has the best taco Tuesday happy hour.  $2 tacos and cheap drinks, can't beat it!  They do get busy, so get there early if you want a table.  The only down side is that they don't do to go orders.
author: David B.

description: Great food. Chips and salsa with guac was fresh and good. Enjoyed the fish taco. The only downside was cash only at the taco bar.
author: Alex G.

description:
Probably one of the best tacos in the country
Try the Pescado or the Carnitas Nicks way
author: Mitch S.

description:
Nick's definitely isn't your authentic mexican taqueria but pretty good as tacos go. They can come crispy or soft and their guac is pretty good. They can get pretty messy but are tasty none the less. I recommend getting your tacos "nick's way"

Nick's and Rouge have a Sunday bottomless mimosa which is fun, it can get crowded, especially during busy game days so it's good to get there early. Tacos and bottomless mimosas, not too bad and a good price. 

Careful, Nick's takes cash only... there is an ATM inside if you forget.
author: Megan S.

description:
I want to hate this place.  The decor is like an over the top ballroom dance club as imagined by my grandmother -all red with chandeliers and big round raised booths, and the food is cheap, tasty, and quick.  The combination jars me a bit.  

So much good:  The staff is always friendly.  And every time I have gone there I have had a great time.  There is a part of me that says it is the company I keep, but I have had bad times with good people in other places.  So I keep going back.
author: Tia B.

description: Even though they don't take reservations, I called ahead and they were able to hold a couple tables for our large group of people.  Thank you for being so accommodating, NCT!  We had a great time and the service was great.  Margaritas were amazing!  We ordered the nachos for the table and everyone loved them.  I ordered a steak taco which was huge and full of guacamole.  So good!
author: Andrea J.

description: So so good. Baja Fish taco is everything... carnitas and pollo asado are also quite delicious. Getting them crispy is a must. While taco tuesday's is a great deal, I just realized they have super similar deals on Friday nights and its WAY less crowded. Aqua frescas and quesadillas are not to be missed.
author: Carolina C.

description:
I love Nick's crispy tacos... I used to live right next to the place and can't get enough.  Their guac and chips / salsa is as good as it can get.  I like the standard pollo asada tacos nicks style, even the veg nick style tacos are great.  The fish burrito is what I love on occasion as well.  

I used to hit up their taco tuesdays, but actually really like going to nick's on a random mid-day.

I wish they took credit cards and they could use another location in NOPA or the Mission.  

But overall, nothing but love for Nick's Crispys.
author: Tater T.

description:
At first, I wasn't in the mood for Mexican, much less "crispy" tacos. But we were already here, and this place was oh so popular. It had to be good, right? It was. 

Pros:
-Popular place. All those people can attest to the fact that it's good, right? 
-Really good tacos. A taco is ~$4, but it's worth it because they're very generous and super filling tacos, not puny Taco Tuesday tacos. 2 tacos are enough for a girl. Probably 3-4 for a guy. I got the vegetarian taco and pollo asada taco cooked Nick's Crispy Taco style (soft taco inside and a crispy taco outside) I loved the pollo asada one. Neither felt too heavy and it was def filling. They were very generous w/ the toppings, i.e. beans, lettuce, and best of all, guacamole! 
-Green salsa verde sauce (on the table). So good.  

Cons:
-Long ass lines. ~15 minute wait to order your food. 
-Hard to find seating. Waited ~20-30 minutes to find proper seating. 
-Dark/dim lighting. Literally can't see what you're eating. But it's not like a romantic dim, it's an annoying reddish hue. 
-Place turns into a nightclub after like, 10 PM... from Nick's Crispy Tacos to Rouge Night Club... Weird. No wonder the place resembles more of a lounge than a taco joint. 
-Margarita was meh, mainly because it was on the rocks instead of blended. I thought it would be the latter. Def very very strong at first. Costs $3 for a glass, or $18 for a pitcher. 
-Cash only or level up. Ugh! Luckily I'm from out of town so I always carry cash on vacay, but usually I don't. And, I don't have a smart phone so I can't level up via mobile. I hate when places are cash only. C'mon, it's the 21st century. Accept debit/credit and dont' be so cheap.
author: Phoebe C.

description: One of my favorite places for happy hour in SF. The food and drinks are cheap and there are lots of televisions for sports. I tried almost all the items on the happy hour menu and I definitely like the nachos the most. The service is great and I'll be coming to get cheap food when in the neighborhood.
author: Jason L.

description:
TACO TUESDAYS. OH. MY. GOSH.

...No really, THE BEST fish tacos I've ever had in my entire life (and that says a lot cuz I love fish tacos and I order them a lot, hehehe!). THIS (and a Shake Shack burger back in NY) would be my LAST MEAL ON EARTH if you ever asked me what it would be. Fresh fish and oh-my-freakin-gosh-to-die-for sauce and guacamole dripping down the side of my face, staining my white tank top and my leather jacket and my bag (due to my clumsiness and hungry-hurriedness)? Eh, whatever, oh well, I can clean that up with some laundry soap and hot water later. Just get those tacos in my bellayyy!!!!!!!!!!!!!

In short, I love Nick's.
author: Jaye C.

description: Waited 1/2 hour for my prepaid taco.  I went to the counter and they had lost my order.
author: Mike N.

description:
I will only say this once: l have finally buckled under and am going to admit that a mans way is the only way- when at Nick's Crispy Tacos. 

Two dollar Taco Tuesday was in full effect and the anticipation set in. We ordered two carnitas, one fish taco and one carne asada tacos, Nick's way.  I couldn't understand why is was so busy that night, until we walked outside and realized that we were actually sitting inside Rouge nightclub the entire time. Given that we were in a nightclub you could only imagine our struggle to find a seat amongst the chatting crowd, but after majorly stalking  the tables from the bar we managed to snag a booth as soon as a group left..and then.. out comes the tacos and down goes my jaw. They were fried and loaded with guac and meat - a fried taco? like it could get any more congesting! It was a dirty one night stand that i probably will do again, if i'm ever drunk and around the area. I'll call you next time to put your carne in my taco-your way. 

(don't you just love ambiguity?)
author: Kelly S.

description:
-1 star for the barf smell near the cash register where i ordered

-1 star for the 2 girls standing there talking while a line formed for other customers to pick up their food

-1 star for them giving me only 1 container of green sauce when i asked for two

2 stars - 1 for a decent green sauce, 1 for the fish taco.  

by the way, the check in for yelp offer only works if you dine in.
author: Lady K.

description: Disappointed with the quality, volume, and price of the fish burrito and even the soft taco, though didn't get it deep fried.  Nice enough cashier but he couldn't do math -- I even said out loud how much change I was giving him to get large bills and held my palm open but he didn't even look and then have me back a bunch of the wrong change, then argued with me and refused to give the proper whopping five cent difference to give the right change to me :/ ... Not a big deal was just very annoying.
author: Jared S.

description:
Wait, I can't believe I haven't reviewed Nick's yet. This used to be my 2nd home. (sob sob)

Pescado Taco Nick's Way - there's nothing better.  

Taco Tuesday - sip on a Corona while you wait in a long line. At least you'll have plenty of time to catch up w/ your friends since they'll all be there too.

Their chicken tortilla soup is to die for and worth the wait too.
If you're not on a date, then don't miss out on the elote - lots of napkins are required. 

I regret to say I've only had the breakfast burrito once, but it was enormous and sooo good. 

If only I could swing by on my way home tonight :(
author: Lauren C.

description:
Definitely a fan of this place!! I came here on a friday night after halloween weekend and people were still walking around in costumes!! I guess the party never stops.
My friend was in town so we wanted dinner and bars close by. Polk street is the perfect place. 
It was pretty busy with food but we waited in line and managed to get a few chairs and eat our tacos. People are moving everywhere so if you wait long enough you can grab a seat. Definitely have patience with this place because its worth it. 
Tacos are delicious..get it Nicks way with additional toppings. Cheap and they fill you up. 
This place is very snazzy and hip with the red velvet everywhere.
If you want a good  spot to sit at for a while get there early..it gets packed. 
If you haven't been there you HAVE to go.
author: Lana K.

description:
Made a reservation at Rouge's to avoid finding seats or standing in the taco line at Nick's. Just a note, reservations need a minimum of 4 people and you can order drinks and food, they're just on different tabs. 

The place got busy pretty quick and that's why we arrived ~6pm before it got crazy. This  was my first time trying Nick's Crispy Tacos. They were good, but nothing special. The carnitas and chicken was a little dry. They're not authentic or anything but $2 makes it a pretty good deal!
author: Hwan L.

description:
My girlfriend and I came to Nick's for Taco Tuesday. We were slightly disappointed to find out that you can't get $2 tacos to go, and there were absolutely no seats available. But the tacos looked so good that we got them to go anyway, paying full price.

We had a veggie burrito, and three different tacos, all soft shell: grilled fish, pork with guac, and steak with guac. My girlfriend thought the veggie burrito and fish taco were the best part, and I thought the pork and steak tacos were best, so it worked out perfectly :). Overall we thought everything was great! Definitely get guac! 

Also two tacos is probably enough for one person, they're massive.
author: Alden Q.

description:
I have had burritos and nachos from Nicks before but I had never experienced Taco Tuesdays. My friend and I decided to stop by after the gym last Tuesday to check it out. The regular tacos are $2 and the bar offered a pitcher of beer for $10. $8 for HELLA beer and 2 tacos each is a pretty good deal! They had a DJ playing hip hop and top 40's. It was pretty packed and finding a place to eat was a challenge but my friend was persistent and stalked a couple that looked like they were wrapping up so we got their seats. My only regret was that I was sweaty and gross from the gym. I had no idea how dressed up people got for Taco Tuesdays. 

Final notes: Go early, wear a cute outfit, stalk people for chairs, get the pitcher of beer.
author: Mahta P.

description: This place is always a lot of fun to do Taco Tuesdays. It's always busy and has music! If you come, make sure you order the fish taco, nick's way. Best fish taco!!
author: Linda T.

description:
My roommates and I recently went to Nick's twice in the same week just to try as much of their awesome menu as we could. We went on a Thursday at 6 with a group of about 7 and discovered their awesome happy hour deal, $10 pitchers until 10pm. What a deal, tacos and cheap pitchers? That's a very dangerous combination but such a great one. 

Nick's has definitely become a weekly destination. If you are ever craving Mexican food this is definitely the spot.
author: Marcus A.

description: It has a nice setting but they are very overrated I'm mad I wasted my money and I could have got better tacos off a taco truck in Oakland somewhere
author: Jerroyn C.

description:
If you're starving and short on patience, don't go to Nick's. A rendezvous to Nick's requires lots of patience to find parking, even more patience to wait in the long long line, and the last of your patience to find seating. 

But once you have conquered all these obstacles and gotten your tacos, you'll be one happy camper. I got the carnitas taco Nick's style-- tender, moist pork, all the usual taco basics, plus beans and guacamole encased by 1 crispy shell and 1 soft tortilla. Genius. And I'm not even a fan of beans normally. Filling and delicious for $3 ($2 if you don't get the guac). They also offer chicken and carne asada tacos for the same price on Taco Tuesdays, plus 2 for $5 coronas and Stellas, $3 margaritas (or $18 for the pitcher..you know you want to!). With these prices, and the lively, gaudy, tequila bar-esque atmosphere to enjoy them in, it's no wonder so many people flock to Nick's.

Cash only though!
author: Yang Q.

description:
Amazing Fish Tacos. Admittedly, I've only ever ordered the fish tacos buuuut "Nick's Way" is the only way. I have yet to meet a fish taco that I like better. My lady and I are hooked. 

If you can't stomach the yuppy crowd of unimpressive Marina bros and hoes that lingers perpetually around the bar, take your food to go instead. But eh, it's Polk street, what do you expect?

They sometimes however have live music on the little corner stage which is alright, cheap pitchers of margaritas and on sundays they have bottomless mimosas for brunch.

All in all it's a pretty unique and extremely tasty taco experience that's not to be missed.
author: Amy P.

description: This place is a little overrated in my opinion. I like it for the drinks and the crowd, but the food is mediocre. It might have been my own fault for getting so hyped up on the taco because I probably built up such high expectations, it couldn't have possibly satisfy me. Come early for happy hour on Tuesdays because this place gets packed! The margaritas at Rouge (the bar associated with Nick's Crispy Tacos) are really good, but it gets difficult to order drinks when it gets busy. They do have pretty good table service (if you're able to get one), though. Also, it's cash only (bar takes credit card) so make sure to have cash on you if you want some tacos!
author: Meygan N.

description:
This place is awesome-especially on a Tuesday night.

If you go later on in the evenings, expect a line...but the wait is worth it. The food is awesome, and the vibe is laid back and chilled out. Sometimes, getting a table will be really difficult. $2 beers on Tuesday nights for Taco Tuesday.
author: Seerat B.

description: Taco Tuesday and I have a love hate relationship. I love the the tacos at Nick's - not sure I can still handle the long the lines and packed crowd. Whenever I go, I end up having a great time. It is worth checking out if you haven't but Nick's really shines every other day of the week.
author: Sumit K.

description: They have 2 for $5 happy hour specials - super good deal, since their tacos are HEFTY. However, I also had a crispy fish taco & although it's good, it's DEFINITELY not worth the $6!!! I would have much rather gotten two extra tacos for that price.
author: Crystal W.

description:
this place is gaudy.  i don't like it at night as rouge, nor do i like it in the day as nick's.

i came here for taco tuesday b/c i have been looking for a new taco place since i just moved up from san diego

taco tuesday is huge in san diego for those of you who don't know.  $1 to $2 shrimp, fish, lobster, chicken etc. tacos, $3 margaritas at various establishments... it's heaven.

nick's crispy tacos did not even come close.  i was incredibly disappointed.  the pico de gallo was tasteless and watery.  the hot sauce wasn't even hot.  tacos were expensive in general.  my shrimp taco was 4.95... wtf.

not coming back here.
author: Jennifer L.

description:
I am a HUGE fan of Nick's crispy tacos. I've been here a couple times before, and I think the tacos are absolutely delicious! I always order mine Nick's way which comes with a heaping scoop of guacamole, cheese, and covered in both a hard and soft shell taco. These are easily the best tacos I've had since living in San Francisco. The Baja fish taco is unbelievable and I also really enjoy the carne asada and pollo. The tacos are quite large. I didn't think it could really get any better until....

TACO TUESDAY!!?!?@%**!! My friend reserved a booth and invited me to join her for Taco Tuesday. This is something that I had heard about, but never participated in, so I was excited to give it a try. $2 tacos. I'm in. $10 pitchers with several different options of beer. In. 

The place was pretty full, but not to the point of being uncomfortable. If you didn't go with a reservation it was pretty difficult to snag a table, though. The line for tacos went through long/short intervals, and I was very lucky because the line was short when I got there. I randomly saw a ton of people I knew, they played amazing music, and I had an incredible time. 

Hip, hip, hooray for Taco Tuesday at Nick's!
author: Holly G.

description: The pico on the chips and salsa appetizer was great. The elote corn was delicious. The crispy fish and grilled fish tacos were good. We preferred them the plain way rather than Nick's way. It's definitely a red aka rouge room with lots of chandeliers. A unique atmosphere. Didn't care for the guacamole.
author: Lorraine S.

description:
Came here after drinking at shanghai kelly's. Tacos are freaking AWESOME. I got me a carne asada and carnitas, both nick's way. I have to admit, they aren't the cheapest tacos but they are freaking delicious. Also, I was rather tipsy so the food could have been better than it really was but I wasn't THAT messed up so I'm sure the food was awesome regardless. The line can be intimidating but it moves quick and the food comes out quick.

The guy taking orders was a pretty funny guy too. I told him may name was Edward and me being tipsy said 'OR Eduardo' and he was like 'I will put down Eduardo because I like it better'. A different guy called my name to pick up the food and he gave me a weird look like 'You're Eduardo??' Good times.
author: edward k.

description: Great tacos for sure. I have never seen a combo of 3 bartenders work a bar slower. My food was late and I come to the bar to mull it over. It takes 15 mins to get a drink. This place drives a huge group of people but they are not capable of dealing with them. Great place with the wrong personnel. Its like being a 49ers fan.
author: Alex B.

description:
I love Mexican food and this is the first decent taco place I've been to on the city! 

Advice: Order the chicken crispy tacos with sour cream. Don't waste your money on the guacamole it was pretty bland and the red sauce gives a nice slightly spicy flavor to the tacos.

They default to soft tacos so make sure you specify Crispy!! It is nice because the cover the crispy taco with a soft tortilla so it's a nice balance of soft and crunchy.
author: Chirag V.

description:
What more can I say about this place other than, it's a pretty damn good taco stop! 
Tacos rock, my carne asada burrito was great too. It was pretty big, good size. I mean, not that size matters, but it was two hands full. One hand full is usually enough for me, but two? Even better!

Thanks Nick! 
I'll be back!
author: Brad G.

description:
Not bad, once I pushed through my social anxiety and figured out WTH I was supposed to do with myself. For the newbies, it's seat yourself and self-service (and no one will tell you that - no signs or anything). They are slow to clear tables, so you may be better off grabbing your food and eating at the bar.

The steak quesadilla I had was tasty (though slightly low on cheese) and the bartenders were friendly once I got their attention. I'm open to trying this place again.
author: Cat W.

description:
Pretty great taco shop with a unique menu and friendly staff! I would recommend their grilled fish tacos, but the steak and the chicken were also delicious, oh and definitely get the tacos Nick's style which is their speciality (soft and hard shell combined). Staff is awesome and they clean the tables immediately after the previous party leaves!

The bar area is nice and they have a full bar so you can technically eat dinner and have a beer or two before going to bars or a club! Would have given them 5-stars but I think the seating is limited and there is usually a pretty huge line.
author: Dmitriy V.

description:
FOOD: Baja-styled Mexican-American food (or whatever you want to call it), but it is delicious. My workplace caters from here on a semi-regular basis.  I didn't realize how expensive the tacos were, especially when done "Nick's way" (which is with jack cheese and a ton of guacamole) - it's about $5/taco.  Yikes.  I'm spoiled.  Oh well, I love these double-layered tacos, but maybe not enough to pay out of my own pocket.
Also good picks: the Black Bean and Grilled Corn Taco Salad ... and... the Sopa de Tortilla.  Flavorful and fresh-tasting!

AMBIANCE:  This is probably what does it for me most.  This place is connected to (the same as?) Rouge SF, which I guess is a Nightclub.  That would probably explain the strange decor.  With a name like Nick's Crispy Tacos, I expected a dive, but it is more like a trippy-confused swank-gaudy nightclub mixed with sports bar:  Many many chandeliers packed onto the ceiling.  Intimate C-shaped leather booths.  Large televisions dispersed for your easy sports-viewing pleasure.
author: Jeanne L.

description:
The pescado taco (nicks way of course) = one of the most amazing fish tacos I've ever had.  Fried perfect goodness. 

Still solid four stars -- this place is way crowded on Friday nights (see previous review).  But, the extended happy hour prices and delicious tacos keep bringing me back.
author: Kimya P.

description: More hype then tacos could live upto.  Had 3 different flavors, and all fell short of delicious.  "Nicks way" made for an awesome stale  texture.  Crispy tacos inside soft taco shell, made the crisp short lived.  Eat fast for proper texture I suppose.
author: Frank P.

description: Taco Tuesday's means cheap tacos and a pretty good party afterwards. But the food is just mediocre and that's what I'm reviewing here. I've been to a lot of taco shops and this place doesn't really even come to mind when I'm craving them. Cool venue, neat idea, ok food. Go experience it on a Tuesday either way. You'll have fun if a party is what you're looking for.
author: Gordon Z.

description: The food is sometimes good, but the delivery is ALWAYS late. Just took an hour and 45 minutes to deliver nachos and a quesadilla.  Everything arrived cold and soggy. No apology, no explanation. It's like this almost every time.
author: Aaron S.

description:
I sort of have a love hate relationship with this place. During off hours I love it----good food---cheap and affordable prices. But---during busy hours it is a madhouse (a direct correlation to the good food I surmise). 

But I hate the wait----- 

Only one other bummer-----bathroom is kind of well---not clean.. Filthy....

PS---add a star if you like velvet surroundings
author: Chris O.

description:
Nick's is about the tacos and you have to get them Nick's way. I am especially a huge fan of the fish taco. The ambiance is a little strange, but somehow it is charming in a slightly offbeat run-down divey kinda way.

Also, don't come here on Tuesday, unless you are prepared for a big scene of rowdy drunkards who make Taco Tuesday their thing. If you are part of that crowd than more power to you, but it ain't my thing.
author: Bryan K.

description: This place is super disappointing. Why bother with Nicks when you could go to Underdogs, which is like 20x better??? The food here is absolutely not worth it - cheese is cheap and not melted and the hot sauce has no flavor. The margaritas are disgusting - so much overly sweet mixer crap - and reviewers who say this is the best Mexican joint in town have clearly had too many of em'. Not a fan.
author: Jessica H.

description: Turn the f'ing heat on already. It's like a meat locker in there. I can see my breath.
author: J. P.

description:
I totally dig their food--the fish burritos are clean, healthy and awesome.  Get the grilled chicken nick style--soo good.

Kind of a weird night club atmosphere, but fun.  The bar is fully stocked and the crowd is cool.

I'll go back for sure--sit at the bar and grab some great food and beer.
author: Zack M.

description:
Teetering between 3-3.5. 

Don't get me wrong, they're still better than anything I can find in Boston....

My biggest annoyance is that the tacos have beans in them. If I wanted beans with my meat and tortilla, I'd, dunno, get a burrito.... I just feel like I'm getting ripped off. It's like finding out that your partner puts stuffing in...NEVERMIND

That said, the carnitas are rather tasty and the tacos are somewhat sizable. They should be. I'm pretty sure they were over $3 and they had a lot of beans in them. (But maybe $3 isn't that much...I tend to get my tacos from trucks with bullet holes).

They need to be better about having soap and paper towels (and lighting) in the bathrooms though.

Free chips and salsa with a Yelp app check-in.

But again, I live in Boston now and these are exceptionally better than anything I can find there!
author: Zulu Q.

description: A veggie taco, a veggie burrito and two glasses of red wine all for $19 plus the waitress threw in some nachos cos it was our first time! Great place for a pit stop
author: Lucy C.

description:
Great food, a huge following and a varied menu. 
My only disappointment was with the red and green sauces. Little depth or character... Food seemed fresh and the presentation creative. I only wish the hot sauce was of the same caliber.
Absolutely I'll be back.
author: Rick W.

description: Came in for an appetizer and drinks on a Monday afternoon. The place was empty, which was to be expected. I wasn't very impressed with the nachos or the margaritas. Also, the decor was a little weird.
author: Scott L.

description: Simply one of the baddest taco's out there, and I mean that in a good way. Nicks taco's Nick's way is the only way to have a taco from this establishment. This isn't your traditional street taco, so don't expect to try el pastor or lengua if you have that specific craving. This taco is just fully loaded with extra everything, need I say more? Okay, maybe just a little bit more. I'll leave you with: any taco made nick's way, especially the fish tacos, chips, avocado, and watermelon fresca. I just made myself hungry.
author: Limuel G.

description:
Order your tacos crispy with guacamole and you won't be disappointed!  Super busy (but also extremely fun) for Taco Tuesday, just don't expect a table with your discounted drinks.  The best Mexican food in San Francisco.

The only downside is that the food is cash-only.
author: Meagan M.

description: Life saving tacos and quesadillas on the late night. Fortunate enough to have stumbled past this place while in town for a conference.
author: Jordan R.

description:
A bit touristy, but the tacos are soo good.

Fish and steak tacos Nicks style are great, we paid for extra guac but I don't think we got much if any extra.
author: Andy S.

description:
Nick's crispy tacos is good if you have a deal for it. 

I came here because I had bought a Yelp deal ($10 for $20) and was very surprised to see that tacos done "Nick's Way" was $5. A taco for $5? I thought that was pretty crazy. 

I got the beef and pork taco and a quesadilla. The quesadilla was good - I gobbled mine down. However, the pork taco was kinda dry and not very flavorful at all. I was pretty disappointed since this is supposed to be a taco joint!

I'll come back if I have another deal. Otherwise, I think there are plenty other places that serve delectable tacos.
author: Kimberly F.

description:
I hate the line on Taco Tuesdays, but the tacos are good. The crowd is mostly young professionals getting off work. 

Other than Taco Tuesday, I rarely go to this joint.
author: Kissy F.

description:
Any time you can watch sports, drink beer, and eat great Mexican food, you are winning. Nick does a great job of combining these three elements at a few locations throughout the city (Underdog's is my favorite). 

Go with the taco's, get them Nicks way, shut up and eat.

My only knock is that the later the night gets the more bros roll in from union street and pack the bar, this often makes it tough to find seating.

IMO, this is a day-time lunch spot.
author: Robby A.

description: Nick's way all the way! Taco Tuesday's here is definitely worth it for 2 dollar tacos and another dollar for nick's way to add guac and a crunchy shell. Their salsa and chips is also addicting. Make sure to carry cash, since it is cash only. If you want drinks to go with it, the bar side has happy hour for margaritas and beer.
author: Susie N.

description:
Expectations were high when I went here based on what I had heard about this place.

 I got the bottom of the barrel horchata which was annoying since it has the chalky taste and the sediments. The chips and salsa were really good and gone in no time. The taquitos were tasty but slightly burnt. The chicken tacos came loaded and was delicious. Torn between giving this a 3 or 4 stars and decided to go 3 since others in the party were not as enthusiastic as me. 

BTW, I have been to Rouge before and liked it but not sure anymore after I saw how dirty and run down it looks during the day.
author: Sunil R.

description:
Mmmmmmm when they say 'crispy' tacos they really mean crispy tacos!

All of their tacos are wrapped in two tortillas, one crispy and freshly fried and one soft. It is absolutely DELICIOUS! I tried the carne asada which was oh.my.gosh good and the fried pescado, which is probably one of the best fish tacos I've ever had! 

I suggest getting all of the tacos "Nick's Way" because ummm guacamole??? Yes please! Also, the atmosphere is lush and super swanky too! Loved all the red and pretty lighting. Prices are not too bad, considering the tacos are pretty gigantic. I got stuffed after two!
author: Michelle H.

description: Good food for reasonable price on Taco Tuesday! Great environment, just go early because it can get really crowded.
author: Amanda T.

description: This review is mainly based on their take-out.I really try to like this place but after today I have given up. The food is decent although a bit bland. I ordered the Carnitas quesadilla to go and they had definitely been sitting for awhile and were cold. Seems like they need to work on their to go order system.
author: David R.

description:
The corn is ABSOLUTELY AMAZING.  You have got to try it, period.

The entrees were tasty.    However, parking is a pain, the lines are long, and there is very little seating.
author: Aamir Z.

description:
Nick's is basically a sports bar that sells tacos. We went on a sunny Sunday morning. It was pretty dark inside, and several football games were playing on different TVs. I had a good chicken taco, and a lukewarm fish taco that was overpriced at $4.50. The Tortilla Soup was good. I thought the horchata was too sweet. 

A good option for tacos but it won't be my first choice.
author: Kurt A.

description: I was visiting my sister from out of town and wanted to take her to lunch, so she recommended Nick's Crispy Tacos. I was so excited to take her up on her recommendation and try this place out. We were at the counter and placed our order. I proceeded to pay, and then found out it was a CASH ONLY joint!! I had no cash on me and felt completely humiliated because I knew my sister would not let me dare go to the ATM machine which was only three feet away from the cashier. She would not let me waste my hard earned dollars by using an ATM. I felt embarrassed because I was the one taking her out for tacos. She ended up buying our lunch and she paid the cash. The tacos were very good, but nothing to write home about. If you ever go here, make sure you bring plenty of cash (because they are very expensive) and an extra amount of patience.
author: Sarah J.

description:
Went here around 4:45 pm, there were street parking available on Polk, Vallejo, etc 1 block from the place. NOTE: On Broadway st. in between Polk and Van Ness, on the school/church/cant remember what it was side, no parking from 4-6 pm. I assume all the meters all have 1-hr limit, so I suggest come here at 5 so then the place isn't that crowded (esp on Taco Tuesdays, I heard it gets really busy) and you have exactly 1 hr til 6pm.

So I went here to see how do SF Weekly's Best Tacos taste like.

They were disappointing. My friend and I had the steak and fish tacos. We got them nick's style or something and the inner tacos were supposed to be crispy. Nothing crunched in my mouth. They were okay, nothing too special, didn't live up to the Best Tacos label.

We also ordered the nachos with sourcream, guac, and steak (which came out to be like ~$8). I liked it, but then, some of the nachos were not crunchy like how I want my chips to be. Like you know how when chips are left out exposed to air. but other than that, it was pretty good.

I liked the place, it's not somewhere I'd always go to but I could see why a lot of people would like to hang out there.
author: V B.

description: HORRIBLE SERVICE. Bartender was the worst I have ever dealt with. No customer service at all. AT ALL. Horrible attitude and should be let go because makes the business look bad. REALLY BAD! Will not be coming back and I will make sure my friends don't as well.
author: Andrew A.

description:
Tacos: amazing. After over 2000 reviews all I can say is, I conquer. 

Service: could use some pepping up. Not as friendly as I anticipated. 

I used the yelp check in deal to get free chips and salsa. The guy that took my order seemed annoyed? I don't know what his deal was. Then when my to-go order was ready a server handed me my tacos and I asked about the chips and salsa. The original guy that took my order came over and took my tacos and put them back with the rest of the to-go orders and tell the kid to go get the chips. Kid comes back with chips and asks where my food went, I point to it and he hands it back to me. It was a weird situation to say the least. The man that took my order all made both of them nick's way when I only asked for one of them. Whatever. 

Next time I'm there my expectations won't be so high but I'll probably stick to going to Under Dogs in the inner sunset for nick's way tacos.
author: Kate J.

description:
Some of the best tacos I've had in SF, but it's a straight [up] bro fest in this joint (I should have expected it-- it IS on Polk Street bordering the Marina after all). If you're a gay boy like me, I recommend that you go for the experience of getting tacos (to go) and not for the ambiance. It's pretty awkward realizing you're the only boy in there who has the nicest hair and shoes than the hoards of Giants jocks. 

Oh, how I wish this place were in the Mission!
author: Jerome C.

description:
The Holy Grail of fish tacos.

I came to San Francisco on a mission to have all the food that this city was known for during my stay. One of those stops on my mission was fish tacos.
To say I love fish tacos is an understatement. 
Nick's Fish Tacos were heavenly. After reading reviews on where to go for THE fish taco, I followed Yelpers' advice and went to this place. 
I was NOT disappointed. 
I got the Posada taco, Nick's way (of course). It was HUGE. I was concerned whether I would need 1 or 2 (some places serve such small fish tacos) but I was all set with 1. The piece of fish in the taco was generously sized. It also didn't taste greasy or heavy, which was nice. The spices they used, the crunch pieces of tortilla inside the soft shell. Man, this was delicious. I'm in Frisco for one more week, and I'm certainly going to make another trip here before I leave!
author: Chantal G.

description:
I dunno where else folks have been eating tacos, but these tacos are OK at best. 
The tomatoes are not very flavorful, and the salsas have no kick to them. 
And they are expensive! 
I went in there and got a couple of fish tacos, cost me like $8.50!
Yes, the place is nice, and yes, the booths are cool and all that, but it just kills me that the tacos are only so-so. I wanted to like them so much, but in the end, meh, I'd rather spend half the money and eat at a taqueria that has spicy salsa.
author: Adrian M.

description:
How on earth did i not know about this place???? 

Taco bliss! when you search for tacos in the encyclopedia a picture of these tacos should be what comes up! nothing more said needed but i will add more anyways: 

My boyfriend and I visit San Francisco quite a bit so I'm always looking for tasty places to try, i found this place on Yelp about a couple of weeks before my trip so with all of the great reviews and amazing pics everybody posted i had some pretty high expectations! 

Lemme tell you this place didn't disappoint! We started off with a couple soft drinks and an order of their Chips w/guacamole and salsa (extremely good! the chips were crispy, fresh and perfectly salted and topped generously with their delicious Guacamole and a pico de gallo type salsa) for the tacos i got the carnitas crispy taco and the crispy fried mahi mahi fish taco both Nicks Way (of course!) My boyfriend got the prawns taco (on a soft corn tortilla) and the carne asada taco also both nicks way. every single bit of it was nothing short of amazing! everything had great flavor, was fresh and the meat was good quality, juicy and their tacos are huge! we were so full! 

*don't be afraid to try the two delicious sauces in the squirt bottles @ the tables, ones a red sauce w/a tasty smoky flavor, and the others a green verde type (both mild heat) i did both for a christmas (red & green) 

this place deserves the 5 stars i gave them 
1. its very clean, plenty of seating (it gets crowded) and the menu's to the point. 
2. very friendly staff 
3. their foods fresh, delicious and great portions 
4. doing it nicks way- extra charge .75cents ea (ie. means your adding a heavy portion of Guacamole and cheese to your taco) and they're not skimpy!! 
5. their reasonably priced- 4 Big tacos (2 of which were seafood) all nicks way, chips w/guca/salsa and 2 soft drinks: $26)
author: Kristin M.

description:
Not sure why this place has such high reviews, I thought it was OK at best. I guess it doesn't help that I came on a Friday night when the restaurant is packed like a can of sardines. The line to order trailed for three quarters length of the restaurant. Finding a seat here was close to impossible. We ended up with one person sitting on a stool and having two people stand the entire time. (wasn't quite as bad as it sounds, but still sucked)

They had some deal going on that night (2 tacos for $5, they're $3.25 ea. originally) but that didn't apply to seafood which I was pretty bummed about since I love fish tacos. We ended up getting 5 of those deals for a total of 10 tacos for the 3 of us (yea we're cheap, gluttonous people) plus a couple beers (2 for $5 that night as well, not bad). We got an assortment of carne asada, pollo, pollo asado, and carnitas tacos. Tacos were alright, they seemed a little bland and lacking in flavor, we probably shouldn't have cheaped out and gotten them Nick's way instead. Favorite was the carne asada. I will say that the tacos were sized quite well and crammed with meat. We were stuffed to the brim afterwards.

The place was definitely on the more expensive side for tacos, especially without any deals or discounts. Oh, and the place is cash only. Overall it was pretty mediocre, I probably won't be back, at least not anytime soon.

2.5 stars rounded up for the good deals that night.
author: Kevin N.

description:
Pescado taco. Nick's way. I almost feel like writing a review doesn't do it justice. Seriously the best fish tacos I've had in the city, or anywhere in the bay for that matter. 

I ordered the carne asada taco and the pescado taco just so I could have variety and try different things. Have to say I'm still a little upset I wasted stomach space on the carne asada one. It was alright but nowhere near as magical as the fish taco. I could have eaten like 100 of them. Just kidding. The portion sizes are pretty big and 2 tacos is really filling. 

It wasn't just the quality of the food, the service was also amazing. The people that work there are all very friendly and so nice.  

Basically, two thumbs up. (Or 5 stars, I guess)
author: Leslie K.

description:
Great food. Definitely get the "Nick's Way" taco if you like gauc because the normal tacos don't come with it.

On Tuesday's this place gets really crazy so come early (before 6:30pm) if you want any chance of sitting somewhere while you eat.
author: Andrew M.

description: Super tasty, fast and friendly service and rad interior. Went with my coworker last week for lunch and only spent $5 for a filling chicken taco loaded with smooth flavorful guacamole and cheese. We could still use a great authentic burrito place nearby but Nick's is pretty great nonetheless.
author: Claire H.

description: I thought the tacos were just fine, but I wouldn't go out of my way to come here again. The favorite was the fish, with chicken being a close second. Definitely order the tacos "Nick's Way!"
author: K. D.

description: Love this place! Their food is absolutely delicious. I've been here a number of times, as my boyfriend lives right down the street. We've called in our order, which they are always on time and efficient - makes for an easy pick up. We've also eaten in, and it's a really fun atmosphere.  On nights where there's a sporting event on, it can get crowded, but it's a big spot with a good amount of tables, depending on the game.  Their food is so good! I highly recommend any of their tacos, done Nick's way, or burritos. The Pescado burrito is my bf's favorite - it's delicious! and he's from San Diego so that's saying something. Nachos are amazing; their chips are thick and crispy. Good beer selection. I love the atmosphere, so definitely recommend it for a fun night out!
author: Andrea L.

description:
Fried fish taco wrapped in a soft corn tortilla- genius!!!!

Being from San Diego I miss really good Mexican food- specifically tacos. I've tried tons of places in the Mission, but none stack up to this one fish taco. This one reigns supreme, and I would even venture to say that this is probably the best fish taco I've ever had.  I'm not a fan of the frat-like crowd here, but the taco was so good I hardly noticed.
author: Nadiyah S.

description: Great tacos! Ill come back for them and im excited to order delivery!!! Wasnt thrilled about how packed this place was even after 9pm on a tuesday. Ill have to go on another day and check it out when its not taco tuesday.
author: Kristan B.

description: 2 words: TACO TUESDAY. If you haven't gone yet you should go. $2 tacos, $5 margaritas, unlimited fun.
author: Simran K.

description:
I got the carne asada and pollo tacos. They're both so much larger than expected, and SO GOOD. I honestly don't even know what was inside. Meat, beans, ... lots of gaucamole. The tacos are also layered with tortilla chips (maybe?) which adds a crunchy layer to the whole mess.  My total came out to be $10 (because I got cheese and guacamole), but you get what you pay for. 

The vibe is very casual. It's a little dark and when I went there was a band playing. Overall, a fun and delicious experience. Definite recommend.
author: Alice W.

description:
It's SF Mexican food, but it is actually tasty! They have baja style tacos (super plus) and of course, tacos Nick's way which I am sure someone else has pointed out. Nice place to watch sports too and the salsa is yummy! 

Bottomless mimosas on certain days too.
author: Kat M.

description:
Probably my favorite taco place in SF. I say you keep it simple and to the point. You came for tacos...GET the tacos!. Now, I am sure that there are other great items on the menu , I just haven't tried them. Back to the tacos... Of course you'll have to get them Nick's way. Dear Nick ( who ever you are)... I say thank you!.

I've had the steak, the chicken and the pescado and let me tell you, they are delicious.  Get them "Nick's" way and you'll get the perfect amount of guac and jack cheese.

With a medium horchata, you are in for a treat.  The horchata was a little warm, but perfect amount of cinnamon and not too sweet.

Of course the decor of the place is also great. Great interior design with lots of red and silver. The place turns into club Rouge at night. If you can get a booth, sit in a booth.

Cheek out the pics. Whenever I am on Polk at., I am lobbying that we go to Nick's Crispy Tacos.
author: saum z.

description:
I would kill my own mother for some Nick's Crispy Tacos! They are like crack.

It's a taco place nestled inside of a pretty cheesy night club (EVERYTHING is red, except for the disco-ball-mirrored columns, bar, etc.). You're just going to have to get over that, and fast, if you want to eat some DELICIOUS EFFING TACOS.

Also, if you are not getting your tacos here Nick's way, you are totally doing it wrong.
author: Celeste R.

description:
Welcome to another "Dear Archie G." review.

Dear Archie G.,

This upcoming weekend, I am visiting from out of state and heading into San Francisco to visit my best friend. While in town, I wanted to grab some delicious Mexican food for dinner. Unfortunately, Mexican food in San Francisco tends to be pretty terrible. 

No matter where I go or highly ranked on Yelp, I am left disappointed. Isn't San Francisco supposed to be the food capitol of California? If so, why is Mexican, as well as other cuisines so mediocre or downright bad here? Can you please recommend a good Mexican joint that focuses on food, rather than the (drunken) atmosphere surrounded by imbeciles with multiple popped collars?

-Sexy Mexi in Manhattan

Dear Sexy Mexi,
