There's a common misconception that San Francisco is some sort of culinary destination. The truth is, San Francisco is full of transplants that left their hometowns because they felt different and unaccepted. They grew up on food that tasted like paper with a sprinkle of salt. Sadly, they don't know any better, so they think any steaming pile of crap on a plate is delicious. 

Even worse, they are quick to jump on social networks and rave about their rat feces burrito. Eventually, new transplants are afraid of being different and unaccepted in their new "hometown" of San Francisco (since they moved here for those same reasons), so they follow the lead of transplants before them and rave about "Crunchy Cucaracha Enchiladas" at the famous "Taqueria Basura." 

Sadly, people perceive value. And that mediocre Mexican joint is rocking a 4 star rating in San Francisco in the lower Haight, would only merit 2 stars in East San Jose because San Jose natives know what Mexican food is supposed to taste like. They just know better. Yeah, maybe they don't know which brand of skinny jeans are in, or what alternative rock band that has only sold 17 albums is super cool right now, or where to buy a powder pink Giants cap; but they do know Mexican food. Trust.

With all of that said, as I am from San Jose, I highly recommend Nick's Crispy Tacos in San Francisco. This place would get 4 stars in San Jose, San Francisco, or Tijuana. It's that damn good.

It's located in Nob Hill and has limited hours. It's only open during the day as the place turns into "Rouge" at night, a dance club that  has repetitive music that goes uns, uns, uns...

This place has real value, as the only use the best ingredients. The menu is limited, so it's easy to order. I'll make it even easier for you. Just walk up to the register and order two tacos "Nick's Way" (with carne asada, carnitas, or fish) and a lime flavored Jarrito or horchata. This should be enough to feed you. And if you aren't concerned about fitting into some San Francisco style skinny jeans, go wild and order a third taco. And if you ever want to be a contestant on "The Biggest Loser," just step up the plate and order a fourth taco. Rawr!

When a taco here is done "Nick's Way," they fry the inner tortilla, wrap it with a warm tortilla, and then slab a pound of amazing Guacamole on top. It's freakin' delicious. Get ready to "Guac and Roll." Ba-Dum-Cha!

Bad joke aside, you really have pay the extra $1 to get them Nick's Way. It's totally worth it. Nick can have his way with me anytime. Oh wait. Not sure if I should have said it like that. I was kidding. No, seriously. It's not like that. I swear.

Anyway, I hope you enjoy your meal. I know I do every single time. And it's one of the few joints in San Francisco that actually lives up to the hype.
author: Archie G.

description:
What the heck? I was expecting some bomb tacos since this place has such great reviews. I ordered a few crunchy tacos: two carne asada and one carnitas. Came out to ~$15 after tax, which for tacos seems pretty outrageous. 

The portions are pretty big, and supposedly they use Niman ranch meats, which might account for some of the high price. However the texture of the meat was really dry and pretty much flavorless. Also, is it just me or do their crunchy taco shells pretty much taste like dehydrated soft shells that have been left out for too long? Crunchy shells to me mean crunch like chips.

Maybe I was there on an off night or something, but this place is way overrated in my opinion.
author: Teng L.

description:
Nick's is a great spot in SF, especially Taco Tuesday nights where it pretty much turns into a party. 

Food: I'm all about fish tacos. I've had the pescado, grilled fish and the camarones. All are delicious, but pescado is my fave. Make no mistake, get it nick's way.

Ambiance: It's a casual spot. Lots of seating but it get packed, almost all the time. You order at the cashier and serve yourself for the most part (get your own water, get your own utensils). The restaurant is attached to Rouge, which functions as a lounge on weekends. It's a random setup, but it works. 

Parking: Russian hill. Not easy, but there are metered parking spots all up and down that street.

These are some of the best tacos i've had in the city!
author: Sabeen c.

description:
I have a rule that if the place that I'm going to eat at has one of its menu items in the name itself, then I have to try it. So what did I have at Nick's? Well the Crispy Tacos of course!

I got the Vegetarian Crispy Taco, with chips, salsa and guacamole, and a churro for dessert. First, the taco. Crispy, delicious, flavorful, and a tonnn of guacamole. I only had one, and was getting full. The chips, salsa and guacamole tasted so authentic, fresh, and delicious. Starting to get more full, but I can't leave without having a churro! The churro.. oh boy. Tasted like the ones that they would sell at the flea markets in the Central Valley (if you haven't gone, you should). Crispy outside, hot and soft on the inside, delicious cinnamon sugar coating it. I had to take small bites to savor the churro.. and to make sure I wouldn't overstuff myself.

Definitely coming back here when I start craving some tacos. Next time, I'll have to try their burritos!
author: Sarah H.

description: Oh Taco Tuesdays... Tacos Nick's Way are fantastic... never had them any other way.  Guac and chips are on point.  Plenty of TV viewing for games... and this is actually an Auburn bar too if you're a college fan.  Good drink specials, but if you want a table, you better call in advance because Taco Tuesday time slots are limited to like 1.5 hours or so
author: Brett B.

description: I was a little skeptical due to the guacamole which should be fresh! However, the shrimp taco was perfectly seasoned.. This is a great casual spot.
author: Mira P.

description:
LOVE the fish tacos... though whats up with all the loud drunk marina guys hanging out in there having a bro-fest? 

put some music videos on instead of the football and kick those baboons out!
author: Ken B.

description:
I ordered the carne asada and pescado tacos.

Pescado Taco: I'm not sure about the hype, it tasted good...but not amazing. Anything fried tastes good?

Carne Asada Taco: very dry, probably not marinaded enough

They both came in big portions that I was full after 2 and I'm not the type of person that gets full off only 2 tacos.
author: Dorris W.

description:
I like Nick's tacos. Their soft tacos, yes, but not so much for their crispy ones. Nick's way, that's what they call it. I usually come on Tuesdays, which it's probably one of the busiest days of the week; Taco Tuesday. Soft tacos all the way. 

My usuals: 
-Carne Asada 
-Carnitas 
-Camarones 

Maybe the next time I try Nick's way I should order their baja style fried fish. I have yet to try their beer battered fish taco, but I've had it once at Underdogs (Nick's way) and it was no bueno. Nick's way is definetely not something I would choose off the menu  on a regular basis. Other than that, their soft tacos are delicious! I'm a fan.

This business accepts CASH ONLY, but don't you fret, they have an ATM.
author: Jenny K.

description:
Super fun place, crazy nightclub decor, and delicious food.  Taco's "Nicks way" are so good, and filling!

Sunday lunch is a little packed ($10 bottomless mimosas), but you shouldn't have to wait too long for a seat.
author: Woody M.

description: The quality of  service at this place is the equivalent of horse shit.   The bartenders are a useless wastre of space who will will literally go out of there way to ignore you.  Avoid At all costs!!
author: Beeza B.

description:
I loved this place...but I have a thing for chandeliers
Great happy hour and Taco Tuesdays is great!
I even got a deal through yelp so make sure you check in!
author: Lidia Z.

description:
I don't know why but I have been dying to come here for years. Maybe it is because it is a taco stand, maybe it is because it is a taco stand right outside of Chinatown. Hard to say. Either way, it lived up to what I hoped.

Tacos are served in a lounge bar with red booths and gaudy mirrored walls and some groovy reggae in the background. Went on a Sunday night so the bar was active with football fans cheering, made it festive inside at least.

Ordered the pescado taco Nick's way and their corn on the cob. Both were yummy and delightful, as desired. The fish was super crispy and huge, hardly a date taco. Smothered in guac and all wrapped for your dining pleasure in wax paper to help avoid mess. I am a fan of the corn, smothered with cheese and pepper and sweet and cooked perfectly. 

I am not sure it is better than their sister site, mainly cause the other place is a cleaner flavor than this. This is the embodiment of bar food, fried, delicious and quick.
author: Mandy L.

description:
Nick's is a well known / popular neighborhood Russian/Nob Hill establishment that serves good Mexican food / tacos and in the evenings weirdly becomes this Asian nightclub called Rouge.  The place is casual (weekend brunch you can even catch people in shacker attire) but it tries to be classy with red/black color scheme & nice chandeliers.  

The food is choice -- big portions, good flavor etc.  In particular I like their guacamole and their breakfast burritos.  Pretty big menu and they are good about customizing it to your liking.  They also have a full bar, which takes CCs (restaurant section is cash only but has an ATM).  They have a number of TVs but in my experience it is not a great place to watch a game if you actually care about said game, as the place gets too crowded/loud / hard to find a seat (and the TVs are kind of small / far from the booths).  

A lot of people like to talk about $2 Taco Tuesdays, but in my opinion the lines get way too long if you actually want to eat (although Tuesdays can be a good time to people-watch).  I prefer the 2 for $5 Fridays and the bottomless mimosa Sun brunch (goes until 3) and the all day happy hour on Sundays as well.  The line can be daunting, but once you make it through, they are very fast to bring out your food.   The space is big but seating can be deceptively hard to come by during weekends and obviously on Tuesdays when the place is packed to the gills. 

One request if the Nick's folks are reading this: y'all need to get some bigger cups for the complimentary water!  I can go through like 6 cups over the course of a meal...sometimes it feels like I'm spending more time going over to that carafe than I am actually eating the meal / socializing with my friends.
author: Molly B.

description:
Hungry on our way back from a day lounging in the SF sun the hubby and I called in our to-go order at Nick's on our walk back to the apartment. We got 2 tacos 'Nick's Way' (crispy with guac) one pescado (that's fish for all of you non-spanish speaking friends) and one carne asada. Also, we got a pollo asada burrito 'Con todo' (with sour cream, cheese, and guac). When we got to the restaurant our food was ready to go and we could pay with Level Up which I love! Otherwise it was cash only. The total was $21 with tax and was more than enough food for the both of us.

After walking a quarter mile home the tacos and burrito were still in pretty good shape considering their trip, and they were delicious. However, there was a strong winner that we both fought over and it was the pescado taco. Neither one of us thought that we liked fish tacos that much but this was the best we had ever had! The sauce was delicious and the fish was fresh without any hint of fishy-ness. The fresh lime packed in the foil was such an added bonus when squeezed over the top of the taco and the guac added a perfect creamy texture to the mix. We could not stop raving about the fish taco and will go back again just for it!
author: Emily S.

description: Hilarious decor - red velvet strip club turned taco joint. Had the fish tacos (nick's way is the only way to eat these tacos) which were great just wish it was that messy to eat. Also had nick's nachos which were great. Loved the sauces at the table - must try the red sauce! Nothing better to have the food with a pitcher of margarita!
author: Chrissie W.

description: How does this place have 4 stars? The only thing that tasted decent was the chips n salsa. We had 3 tacos and a burrito for 30$. The tacos and burrito tasted like nothing.  No flavor at all. So I drenched it in their table side hot sauce. Still no flavor...no spice either.  I really was looking for to eating here considering all the reviews and the 4 stars and the fact that I love tacos.  Very disappointed.
author: David S.

description: Unquestionably the best tacos in california. Undoubtedly!!! Make sure you get them Nicks way and baja pescado is the best (my opinion obviously). Perfecto
author: Matt L.

description: Really good tacos but gets super packed on taco Tuesdays so come early or be prepared to stand.
author: Julia ..

description:
There's a good reason why it's not called "Nick's Crispy Tacos AND Burritos."  I'm not sure why I was so eager to test the quality of their burritos, but I already started having doubts when they rang me up for $11 for a grilled chicken burrito "con todo" and a large horchata.

That's a lot of money for a crummy burrito and some sugar water.  The burrito was about 85% black beans and rice, with the occasional bite of (very good) chicken and pico de gallo.  There was no guacamole in sight.  Nor sour cream or cheese, as promised.  Since I'm a firm believer that rice doesn't belong in a burrito and the menu doesn't list rice as one of the ingredients they put in their burritos, I was confused why the thing was filled with the starchy stuff.  Give me a heads up next time so I can order without!

Even ignoring the various oversights on what they did and didn't put into the burrito, it just wasn't all that good.  If I ever recover, I'll be sticking to the tacos...
author: Laurence W.

description:
I like Nick's, but sometimes the Red Booths smell like puke...  It's not always easy to scarf down some tacos when it smells so bad.  Thanks for providing a yummy taco, but how about some bleach to clean?

Thanks!
author: Josh R.

description:
Ok, so the veggie burrito was good. I'm super impressed you used cabbage as well. Awesome. 

-1 your hot sauce is not hot. the burrito was not spicy. ?!

-1 a veggie burrito costing $6.70, that is half the size of a cancun burrito... um, no.

-1 why does something that costs $5.95 on your board then total $6.70 with tax? last i checked, it wasn't more than 10%, and 10% of 5.95 is 59.5 cents... not 75 cents. i know this is ridiculously picky, but when i asked how that math worked out, you didn't give me a receipt... but i just didn't want to bother with it anymore. still, what?

Oh and nice pinto beans that weren't cooked to a mash. +1

-1 for being a posh dance club meets sports bar meets new age diner and then has a taqueria on the side at the bar. maybe that's just how nob hill is when it comes to taquerias?

Better than... cafeteria burritos... not worth the $$.
author: Amanda S.

description: On a Tuesday night, this place is happening! Overflowing with people, tacos everywhere, it's certainly a fun place to be. Be prepared to eat standing up as you might not get a table. The bright red walls and chandeliers give this place quite a bit of character.
author: Amy M.

description: This review is only for the one taco and nachos that I've tried only and they are both DELICIOUS! Best pescado taco and gnarly nachos! Cheap too. I think about $5 for each hand side taco.
author: Elaine N.

description:
After Aux Delices, this is my third kitchen extension on Polk. Only sometimes I'm too tired to cook, don't want Vietnamese, Real foods is closed, one roommate is at work, and don't want the other  roommate to cook because he has set the house on fire twice and swears he's Ratatouille. No offense, buddy ;).

Since the first time I went to Nicks I've always asked myself, where does Nick hide? What is Nicks Crispy Tacos? Is it a bar? a taqueria in the day? a club at night? All we really know is it's Mexican, cheap, quick, the lines can go all the way to Shanghai Kelly's, particularly sketchy that one side only allows cash and the other side accepts cash and cards, It's popular on Taco Tuesdays, you can reserve your table beforehand, has TV's, tacky looking chandeliers, red booths, red curtains, and other red looking things. Ask for Santiago, he's cool!

I grew up in Central America and I have to say, ¡Caramba! This place is fugly, but you can't complain. Also, they aren't like real tacos, these are massive. But, come on, where else on Polk can you find good Mexican tacos? Just make sure not to take a date here, not sexy. Friends, yes, always. 

Go for the Margarita pitcher, Nachos, Tacos: Fish, Carne Asada, and Pollo and always Nicks way, unquestionably!

Tips:
#1 If you check into the Yelp App: 1 free chips with salsa (Not Tues)
#2 Beware of Rouge (YES, I have been there once in my life after being convinced from my neighbors. It was awful. My friend almost got beat up by a wannabe looking Snooki for just dancing near her table)
#3 If you are like me who always forgets to have cash, go to Walgreens and get cash back, don't use those sketch ATMs. 
#4 Maybe it was a once time thing, but keep an eye out for three incredibly sexy European models here who i'm guessing where lesbian and wanted pictures with me and invite me to shots = awesome! 

Don't let your friends drag you to Rouge, Nick's si. If by accident you have had too many drinks and happened to stay late and it turned into Rouge, run, man, RUN, don't think twice!
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Who knew?  The best tacos are not in the Mission and are not made by Mexicans!  Maybe Nick's is pandering to the American palate that likes greasy crispy fried texture and gooey cheese product, but with over 1300 Yelp reviews it can't be wrong.  More pricey than a taco truck or Mission dive, after taxes the tacos will run you between $4.60 and $5.70 (since you shouldn't even think about getting it any way but Nick's Way)!  I went just after the lunch rush and the lines still moved slowly, I can't begin to imagine the hot mess this place will be with all the el cheapo patrons on Taco Tuesdays!

Nachos: It always annoys me that I cannot get nacho cheese at any of those taquerias in the Mission.  Screw queso blanco and oaxaca cheese, I want the orange kind that oozes.  No clue what their recipe is, but probably doesn't include the lesser varieties like Velveeta and Cheez Whiz.  The nacho chips themselves were good too - hardy.

Nick's Way Taco: Two medium sized soft corn tortilla shells (from a bag, not freshly gridled from fresh masa).  The inner most shell is semi-deep fried to give a strong structure and amazing crunch.  It also makes the tortilla shell tastier because they're infused with grease.  The regular soft outer tortilla shell adds a texture contrast, almost like the Double Decker at Taco Bell.  They also add on some guacamole and jack cheese.  Wish there was a lower price point option for just the crispy upgrade since the cheese and guac addition don't add much taste.

Guacamole: I've been spoiled by the authentic Mexican restaurants that have authentic Mexicans scooping authentic Mexican avocados at your table side for an authentic Mexican freshly hand hacked guacamole.  It was good here, just probably made earlier in the morning and machine processed so missing that finer detail.

Carne Asada: Cubes of grilled seared goodness with no soggy pieces.  The pinto beans were a bit overkill because who needs beans when you have that much meat?

Pollo: My favorite of the two chickens.  Mostly white meat, but tender since it was slow simmered.  Loads of flavor.  Once again, the pinto beans were kind of unnecessary.

Pollo Asado: Bland, dry and tough.  Horrible way to mess up free range poultry.

Carnitas: iNo es auténtico!  Soft pulled pork without any of the crispiness we love from true carnitas.  Also seemed to be lacking on the spices.  The pinto beans seemed like flavorless filler in this one.

Pescado: Fried tortilla shell, fried fish and lime mayonnaise... sounds like a perfect American innovation on Mexican food.  The breading is full of spices and is extra crunchy, way better than those boring fish & chips style filets other taco joints use.  The cabbage and cilantro were good choices too, helping balance out the fried factor.

Grilled Fish: Nowhere near as good as the pescado.  Bland and a tad fishy tasting.

Camarones: Could this be?  My first meaty shrimp taco that doesn't taste rubbery or overcooked?  Totally awesome.  The shrimp looks almost unreal in the shape of cool shrimp discs.

Vegetariano: Bad idea.  Other tacos already have pinto beans in them (carne asada, carintas and pollo) so there was nothing new in this one.  At the same price of four other meat tacos, why bother?

Melon Agua Fresca: A disappointment.  The melon seemed puréed so each sip yielded a bunch of grainy slush.  Would have been better if in the form of  larger muddled chunks to add flavor to the sugar water without bordering a smoothie texture.
author: Adam B.

description:
Pescado taco, Nick's way. Oh yes baby.

So big that you honestly need just one taco... unless you're a FA =). Free chips and salsa with a Yelp check-in!
author: Alex R.

description: It's good, but not great, or worth going out of your way for.  The establishment is mildly sketching.  You go up and buy your food then you sit down and wait for it, it's a bit confusing if it's your first time.  All in all, pricing is relatively fair and the food is average.  Doesn't exactly live up to the hype in my opinion.
author: Andrew H.

description:
Best fish tacos- ever.
Came here twice over my weekend visit to San Fran- the food was that good!
casual cool atmosphere- 
really generous portions- they said 1 is a snack, 2 is a meal- each one is pretty big but you want to order 2 because they're so good!
prepare to leave really full and happy....and then return asap!
author: Dena R.

description:
Good but priciest taco I've ever had considering I'm use to paying $2.00 on Roosevelt Ave .   This taco had a twist though, remember those taco bell commercials, soft taco shell on the outside hard nacho shell on the inside , well this is why Nick's Crispy Tacos is"crispy", for some reason before I arrived here I imagined something different.... Anyhoot def. a decent taco but not something to go out of your way for.

The place itself is a dump  in day light,  dirty clubs in the morning don't make good eating spots... I was worried I'd see puke stains on the velvet chairs.  

Enjoy!
author: Jan Y.

description:
Nick's is solid but I felt like I wasn't quite cool enough to be there. I wasn't feeling the whole hipster vibe and right when I walked in I started to wish I had gotten that tattoo I wanted get back in college.... 

But as far as the food goes it's solid and I don't think I would ever make a trip to go back, but if I was near it and somebody wanted to go there then I wouldn't object. Got the fish, grilled chicken, carne asada, and carnitas tacos. The tacos don't automatically come crisp because why do that it's not in the name or anything, so you pay extra to have them crispy. The fish taco was the best of the bunch with carne asada bringing up the rear. I'll admit though the red and green sauces at the table were pretty good.
author: Greg T.

description: Taco Tuesday at Nick's Crispy Tacos!! There are a few reasons this place is packed on Tuesdays; low prices ($3 tacos, $2 giant quesadilla and $2 chips and guac.), pitchers of margaritas ($19), and the tacos! These are not your typical happy hour tacos, get them "Nick's Way". The tacos were delish, and the guacamole is better than Chipotle. 4 stars, check it out, the food is awesome. The only downside, is that it is so popular there is never anywhere to sit.
author: Kristin F.

description:
Come early and often to Nick's for some $2 Taco Tuesdays. Last time I was there a friend figured out if you Yelp checked-in on your smart phone, you got half-off a pitcher of beer. Needless to say everyone did so and we stayed another hour or two longer. 

The place gets really crowded around 7:30-8 and the taco line can seem intimidating. But it usually moves quickly and the tacos are worth it.

My one gripe is it usually takes me a pretty long time to get a drink from a bartender. Several friends blame this on my average looks, and while they may have a point, I chalk it up to needing another bartender or two. Setting up shop with one of the waiters is a better move than standing at the bar. You can order from them while they're running around and it usually takes much less time to get some service.
author: Jonathan G.

description:
Went back and tried the crispy tacos - a definite improvement over what I now call the Sadness Burrito I had last month, but the fillings continue to be cooked well but underseasoned. The fried fish taco in particular would be slamming with a better sauce over the top...perhaps even moreso if they removed that useless soft tortilla - you're just diluting the crispiness by double-tortilla-ing, guys!

And FYI, the grilled fish taco is a gloppy, slimy mess....I would really love to see it grilled a little more cleanly than that.
author: Bradley M.

description:
My marketing professor would say this place needs to decide what it is.  You walk into a place on Saturday night that looks like a club and says "Rouge" outside.  Sure nuf, it's all. red. inside.  Your friend swears there's tacos by the side, and at this point you're thinking they're pulling your leg.  Half the people are wearing tshirts and sneakers, the other half are dressed all nice.
And then you get your taco and have your pitcher of margarita (with help of course...or not), and it all starts making a little more sense...

By 10pm, the tshirt wearing peeps have all been replaced by scantily clad girls in heels.  On your way out, you pass the bouncer and the line of people trying to get in to the very exclusive club where you just had a fried taco.  And a darn good taco, at that.

What?

Well, if the mishmash of ideas is part of what makes it special...if it ain't broke don't fix it, right?
author: Yushan K.

description: Best tacos I've ever had! I usually get one veggie and one fish taco. You must get them Nick's way! Loses a star because seating is a bitch. Just avoid this place on Tuesdays if you're not going for the "marina-like" scene. Oh, and bring cash!
author: Sami L.

description:
I LOVE Nick's Crispy Tacos, but NOT from this location (head to Underdog's instead).... 

We ordered: 

FOOD 
*Chips, Salsa, and Guac: Same 'ol, same 'ol--no complaints. Chips was crisp and held up well to the salsa and guac. Guac was fresh and buttery. 
*Pescado Taco (Nick"s Way!): Ehhh.....the fish was way over fried. It was a dark brown color, overcooked and a bit dry. Also, the fish didn't taste very fresh at all. All the sour cream and guac in the world couldn't mask the poor quality and preparation of the fish. 

What's up with their trademark salsa's here? My usual fav of salsa verde was watery, not seasoned, and not spicy at all! Argh! 

SERVICE: Self-service--pay upfront and they bring you your food. 

AMBIANCE: Non-existent. I can't get over the fact that it's in Rouge; but do people really still go there? The floors and tables were sticky--GROSS! We ate in the booth and the table was literally a 2 feet away from our chest. This is not a good thing especially eating the tacos can get very messy. 

Like I mentioned I LOVE Nick's Pescado Tacos, but I will never come to this location again. Once the craving hits, I'll be heading to Underdog's where the food quality is far better, cleaner, and the service friendlier.
author: Cherylynn N.

description:
This isn't my first time at Nick's but it is my first time for Taco Tuesday's!!! I read the previous reviews (super helpful!!) and made a note to go a bit earlier. We got there around 7 and I was worried it'd be packed, but thankfully it was still manageable. The crowd was definitely rockin' away especially with the NBA playoffs on. 

Ambiance: Mid 20s-Early 30s crowd. Mainly working folks who just got off work and want to get together with friends for some cheap drinks and food. 

Service: Good. It's CASH ONLY so don't forget to hit up the atm before you get there. You order up front, get a number and then they bring it to you wherever you are. You can order all meat tacos fro $2 (fish isn't included - BUMMER!!!) and for Nick's Way, it's an extra dollar. Your total should come out to $3.23

Food: GOOD. My favorites at Nick's are the baja fish tacos and the quesadillas. They are amazing and to die for!

Drinks: On Taco Tuesday's, you can get a pitcher of beer for $10 and a pitcher of margarita for $18. 

Price: Fair. I think for a baja fish taco Nick's way, it'll come out to be around $5 or a bit less. Might be a bit pricey, but so worth it for amazing-ness. Definitely worth trying that and quesadillas!!!

I will definitely come back, but I'm not sure if I'll be back for another Taco Tuesday since what I really wanted was the baja fish tacos. Also, it's tough because seating is so limited and you basically need to hawk for any available seats which make the experience not to pleasant. 

Hope this helps!
author: Sharon G.

description: It is all about the 2 for $5 Friday! Splurge a little, and drop another $1 to get your tacos done Nick's Way ;)
author: J H.

description:
I'm liking nick's crispy taco's. A little over a year back I first started going to nick's because I saw it on 7x7's top 100 foods to try in SF. Of course the Baja taco was the recommended dish and of course i loved it. I have brought a number of friends to this location because it is a great spot for enjoying a casual meal and drinks. With rouge being directly connected and the booth seating its a really great environment. Not to mention the convenient location on Polk that is great for bar hopping. However, I've decided to mix it up from the typical taco and my new found love at nicks is the chicken taco salad. It is perfect balance of ingredients and my favorite taco salad that i have had in SF. 

To my surprise they also have spendgo there! I first saw spendgo at the yogurt shop and I'm now a frequent visitor of few of  these locations. 5 salads in....and I'm well on my way to my reward!
author: K B.

description:
I doubt I have to write my own review for this place - read all the other amazing reviews.

I love the fish taco, the veggie taco, and the fantastic salsas.
author: Anuj K.

description:
I am a huge fan of fish and where else to get some good old seafood than SF? After seeing all the good reviews about their fish tacos, my family and I decided that Nick's Crispy tacos was a place we had to go to!

I ordered:
-Crispy Fish taco with guac and cheese: SOOOO SOOO good! They put a good amount of guac on there and they give you a generous portion of the fish too. Probably the best fish taco I've ever eaten! Really good and flavorful.
-carne Asada: i thought it was pretty good. i didn't really like that they put beans in it. Fish tacos are the must order items here!

It was pretty big and roomy here. The place kind of reminds me of a night club. Definitely a place worth visiting if you are in SF!
author: Phuong K.

description:
My friend brought us here and told us they make the best tacos. I dont know if I would say they are the best tacos Ive ever had, but they are darn good. I ordered a Pollo Asado, Carnita (both Nicks Way) and a Fish Taco. Our food took some time to come out, but when I saw everything I understood why. These tacos are pretty big and triple wrapped in corn tortillas. Out of the three I ordered the Carnitas was hand down my favorite. By the time I finished my Carnitas & Pollo Asado, I barely had room for my Fish Taco. I finished half of it and pushed it aside. My friend ordered the Elote and I took a few bites. Coming from AZ, I wasnt blown away by it, but again it was quite good. 

We opted to sit at the bar and the bartender was great. He was funny, nice and told us about a great Friday special. A pint & a shot for $5...I aint mad at that!!! Definitely hit up Nick's if youre in Frisco. You wont be disappointed.
author: Lucky U.

description: I have ordered from there multiple times, clearly stating in the comments every time my simple order of THREE ingredients. They have yet to get it right. It's expensive, and they don't even bother to give me a beans, cheese, and rice burrito? You just lost a customer.
author: Paulina P.

description:
This place confuses me.

It's like walking into a hip-hoppity club &seeing scantily dressed girls and guys in suits, but instead of dancing, they're standing and eating tacos. 

Then there are the red cushy velvet sofas all along the side, where the vip would normally orders bottles, but instead there are groups of people overfilling the tables with stacks and stacks of tacos &pitchers of margaritas.

Oh and their tacos confuse me too! They're sooo crispy, but soft... softer than a hard taco (I don't normally like hard tacos anyway). It was definitely tastier (& a bit cheaper!) than the taco I had in the Mission- they had a 2 for $5 special on tacos 5-10pm which is bombass!

Note: make sure to reserve a booth ahead of time, they make the tacos much much more enjoyable.
author: Lucia C.

description: Its hit or miss, I had Nicks for my first SF when moving here a few moths ago and it was fresh and crispy. Just brought a friend who was visiting from out of town there and our order got messed up, we got Nicks way and they came out regular and he didn't realize that all the add ons cost so was blown back when we shelled out over $40 for a few tacos and a burrito before even even getting beers.
author: Max S.

description:
OK, I'm converted.  I'll do all the tacos Nick's way from now on.

Baja style crispy fish tacos.  How come it took me so long to find you?

$3 mimosas, bloody marys, and draft beer on weekend afternoons.  How sweet is that?
author: Jenny L.

description:
This is one weird place.  It's like a hipster's dream.  Shabby but hip...hipster and peculiar.

Nicks tacos are good until you get to the bottom of the taco plate and see the grease.  Gross.  The bar and the restaurant are two separate businesses under one roof. Odd too.  As weird as this place is, there is something endearing about it.  It's a blast to sit at a table with 6 of your best guy and girl friends, drink a beer, share some tacos and just take in the craziness of SF.  Gotta love it.

Oh, Free Chips and decent salsa if you check in.
author: Jeff G.

description:
My affinity for tacos can be traced back to the time when, upon devouring my very first soft shelled delicacy, my mom lied and told me we were Mexican. Later, she revealed we were actually part of the Colombian drug cartel. "Why do you think your aunt's last name is Escobar?" 

Shocked and stomach sick, I swore (to myself mainly) that I'd never tell anyone. And so it wasn't until last year when she shrugged, "oh, I don't even remember saying that. Of course I was kidding." And all these years spent in silence, thinking I belonged to blood money. 

This is mainly a way of iterating to you, dear reader, my affection for Nick's Crispy. A taco lover from a young age, my naive tongue was unfamiliar with soft, nay, hard tacos Nick's Way. This majorly respected taco trap conquers with the line caught mahi mahi grilled taco. 

I can just imagine a fisherman out there in the deep blue holding a little spool with fishing line and a wormed hook. He tied together buttons as weights and before you know it, I'm eating his victory. And that victory tastes great. Perfectly grilled (with a nice little blackened seasoning) and smothered with a dollop of guacamole. Also divine was the free range funky chicken taco. Organic as ever, I give mad props to the high brow attention bestowed upon on a low brow specialty. 

Plus they serve margaritas. It's hard to find a lunch spot that can offer comfort eats and a stiff one. Nick's you win.
author: Monica S.

description:
Probably one of the best Mexican food joint I've been in.  Surprising how far north is away from Mexico, you would think really good Mexican restaurants are all in SoCal.  Nope, this place blows most of those places away and it's also a nightclub.  Pretty darn cool if you consider getting your groove on while holding a shrimp burrito in one hand.  You can't do that at other nighclubs now can you? 

Their fish taco is pretty darn good.   The only place I know that is on the same level as them are the fish tacos from Taco Nazo, which are pretty amazing too.  

Their shrimp tacos are pretty good too. 

But their Shrimp Burrito was pretty amazing.  After eating theirs, I could never find another place that was as good as theirs in SoCal.  Nicely seasoned and full of flavor, it's one of the best pescado burritos I have ever eaten.  

I'm definitely going back when I go back to visit SF.
author: Phil H.

description:
DELICIOUS!!!!!!!

I'm a sucker for good tacos and when I had a livingsocial credit, I decided to use it here. Definitely worth it!! I had the grilled fish taco and a shrimp taco and it was so tasty and delicious!!! I would definitely come back for more!
author: Laura L.

description:
I'm very torn about my rating of Nick's Crispy Tacos. Do I love tacos? Yes. Do I love guacamole? Yes. Do I love standing in line? No. Do I love waiting for a table even after standing in line? No. 
I've been on a Tuesday for their deal, I've been mid-bar crawl for tipsy tacos and I've been on cinco de mayo. Every experience has been different. The atmosphere is always vibrant but there's a fine line between that and obnoxiously packed with drunk marina-ish types. 
As for the actual tacos...yeah, they're good. Are they $4 good? Depends. 
There's regular style and Nick's style. I like the carnitas but sometimes you'll get fatty pieces. I also like the grilled fish but I've had better fish tacos elsewhere. I like that the ingredients are fresh. Also, they make good quesadillas but so can I at home with 2 tortillas, some cheese and a pan.
author: Sara P.

description: Manager (or owner -  he has keys from the doors and went to kitchen also) was very rude. He came and told us that we're sitting on reserved table for him (there was no any sign on the table and waiter cleaned it for us and sitter us there). Also he said that its prohibited to smoke e-cigarette because my friend hold it in hand (he was not going to smoke it inside).
author: Vasyl P.

description: I legit had a dream about the carne asada tacos last night and had to review.  Every time I get the pleasure of being in SF this is my first destination... SFO-NCT.  Not to mention the atmosphere is world class... EAT HERE, you won't regret it.
author: Jared L.

description:
Why even review?  

pescadero, nick's way.  nuff said.
author: Robb O.

description:
As a southern california transplant in the great city of SF, I was a little skeptical to try Nick's Crispy Tacos. I had heard all the hype, I had heard about the massive quantities of guacamole, and I had heard about the $2 deal for Taco Tuesday. But, hailing from the land of OG Mexican Food (which is socal, not Mexico, contrary to popular belief) I didn't want to get my hopes up. This Tuesday, however, I got one of those really bad cravings for guacamole (you know the kind I'm talking about) and I just couldn't put off a trip to Nick's any longer. 

Another yelper fittingly deemed these "White girl tacos"- which, being a white girl, doesn't offend me because it's true. But they have the tortillas down, they have **** tons (fill-in-the-blank with your expletive of choice) of guacamole (provided you get it "Nick's" way) and they have massive shrimp in their tacos which are my absolute fave. They were, I must admit, delicious. and HUGE! Can we take a minute to awe at the size of these tacos?! I guess the rumors are true...

The only downside is that Taco Tuesday doesn't start until 5 or 6, and I went in at 12pm right after they opened (so no taco tuesday price, sad day). 11 dollars for two tacos is pretty steep but considering the fact that I usually shell out $6 for guacamole on a $2 taco (I like guac, okay??!!!) I guess it all evens out. Give them a try! You won't be disappointed.
author: Stephannie M.

description: These may be the best tacos I've ever had. The fish and carne asada were the best out of all of them. You definitely have to get the tacos nicks way or else they won't taste as good. You also have to walk up to the counter to order and there's no servers or hostesses. It's kind of a weird setup.
author: Collin W.

description:
Wait a second...this is club Rogue??!  I'm officially a fan of Taco Tuesday.  $2 crispy tacos and super cheap drinks.  Can I just say that the crowd here is COMPLETELY DIFFERENT during the day.  For once I'm not in a room filled with awkward tourists and "aZn's".  Ok Ok the tacos are a bit dry and over-fried.  However, that's what good ole' guacamole is for (don't forget to add that to your tacos).  The place gets pretty packed, definitely did not expect a crowd like this on a Tuesday.   

+4 because it felt like a Friday night when I was here.  Good people.  Good times.  Too bad I woke up 6:30AM the next day with a major hangover and the realization that I still had half a week left of work.  Sad Wednesday.  

Nonetheless, I'll be back for sure!
author: Jacquelynne S.

description:
Yum. Tacos- Yum. Guac and chips- yum. Margaritas- yum.

Need I say more?
author: Lara M.

description:
Good tacos, fairly reasonably  priced for Taco Tuesday. 
It does cost extra to get the meat tacos "nick's way" but it does make them extra tasty. 
Parking is  difficult of course, so try not to drive up there. But good place to hangout with friends during the work week.
author: Nicole S.

description: I've heard SO much about this place. I finally stopped in with a friend while exploring Nob Hill. I got the the chicken taco Nick's way which was overflowing with guacamole. These aren't Taco Bell tacos that's for sure. The flavour was just about right and the booths here are cozy. Prices are a bit higher than most places. I think one taco costs about $5 with tax. They serve you really fast if they're not busy. I'll stop in again if I'm in the 'hood.
author: Amy J.

description:
Experiencing sub-standard tacos makes me appreciate this place all the more. Nick's Crispy Tacos - "I want to go to there".

Parking near here can be a problem on Saturdays since the area gets pretty busy.
author: Shane O.

description:
I'm not sure what the real deal is, but I must say I prefer the atmosphere and food at Underdog's in the sunset.

The corn wasn't cooked all the way, and the flavors weren't nearly as good as Underdog's....My shrimp taco was so so, but nothing was outstanding.

I will say I loved the booths and chandeliers, but we weren't able to just order another margarita, or grab another taco because you can only order at the counter....

Thanks for the comfortable seating....but we won't be back.
author: Jay T.

description: Great tacos! Fresh ingredients and very tasty! I had the fried chicken and the fried fish and both were good. My friend had the chicken taco and she also enjoyed those. We also had chips and salsa and the chips have a good flavor and the salsa was fresh and flavorful. I did burn my mouth on the taco though!
author: Molly M.

description:
This place is absolute insanity on Taco Tuesdays. I was not prepared. The two dollar tacos are tasty and formidable, esp "Nick's Style"- fried + guac.

Basically it's like a club, with a dj and dranx. Oh, and a taco bar in the back. Worth coming with friends for the insanity and people watching. If you don't show up at 5, you won't get a table.
author: Tracy T.

description: This place is awesome. It serves great Mexican food which usually does not come with such a nice, sit-in atmosphere. It can be hard to get a table unless you've reserved beforehand, so be ready to wait a little bit but it's worth it!
author: Dhwani T.

description:
The pescado tacos are soooo delicious (get it Nick's Way) - ample filling and lots of guac!  I also love how the shell is so soft so I don't feel like I'm spending half my time crunching my way through a hard shell instead of enjoying the taco ingredients. 

The workers there are suuuuper nice too - I didn't realize that it was cash only and neither my friend nor I had enough cash on hand, but they filled our order anyway :) can you say Christmas spirit!!

My only downside (if it is considered one?) about this place is the ambiance (but really)... to say that it has an identity crisis would be an understatement.  Imagine an 80s loungey space with an all red interior, chandeliers, flat screens on sports channels with a hipstery SF taco bar.... yep. Very vampire-y - but other than that at least the ambiance is somewhat entertaining?
author: Lena R.

description:
This is absolutely one of the best Taco shops in San Francisco. The Pollo Asado taco Nick's way is the way to go. Make sure that you call ahead of time though because sometimes it is closed and nothing is worse then getting to a restaurant and it being closed!!

Also- make sure you have cash! 

Keep up the good work Nick's!
author: Charlotte S.

description: Got the grilled fish burrito with whole wheat tortilla and avocado slices. From the moment the basket with the burrito hit the table until that piece of heaven was all in my stomach, I was silent, which NEVER happens. The burrito was amazing, and the service is wonderful! Will be back for sure.
author: Monica A.

description: The food here is so good and fresh here. Been here two nights in a row and I've only been in SF for three night! The service is good but there aren't a lot of seating for the crowd I've seen coming here.
author: Katrina P.

description: Excellent tacos. I went in while visiting SF and I Yelped "tacos" and this place came up with raving reviews. I went in and had great service and super good tacos. If I'm ever in the area again, I will return. Great job Nick!!
author: Eric W.

description: The tacos are humongous and super yummy. If I am extra hungry I get two tacos, but otherwise I just order 1 taco because they are that big! Definitely get them Nick's way--crispy with guac for only $0.95 more.  They also have a Jones Soda machine which is so cool. Love this place!
author: Natalia K.

description:
GET THE QUESADILLAS! Yes, the tacos are great. BUT THE QUESADILLAS! oh, the quesadillas. 

They are extremely oversized and filling.

But most importantly, they are muy delicioso.
author: Sam A.

description:
This place is pretty legit! The tacos are massive and extremely delicious. Plus they aren't skimpy on the portions, especially on taco tuesdays.

Beware though, if you do try to come on taco tuesdays be prepared for a very long line. People get serious when the tacos are practically free! You will be surprised, the wait isn't that long, they're really quick. But watch out for your order, you don't want to steal an other mans taco!

This is also a great spot to pre drink and get some tasty cheap dinner. They have a full bar and the bartenders are really attentive and generous!
author: Debbie P.

description: A friend of mine visited here after hearing crazy reviews about this place. The food was just alright, def. not the best taco I've ever had. I had the Nicks' Special Tacos. Good but small and pricey for the taste and quantity. It's a cool place to hang out but def. not worth a special trip if you are craving tacos.
author: Shikha S.

description: Didn't go on Tuesday taco night so it wasn't as packed.  I went for a special alum event where a section was roped off.  I tried the nachos, quesadillas, and carne asada tacos.  If the food were served hotter I would have gave it a 4 stars.  I'm not sure why the food was cold. Everything was pretty good and for a reasonable price.  The parking is pretty difficult around the area so we had to park at a garage.
author: Jennifer S.

description:
I guess Nick's is so busy that they are too cool for you.   Or at least for me.

Got a takeout order.  Drove back to my FiDi office. Opened my bag.  Wrong order.  The little tag stapled to the bag had my name on it, but nothing that I ordered was in the bag.  Called them to tell them of the error, figured they would at least apologize and give me a credit (for the record, the value the food I got was half of what I paid).  They are apparentlhy too cool for anything as pedestrian as answering the phone, so expecting a call back after I left a message is certainly too much to ask.

BTW - don't order the rubber.   I don't know why they would even have it on the menu.  At least I think that's what it was that erroneously came in my bag, a taco with small brown flavorless rubber cubes.
author: craig F.

description:
You simply have to try these "double-wrapped" crispy corn inner tortilla inside an outer wrap of flour tort......


The effect, and the damn guacamole comine into something wonderfulllll

great.
author: Kevin M.

description: Who doesn't love their tacos?  We were watching college football games one weekend, and brought our tacos next door to Rouge, where we devoured them on the large comfy round booths/couches.  At the same time, we were ordering $3 margaritas & $2 beers cheering on our teams.  Besides the Auburn Tigers winning, it was a great way to spend a Saturday afternoon ^_^
author: Christine R.

description:
Love this place! I've been coming here for years. Cheap. Delicious. And now I found out that they have bottomless mimosas on the weekends for brunch! I think for only $5!

DEFINITELY get your tacos made "Nick's way". Oh, and they have super cheap prices for well drinks during happy hour. NCT is awesome. Nuff said.
author: Gregory G.

description:
I've been to San Francisco multiple times, but hadn't been to Nick's...but this trip, I couldn't escape it. Everyone was telling me to go to Nick's. And I wasn't disappointed. 

I ordered the Baja style pescado tacos -- Nick's way. I was told by a certain fish taco aficionado in Boston that it HAD to be Nick's way. And I HAD to use both the red and green sauce on them. Oh, and I HAD to get the chips and salsa, too. She was right. These are hands down the best fish tacos I've ever had.

The chips and salsa were good. The salsa isn't spicy at all, but man is it fresh. I haven't seen tomatoes that deep red since...well, ever. And add a little of the smoky red sauce and the spicy green sauce on the top and it's perfect. 

And the fish taco...oh the fish taco. Amazing. The standout for me was the fry. Something about that peppery batter, fried to golden perfection...and the lime. The guac was so creamy and tasty. There was a certain crunch I couldn't quite identify for the first taco...and then it hit me...there's a freaking hard taco shell inside the soft taco shell. Pure brilliance. Pure heaven. 

I also love the speakeasy-like decor. It seems odd for a taco joint, but I could see this place easily fitting in Oaxaca or Mexico City as an upscale taco joint. 

Oh, and the super-hot guys working there were just icing on the cake.
author: Brian S.

description:
Love the fish tacos Nick's way! I wasn't sure how to tackle this monster. A crisp and soft tortilla were filled with large pieces of fried fish and topped with a huge amount of guacamole! Woohee!

We arrived early to get a table and chow down. Service is very fast so you don't have to wait too long if you're starved. The ordering system can be a little confusing for a first-timer since you order your food and drinks from different locations.

With that said, the fish tacos are worth coming back for and not just for Taco Tuesdays!
author: Bernadette A.

description: We found this hidden little gem while out last night at a bar across the street. The Carne Asada tacos were delicious. So good we came back today for lunch!!
author: Michelle Z.

description: Order the pescado tacos and pollo tacos Nick's Way (with the taco shell crispy and guac) and you will not regret it!  I got really full off just those two tacos, they are loaded.
author: Terry K.

description:
I normally choose my restaurants based on Yelp so I find myself commenting on very popular places with tons of reviews most of the time.  I usually agree with the general consensus of the reviews and sometimes feel like I'm not making as big of an impact as I can, well here is an opportunity where I disagree with the majority of Yelpers.

Nick's tacos is over hyped.  After moving to SF within a week 4 or 5 people had raved to me in person about Nick's after finding out where I live.  I finally made it down the street brimming with excitement waiting to stuff my face with delicious guac covered tacos.

The final verdict....mediocre.  Decent tacos, nothing extremely special, that are overpriced and no free chips....

I'll eat there again because I have found a lack of quick taco/burritos places but it is not nearly as good as people make it out to be.
author: Ryan J.

description: Great tacos (nick's way, is the only way to go) and great salsa...aAll the food is good actually.  Love that you can get cheaper drinks within the same building from the bar.  Great tv's, and cheesy red-velvet layout.  The only problem is the line--it's is massive, at any time of day, especially Tuesdays:(
author: Justin W.

description:
Been here for a couple taco tuesdays and I'm always left drunk and satisfied. I love the pescado taco nicks way & the vegetarian taco. It's super tasty & crispy!

This place gets real crowded on a tuesday so i suggest early arrival if you want a place to sit. (Or you can sit in the baby high chairs like my roommate & i did). A line can build up too but the food comes out pretty quick I must say!

Overall a good time if you're all about good cheap eats & drinks! ($3 margaritas & 2 for $5 coronas)

I'll be back another tuesday for sure.
author: Natassia S.

description:
What do you need to know? Baja Fish Tacos Nicks Way. They'll change your life, I promise you that.

Nick's is a funky little place in a shared space with a bar called Rouge. It works out alright because you can get your food from Nick's, take advantage of Rouge's happy hour specials, and find a seat in the middle wherever you can.

The place is usually pretty crowded, often with fleets of young Marina professionals who find themselves far more interesting than you do, and whose tolerance has severely lowered since their college years - leading to a consistent air of a yuppie shit show. Sometimes it's funny to watch. Sometimes I just take my tacos to go.

The folks at Nick's are pretty nice, for being as busy as they are. The restaurant shuts down long before the bar, so just show up before closing (or call your order in ahead) and you're welcome to drink and hang out in the bar for as long as you'd like.

Nick's is cash only. Rouge takes card. Oh, and you can check in on Yelp for free chips and salsa and half off a pitcher of beer. Not too shabby.
author: Reishi A.

description:
What's Nick's Crispy Taco's secret?

Apparently being 4 miles from The Mission...and groupthink.

The food :: 2/5 
I had 2 "Nick's Way" tacos. I guess this is the way "Nick" liked them...

Either 
A) someone thought a proper noun was a clever way to say 'crispy' 
or 
B) Nick just needs to get out more...

If that's all that takes for a hook, consider this review done "Mark's Way"

The carne asada was good, not great. 

And the nachos I split? 
I don't recall asking them to be done "Costco's Way, but I guess they just use Cheeze-Whiz by default...I like Cheeze-whiz, for the record. But for 8 bucks, I can get a month supply.


The drink :: 1/5
Stella flat. Moved on to the Sierra. Flat, but not as flat. My buddy waited at least 20 minutes for the third round.


The DB factor :: 2/5 

I don't want to sound like the back of a blockbuster video rental box, but: 

If you like the lines at the DMV, you'll love Nick's Crispy Tacos!

Yes we waited 30+ minutes to order. And yes, I've been here before so I was prepared. This would not have been such a painful endeavor if the dude serving tables wasn't using us a pathway for EACH and EVERY order. Front, middle, back of the line, it didn't matter - homeboy was like a lost child in the woods using my ass for NORTH.

OK OK Mark. You bitch about the food. You bitch about the drinks. You bitch about being a GP-ASS...

Is there anything you actually liked?

Well it just so happens, yes. Nick's turns into Douge nightclub after 10 pm. Douge isn't just VIP tablecloths and tools with walkie-talkies. Oh no - Douge represents the very best of San Francisco nightlife. And tonight we had a special group of VIP's...

The cast of Real World Denver. That year was 2006 for you non-Real World aficionados. We didn't stick around.... but I haven't had a more exciting near miss of a D-level MTV celebrity since Puck almost ran me over with his bike on 2nd and Harrison.
author: mark q.

description:
It's Nick's way or the highway!

Seriously, 95 cents extra to make the taco crispy (I HATE soft tacos) and to add guac (my FAVORITE) and Jack cheese (I LOVE CHEESE) is a great deal!

Bf and I got three tacos: fried fish, pescado, and pollo asada.  They were all very tasty and bursting at the seams with ingredients.  Sooo very tasty.  And the prices!  Oh they were so low!

However, 1.5 tacos didn't seem to fill my boyfriend up.

I will be back!  Again and again and again!
author: Vivian H.

description:
This rating is soley on the pescado taco.

We came here on a weekend, the wait was long, you pretty much wait in line, order your food, get your number and find a place to sit, if you can find one.  Nick has a full bar, but seem to be missing certain types of liquor.  I'm assuming this place used to be a club because the outside looks rundown and the inside has these dark red walls, dim lighting with gaudy crystal chandeliers, totally not what you expect when you think of Nick's Crispy Tacos.  

The tacos were pretty pricey, $4.5-6.  I had the pescado, fried fish taco and it was the best fried fish taco I've ever had so far.  It's packed with salsa, lettuce and guacamole with a decent size crispy fried fish in the middle.. mMm.. I wish I had one right now!..
author: Kim R.

description:
This review is only for Taco Tuesday's but I would say that's all that needed (although i haven't tried brunch on a gameday with bottomless mimosas). Here are some things to consider:

- Call sometime in the week ahead to Rogue and get a table, makes eating and drinking and hanging out much easier
- If you get there anytime after 6:15 or so, you will be standing in line for tacos for a good 20 minutes, but for how long the lines are, and the amount of orders coming through, the line moves fairly fast and the food comes out even faster
- Get your taco Nick's style, whatever you decide. you get a crispy taco and guacamole for only a dollar. Well worth it

**Cash Only for Tacos**
author: Taylor C.

description: I had two tacos for a very good price, they tasted satisfactory and because it was during a SF 49'er game on a Monday night it was packed!
author: Sam P.

description:
Last night was my first time at Nick's Crispy Tacos, and it will also be my last.  Having previously enjoyed Nick's Crispy Tacos at Underdogs, I can't help but compare the two places, and this location is wholly subpar.

Service here is downright crappy.  We were never greeted.  No one cleared our spot when we sat down, and we were left with prior guests' drinks sitting on our table during the entire meal.  When our orders arrived, we were not given Nick's signature bottles of salsa, and instead were instructed by a server to grab them ourselves from a nearby table, where people were already sitting (we had to ask these patrons if they wouldn't mind us taking the bottles, since they were not using them).  Unlike at Underdogs, where servers come by repeatedly to pick up our soiled napkins before we're even done eating, no one here checked in with us even once.  

Additionally, I swear they skimp on the food here.  The chips and guac were not as plentiful, and my two tacos were not nearly as filling as they've been at Underdogs.  

Lastly, cash only (this isn't a huge deal, but still a con compared to Underdogs).

Next time I'm not bothering venturing out to Nob Hill for Nick's Crispy Tacos - I'm sticking to my neck of the woods and heading to Underdogs.
author: Mel T.

description:
The tacos are just not as good as the hype sets them out to be, really.  Sorry.

But, for $2 on Tuesday, I'm not complaining.  Much.
author: Meg W.

description: Good food but extremely slow service. More than 40 minute wait for 1 taco with 3-4 other tables in the place. People that ordered after me got their food. The same thing happened to someone else before me.  The bar has great service though.
author: Ginny S.

description:
The pescado tacos are very tasty, but they are not a part of the taco tuesday listed special- you are limited to the basic meats for the $2 price.

Service is good- the ladies at the bar are always pretty nice.

Idk why, but this place smells weird- I can't put my finger on it, but it definitely is not pleasant.  

Also, the place used to look so much better years ago, now I feel the interior could use a renovation- the wallpaper is fading and coming off and the mirrors seem dirty/scratched up.
author: Clarissa P.

description: I've been to Nick's once and really liked it. The decor is random and unique - lots of chandeliers coupled with huge TVs showing sports. The crowd was mixed and fun. The food was great though you do have to go order it separately. Definitely recommend.
author: Emily N.

description: Can't beat $2 Taco Tuesdays!! The chandeliers and funky red interior make this a cool place to hang out as well.
author: Merri K.

description:
MY INSTRUCTIONS:  (IMAGINE I AM SCREAMING IN YOUR FACE! But in a nice way...especially because I'm a nice girl...but STILL...I'M TALKING REALLY LOUD SO YOU'LL PAY ATTENTION)

Bring cash!

Get the fk off your phone!

Feel sexy with your lover under the dim soft red lights as you watch the Giants game in your corner booth!

Order a watermelon aguas fresca!!!  Or a beer!!!

AND FOR GOD SAKES ORDER A FISH TACO DONE NICK'S WAY AND SHOVE THAT PUPPY IN YOUR MOUTH....

WITH AVOCADOS...

AND A SHRIMP BURRITO IF YOU'RE A HEFFER!

Chew!  Or as I like to emphasize...GET YOUR MASTICATION ON...

SWALLOW...(wink!)

Enjoy!

THANK ME, AND YOU'RE WELCOME.
author: Meesh K.

description:
Came for the famed "Nick's Way", a taco made crispy that comes with guacamole. You'd think I wouldn't be into that. I am. In moderation of course. My tiger prawn taco was legit.

But what should be equally famous if not more so is the pollo asado burrito. Didn't think a burrito with just grilled chicken, black beans and pico de gallo wrapped in a wheat tortilla could be worth $7. That's expensive, at least by Mission standards. Yet I stand corrected. You get a ridiculous amount of meat, and wasn't greasy like at so many other places. So, so good.

If Nick starts making burritos crispy, I might be back for another round.
author: Jason B.

description: Best tacos I've ever had.   I tried the 3 seafood items, the nachos, and rice and beans, and everything was amazing.
author: Sara B.

description:
Tuesdays are bomb! The fish taco is fantastic. It is a bit pricy though.. but it's worth the splurge once in a while. The $2 chips with salsa and guac are fantastic.. 

The atmosphere was fun and the service was fantastic. The staff is very accommodating. Even though it's crowded with people on Tuesdays, the waitresses are very attentive and the line moves fast.

I definitely recommend this place! I want to come back every Tuesday!
author: Cathy S.

description:
Typically, I don't check receipts to make sure an order is accurate. I trust a place to charge me accurately. Nick's overcharged me for the tacos, and I have verified through multiple other sources that is standard practice. The tacos are damn good, but getting ripped off leaves a bad taste in my mouth. 

Fortunately, the extra money they steal can be paid to Yelp to remove this review, so really, there isn't nothing stopping Nick.
author: S C.

description:
Like eating big juicy fish tacos in what appears to be a disco ball-clad bordello? Nick is your man (not the Ladies Man's sandwich, Pervo-McNasty)! 

I figured I was going to be let down because of all the hype. No, not this time. Nick's was the perfect meal after a day of city hiking from downtown all the way out to Crissy Field.

Fish tacos = the shit! If fish tacos are on the menu I'm ordering them and was impressed that they offer both fried and grilled options. I ordered two grilled tacos because I sure as hell wasn't about to spend $12 on three tacos---especially since I was expecting taco truck sized tacos. But hell no! These are thick and moist mountain-man fish tacos and we could barely finish two---and we all know how much I can put away. 

Guacamole = fresh and delish! Get it! 

Go...eat in that whore house!
author: Kristine W.

description:
I really love this place.  The only thing is that I absolutely hate cilantro and almost everything on their menu has cilantro in it.  That being said, they're very good about putting the pico de gallo on the side if you ask them to.  The nachos, tacos and quesadillas are amazing!  I want to try some of their other stuff when I come here.  

The other thing that I love about this place is that it's connected to Rouge so it's so easy to just order and grab a seat at the bar or a booth and watch games!  The drinks are also cheap at the bar for HH!  

I really don't like this place on Taco Tuesdays.  Sure it's $2 but it's way too crowded for my liking.. I'd rather just come on a regular day... I think my sanity is worth the extra $1.50.  Also, it's cash only at Nick's but they take card at the bar ($10 minimum).
author: S R.

description:
THE BEST TACO I'VE EVER HAD, and I wasn't even in the mood to eat tacos! I actually wasn't feeling well (and definitely did not feeling like eating tacos) but my group wanted to eat here, so I went along. I got the grilled chicken taco, Nick's Way. 
OH MY GOODNESS, it was so good! I wasn't expecting anything great but holy moly, it was SO FREAKIN GOOD. The taco was loaded with chicken, pico de gallo, etc., and it was topped off with so much delicious guacamole. I was pretty full after eating one taco, but they were so good that I wanted to eat several more just because of how delicious they were. I will definitely eat here again next time I'm in town!
author: Sandeep D.

description:
I've been to Rouge a number of times before, but never for tacos.  It was kind of odd to be sitting inside Rouge with all of the lights on and seeing the swanky night club for the first time in its entirety, covered wall to wall in red and with the Victorian era deco.  It's definitely not your standard or traditional environment for chowing down on Mexican food.

I ordered three tacos -- carne asada, pollo asado, and grilled fish -- all Nick's way (extra expense).  All three tacos were quite good, served with fresh ingredients and were pretty sizable.  My only gripes would be the slow moving lines to place your order and the value -- three tacos cost me about $15.  Overall, 3.5 stars.
author: Erich D.

description:
Love it! Their pescado tacos is epic! 2 of
those and I'm good to go!
author: Patrick L.

description:
The food is not bad! Like I've probably mentioned before, I went to college in SD, which makes eating non SD/Mexico mexican food kind of always a disappointment. I still enjoyed the food, but I was definitely hoping for deep fried shredded beef, queso fresco goodness. We did order the tacos crispy style, but it came more like the old Taco Bell double decker style, with a taco bell-esque hard shell, and then another soft shell around it. Ummmm... not exactly love at first bite. The tacos themselves were really filling though.

The vibe is really cool, red velvet and chandeliers. Pretty dark in the evening, so you dont have to worry about schlepping another face on after a long day at work. Taco Tuesdays are really crowded, so better to get there early!
author: Sabrina T.

description:
Ok - I hate Nick's crispy tacos. I just want that to be known.

The food is average and overpriced. 

However - I don't hate it enough to pass up taco tuesdays and: 

$2 tacos
$2 gigantic quesadilas
$2 beers

It's average, but where else will you get non-fast food for $2?

This place is like a club on tuesday nights: packed with young people getting grubbing and drinking.
author: Carlos A.

description:
Summary: Fried fish taco's are great, done Nick's way with a ton of guac and double layered taco shells!

Mandatory pun: It's nick's way or the highway

What can I say that hasn't already been said?
"Interesting" decor to say the least, but the taco's done Nick's way are superb if you like guac (and really, who doesn't?).

Whoever compared Nick's way to Taco Bell's double layer taco's of the 90s (with the absolutely awesome SOFT, CRUNCHY commercials!) is right on cue.  This is exactly that, but with the obvious quality bump. 

Fried fish tacos were lightly battered, fresh and delicious. I'll definitely be back.

All you "it's not real mexican food" people can stop: if you want "real" mexican food, go to another place. :)

Two fried fish taco's done Nick's way was $12.
author: Jonathan C.

description:
I've only had their tacos, nachos, and rice here but overall I do enjoy the Pollo Asado Nicks Way with Guac and Sour Cream. Very tasty. 

Nicks is okay for what it is..  cash only but they have comedy night and other events for entertainment. The staff is very nice and the food is good.
author: Brie S.

description: GREAT food- especially the tacos NICK's way. Can get crowded on weekends and taco Tuesdays, but always a good vibe.
author: Marcy M.

description:
I never really liked tacos. Maybe because Taco Tuesdays in Sacramento meant a bunch of high school kids trying to save a couple of cents on an already cheap commodity while they ghost ride the whip in a Del Taco parking lot.

So when my best friend in San Francisco said, "Let's go to taco tuesday!" I thought... WHY?

As it turns out, the meaning of Taco Tuesday in SF is drastically different than Sacramento.... and infinitely more sophisticated as well. 
Held in a bar/lounge, one can order these gourmet tacos at less than gourmet price while keeping it classy with a Margarita or cool with a beer. And when I say gourmet, I mean Nick ain't playin' with it. His way is the only way to go. I'm not gonna lie, thing's huge. 

This place cultivated my love for tacos and I can now say that I am a firm supporter of Taco Tuesdays... in SF. Here the guys are smart enough to buy girls tacos instead of screaming Hey Bay Bay! Trust me guys, that does not work.
author: Spring L.

description: Tacos are pretty good and the size is decent. It's the wait in line that made me give them 4 starts instead of 5. You have to reserve a table in advance for Taco tuesday and even then it's only for 1.5 hrs until the next group gets it. This is a great place if you're looking for a snack after work and a place to hang out for an hour or two.
author: Dasha K.

description:
Eating at Nicks is akin to riding a really fun roller coaster at an amusement park. As soon as you're done, you just want to do it all over again.

The menu offers burritos, quesadillas and assorted extras, but the stars of the show and reason for going are the various tacos. The protocol is to order them Nick's Way, which adds a crispy layer to the soft tortilla, along with jack cheese and mounds of guacamole. Similar to the nightclub in which the restaurant is housed during the day, the tacos pull off the parlor trick of taking something seemingly garish and making it sublime. Bite into one and happiness ensues. As will the use of multiple napkins.

Round out your meal with a crisp yet slightly chewy churro dusted in cinnamon and sugar and sink into one of the booths for a few minutes completely sated. Any place that can put you in a good frame of mind is worth a visit.

Summary: (arms in the air) Wheeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeeee!
author: Andre E.

description:
It's not the most authentic Mexican food you'll ever have. But it's better than a lot of other places around. The food is tasty and enjoyable, just don't go around thinking that it's the real deal. 

Highlights- fish tacos (the fried ones) Nick's way.
author: Rose T.

description:
Nick's made it onto The Big Eat SF: 100 Things to Try Before You Die list
http://www.7x7.com/content/eat-drink/big-eat-sf-100-things-try-you-die

#10. Baja-style fish tacos at Nick's Crispy Tacos

I absolutely love taco's Nick's Way (crispy taco wrapped in a soft tortilla with melted cheese in between and a HUGE scoop of guacamole on top. Completely and totally delicious.

The fact that it's the same location as Ruby Skye is hilarious. I think it's perfect decor for a taco joint. 

I haven't tried the baja fish yet. I'll have to go back.
author: Aaron M.

description: Great place for happy hour. My friend and I came here we had a good time plus the people there friendly.
author: Simone M.

description:
First off, great tacos! Get here (early) on a Tuesday night and enjoy your $2 tacos (Nick's Way of course)! 

But this place really needs to make up its mind what they want to portray. Is it a taco-shop? A sports bar? A lounge? Or a club? Wait, it's all that, and more. On any given night night, half the people are wearing sweats and t-shirts while the other half of the (underage, mind you) crowd are wearing high heels and clubbin' clothing. 

I feel like it half-asses being each of these segments. Underdog (in the Sunset) did a better job this way, it being a sportsbar with tacos! 

I do not complain about the tacos, cause let me tell you again, they are amazing. But Nick's Crispy Tacos definitely needs to make a better business plan.

Oh and their "hot" sauce is good, just don't think it's hot.
author: Helen D.

description:
Nick's Crispy Tacos is quick, casual, fun, and cheap! Every once in a while, I get the craving for a Mexican "bar food". This is the place to go! I went with a group of girlfriends this past Sunday and we all loved it! Service was quick and the food was great! No complaints from anyone sitting at my table. 
I do have to say I was craving fish tacos, and they were out of fish. That was kind of a bummer, but I got the carnitas nachos instead and I was a happy camper. I will definitely be going back to Nick's Crispy Tacos soon!
author: Heather E.

description:
I've been to Rouge to party a couple of times and I must say it is TRIPPY to be sitting and eating tacos in the same venue! At night, you aren't able to see the worn out material on the booths and how tacky the actual decor is, but that's besides the point. The point is that they have one of the BEST happy hours!

Every night they have different specials and their happy hour ends at 10pm. You can get your eat AND drink on all for $20! Well, that really depends on how much you eat & drink, but for me at least, that's a good deal! I don't usually drink margaritas because Tequila and I have acknowledged our differences, but at $3 a drink, I can't resist. Granted, they aren't as great tasting or even in the same caliber as say, Tres Agaves' margaritas, but if you had a long day at work and just want to chill, it's not bad. Oh, and their tacos ARE good and crispy!
author: Linda C.

description:
49ers Monday Night Game = Good

Fish Tacos = Good

Draft beer = Good

All the above = EPIC.

Get the fish! Avoid the other meats (chicken, pork, beef, etc...)! They are pretty dry and not as flavorful. The fish is juicy and tender. Tacos or burrito, it doesn't matter. Just get the fish.

We arrived only minutes before kick-off but luckily got a booth. Wasn't the most comfortable way to watch the game but pitcher of beer for $10 makes it better. 

Get the fish tacos!

Oh ya...49ers won. Woot! =D
author: Jonathan L.

description:
I wandered in here at about 930, hungry so I wasn't expecting too much anyway. Stuck out in Russian Hill, it was between this place or the little Thai place across the street. Neither jumped out, but I figured. you can't mess up Mexican really.

Oh wait Vince, you're not in LA anymore. Because in the bay, they are very liable to mess up your buzz with a crappy excuse for mexican. The tacos are somewhere around 3.50 each, not cheap. Pay about a buck extra for Nicks Way which has cheese and guac. But the thing that got me the most is that their tacos (unless you say otherwise) is filled with beans!. Been to Mexico, TJ, SD, ELA, that's a quick way to bastardize the whole experience. The meats were not particularly tasty either. We were only saved by the late night happy hour at the bar. See Rouge Nightclub.

Would not recommend this place really at all.
author: Vince E.

description:
DELISH!!!  I read the reviews before going to san fran..and was happy happy my hotel was i block away..  i ate here 2 days in a row.  

the price was right..

i had pescado (fish taco), and carne asada, and chicken tacos.
the inner tortilla is fried crispy the outer tortilla is soft, the filling is beans and fresh salsa - lots of it..

PESCADO was my favorite, crispy and fresh

the gentleman sitting at the counter was very helpful in our choice and even bought over a basket of chips with fresh salsa sprinkled over it..  

people were hanging out, having a good meal and and a good time.
author: A Perfect Me -.

description:
I've read reviews and was curious, I was even excited because I got a front parking!!!! I didnt know why everything looked familiar, and I dont get why people like eating inside a club?  I've been to the rouge at night when all the lights were off and I was just dancing and drinking.  

 But during the day their is a taco option...  The line was too long for the quality of food, Tried the carnitas, carne asada tacos and a quesedilla.  Seems pretty simple but, the food just tasted kinda old/dirty.  The service at the counter were really nice, I think I also ordered a rum an coke to mask the unsanitaryness of my surroundings,  I ate as quick as possible to get out.   Probably wouldnt go back to the club or the taco stop.
author: Grace T.

description:
Hands down some of the most interesting and delicious tacos I've ever had.

I think there is some sort of combination with a soft taco shell and a hard taco shell that is making Nick's Crispy Tacos extra delicious to me. It's a subtle distinction, that makes a big impact. 
I ordered two fried fish tacos ($4.50 each) with the works (cheese, guac, sour cream) While at first, that might seem like kind of a steep price for a couple of tacos, once you see how big each one is it makes more sense. I am a big guy and I get full off of two of these. 

I want to come back and try some more variations of the tacos, but for the fish tacos alone, This place is well-deserving of 5 stars. 

The only weird thing for me is this place is in the back of Rouge (Nightclub) so it feels a bit awkward but once you take a bite of a taco you''ll forget all about it.
author: Egan B.

description: What a pleasant surprise this place is. It's spacious, awesome service, delicious food, and awesome bar feel. Went here to celebrate a friend's birthday and it was a wonderful experience. Great for groups, casual, fun.
author: Olya S.
