description:
Taco Tuesday! Good to go early eve. Specials on featured items like cheese quesadilla's, tacos and margarita's. This place has awesome Baja (pescado) fish tacos. I am addicted. Also like the beef quesadilla's that are light, crispy and flavorful. They use Niman Ranch beef (grass fed & hormone free). 

Tasty Margarita's. On weekends there is a full bar  which is part of the night club (Rouge), if you want to party afterward. Bourgeoisie decor, red velvet colors, large funky booths and swanky chandeliers. Definitely festive. Expect to stand in line for this popular place.The line moves fast and so does the seating. You have to be running back to grab a seat, but it's worth it. If you come with a large party, it will be a HUGE challenge to get a table. Especially on weekends. Not so bad on weekdays. Expensive? No way! This is not Park Place of Mexican Cuisine. It has median prices. 

Location has notorious night club history. I partied here a long, long time ago. Once called Johnny Love's I attended a Guess fashion show here and saw Lucas and Spielberg in a booth.(Surreal) Who knew it would turn into a taco stand. So weird...
author: Sandi P.

description:
Popular Taco Tuesday joint. It gets crowded and there aren't many tables so either make a reservation or be ready to stand with your drinks and tacos for a little bit. People usually move in and out regularly so you'll usually find a spot to plunk down in at some point. 

The tacos are whatever. They taste exactly the same as the tacos at a place called Underdogs on 19th and Irving (its a more divey type place). Not very tasty and actually sort of bland. The corn tortillas are usually pretty dry. Also, every taco is an extra dollar or so to get it Nick's Way (w/ guac, sour cream, and sauce) so its really not that worth it. If you drink enough $2 coronas its not so bad at this place.

It has a pretty swanky interior with some chandelier decorations and velvetty curtains around everywhere. Taco tuesdays are casual, but later at night the place become Rouge which is more of a nightclub/lounge. They charge a cover after 10 I believe and its just your average lounge. I wouldn't recommend Rouge, but Taco Tuesday's are ok here.
author: Arthur C.

description:
So do not expect this place to be the cleanest establishment you ever been too....there is a reason clubs and bars are open at night and closed or dark in the day. This place cannot avoid letting the sun in because it is a bar at night and a restaurant in the day, so you may see a bit of a dinginess remnant of the nightlife.....SO WHAT! If you can't get over a little dust in the corners and that light dried beer smell in the air that comes from someone having a little too much fun the night before, then you might be too foo-foo for Nick's. But if you are down and want the BEST fish tacos ever, this is the PLACE!  

This is one of my favorite spots in the city! The fried fish tacos (pescado) are amazing. The guacamole is awesome (and I don't even LIKE guacamole)! The chips and salsa (pico de gallo) is a great starter! The Agua Frescas...great!

The tacos are shaped so that the mouth of them opens up and is full of taco-goodness and the pinch at the end of the shell is the perfect last bit of juices, sauce, vegetables and tiny pieces of meat...it's like a taco kiss good bye. 

Stay away from the regular meats here...you can do that anywhere. Go for the fish or shrimp tacos and be sure to order them "Nick's Way." TRUST ME!!!
author: Gabriel C.

description:
I stopped by Nick's Crispy Tacos this afternoon after a recommendation from a friend. Located inside of Rouge NIghtclub during the day, I found it quite interesting since i've only been here at night when it's a nightclub. 

Anyhow,I ordered exactly what my friend told me to: carne asada (nick's style) and the fish taco. When I got home I quickly opened up my bag to dig in. I was quite disappointed since the carne asada didnt have any meat in it- they must of forgotten =( The fish taco was really good though!

While I was waiting for my food, one of the customers found a ring in his burrito which must have fallen off of someone's hand. The manager was very apologetic and gave the guy 10 bucks back for the cost of his burrito- luckily he the old man didnt bite into it.
author: M W.

description: I have been going here since freshmen year of high school so about six years now and have always had great experiences here. They give great proportions and the food is always fresh and delicious. It also matters when you go depending on whether you're going for food or clubbing. This is purely a food review.
author: Lawrence Y.

description:
How could you not love Nick's crispy tacos... the ambiance is awesome... gaudy red velvet, antiqued chandeliers and mirrors...

And the food is great! Always!
author: Kane M.

description:
My boyfriend and I came right before the rush on a Friday evening. Thank goodness!! The place is packed with lines almost running across Rouge. Is it weird to see babies and toddlers in strollers with old grandparents in a club? A bit... There's minimal tables and some douchey couples would take up an entire booth for the two of them. -___- If I had the luck of getting one of the booths, I guess I would do the same. We had a 50% Scoutmob coupon to use, and only $10 max can be discounted. 

2 x Pescado Taco - Nick's Way
1 x Carne Asada Taco - Nick's Way
Supreme Burrito
Chips and Salsa

I've had Nick's tacos served at Underdogs before, and the Nick's Way Pescado taco here is BOMB. The batter is 10x's better than Underdogs and it's sooo delicious. The BF and I were sitting in slience having a one-on-one with our taco. 

After my fish taco, I moved onto the carne asada... Mmmmm.. No. I don't think I would order it again. It was loaded with beans and just not tasty. Skip it next time.

They forgot our chips and salsa... They walked by, dropped off our food, took our number, and never came back with the rest of the order. No tip for you.

Go EARLY. Anytime after 6:15 will be super packed!! 



AND CASH ONLY.
author: Rosanne L.

description: The tacos are good, but not as much as people rave about. Here's the catch 22 about Nick's. Come on a regular day, the tacos aren't REALLY worth the price, especially after you get it Nick's way just to try to get some guacamole in there. Then if you come on Taco Tuesday, you better damn well make sure you get there EARLY. Early as in, right after work early. Unless you want to spend 30 min hovering and waiting for someone to stand up from a table, go by 6. Otherwise be prepared to eat while standing or waiting. And both in my opinion, are not worth it when you can just go to the mission and get a cheap and good taco there.
author: Angela S.

description: As a vegetarian, you always wonder what they can do with a taco to make it amazing...Nick's has got it down! Crispy outside, delicious and fresh ingredients on the inside, it doesn't get any better. They make taco Tuesday the best day of the week.
author: Pavknee M.

description:
Nick's is cool. I either get a quesadilla or a carne asada taco Nick's way - it depends on my mood. The quesadilla is wonderfully cheesy and has that nice buttery crisp on the outside of the tortilla. Nick's way includes a cruncy taco shell and some guac - enough said.

This place gets crowded on Taco Tuesdays, so if you don't like running into people you hate or you hate long lines, avoid Nick's at all costs.
author: Jennifer L.

description: This place is basically a taco stand in the back of a bar.  The food was pretty good and tasted fresh.  Be prepared to wait on line if your going on a weekend.  Even though we waited in line we had no trouble finding a table.  I had the black bean and grilled corn salad and it was very good.  This is not the type if place to go with kids or if you want to have a conversation.  It's very loud and there was a drunk girl yelling over a pitcher of margaritas the whole time we were there.  Nevertheless, it's a trendy place and good for a reasonably priced dinner and drinks.
author: Daisy T.

description: It was our last stop in SF! DEF worth it! we had the Carne Asada beef and chicken- Nick's way...aweseome! we will def go back! ps. the mango drink is awesome!!!
author: Beena M.

description: "Great great happy hour drinks as well as delicious foooooooood! Such a great find."
author: Shirin T.

description:
There's a better taco place near my school in Richmond, Virginia than Nick's Crispy Tacos. Yeah, I said it.

We went here after the rave reviews with the Yelp coupon in hand, expecting our minds to be blown. I realized a few different things immediately after stepping inside: it's dangerously overpriced, and we were way too sober.

D and I both ordered two tacos, "Nick's Way" (when in Rome, I guess), for an additional $1 on an already expensive, $3.25 taco (I might mention here that at Taco Grill in Oakland, you can get Niman Ranch meat stuffed to the max in a handmade tortilla for only $2). D also ordered elote and a mango agua fresca. With an order of chips and salsa, the total was over $30!

While we snacked on our expensive chips and salsa, we were able to enjoy the only fun thing about Nick's - people watching. Had the food been as mind-blowingly good as everyone says, I would have been okay with paying $30, but unfortunately it just wasn't.

The "crispy" tacos are pretty huge, but pretty flavorless. The guacamole lacks flavor, the meat's overly sweet and/or dry, and the fried shell gets stale inside the outer store-bought, steamed tortilla. The elote was mushy, and the agua fresca was atrociously bad. It had tiny little rock-hard chunks of mango in it that tasted like we were swallowing sand.

Despite having the Yelp Deal coupon, I felt totally robbed. It was a huge mistake to trek all the way from the East Bay, and I pray that if I ever get trapped into going out in North Beach that it's nowhere near this place.
author: Kara R.

description:
Probs my favorite place to eat in SF... or at least one of my favorites. Whenever friends come to visit SF, I take them to Nick's, because it's quintessential San Francisco food

I love drenching tacos with the salsa they have.
author: Daisy J.

description:
great tacos and burritos; really delicious. 

wait is too long and the place is really frakkin dirty.
author: Bobby B.

description:
i love it when my bf feels like exploring and going on foodie adventures =D

we were driving and venturing around, parked somewhere and were walking around when we yelped for a bite to eat. HE was still hungry, not me.
nick's tacos! heard it was awesome but we were never close by. but not today!

awkwardly located in/next to Rouge...definitely looked different in the day time compared to when I came at night one long long night ago.

ordered
carne asada-barely got a bite of it. but bf said it was awesome
the shrimp one- YUM! juicy shrimp and plenty of guacamole sauce. the taco was soft and the outer taco was crunchy

we really liked it and it reminded me of my bf's tacos he makes at home which beats alot of other places. this place was prettyyyy good. BUT price is $$$. $14 for two tacos and a coke!?
craziness...

for a snack, sure we'd come back, but if you're hungry...ur going to end up spending quite a bit here.
author: Christine M.

description:
Based on today's visit they get 5 stars.  The woman at the register was patient and explained everything well for a couple of first-timers and the food was fantastic!

I had the pescado taco done Nick's way and it was HUGE!  Definitely didn't need more than one.  My partner got a veggie burrito and brought half home.  We split the corn and black bean salad which was really tasty, light and had a salsa vinaigrette that didn't taste at all oily.  They even split the salad into two plates for us.

Even more qlassy was the decor.  The place is located at one end of Rouge bar which is a blood-red lounge with plush semi-circle booths and evidently great happy hours that were listed on a table tent.  Will definitely take visiting hipster friends there for the crispy tacos and the $5 draft & Fernet shot special.  ;)
author: Jon B.

description:
These tacos are amazing. I've had the chicken and also carnitas and carne burritos and they never disappoint.
Recommendation:
* get it "Nick's style" aka "con todo"
* do NOT use the service Caviar to do delivery. They messed up our order and took over an hour to make it up. Luckily, Nick's is great and gave us a new order for free and credit. Just go pick these up yourself, it'll be worth it.

Also, CASH ONLY. Don't forget that or you'll have a bad time.
author: Josh E.

description:
Hey, you like eatin' tacos?
You ain't eatin' tacos 'til you've eaten 'em under a CHAN-DE-LIER!
You like drinkin' a margariduh?
Yeah. Well, try drinkin' it under a CHAN-DE-LIER!
Just ask my be-yoo-tiful daughter Lexie...

Look at all dese chan-de-liers!
Look at dis one, look at dat one. Look at dis one, look at dat one.
If you had one of dese in your house, you could look like a millionaire!
Like da King of England! ...like da King of France, or somethin'.
People are gonna look in your house and go...
"Who lives here? Da Pope?!"
"What is dis here? Da Playboy Mansion?" It's ridiculous!
How nuts would it be to walk in your house and see dis one. Or dat one. Or dis one. Or dat one.
(Lexie hoists up her boobs.)

OK, so we're not in Joi-sey...or on Saturday Night Live with Fred Armisen and Scarlett Johansson. However, this is a creative alternative use for the Rouge lounge, so that's why you can eat your tacos at big red-leather booths underneath a sea of chandeliers. Nope, it's not your typical tacqueria when it comes to decor...that you can get in the Mission.

The funny thing is that the food is pretty darn good here starting with the basket of chips covered in fresh salsa for only a dollar. I tried the $3.25 Grilled Fish Taco, which was a nice-sized fillet of fresh fish snuggled in a fresh corn tortilla with some tomatillo & pico de gallo salsas, cilantro, shredded cabbage and onions. My one minor complaint is that it was a little too heavy on the cilantro, not my favorite.

Even better is the $3.25 Pescado Taco, which they describe as a Baja-style fried fish, again in a corn tortilla but with spicier salsas, a lime-flavored mayonnaise, cilantro, shredded cabbage and onions. Both were delish. And for just 75 cents more, you can have them Nick's Way which means they pan fry them with cheese and guacamole...sounds wicked good.

If that wasn't enough, we also tried the $5.50 Carnitas Quesadilla, which replicates Nick's Way in a big way. It had braised shredded pork folded with pico de gallo and melted jack cheese in a pan-fried folded flour tortilla. The pork was not what I expected...it was better...like the kind of pulled pork you'd get at a Kansas City barbecue joint. Most definitely worth a return visit.

FOOD - 4 stars ...surprisingly good tacqueria food
AMBIANCE - 4 stars...like a PALACE!...like a CASTLE!...How nuts would it be to eat dis one or dat one...dis one or dat one!
SERVICE - 4 stars...pretty quick and responsive when it comes to extra chips
TOTAL - 4 stars...so remember...You's GOTTA get yourself some CHAN-DE-LIERS ...and some tacos from my Cousin Nick (Nick cracks his knuckles.)
author: Ed U.

description:
Meh. I heard such amazing things about this place and salivated all day waiting for it, just to end up with a pair of blue balls. I can't say I know how that feels EXACTLY, but what I felt had to come pretty close.

Don't get me wrong-- I could SEE why people talk about this place. I ordered two fish tacos (one fried, one grilled) Nick's way. The tacos are HUGE and flavorful. However, the wait was long-, which is okay considering how busy they were, but when the tacos did finally arrive, they were COLD. Not sure if they are served that way or if they gave someone else our order or what, but I know the tacos would have been so much better if they were warm. Have you ever tried to eat something fried cold? Damn, at least when it's hot it TASTES like it's worth the fat. Still, the wait was too long and we didn't want to have to wait any longer for another set of tacos that could potentially have spit in it. 

-4 for the cold tacos (not worth the time or money). +1 for the cute cashiers.
author: Jan C.

description:
Are you KIDDING me?   I am amazed at how people think this place is good.  I went once about a year ago and thought maybe I'd just had a bad experience.  My friends talked me into going again....  nope.    

I'm only giving this a star because I can't give it 0 (I'll have to check on that).   Long line (can not figure out how this is possible).   Tacos (Nick's style) were luke warm, SOGGY, and greasy.  Nothing crispy about them.  The guac was generous, but it makes no sense to pile it on the first bite of your taco.   The place smells like old milk (or vomit).   The booth was too small for us to sit in.   The waitress had attitude.  (btw, I had to bus and clean my own table).  I had to pay $1 to the poor guy in the bathroom (not sure why he's there except to "class it up" for the  "clubbers" that think this place is cool).  

(I'll dedicate my one star to the bartender and my cold beers.  There.)
author: Jon W.

description:
Oh Nick's Crispy Tacos, why do you taste so good? Living so close by, this is my go-to place when I'm craving some good tacos. I always order the pescado (Nick's Way, of COURSE. There's no other way. Trust me) and either the carne asada or pollo asada. Agua Fresca isn't bad here either. The flavors rotate, but my favorites have been the watermelon and strawberry. 

I've come here on Taco Tuesday, and it can get really packed! If you come here on a Tuesday, either come here before 6 pm, or make a table reservation.
author: Kim C.

description: Went it on a Friday night and place was full! Nowhere to sit, bunch of people just standing around bar. Ordered two of their famous tacos and a quesadilla. Quesadilla wasn't very good. Tortilla was too dry and crunchy. Not to my liking at least. Tacos were great though. Very good carne asada filled with beans and cheese guacamole and sour cream. If you want good tacos, this is a good place to go to. As for the rest of the food, not so sure. Place is a little weird but looks like a cool hangout spot for late night drinking and tacos.
author: Alberto D.

description:
after 6 hours flight...

J D: what do you want for lunch?
moi: FISH TACOS!
J D: which one??  
moi: I don't remember the name.. let me find on yelp..
          Nick's Crispy!  this is it!!

this is what I am doing in SF!
author: Julie K.

description:
MAKE SURE TO COUNT YOUR CHANGE!!!

i came here on a tuesday for $2 taco day. make sure you get here EARLY cause the line can get really, really long. i got there before 6pm and so there was't a wait. i ordered 2 tacos and a beer - gave the guy $20 and got $3 back... i didnt notice til the next morning when i needed some cash and of course they didnt give a receipt.. sigh they dont even have to do math! thats what the cash register is for! all they have to do is read the amount and give you the cash. you'd think for a cash only place they're better at it.. 

i had to give them a couple stars because their tacos ARE good. the fish taco actually is the real fried thing, unlike one of those fake fillets they give you at rubios or mcdonalds. and their pitcher of beer is $10 whichs is totally worth it. plus the girl comes around to ask you if you need anything often so you can always havea  drink in your hand. 

but beware if you dont get there early you wont get a seat or barely even any space to stand. imagine eating a messy taco and drinking a beer with no table to set things down...
author: Jen S.

description: Thus far, the best tacos I've found in San Francisco. I'm in a different city every other week and streetstyle tacos are my go to dinner. So I try lots. San Francisco had disappointed me but Nicks just made up for it. Better tortillas than other places. This isn't your classic street taco, bit it's a good one. They're big and the guacamole is perfect. I also like the vibe of the place. Glamour dive bar. Good one.
author: M P.

description:
This has awesome ochetta and watermelon drinks. If you come just spend the money to buy it. Always nice to have a good tasty wash down. 

I had the fish taco, nicks way. It was yummy the quesadilla is fantastic. 

DO NO GET THE SHRIMP TACO UNLESS YOU WANT TO BE JIPPED!! I got two tiny shirmps and a bunch of cabbage, ugh! That really ruined the experience. It was pricey too for the shrimp once. BS. 

I'm not a big fan. I'd rather go to another taco place that's closer by my bf's house. 

The decor is odd looking. i think that's what they were aiming for. It's definitely a place for guys. They need to learn how to clean up better. 

Girl bartender was very cute and didn't seem too snobby.

The serving sizes are hearty too. One taco made me pretty full.
author: Jessica B.

description:
I think this place is definitely overrated.  I've only been here for Taco Tuesday and maybe that's the problem -- the tacos aren't that much cheaper and it's crowded as fuck (or maybe it's always like that). It's just not fun to be there and have to stand with your food and drink while waiting for seating. I felt like an eagle stalking its prey.

The food was good though, can't complain there!
author: Richa A.

description: The nicks tacos are good, but if some one over hyped them lower expectations and you be more satisfied. The drinks are super cheap at night. They have great beer us fireball shot deal.
author: Vishal V.

description:
This place is an amazing deal. I ordered 2 veggie tacos (Nick's style) and because it was Friday, it was 2 for the price of 1 ($5). I also checked in on Yelp and got free chips and salsa and my friend checked in and got 50% off a pint of beer ($5 total for a pint of Stella). The tacos are good and are really filling. I had trouble finishing mine so 2 should be enough for most people. The agua fresca, salsas, guac & hot sauces are also really good.  

The ambience of this place is really cool too. I love the red walls and floor and chandeliers in here. It's really lively on Tuesdays and Fridays so it's a great place to grab a bite before you go out for the night. 

The biggest downside is that it's really hard to find seating. You have to be pretty aggressive or be okay with standing up while you eat, which can get really messy.
author: Shreya O.

description:
Why do people love this place?  Oh yea, it's probably people that have never had good Mexican food.  Sorry, but the tortillas they use suck ass and the fillings are bland.  The only thing I like here is the baha fish burrito, but the tortilla ruined it for me so I don't order it anymore.  

The drink specials are ok, and I give them two stars for having strong margaritas.  

Minus three stars for the cheesy vibe and sub-par food.
author: Elena M.

description:
Nachos, Crispy Taco's, Mimosa's and football 
Now that's what I call a winning combination! 

Nick's Crispy Taco's, which is located in the Nob Hill area of SF, is another one of those places that I have had bookmarked for a long, long time. Nick's is a large, cash only restaurant/bar/nightclub. The inside of Nick's is huge. Right when you walk in you see a wide open area that serves as the dining room by day and a dance floor at night. To the right of that is a counter where you place your food order. To the left is the bar area where there are about five or six flat screen televisions hanging above the bar and about nine or ten booths that surround the bar. The inside of Nick's is painted blood red and there are big, gold chandeliers hanging throughout the restaurant. 

My friends and I arrived at Nick's right when they opened at 10am. On Sundays, when football is on, they offer many early morning drink specials. I usually do not like to drink alcohol that early in the morning but on their AM HH menu they offered large carafe's of Mimosa's for about ten dollars, which is a great deal. My friends and I went through four carafe's before we left Nick's at 1pm. Besides the tasty Mimosa's, we also ordered lots of nachos and crispy tacos. The nachos at Nick's are pretty good, definitely not the best I have had, but better than average. Nick's nachos are made with tortilla chips, nacho cheese, carne asada, tomatoes, sour cream, guacamole, and jalapeños. The asada in these nachos was really juicy and tender. Each of us also ordered a bunch of crispy tacos. A crispy taco at Nick's is made by filling a crispy corn tortilla with whatever meat you choose, plus veggies and sauces, and then wrapping a soft corn tortilla around the crispy taco. 
These are the crispy tacos I ordered: 
Breakfast CT- Scrambled eggs, cheese, french fries, fresh salsa and sour cream 
Chicken CT- Strips of juicy chicken, cheese, lettuce, black beans, salsa, sour cream and guacamole 
Crispy Fish CT- Deep fried fish, cabbage, guacamole and lime mayo 

All three tacos were great. I really liked how they use both a crispy tortilla and a soft corn tortilla. The best of my three tacos had to be the fish. The fish fillet itself was pretty big and perfectly deep fried in a delicious batter that was semi sweet. The fish was not greasy at all, which is unusual for a deep fried piece of fish. 

The prices for food here is somewhat high. For my three tacos and an order of nachos my bill was over $25. Since the tacos are not huge I kind of felt like they shouldn't charge $4 a piece for them. 
The service here was great. Once our orders was placed it took them less than ten minutes to have our food delivered to us at the bar. 

If you're a fan of nachos crispy taco's, Mimosa's and football than you need to check out Nick's. If you happen to be a fan of those three things than I guarantee you will love Nick's.
author: Craig R.

description:
Despite the hype, there's nothing quite special here. It's more of a bar than a restaurant, but nice to have 'bar food'. Nick's way is the only way to go otherwise you'll be disappointed. Even so, it's just a soft taco in a hard taco with sauce - and it's way overpriced ($7 for a Nick's way fish taco). 

Change to $$ and I'll give it a third star.

Tuesdays are crazy as expected. Good to know: no special discount for the pesca taco on Tuesdays. Nice fried fish, but still nothing that special. Service is fast.
author: Jay L.

description: so good i want to come back on a weekday, they have some really good deals!
author: Hannah L.

description:
On Fridays, I wake up at an ungodly hour to work because I'm nice enough to help out the other staff.  This also means I get to leave early, which is nice, because Boyfriend also gets off work early on Fridays.  Today, we decided to use his Yelp Deals for Nick's, so we headed over for lunch.

Thank goodness for Boyfriend, his Yelp Deal, and his wallet, because if I'd paid a cent for my food, I would've torched the place for being the overrated crap that it is.

My first piece of bad news came when the guy taking our order forgot one of my tacos.  We found out when I only got two tacos delivered to our table.  We went to ask about it.  Okay, whatever, at least he didn't charge us for it.  But I paused after each taco order for the guy to type it in, so he most likely spaced.  Two tacos was theoretically enough food, but I was still a bit peeved.

Then, seriously, almost $4 (or more) for one taco?  Are you freaking kidding me?  This has really nothing to do with the fact that I'm CCG.  It has to do with the fact that everywhere else in the city, you can get a taco for half of that on a regular day.

I had two tacos (both regular style): pollo and carnitas.  Both lacked flavor, were greasy, and completely underwhelming.  Publico and Tacolicious blow this place out of the water when it comes to tacos.  Then, I took a bite of Boyfriend's carne asada taco Nick's way, and I almost threw up because the whole thing was not only bland, but tasted like grease.  His carne asada quesadilla was also a big greasy sandwich, basically.  I actually felt physically sick from eating even one bite, and I wanted to wipe my fingers immediately.

Two tacos were definitely not enough to make me feel full, and I left feeling completely unsatisfied.  Taco Bell hits a home run compared to this place, AND it would've left me enough money to go further down Broadway and pay for my cover into a strip club.
author: Tori S.

description: Some of the best tacos in San Francisco. And a great bar attached.
author: Jon F.

description:
Good place to go on any given night for some good drinks and great food.  Happy hour margaritas are about $2-$3 and a pitcher is ridiculously cheap.... and beers are cheap as well during happy hour (about $2). I'm not really a fan of the happy hour margaritas though... I'd rather pay a little more and get something that tastes a little better.

Both the veggie tacos and chicken tacos (Nick's way) are great. Also opt for the chips & guac. Can't go wrong at Nick's!
author: Kristina C.

description:
For some reason, I was sorta anticipating Jack in the Box-style tacos, but was pleasantly surprised!

There's definitely a lot of hype around this place, and it's totally delicious and worth the adventure. I ordered the Carnitas taco and some beef nachos and both were absolutely awesome. The tacos are HUGE -- I definitely only needed one. And it's conveniently located right next to Rouge so you can grab a table and a couple of pitchers of beer. 

Would be an excellent late night fix, too :)
author: Lauren F.

description: Nicks.. I think it should be called something else like Nix (as in Nix that place).  This is what you could expect when you go there.  Walk in, see a few people at the bar.  Not sure where to order.  You try to ask some people that might work here where to order.  You finally see some body come from the back through the bar kitchen and decide to ask them.  They say they don't work here.  Then a customer points to some other guy who has been watching you this whole time.  Apparently he works here and is now ready to help take your order.  You order the burrito with no sour cream.  Your burrito finally arrives with as much sour cream as they could fit in the tortilla.  Nix this place if you care to be treated good.  But in spite of this, that was a damn good burito.  So its getting 2 stars for the burrito only.  Oh, I think I was charged incorrectly too.
author: Gary A.

description: Excellent tacos. I definitely recommend getting Nick's style although it gets a little pricy. Good place to watch sports with lots of big tvs. If you are very hungry get two tacos. If not, one will suffice.
author: Jeff G.

description: Yum! Perfect place for an afternoon margarita and tacos. The old theater architecture provides interesting ambiance. I prefer nearby Tacolicious when it comes to the actual food but this place is great fun with a chill vibe.
author: Kendra S.

description: It's really fun.  You have to go on Taco Tuesday's.  Get it Nick's way and expect to be punched in the face with deliciousness!   Umm, you can get table service which is kindof funny to me still, call in a week ahead of time to get a good time for it.   Idk if I love Rouge at night though... it's so-so
author: Jesse M.

description:
Best tacos this side of the Mission!

A little treasure in Nob Hill, Nick's is inside Rouge and uses the space until about 10 at night. It's a great red color inside with lots of space for parties, games, and dancing!
author: Kristin F.

description: Damn good tacos. Read the reviews here dropped in and ordered 2 chicken t's Nick's Way. Very tasty, but I wasn't full, so I'd recommend ordering a side dish perhaps chips and salsa to top the meal off. I can't say its a destination eatery, but certainly if you're in the neighborhood...
author: Jeremy S.

description:
Mango Fresca

All I ordered here when my friend "L" ordered her tacos to go.  I was parched from my downing of the Peet's earlier so I absorbed the mango fresca before I got to the end of the block.

I found it amusing that this "eatery" transforms itself into a cheesy nightclub (came when it first opened and then never went back due to the slimey cheeseball variety) at night, but opens the doors for fried tacos during the day.
author: Miika M.

description:
You walk into a place that's called "Nick's Crispy Tacos" and expect their tacos to be..., oh I don't know, crispy, right? No no no, not so the case young padwan!

I ordered 5 tacos, 2 chicken, 2 fish, 1 shrimp. It turns out if you want your taco 'crispy', you have to specially ask for that and pay roughly $1 extra. Right. That totally makes sense. With this set of 5 tacos, we also ordered a Mexican coke and a strawberry drink, which totaled up our bill at a bit over $36. Meanwhile the guy behind the counter taking the order keeps scratching himself as I try to ignore the bad feeling I'm getting in my gut about this place.

$36 for 5 tacos and a two drinks. The Mexican Coke was warm, and the strawberry drink tasted like water, no strawberry. The tacos were the blandest tacos that I've EVER had in all of California. The only redeeming quality of one of the tacos was that the shrimp/prawns were actually ample sized. Everything else sucked. 

I honestly wanted to cry while eating these tacos. Why? Was it the fact that I had just paid $36 in San Francisco for some horrible tacos when I could've gone to ANY random taco truck and gotten 10x better tacos for a fraction of the price? Or was it that I had just ruined my appetite with these faux-tacos and now had to wait a few hours before being able to eat tasty foods again? All of the above, and so much more.

To sum it up, there is simply NO reason to eat at Nicks Crispy Tacos. No reason at all. Seriously, what the hell are you even DOING eating tacos in Nob Hill? Go to Mission, go to SOMA (tropisueno), hell, just walk around randomly in the the city until you smell mexican food, just DON'T walk into Nicks Crispy Tacos!
author: Chubby K.

description: Came here for taco Tuesday last night. The drink and food specials were cheap and delicious! $30 for 8 massive tacos/2 orders of chips/guac & quesadilla--- unbeatable. I'm coming back soon. Only downside is if you reserve a table, you only have it for 90mins...
author: Christie S.

description:
I love this place! They have some of the best tacos, but probably because of all that guac that they're loaded with. Tacos, quesadillas, burritos - The basics are all there, but with a Nick twist to all of them. The tacos, ordered Nick's way, has a soft shell on the outside and a crispy shell on the inside. The quesadillas are made to a flaky crisp. As for the burritos - they're the most boring thing to order. They aren't bad - there just isn't anything special with them. They also have the horchata, agua frescas, elote (corn smothered in cheese) and tortilla soup.

It's not often I get to have fish tacos, so when I'm here, I'm always sure to order the pescado taco - Nick's Way. JONASAPPROVED!
author: Jonas T.

description:
Aside from the totally bizarre ambiance this place has as a result of sharing its location with a nightclub, this is a solid place.

The tacos are quite good, as are the burritos -- although a little on the expensive side for foil wrapped Mexican food. 

Would recommend take out given the super dark and funky atmosphere
author: Sydney L.

description:
Headed out here for the infamous taco tuesday.  Arrived around 730, and the place was packed with tons of brochachos and ladies.  Think of Nick's as a club that happens to serve tacos...

Line was long, but moved fast.  Know what you're ordering beforehand, bc the guys at the counter are on a schedule and you'll feel rushed if you haven't decided.  Nick's Way, obvi, is superior, and worth the extra dollar.  Food is delivered surprisingly quickly, so you can satiate your hunger, provided you can find a seat in the throng of people.  Cash only!

Tacos are pretty damn good, and at $2 a piece are a steal.  Waaaay better than Rubio's (my other Taco tuesday experience), which pales in comparison.  Not super authentic, but 3, or even 2 of these will fill you up quickly.  Pair your tacos with a Corona, bring some friends, and observe the madness that is Nick's Crispy Taco's.
author: Michael C.

description:
My favorite things to order here are pescado tacos, Nick's way; and carne asada quesadillas.

The tacos are pretty delicious, but be ready to spend an extra few bucks for the tacos. They aren't your run of the mill tacos, especially if you get them Nick's way - which you should.

And if you go on a Tuesday, then you should expect to NOT find a place to sit.
But you can make reservations for a table by going to rougesf.com - make sure you do it well in advance, and not the day before.
author: Andrew M.

description:
A fun time at last night's Taco Tuesday at Nick's Crispy makes me feel inclined to tack on another star... 

To be safe, in the food department, I stuck with veggie options. My veggie taco ($2) was super yummy and the chips with fresh salsa and guacamole for $2 were a delicious steal. 

In the drinks department, I enjoyed a salty margarita and two $2.50 beers that I didn't have to pay for...

The company was the best part though! We sectioned off one of the raised balconies with two tables, chairs, couches, etc. We all enjoyed a rowdy time praising Yelp and getting excited for the holiday party. We ran into lots of other friends too who had the same Taco Tuesday idea... 

It was packed but I still got food and drinks within 10 and 5 minutes respectively!
author: Meghan P.

description:
If all you care about is cheap drinks on a Friday night, well, even then I'd be hard pressed to recommend Nick's.  

Tacos were ok.  The shells tasted odd, not sure if it was a stale flavor or maybe they were fried in an old oil.  Just not tasty.  Same goes for the carnitas.  Nothing special about the flavor.  

Not really much else to say about it.  The food was ok at best.  Drinks were cheap.  Probably won't return.
author: Bobby N.

description:
Nick's way? Yes way. 

My first time here and I will definitely be coming back. There was a huge line but I have to say the staff is on it when it comes to delivering food in a timely fashion. I ordered two pescado tacos and they were sitting in front of me maybe 2 or 3 minutes after ordering! The food was incredible, simply put. You must get tacos Nick's way, the hard shell wrapped in the soft shell, mmmmm. 

The downsides I see to this place is that it gets crowded, although that's usually a good sign, and it's cash only - wahhh. Thankfully they have an ATM right by the register (I hate it when cash only places don't have an ATM).
author: Allie M.

description:
Delicious and so easy for a Thursday night. 

A couple of tacos, the nacho salad and a pint of Anchor Steam. 
My only complaint is the standard issue I have with Californian beer, its never cold enough. 

The fish taco was amazing, melted in my mouth, the pork was a little on the dry side, but the beans and guac. made up for it! 

Can't wait to come back for Taco Tuesday !!
author: Kristy B.

description: I ate here on a whim for the first time today.  OMG it was SO SO good.  Seriously the best taco I have ever had.  Make sure you get it Nick's way with the cheese and gauc!!!  I'll definitely be back every time we come to SF!
author: Heather A.

description:
I love the fried fish tacos and have to have it Nick's way to get the house sauce. I don't even need to add the green or red sauce after getting a taco Nick's way. 

The steak nachos are large and very yummy. Although those lactose intolerant should stay away from the abundant cheese. 

The burritos are huge and quite tasty and have good portion of meat for those into meat burritos.

It's a nice lunch spot and there's always available seating even on lunch on weekend. Weekend nights can be busy though.
author: Melanie O.

description: Grilled fish tacos nick's way are the best in town.  Carnitas are pretty good as well.  Go during off hours for a really relaxing low key atmosphere.
author: Mike D.

description:
Love the randomness of this place (you have to go to truly experience why).
Love the burritos, especially when tipsy. Kudos for whole wheat tortillas. Love Nick's. Need I say more?
author: Meredith R.

description:
I am a big taco fan..  So why the three stars?

It is not the decor.. It is not the restrooms.. My stomach doesn't care about those things.

I think the taco taste compared to the almost $5 you pay with Nick's style Fish Tacos is quite a lot for how it tastes. It isn't really anything but fish battered fried + guac + hard taco + soft taco. The taste doesn't particularly jump out at you even if you add their salsas. Maybe if I was in the area for drinks and had a buzz to rub off then it would be a lot better.
author: Hevad Y.

description:
Best fried fish taco's I've ever had.
I prefer to skip Nick's way and just get 2 pescado tacos with a beer.
Delicious start to a polk street pub crawl
author: Skye W.

description: Love the fish tacos, Nick's Way of course.  Ingredients are fresh, and the food is never a disappointment!
author: Kona L.

description:
ummm LOVE IT! ADORE IT! want more OF IT! 

Great taco's...fun environment...and friendly service!
author: Alina B.

description:
So this place gets reaally really packed on Tuesday's. If you're thinking of going, get there early otherwise you'll end up waiting in a line for half an hr to get a taco, another line for drinks, and not even have a place to stand when you've got everything.

We waited forever to get a fish taco, which was really good when we got it crispy style I think. We also got a pitcher of margs. They were single handedly the worst margaritas I've ever had in my life. I can't even describe how bad it was other than to say I'm usually not picky about them at all, and my friends and I literally couldn't drink it. It was like all margarita mixer or something, I don't even know. No  lime. Couldn't taste tequila. I went back and asked the guy to fix it, but all he did was squeeze lime into it which didn't help. And he was an asshole. I wanted to yell at him to try it himself but he didn't so much as look at me again the rest of the night.

Overall, not a fan. Go to bluelight.
author: Julie F.

description:
Came here with a friend who was visiting from out of town because it has been on my bucket-list since I discovered Yelp.

Got the baha fish tacos nick's way, as recommended by trusty yelpers, and OMG can I say the combination of the fresh and cool creamy guacamole, the deep fried fish, the crunchy shell, the soft shell, and the salsas along with the agua fresca to wash it all down was pure deliciousness.  I was tempted to eat another one, but seeing as we had reservations for house of prime rib in about 1.5 hours, I refrained(my friends and I get down with our food haha)

But my friend was so happy with the food, and seeing as she wouldnt be able to enjoy this taco peculiar to San Francisco for a while, ordered up another.  
That amazing.
author: Jane K.

description:
What everyone else said.

I'm not really going to be satisfied until I try everything on this menu.  

Yeah, it's that good.
author: Jeff C.

description: I love me some tacos and I love me some Taco Tuesdays even more! You can't beat $2 for Tacos so there we were, rollin into Nick's Crispy Tacos last Tues which happened to be Fat Tuesday and they had this whole fun Mardi Gras-Theme thing going on. The place is crowded on Tuesdays anyway so you can image how crowded it was then, which translates into long lines to order and no place to sit unless you thought ahead to reserve one of the booths (we didn't). But tacos, they did not disappoint! We had grilled chicken tacos (Nick's way), veggie tacos and churros, can't forget about them churros.. Yumm. I will back!
author: Karin M.

description:
This is only concerning their fish tacos.  Bought other food items there and I wouldn't do it again. 

good fish tacos.  Almost like home, almost.  A little bit on the expensive side and cash only : (  but I guess you can charge that when you are the only game in town and it's still cheaper than a plane ticket to SD and a drive down to Baja.
author: Edelmira D.

description: I haven't been to Nick's crispy tacos in a while and although I have enjoyed it in times past, today (Tuesday of all days) it was less than enjoyable. We ordered both the fish taco's and carne (nicks way) the presentation was nice filled with a good portion of guacamole, the "crunchy" tacos were less than crunchy. The stale tacos did not compliment the rest of the dish. The salsa verde was still on par and flavorful; however, the experience is lacking with the dim lighting and the grungy ambiance of the rouge lounge. For a true experience of "crunchy tacos" (nicks way) try his taco shop at underdogs on Irving.
author: Randy W.

description:
Silencio, burrito and taco snobs of SF!!!

For all those people who hate on all Mexican food not born in the Mission, you need to check yourself.  Nick's Crispy has been slinging the goods for years in the Hills of Russia.  I'll put their tacos up against anyone's in the city...and then declare them the winner.  

Get them "Nick's way" for extra crunchy tortilla, guac, and cheese factor.  Their carne asada, carnitas, and pescado tacos are all insanely good.  Add in a horchata or a MexiCoke and you're good to go.
author: Clayton S.

description:
There is not another place I would go to to get a taco in the city.

I've been on taco crawls that have spanned 10 different taco places. 

They were all okay.

This place is the best.
author: Jim B.

description:
I have been eagerly awaiting to try the tacos here and tonite was the nite! Actually it was the second pit stop in our marathon meal. 

We already had dinner at Sushi Groove but wanted alittle something more so we walked over to Nick's. Each of us tried a taco...I had the grilled fish and it was good! Next time I'm going to try the pollo Nick's way (crispy taco).
author: Helen Y.

description:
I still remember the first time I bit into that fried fish taco ... pure joy!!!!  It's my taco of choice here.  When I'm attempting to be healthy, I'll have the grilled fish taco with a Corona Light ;)  Still super tasty! 

Mike and I discovered that they serve breakfast on the weekends.  He had the sausage burrito and I had the bacon quesadilla.  My dish won!  The quesadilla is massive and bomb diggity.  The burrito was also quite large ... but I was not a fan of the "sausage" they used.  It tasted like cut up hot dogs.  I'll probably go back this weekend and try the burrito with carne asada instead.   

Other pluses ... Friday nights there's a "2 for $5" deal.  Taco Tuesdays are crowded but can be fun!
author: Dina H.

description:
Living around the corner definitely helps when deciding where to spend my taco Tuesday...but did you know this place also has a GREAT happy hour menu over the WEEKEND? yes, you heard me right...weekend. I also didn't know that happy hour prices were offered over the weekends but apparently Nick's/Rouge has made an exception. Lasting all day and until 10pm Friday-Sunday you can get $3 well drinks, #3 draft beers and cheap shots. Even margaritas are $3 bucks and pitchers around $10...and while your enjoying your delicious cheap drinks you can chow down on some taco's and other Mexican food. Make sure to get your taco's Nick's way...adding some guac to really make them tasty! You won't find all the cheap prices for food except for on Tuesdays, but its definitely worth it for the cheap weekend alcohol prices!!

You're welcome.
author: Masie A.

description:
Taco Tuesdays exist because of Nick's Crispy Tacos. Nick's Crispy Tacos exist because of Taco Tuesdays. This place is PACKED. Lines go from end to end at Nick's. If you get here past 7pm, be prepared to wait for 30-45 minutes for tacos. It's less than likely that you can get a table pass 8pm. People get here early to reserve tables for their groups. I ordered two tacos (chicken and veggie, wish they had fish!). 

You can make it a "Nick's Taco" to get avocado, cheese, and have them slap on an extra layer of crisp - all for an additional buck or two. It honestly doesn't make too much of a difference for me. Plus, my chicken tastes drier for some weird reason. 

Anyway, Nick's is a great place to go for tacos any day but it's the best place to go for the tradish Taco Tuesdays. At times, you'll either feel a little awkward holding your order number around while waiting for a table. Other times you'll feel even more awkward standing up and eating your tacos. But you'll get passed all that, like most people do, and then you'll continue to come back every Tuesday (like most people do).
author: Linda T.

description:
I'm a sucker for good fish tacos and Nick's are great! I tried my fish both grilled and fried. Although they both tasted good, I'll have to agree with other Yelpers that the fried pescado wins hands down. Add a little bit of green/red sauce on your table for a little kick of heat, though the fish tacos are dee-lish on their own.

I'm not quite sure if the place is a bar or taco joint first. Judging from the fact they have cocktail servers, but you have to go up to a counter to order your food fast food style, tells me it's bar first. Approaching 7pm, that taco line starts to get long and sloooow. But on Thursday nights, you get to enjoy your wait with great funky jazz played live by a bunch of cool cats. I must say, I come here for the fish taco & jazz combo because it's kinda out of the way for me.

Once I caught Nick's on their Taco Tuesday, which offer half priced tacos excluding their beloved fish tacos. I was willing to give the carne asada and carnitas a try, but I left regretting not at least getting a fish taco. Of the two I ordered, the carnitas wins by a small margin. The little chopped up meats in the tacos didn't quite add up to the big bites of fish in the pescado, plus I'm not a big fan of filler beans (comes in carne asada). They do have shrimp tacos, which I'm curious  to try sometime.

For $4.50 a taco, I'd say the price is a bit outrageous. It's safe to say I'll never shell out another buck to have it Nick's way. But hey, I'm a sucker who keeps coming back for more and willing to wait in that ridiculous line... so I shouldn't complain too much. But I'm new in town and my search for great fish tacos in SF has only just begun, though I've been told this place is best.
author: Rina W.

description:
Okay, I've been coming to Nick's for a few years, but had not been there in many months. Stopped in on a weekday for a taco...

One carnitas taco. Nick's way - $5.05! Are you kidding me? One taco?

Vaya con dios, Nick.
author: Zig Z.

description: Nicks. Oh man. This is what tacos are all about... And I'm all about tacos. I know this is short, but if you want great food and a very SF experience, I highly recommend it.
author: Jay E.

description:
I live about 2 blocks away from Nick's and this is my go-to whenever I am craving Mexican Food. The atmosphere is super chill (they always have reggae music playing) and during the day it's pretty easy to find a place to sit. 

Taco Tuesday here is MUCH better than at Blue Light (better tasting tacos, more drink specials, and not as packed) and it's also a great place to watch sports when Greens or Shanghai Kellys get too crowded. 

I usually go with the Carnitas Taco or Pescado Taco Nick's way. You MUST get them Nick's way or it's really not worth going. Their guac is fantastic, and the extra crispiness brings everything together! They also have 2 different hot sauces, both of which are also delicious. 

The only bummer is that it is cash only and a bit expensive (expect to pay ~$11) for 2 tacos Nick's way. 

Overall though this is a great neighborhood spot and a fun bar to hang out at!
author: Jeff S.

description: Finally made it up to try the breakfast burrito at Nick's this Sunday.  I was itching for a fix and was slightly disappointed that this one didn't blow me away.  I like the tacos here but the poor distribution of ingredients in the breakfast burrito made it not work so well. Lots of eggs were on one side while huge swaths of potatoes would dominate other bites.  I got it with bacon and the crunchy bacon was good, but overall it didn't really satisfy.  Will have to give it another shot some time...
author: Gene X.

description: While it has already been said, you can't go wrong with Nick's. Admittedly, you cannot get a Mission quality burrito here, you really can't beat the ambience. Bright read, 10 million chandeliers, and pitchers of beer. While I was saddened at Rogue's departure from actual glass pitchers, this place is a Poll Street classic. Specifically, if your inside Rogue at around 8:45 PM, you get a strange feeling that the atmosphere is changing. Why? Because it's suddenly a club night. At that point, I take my cue to exit, but I'll leave that decision to you...
author: Matthew T.

description:
Honestly, this place is a hot mess to me. It is completely overpriced, the decor (yes, i know it is a nightclub at night but come on) is obnoxious, and the food well...it is hard to mess up tacos but these are for sure sub-par tacos.

Their one redeeming quality is that they have a soft taco inside of a hard taco, and that adds a different element to it but all in all I would say this place is a waste of money.
author: Maya-Luisa G.

description: I used to be a fan but ever since the owners split up the food isn't as good anymore.  But if you never tried it, you should give it a chance!
author: Ammala B.

description:
4.5 STARS

Nick got it right! :)  The food is made fresh and they really pack on the meat into their tacos and burritos.  Nicks way is the best way.  They also have these two hot sauces to try on your table.  It looks like the red sauce is a little hotter (red chiles?) The green sauce is probably a tomatillo and Jalapeno sauce?  The green sauce is a bit more citrus.  The prices are amazing in comparison to the quality of food.  My burrito was so packed it practically ripped at its sides lol  Anyway I'm a big guy and if one burrito and horchata is enough to stuff me...you know you are getting huge portions.  :)  Good job Nick.  I believe we have some Latinos on the line so you are getting authentic made Mexican food...no American "Mexican food"  here.  

I could have given five stars but they didn't have Tamarindo or Jamaica and those are usually the Aguas Frescas Trinity along side Horchata.  I believe they had Honeydew that night.
author: Carlos U.

description:
This is the place to be for Taco Tuesday. GET THERE EARLY. If you're in past 6:15, you're probably screwed and will end up in a line spanning the wall of the bar. It does move fast, but that's less time you have looking for a place to sit.

Oh, and get all your tacos "Nick's Way."
author: Tyler H.

description: Delicious Mexican but this is more of an after drinking all night spot. The place itself is creepy looking and the food is just not sit down quality. It is very fresh but I think this place is overrated!
author: Leya r.

description:
The tacos here are great. Prices aren't as good as a mission taqueria but order your tacos nick's way and you get a really fresh meal. 

My friend caught the bartender shorting us on liquor for drinks but she tried to make it right. the margaritas are okay but small and overpriced when push comes to shove. i will still come back occasionally for the tacos.

Also, the restaurant is large and comfortable so there is typically a nice big booth to enjoy your food and drinks in. But beware because occasionally there will be a private party there and you have to take your food to go (or sit on one of 4 chairs they will leave outside.
author: Leuwam T.

description:
I've never thought of myself as a connoisseur of tacos, always preferred to think of myself as a 'burrito girl'. The Pescado-Nick's Way has me cheating on my beloved burrito without a hint of guilt, sooo yummy!

Many cool things about this place: the chandeliers, the red/pink colors, the freshness of the ingrediants, the guacamole, and much more! 

You need to go to add on to that list ;)
author: nina B.

description:
My personal fav is the Black Bean & Grilled Corn Taco Salad with grilled chicken. 

Description:

Romaine lettuce, corn, black beans, cilantro, onions, tomatoes, cabbage & guacamole tossed in a tomatillo/rojo vinaigrette.

Their guacamoe is the best I've had in the city, which says a lot considering how many taco shops I've been to. I have yet to try the breakfast burrito which also sounds incredible!
author: Danielle S.

description:
The food would be amazing, if you do not mind the fact there are MICE running around the place. MICE?!?! Saw it with my own two eyes and reported it to the guy and he looked left, looked right and went back to his post as if nothing ever happened. 
So next time you get Nick's style there might be some extra crispy MICE FECES in there too!
author: Igor T.

description:
I'll start with the bad because you'll see enough of the good.  The margaritas are probably the worst I've ever tasted.  Unacceptable from a tacos joint.  Also, the complimentary sauce were both pretty mild.  Would be nice to have a hotter option.  
Other than that, every other positive review is correct.  Tacos and burritos are great.  Well put together, big portions, and generally satisfying. 
Atmosphere is pretty unique during the day but never made it for the club after hours. I can't foresee ever dancing after mammoth burritos.
author: James M.

description:
It felt so odd to step into Rouge when there was actually light out. I had to blink twice... Ohhh..so that's how Rouge looks like when I'm sober and aware of my surroudings. Ohhh..so that's the bar top that my friends danced on a few years ago. Ohhh.. so that's the bathroom and the porcelain god I worshipped back in the day.

Regardless.. my husband and I were itching for an afternoon bite so we decided on mexican over the pizza joint next door and we were pleasantly surprised.

Behind the red leather seating, highboy tables, bar top and chandeliers.. there is some great mexican food in action. We split (okay fine, it was more like I ate and my husband nibbled) on the nachos and it was divine. Crunch tortilla chips oozing with melted cheese, sour cream, guacamole, beans and meat. Next time we come back, the shrimp tacos are on my must-try list.
author: Nancie T.

description: Delicious Tacos in a unique atmosphere. After walking in through a mirrored entryway and past an open dining room covered in chandeliers and red-velvet booths, you'll make your way to the counter where everyone places their order. All I can speak for thus far is the tacos, (done nick's style w/ cheese and guacamole on a crispy shell) but they were quite tasty, however they were very mild on a spicy scale. 2 was plenty for a guy who can eat, especially when you throw in chips and queso.  Not too crowded during happy hour on a Thursday, but after passing a DJ stand and disco ball, I'm sure this place can turn busy in a hurry.
author: Adam K.

description:
This place cracks me up -- only taco joint I've ever been to with chandeliers (although to be fair I guess that's 'Rouge' and not Nick's Crispy). I've not been able to find a time where it's been easy to find a seat while the kitchen is still open, but there's a few golden hours before it switches to Rouge that tables are easy to come by and pitchers of margaritas can be had. It's worth coming with a small group during food hours to sample the tacos, and at least ONE should be Nick's Way.

Rouge, the nightclub, cracks me up. If you're in the neighborhood and somewhat sober around 12:30am, stop in to check out the scene.
author: Adam D.

description: Yay for Taco Tuesday! $2 tacos. Recommend getting it Nick's way for 95 cents more. Tacos are much better with the crispy taco shell and fresh guacamole. Tacos and quesadillas are slightly less greasier than those served at Underdog's. Line for tacos can get long, but once you place your order, food comes out really quickly. Good luck finding a seat.
author: Sophia B.

description:
Get a couple tacos, whichever kind you like. Personally, I like to get one carnitas and one fish. Get them Nick's way. Don't expect them to actually be crispy.

Do not order a drink at the taco counter. Go over to the bar and get a cheap draft beer or a margarita or hell, maybe a pitcher.

Cash only. 

If there isn't anywhere to sit, grab some standing room at the standing bar/shelf.

Enjoy!
author: Emily C.

description:
I really wish the $2 tacos were crispy - that's one of the reasons it gets 3! Otherwise a great place to check out after work on Tuesdays, chandelier atmosphere is pretty damn random but it works. I've tried it once but I think I still like Blue Light's $1 Taco Tuesdays better...
Will give it another chance in the near future. Who knows...maybe one Tuesday I'll feel more baller and go for the crispy ones...
author: Christina L.

description:
ONE OF MY BEST BITES OF THE YEAR: JULY 2005 - JUNE 2006
I know it's been around awhile, but I only was able to try their legendary taco this year. A soft taco encases a crispy taco and the whole thing holds good quality steak and a heap of guac and salsa. I've been looking for a good taco for a long time. This exceeded good by so, so much. As soon as I tried it I told my friend John that it would make my top 10 list for the year. Their chips and guac and salsa aren't free, but are totally, totally worth it.
author: Kathleen M.

description:
When my friends told me we were going to "Taco Tuesday," I sort of had a certain kind of restaurant pictured in my head. I mean, what is one to expect from a place called Nick's Cripsy Tacos?

It definitely was not the red walls, mirrors and chandeliers that greeted me when I walked in. 

Tacos and fabulous drag queen inspired decor?!? Am I in heaven?!? 

No, just Nick's Crispy Tacos.
author: Tara H.

description:
Gotta say these tacos were delicious but WAY overpriced. I went there for lunch on a Friday afternoon and had 4 different tacos, all Nick's style by the way. Carne Asada, Pollo Asada, Fried Fish and Pulled Pork with a large strawberry agua fresca. 

-Tacos were delicious. Nick's way is the only way. The guac was thick and alvacado-y. The pico de gallo was so good. That being said...
-Way too expensive. The pork, chicken and beef tacos were $3.50 each. The fish was $5. Then I wanted all four taco's "Nick's way", which added $1 each! I ended up paying $25 dollars for four tacos and a large drink. It was ridiculous.
-Order at the cash register on the right of the restaurant and then find your own seating. Nice comfortable atmosphere, but I like a messy taco with a dirty diner feel.
-Parking might be a pain as its on Broadway. Bring change for meter!
-Went there with my tubby girlfriend. 2 people eating 4 tacos, nick's way... and I was not full at the end. But maybe I'm a fatass in denial.

I just want to say "Nick's way" is a rip off. I think all tacos should be nick's way without the $1 extra add on. You can't call your restaurant Nick's crispy tacos and charge customers $1 to make it so... 
If you're a taco lover and willing to hash out the cash, Nick's is worth a one time visit. But I won't be going there again. Too pricey for too little.
author: Aron L.

description:
1 carne asada taco + 1 carnitas taco + elote + agua fresca = one happy fat a$$!  

I'll pass on the carnitas next time, but the carne asada and mexican style elote killed it, I'll be back!

Draw backs... Cash only place and a little pricey.
author: Cynthia V.

description:
The boss and I checked out Nick's Crispy Tacos on Thursday for a quick dinner before the Chieftains game at Yerba Buena. Thanks to Yelp Deals, we had a prepaid coupon (God, I feel like I'm turning into my Mom) for $20 worth of food for $10. Lemme preface by saying that while I still had my Nick's cherry, the wife HATES Nick's. Unfortunately, our neighborhood is pretty devoid of cheap, decent Mexican food (come back, La Salsa!) and we didn't have enough time to shoot down to the Mission. Still, we figured with the deal, we'd be covered for food and 2 beers.

What the woman didn't mention is that Nick's is retardedly expensive. We ordered 2 pescado burritos Nick's style and 2 beers. I happily handed my coupon to the gentleman behind the counter (like the cheap bastard that I am) waited for my rations like a good little boy. So you could imagine my surprise when he said "that'll be $9.75"! I tried explaining that I signed up for the $20 for $10 deal, but apparently with Nick's ass-inine pricing $20 doesn't even cover the 2 burritos. To make matters worse, they only take cash, so I had to run across the street to Walgreens and buy a homeless guy a banana (seriously) to avoid $6 in ATM fees. No wonder the place was freaking empty, and 2 patrons actually walked out without their takeout orders!

Well, my cash was already wasted and I was starving, so I sat down and waited for my food. So out comes the 2 burritos, sans chips. How can one eat a burrito without having fresh chips to scoop up the slop that falls out? So I mention to our server that he forgot the chips, and he says "oh no, they're extra"! Are you f*cking kidding me? $30 for 2 burritos and 2 beers and I have to pay extra for chips?!? Nick's might be the most expensive taqueria in the City, even more so than Papalote, home of a $20 burrito. To make matters worse, the fish in the burrito was so over-fried that it was barely edible.

Find a new line of work, Nick. 'Cause your burritos suck d*ck!
author: Michael T.

description:
My GO-TO spot around Russian Hill.

Here is the cliff notes version for all you yelpers just looking for a solution to your hunger and not a foodie diary entry:

          *********************************
          PESCADO TACO NICK'S WAY = best thing on the menu.
          *********************************
                    Its a  fried fish taco with the crispy tortilla on the inside
                    and warm soft tortilla on the outside all topped with a
                    dollop of guac. (2nd place - Carne Asada Nick's way)

This place is great for:
          * Lunch/Dinner or after-bars late night
          * Taco Tues (dollar off eat-in orders that are non-pescado
          -- nick's way extra $.95)

Minus one star for being expensive mexican. Nobody should have to pay 5 dollars for a taco, but I can't help coming back because I like it so much and there isn't much cheap to-go food in Russian Hill.
author: Samantha R.

description: It was hopping here on a Tues night because of their taco specials but I was here for their most popular, the "baja" taco nick's way.  It was crispy fish, pico de gallo, sour cream, sauce, cheese, in a hard shell taco wrapped in a soft shell taco.  Awesome taco but not too big of a fan w. the dual taco shells.  I just like mine soft.
author: Ricky C.

description: 2 Kids taco, Eliote, Pescado taco, and horchata $19.00, it was delish. Great music and vibe. Not what I'm used to in SoCal for Mexican dives. Asians behind the counter led me to think Kogi vibe, but I was wrong! Authentic taste! Will be back.
author: Chantel R.

description:
I dig this place. I really, really do.

While I'm tempted to deduct 1 star for Rouge Nightclub and the "stylish" chandeliers, I can overlook them thanks to Nick's ridiculously delicious tacos (Nick's way, duh). Despite living within walking distance for three years, I still don't think I have been here enough. If I'm hungry, I definitely order three tacos, but on an average day, two is probably fine. 

Atmosphere is fun, food is incredible, wish they took credit cards but such is life. Great place to bring friends from out of town.

Okay, time for dinner and I'll I want now is a taco!! (Nick's way!)
author: Peter C.

description: Went to Nick's for the first time during SantaCon and had a great time. For such a chaotic day and crowd they handled it really well. We ordered our food right away and got it shorty after...in less time than it usually takes at Tacko on Filmore (same owner as Nick's). As usual I indulged in the chicken taco "Nick's Way" and it was delicious. My husband gets the same but with fish. He enjoyed it too. The lounge area has great freshly made margaritas, although the cocktail waitresses are a little bit like delicate geniuses. Anyway, with good company and an appetite for some Mexican food, Nick's is a really fun spot. I'll definitely be returning. Oh yeah, if you're going with a group you can reserve tables in the lounge beforehand. This is a huge plus for me!
author: Kelsey K.

description:
So, the chicken burrito I had was pretty tasty. No complaints. :-)

Now, Mon-Thurs they have an extended happy hour from 5-10. On Friday it's 2-10. $3 MARGUERITES, DRAFT BEERS & WELL DRINKS...do I need to re-write this?!?!?! I hope you guys get the message. Lol. 

But go eat tasty tacos and burritos, while getting buzzed off of $3 drinks! You can't beat this guys!
author: Lauren H.

description:
Salad - Outside of the awesome taco tuesday deals - go for the taco salad. I love this hearty salad of romaine, charred corn, black beans, pico de gallo, tortilla strips, cabbage, and a huge mound of guacamole. I love throwing the shredded chicken on this salad for a quick weeknight take-out meal. 

Tacos - Nick's Way are unstoppable. Chicken, fish, carne - they can do no wrong. I wouldn't recommend buying these outside of Tuesday, a $6 taco is hard to justify.

Breakfast - Though the tacos are lovely, the breakfast quesadilla is the gut-bomb that you should love on the weekends! It's a massive burrito tortilla crisped up with scrambled eggs, jack cheese, bacon, and potatoes. One quesadilla is enough for two people.
author: Kristen K.

description:
Nick's is what I call a trendy place.  

The food is not as good as the reputation of the place as a whole.  The employees are all hipsters, the interior is kind of gaudy and the food is definitely not worth what you pay for. 

It is only good for the Taco Tuesdays but it does get really busy so I don't know... I'd rather look for another taco place.  

Don't get me wrong, the fish tacos are pretty awesome.  Hence the 3 stars because I can't give it any more for anything else and docked it from a 3.5 to a 3 because the employees were kind of snobs almost every time I've been there.  Must start to look for a new place.
author: Anna C.

description:
Ole!
Ok, so that was lame, BUT this place es un pequeno slice of heaven in the ridiculously non-ethnically diverse part of town I live in. I LOVE MEXICAN FOOD. With a passion that leads me to believe I was Latina in a past life, but that is a story for another day my friends. 
Its in the heart of Russian Hill, and offers a great ginormous burrito with spicy salsa and small hole in the wall goodness. Not nearly as impressive as the Mission, but then again this IS in Russian Hill. Still, its reasonable, yummy, and the best part? It turns into Rouge after 9 or so and I can't help but crack up every single time I have a craving for Nick's and realize that instead of my yummy burrito coming out of the back, some drunk girl is shaking her ass trying to impress some equally drunk guy. Awesome. If only they had a taco to share.....
author: Kathy K.

description:
Chandeliers, and tacos, what more do you want.  It's a good change of place, and it's lively and fun in here.  This place spits SF crazy.  The taco was different, cuz it's crispy...duh.  The drinks were good too.  A great find if you're in the hood and want a fun vibe before going out.

But as for cheap taco places in the city, none compete with Reaction cafe in the mission hands dowwwwwwwn.
author: A A.

description:
I have no idea why this place get such good reviews...The portions are large and overflowing. This is a bit better than Chevys LOL! Not great or authentic. There are better tacos elsewhere to be explored in this great city.

The location is in a great building that they turned into a sports bar. It is a great place to meet friends for drinks. But wouldn't come here for the food.
author: Lola L.

description:
FISH TACOS. Get it. It'll be the best you'll ever have.

Go on Fridays @ 5PM for the 2 for $5 specials (except seafood). The nachos are bomb!

Go early to avoid the long line or have your friend find a table while you're waiting in line. You may end up fighting for tables like people were doing for mine. 

Decor consist of red walls, red seats, and cheap chandeliers. It may be on the cheesy side but definitely better than your typical taco shop. 

I'll be back next Friday.
author: Denise W.

description:
I am a big FISH TACO fan! So when Lucy L. and Mirky Z. suggested we come to Nick's I was ecstatic. Having read the reviews on Yelp and knowing we were coming on none other than Taco Tuesday, we planned ahead-- arriving around 4:30-5. We got a seat early, (there is no assigned seating as it is first come first served) and by that time the place was starting to fill up. We ordered our food and got a number. The waitress came over and got us a few drinks to get started. Happy Hour is the best, discounted alcohol! The food took a while but not a too long of a wait. 

The Crispy FISH TACO - at around $4 a pop this thing is HEAVEN, have not found a place better than this in the city! This taco is just oozing with yummy goodness, the cream sauce the guacamole (extra $) and the crispness of the fish. ORGASMIC!!! 
 
The other stuff - The other food was just so so, nothing spectacular that would make you scream the big O. 

Be sure to get here early as this place does fill up quick. If you come late, you will often see people just standing around holding their tray and gorging on the fish taco. Luckily we secured seats so we were able to eat, drink and be merry. We were approached several times by other parties asking if they could have our tables when we left. Bring a beer to the table and ask next time to guarantee your spot. 

By the time we got up to leave, the line just to order wrapped around to the bar that Nick shares with called, Rouge, I believe. 

Overall, I had a stellar experience at Nick's and will definitely be back for more. CFT! CFT! CFT!
author: Myron J.

description: Solid tacos for the price.  Got 2 tacos for under 10 bucks and it was more than I could eat.  Minus a star for cash only.  Friendly staff and good atmosphere.
author: Mike C.

description: Fish tacos are THE BOMB!!! $2.50 beers on a Friday - can't do much better in SF!!
author: Amy B.

description:
Great tacos, especially when you get them Nick's way.
Fast & friendly service.
author: Adam M.

description: Delicious food. Crumby co-tenants. I won't sit down at Rouge, but it's still worth taking this stuff to go.
author: Emy D.

description:
WHAT? How have I lived my life without trying a fish taco for so long?

FAIL.

I had one pescado and one camarones taco.  Both Nick's way and I was in HEAVEN.  I can't really explain just how delicious they are.  The guac is full of chunks of avocado- the ONLY way I like it. It's like the La Taqueria guac. RidIC

GO. NOW. There will probably be a line, so bring a snacky.

Oh and try to avoid on taco tuesday.  It's a madhouse.
author: Josie A.

description: Is it just me or has this place gone a bit down hill. I use to be totally happy to pay 6 bucks per pescado taco - nicks way. I would order 2, a few drinks, maybe a corn if I am feeling hungry and be in heaven. However recently I have been left unpleased and unsatisfied. =/
author: Linda L.

description:
Chandeliers and tacos. 

Nick's Crispy Tacos is randomly inside of Rouge, but in the daytime, you get to eat your tacos in plush seating underneath chandeliers. Where else can you do this?

Their tacos truly are extraordinary and worth the wait in line. They are HUGE and made Nick's way (crispy & soft tortilla), they are even bigger (and tastier!). I don't think you should get it any other way than Nick's way! Everything in the taco is fresh, from the meat to the guacamole. Yummm!

They had watermelon aguas fresca and horchata, yes! I hope to come back on a day with strawberry.

They have a few other things on the menu that I definitely need to try: the carne asada salad and the elote (corn on the cob smothered in cheese/chilli!). This is truly a great place on Polk St., you don't have to travel all the way to the mission to get awesome mexican food!
author: Stella C.

description:
Get the carnitas tacos Nick's way. This is the best non-traditional taco that I have had. It is a crispy taco shell atop a soft taco shell. The fillings consist of juicy carnitas, cheese, beans and a heaping pile of fresh guacamole. It is fairly large and filling for a taco. The only slightly negative thing I can say is that it is a bit pricey and the beans didn't need to be there. 

Note: The atmosphere is strange for a taco joint. It seemed like a real swanky bar with a red and black color scheme, full bar and chandeliers. I ate outside to stay in the taco mood.
author: Andee L.

description: Their fish tacos are fantastic, the sauce they use makes anything taste good. Make sure to get them "Nick's Way."
author: Bibiano L.

description:
I've been to this place now twice. The reason people keep giving it a good review is because they have no standards. 

The first time I went, I ordered a fish burrito. Fried fish, cabbage, cilantro, lime... The tortilla had the consistency of the rice paper that had been soaking all night. Not what I was expecting, but this happens when you put a gallon of water in a burrito. Also a margarita. $6.50 for a tiny thing only three-quarters full. Don't try getting a buzz on here. 

Later, I decided I must actually order the Nick's "crispy taco," since that's what the place is called, and went back. Two tacos I got--pollo asado (that's grilled chicken, folks) and carnitas (yes, slow-roasted pork)--the meats for both were incredibly dry. And this was like noon--your meats shouldn't be that dry--maybe they were day-olds microwaved. 

Now, the chips, although you have to order them separately, were good, greasy, and plentiful, with salsa heaped on--one star. 

Now, the tortillas must be commented on again. What they do with these tacos, if you haven't heard, is take a crispy shell corn tortilla and surround it by, I think two soft shells. This provides for an unmatched taco durability, and that's why they get two stars. Huge, overfilled tacos that I doused in sauce attempting to rehydrate the meat, and they still didn't fall apart. Taco-engineering genius, I've never seen anything like it before, two stars. I'd rather eat three smaller, tastier tacos, but that must just be my standards showing up again.
author: Damon L.

description:
Pescado Taco- Nick's Way
Carne Asada Taco- Nick's Way
Nachos w/ Carne Asada
Elote (mexican corn on the cob)

PESCADO TACO was AMAZING! It beats Rubios fish taco ten times. We also order a carnita taco but it came out to be carne asada..that cost them half a star. The other half of the star was the nachos, it was nothing special and was ordinary. El Farlito has better nachos. It was plenitful though. Elote was decent, I've tasted better. The best elote I've had is at the swap meet where they roast the corn on the cob and then you can put mayo, chili, and lime. It was good and I don't crave this often. Maybe its because I live so close to El Farlito..
author: Jennifer D.

description:
BEST AND CHEAPEST TACOS IN THE BAY AREA. HANDS DOWN.
