I came here with my coworkers after a long day of work and it was the first time for most of us... We all could not get over mentioning how amazing this place was..

I love discovering places like this and Nicks Crispy Tacos was a rather pleasant discovery! 

If you must come here, go for happy hour! You can get two items off the menu for only 5 bucks! I got one delicious cheese quesadilla and 1 pork taco for only five bucks!

Best item on the menu: FISH TACO AND CHEESE QUESADILLA! Both to die for! And don't forget to order any taco "Nicks way" for delicious guacamole and crispness to it!

NICK's WAY ALL THE WAY! FAVORITE RESTAURANT IN THE CITY.
author: NC B.

description:
I'm drooling just thinking about this place!

oh lord, I found this place via yelp and experienced it first hand. DAMMNN... the fish and shrimp tacos are sooo YUM.

It's a bit pricier  than a regular taco because if you make it "Nick's Style" they add guac and a hard taco shell. Nice touch!

The sauce they have too, the green one? it's yummy. It get's a bit messy. So bring your antibacterial hand sanitizer because I don't know how clean that bathroom can be, since at night, it's a night club!
author: Tam T.

description:
Nick's may even be a place you take someone that claims to "not like mexican food". Not because it's not authentic, but because it breaks down expectations about how much flavour and crunch can be packed into a little Taco.

However, I have to say that the look of this place is very odd. It's mexican food served in a Rococo style lounge converted into a sports bar.

Anyway, I've been here a bunch of times and never had occasion to stray from the pescado or carnitas tacos. "Nick's way" shouldn't be a choice...you have to have it that way.
author: Brett G.

description: Great price, maybe the best tacos of the town?  And, you will simply love the gaudy decor - adds a certain something.
author: Jenn D.

description:
If you go on Taco Tuesday, show up around 6-ish. It starts getting PACKED around 6:30 (this could have been because of NBA finals, not sure). If you can, reserve a table. They're really good about reservations, we tried to pretend to be Blair, but they knew we were full of it and were very kind about having us move.

Get the fried fish tacos Nick's way. This is not a time to be healthy and watch your weight, this is a time to enjoy some gluttony! I ordered one fried fish, one shrimp and one carnitas. I can't say I was a fan of the carnitas or shrimp. I actually didn't like either of them much. But the fish taco was so delicious. Next time I go, that's all I am going to get. And I'm only getting two since they're pretty filling.

Drank the margaritas, those were pretty good, even though I'm not usually much of a margarita fan. I'm definitely paying for it today though.
author: Analisa S.

description:
Oh so yummy... why don't I live a block away anymore?

I stopped in for lunch today after not eating here in awhile since I no longer live in the neighborhood. It seems the tacos have actually gotten better than they used to be. They were always tasty but I recall thinking that they were stuffed rather skimpily in the past. Today they were bursting with fillings and tastiness. I ordered one fish taco and one chicken taco and was quite stuffed. 

My only complaint is that the staff never seems to have the time to regularly wipe down the seating areas during the lunchtime rush.

FYI, the decor comes from this place being a nightclub on Friday and Saturday nights (Rouge Nightclub). It is a little random, but I've always found it charming and quirky.
author: Dani D.

description:
Carnitas taco Nick's way - so tasty. The sauces are amazing compliment as well. I've had the other tacos on the menu, but nothing compares to their carnitas.

This place is really a self service place. So don't expect any pampering.
author: Cindy W.

description:
So I went for a great taco and got two!  Ate them both and watched a warriors game too, but the downside is that I had to pay full price on Taco Tuesday.  Correct me if I'm wrong, but you should never pay full price for a taco on Tuesday.  It's just common sense. 

The atmosphere of the joint is crowded and uncomfortable, with a side of yuppy I just couldn't shake off.  It's full of those anxious up and comers who aren't quite relaxed enough to enjoy a taco.  

The service took an hour to get to, but the tacos came quickly with a sweet mexican smile.  

Bottom-line?  Underdog's in the Richmond district has the same great tacos minus the huge crowd and the annoying yups...
author: Nick M.

description:
This place is a solid 4 stars.

I've been here 4 times already and their Fish Tacos (Nick's Way) is absolutely the bomb.

Also on the menu is the Fish Burrito, but unfortunately the same fish used in the Tacos are much soggier since it's wrapped up.

I suggest that customers eat the Burrito fast so you don't have a poor experience.

CASH ONLY
author: Eric A.

description:
Nick's Crispy Tacos, a favorite of the locals, is a casual Mexican joint that looks pretty dingy. More likely than not, you  will have to fight for a table especially on Taco Tuesdays.

We started off with the Nachos. The thick crispy greasy nacho chips with the guac and salsa was so addictive. I couldn't stop eating them! When my Carne Asada Taco came, I was happy to dig in. I'm not skilled in the art of eating taco (I'm more of a burrito girl) and accidentally dropped food here and there. My boyfriend helped me order it "Nick's Way," which is $1.00 extra but you get the works (guacamole, salsa fresca) on top of your meat. It's definitely worth the $1.00. It's definitely A-OK! But I don't think it's anything I'd crave to go back to.
author: Thy L.

description:
The tacos are so-so, big, and sloppy.  The guy behind the counter was drinking a liter of pedia-lite on ice...  

They have a weird set up being a club by night, and a taco joint by day - it's like having Mexican for lunch in a cave with streaked mirrors and cheesy chandeliers.  We first sat on a torn vinyl sofa at a table that was much too high for the seating arrangements.  The tables and bathrooms were not clean, and the service was slow.
author: Erica K.

description: $2 tacos on Taco Tuesday! Sweet deal :) and join LevelUp for more discounts here. If you have a group make sure to book a table during busy times (Taco Tuesday or during big sporting events).
author: LB D.

description: Johnny Loves is what it used to be and now it is Nick's Crispy Tacos.  Funky kind of outside and lounge lizardee inside.  But if I had wanted to have a drink, watch a game and eat good Mexican food I would be loco not to go to NIck's.  Mexican food is tougher to find in SF than LA. One thing I appreciate is that they use whole pinto beans or black beans "frijoles de la olla".  I got the simmered chicken burrito but everyone said the Tacos were tasty and good (Duh...  Nick's crispy tacos), but I had a burrito craving/jones going on.  Next time I will order the fish tacos.  A few notes - Not cheap but good and no Chili Verde puerco (my quest to find the best Chili Verde)  ¡buen provecho
author: Toby N.

description: Love $2 Tuesday!! The steak taco was sooo good!! The only thing I didn't like was the tacos have beans on them, but they are very generous portions. The atmosphere was fun the music was good. I'll definitely go back!!
author: Dominique J.

description:
HOT CRISPY FISH WITH COOL CREAMY GUACAMOLE= HEAVEN IN A BITE!

We came here for the first time last night. I had been craving a crispy fish taco so my fiance decided to take and our 2 year old with us. MANNNN was it good! We did have to stand in a pretty intense line  to order but it was well worth it. 

We ordered 7 Pescado (fried fish) Tacos and 3 were Nicks Way for me! Come to find out it was waaay too much food for the 2 of us but we still ate it all. I had ordered a side of rice of beans for my son but he did not like it, i tryed it and the rice tasted alot like plastic..."wierd." But this was not worth knocking them off a star, because thier customer service was so great. They saw that we grabbed the 1st table available, and we were holding our son in our laps, until one waiter came to give us a high-chair, it was really nice of him to cater to us during such a BUSY BUSY time on a Friday. 

My Fiance grabbed a $5 beer from the adjacent bar and he was happy! I loved the tacos, they were filled to the max with hot crispy fish and cool creamy guacamole! YUMMMMM! definetley going back for more and more and more! ;-) 

REMEMBER CASH ONLY! I had to use the ATM there which costed me a $2.95 fee.
author: Daniella G.

description:
Nick's is a fun place but the food is mediocre flavor-wise so they're only getting two stingy stars from me. Points also lost for the lazy guacamole application, which makes the tacos impossible to eat without spilling all over the place. I wish they'd apply the stuff evenly before wrapping them up instead of smearing the unwrapped half of the taco with an excessive pile.

Meh.
author: Walker Y.

description:
Absolutely THE best tacos I have ever had. Crave this place whenever I'm within a 50 mile radius. Must have the carnitas taco nick's way. The seafoof burrito is pretty darn good as well.

Try both the green and red salsas. Also, get the chips and guac to share = super good.

Sitting next door at Rouge eating tacos watching football and drinking some beers...doesn't get much better.
author: Alex P.

description: Love this place...especially on Taco Tuesday!  Great atmosphere and good food!
author: Maayan C.

description:
Let me just say it's harder to find a table inside here than it is to find parking! If you're going to come with a group, it would be a good idea to make reservations! 

Other than that all you need to know are two things:
1. do it Nick's way
2. don't pass on the watermelon agua fresca

TIP: beers are also 2 for $5 on taco tues!
author: Kristen C.

description:
Damn good tacos! I was driving through the Broadway tunnel and totally happened upon this place. I meant to go here but then I saw the cross street and I knew. 

The place is combined with some random bar-place, but it has it's own door. Their menu is pretty expansive and ranges from tacos to burritos to quesadillas. I got the Pescado (fried fish) and Carne Asade tacos while my friend got the Carnitas quesadilla and something else deelishis. All were "Nick's Way"

That extra .95 cents was totally worth it. The fried crispy outside, the warm, gooey, melty, flavorly inside was divine. I don't know what they're doing, but it's awesome. All of the meat and fish was so flavorful. It doesn't make sense. The only complaint is that I wish they gave me more, but I guess that's just too American of me :( I need to go back again and get more food......!
author: Dustin H.

description:
Tasty tasty!  

Go here for great tacos and burritos at lunchtime.  Super filling and yummy.   Go early if you want to avoid a long line and crazy crowds because it becomes a nightclub later.  

I recommend a shredded chicken taco or a fish taco.  

Yummo!
author: Robert M.

description:
Came here for Taco Tuesdays yesterday. It was packed, of course, and the ambience was very lively. Even though it was packed with people, 

We ordered four carne asada's with two being Nick's Way (includes guacamole), chips and salsa, and two margarita's. When we got out order, we were surprised at how large they were! They literally packed them with beans, meat, tomatoes, and onions. Man, oh, man were we ready to just dig in!

Unfortunately, Nick's Crispy Tacos should probably be called Nick's Ordinary Tacos, because they honestly were just ordinary tacos. What was weird was that the two Nick's Way carne asadas had chicken instead of beef in them, which made them really dry and stringy to eat. The beef carne asadas were already pretty dry and lacked much flavor. There really wasn't anything too special about them, except for the fact that the line was incredibly long. Nevertheless, for $2 each, they were decent tacos, but there really wasn't anything spectacular about them, unfortunately.

For $2 each, yeah, it's a really good deal for dinner, but I would recommend coming here with a large group of friends to make the wait and drinking worth it.
author: Jason T.

description:
Some delicious tacos this guy Nick makes...
Taco Tuesday is where it's at! 
Be ready tho, might have to fight someone for a table...
author: Joey F.

description:
Get the tacos, stay for the quesedilla. At least that is what we did rainy yesterday. I got two tacos which were yummy. But I was extra hungry so I got the carnitas quesedilla as well. Took it home and it was snack, dinner, and bed time food all in one. 

Thanks Nick. 

FYI: Cash only. Nick doesn't mess around with credit/debit cards.
author: Heather O.

description:
NIck's is part sports bar, part taqueria, part dance club. Whatever it is, it just works. Its great. 

As for the food, the tacos are very good; the black bean salad is excellent; the quesadilla is good (and they have wheat tortilla, a nice plus); the burritos are meh. They have an awesome Taco Tuesday deal and Fridays they have a two taco deal for $5; on both days, the place gets packed! Prices in general are very reasonable. Overall, Nick's is a great spot.

Update: bumping it to 5 stars since the Veggie Taco (no oil) is the best veggie taco in San Francisco. Its a little pricey at 3 bucks, but it is so, so excellent!
author: Rick P.

description: Stopped by after overhearing some girls talk about their taco's.  By far the best fish taco I have ever eaten.  The carnitas was amazing as well.  This will forever be a stop when visiting the city.
author: Billy F.

description:
Good food and really good carnitas tacos.  They keep raising their prices slightly over the years, but still good if you are in the neighborhood.   
Any more expensive and I'd say they are overpriced.
author: Jason E.

description:
Ok, If I could give Nick's Tacos (for the Tuesday special) 3.5 stars I would, but I'm going to round up and give it a clean 4. whole numbers FTW.

Pro's: delicious veg tacos. I haven't had chicken here, and I've heard the fish is phenomenal. But extra love to Nick, who charged only $2 for mind blowing $2 veg tacos, fully loaded with beans, lettuce, guac, etc. Totally feasible and one fills me up plenty (though I rarely stop there). I also dig the margaritas. Wish they went lighter on the ice (come on, guys) and gave them a little more the tequila, but I don't mind it much.

Cons: Lack of seating of course, but after a few visits you get used to standing and playing the waiting game. 'Tis a hard game to master, but once you find a table you're golden. Also, downside - you cant order to-go! I hope they change this soon!
author: Tejal D.

description: Best tacos in San Francisco! I've actually spotted tacos 'Nick's Style' at a few other restaurants, they're so tasty. Basically they melt cheese on a crispy taco shell that's wrapped in a soft taco and load the meat and pico de gallo and guac. It's delicious! Cash only, but there's an ATM for the unlucky few. I definitely stay away from Nick's on Taco Tuesday because it's packed like crazy, as in line out the door wrapped around the block. I mean it's definitely a great deal, I'm just not one for crowded restaurants. I highly recommend the nachos, which are delicious because they use the brilliant fake-nacho cheese cheese, as opposed to just melting cheese on it. So good! The tacos are fantastic, as well. Whenever I have friends come visit me Nick's is always a must on the list.
author: Laurelle H.

description:
Go for a taco! I can't say I've tried anything else on the menu, but "Nick's Way" is a must. Hefty portions of guacamole, which is ALWAYS a plus, fresh pico de gallo which isn't overpowered by onions and cilantro, and plump, juicy, succulent meat. Very tasty!! It was considerably filling, and the tacos don't give you the lardy or regretful feeling you sometimes get after eating questionable Mexican food. They're good, but  I can easily scarf down two. For them, that's a good thing, but I've already racked up over $7 in tacos.

My boyfriend ordered a burrito, but felt it was lacking a good deal of rice. Hoped it would come with tortilla chips, also.

Tacos, reggae music, red velvet upholstery, sparkled chandeliers. Definitely not your typical taco joint.
author: Chelsea P.

description:
These tacos here be singing that crispy song "so crispy, I'm so crispy..." cuz they be deep fried, hard. So after all the hype about their tacos, it is pretty much just a regular hard taco at the end of the day. They have various meats and toppings but nothing unique or memorable. Prices are good but got to keep in mind these are tiny tacos and you might need 5 to make a meal. The best one is the fried fish which was crispy on crispy all around.

I think eating tacos at Rouge was a little weird given the night club setting (piss-poor nightclub) but that's just me.
author: Ed L.

description:
I've been here multiple times for Taco Tuesday. Their drink specials are great on Tuesday, and given the fact that my favorite beers are mexican beers, I'm a happy girl on Tuesdays at Nick's. To order tacos, you have to wait in line at the counter in the back. The line is a mile long on Tuesdays as the tacos are only $2. Add a dollar for Nick's Way (crispier taco and includes guac). I do recommend Nick's Way, I think it tastes way better. However, $3 for one taco is not that great of a deal. And think of how pricey it is when it's not Tuesday... probably not worth it if you go any other day.

The atmosphere is kind of hilarious in my opinion. Tacky chandeliers and disco-ball material on pillars. Very random for what the place actually is-- a taco bar. But this place turns into a club like atmosphere probably once or twice a week. I've actually been, and it's fun. Most of the people that come here seem pretty cool, it's definitely easy to meet people and have great conversations.

I recommend this place for Tuesdays, but I probably won't be coming in any other day.
author: Ashley D.

description:
get the fish tacos or the shrimp tacos, and get it nicks way. Be prepared to drop $7/taco. 

these are not your average tacos you find for $2 in the mission, these are like tex-mex premium tacos that are big and filling.

pros: nicks way style tacos, get something in seafood (fish, shrimp), you can get carne asada somewhere else

cons: price... after adding $1.XX to a $5 taco you are paying nearly $7 a taco and you need 2 to get full so be prepared to spend money, this isn't your run of the mill taco joint you may be used to be going to in the mission.
author: Noah P.

description:
Shrimp taco, Nicks' style = 4/5
Fish taco, Nick's style = 5/5
Margarita (Rouge) = 3/5
Atmosphere = 5/5

Love it. Would go back any day! Bring on the tacos and margaritas!
author: Jodie B.

description:
This review is mainly for their pico de gallo. It is by far the BEST in SF. The rest of the fare is fair. But for $1.25 the pico de gallo and chips is not only an excellent app but probably the best value in the Bay. 

Bonus nachos amigos!
author: Alan S.

description:
We had a really good basket of fresh chips and salsa.  

The Fish Taco was scrumptious.  I had a Chicken Burrito that was really good too.  The chandeliers are trippy.     This place becomes the "Rouge" at night.  I haven't been to the club at night so I wouldn't know :)

Taco's are definitely yummy though.
author: Ben B.

description: Love this place !! is so fun and different form other taco places... Bring cash , no credit cards....Salsas are good , hard to find parking at night. Muy RICO !!
author: Katia C.

description: i love taco tuesday's here. The crowd is fun the food is good. It is more of a social scene as opposed to going just for the food. If you call ahead you can reserve a booth/table that way you get a spot to sit at. The margaritas are okayyyyy, but the waiters/ bar tenders are friendly. Very generous on the guac!
author: Maxine S.

description:
Having lived in SoCal for a while, I have gotten very use to eating Mexican food at least twice a week in spite of its high fat content and food-coma induction. And naturally, during our 3-night, 4 days trip to San Francisco, my boyfriend and I were craving for some Mexican food one gloomy afternoon. 

So we found Nick's Crispy Tacos. Before stepping into the restaurant, we thought it would be one of those tiny taco joints by the beaches in San Diego. But we were wrong. SO WRONG. This place looks like a decked out clubbing venue with at least (I counted) 23 chandeliers in various sizes. And there were these giant hemisphere red couches just like VIP booths at hotels. This is definitely something different from other mexican places I've been to. Very hip (Do people say "hip" anymore?) and trendy, although I don't understand the cheap looking steel tables and chairs scattered around the floor. 

We didn't know about Nick's way, but the cashier seemed to added it automatically. I had the crispy fish burrito and boyfriend had crispy fish tacos and carnitas tacos. 

The food was good and in generous size. Every bite I took into the fish burrito was a mouthful of lettuce, crispy-fried fish and sauce. It certainly satisfied my craving. I tried the carnitas one too and it was pretty good. But I'd recommend the burrito more since it's a better value and it's essentially the same thing. I still wonder why the tacos were that expensive, considering that the burrito is much bigger but just a buck or two more than what it costs to get a taco. 

We gotta give credits to the novelty of Nick's Crispy Tacos. 

What do people crave when they're wasted?! Mexican food, duh.
author: Jenn H.

description: The pescado burrito rocks! Fried fish fillets, cabbage slaw, red onions. Excellent. 2 for $5 @5pm on Fridays also a great deal, I got the chips & salsa and nachos. Love their red salsa.
author: Saunders C.

description:
order: carne asada taco
veg: nothing really

it's overpriced. like 3x. the crispy-ness of the taco is worth the first taco, perhaps, but it's not particularly better than taco bell's double decker taco... and for 4-6 dollars a pop, it's not even that good. it's generally a fun hangout place if you want to drink/kick it with live music, but definitely don't come for the food. if you do though, get it "nick's way"
author: Niket B.

description:
The taco nick's way is decent, I've never had a fried taco before but it didn't disappoint. 

DO NOT, I REPEAT DO NOT order the regular tacos. Its the special they boast at $2 for taco tuesdays but it is the driest most unflavorful taco you will ever get. Expect to fork over the extra dollar per taco to get nick's way or else be prepared to Michael Jordan your food into the nearest trash can.

The lines are absurd for Tuesdays and since the place is also Rouge (nightclub) good luck finding seating. Parking is difficult since there is not parking dedicated to the place itself (welcome to San Francisco right?)
author: Ken P.

description:
Pretty tasty fish taco. Make sure to get it Nick's style and get the fish crispy too.

Three of those for $20 is rather steep, but not with the deal given on yelp just recently ;)
author: Timothy L.

description:
Nick,

Dam you make a good crispy taco.
You only accept cash because.... who knows why you only accept cash only, but the fact of the matter is you can; dam you make a good crispy taco.
Tuesday are especially the best times to enjoy your mariachi of Mexican ingredients; taco Tuesdays hold a special place in my heart.

Don't ever change; unless you get cheaper.

Mexican Food Fan
author: Po L.

description:
Nick's is the place to be on a tuesday evening. Me and 13 of my friends were here last night having a blast.

I use to eat their other tacos such as the carne asada, or chicken, or etc for $2 on tuesday, but after eating the famous Crispy fish taco, i couldn't let myself eat the other ones. i always order 2 fried fish tacos and i would be full. 

The crowd here is crazy, $2.50 beers and $3 patron shot will bring any party animal into this place. Everytime i come here on a tuesday, the line is wrapped around the restaurant.  Although that is a bad thing, there are bartenders that walk around and serve you your alcohol as you wait. You can also shake your ass while you wait too because there is live DJ every Tuesday.

1 star for the fish tacos
1 star for the live DJ
1 star for the cheap alcohol
1 star for great vibe.
-1 star for being too packed.

add that up and you get 4 stars!
author: David T.

description:
If you're going to Nick's definitely order the Pescado Taco Nick's Way.  It's delicious!  I'm not a taco connoisseur, but eating at Nick's really makes me want to be! The Pescado Taco Nick's Way was perfect, especially that guacamole on top-- MMmMmM.  It's not too overpowering and it gives everything a creamy, delicious texture.  The carne asada is also good, too.  According to the wait staff, the pescado and the carne asada are the two best sellers of the restaurant.

Like the other reviewers say, the fried fish is perfect.  The batter isn't sopping wet from the oil and the fried fish comes out perfectly crunchy on the outside and warm and buttery delicious on the inside.

The restaurant is quite big.  You can order to go at the bar (super friendly staff), and the restaurant itself has a sit-down area that's really big with booths and tables. 

My friends also ordered the fish tacos, but for some reason, they didn't seem very impressed.  It wasn't stellar for them.  I guess to each his/her own.

The hot sauce is great-- I've never had it that hot, and usually you have to ask for it because it's not always on the table in a little red tube.
author: Sunny S.

description:
The tacos are as good (actually, fantastic) as ever but I'm bitter that Nick got screwed.  Check out Underdog in the Sunset for the real Nick's.

http://www.misterarcher.com/san-francisco/2009/11/nick-fasanella-interview/
author: David C.

description:
I usually tend to find authentic flavor mexican restaurant, not anything like chipotle however I still eat them anyways. To get to the point this place rocks, I love the interior and the food AsadaTaco and Chicken Quesadilla both with quacamole and sour cream it was awesome. 

Price was decent, I was able to find the 10th anniversary combos for $5 after I ate.
author: Daniel H.

description: I go to San Diego sandbar for fish tacos and looking for a substitute.  At nicks the tacos were nice enough but there nachos were the worst that I have ever had.  The chips were just HORRIBLE. Thick and tasteless had no seasoning.
author: She L.

description:
So it's currently 12:45 am, and like most people, I have to work tomorrow, but couldn't sleep. I was reflecting back on my weekend and was thinking about the food I ate and remembered that I had Nick's Crispy Tacos on Saturday night--and decided to yelp it!

We entered and I asked "'what is this a dirty strip club in the evening? I apparently forgot to bring my 1 dollar bills" The walls, floors, and seats were red (duct tape covered the tears in the booth seats), and there were a few chandeliers hanging above. Whatever. I'm reviewing the food, not the decor, so I digress. 

We went to the counter and ordered. The only complaint I have is they need to chop chop on the craft of order taking. We waited forever to order from a guy that looked like he was from the 1970s with long, birdsnest-esque hair and a headband...and the line wasn't even that long to begin with. Isn't there such thing as opening another register?

I ordered 2 tacos: one pollo asado and one carne asada--both Nick's Way. This was my first time here, so I had no clue what that meant, except the best way my friend could describe it was "Remember those amazing gorditas from Taco bell? the one with a soft taco wrapping a crunchy one? Kinda like that..." And she was correct. The tacos were STUFFED with beans, cheese, guac and meat. Pretty generous with the portions--well it better be for $3.50 per taco with an additional $1 to have it Nick's Way. It's ok. I don't mind spending money when it's freaking delicious.  

Also ordered the nachos--standard nachos, but they were so good. The chips weren't those thin bull-shit Tostito chips from Safeway. They were thick, slightly greasy, and had an amazing crunch to them. Pile on the guacamole, sour cream, salsa, and cheese and that chip won't fall apart. BIG DEAL. 

This isn't the best Mexican place ever--being that I lived in San Diego for 4 years, so I know what a good dirty taco tastes like, but it's pretty solid. I want to go back and try their other items on the menu--quesadillas, burritos, etc, but I don't mind eating those tacos again--everyday. Yum
author: Victoria B.

description: Taco Tuesday! $2 tacos, quesadilla, and chips and salsa and guacamole. Great deal, and fun atmosphere. Almost a sports bar/club hybrid. I'm not sure what it wants to be, and maybe it's a teenager that hasn't fully grown up, but it's also charming and fun in the same way a teenager is.
author: R G.

description: So, so, SOOOOO good. Fish tacos are some of the best I've had and the nachos are to die for. Definitely a must try.
author: Roxanne R.

description: Wow.  It was sort of sad to compare this visit with my last one.  The double hulled tacos were cold, the crispy part was over-fried, and there was so much cabbage that the important toppings with the flavor were falling out all over the place.
author: Julie T.

description:
No salsa bar and fake cheese. I think a better name would be "Nick's Crappy Tacos". With a name like "Nick" they don't even try to sound Mexican and really this is place is by and for gringos.

This is more of a sports bar. Not about healthy food.
author: Garrett S.

description: So good, so consistently good. I love "Nick's way" of doing tacos. This place is definitely not gourmet, but totally down to earth grub that is perfect for lunch or late night food. The churros are also awesome.
author: Kathryn M.

description:
Got free chips and salsa from my Yelp check-in!

I ordered the black bean and roasted corn salad. It was pretty good, but there were hardly any beans or corn kernels. It was pretty much a cabbage salad with lots of crispy crunchy tortilla strips. I will definitely come here again, but I may ask for light on the tortilla strips.
author: Tina H.

description: Where do I begin?? I've been wanting to come here forever and a day! I finally made it and wasn't disappointed. I only ordered 2 tacos and was actually full. You can pick if you want it crispy or soft and I got the crispy chicken taco, and the soft pescado (fish) taco. I liked both but the pescado is the one! Next time ill just get fish tacos, love the perfect blend of the fried fish, cabbage, and tortilla.  Skip the horchata, it's quite powdery. We didn't like it so the waitress let us switch it out for the watermelon (agua fresca) and it super refreshing. The only downsides to this spot is the seating is limited, it's super crowded and the bar is adjacent so it's loud and almost rowdy. Nevertheless we ate quickly and left since its not really our scene but it was still worth it. 5 stars for the
author: Brandi W.

description: This place not only has great happy hour, but it's so f'in fun!!!  Being in my 20's, I love coming here to see people my age, eating tacos, drinking bear, and getting rowdy!  The tacos are cheap and surprisingly filling, and the best one to get is the carne asada taco.  I usually eat a lot, but I had 2 of those with some chips and salsa and a beer and I was beyond full.  The tacos are literally HUGE, not your average taco from the Mexican taco truck taco.  Plus, our waiter was extremely helpful and awesome, and he actually brought out two rounds of shots for everybody at our table...which was about 6 of us.  Apparently this place turns into a club or lounge at night?  I have yet to come for that still.
author: Liz W.

description:
Grilled Fish Tacos are yummy and healthy..loaded with guac and sourcream--not so healthy..but soooo worth it.
You can't go there without order the guac...

9/14 Went there again tonight..yes..only two days later...and discovered that they have the best HH in town. $2 well drinks..Basket of tacos (carne asada, pollo, pescado) for $9.95...chips and guaco for $2
Best part--running into one of my favorite fella yelpers Miriam :-)
author: Mimi T.

description: This is by far my favorite place in SF to watch my Giants and the Warriors!!! Of course, the tacos are to die for!!!
author: Ramneek S.

description:
This is a great place to get a quick, cheap lunch or dinner and it's really child friendly, which i love. 
The kids can sit in a highchair and listen to reggae and check out the mirrors and disco balls. 
The staff are super tolerant and accommodating. The food is delicious.
author: B H.

description:
Okay, I love me some tacos. L-O-V-E Tacos! I have been on the search for the best mexican food in SF. Or at least the best tacos. Gordos comes close, but its their burritos I love so much. 
I digress. 

Nick's tacos while delicious are extremely overpriced. And to have them "Nick's way" is even more of a rip off. Their fish tacos are a crunchy sauce-slathered delicious mess, tho. 
For two people, the bill almost always comes out to $35 to $40. Really?!?! For tacos?!?!?! 
Sigh. 
Must resist the draining the wallet for such deliousity!!! 

P.S. Their taco salad is reasonable priced and is loaded with veggies!!!
author: joanna r.

description: Sunday brunch $10 bottomless mimosas I'll be back for you...
author: Aaron H.

description: Hit the spot but nothing to write home about. I got fish tacos and the grilled fish was cooked nicely and had a light texture. The interior was fun and different from what you'd expect from a casual taco joint.
author: Steph B.

description: Have been here just a couple of times for chips and salsa / guac / one taco...great value, very fresh and delicious.
author: Sean S.

description: First time at nick's, tried the pescado. Yummy fried fish with all the fixins', loved the double taco shell concept. The chips were served with an excellent pico de gallo loaded with ripe!!! Tasty tomatoes. We chatted with the owner and he was ever so friendly and glad to hear we liked the food. Told us an awning for the outside tables was on the way.Good, cuz we always eat outside with our dog meebo and we will return! Great taco at a great price.oh, and the salsas were spicy and so tasty.
author: Kelly K.

description:
Pescado Taco Nick's Way is pretty much all you'll ever need in life.  but unfortunately it isn't a part of their Taco Tuesday menu, so you're still stuck paying almost 5 dollars for one slab of fried fish wrapped in a crunch/soft taco.

And timing is key.  get there too early, and you're not hungry enough for their massive tacos.  Get there too late, and you're stuck in line for hours.

But even if you dont get pescado, do yourself a favor and pay that extra dollar for Nick's way.  You'll thank me
author: Eric C.

description:
People who think these tacos are good have never had real mexican food. I'm talking taco truck in front of a construction site with shaved pork, hot peppers, pineapple and a radish to cool your mouth down. Southern California, Colorado, and Arizona are places for real mexican. These tacos are around $4-5 if you get them Nick's way and are a fancier version of a taco... but really they're just smothered with guacamole. 

Plus the service is terrrrrible! I went in with a few of my best friends visiting from Boulder... and a bartender asked us if we wanted a drink while waiting in line and we ordered margs... then this guy demanded to see our id's and we told him we already bought our margs and were waiting then he yelled at us threatened to kick us out and told us that "frankly, you bitches look like you're in high school." i almost smacked the shit out of him. and it turns out he was the manager and wouldn't apologize for treating us like shit. Terrible rude service, and mediocre food equals 1 star
author: Annette K.

description: Seen a lot of friends trying this place so I had to check it out. Girlfriend got the fish tacos nicks way and I got the carnitas nicks way. Both were very good. The green sauce they have in the bottles was my favorite.
author: Andy T.

description:
If you don't think there is inflation, then you haven't been to Ike's or Nick's.

Man - so the tacos are "good". But you can bet your a$% that I will NEVER pay 11 dollars for 2 tacos with guac and pico. 

Are you kidding me?

Sure, there is a decent discount on Tuesday's, but I'm not going to fight the crowds. Still a great place to grab a drink and a bite with friends, but I stick to my burritos now.
author: David N.

description:
Good, but definately a hybrid Mexican. I definately think there are particular things that are way better than others here, but the pricing was pretty good, things are filling and fresh, the guacamole is good.

I love the restaurant itself, it's got a great vibe and awesome space and the staff was very helpful. I'd definately come back here, and, possibly, would make a special cab-trip from within SF to get here again.
author: Caroline C.

description: I love this place. Yes, the decor is really bad. But the food is great. And it's a fairly inexpensive meal. There was a point where I got into a routine of going once a week. I crave the chips and salsa if I don't go for a while and the elote is so yummy. I'm so glad I only live a few blocks away. It is definitely my favorite default place when I'm looking for a quick, cheap meal. I have to admit, I've never been there on Taco Tuesdays though. I'd rather have to pay the extra dollar and not deal with the fraternity shitshow.
author: Kerry K.

description:
Although maybe the best tacos I've had in San Francisco, it doesn't match up to the fish tacos down at Ocean Beach in the San Diego area.  But at the same time, how can you complain when you go on Taco Tuesdays and get $2 tacos: carnitas, pollo asado, carne asada, and grilled chicken.  I was a bit disappointed because my tacos weren't crispy and I then realized I should have asked them to make it crispy!!!!  Arrrgghhh...gotta go back again sometime after work....

Get there early on Tuesdays because I got there about 5:45PM and every table was almost filled with a long line almost going to the door.
author: Albie F.

description:
Mmm, mmm, mmm, mm-hmm!!  (expressed like Tyler Perry's Madea)

Arrived with a party of 10 and we had spacious eating room.  The decor was fun and the menu options were numerous!!

Even tho' I only had chicken nachos, I was quite surprised at the deliciousness!  The chicken had an exquisite flavor with Real cheese.  I was sooo full but wanted to keep the taste-bud party going!

Great spot for groups, first date or steady, friends/fam from outta town, grab-n-go, grandparents, co-workers, or even solo grubbing.
author: McCracken C.

description:
I had no idea this place was here! I have been to the night club this turns into after 10pm a few times! 

To say the least I was glad I came early this past weekend! 
When standing in line i was a bit skeptic for 3$ a taco, but i was wishing i bought three after eating the first two. 

I was there from about 8:30-9:30 to eat and it was packed and lined stayed long, but the cashier was very fast and friendly. 
The staff was quick about cleaning tables and refilling salsa. 

Great ambiance and good times! 
Tacos were great and I was not disappointed at all. Free refills for soda which is also a plus! The full bar is also real nice if your wanting anything else. 

The only draw back was the cash only rule. It didn't effect me personally, but I'm sure and inconvenience to people there for the first time.
author: Derek S.

description:
This place has been one of my all time favorite foods in all of San Francisco.  Do you like tacos?  Do you like crispy tacos?  Do you like being able to refresh yourself with beverages (depending on whether or not you are 21) while waiting in a long line that makes the food taste even sweeter when you finally get it?  YOU WILL LOVE NICK's then.

Of course, there is the happy hour on Tuesdays, that essentially makes every taco get a free Nick's way, which you have to get otherwise you hate yourself.  Advice: don't hate yourself.  However, after going there a few times, I would have to recommend not going because it is a bit too wait of a line and there is just never any seats.

A friend and I got the Yelp deal that was on a few months ago that allowed for $20 worth of Nick's for $10.  That's just a steal.  We just robbed them and I don't think that they even knew it.  We used that coupon to get the Fish (a monster that is misled as a taco), carnitas, and steak.  You have to try all of these for a variety and then ask yourself: How many tacos can I eat in one sitting?

The most I have done is 4.  I have heard rumors of five being done, but those are rumors... If you guys go after reading the review and accept this challenge, let me know how many you do!
author: Min P.

description:
Hands down, zee best Crispy Fish Tacos I've ever had.

Tip: You've got to have "Nick's Way" or you won't be able to fathom how awesomely amazing these Crispy Fish Tacos are.

P.S: Grab hella' napkins, it's going to get messy. (Fantasies) Lol.
author: Valerie N.

description:
Nick's Way?  Nick's Way???  You put guacamole and sour cream on a taco, and have the balls not just to charge for that, but to pretend like y'all though it up yourselves?!  Outrageous.  Angering, even.

The tacos are overpriced, they charge a billion dollars extra for basic things like guacamole and sour cream (aforementioned "Nick's Way"), and the tacos are really only on the plus side of mediocre flavour.

Because of the extra charges for guac and sour cream, the Taco Tuesday deal isn't really a deal at all.  Nor is it worth waiting 45 minutes in line.  Oh, this place is cash only and the ATM outside is frequently out of order.

Hell, even the (men's) bathroom is uncomfortable because there's that mint and handtowels guy looking for tips for offering you mints you don't want, and handtowels that you would rather grab yourself.  When's the last time HE washed HIS hands?

The only plus to Nick's is the bar.  The bald guy is super friendly and takes great care of you, and one of the female bartenders looks like Eva Mendes.  They have good happy hour prices too.

If there were a single other establishment in Russian Hill selling tacos, we wouldn't have to suffer this artificial hype for Nick's.

For $1 tacos that blow Nick's tacos out of the water in terms of taste, and don't charge extra for basic condiments, go to Taco Tuesday at the Blue Light Cafe.
author: Dmytro A.

description: Tacos are just alright.  There are better tacos in the Mission and the space is just weird.
author: Michelle H.

description:
I tried this place due to the Yelp traffic and decided to take my family for a lunch meal.  It was pretty packed and it obviously looked like a day restaurant/night club due to all the furniture.  

The food was pretty pricey at this place.  I don't remember paying this much for Mexican food but then I live in San Diego so.... My favorite taco had to be the fish taco.  Their sizes are pretty filling but this is definitely not authentic Mexican tacos like the ones you try in the street trucks in LA.  The nachos had way too much cheese which converted 50% nachos in wet cheesy tortillas.  The carne asada quesadilla was muy deliciosa!
author: Camilo G.

description:
By far one of my favorite places to eat in SF! While my boyfriend went to USF, he'd always pick me up after school at the Art Institute, and Nick's Crispy  Tacos would be A FAVORITE  to hit up.

My lord the Salsa is fantastic. ALSO their avacado. While eatting, it tends to get a little messy, and if your just sitting on their "patio" furniture it gets kind of frustrating eatting on a small table. This place also tends to use up ALOT of napkins while eatting (LOL - and thats a good thing..?)

As for everything else. Tacky place. But Good food.
author: Tiffany M.

description:
LOWER YOUR PRICES ... SF Taco boutiques need to check themselves.

mind the prices, and try strawberry fresca and pescado (plain) tacos! the carnitas and carne asada is also very good. 

don't let them sell you the "nick's way" it'll cost you extra, and it never fails...they ALWAYS ask. 

i'm starting to see a theme here. 

oh, and bring cash (only), a lot of it. zing.
author: Bruce A.

description:
How can something named Nick's Crispy Tacos not be awesome?

Coming from 4yrs in San Diego, I'd like to think I have a eye for good Mexican inspired cuisine.  Let me tell you, these tacos are delicious.

The pescado taco has a perfect golden fried coating and the cool crunchy cabbage complements it well.  I refrained from getting it Nick's Style despite my implicit love for guacamole.

The carne asada taco comes pretty standard with plenty of meat.  Nick's style is a must here.

The Chips&Salsa + Guacamole is perfect for a 2-3 person party to supplement the tacos.  My only gripe would be how the salsa makes the chips soggy and I would probably request to have it on the side the next time I go.  However, the way they make guacamole produces a viscous creamy finish that I can't get enough of and will continue to come back for.

From one Nick to another, good job. :)

Note: Not a huge fan of the carnitas (a little dry) or the burritos (tacos are way better).  And yes, Taco Tuesdays are awesome granted you can find a seat and are willing to fight ridiculous crowds.
author: Nick W.

description: Holy fish tacos. Just try one bite and you'll be hooked. Get it Nick's way. Food coma.
author: Michael S.

description:
Nick's is off the hook! Tacos taste fresh, not dry at all. A little pricey for a taco, but one taco is really equal to 2 taco truck taco's. This place is actually the same place as Rouge night club, if you know where that's at. I'd definitely go back some time soon.

2 carnitas tacos (nicks way)
2 chicken tacos (nicks way)
1 nachos
-----------------
$25.
author: Monte R.

description:
My second visit to Nick's in less than a week:  Taco Tuesday.

Here's the lowdown:

* Taco Tuesday specials until 9PM
* $2 tacos:  carnitas, carne asada, pollo, and vegetarian
* $1 extra for "Nick's Way", ie. crispy with guacamole on top
* $2 cheese quesadillas
* $2 chips/salsa/guacamole
* $2 - $3 beers, margaritas, well drinks

* I'd advise to come with a group and split up upon arrival- you'll need one person to stand in the massive line to order, another to retrieve drinks at the bar, and one more to stalk tables for seating.  

* Super crowded, but it's a friendly, fun group.  Since every table was packed, we were standing around lost for a little while until a group of people offered us their table upon leaving.  Really nice of them!   

* And the tacos?  Both the carnitas and carne asada were nothing short of awesome.  And you can't beat a meal and a drink for $6.
author: Joanne G.

description:
1. Where have you been all my life? I love you.

2. Crispy tacos. Add steak, fish, or just veggie. Hell yes.

3. Make it "Nick's Way." Oh YEAH!

4. Margaritas. Check.

5. I don't care too much for the fact that it turns into a club later on. I just want to eat my tacos. Leave me be and I'll be all good.

Be back to eat more. Stay tuned.
author: Mel P.

description:
I'm so torn on how to rate this place. The tacos were good, got them Nick's way 4 carne and 2 al pastor tacos split between 3 people. They didn't rock my world but they were good. 3 stars just for that. I also got a quesadilla. 5 Stars just for the most amazing cheese quesadilla of my life! When I'm blue and feeling down I think about that quesadilla and cheer up again. Super thin tortilla with tons of cheese and fried in pig fat and magic or something close to that. Get it! $2 on tuesdays, best choice of my life. 
Now onto the service. This is the part that makes it hard to rate. My group walked in at 6 and unlike most people, you know who you are (and so do your bosses) we can't go online ahead of time to make reservations because we actually work for a living. So there were only 2 tables that people who just walked in could sit at IN AN EMPTY RESTAURANT because all the other tables were "reserved." We finally get a table because this mother and daughter dual, bless them, decide it's too late for them (daughter is like 6 and super cute) and leave the table for us. We now have a table WITH NO CHAIRS, which is another reason why they left. So we asked around at other tables for chairs and this brown haired waitress in all black comes over and starts scolding us like we were 5 for taking chairs away from the other table. Then she complains about it to another guy and he tells her it's fine and just gets more chairs from the back. First off, unless you're cutting my hair at a place charging me $100 per strand or working as a puppet master at some Japanese Kabuki theater, let's try to be a little more creative with what we wear. You're not a ninja and yes I still notice you trying to take away my half full plate that you clearly see me eating from. Second, if you have more chairs and you see tables without any, esp ones with little 5 year old girls out on a fun day with her mommy, GO GET THEM! This isn't the year 3000 where the world just blew up for the 5th time and now cheap metal chairs from Ikea are the new form of currency. Want to make the place standing room only? Get cocktail tables that are tall, not midget tables that rise 2 feet off the ground. 
Finally go to order our food now that the table situation is figured out and of course because of Ink Blot Sally the taco line is super long now. We finally get there and were greeted by the most wonderful man EVER. I want to put him in my packet and take him home! He would make the funniest sassiest comments as I ordered, go just for him and quesadillas. My friend couldn't decide between the cantaloupe or the watermelon juice so the man goes, Half and Half! and fills it with both halfway. Most amazing juice this year!
For those of you keeping track, we went +5 stars for food, -100000 stars for Ink Blot Sally and now +100003 stars for the funny, sassy man taking my money.
Then we get a visit from this other curly brown haired girl dressed in a long gypsy skirt, a brown cardigan and rainbow scarf, like she couldn't decide what she was going to wear today, so just a bit of everything to cover all her bases. Someone should have told her boho chic died a long time ago, along with her customer service skills. She clearly wanted to kick us out, for reasons we can't figure out. We'll go get drinks and she'll whisper something to the bartender every time, we'll finish a basket (they don't believe in plates) and she'll be right there to pick it up. Extremely rude, the bartender is a friend of someone in our group and was clearly upset with her, but now I want to stay for hours JUST to piss her off. 
The rest of our group comes after work a few hours later and I go out to meet them. I try to get back in the side door that I left through and this Mexican version of "The Situation" with less hair and less muscles tells me I need to wait in line at the front. You CLEARLY saw me sitting in front of your counter and you for the last three hours and then saw me leave through the door, so why would I have to go to the front when all I want is my stuff, 2 feet away. So I had to wait in line to get back in to get my stuff and the place's last saving grace was the photo man who had just taken our pic, sees me trying to get back in and lets me and the rest of my group in without trouble.

Long story short, 5 stars for food, but they need a new staff.
author: Brian J.

description:
I want to bathe in Nick's carne asada.  Huge, flavorful burrito for a little price.

Nick's was my first meal on my first night of my first trip to San Francisco and...well, it was a magical.  

From the outside, I thought Nick's was going to be a tiny hole in the wall, but upon entering I found myself in a huge, red room with plenty of comfy, lounge style seating with sparkly chandeliers hanging from the ceiling.

I will most certainly be back on my next visit.
author: Emily T.

description: Good stuff. Walked here with a friend the first night in SF. She lives a block away. Hard to find good fish tacos, everyone tries to put crazy spins on them.
author: Tiffany V.

description: Bad management and i can tell employee hates the restaurant. Food quality is getting worse and less meat/sea food portion  and i have been going to this place for almost 10 yrs.It changed a lot comparing to the old management.Sorry but i won`t go back since it is also getting pricey and unfriendly staff.
author: Wessan A.

description:
first off. i have NEVER EVER paid $11 for 2 tacos and a fountain coke before. but after the first two bites of my carne asada crispy taco, i knew why everyone raved about this place. mucho flavor and the soft corn tortilla outside of a crispy taco shell holding all that meaty and savory goodness. the second taco was a carnitas crispy taco and it was just as good. the real bonus here is the red sauce. if it's not crack cocaine, it's its second cousin. because it is so delicious and addictive. 
definitely not from a can or jar the red sauce was smoky, tasty, spicy all at once. i should read through some of the 1300 other reviews here and find out what is actually in it.
there's also a decent green hot sauce but i think i used half of the bottle at my table between two crispy tacos.
hmm hmm good!
author: Jeff W.

description:
This review is NOT for the food (every time I have stopped in for a taco it's excellent).  

Today I went to Nick's/Rouge for the Packers/49er game. I went to the bar to buy a pitcher of blue moon ($12)  and found a table where some guys were leaving. 

My friends and I enjoyed our space and our beer until the blonde cocktail waitress came up to us and tried to charge us all $10 each for drinking mimosas (there were empty carafes on the table we got). We told her that we bought the beer at the bar and she walked away. 

The bouncer then approached our table and tried to make us pay him $10 each 
"because the cocktail waitress told me, you were drinking out mimosas which are per person".

Needless to say I told him no (SINCE I PAID FOR MY BEER ALREADY) and he kicked us out. 

You're welcome for the $12.  Good luck with a business that kicks out paying customers.
author: Sarah H.

description:
I arrived here at 4:55pm last night (Tuesday) and it couldn't have been more perfect timing: 
3-5pm: $1 off tacos (which means my carnita taco "Nick's style" (add cheese and guac for an extra $.95) was only $3 and it was much bigger than expected and packed with meat)
5-7pm: some drink special (someone else was buying the pitchers of margaritas)
5:15pm: the place was packed and we were glad we secured a table (and a taco) early. 

I don't know if all those things transfer to other days but I know Tuesday is Taco Tuesday with some deals.  Nothing special about the venue or margaritas but, as the 3 stars denotes, it was certainly A-OK and is a great place for groups and being loud on a Tuesday night after work.
author: Luthien N.

description: You don't go to Nick's Crispy Tacos for the atmosphere because it looks and feels like someone has just moved out all the pinball machines and the walls hurt your eyes (I think someone told them that the color "red" makes people hungry?) You go to Nick's for take-out and the guacamole and seafood tacos are spot on and it's a great place to grab some great food to mop up the alcohol after a night out.
author: Jennifer O.

description:
taco tuesday definitely colored my experience, for the worse.  When I arrived at around 7, the line for ordering tacos was already snaked across Nick's/Rouge and out the door.  Which wouldn't be a terrible thing, only we never seemed to move....which may be true, as there was nothing delineating what was the line and what was just people hanging about.

After way too much time in that line, I finally order my chips+salsa+guac and carne asada taco, nick's way.  I get the chips immediately, which are a great deal for $2.  Heck, I would probably pay full price for them!  The chips were thick and had the satisfying crunch of a deep-fried tortilla.  The salsa was cool and refreshing, and the guac was smooth and creamy.

I have no idea how the staff is able to match up orders with the numbers we had.  There is barely any room to walk around in there, yet they somehow found us and gave us our tacos.  For $2 it was a pretty good and very filling taco, but I'm not sure it was worth the wait, nor do I think I would come again to buy at full price.
author: Cathy Y.

description:
After hearing so much about Nick's, my bf and I went to grab tacos on a Friday night.  Walked in and boy was it crowded.  The way this place works is that you order your food at the counter (cash only) and then find a seat.  What sucks is that if you go on at a busy time like we did, it might take a while to find a table.

We ordered 2 carne asada tacos, 1 pescado (fried) taco, and 1 shrimp (grilled)  taco, all Nick's way (guacamole and cheese for an extra 95 cents).  I thought we would be able to finish four, but the tacos were so big that we only ended up eating 3 and taking the 4th one home. I was practically full after the first.  The tacos itself were very tasty and they are very generous with the filling.  They seriously do load each taco up with the guacamole.  

We also got a side of chips with salsa and guacamole.  Loved that the chips were so crispy and they pour the salsa and guacamole all over them.

Happy hour was apparently still going on (8-12) and for $5, you an get a beer (draft) and a shot, or 2 beers if you preferred that. So worth it!  I guess that made up for the frustration of  having to look for a table earlier.
author: Alice C.

description:
This place has like a thousand million reviews but I at least have to toss my hat in the ring here.

Tacos.  Nicks style.  You wont need more than two.  Then go sit int he VIP booth for FREE... at one of the least exclusive clubs in all of San Francisco. Thats right...no cover or VIP charge and you get to eat some of the best tacos I have ever had...like a rock star.

(Personally I prefer to get escorted out of Shanghai Kelly's or Sasquatch).

Cash only.  Bring your friends.  The tacos really are amazing.
author: Andrew K.

description:
I think getting our tacos not done nick's way was a mistake because they weren't that great - the carne asada and carnitas was bland, but they didn't skimp on the portions. jalapeno poppers were good (although not as good as jack in the box according to the bf). 

overall i liked the atmosphere and the bar (2 coronas for $6!) and would come back if i were in the area and we got amazing parking like we did tonight. also completely forgot that this location is actually rouge.
author: Leily P.

description:
My favorite place to eat in the neighborhood! The tacos are delicious, especially the pescado taco. You have to order all the tacos "Nick's Way" -- with a crunchy shell on the outside and covered in guacamole. The only bad thing is that they're really expensive for tacos -- about $6 total for ONE pescado taco Nick's Way. It's still worth it though!

If you want lots of cheap, delicious tacos and don't mind waiting in a huge line, go to Nick's on Tuesdays for their "$2 Taco Tuesdays." All the tacos except those with fish are $2 if you eat in.

Nick's is also cash only, but they have an ATM inside.
author: Jackie C.

description:
Thank goodness I don't live too close to this place...  I was advised to have the tacos "Nick's way", so I have no idea what they're like otherwise.  But "Nick's way" is awesome - tons of yummy, delicious guac.  I got the chicken and the carne asada - really, why didn't I get the carnitas?  Next time...

I was a little surprised that they needed us to order by 9 because the kitchen was closing - I guess they must've had to close down for a bit to wait for the post-party crowd...?
author: Wendy L.

description:
Sorry Nick.  I'm just not that in to you.

Having eaten at a couple dozen taquerias in SF, I cannot recommend Nick's above just about any place in the Mission.  It's probably one of the best you'll find in Russian Hill area.

Speaking of which, Nick's would be a good choice for folks bar hopping along polk gulch.  This place is one of the only taquerias that has a full bar in the same location.

If you would like to eat rather pricey, good tasting tacos in a nightclub-with-the-lights-on, Nick's Crispy Tacos is for you.
author: Christopher K.

description:
I practically live at this place - I'm there a few times a week and it's the first place I go whenever I get back to SF from traveling.  

If you've never been before - the line can be long but it moves fast so don't be intimidated.  Everything on the board is good, but above all others I would have to recommend the Pescado Taco Nicks Way.  Even if you're not typically one that goes for the fish tacos - this is different (trust me).  And don't forget to get it Nicks Way - that's important.
author: Tim A.

description:
I like coming just for the fish tacos during odd hours.  Get it fried and Nick's style (go big or go home!) for the full experience.

Taco Tuesdays is fun, but the fish taco doesn't apply to the happy hour discount unfortunately, and let's be honest, that's why you're there.  Also, it can get crowded right after work, so unless you're in the mood to mingle, wait 10+ minutes for your tacos, and eat standing up (unless you're lucky and happen to get a table), I'd go in the off hours.
author: John H.

description: First and foremost... this place is cash only. After being told that there is no place at another restaurant, we looked at our trusty Yelp App, and found out that Nick's Crispy Tacos wasn't too far away. So we decided to try it. It is inside a night club, I think the name was Rouge, but I'm not very sure. We walked in and went up to the Nick's and looked at the menu. Then we ordered and found a place to sit, while my husband went to the bar and got us drinks. I ordered a Elote, which came much after the tacos, I think they had forgotten it, and a Pollo Asado, Nick's way. My husband ordered the Carne Asada and the Pescado, both regular. His fish taco was the best out of all of them, but the other two weren't very far behind. I really liked the addition of the Guacamole and cheese to the tacos. I'd do that to all of them if I could. After about 9:30 however, the lounge started putting away tables to make more standing/ dancing room, and they came up to us and asked us to please vacate the area we were sitting in, as it was about to become the VIP section of the lounge. Luckily, we were almost done, so we finished up and left.  Nick's Crispy Tacos are great. But I wish they had a better location, a restaurant style place where we could sit and eat without being hussled.
author: Natasha P.

description: I didn't think this place could get any awesomer until the employees moved the tables out of the way at 9pm and turned the place into a club! I was eating nachos and dancing with a hot chick on rollerskates by 9:10. Heavenly!
author: Kevin K.

description:
This place is pretty good. But I'm bias to fried food. Just can't seem to get enough of anything fried! (Guilty pleasure I guess) The portions are good, the flavors is there, and the texture is definitely a plus. Although, the prices might be a bit high in terms of taco value, it's not really anything I could complain about. However, I have heard that they do have 2$ tacos on Tuesdays from other people that frequent Nick's on a more regular basis. On that note, they've also mentioned that on Tuesdays, it's extremely packed because of all the college students that want a good meal on a budget. 

One thing to watch out for is the seating, since it's a club at night, I would say that they lack the knowledge of how to really run a restaurant. It's self-seating, so once you get in, start looking because there are usually very little open spots and not to mention the people working there probably wont lift a finger to help you. The previous time I was there, we even had to wipe clean our own table. The only time we had any interaction with someone there was when they approached us to let us know that we have 10min left before they close to convert it to the club. 

My favorite there would probably be the crispy fish tacos. 

Go there, have some tasty tacos and then leave, because they want you to.
author: Frank L.

description:
706th reviewer. Wow. This place sure is popular.

I came here for the first time today and ordered one Pescado Taco, Nick's Way for $5.32 (with tax). Kind of pricey for just one taco. And it didn't fill me up, but I know two of these would be hard to finish all by myself. Anyway, it was delicious! Very crispy fish, creamy lime mayo, and a crunchy shell. Downside, guacamole only covered half the taco since the other half was still covered in the wrapper.  Every bite of my Pescado Taco = a drip of sauce in my basket. Took one bite of my bf's Pollo Taco, Nick's Way. Love that they used white meat, didn't like how chewy and kind of dry it was. Service is good, with a friendly staff. You order up front, pay, take a number, find a seat, get your food delivered to your table, enjoy, and they even bus for you. It'd be nicer if Taco Tuesdays were all day long. They'd probably make more business, and at the same time, need to restock on food.

Didn't give this review the full five stars because 1) price, 2) freaky horror movie-like environment, 3) smell of the place, and 4) location: Russian Hill is across the city from where I am.

I'd come back again, but during Taco Tuesdays!
author: Priscilla W.

description:
Twinkie = good.
Deep fried twinkie = better.

Oreo = good.
Deep fried oreo = better.

Taco = Great.
Deep fried taco = epic bliss.

The best part about eating these deep fried little bundles of love is that I don't have to worry about getting stabbed by some midget carnie.

Do yourself a favor and park a few blocks away.  

You're gonna need to walk off the calories after the 5th taco makes it's way down your gullet.

Snap.
author: Archie R.

description:
Yum! Their guac is really good. I came here for lunch with my friend and was surprised that this is the same place as Rouge. Other than that, the place is roomy since there are no club crowds during lunch time.

I has the carne asada crispy taco with guac and it was ok. Their fish tacos and shrimp tacos are really yummy. Their shrimp is grilled and it's about a 16-20 count for size. They serve these tacos with 2 types of salsa: salsa verde and a hickory red salsa. Both are pretty yummy.
author: Eva Y.

description: We have eaten freshly prepared cerviche in Costa Rica, pescado tacos in Cancun, Cabo, Tijauna & the trucks across Los Angeles and these tacos honestly did not come close except for the cilantro and onions. There's no bang! There was no distinct flavor that we could recognize. This is an honest assessment. Trust us, if you've ever eaten REAL tacos anywhere, and we were raised on taco trucks in L.A., this may be the best in San Fran, but not as live as advertised. Sincerely Yours, Taco Techs!
author: Mrs. AS H.

description:
I love everything about this place. I've tried the fish and shrimp tacos (Nick's style) and the corn on the stick. Great atmosphere, yummy food, and you get to watch the Giant's game on the tvs at the bar. I'm a fan!

I've also been to the one on Irving in the Sunset for brunch but it was still just as yummy. I had a veggie breakfast burrito and bloody mary, both were spicy and delicious!
author: Talia M.

description: I would have loved to have made a large order tonight. But their phone has been busy for 15 minutes. I give up. Maybe you should think about getting more than one line for orders or having a hold button. You might keep customers that way.
author: Hillary P.

description:
Solid. Very Solid Burrito. Not greasy and generic tasting like so many of the other shops around here.I got the pollo asado in a spinach tortilla. $1.50 more to get sour cream and guacamole. Please do so, otherwise the burrito will be a little dry and not as good. How do I know? Because they forgot it in my burrito. After 5 or six bites, I realized what had happened and they fixed the situation. Muuuuuch better.
The hot sauce/salsa is tasty, but not spicy enough for me. So maybe bring your own hot sauce (I always carry some emergency Tapatio packets in my pockets) when you come here.

I want to try the Taco Tuesday's but I hear it gets a little packed.
author: james m.

description: Was recommended to eat here by a friend local to the area.  We are glad he did.  My husband and I stopped in for a quick bite and the fish tacos were awesome - among the best I have ever had.
author: Maria I.

description: Came here on a whim while wandering the streets of Nob Hill. Didn't know what it was all about, so I ordered a regular taco without requesting it Nick's crispy style - doh! I have to say though, it was a damn good taco anyway!
author: Thy N.

description: If I could write a song about the fish tacos Nick's style I would be the next Jim Croce.
author: Nico O.

description: I go here all the time considering that I live on Polk Street. They have great tacos, lots of seating, and decent margaritas. Taco Tuesdays, or "Club Taco" as my friends call it, are always a good time as well, though you want to arrive early.
author: Jeff W.

description: Nice! I think it's a bit overrated on here, but I've never had a bad experience. Good but not perfect Mexican food. Still, que bien!
author: Ryan S.

description: Expensive ass tacos but freakin delicious.  The fish taco is emazing.
author: Fatty A.

description:
Far from an authentic mexican taco... but the Carne Asada Tacos, Nick's Way is my GO-TO for when I'm craving something quick and just plain satisfying under $5. Its just the perfect combo of meat, fried tortilla goodness, and creamy guac dollops packed into one.

The $2 happy hour margaritas & $3 pint beers from Rouge also hit the spot. My idea of a value combo meal. ;)


**NOTE:
If you order chips & salsa - make sure you tell them you want the salsa on the side. Or else your chips will be soggy.
author: Sue Y.

description: I was disappointed by nicks crispy tacos. Many of the reviews led me to believe the tacos and burritos would knock my socks off but they were just mediocre
author: Sarah S.

description:
Fish taco is to die for.. 


Every time I think/breath/dream of fish I think of Nick's....

Taco's are soft.. not crispy! 

YUMMY!!!
author: Sissy T.

description:
Delicioso! 

I ordered the pescado tacos and my friend got the carne asada tacos. Portions are perfect as well as prices. The guacamole is not the best, but I really didn't need it because their special sauce was enough flavor for me. Quick, casual..sit anywhere  you want! Yumm can't wait to get some more tacos later.
author: Alexa M.

description:
I loveeeee nicks. Everytime I am home from college I make a point to go here. Taco tuesday is really fun here but it gets really crowded and the line gets crazy long. If you have a big party make sure that you make a reservation in advanced!!

get the tacos "nicks style" and you wont be disappointed
author: Katie P.

description: Nothing special...Luckily, I showed up on taco Tuesday and at least got a discount...otherwise this would be a 1 star review.  I ordered chips, salsa & guac basket and 2 crispy tacos carnita + beef.  1. The crispy tacos were not crispy, just oily under fried bland corn tortillas.  2. The carnitas were unseasoned but tender.  3. The beef had lemongrass seasoning in several bites, a nice surprise but that means seasoning was uneven. 4. The food came out fast and cold...no likey.  Okay changing this to a 1 star review. (I initially assigned it 2 stars but after recalling the meal, 1 star because I've had far better cheap tacos.)
author: Linda W.

description:
I have waited to write a review because I just wanted to give them 5 stars after every visit. Were they consistant? YES! I want to personally thank the men and women responsible for my Nick's Steak Quesadilla (with Sour cream) addiction. Do you know how hard it is to not go everyday? Tuesdays I don't try because of taco tuesday, so that is one day of the week I avoid but the other 6? Hello! I can not stay away. 

Tuesdays are crazy. But no docked points for being popular.

Food is consistant, great, fresh tasting and fast.

I enjoy that the cash reg guys recognize me and my boyfriend. It is an odd place at first glance- club- crappy bar and then amazing Tacos? Its a bit off but the Nicks is hands down the best quesadilas in town. Maybe one day they will get rid of the suck ass bartenders and hire the taco guys it would be prfect!  I have had the worst service everytime I have tried to sit at the bar. Several times the bartenders would ignore me while doing nothing else. I gave up on that side fyi- but Nick's side is worth the line and cash only.
author: Amanda F.

description:
I would go w/ 2.5 but not possible. 

The only things going for them are: 1) the combo of a crispy shell inside the soft shell for 2 distinct textures in 1 bite (pretty genius, honestly) & the watermelon aqua fresca. (bits of watermelon & seeds in my drink? yeah, pretty darn good!)

I got the pollo taco on $2 Tuesday Tacos. Got there about 6:30pm & by 6:45 there was quite a line. Service is extremely fast - for pretty much everyone. 

There was a good amount of guacamole on top but barely any cheese inside (which was fine, because on inspection it was the nasty pre-shredded kind...nothing fancy). I asked for no beans, but voila! there were lots of beans - more beans than chicken so it made the taco mushy (why I don't like beans), softened the flavor of the chicken (another reason why I don't like beans) & when they were removed my taco shrunk to 1/2 its original size (did I mention I don't like beans?). 

The combo of crunchy shell inside soft shell is a good call - I'll have to steal that 1 next time! Never had that before & would spend the additional $0.95/taco for the upgrade. Kudos on that one. 

Cash only - which is fine when you're only trying to get a few tacos, maybe some nachos & drink for $2 a piece.

It's still so busy because it's cheap, there's a full bar inside with TVs to watch sports that also offers happy hour & conveniently located for those living in the area. I'll check out other places before going back.
author: Marissa H.

description:
Mucho love for the tacos here done "Nick's Way".  Nick's way isn't the only way but it's the best way.  Fried crispy shells... but the story took a dark left turn for me.

I sat in one of the circular red booths waiting for my tacos and noticed the full bar across from the taco counter.  I suddenly found myself in the deja vu twilight zone.  I knew I had never been to Nick's before, but there was a hazy memory I couldn't put my finger on involving Angelo F, Lisa C, live music and large quantities of alcohol.

After leaving and walking around the building I realized this place was a taco joint by day and a Rouge nightclub by night.  During the day on the weekends it's both with a full bar with plasma TVs showing the game on one side and awesome food things on the other.  Oh happy day!

When the sports bars around the corner are packed and I'm in the neighborhood you'll find me here munching on delicious tacos, sipping cocktails and watching the game.

Score!
author: Theron L.

description:
Oooo going to Nick's for tacos? Yesss!

I still remember when I first stepped foot in your doors. You weren't Nick's. You were Rouge~ overcrowded club by night. But by day, you transformed into Nick's. 

I like day-time at Nick's much better.

Cheap & tasty tacos never disappoint, especially your crispy fish tacos made "Nick's Way". Nick's Way adds the good 'ol fixins to your taco- guacamole, sour cream, & a dash of lime. The grilled fish tacos are just as yummy, too!

Even the drinks are nice & cheap. A few measly dollars for a nice, cold beer or a glass of wine.

I can be in casual gear at your humble abode, just order my tacos at the cashier line, then park my rear at one of your many tables, and I'm good to go. 

I can't wait to come back to you when I have the next taco craving!
author: Joy A.

description:
When I used to work at Ghirardelli I was told about this place through a friend. came here on a tuesday night. BIG mistake! So packed. so cramped. We couldn't even walk inside. But it gave me a good feeling.

Two weeks go by and I'm walking gus and pass by Nicks. So I order some tacos to go and meet my friend on the way. So surprised the tacos kept (No soggy tacos here surprisingly) and SO delicious. I've yet to actually sit down and eat in here but it looks fun. 

I'm super enjoying Nicks and will have to update soon!
author: Amanda S.

description:
Check your expectations before you visit. This is not a traditional taqueria by any stretch of the imagination. This is a dive bar with tacos. This is drunk food. Delicious Delicious drunk food. 

The first time I came here I was disappointed with the burrito. It just didn't have the panache that some of the ones in, oh lets say, the mission have to offer. Also, the beer was a little boring except for the Mexican choices which were good. Bohemia etc...

The second time I was drunk (I should delete this review if I ever run for office). The taco I had hit the spot. It was messy and filled with salty, greasy, and delicious food. I do suggest asking them to go easy on the guacamole. They gave me a ton of the stuff.
author: Eric G.

description:
Mexican food meets a very red club! is the way to describe Nick's. I have been hearing about Nicks for the longest time now and after seeing it on Check Please Bay Area, it made me want to go even more. In my past review I stated I woke up early on a saturday to go to a dentist appt. I had no idea that Nicks was not even a block away!!!!!  I was like dayum, imma never reallie in this area, I gotta check it out. I was drawn toward it. As i entered and looked around it didn't seem all that great until I looked over and into the area that is Rouge. Red velvet couches, red curtains, red walls and huge Chandeliers hanging from the ceiling.  

Being 11 something in the morning and not reallie eating breakfast i was hungry and decided to be a  fat ass. I got one pollo crispy taco and a carne asada burrito. Prices were great the gianormous burrito was only 5.95 and the taco was 3 sumthing. I didn't feel like being stuck inside so as soon as I got my order I decided to find somewhere outside to eat. I walked a bit and found they had opened a Tuttimelon here and there was a park bench outside. PERFECT!! so the taco didn't last very long, it went with in a matter of 2 minutes. The chicken was tender, they had good amount of guacamole and if i had just gotten this I would still be hungree. So imma really glad i got the burrito too. As I started to nom the burrito I noticed that many people were walking by. I love people watching, what better chance then when i was stuffing my face. I am a multitasker that is for sure lols. 

The burrito was huge! yet somehow my fatass finished it x_x The burrito was packed with steak, beans, guacamole, melted cheese, tomatoes, god damn it, imma making myself hungry thinking about it XDDDD.
