I will be back to check out their fish tacos, wasn't in the mood for fish in the morning :3.  Overall the food is awesome! Can't wait to go to the dentist again? LOLS
author: Jonathan W.

description:
So good. Like, get sentenced to death row for murdering a guy that cut me in line on two-dollar taco tuesdays, and asking for two veggie tacos Nick's Way with a chips special as my last meal before being lethally injected good. 

 Like, I don't give a crap if it's not "authentic", yes I know the mission has good mexican food but I don't live in the mission and I'm not about to get on the 49 for 20 minutes to get a freakin' taco when I live 5 minutes from this awesome place good. 

 Like, yeah I could go and have a mariachi guitarist serenade me while I eat (happened in Taqueria Cancun), but sometimes its fun to go eat in what looks like an abandoned strip club made out of Hugh Hefner's old burgundy smoking jackets with blaring dub-step music good.
author: George B.

description:
I visited Nick's Crispy Taco's last week for happy hour with a friend.  They have these banquettes that you can collapse into that are super spacious and perfect for catching up with friends.  

I didn't have any crispy tacos because I had dinner plans but the chips and gauc were great!  The very best part about happy hour is that the drinks were $3 each and they were GREAT!  And the bartender was fantastic - she made me a little something special (I just told her that I needed to keep it classy so that I could drive home, but that I wanted something sweet and tasty).  No idea what she made but I loved it.  

I would give it more stars, but I like to reserve four and five stars for great, unique places.  I'll definitely be back!
author: Ashley C.

description: Love the food. The tacos made Nick's way are my favorite. Everything is fresh and the service is fast. Try the quesadillas and the fish tacos. Excellente!
author: ed A.

description:
Favorite fish taco place in San Francisco.
5 stars because it's my favorite, don't love love the margaritas, but I'm rating the fish tacos. I find that the Baja style is just too much stuff, so I recommend the regular pescado taco. You can taste their special sauce better this way. And I get guac, salsa and chips on the side. Cash only. Be patient, it is a popular joint.
author: Jennifer L.

description: I have only been here after 9pm for drinks...They Margaritas are ok, they just taste like a standard mix, nothing special. Good to stop in for a pitcher if your in the neighborhood and want to sit and chill. It has a lot of booths to sit in which is great if your going out with a group. Also a ton of TV screens and fun music. The scene is very SO-CAL, not good for true SFers...but is Polk an SF scene anyway?
author: Natalia H.

description:
My cure for a case of bad hangover= the Carne Asada, and Pollo tacos- both Nick's Way. 

Get it to go, walk across the street to Real Food and pick up a beer, find a patch of sun, some fresh air and enjoy.

Never fails.
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
For a few months, I worked around the corner from NCT on Polk.  And I loved them.  I thought that this was the ultimate in crispy taco eating.

And then...

I moved to the fog and discovered Nick's at Underdog's in the Outer Sunset.  And even though I still love the original NCT, I have to say that the pescado taco Nick's way at Underdog's gives the original quite a run for its money.  

If you're a south-sider like me and Russian Hill is a schlep, check out Underdog's on 20th and Irving.
author: Melissa Y.

description: First time at Nick's last night and I loved it! Cheap prices, good food, and a fun atmosphere with DJs mixing songs that will make you want to dance with taco & margarita in hand! Can't wait to go back!
author: Gabriella F.

description: Legitimately, the best fish taco's I've ever eaten.  I've wanted to try this place for a long time, but never had the chance to.  Recently, I had a bit of time to kill, so I dropped by to try the Pescado, Nick's Way.  Needless to say, I was blown away, even though I was eating alone.  At that moment, I really didn't care, because it was all about the taco and me, and nothing else mattered.  I am definitely coming back on a Tuesday to take advantage of the Taco Tuesday's and I'm bringing friends!  The taco is crispy, but not so much that it cracks and falls apart.  The ingredients are all fresh and clean tasting.  And best of all, the baja fish is perfectly seasoned, battered, and fried.
author: Christopher L.

description:
Best fish tacos I've ever had!.  I went to Nick's for my birthday this year with a huge group of people.  Nick's doesn't take reservations but luckily we were able to nab some booths next to each other.

I love how Nick's is festive, affordable, fun and the food really is fantastic. Next time I'm in SF I'm definitely going to hit up Nick's.
author: Meghan F.

description:
OK, that was fun! I really liked coming here for a couple of reasons. 
First, it's located in a fun part of downtown, on the corner of one of the oldest buildings, totally old SF, huge open room with high ceilings, all painted red, with red banquettes, giant chandeliers, and a huge horseshoe bar. Very cool! My only negative here would be that someone needs to get those giant chandeliers down and wash them! 
The crowd, and I mean the place was packed, was a mix of all kinds. Casual, urban hipster, business, Saturday night dates, you name it "we" were all there.
You head to the back of the place to get in line and order your tacos. . . OK, they're just tacos (or burritos or whatever). But, really good tacos. . .
Jammed full of good stuff. Use lots of napkins here kids, they're messy.
One or two will fill you up. 
AND. . . The servers are quite the eye candy here. Loved the bartender, and he was totally a sweetheart, in his looks and his friendliness. ;)
Everyone had a great time.
author: Greg S.

description:
2 Grilled fish tacos nick's way = total satisfaction. 

I get a kick out of the trashy faded discoteque vibe with the mirrors, velvet seats and disco ball--it's totally easy to envision polyester suit-clad men with their gold chains and shirts unbuttoned down to there, and women in their quiana Diane Von Furstenburg-ish dresses and Farrah Fawcett hairdos hustling the night away...but it seems a little dirty.
author: N B.

description:
I have been to this place about a million times. Considering it's location in retrospect to my house, it is the only place where I can get a taco or a burrito that is somewhat decent and I don't have to travel to the Mission. 

With that said, Nick's is good. I have had their soup, their burritos, their nachos, and of course their tacos. I recommend getting their tacos done "Nick's Way," but of course be prepared for a heart attack risk occurring. They are that good and that greasy, which creeps me out and makes my night all at the same time.

Of course if you are going there, pick up a pitcher of Margaritas. Their Margaritas are strong and delicious. If you go just late enough, it transitions into a night club. Kinda random and yet it makes me sad because if they stayed opened later they could make a killing off drunk people wanting Mexican Food. 

Anyway, if you live anywhere close to NIck's, it is like a right of passage to go and check out this place. You are definitely in for an experience (in a completely good way), as well as some tasty food.
author: Diana R.

description:
The GOOD= Taste great

The BAD=  Too expensive

The WORSE= 2 weeks of having Nicks Crispy Turds is not my cup-o-tea
author: Yelp-a-holi C.

description:
As mission dweller, I feel entitled and expect that one would listen, when I talk burritos ;)  A good burrito is never more than a stones throw away from my coordinates, and I wasn't expecting to get blown away on Polk St. by Mexican fare. After sampling a couple of fish and shrimp tacos, some beef nachos, and a fish burrito, I had to step out and make sure that I was actually not in my part of the city. 

Nicks has a ton of seating, but they get busy enough where you may find yourself searching for a spot to occupy while you chow down; oblivious to any and everything that's happening around you. The lines get pretty long, and I can only imagine what its like on Tuesday's when they offer their specials. Good stuff!
author: Vivek N.

description:
I came here with friends last week for the 2nd time... and the tacos are just fantabulous!!! so yummy! Ive only had the pescado crispy fish tacos.. and had it nick's way!  and the only way it should be!  I got 2 fish tacos.. and that was plenty! was so full after.

Its such a strange place to have tacos... at night it turns into a club/bar... The place is pretty interesting... has chandeliers everywhere... red walls.. oh and the ceiling is red also... which kind of looks like red velvet cake lol... 

the place is huge but the place is such a hit that you may have to wait for a table... 

Definitely a must try ! =)
author: Jasen L.

description: I did not have the food, but rather came to drink at the bar. They have $10 pitchers on basically any kind of beer an the atmosphere is legit. The red color scheme really gives a great social vibe. The place turns into Rouge Lounge at night. Great place for going out with some friends and kickin back a few.
author: Alan H.

description: Mediocre food. Unsanitary. Expensive and cash only. Incredibly rude service. Never coming back.
author: Ishaan T.

description:
BEST TACOS EVERRRRRRRRR!!!!!! You have to get your taco Nick's way (one soft shell and one crispy shell with jack cheese and guacamole. . .SOOOOOO BOMB!!!!!!! I usually get 2 pollo tacos Nick's way, but I've heard the carne asada is really good too!!! Get 1 if your a little hungry, get 2 if your STARVING!! 

Be warned that Taco Tuesday can be a VERY big event at Nick's. Sometimes (usually) there is a line out the door, but the tacos are totally worth the wait, and the bar has specials on Tuesday nights as well. I usually opt for the 2 for $6 Coronas, but they have specials on Margaritas (really amazing margs), and pitchers of beer too!!! 

You gotta try it!!! And if you have trouble finding the place. . .it's inside Rouge on the corner of Broadway and Polk. Best way to describe Nick's is a taco truck inside a bar/lounge.
author: Allison M.

description: Fish tacos are real good here, the watermelon water is the best!
author: Marisol M.

description: Only 3 stars today,,,,Luke warm, no flavor tacos today...not sure what has changed?
author: V. R.

description:
I grew up in Chula Vista, CA about 10 minutes away from the Mexican border so I know what a good taco tastes like. I'm always on the hunt for authentic, delicious Mexican food in the city and Nick's Crispy Tacos is NOT it. 

Walking in I was pretty horrified by the obvious fact that the location used to be a dance club. It's got red velvet drapes, mirrors covering the walls, and cheesy chandeliers hanging from the ceiling. It did not give off the vibe that it was going to be pricey, instead it gave off the vibe that it was tacky. But whatevers, right? Let's let the food speak for itself. 

My fiancé and I ordered the crispy pescado, carnitas, and carne asada tacos. The crispy fish taco was too greasy that you couldn't really taste the fish. The guacamole they have doesn't taste fresh nor like real guacamole. Their carnitas had a lot of fat attached to the meat and also tasted too greasy. Lastly, the carne asada, which I'm always very picky of because I've had the best home cooked carne asada all my life, was tasteless. Where's the seasonings? The limón? The flavor? 

I'd heard so many people rave about Nick's Crispy Tacos, and it was definitely the biggest let down. It was simply not good. Why return when you've got the Mission district to go to for good Mexican food (which can also be hit or miss though). 

Ok, so I hated Nick's and you want to know where to go for a hell of a taco? There is a place. It's a small hole in the wall on 24th street in the Mission that you'll never catch your average Joe walking into. I don't even want to mention the name because this place is such a gem and authentic as can be that if you're loving and grubbing on Nick's Tacos then you kind of don't deserve to know about my secret gem. If you're so inclined to find out, just cruise 24th street and look for a taquero cooking up a storm inside a small room that can fit about 5 people :) Good luck!
author: Junia I.

description:
LOVE the Grilled Fish salad!!!!!!  2 pieces of fish and a large bowl of salad with black beans, corn, fresh tomatos, onions, and a tasty fresh dressing.  

PS- Out of towners- know that is a sit down location (because you sit in the club).  But it is a small corner of the club.  A great neighborhood stop in.   Cash only, of course.

Side note: Damn, this place looks different in the daytime!!! haha
author: Deanna A.

description: OVERRATTED.. Not authentic.. Authentic GRINGO. Location Location Location. I always passed by this place and I had to go in here to see what the big deal was. Ordered carne asada tacos and a qusidilla con carnitas and it was bland as hell. I hate taquerias that give you nasty stale chips too...
author: Tareau B.

description:
Really enjoyed this one bro. 

First timers - head to the bar on your right immediately and place your order, then take a number and get a seat. Cash only (annoying)!

Delicious chips and pico, really great rancheros. Horchata a little too much Cinnamon for my tastes tho (but maybe that's more authentic, I am from the Midwest). Don't miss the watermelon drink either, not on the paper menu.
author: Francis U.

description:
Nick's Crispy Tacos are a-ok in my book.

Tacos are delicious and crispy. Love the baja fried chicken taco. Yummy! Ambiance is unexpected and *klassy*. Tacos are a bit steep (especially if you get them *Nick's way*) however they were delicious enough to let that slide. Not close to BART though, which sucks.

I will be back!
author: Sara J.

description:
Wandered in here in the late afternoon. No idea what I was in for. Wow! Really great tacos. Steak and fish tacos were incredible.  Tacos are both soft and crispy at once. As I'm writing this I'm considering ordering another so I can inspect further. So tasty. Get tacos 'nicks way'. Nick is good in my book. 

Very relaxed atmosphere. Think I'll have to come back to try a burrito.

(I actually started this review a few months ago and never finished it. I'm STILL dreaming about these tacos...)
author: David W.

description: The best tacos I had in a LONGGGGGGGG TIME!! Bring cash!! Must try the shrimp tacos amazing !!!
author: Veronica C.

description: Ok so there's not much to be said that hasn't already been said about Nick's fish tacos but they are simply worth the hype and, thus, the energy.  Get one grilled and one crispy "nick's style."  Melt in your mouth delicious and every bit worth the lines and location on busy days.  They also have blue moon on tap if you're a drinker.  Just go there.. you won't be disappointed.
author: Amanda G.

description: Best pescado burrito I've ever had.  Don't mess around and add cheese and guac, just get it the way it comes.  Perfect.  Get's a little crazy on Sunday's during football season, but if that's your thing, all the better
author: Scott L.

description: I am a fish taco nut. If I see fish tacos on a menu, I am likely to order them. So I know a good fish taco when I see one. This is one of the top, if not the top fish taco I have had. A few downsides: Cash only, drinks are limited, and seating is willy-nilly. But, if you can put up with that, you won't be disappointed if you order a fish taco (hell, order 2!) Nick's way and chow down. I normally hate Guacamole, but I loved it with this. Clearly it is some fresh Guac, and it compliments the taco nicely.
author: Chris L.

description:
I've been here a few times now and not once have I been disappointed. I typically don't like tacos but these tacos are really, really good. I've only had them Nick's way and will probably only stick with that. The nachos are really good too and the portion size is very generous. Man, just thinking about the food right now is making me salivate!!!!

Word of advice: try to get there early, this place gets crazy packed!!! If you can make reservations, that's a definite plus!!!!
author: Natalie C.

description:
I could give it four stars for the food, which was pretty good (yummy carnitas, and I like the crispy taco inside soft taco thing), but it loses one star because:

1. A guy in front of us complained that he was being charged more than the posted menus and signs, and the person at the counter said, "Those are out of date." No bueno! Our meal also seemed more expensive than it should have been, but we can't know for sure because they didn't give us a receipt.

2. The decor is interesting but trashy. Needs cleaning in many spots. Many. Many many.

3. Their guacamole was not very tasty -- it was strangely pasty and flavorless, and seemed like it came from a plastic pouch (although I've been told it's housemade). Needs more onions and less pureeing.

4. And fourthly, I have NEVER FARTED SO MUCH IN MY ENTIRE LIFE. From the moment we finished eating lunch and both felt bloated, through to the next day -- it was unreal. There weren't that many beans on my taco, so to me this means they didn't soak their beans properly before cooking with them. Still, as a write this, I feel the rumbling within. Please God, let my intestines have relief today. Please. Please please please.
author: Brooke H.

description: I change my mind about Nick's.  While the tacos are delicious - the place feels sort of seedy on Tuesday nights. It is overly crowded, there is nowhere to sit. It's virtually impossible to order a drink, and the bar is always splashed/wet. Their bathrooms are sort of gross too. It's really a shame b/c the decor is sort of funky (love the chandeliers) and the tacos are great.  This place has a lot of potential, but isn't living up to it.
author: Michelle T.

description:
I enjoyed every moment devouring the pescado taco!

I came here on Nick's famous Taco Tuesdays! I felt like a 21 year old again on an exciting Friday night. Great vibe. Poppin' music. I'm now a big fan of Nick's Taco Tuesdays! 

I made the mistake of underestimating the size of Nick's tacos. Afraid of still being hungry, I ordered 12 tacos for 3 females. The total came out to $50.00 - I'm not sure about most of you all, but I've never spent $50.00 on tacos before - pure craziness. Don't let the single "$" fool you!
author: Monica Y.

description:
Taco Tuesdays are crazy! The register is at one end, the line is at least a full 20-30 minute wait from the OTHER end of the place. The whole place is packed and there are not enough seats for everyone. But what to do but to line up when Taco Tuesdays are dine-in only.

For $2, you can get one of these: 
1.) Taco: carne asada, pollo, vegetarian. Nick's way (guacamole: add $0.95).
 2.) Cheese quesadilla 
3.) Chips, salsa, and guacamole

Margaritas: $3

We were able to pay and walk out with our chips and salsa with guacamole. Chips are warm, thick, bubbly (?), crunchy, nicely salted and fresh! They give lots of guacamole. With the salsa, oh-so-good. When the tacos finally came, we found a couple of seats at the bar so we scarfed them down in front of flat screens showing ESPN. It's not really $2 since you pretty much HAVE to get it Nick's Way (it shouldn't be in any other way) so for $2.95, you can get a small taco stuffed with carne asada and guacamole. We can't deny it; the tacos are really good but we're just not sure if it was worth the wait. On any other day, the taco would've been $3.25 + $0.95 Nick's way. 

Taco Tuesdays: great for young, professional singles. Great carne asada tacos and chips. Be ready to stand in line for a long, long time!
author: Tina T.

description: Fish tacos and margaritas are the thing to get here. Try either the grilled or fried (my fave!) fish and be sure to order it nick's way. It's the perfect sized taco served with two tortillas, one crispy to hold it all together. And the yummy and stiff margarita will wash it down nicely. Don't bother with eating much else here although the elote is not bad. The nachos taste like the kind you would get at a movie theater with squirty Velveeta  type of cheese sauce rather than just melted cheese.
author: melanie k.

description:
So, automatic 5 stars for a restaurant whose manager takes the trouble to follow up. That must be difficult and, therefore, commendable. 

However, advice to Peter: You guys have to make plenty of money- stop sharing spaces and let me get some late night guacamole!

Thanks for the response Peter.

See below:
 My name is Peter and I am the GM and VP of Nick's Crispy Tacos.  Allow me to explain a few things.  We rent our portion of the space from Rouge.  We are not the same company.  We are under contract to vacate the premises by our posted closing times.  It is Rouge's staff that are asking you to leave and no one from Nick's Crispy Tacos.  We are happy to have you as a customer and would allow you to stay as long as you want if it was up to us.
author: Katie T.

description:
Monday Night Stand-Up night is hilarious! One of my favorite nights of the week.

And the tacos are killer. Get them Nick's way.
author: Justin G.

description:
This is an interesting place...first time I went I was little intimidated to be honest.  It is a club/taco place.  So it has the club vibe (with the lights on) but has delicious taco's that they promise.  

Seating isn't the greatest, but you must eat it there.  Just doesn't taste the same when taking it home!  Best taco, well worth the price.  Their choices of salsa are super good too.
author: Stephanie M.

description:
Nick's, it's places like yours why I wish I lived in the city, and no, I don't tell that to all the spots I eat at, so yeah, you're kinda special. 

The boyfriend and I went to Nick's Crispy Tacos before hanging out with a few friends at a local bar, and since it was Friday we wanted some fish tacos. Luckily I came across this, oh so lovely, restaurant/lounge. There is usually a line and the seats are scarce, even at the bar, so I suggest that someone from your party grab some instead of everyone waiting in line. I had the fish burrito, which I kept frequently dousing with the green sauce. The burrito was a good size, so needless to say I split it with the bf. From the first bite I wish I had the appetite of my bf, because, well, I didn't want my burrito to be gone. There was the right amount of fish to cabbage ratio, love that! The fish had a great crust - mmmmm crunchy - and the meaty inside was just so tender...melt in your mouth goodness! Adding the green sauce just gives it the extra oomph that you knew you wanted, but would probably get caught up in how great it taste from the beginning. 

Oh Nick's Crispy Tacos, you best believe I will be back!
author: Tyree G.

description:
Awesome food! Don't be put off by the decorum or atmosphere - after a while, you'll notice that's where part of the charm is.

These guys make some fantastic quesidillas and burritos. If you get tacos, make sure to get them fried up, it's worth the extra buck or two. Be careful about coming on weekends, especially during football season, as the line can get a bit ridiculous. However, they are incredibly quick, and I've always been amazed at how fast they get my food to me despite the long lines.

The guys behind the counter have a good sense of humor and are very nice. Only thing that sucks is that they're cash only - but there's an ATM right next to the register, so no big deal. 

I've never been here for Rouge, so I can't comment - but for food and beers and good ambiance, you really can't beat Nick's. I'm incredibly happy that I only live a few blocks away, as this place has become go-to for good Mexican.
author: Nick B.

description: I had pescado taco (nick's way) and carnitas taco (nick's way too) and they were satisfying.  The amount of guacamole they piled on the tacos was generous.   The double-shell idea is brilliant... a shell is crispy fried and cheese is melted onto it!   Pescado (fried fish) has too much batter and not much fish so it's a bit disappointing.  Carnitas was not fatty enough, so it tasted a little dry.  But i love the concept of double shell, crispy, and loads of guac on tacos!  The nick's way tacos are about $5-6 each so a bit much for one taco, but they're huge and two is more than enough for one person.  We also had cantalope juice and it was delicious and pulpy!  Oh yeah, it was strange to see Rouge nightclub in bright daylight.  It looks better at night ;)  (Side note: I prefer Underdog Taco on Irving.  They have nick's way tacos too)
author: Jessica N.

description: Disgusting, cheap yet over priced, smells and tastes like they dip their food in community bath water. Fucking waste of money.
author: Calen C.

description: The most bland tacos I've had in SF. Why come here when there are so many better options in the city? The chicken was bland and dry, and even the salsa on the table couldn't save my tacos. I think I'll skip on Mexican food while in this neighborhood.
author: Lauren V.

description: We love their crispy tacos!! They are so so good!! You have to try them. I always get the carnitas done Nick's way and my hubby gets the fish tacos. We love their frescas. Oh wow just writing this, I want a taco now.
author: Cynthia L.

description:
Yes I live 4 blocks away and eat here almost weekly due to great food and convenience. 

Solid taco's get them nick's way. Pescado, grilled fish, chicken asada, and carne asada are my favorites. The carnitas are a bit too mushy for my taste. My dilemma here is always getting 2 or 3 tacos. 2 taco's are sufficient but I still crave more and 3 stuffs me. It ends up depending on how many beers I plan on having with dinner, because after 3 tacos good luck.

Camarones burrito is a hidden gem on the menu. A 1LB burrito stuffed with prawns with the acidity and crunch of pico de gallo, onions, and cabbage work well with the prawns. 

Come on Tuesdays for the taco Tuesday (2 beers for $5 at Rouge and $2 tacos) madness but expect huge lines. 

Not the best Mexican in the city but location location location! When I'm hungry and don't want to go on an adventure for food Nick's hits the spot!
author: Mike K.

description:
Who needs seafood in San Francisco when you can go to Nicks?

I was introduced to Nick's Crispy Tacos by a friend which in San Fran in 2009 and every time I think about San Francisco, I think about these tacos. I don't really know how to adequately describe them, all I can say is try one and you won't be disappointed, especially if you like guac.
author: Jess C.

description:
The tacos are pretty good. 

The pollo asada (grilled chicken) taco Nick's Way (additional .95 for a crispy tortilla and guacamole) - totaling $4.45 per taco. Good...but if you want a few it gets pricey. 

The baja fish taco regular style was good. The fish is freshly fried with cabbage and mayo lime -pretty good.. but at $4.95 a pop - again pricey if you want a few.

The meat all around was good quality. 

No chips included either. Lame. ($1.25 extra)
But there are two types of salsa on each table (one green, one red)

The ambiance is kinda cool - I love the big red booths.
author: Chili B.

description: We came in here for a quick snack and some drinks. The prices were great and so were the tacos. The mens restroom wss out of order, so they had the employee restroom set up to accommodate.  There was a pretty long line all night. I hope they got that fixed quickly.
author: Chase L.

description: Checked this out on Yelp and it was highly recommended as a good gluten free place to eat. After taking two munis and walking a few blocks we found it and excitedly entered. We were greeted by two gentlemen and explained that we were looking for gluten free eats. They looked at us like we were crazy and said nothing on the menu was gluten free. NOT impressed!
author: Heather R.

description:
In response to my review below, a manager at NCT sent me a message to explain their prices. 

1.Beef and Pork both come from NIMAN RANCH, one of the most respected ranches and producers of quality meets in the States.
2.Chicken is Organic and free range.
3.Line caught MAUHI MAUHI that is delivered daily, except sunday, never ONCE sees a freezer. After the BP oil spill the seafood market SKYROCKETED!!! We went from paying $2-$3/lbs sometimes $4/lbs on a bad day to currently paying $6/lbs on a good day and as high as $12/ lbs on a bad day!
4.Organic Produce, as you may already know is not cheap at all. We try hard to provide the best quality products we can by starting with the best products possible.

I can appreciate all of the points listed. Moreover, I appreciate that the manager was able to address the negative aspects for my review professionally. That was impressive. 

Because of that, awesome customer service, I'm upping my review to 5 stars and I will definitely continue to go to Nicks. 

------

So Nick's tacos are overrated. They are decent but the taste does not justify the price. Everything is overpriced

HOWEVER,

there are a few items on the menu that are nearly worth the inflated price. 

The pescado/fried fish tacos. Um... hella good.

But even better than the fried fish tacos, the fried fish burrito! My husband and I ordered one to share and then he stood in line for another 20 minutes to order another one. We then waited another 20 minutes until it was ready. It was worth the 40 minute wait and the $10 price. Ouch, I know for a burrito but it is so good. Don't try to eat anything after the fish burrito; you'll be disappointed. 

I love the elote but I hate paying nearly $4 for a corn on the cob. 

Hate the prices, love (some) of the food.

Luckily, there is some type of Groupon, Living Social, HomeRun deal for Nick's every 4 - 6 months.

Cash Only - meh!
author: Kiristen R.

description:
I love Taco Tuesday as much as the next person, but I have never been able to get wildly excited about Nick's tacos.  And yes, I've tried them Nicks way but there is just way too much guac for me.

But on Friday night we stopped here in between bar #1 and bar #2 for the night and I ordered the quesadilla.  Life changing.  Giant and almost crispy on the outside from being perfectly grilled.  The flavors paired excellently with my pitcher of margarita. :)  I cannot wait to go back for another.  

This time though, I'll be sure to leave 10 minutes earlier before it gets all "Rouge" in there.
author: Meagan C.

description:
Nicks is like heaven on earth. I absolutely love it. Not only are their tacos to DIE for (Order Nick's Way--lots of guac and cheese and amazinggg), the atmosphere is awesome any time of day, any day. 

Taco tuesday is my favorite day to go--I don't think I've missed a taco tuesday in the last ten weeks. There's usually a line out the door for the food (its THAT good), but you can order drinks at the bar. $3 margaritas, what more could you want?! The music is amazing, the people are amazing, and (some of) the bartenders are amazing. Marlow is my favorite, but I think she's maternity leave. 

Go on a tuesday! You'll be glad you did.
author: Jasvir S.

description:
I'm from Arizona, so I know my Mexican food...and Nick's was great! The flour tortillas are outstanding and so fresh that I wanted to take a dozen home.

My basis for all mexican restaurants is if the place can do a good machaca burrito then I'm hooked - and Nick's can! Filled to the brim with tastiness. And the guacamole was amazing too (isn't everything better with guacamole??)!

The ambiance in Nick's is also great and seems authentic mexican restaurant - plastic tablecloths, folding chairs and all. However, since it's in Nob Hill, it is sophisticated (but not obnoxious). That includes beautiful sparkly chandeliers and a deep red color on the wall. The booths also looked very comfy.

I will definitely return - especially for their happy hour. Nothing ends the day better then a Pacifico and a burrito!
author: Ellen S.

description: Overall 3, but the tacos Nick's Way are a 5 fasho (see carne asada and fried fish).  Nachos and burritos are bleh, love the easy to dispense bottles of hot sauce... always disappointed when I order 3 tacos and it costs ~$15... though to be fair 3 tacos Nicks Way = a lot of food.  Their horchata is as good as any, especially considering it's a gringo-style taqueria...
author: c d.

description: DELICIOUS food! Don't miss the pescado taco :-)
author: Scott G.

description:
Alright, Nick. Whoever you are, you got me. 

I was ready to hate you and your tacos. Especially that fish taco with the perfectly battered and fried piece of Pisces (see what I did there?) and the perfect accompanying lettuce slaw on top. I was also ready to hate the ridiculous amount of guac slathered on them when ordered Nick's way as well as the awesome double soft and crunchy hard shell and the great salsa. 

I was ready to hate you but I don't. But why the 3 stars? Price, price, price. I know you're on Polk and you gotta pay the high rent, but $7 for a taco is borderline crazy. Granted, your tacos are huge (that's what she said?) and I only need two of them to fill me up (getting risque here), but spending $15 on two tacos is almost against the law in California.
author: Emily H.

description:
I'm at Nick's Crispy Tacos right now and I can't believe it's not rated 5 Stars.  The food tastes so clean and fresh - Mexican done right.  Not to mention the bar and the crazy cheap drinks - $3 Margarita.  Get your taco "Nick's Way" and you can't go wrong, unless you don't get any chips. That would be a mistake because they're some of the best chips I've ever had, solid, and they serve them topped with a pile of fresh tomato salsa.  Awesome.

PS - I was there when I wrote this like two months ago, aparently it didn't post.  And yes, I still love this place!
author: Kasey K.

description:
YUM! I don't even like fish and I would shave my head for a pescado taco, Nick's way.  So fresh, so fried, so delicious. The carnitas tacos are great too, as long as you get them "mas carne." The spicy, cheesy corn on the cob ("elote") is unlike anything else I've ever had and it is fantastic. The tacos here are so filling, two will do you in, making Nick's a pretty cheap place to eat. Yes, their tacos are more expensive than T Bell's, but you pay for what you get.

One word of advice - get take-out.  It is not easy to score a table here, at least not on the weekends. You seat yourself, and the competition is intense.
author: Mem W.

description:
The tacos are mediocre. I've definitely had better! I would pick the fish taco over the carne asada taco. You also have to go Nick's way! 

A little over my budget, specially cuz it's pretty difficult to find parking and you'll end up having to pay for that as well! 

The ambiance is cool. I love the red color scheme, chandeliers and music. But probably won't be coming back.
author: Dora S.

description: Good tacos when you want to chow down.  Sometimes they're kind of tough or like off, but generally they're good, and i always plan on coming back.  you can get a nice big beer at the bar, too, and if you go during the day or early evening you have the place to yourself, haha.  cash only.
author: M C.

description: I told my friends I would give it 2 stars, they wanted me to give it 3, but in the end, if you have mice climbing up your curtains, it doesn't matter how great the food is.
author: Erica S.

description: From the outside, you wouldn't be able to tell that inside is packed with taco-loving mimosa guzzling characters.   Popped in for a few tacos - no tables were open so we ate standing watching the football game on the tvs.  But the energy in this place is just as good as their tacos.  Got the Pescado and the Carne Asada - Nick's style - yeaa.
author: Maxine C.

description:
I love their tacos, especially the fish taco, done "Nick's way". They are pretty hefty and two fills me up nicely. Boys should get three.

$2 Tacos! Except for the fish taco :(

Speaking of taco tuesday, I must come waaaaay earlier next time. This place gets packed (SUPER PACKED) fast and you really don't want to be standing eating your fish tacos. 

Also, the line to order your taco is ridiculously long, so order a drink and stand in line.

Overall, had a great time here. Must find some buddies to drag here again!
author: Helen T.

description: Crowded but delicious.  Pescado taco nicks way is a must
author: Alan S.

description:
Nick's Crispy Taco is a sorry excuse for Mexican food.  It's barely a step above Chevy's.  I ordered a carne asade quesadilla and my friend ordered chicken tacos.  Both of us agreed they were bland.  To add insult to injury, the "hot" sauce was mild at best.  I know that this place is frequented by a bunch of WASPs, but some of us expect our hot sauce to be hot.

On top of boring food, you have to fight to find a seat.  Ugh. The only good thing about this place is the hilarious, upbeat cashier.
author: Lara O.

description: Tacos were great! We had their 2 for 5 Friday's Nachos and a few of their Tacos made Nick's way. Great food, Great price and a great atmosphere.
author: Jeffrey M.

description: Great taco selection, fresh guacamole, and fun bar atmosphere.
author: Ashley P.

description:
pescado...the best freakin fish tacos ever! 

last time, i went for the carne asada and carnitas tacos...but these pescado ones blow those out of the ballpark!

the fish is piping hot, crispy, and all the fixings make this taco a perfect 5 stars.  super yummy...i swear this place gets better as it ages!
author: Jen W.

description:
The food was good - my friend RAVED about the tacos, which were good, but not rave-worthy. The guacamole on the chips was adequate, but nothing particularly wonderful. 

What really bothered me was the actual space itself - nightclubs are meant to be seen in the dark of the night, not in the clear bright light of day, which shows you things that are better left unseen. For example, the chandelier (there are a million chandeliers, BTW) over our head while we ate was SO dirty and full of dust, it actually disgusted me - you sit there in constant fear that some of that will fall on your food (or your head). The place needs a deep clean.

I'd definitely try it again to taste other menu option -  but only to go.
author: judah m.

description: After getting back from Costa Rica, I had an obsession with fish tacos. Nick's definitely hit the spot. And the sauces!! just when I thought the taco couldnt taste any better... I added the sauce. talk about a party in my mouth. it wasn't Costa Rica, but it was the closest i've gotten.
author: Elisa T.

description:
I managed to eat around 3 slices of pizza from Escape From New York last night. Don't ask me how I did it,  I'm not even sure. Was it a good idea? No. Should I have walked next door to Nick's Crispy Tacos and gotten a veggie taco instead? Absolutely. The veggie tacos here  come with cabbage, guacamole, and a ton of other vegetarian goodness. And they're really big!  The meat tacos are just as good but vegetables won't clog your arteries or haunt you in your dreams.

I take issue with Nick's ONLY because they are inside of Rouge, which is, aside from the corner of Turk and Taylor, probably my least favorite place in SF. However, because the tacos are delicious, I am willing to suck it up, tolerate the drunk-seat-dancers (You know- the 21 year olds from Richmond who have had too many drinks to walk by 9 p.m. and therefore sit glued to their booth seats, swaying back and forth and fist pumping), and take my food to go.
author: Autumn K.

description:
I went with a friend on a Wednesday afternoon. There was a short line and wait, but I had heard it normally gets much more crowded so I wasn't upset. The atmosphere is really different during the day. I can tell that it moonlights as something completely different at night, apparently a club. 

I had a carnitas taco, pollo taco and carnitas quesadilla. The tacos were pretty good. I especially liked the pollo taco as it wasn't dry at all and they layered on good portions of guacamole, which I love, and had good amounts of beans and pico de gallo. We had the tortilla shell slightly fried which was a great choice, and I recommend it. The carnitas in both the quesadilla and the taco were slightly dry for me, though. Some bits were good, but some were tougher, though still held the taste. My friend had a fish taco which she praised, something I'd try next time. I definitely want to try this place again, maybe at night and give a shot to the other items on the menu.
author: Larry Y.

description:
There are not enough Mex places on this side of town.  So of course when you saw the sign for Nick's crispy tacos go up you get excited.  Well, maybe not too excited when it look adjoined to a nightclub that you probably wouldn't touch with a 10' pole on any given evening (but that's just a shut-ins prerogative).  At any rate the half night club seated off Broadway/Polk daytime taco joint is damn good.  Kudos to the minds behind provided Northeast San Francisco with a nice taco alternative.  Prices aren't half bad, the variety is aplenty and the mood has a strange Vegas meets Hollywood set for the shooting of a high-school mini drama feel.   What else could one want for a quick bite in a city of options?   

I like the fish -- breaded or not.  Have not sampled anything else.
author: Brad C.

description: We went on a trip out to San Fran, followed yelpers feedback and it did not disappoint.  The tacos were yummy and overflowing with ingredients.  The chips and salsa were great also. I am giving it 4 stars vs 5 for atmosphere, it is just kind of a random experience.  I think the place is a bar later at night, you order at the bar and sit wherever you want, but it isn't a dive either and no real waiters either, it was just kind of non descript, great food though out weighs the experience. Also, the margaritas were on the smaller side.
author: Jennifer G.

description:
In case you've ever wondered what would happen if a taco bar and cocktail lounge mated you would have your answer after visiting Nick's Crispy Tacos.   At first it was a bit hard for me to wrap my arms around the joint, but after standing in line for a very long time it all started to grow on me. 

I had a Carne Asada taco and Pescado taco... both prepared "Nick's way". Nick's way is a crispy shell with cheese and grauc. The carne asada was just okay. For me the meat needed more of "kick" to bring out the flavor. However there was a lot of meat and good stuff in my taco. On the other hand the pescado was absolutely purrrrrrrfect. The fish was fried nice and crispy and very tasty. And all the fixings just enhanced the whole experience of every bite. 

I love the vibe of this place... its cool with the red velvet high back cocktail tables (be warned if you are a germ phobe you won't find the red velvet enjoyable, it has seen better days) and the steady stream of people ordering made me excited even before I had my first bite.
author: Robin G.

description:
I was suddenly hungry this afternoon, after hunting all over for Bay to Breakers costume items. From far away, I saw Nick's sign and I knew that this was the place to satiate our hunger. We stumbled in, weary and bewildered (thinking and executing a clever costume idea is apparently not our forte) and ordered the following: a small horchata, a small melon agua fresca, and then four tacos -- carne asada, pollo, pescado, and carnitas, all Nick's way. The horchata here really hit the spot, as did the melon agua fresca, which tasted like we were drinking bits of fresh melon. If I were to come back, I might skip the pollo and carnitas tacos (as they were just ok), and get all pescado tacos, Nick's way. Those were so good, so delicious, and hit the hunger spot so hard that I wasn't hungry again until late in the evening.

Can't wait to come back here -- make sure to drop by if you're in the neighborhood!
author: Annie M.

description:
$2 Tacos & $3 margaritas are perfect during out state of economy.  

I had never heard/been here before and was had no idea that they restaurant expands into the club I had checked out once during college (Rouge).  Like previous reviews mentioned, the place gets packed so best to get there during the earlier portion of happy hour if you want to snag a seat.  I had been craving for nachos for a few days so I ordered that and skipped on the cheap tacos (although they looked alright, and a decent size considering they are only $2).  The nachos were great...fresh crisp tortilla chips piled high with salsa, grilled chicken, cheese, and guac.  It was a little over $6 but well worth it.  It totally satisfied my craving.

We were served by Eva Mendes' dead ringer.  Seriously...she could be her double in the movies.  My friend couldn't help herself from complimenting the bartender.  Eva Mendes' twin was cool =)
author: Michelle N.

description:
Essentially, it's absurdly delicious street tacos served in what looks like a strip club with the all the lights on.  The tacos come in chicken, beef, fish, and maybe something else I can't remember.  I always try to get 1 of each.

Their horchata is almost a milkshake, thick with cream and just enough cinamon. The beers they serve are the typical groupo modelo: negra modelo, modelo, and dos equis.
author: Brad K.

description: Yeah, they're really good.  Not sure they quite live up to the hype, but I wasn't  drunk when I ate here.  Hopefully I get a chance to try it when I'm drinking one night.
author: David P.

description: How sad that San Franciscan's can't get real mexican food. Look at Yelp's highest rated and you will see only Taqueria's, stands and trucks. Mexican food is vast and so , so much more than that. It's like saying "crepes are french food". And then the reviews...all these San Franciscan's talk about is chips and salsa and margarita's. Pendejo's.  The solution. Come to the East Bay, where we actually have it.
author: Armando Z.

description:
My friend took me here on my first day back to the city and said "try it Nick's Way." Yum! Their tacos are amazing, 'nuff said. 

Okay just a few things: the lines get long, so be prepared to not sit in. Cash only. And I think that's it.
author: Shauna S.

description:
I've heard a lot of good things about Nick's so I decided to check it out.

First off, I was completely surprised by the interior!  I wasn't expecting to see crystal chandeliers and red plush. That was a nice touch :)
Soo the food!  I got a their chicken taco and it was OK. I think it would have been better if it was cheaper. Maybe I'm just biased because I went to school in San Diego and they have yummy tacos for about half the price :p I had initially wanted the grilled fish taco, but it was EXPENSIVE too :T Almost $5?!??? 

It was pretty dark inside and it felt a tad bit uncomfortable.
author: Kei H.

description:
I have dreams about these tacos.  No, really.

Get them Nick's way, but don't expect traditional Mexican food.  This is about as California-Mexican as you can get, and the margaritas are only $3 all day at the bar area!  I don't recommend coming on Taco Tuesday, though, unless saving $4.00 is worth standing in line for an hour and having to eat your tacos hovering over someone's table.  Other than that, go here!!
author: Erin B.

description:
Nick's Tacos is soooo good! If you ever go there make sure to order them "nicks" style. If you do then it comes over flowing with yumminess. 

I've always ordered just the tacos but my sister decided to go with the nachos, they were not as good as the tacos. Both of the salsas are just delicious. 

The setting is a little weird in that they share the space with a place that turns into a bar at night (Rouge). Thus making the span of time in which you have to get there and eat is limited, unless you can get there during work hours. 

Rouge has drink specials at the time that Nicks is open and this is convenient.
author: Ka C.

description: Completely recommend carnitas & pollo Nick's way tacos. They are crispy and inundated with guacamole and the good stuff. The waiters and cashiers are happy people and the atmosphere is a great for a drink or two as well!
author: Aristides N.

description: I don't entirely understand the hype for this place. I think the tacos are good (especially the carnitas) but am never overwhelmed. There are much better taco places in the Bay Area (Tacolicious, El Farolito in South SF, Pacific Catch). I eat here because it's close to my house but would never make a special trip from farther away just for the food.
author: Amy F.

description: When I saw the Yelp deal for this place I snatched it up with a quickness but didn't get to use it til it almost expired.  I've never been to Nick's but have been to the Taco Shop at Underdog's which serves their tacos Nick's way as well.  I knew Nick's was inside of Rouge but it didn't hit me that it would be so lounge like til after walking in.  It sure is a different feeling feasting on tacos while sitting in plush booths with chandeliers and disco balls all over.  We walked in a little confused, but one of the servers heard us when I asked the hubby if we should just sit down or wait.  She explained that we order at the bar and get a number and sit wherever we want.  Our eyes were way hungrier than our stomachs because we ordered a lot.  I knew I wanted the fried fish tacos (Pescado) Nick's way because it's just amazing.  I love the crunch and soft tortilla and their guac is delicious!  I noticed they had a shrimp taco too so I wanted to try that.  We ended up getting 3 fish tacos, a shrimp taco, a carne asada burrito and elote... yes for the 2 of us.. on top of that we got free chips and salsa for checking in on Yelp, and it was a super fresh very tomatoey salsa. I forgot how filling the tacos were because I was pretty full after just one.  The food comes out pretty fast and it's really fresh.
author: Kymberli C.

description:
Just thinking the name "Nick's Crispy Tacos" makes my mouth water. Makes my heart sing. Makes me so HUNGRY!!!!!! 

OMG this place rocks. Do have a crispy taco.  I get the fish tacos with guac! Ok, then I go back and have another.  Sometimes three!

I am warning you now...they are habit forming and should be the best darn taco in SF.  

GOODNESS has a new friend and its Nick's Crispy Tacos!
author: keith s.

description:
BEST pescado (fish) tacos ever, without a doubt!  I recommend having it "Nick's Way" with everything on it including guacamole & cheese, you won't be sorry.

I got 2 pescado tacos for $11, that's because I had it fully loaded.  Don't let the price turn you the other way, have the tacos your way & I am sure it won't disappoint you!

It's a must try :)
author: Jennie W.

description:
The people who work here are great.  Really efficient and attentive.

Horchata was really grainy and all you get is a mouth full of cinnamon.  The strawberry agua fresca was so watered down and had no fruit flavor at all.  I was really sad because I had nothing to quench my thirst. 

The Pescado was pretty good.  There was definitely too much guac and sour cream, but I can see why everyone raves about this.  But this is definitely not even top 5 on my best tacos list.  It was just okay...

I also tried their chicken quesadilla, which was decent, but again, too much guac and sour cream.  I hate to compare it to El Farolito, but shit, it was like 7-11 quality compared to El Farolto quesadillas.  

Nachos w/ carne asada.  Seriously don't get nachos from here.  They use the shitty fake nacho cheese instead of real cheese.  And the carne asada was really dry and disgusting.  

So if you're a small Asian girl like me, I would suggest getting ONE Pescado Nick's style. And share like another taco with someone else... or just enjoy your taco with a margarita or something.  I really think my meal would have been better with alcohol, but I had to drive home after dinner.  

I wouldn't eat here again.  El Farolito has seriously raised my standards for food.  You can get an El Farolito super burrito for the same price as a Pescado Taco Nick's Way.... wtf man?

Also, WHY IS THIS PLACE ON THE 7X7 LIST?  I'm starting not to believe in that list anymore... -_-
author: Anna T.

description:
Nick's "Baja-Style" Pescado Taco and Pollo Taco are the way to go. I came here after hearing about how good the tacos were, and it totally lived up to its hype. I am not addicted! Its cool how the restaurant is connected to Rouge which turns into a bar/nightclub on the weekends and evenings. The only thing that kinda sucks is the super long line to order and the lack of parking around the area, which is why I knocked 1 star off.


NOTE TO ALL: Nick is now at The Taco Shop @ Underdog's. 

I'd much prefer to go to The Taco Shop because there is more parking and its inside a sports bar so there are a bunch of TVs to entertain you while you eat.
author: Helen Z.

description:
Gross!

Young business traveler looking for some good take out in the area.

$12 for two Taco Bell quality tacos.  This place is a dirtly little hole in the wall.  The interior is so antiquated and the establishment is filthy.  Very trashy crowd as well.  Is this seriously a SF highlight?

My food was nasty and the tacos were cold.  They fell apart , I have no idea what type of mess was on the inside, and the service was bad.

Went to this place bc Obama was in the area hosting a fundraiser.  Once I got to Nob Hill, I couldn't belive that Obama went there.  The area is sketchy and overrun with bums.

SF is nothing like I expected; it is a filthy dirty city.  So much smoke and weed walking down the street no wonder everyone there is so weird, they're all high!  Much more dirty than Chicago where I live, how is that even possible!  Stay away!
author: Sherill M.

description: Good neighborhood standby! Crispy fish tacos are the best in the city. The taco salad was kinda meh.
author: Genevieve W.

description: I lived 3 blocks from here and would go all the time.  LOVE the tacos.  I'm not really a fan of the late night scene here, but for a quick, cheap, and really good bite, it can't be beat.
author: Umesh J.

description:
I've only had their pescado tacos "Nick's way," but they're so goddamn good I don't want to try anything else.  You shouldn't go here for lunch every day unless you're looking for cardiovascular trauma, but on the occasion you're craving a delicious fried, crunchy, taco piled high with guacamole and whatever sauce is in there, go here.  Yep, go taco pile yourself into fried food happiness at Nick's.

p.s.- the atmosphere is unique in a tacky way- do yourself a favor and don't go clubbing here.  And if you do, you probably shouldn't admit to it.
author: Liza W.

description:
After hearing friends talk about this place for years, I finally made it into SF to try it a few weeks back.  I ended up having a pescado taco Nick's way, a carnitas taco Nick's way, and an aguas frescas (watermelon).  Our group also ordered the chips and guacamole as an appetizer.  My friend warned me the tacos (especially Nick's way) were pretty good sized, so I was a little worried that it would be too much food -- but the tacos were so tasty that I ate them all (despite the fact that it WAS a lot of food).  

The prices of the tacos are definitely a little on the pricier side (especially if you get it Nick's way) but they are worth it as a treat every once in a while.  I can see how these tacos would be SUPER YUMMY after a few alcoholic beverages...
author: Kristy S.

description:
Delicious tacos, friendly staff, and cozy atmosphere. Any yes, I went for Taco Tuesday tonight, so I will have to update this review when I've had more than just the Pollo Taco. :-) All I know is that the aftertaste of heavenly tacos is still swimming in my mouth, and I'm tempted to run back up the street for some more of that awesome grub. 


PS- It's cash only.

(To the guy who had to run across the street to take out cash, Nick's has a cash machine inside, right by the ordering area. Teehee)
author: adrienne l.

description: On tuesday, you can grab taco just 2 bucks. If you add on Nicks' way, it would be much better.
author: Hyungsuk O.

description:
I firmly believe that a good taco has healing powers that lesser opiates like tranquilizers and psychoanalysis could never hope to attain.  Hell, even a bad taco can turn your day around.  So when in a sourpuss mood the other day, the Mr. and I decided to go ahead and try this trendy place, in a part of town we spend no time in, adjacent to a bar we had never set foot in.

And we learned that these tacos kick ASS.  My shrimp taco was stuffed with large, juicy prawns and -- since I got it Nick's way - generously blanketed in fresh, flavorful guacamole, all gently nestled in one crispy and then one soft tortilla.  

Eating in Johnny Love's or whatever it is now was a mistake.  Most bars are not pretty during the day, but seeing this place in the sunlight was like seeing a hooker doing her grocery shopping.  Everything is made of plywood spray painted black and silver, and the disquieting matted spots on the velvet booths will leave you wondering, "What is that?"  As your mind runs through the options, your taco enjoyment will be interrupted.  Next time, I'm taking my Mexican sedative on the road.
author: Rosie W.

description:
Not that this place needs another review, but here is my two cents. If you want a good taco Tuesday, this is the place to go.

$2 dollar select tacos, $3 dollars for fish tacos (but worth it). $3 dollar margaritas and cheap beer deals. When I got here there was a huge line, but the wait wasn't too bad because there were servers taking drink orders for people in line waiting AWESOME, this place gets three stars just for that! So i was sipping my margarita and was a happy camper, despite the wait.

The tacos here are huge and worth your money. Get your tacos Nick's way because they add a huge mound of guacamole to it. Also your taco comes with a crispy fried goodness shell and a soft shell with cheese. YUM. I would say 2 tacos and you are would be stuffed. I recommend the fish tacos and the carnitas one. An additional two stars for the food!

The atmosphere is pretty cool because the place is huge. I recommend coming here if you have a big group because it's more fun that way. Don't listen to the negative reviews on the prices of the tacos, because the tacos are pretty big and filling....worth the 3 bucks on taco tuesday if you get it nick's way. Be prepared, however, for a wait. But most places worth trying have a wait anyways.
author: Mai L.

description:
Best tacos in town. If you come on Taco Tuesday, they're a dollar off, but everyone in the area is there, too. Expect a wait!

The tacos are delicious. There's no excuse for not getting them Nick's Way. It's well worth the extra charge.
author: Mark W.

description: Nick's Tacos are some of my favorite in the city.  I love me a nice Taco Tuesday, and always know I'm going to have a great time.  Decently priced and always delicious!
author: Bridget B.

description:
Walking into this dimly lit and chandelier filled restaurant, I first thought, "Oh great, another overpriced taco spot." After approaching the menu on the wall a few seconds later, I realized I was wrong. Everything is well below $10 and for about $14 total, we were both full.

If I lived down the street from this place, I would gain a good amount of weight because I'd likely dine here 3-4 times a week. The Pescado, baja style fish tacos "Nick's Way" are so far the best thing on the 7x7 list. The fish is deep fried in batter than placed in a semi-crispy tortilla with cabbage, some type of sauce and topped with guacamole, jack cheese and a squeeze of lime. I was even surprised to find Elote (grilled corn on the cob with butter, fresh grated cheese and chili powder) on the menu. Ever since I first tried Elote at Cafe Habana in NY, I've been searching long and hard for a place in the Bay Area to fulfill that craving. So glad to have found it here!

I seriously left my heart at Nick's Crispy Tacos. I walked out that door immediately feeling withdrawals. During my meal, I almost bought more tacos even though I was already stuffed. Another plus about this place, it's connected to a bar/ nightclub (was once called Rouge, not sure if it still is) so once you're done ordering your food, you can take your number to your table and grab a cocktail or beer while you're waiting and check out whatevers showing on one of the flat screens.

Verdict: Soooooo good. I'm dying to go back - NOW.
author: Melissa P.

description: Tacos are below average, and nicks style just means smothering in guacamole. It's really stuff you can get at any taqueria, but not as good.
author: Varun S.

description:
OK, so we all know that the best Mexican food is in the Mission.  But if you live up here in the yuppie area of town, who really wants to go all the way down there to get your Mex fix?  Not I.  Enter Nick's Crispy Tacos.  It's your one-stop shop for solid Mexican eats with the comfort of non-shady surroundings (unless you count the creepy red suede booths that are around for when the joint turns into Rouge Nightclub).

Not only do they have pretty tasty tacos & burritos, but the breakfast is pretty good too.  I recently had the breakfast burrito with Andouille sausage, and I very much enjoyed the slight spicy kick to wake me up ion a Sunday morning.  Taco Tuesday are great for some cheap eats as well.

N ice, convenient location on Polk at Broadway, in Russian Hill.
I t's cash-only, so hit up the ATM outside before you go in.
C heap and delicious... like any good Mexican place should be.
K eep away on Tuesdays if you can't handle a crowd.
S olid eats at an affordable price.
author: Kenny L.

description:
Can't wait to go back!  Best margaraita...ever.  But you have to order it from the taco stand, not the bar.

Had the carne asada taco "Nick's way" - one is just right, super delicious! and the corn on the cob with chili and lime mayo with cheese - sounds goofy but it's f**king amazing!  

It was busy and hard to get a table, the line was long.  You'll order first, pay and then take your number to the table where they will deliver it to you when it's ready.  If there's a line, I would suggest ordering a couple of drinks at a time so you don't have to stand in line again and again.
author: Corinne C.

description: For Nob Hill, it's pretty stellar, I guess.  But for good tacos in San Francisco, go elsewhere.
author: Kevin C.

description:
How disappointing. When I first came here in 2010, I thought the tacos were delicious. Came back recently and the quality was sub-par. Maybe it was an off day (Sunday 430pm-ish), but as a restaurant, are you able to have those??

The pescado and chicken pollo were pretty tasteless. I was really bummed about the pescado, was looking forward to some tasty fish tacos and instead got a heaping mess. I love that white sauce, but there was hardly any of it. The fish was much smaller than they usually are and the tortillas were stale. Gross.

Only high point of the meal was $4 draft beers at the adjacent Rouge bar.
author: Yee-Shing W.

description:
Why didn't i buy the yelp deal for this place?  Went here the other night for some tacos and margs.  The ambience was very unique for a place serving tacos, I was into that.  It looks like a Queintin Terrintino movie.  I was a bit shocked at the length of the line stretching all that way across the place but at the same time comforted that the food was going to be amazing.  Which it was.  I was told by a friend that you HAVE to get it Nick's Way, so I did, and now I'm telling you to do the same.  

The margs were a bit lacking, 
but the tacos were to die for.
author: Andrew Christian C.

description:
This place has, hands down, some of the best tacos around. Considering this is more a sports bar than a taquería, I was as surprised as you are.

The positives are many. The meat is fresh, quality and well-spiced. Personally, I preferred the carnitas. They were definitely better than most. The carne asada was only average. Still good, but I wouldn't go here for the carne asada. 

The portion of guacamole is huge and delicious. If you are sick of eating guac that is half tomatoes and want some fresh, avocado-y goodness, this is it. 

The 'Nick's way' tacos are made with a hard shell and a soft tortilla, giving it a great texture. The hard shell is also formed in such a way that you are never in danger of spilling your taco filling all over your lap.

The ratio of various fillings is great and you get loads of meat. Because of the unique shape of the taco, they are able to stuff more filling into your tacos without causing a disaster. Some people are complaining about the beans, asserting that they are just filler and there are way too many. I'd estimate that there are maybe 20 beans in the entire thing, and they impart a subtle flavor and texture without overpowering the taco. It seems to me they are the opposite of filler. You're not getting a pound of tasteless refried crap here: all fresh and flavorful, just like the rest of their ingredients.

It fails to get five stars because the price is a little high (you have to get two tacos minimum and that runs you ten dollars already, sans options or drinks), the beer options are anemic (entirely domestic and common imports you'd find on the grocery store shelf) and the Taco Tuesday dollar tacos are so small as to be a worse value than just getting the regular tacos.

Still, highly recommended and I would go here again. Visit Nick's if you're looking for a place willing to experiment with cheap (but tasty) Mexican food instead of serving the same boring crap you can find in any (every?) taqueria in SF.
author: Benny B.

description:
So after a friend's suggestion I went to Nick's twice in one week, which is more than I had ever gone before.

On the first occasion the bartender was sweet, and the $10 pitchers were a steal. The carnitas nachos I ordered were fine, but I was surprised by the ballpark cheese. Really? Maybe I'm becoming a Mission hipster privy to too many good El Farlito burritos.

On the second visit I tried the fried fish burritos. Def. an improvement. Though $7.75 for a burrito? I know I'm frugal to some degree, but seriously, if it weren't for the chandeliers I'd feel a little ripped off.

One more down on the bucket-list.
author: David J.

description:
Taco Tuesdays, hands down best Tuesday night activity.

$2 tacos, $18 pitchers of margaritas, young/hip/attractive crowd (and by that I mean CROWD - like by 9pm there is no room anywhere, sitting or standing), sports games showing on multiple screens, and fun atmosphere.

Rouge and Nick's Crispy Tacos are combined, I guess. Anyway, fun times here on Tuesdays.
author: Lina L.

description: Love the idea of eating breakfast with my 5 yr old in a nightclub with. Ha! Red walls and chandaliers are a beauty. The food was just okay ...not very mexican but yes edible. Sauces were not spicy enough for a spicy girl.
author: E. Y. G.

description: I miss this place, the salsas, the crispy tacos done Nicks Way, the agua fresca.  it was never better.
author: jed p.

description:
Tacos and quesadillas are $2 each. You can order a pitcher of beer or individual beer bottles. There are tvs at the bar displaying sports games. Overall a casual, relaxed atmosphere. Came here on a weekday night and it was packed.

Restrooms are okay, though they're small for a place that fills up fast and holds many people, and the mirror is oddly placed above the urinals instead of at the sink.
author: Carl Z.

description: Decent...I got a veggie burrito, and it turned into more lettuce than anything else...I remember it being a bit expensive, but we do live in SF. Anyways, overall, good. I wouldn't go back for the food, but if I was in the bar, I would order it again.
author: Maryam R.

description:
Finally got to sample the tacos at Nick's.  They're pretty good.  Ordered two big ass carne asada tacos and one pescado taco.  Their pescado taco beats any other fish taco in the city? One taco was enough to fill me up and the hubs ate the rest.  

Oh and i couldnt stop laughing when the dude that took my order kept calling me "homegirl".
author: Lauren S.

description:
Not much to say that hasn't already been said.

Great tacos at a reasonably affordable price, but remember that it is cash only so you'd better not be bringing your plastic, they will probably laugh at you.

If you haven't already, be sure to try their breakfast burritos before 3PM, in my opinion it's the unsung hero of their menu and worth at least a try.
author: Richard T.

description:
I admit it, after reading all the other reviews on Nick's Crispy Tacos I expected to be more of a dive! The place has character, red booths, full bar ect. 

Don't even bother ordering a reguar taco, you need to get it "Nick's way," crispy and covered in guacamole goodness. I was super impressed with all the options -  cane asada, chicken, fish and even the camerones were of really good quality. Much better that that of the average tacqueria! The taquitos are really good and not too greasy which is ofter the problem with taquitos. The green salsa is my fav. I also got the top shelf margarita ($6) whooo it was strong! I would argue I got my money's worth of tequila. However, they also had a $3 House margarita. 

So glad I listened to all the other yelpers and finally tried this place. 

TIP - Cash only, be prepared!
author: Marissa P.

description: Veggie tacos were good. Went with a friend who had one of those online deals. We got a lot of food and drinks for a decent price.
author: Taryn O.

description:
I'd like to find something "good" to say about Nick's but I can't.
Nacho's had "Velveeta" cheese. My burrito was missing ingredients, when I brought this to their attention I rec'vd a "shrug" and...we can give it to you on the side. All in all the service and the food is terrible (the club interior is kinda cool).
author: Brian C.

description:
While visiting SF for the night my friend and I went to Nicks.  This place is a lot of fun with great ambiance and decent food.  We got tacos and weren't disappointed.  We also tried the margaritas of different flavors, I think the raspberry was the best.  

Happy hour was a great deal, cheap and yummy (just how happy hour should be!)
author: Elizabeth R.

description:
Are you serious?  Idk...maybe i really just have had better because I couldn't figure out what all the rave was about.  I ordered a fish taco and eh it was okay.  I mean for 5.95 I thought I would get a good one but it was just okay!  I got a chicken taco Nick's way and it just didn't have enough crunch to it.  I also shared a basket of chips with salsa and guac and mmm those were yummy but thats what I enjoyed the most!

Service was awesome as the food came out really fast.  The decor is really cute but after all, it is club Rouge at night time.  But hmmm I must've missed something because I think my favorite taqueria actually delivered a tastier taco.
author: Mary-Anne C.

description:
Nick's is awesome.  DON'T GO ON TUESDAYS THOUGH.  Just don't do it----it's this stupid thing in San Francisco where everyone says "Hey, let's go to Nick's for Taco Tuesday because you get like a buck off a taco."  This is stupid thinking.  1)  You will wait in line forever and a day, 2) there will be no where to sit.  It's worth paying an extra dollar for this reason---don't fall for the yuppie propaganda.

Assuming you go any other day, the food is great.  I really like their new salads and their taco's (if you get them nick's way) are really delicious and different.
author: Raman R.

description: I ordered nachos and got the same sort of pasty cheese you'd get from concessions at a high school football game.  They charge money for this crap?
author: Brendan W.

description:
Can I please give this place 10 stars? please?  We were staying in Union Square and took the cable car to Broadway and walked 2 blocks down hill to this killer place.  Yes, there was a line to order food (about 15 deep) but it only took 5-10 minutes to get to the front of the line.  We ordered a carne asada taco (nick's way), chips & salsa & a bean burrito.  We took our number and sat down at the bar to wait for our food.  Happy Hour was going on (on a Sat night!) and beers were $2, margaritas (STRONG ones) were $3 - sweet!  Food came over and I was sooooo happy.  Hubby was bummed as they brought out some type of shredded meat burrito - he was really wanting a bean one but didn't feel like waiting for a new one to be whipped up.  Still, he was happy with what he got.

The place itself is super chill - red velvet walls, crystal chandeliers and big screen TVs playing whatever game is on.  The crowd was 100% 25-35 year olds.  Would LOVE to be able to go there again....
author: H G.

description:
It is a little expensive for tacos, but that is about all the bad stuff I have to say about Nicks Crispy Taco's

After buying a Living Social Coupon for Nick's I went there for dinner with a buddy and ordered 2 tacos. I went with the Fried Fish and Shrimp Tacos Nicks Way. They were amazing, Slathered in Guac with wonderful fresh ingredients. I have no doubt that any of their tacos would kick some serious butt. 2 tacos for about $10 bucks got me almost full, they are bigger than your usual taqueria taco but still 3 would be the ideal amount. 
Even better, free chips and salsa would have done the trick. That did strike a bad chord with me as well. I believe that it is an unalienable right to free chips and salsa at Mexican food spots and they tried to charge $1.25 for them.

All in all i would say give it a try, and hassle them to give you free chips and salsa.
author: Josh B.

description: The tacos were definitely crispy, and delicious, the burritos were good too and very filling!
author: Hamel K.

description: I absolutely LOVE their tacos! I usually order carnitas tacos "nicks way" Their guacamole is creamy AND has wonderful chunks of avocado. 2 tacos and a side of chips & salsa will set you back about $10
author: Maria M.

description:
I went on a monday night and saw a comedy show they would have charged 30$ for at the punchline and cobbs. The comedians were having a good time and made me feel comfortable as an audience member. The shows was free and even though the tacos were good the comedy really made the spot. I will be returning any monday I can at 9:30
good times
author: Luke L.

description:
Pretty great. 

More of a gourmet style taco joint.

Taco Tuesdays are out the door. 

Make sure you get them Nick's way!

The decor kinda reminds me of a scene straight out of Casino. Awesome.
author: Pamela R.

description:
Yay for some very tasty fried fish tacos! Thank God I live on the other side of town or I would come here more often...

Ambiance is so-so as it wait staff, but you don't go to this kind of restaurant for those things: you come for the damn good tacos.
author: Mary L.

description: Love Nick's and their crispy veg tacos.  Perfect afternoon food on a lazy sat/sun with a Blue Moon or agua fresca, and great for game day.
author: K G.

description: Burrito de pescado like they do in San Diego!! Been looking for this up in SF for years. So happy right now. Going back to eating now. Nom nom nom nom
author: Pris C.

description: Solid tacos and drinks for good prices. Great ambiance. Gets crowded like a party.
author: Dillon L.

description:
One word: Bliss

Expect to wait in line at Nick's- it's really good and people know it. 

Walking into Nick's for the first time is a little confusing- it's connected to Cub Rogue and you can sit on either side awaiting your food. 

I'd recommend, of course, the crispy tacos. Order them "Nick's Way" and your taco will be enveloped in a wonderful combination of cheese and tortilla; unbeatable. 

The beef, chicken, and grilled fish are the best. Fried fish is a little much. 

Also, get a pitcher of margaritas from the Rogue side, for $18 you get about 6 drinks. Or, if you're there while the margaritas are still $3 you'll also get 6 drinks...with a little more alcohol and a little less ice. 

If you don't have time or patience to wait in the line you can always to take-out.
author: Erin G.

description: Love the carnitas taco Nick's way. I love this place because it has so much character. The happy hour Don Julio margaritas for $7 are lovely. If you have never had a Nick's crispy taco, you must go.
author: Claudia O.

description: I want to give Nicks 2.5 stars but I can't, and surely they don't deserve 3. Maybe I'm spoiled from living in az and having so many taco shops at my finger tips.  To start off the aguas frescas were flavorless and just plan horrible.  I asked for a carne asada and pollo asado taco, I should have just asked for two black bean tacos because that is all I got.  Also, charging for chips and salsa is BS.  If you have had too much to drink and taco bell is out of your reach then stop by Nicks.
author: Paco V.

description: Food is good, but the service sucks. The wait staff drops off your food and don't  even say a word to you. They don't ask if you need anything.  bartender was good.
author: Jenny L.

description:
so i finally came here for taco tuesdays with some friends and the overall experience was pretty fun.  i didnt know so many people came out to happy hour on tuesdays.  maybe im a granny

nicks is actually a window.  the place is rouge, a club, therefore the red, mirror, chandelier gawdiness.  we came in and its packed.  we figured that we order the tacos first then find a seat.  luckily we knew the GM and he saved a table for us.  we got many death stares from people who were waiting near the booth to snatch it but whatevers.

ordering is a bit weird.  they have two registers but only one girl taking orders.  the other two people are facilitating?  i dont know.  to clarify on taco tuesdays only certain tacos are $2 (all except the seafood ones) and nicks way is an additional .95 so unless you want a guac-less cheese-less taco then no one is really paying $2.  i ordered one pascado (fried fish at the regular price of  $3.95 + .95 for nicks way) and one pollo asado. and also the corn.

the meal was decent.  i could definitely see how it can be too much.  but with the margaritas, it was perfect.  the waitresses kept coming around to see if we needed more drinks.  pitchers of margarita were $15 or $3 a glass.  coronas for 2 for $5.

in all honesty i could only really finish one taco.  then i had to take bites of the fish one because everyone said it was the best.  because i bit the end, i got more fried stuff than fish.  maybe if i had gotten to the meatier part it wouldve been better.  the corn is spicy.  and yes its steamed not grilled.  but it is very ... juicy. messy.  and spicy.  my mouth was on fire afterwards.

all in all a pretty good time.
author: claudia y.

description: Go for the quesadilla nick's way, and you will not be disappointed. Crunchy and jam packed with amazing fresh ingredients. Throw in $10 pitchers of any beer you want, and this place is a solid destination for happy hour and a mellow night out. Not the fanciest place, but fun and affordable.
author: Ryan M.

description:
Came here last weekend to give their famous fish tacos a try.  

Unfortunately, this was the last stop of a food filled day, and I was already incredibly full walking into this place.
