And being the fatty I am, I ordered a fish taco anyways just for the sake of trying it.  Given the reviews and word of mouth, I had high expectations; however, the fish taco wasn't that great.  It wasn't bad, but I've definitely had better.  The batter got just a little too soggy for me and it's overall taste was just ok.  I also managed to take a bite of my friend's carnitas taco.  That one tasted a little better, but still nothing out of the ordinary.

I would be willing to come back to give other items a try.  3 stars for now.
author: Lori K.

description:
So, I know that it all has been said about Nick's & The Rogue as far as the Atmosphere and How incredible Nicks Taco's are.. 

BUT the one thing you guys don't know is that Nick's on Monday Night Turns into San Francisco's premier Comedy Open Mic... Ok here's the BEST part... IT's FREE! 

That's Right.. You Heard me.. The Best of the Bay Area Comics with the legendary Tony Sparks The Godfather of Comedy here in the Bay!... 

So what's your excuse now? 

Great Food, Atmosphere, Drink Specials & NOW Comedy! 

So do yourself a favor & live a Little! 

I don't know about you.. but writing all this makes me hungry and thirsty!
author: Paul B.

description: Pretty solid tacos, especially Nick's Way, but the way they serve them means all the guac and a lot of the good stuff is sitting at one of the taco, which is kind of annoying.  Spread it all over with a fork and we're in business.
author: Niall H.

description: Tons of people flock here for the Tuesday night specials!
author: Andrew B.

description:
Oh, Nick...  I can not deny that your food is delicious.  Your Nick's way tacos, of all meat options, are some of the better things to ever visit my mouthhole.  Your salsas are grade A, and your food is good enough to make it worth standing in the usual line that forms outside.

That being said, your prices are criminal, and your staff is rude and unhelpful.  Without fail, they throw our entire order in a bag after I request it be separated.  Nick, there are these people called vegetarians who don't appreciate their food soaked in meat juice.  There are also people who don't eat pork and would rather not have the juice from your (delicious) carnitas on their hands.

Without exaggeration, I request the separation of our order every time I call, and it hasn't happened once.  This is not just bad service, it's offensive.  Almost as offensive as the cost of your food.

Nick, I love the tacos, but please stop smoking crack.  It's affecting your business.
author: Adrian L.

description:
I had HIGH expectations for this place, since my gf and her roommate have been talking about it for a while now.  It's a very confusing venue on the corner of a busy street - bar, restaurant, club/lounge ... it's like it can't decide what it wants to be. Moving on...

We got a ton of food: 4 tacos (1 carne asada nick's way, 1 carnitas nick's way, 1 reg carne asada, 1 pollo asada) and a carne asada burrito.  Let's start with the tacos ... I thought the carnitas nick's way was bomb.  Super juicy and flavorful carnitas and the taco had a great textural combo with the meat, soft/hard taco, cheese, and guac.  The carne asada and pollo asada were let-downs for me.  It was really dry, tough, and plain tasting.  For around $4 a taco, I'm expecting top notch meat and a FAT serving of food.  I can see how people think this place is legit, especially after day drinking and having drunk muchies though.  The burrito was also mediocre.  Same ingredients stuffed into a big flour tortilla.  

I guess it might be worth going back on taco tuesday, but I would not go back during normal hours.  

Bottom line: food is mediocre, price is ridiculously high, lines can be insane.
author: Phil L.

description:
Not a bad place to get some cheap ($) tacos but not the best that I've had so far.... obviously you get what you pay for.. it's $4 taco.. you cannot expect the world but you can expect to be pleasantly surprised... i've enjoyed my pescado taco and camarones taco... two bites and DONE!!!

Anyways, i recommend it for the sole reason that the cashier showed me how to get cash back from Walgreens across the street without paying the ATM fee using their machine inside the store.. remember folks, it is CASH only...
author: Mark R.

description:
Okay, Taco Tuesday. I get it. But last Tuesday was ridiculous. It was my first time here for a friend's bday. If there wasn't an occasion involved, I would have walked-in, walked out. 

The reason? The place is out-of-control packed! For single people ready to mingle, this is probably a great thing. Lots of young profs ready for happy hour. Great times. For everyone else, not so much.

I swindled my order for a taco in with a friend who was near front of the 30-min long line. After ordering, we had our tacos within a couple of minutes and they were great! 

As far as taco-tuesday situations go, the tacos here are above average. I'd like to come again... maybe on a different day. I'd rather pay a few more bucks to sit down while I eat.
author: Rachel L.

description:
For those of you who do not know the difference between a bad decision and a poor decision, don't despair. I do, and I have come to spread the gospel.

A bad decision is something that SEEMS like a good idea, and then in retrospect was probably an unwise move. For example, say you're AEG Live, the renowned concert promoter, and you've just landed a deal for 50 back-to-back London shows with a superstar and everything is just fine and dandy until said star goes kaput. Now you're fucked.

A poor decision is something that you KNOW is dumb, but you convince yourself otherwise for the sake of adventure or just plain stupidity. For example, you and your husband choose to have cameras invade the everyday lives of you and your eight children, and then you wind up divorcing when fame and the pressure from a lack of privacy siphons off any remaining breathing room you two had left.

Easy enough, right?

This past Saturday, at the end of a very long bar crawl, I made both a bad decision and a poor decision, although admittedly the overabundance of alcohol contributed to both.

The poor decision occurred at the Buccaneer when I decided to take a random dixie cup shot of tequila-looking liquid that had been sitting on the bar for at least as long as we had been there. Unsurprisingly, I had to grab a few napkins and make a beeline for the front door. 

The bad decision came a short time thereafter at Nick's. I had been drinking for four hours, that morning I had run ten miles, and I was starving. I'd had their crispy tacos before, and enjoyed them. The amount of guac and cheese would make any Mexican food lover happy. But this was not Taco Tuesday, and no skimpy little taco would do. Super Burrito done crispy style? Fantastic! Everything you love about the tacos, but MORE. After I finished, I decided that it would be a good idea to have a second. And so I did. Two super burritos in the span of half an hour. Delicious, but a 24-hour food coma is never pleasant.

Regardless, whether you're up to no good or you're just a little hungry, Nick's is the place to go. And sure, they may be famous for their tacos, but try their super burrito. If you only have one, it's definitely a smart decision.
author: Devon S.

description:
Ok, I gotta say I was pretty disappointed with Nick's. I went there with my friends who worship this place and I ordered the nachos...paid for extra meat and it was just 'ok.' How can you mess up freakin' nachos? The guac was bogus and I was bummed out. I went there after going to the How Weird fastival on Howard Street and I don't think I'll be back. Pancho's, down the street is cheaper and better. I have yet to have a kick ass nachos experience in this city. My friends ordered burritos and I had a bite of that and it was really good, so I have to give Nick's some credit.

The ambience is pretty sick and you can order any drink you want at the bar, which is always good times. They need to add more cheese to their nachos and make better salsa for sure. I guess I'm a picky girl when it comes to my food, but come on...that is what nachos are, right?

The beef is good though, I did go to town on that for sure. Just wished I had that religious experience everyone else seems to have at Nick's. It was pretty busy, so maybe I'll try it again, hell...it's in my neighborhood and I refuse to go down to Victor's for pizza, everyone loves that place too and I'm like WTF? Amici's is way better and I know we're supposed to support our local peeps, but get it right man!

Sigh...talking about all this food makes me hungry...need to get to work and get some chow.
author: Tina C.

description:
Where do we begin... so here's the run down -- if you've never been here before, i think it's worth a visit on taco Tuesday's. Tacos for 2 bucks and a couple of other great deals; fun environment with a packed crowd, how can you go wrong on a Tuesday. I don't recommend the Margaritas, since there's absolutely no alcohol in it. I can put down two pitchers with no buzz.

On a side note, the pescada (however you spell fried fish) burrito is amazing! I've never had anything like it before, pretty damn good!
author: Joanna N.

description: Best prawn tacos! Have to come here every time I'm in SF. Cash only tho!
author: Natalie C.

description: I'm pretty sure I got food poisoning from Nicks beef tacos. This makes me so sad because their tacos are really good. But when you only eat Nicks and then have food poisoning the following morning what are you expected to believe. I ate here on NYE and perhaps the beef was old or the chef was away for the holidays. I'll be going back eventually, but it's going to take some time to build my trust back. In the meantime I hope they clean up and serve safer food.
author: Heather J.

description: This place is alwayyyyys packed! I have to give it 3 stars for food, it's nothing special but I will give it 5 stars for ambience, entertainment, and pricing on the food. Plus you can beat the deal where if you check into Nicks on your smartphone you get free chips/salsa!!
author: Natasha I.

description:
I used to come to Nick's a lot, but lately, it's just been too much of a trek for dinner.

 My favorite is the grilled fish Nick's Way. I find the fried fish to be too greasy even though it's the fan favorite.

It's a cool spot and a fun place to go with friends. I just don't usually feel like dealing with the crowds on Tuesdays...
author: Abbey S.

description: Great tacos and amazing atmosphere. In a great section of town. Bomb asada tacos. Do not miss this place. The seating is really great and they have really good drink specials during with week.
author: Clayton A.

description:
Nick's Crispy Taco Tuesdays are definitely worth the $2 dollars and the wait. I had the vegetarian ones (Guac, pinto beans, onions, cabbage, corn, salsa - maybe more) and they were great - possibly better then homemade!!! Also the $3 dollar beer specials make them that much better. I had 2 tacos, and 2 beers and was satisfied!

only downfall - its crowded and seating is difficult to find, but that's expected so either arrive early or be willing to eat standing :)
author: Harvinder K.

description:
Order the crispy fish tacos. They're delicious and two are enough for dinner. I liked the ambiance of this place. It's casual - you order at the counter and get served at your table - but nicely decorated.

I was disappointed with the margaritas. They were not very good.
author: Amy K.

description:
As you can see, people have been raving about their pescado tacos .. and they are correct, it's pretty darn good.

I kinda had mixed feelings about eating tacos at a place I've always known as a nightclub. On top of that, the music was loud, there were tons of people at the bar and it was pretty crowded. It was like eating tacos at a nightclub with the lights on. The vibe was good, very positive. If you're looking for a sit down place, then good luck finding a table, but if you're looking for some good hardy tacos, nick's is the place to be! Pescado!!!
author: Rosie W.

description:
To be fair, I didn't step into Nick's to soak in the full experience, but what I did experience was a Crispy taco done Nick's way that was soaked too long in grease.  

I enjoyed the crunch of the taco and the ingenuity of the outer soft taco layer (did Taco Bell do this first?), and it would be a sin to whine about excessive guac, but after complete consumption, a Nick's diner is left with a greasy pool IN the tum and a meaty, guac-y mess ON the tum.

Not bad, but regrettable.
author: Jane L.

description: Over rated. fun scene that gets packed early but the tacos are greasy and dull. The Salsa has no punch nor deep flavors. if your under 30, don't have a job and hungry worth hanging out here but otherwise look elsewhere.
author: David B.

description:
I've been here 3 or 4 times since moving to San Francisco and am absolutely in love with the Pescado taco. I'm usually not a fried fish taco fan, but they fry that fish like no other! It's light and crispy (hate a soggy breaded fish) and the toppings complement it wonderfully!

I've had the Pescado Nick's way (w/a crispy tortilla, guac and jack cheese) and regular - theyr'e both great depending on your mood. Not into fish? I thought the Carnitas taco was pretty good too, except I prefer it regular...the cheese was overkill.
author: Karena Q.

description: Not only was the food not very warm, the dining room was super cold. The namesake tacos were pretty bland. I enjoyed the nachos a little bit and the red decor. I wouldn't call it authentic Mexican, but it's definitely authentic bar food intended to be consumed by drunks.
author: Raymond D.

description:
There's enough reviews to go over so I'll just hit the major points.

1. Get the tacos and get them "Nick's Way"
2. Unless you're cheap and like horde's of people, don't go on Tuesday.
3. No you can't order food at the bar, there's a system, get over it.
4. The taco's are freaking amazing, especially with beer (from said bar)
5. There's plenty of TV screens to watch sports
6. This place made "7x7's 100 Things to Eat in SF" list, and rightfully so.

ENJOY.
author: H H.

description: Albert Einstein once said, 'Any intelligent fool can make things bigger and more complex... It takes a touch of genius - and a lot of courage to move in the opposite direction'. Nick's Crispy Tacos is an example of this testament when it comes to their fish tacos.  The simple fresh ingredients prepared with thought and care makes these tacos one of the best if not THE BEST fish tacos I've ever had.
author: James M.

description:
Each of the taco options is unique and flavorful.  They are HUGE - I ordered three, but two would have been just fine.  Loved the grilled fish and carne asada and my friend was a big fan of the carnitas. 

Preparation-wise, "Nick's Way" is the way to go - add guacamole, melted cheese, and a crispy, double-decker layer to any taco and you have a winning recipe.  

Can get busy and seating is somewhat limited, so weeknights and off-hours are probably better if you don't want to wait.  Space is pleasant and clean. Service is friendly, but no-frills.  Just be prepared to be there for the food, not the atmosphere. Definitely worth a trip (and a return visit, for me!).
author: Lindsay N.

description: Any taco Nick's way is delicious. One of my favorite low key spots to go! Taco Tuesday is cheap, fun, and crowded. Get there early and still expect to wait in line, wait for a table, or eat standing up. Despite the crowd, I'm there a lot!
author: C B.

description:
I live right down the street from this place. It is popular. But overrated. It also looks like a dimly lit whore house. Not that i'd know what a whore house looks like. But i can imagine it'd be like this.

anyway, for tacos take the Muni and get to the Mission. I heart Mission.
author: amit s.

description: Best tacos EVER!  I crave the beer battered fish tacos and cant wait to have them next time I'm back in the bay.  Get 'em "Nick's Way"!
author: Madny L.

description:
I suppose I shouldn't have ventured down Polk Street for tacos on a Friday night, but I really wasn't expecting to fight over table space with a bunch of drunken frat boys in a taco shop. Ultimately, I had to take my food to go, and I suspect it would have been better consumed fresh. Mexican food + takeout containers + multi-block hike = soggy. On the other hand, the burrito I ordered lasted for three meals. 

I didn't like: 

1. Paying extra for condiments 
2. Waiting in line forever for tacos 
3. Drunken douche-bags cutting in front of me in line (but I suppose that's not Nick's fault; however, this is the clientele you will find there) 
4. No table space as per everyone camping out and drinking, because when you get down to it, Nick's is a bar that serves tacos, not a taqueria that serves booze. 

I believe tacos should be consumed in cramped, sweaty, often questionable environments. If the threat of food poisoning is not present, then chances are I am not either. The moral of the story: If you want good tacos, go to an authentic taqueria. If you want to pick up a date with your tacos, go to Nick's.
author: Tash T.

description:
Being rung up for $9 tacos by 19 year old hipster boys in tight pants is never a good sign.  It's like the creepy music in horror flicks warning you that the virginal cheerleader is about to meet her maker via a chainsaw.  Tight pants, Ray-Bans, and Scarves on Cashier @ Taco Joint = BAD THINGS ARE ABOUT TO HAPPEN!

I want you to be decent Mexican food within 5 blocks of my house, Nick's, I do.  But how any combination of tortillas, beans, and salsa can be so mediocre, I don't know.  Your fish tacos are just adequate, leaving me to bus 45 minutes to the Mission if I want even psuedo-authentic tacos.  Siiiigh...
author: Sarah J.

description:
Their Pescado/Fried Fish Taco and Burrito are super good..

Awesome bar and crowd
author: irwin v.

description:
WOW.  TOwards the end of my 30 day drinking stint, i came by anyway and had a burrito (burrito? at nik's TACOS.. blasphemy i know).

either way it was AMAZING.  seriously beat half the crappy burritos i hear people touting out in the mission.

delicious and good.  Well done Nick, well done.
author: Joseph F.

description: Super crowded on their Taco Tuesdays but they are worth the wait!
author: Adal B.

description:
I echo what Laurence W said, there's definitely a reason why it's not called Nick's Crispy Tacos and Burritios" The tacos were amazing, the burritos, not so much. 

My friends and I were suppose to eat at another place for lunch but after failing to find parking for two hours, we just decided to eat whatever restaurant was closest to the next parking spot we could find. This is how we came here. 

First of all, we were starving so I can't really say whether it was really good because it was that good, or I was just that hungry. Anyway, that being said, I still think this place was pretty good. The tacos are yummy yummy yummy. The chips and salsa are good too. I don't know what it is but it just tasted awesome. I ordered the carne asada burrito, thinking you can't go wrong with a classic. It wasn't bad, but it wasn't great either.  For a burrito that "comes with everything", I felt like I was just eating a rice and meat burrito. Even though I was starving, I wasn't blown away by the burrito. But everything else was great. AND cheap. yay for Nick's

FYI, this place is CASH ONLY.
author: Diana Y.

description:
Really don't know how to begin this review because everyone seems to enjoy this taco shack.  I ordered the revered pescado taco and ...  it just didn't "wow" me at all.  It was edible, very thick breading but crunchy.  The guacamole topping was average and the filling in the taco was nothing memorable.  For the price of $5.50 per a taco, I got to say I had way better and fresher fish.

As for the decor, that's up for you to decide.
author: julia c.

description:
Order the Pescado taco "nick's way," elote and an horchata.  So good!

Tacos are pretty huge...but at $4.50 per taco, they should be.
author: Eleanor D.

description: Overall a good place.  Great happy hour specials and a nice crowd.  Plenty of nearby options if you want to bar hop.  The tacos are not that big a deal.  I will not be going back for the tacos but I will go back for the drink specials.  Ambiance makes the place.   Emphasis should be on the word lounge.
author: Jesse H.

description: I don't know, maybe it was b/c I wasn't hungry but the tacos were just OK. I've had Nick's tacos before (the one by 19th Ave) and they never disappoint but for some reason, these were...eh. The decor was amazing though (better than the one by 19th Ave). We just ordered like 4 tacos and it was over $20, man.
author: Lily W.

description:
If you want to try Nick's Tacos, you have to order it Nick's Way.  You get the best of both worlds - a fried taco encased in a soft taco smothered in cheese and avocados.  YUMMMM!  You couldn't ask for anything better!  The only thing missing though was that they didn't serve the tacos with a side of lime...so we had to "take" some from the bar area.  The salsa were tasty as well...complemented every bite!  

The only wierd thing about this place is that it's attached to the night club Rouge.  So you probably have to go there during the day to enjoy these tasty tacos in peace.
author: Michelle F.

description:
Definitely a local favorite among the bar crowd nursing a hangover from the night before.

This place offers high quality "American" Mexican food. Nothing too spicy or really fantastic - decent margaritas. 

The chips with salsa and guacamole and nachos are the best bang for your buck.
author: Kate F.

description: The burritos here are phenomenal and consistent. The red sauce is also best in the business. Their homemade chips are the best I've ever had. I would recommend Nicks to anyone.
author: C T.

description: Had the vegetarian tacos. They were very tasty, and I like how they wrap the crispy taco in a soft taco so if the crispy taco breaks apart, the soft taco can contain the spillage. Only problem was that the crispy taco is a little chewy.
author: Nithin R.

description: Sooo good! I have 4 words for you: Carne Asada Nicks Way...
author: Limor B.

description:
I live right on the other side of the hill from Nick's, but it's taken me a year to actually go in thanks to a Yelp deal offered a little while ago. I'm not going to lie, I was pretty excited to try it because my friends all rave about it.

The fish tacos were good! mmm especially Nick's way with guacamole on top. I'm from LA, so good tacos are a must, and the crispy fish tacos are pretty good (the nachos too). BUT, although the food was really good, I'm not sure if I would be willing to spend that much on tacos again. Ok, well, on the tacos, yes, but on the type of establishment, no. It's cool if tacos are a buck and you're standing at a taco truck, but to wait in a line for 20 minutes, then have to fight for a table AND pay such high prices...maybe not.

Also, I was a little upset that the guy who took my order didn't tell me that I could purchase cocktails at the register, and ended up wasting money buying drinks at the separate bar (though, not too much was wasted, so I can't say I'm too upset). It would have been nice to know...

Though, overall, it was a good first experience!
author: kittCAT L.

description:
Huh?  I thought I wrote a review on this place a long time ago?  Um, okay.

Anywho, I used to work in the area and would come here for lunch.  It was always pretty busy, okay tasting, and as I remember...more on the greasy side.  Then again, I haven't eaten here in about 4 years, so maybe it's tastier now? Dunno.

~Wow, now that's a useful review!! Not. lol ~
author: Ladi Da A.

description:
Chips and salsa with guacamole - delicious.  The chips were crispy, fresh, and not too thick and not too thin.  
Chicken taco, Nick's way - omfg yum.
Jalepeno poppers - cheese in them was like nacho cheese, kinda weird.  I prefer cream cheese in poppers.  But they were piping hot and fresh.

I love this place and will be taking out of towners here if they crave a hearty taco.
author: Light Bulb J.

description:
Really fun place to go.  Tacos and burritos are quite delicious.  HIghly recommend to add the guacamole, otherwise the tacos are a little plain.  Outrageously ugly decor but I guess it's part of the charm.
Tuesday nights are always super packed!
author: Sven H.

description: I'm giving this venue 1 star, because my deep-fried shrimp tacos were pretty good; However, the service is absolutely terrible! My friends and I made reservations before hand, and once we arrived we were told to go inside and come back out closer to our reservation time-- weird! So we come back out, and the bouncers let a group of what seemed to be under-age girls in before us, and that group arrived AFTER us and their reservation time was after ours. We were pissed, to say the least. After complaining to the bouncers, we had to wait another 30 minutes for a table. Once we were seated, we were further disappointed by our waiter's service! Talk about a lack of customer service! The tacos at Nick's are OK-- not the best. I would never waste my time going there again.
author: Pele T.

description: Like everyone else, I friggin' love this place. It's right around the corner from my favorite tattoo shop (the diamond club). Beware, it's cash only. Can't tell you how many times I've had to run across the street to get cash from the Walgreens store. All the menu is amazing but I personally like the carnitas taco and make sure to get it Nick's way. So good. And the green salsa in the squeeze bottle? Not hot but really good. This is a place that is truly San Francisco.
author: Kevin G.

description:
Nick's Crispy Tacos can be considered a Taco Bell or Del Taco from the 70's, Decor is Disco Duck meets Velvet Underground. Totally over the top. Must have been a bargain for the materials.

Tacos served on wax paper in a plastic basket. Hmmm. I am not sure about this. It is saving me money I believe, and it stays clean because the wax paper is not reused I hope. Not a sit-down candlelight romantic experience. Food is tasty, though. I like the fish tacos and the pescero tacos. I am all about the crunch. The taco must be delicate, not fall apart in your mitts on first bite, and not be so thick and tough that it makes tiny cuts in you gums and cheeks when you chew them. Pass for all of these concerns.  Not drinking now, so I have no review for the alcohol.
author: Ushra M.

description: Had the pleasure of coming here during a weekend in San Fran. The beef tacos are tasty and fresh. The food came fast and is cheap. I will definitely come again the next time I'm in the neighborhood.
author: Nichel B.

description:
Grilled fish taco's are amazing! Get them, "Nick's way" (mmmm guacamole and cheese). If you ever come to San Francisco, you should definitely stop by.

so..you come in and order at the counter on the right and pay first. They give u a number and you seat yourself. 

The 2 sauces on the table are de-lish!  I think the red sauce is the best. They have lots of booth seating and flat screens with the games showing so I guess that's a plus.       

oh and CASH ONLY!
author: chloe c.

description: Not sure what else I can add that others havent already talked about. $3 for an amazing taco with lots of meat and guacamole... You have a choice of al pastor, chicken, and steak... I think I liked the chicken the best, the al pastor the least. Three tacos make you extremely full, especially if you are drinking the beers (2 for $6) that they quickly serve you (while you wait in line). On a Tuesday at 6:30, there isn't really any place to sit and eat, but the food, music, service, and atmosphere are all good. I will love it when I can go back :)
author: Kimberly S.

description:
Now normally I wouldn't give 5 stars to a place with crappy ambience but the food at Nick's is so amazing, I cannot in good conscience not give it 5/5. 

If you like taco's, simply put, you will love Nick's Crispy Taco's. Assuming you live in the Russian Hill/Pacific Heights/Nob Hill/Marina area, Nick's is conveniently located at Polk and Broadway, and is always worth a stop in if you are in the region. I often find myself having to stop for at least one taco is if I get north of Clay Street for whatever reason! 

I would highly suggest getting a taco "Nick's Way" (with guacamole), it is still affordable. As many have pointed out, you don't need to get more than 2, and they have a great selection of different types.

As I said before, yes, the ambience is extremely awkward (as many have pointed out, its in a trashy club that I wouldn't be caught dead in otherwise), but there is simply no excuse not to love Nick's if you enjoy Mexican-American cuisine!

Over and out.
author: Andrew M.

description:
Fantastic food that's pretty affordable, with a hole-in-the-wall atmosphere. Don't be mistaken - this is no restaurant, it's just a bar with a place to buy food in the corner, but that doesn't make it any less tasty. My favorites are any of the tacos (be sure to get them "Nick's way"), and the nachos. The nachos have a different type of cheese on them - it almost seems like a mix between real cheese and processed cheese, but it's still tasty.

Again, if you're looking for a sit-down restaurant that looks and feels fancy or well-kept, stay away. If you're looking for a quick bite of delicious food and don't mind hole in the wall-type places, this one's for you.
author: Mike M.

description: Nicks is the spot for a quality, well priced burrito. The tacos are decent, but the carne asada burrito is what really shines here. Prompt service, great price, great food. Consider me a regular,
author: Keegan R.

description:
After scoring a coupon over Yelp for this place, we ventured down to Broadway with the objective to spend $20 for the coupon to be valid. That ended up not being a problem, as we spent close to $30.

As for the food, its amazing. Some of the best tacos and chips one can get... well anywhere. The problem is that the food is mostly the same, although not quite as good, as Underdogs (another place run by the same owner). Having frequented Underdogs often, we couldn't help but compare the two during our meal there and, frankly speaking, Underdogs came up ahead. Waiter service and chips that keep getting refilled, rather than having to pay $1.25 over and over again... not to mention slightly better salsa found at Underdogs.

All in all, Nick's is great, no doubt about it. Its real drawback though is that there is a better option available. So while we love the food, we aren't likely to come back and will probably stick with Underdogs (unless we get another awesome coupon).
author: Sami R.

description:
Nicks Crispy Tacos,

How could I live for almost a year in San Francisco and never sample your Pescadero Taco. Instead I have been going to Victors, which to put it mildly sucks next to you.
The carnitas were ok, if you are in the know.... like my friends were you will only order the Pescadero taco.
The crunchiness of the fish and the taco went well with the guac and cheese... This should be featured on food network, if it hasnt already.
author: Pooja S.

description: Crispy inner shell + soft outer shell = super win. I had the carne asada Nick's way (always go for "Nick's way", I learned quickly) and the fried fish - both incredible. And HUGE - I was hungry, and I couldn't even finish two. Now I get why everyone here loves this place.
author: Rachael K.

description:
Yummmm!

Amazing tacos - and going for "Nick's way" is the only way to go.  You really can't go wrong with anything on the menu.

The downsides - cash only, crazy lines, weird shared decor with Rouge and frequent infestation of Marina types on Friday/Saturday nights.
author: Kristin S.

description:
This place was pretty good. Love the posh atmosphere- you could dress up going here, and still only have to pay $5 for a burrito. Not to mention we happened to make it there for what I believe was Happy Hour- meaning $3 Margaritas that weren't too slim on the alcohol.

Love the U-shaped red velvet seating. Nice glittery chandeliers. Laid-back waiters and waitresses that were unobtrusive but friendly and helpful. 

I had the Veggie burrito- which is why there's one star missing in my rating.. Taste good? Yes, for the most part. But- I was a bit disappointed that it was mostly stuffed with raw cabbage, which tastes nice and fresh at first, but after a while starts to get old. I found myself enjoying the bean side of the burrito, but a bit burnt out on the overflow of cabbage about halfway through.. What about avocado? Doesn't that count as vegetarian? Or lettuce? Steamed broccoli? More warm stuff might have been nice, in combination with the raw.

Otherwise, I would go here again. Nice atmosphere, and makes you feel rich when you're not.
author: Emilia J.

description:
If you're not paying attention, you'll think you just walked into Club Rouge! But hidden off the side, you'll find Nick's Crispy Tacos.

Their carnitas tacos were pretty tasty, although I have had better. But their best taco is the baja-style fish tacos. Two corn tortillas, a big fat piece of fish battered and fried to perfection, coleslaw, avocado and salsa. Not much more can be better than that. Even after eating my two tacos, licking my fingers, and eating all the pieces that fell on my plate, I was wanting more. Absolutely delicious!

The location is ok, although it draws some of the douchey customers from nightclub. Parking in the area can be challenging, but definitely try out the tacos from this place if you're in the area.
author: Jan Z.

description: Their pescado taco is awesome!  Make sure to order it Nick's way (with guacamole and cheese).  I also tired their carnitas taco and it was okay, the pescado is way better.  Their green hot sauce is yummy and they also have a red one that's a bit sweet.  I prefered the green over the red.  It was delicious over my pescado taco.  Tacos will cost you about $5 each (nicks way included) and they're pretty huge.
author: Veronica N.

description:
We happened to stop in during their Taco Tuesdays deal. The guy at the order station was very nice and let us have the special price even though we were a few minutes past 9 p.m. (Five stars for the nice guy.)

Apparently I wasn't expecting much because I was pleasantly surprised! The carne asado taco was full of meat, lettuce, and avocado. De-lish! (Four stars for the food.)

I have to mention the awkwardness of the Rouge nightclub decor with a taco joint. It's a nightclub setting with collapsible tables, chairs and vinyl table cloths on the dance floor. It's quite choppy too since you have to order first, find an empty seat (which is hard to do on Taco Tuesday), then go to the bar and order your drink. And don't forget to pick up your utensils on the way back. Oops, and don't forget the napkins in all this chaos. It's not relaxing to say the least. (Two stars for the dated decor and awkwardness of ordering at two locations.)   

Overall, I say eat here when you have a nice buzz and just need subsistence to get through the night, or it's a Tuesday and you want a good deal on a delicious taco.
author: Kathy M.

description:
The weird strip-club-looking atmosphere is oddly charming. Great food, huge portions.

TERRIBLE margaritas.
author: Sarah B.

description:
I first discovered Nick's Crispy Tacos when 77 released it's 100 Things to Try Before You Die. Back then, I was completely oblivious to good quality fish tacos. I had been eating Rubios at least 2-3 times a month thinking it was the greatest thing on earth. Boy, was I wrong. Now, stepping into another Rubios would be blasphemous to the fish taco gods.

The scene:

The decor at Nick's Crispy Taco's is actually unexpected. The hipster-style interior is gaudy red with crystal chandeliers hanging from the ceiling. The restaurants double life consists of a heavenly taco place by day, the trendy nightclub Rouge by night.

The food:

I only stick to what I know is good here - pescado (fish) tacos "Nick's Way" ($5), an elote (corn) and a horchata (rice drink).

Pescado Tacos - When you order this, you MUST order it "Nick's Way," which is about $1 more. Trust me, it's completely worth it. "Nick's Way" is an extra crispy-fried corn tortilla wrapped with a soft tortilla with jack cheese and guacamole in addition to your choice of filling. These are the best fish taco's I've ever had and any other fish taco I've had since has never come close.

The pescado taco consists of a layer of cabbage and red onions, Baja-style fried white fish, fresh guacamole, lime mayonnaise, salsa and cilantro. The tacos are enormous, so you can get away with one if you're looking for a light meal. If you like spicy, ask for the habanero sauce. They keep that hidden in the back and it'll add a huge kick to the taco.

Elote - I LOVE Mexican corn. I get this any time I'm at a county fair. Mexican corn is grilled corn rubbed any kind of seasoning. This one specifically had butter and topped with Mexican cheese, chili powder and cayanne pepper. It's so rich and creamy, and mucho deliciouso. It really does make this healthy grain/vegetable unhealthy for you.

Horchata - Horchata is a Mexican sweet rice drink flavored with cinnamon and other spices. It pretty much tastes like the left over milk after a bowl of Cinnamon Toast Crunch. It's a little chalky, but I still love it.

The Nick from Nick's Crispy Taco's is actually at Underdogs on Irving now. They pretty much serve the same menu, including the famous fish tacos. I like to go there since it's more convenient for me, but parking is pretty rough during certain times of the day.

I shake my fist at NIck's Crispy Taco's for setting my fish taco standards so high. I will probably never eat a fish taco anywhere else ever again.
author: Sam L.

description: Yum. Big pieces of fried fish goodness wrapped in a corn tortilla. Delicious chunks of shrimp served "Nick's way". Corn covered in spicy sauce and cheese that is off-the-street-cart fantastic. Not only is the food good but the place has character. A definite must visit.
author: Christine B.

description:
There is no way I will give this place a 5 star..I give it a 3.5 star. 
I was suprise at how high the rating was, so i decided to come here. I was a little disappointed at first. I had no idea this place was in a club..the atmosphere was a little big weird...Well i had the Carne Asada and overall it was good. Everything tasted fresh. I was just a little disappointed i thought it would of been something like wow..

And cash only. There's a ATM right in front of the register..
author: Tiffany L.

description:
The good:
Carne asada taco. Nicks way. With lots of sauce (from the tables) on it.

The bad:
Pricey
Cash Only
author: Jessica S.

description:
There is a ridiculous amount of hype over this place, I finally tried it out, got a medley of different tacos and quite frankly, wasn't that impressed. They're basically the standard, Americanized tacos that you can find most anywhere else. So you might ask, how did this place build such a following? 

For one, the people. Marina kids love to push their district border by coming to Nick's and throwing their trust fund down the toilet. Marina kids can build up hype better than any other group in the city.

Two, the scene. It's a night club in the evening so the set up attracts a lot of attention and people think it's so clever, "OH! A taco shop during the day and a club at night? How unique!" Yea right. 

Three, the phrase "Taco Tuesdays". Marina kids love that phrase and flock to any Americanized Mexican joint in the city that has a deal on Tuesdays. 

Four, the noise. People who don't have anything interesting to say love to flood a bar or restaurant that's so obnoxiously loud, you can't hear a damn thing.

It's not that the food was even bad or the set up was lousy, it was actually pretty decent food. But I sure as hell ain't about to put up with the crowd, the noise, or the decor. It's simply not worth it.
author: Anthony C.

description: I ordered the fish taco "nicks way" and never looked back! It was great! A generous piece of fish topped with guac, its def a must try!!!! The line might take a couple minutes, but I assure you its worth the wait!
author: Jeff C.

description: Love this place! Great food and drinks.  I have tried many of their different tacos and burritos and they all taste great.  Can never go wrong with anything on the menu and it's not over priced either
author: Tanmaya H.

description:
It's hard not to like Nick's.  It's cheap, the food is very good and the atmosphere is charming in a grungy way.  The place doubles as a night spot called Rouge, which is a little too b&t for me, but it still can be fun.  I recommend going for lunch and drinks on a Saturday.  Happy hour prices apply all day on the weekends and for $20 you can eat a full meal, and have 3 margaritas.  This makes sense if you are watching a game or just having a lazy day, not if you have to be productive.   

If you eat stick with the tacos and get them 'Nick's way' which means with everything.  Make sure you stake out one of the horseshoe shaped booths so you don't have to deal with your neighbors and sit up on the left side of the place so you're close to the bar.
author: John M.

description:
Imagine eating pescado tacos, tangy with lime, fresh fried fish wrapped in warm crunchy tortillas smothered in thick guacamole and salsa under a chandelier on velvet couches in dim lighting...

Not quite as luxurious as it sounds, but full of fun fun fun. 

I hear it turns into a bar/lounge at night. Ooh la la!
author: Hana J.

description:
Tasty treats that are super satisfying after a nice run. Loved the tip to order Nick's style but was bummed at the price difference. You do get a lot of guac for that dollar fitty but it really adds up. Our 5 tacos and juices were over 30. I usually like to spend 15 max at taquerias for 2.

I will go back, especially because the salsa is not terrible AND in squeeze bottles for condiment junkies like me. I think I will go less hungry and order less tacos so that I can stay in my comfort zone.
author: Allegra F.

description: What can I say about Nick's Crispy tacos that hasn't already been said?  The tacos Nick's way are the freaking BOMB!!!  So flavorful and loaded with good stuff.  I don't know what it is about the soft and hard shell combo that makes these tacos better, but it does.  Their guacamole and salsa fresca are fantastic.  I've eaten at the Taco Shop at Underdogs when we used to live a block away, but the tacos at this location just seem better.  The service is lightning fast so your food comes out nice and hot.  Definitely check this spot out if you haven't already.
author: Eileen H.

description:
Three words:
FRIED FISH TACOS

eaten under crappy chandeliers and red walls that got thrown out of the cheapest brothel.

Life doesn't get much better than that.
author: Tatjana G.

description:
UNIMPRESSED.

What's the big deal about Tacos Nick's Way?

It's a lightly fried, not-even-that-crispy corn taco surrounding a regular taco (so you get another soft corn tortilla too).  

Sure, there's a lot of guacamole, but at this price, there had better be.

The flavor is bland otherwise.  Why not go get real tacos in the Mission and save some money?    Or go to any other highly rated place on my list...
http://www.yelp.com/list_details?list_id=7moDaSk5jQWRZ76X3AbyFA
author: Daniel S.

description:
Went for lunch on Tuesday and parking was surprisingly easy and the meters gave 10 minutes per quarter, not like downtown where you give your first born for an hour.

Nick's Crispy Taco's were good, but not great.  They were a blatant rip off of La Taqueria's tacos without all the flavor.  I paid almost $12 for two carne asada taco's "Nick's Way", which means adding cheese and guacamole and a small Melon aguas frescas.  Good stuff, but not as good as tacos in the Mission.  

A fairly good taco option if you're over on this side of the city and if you don't mind eating inside a stinky bar.  You know how Vegas is ugly during the day?  That's how it feels inside this place when you're eating-I'd rather eat in Walgreen's parking lot across the street.

Overall, a good spot to eat and I'll go again, but if it's between any Mission taco and these, I like the Mission.
author: Curtis C.

description:
They don't mess around on Taco Tuesday.

The place is packed with people looking for great deal - $2 quesadillas, $2 chips w/ salsa and guac, $2 tacos...and 2 for $5 Dos Equis. What else IS there in life?

The food came quickly and it was easy to get a drink at the bar. That being said, we stood the whole time. We were there from 7pm to 9:30pm and never had a chance to snag a table. Such is life. 

Will definitely return to Nick's on a Tuesday and different day of the week :)
author: Jeanette L.

description:
I'd says this place is about 3.5 stars, I come here mainly for the fish tacos and chips and guac. Both are excellent and pretty consistent. I've had other tacos too, Nick's way, but they were just okay. All fish products are currently $1 more than normal because of that chocolate spill in the gulf.

I watched a Giants game at the bar and service was attentive but I only had beers so I can't comment on the mixed drinks.

I think the decor is dreadful, but I have a fear of velvet, so perhaps i'm biased. 

CASH ONLY.
author: Jeff O.

description: Personally during daylight hours I think the decor leaves A LOT to be desired but the tacos were AMAZING.  I highly recommend the grilled fish taco "nick's way" with guacamole.  I love that they have cabbage in their tacos and it seems like a good deal for the price.  YUMMY.  The drink prices can't be beat either!
author: Maria S.

description: We had to walk a bit to get here, but it was a nice day so we didn't mind too much.  We walked in and it was very nightlifey.  Turns out they turn the place into a lounge of sorts at night.  I've heard it is pretty cool at night too.  Having grown up in SD, I am a pretty tough judge of Mexican food, but I love love love LOVE fish tacos, so I thought I'd give this place a try.  The fish tacos were pretty good, I've got to say - but kind of a weird shape.  More cone-like than taco like, and way more pricey than they should have been.  I would go back for the fish tacos - everything else was kind of meh.
author: Jenna L.

description:
Was there last night with Urban Diversion for Taco TUES.

Great to see after all these years it's is still going strong.

Solid marks across the board (scene, food, and drinks).

Speaking of which, I ran into four different sets of friends.

Kinda cool to find a place where all the universes collide.
author: Francis M.

description: The crispy fish taco done Nick's way - best on the menu. Really, I wouldn't bother getting anything else. Decor is awesome too.
author: Valerie C.

description:
Nick's was featured on the 7x7 list of things to try before you die, so of course I wanted to venture and try it, but never got the chance to go. Not until Yelp featured a coupon for $20 worth of food and drink for $10!! What a perfect opportunity, lets GO!

What we ordered:
Pescado Taco: baja style fried fish in a corn tortilla with salsa, lime mayonnaise, cilantro, cabbage & onions 
Carnitas Taco: braised shredded pork in corn tortilla with pico de gallo & pinto beans
Carne Asada quesadilla: grilled steak folded in a crispy flour tortilla with pico de gallo and jack cheese
Elote corn on the cob done up the mexican way, with grated cheese and chili powder

be sure to order all your tacos Nick's Way! any taco made crispy with jack cheese and guacamole

the tacos were nice and crispy, with each bite loaded with meat and guac! Delish! the drizzling of the lime made it even tastier! The fish taco was by far the winner of our whole meal, with the lime mayo. The fish was lightly battered, and moist; mM salivating just thinking about it! The Elote was also very tasty. It came out piping hot, loaded with chili powder and cheese. Make sure you have a drink handy before trying to devour this treat. The only downside to this experience was the steep pricing of the tacos.  I didn't expect that our tab would be ~$32 for 3 tacos, quesadilla, corn and a drink. I would come back, but probably not as frequently as I would like. When you go, be sure to be aggressive to fight for a table with chairs, cause they're a rare commodity!
author: Margaret Y.

description:
If you don't give Nick's a glowing review this is the kind of message you will be sent and by the way Nick's, I still don't like your interpretation of the "Taco". It's still my opinion and my palate. 

Hello Karla, 
Thank you for taking the time to write such an accurate review. You are without a doubt THE authority on REAL tacos. Sorry you don't like our Niman Ranch Meats and Fresh line caught fish that is delivered daily or our organic produce, all of which I'm sure Taco Bell has on their ingredient list. 

What gave you the impression that we are trying to be authentic, and for that matter, authentic what? The food we serve is our own interpretation of what we like to eat; we make no claims to be authentic. 

As for the drinks, sneaky is not quite appropriate since Nick's and the bar are 2 separately owned businesses simply sharing the same space. Our margaritas are $5.50 because we use fresh squeezed lime juice and top shelf tequila whereas Rouge Bar uses well tequila and sweet and sour mix. 

My two words for you, 

"bye bye"
author: Karla B.

description: Carne asada taco nicks way!!!
author: Kelly K.

description:
A particularly good way to celebrate becoming an official San Francisco resident :-)  We came here after a day of serious Ikea shopping and furniture assembly, and it proved to be a few things: filling, satisfying, cheap, and convenient.  And $2 bud lights?  You certainly won't find anything like that in Boston.

In general the food was good - gotta love a place that appreciates a good guac - but it could be a liiiiitle more flavorful.  I got the veggie burrito, and felt like it needed more spices... I ended up soaking it in the green salsa they give along with your order.

Despite that single qualm, I will def be back.
author: Allison B.

description:
#10 on The Big Eat SF: Baja-style fish tacos at Nick's Crispy Tacos 

Nick's Crispy Tacos was an interesting choice for the 100 things to eat before you die. 

They're pretty solid, just not sure if it deserves *best* taco in SF.
Cruise down to the Mission area, and you can find a handful of hole in the walls to rate there tacos to Nicks.  

Pretty grubbin but not the best.  Burritos here are generic.  

Parking-Pretty decent for a busy SF area.  

Place- Tacky red, kinda has that "The Shining" Feel to it.  But it's a huge place, especially city standards.
author: Chase F.

description:
To prevent people from taking up the precious, highly sought-after booth space at Nick's I'd say this place is gross. But that would be a lie. In fact, even joking about lying about this place being bad is making me tearful. 

There is no place in San Francisco I crave more for price, ambiance, food, and drinks. Nick's is where I take family and friends whenever they show up from out-of-town, and it's the only restaurant in the city I'll sit on a bus for an hour for, then stand in line for 30 minutes, then stand staring at people with daggers for another 30 minutes, while my food is getting cold, until they empty *my* booth. 

I love Nick's. Please open another location. Please?!
author: Courtnee C.

description: I love their tacos and burritos, true, but their chicken tortilla soup cannot be beat. As a serious fan of sopa, this one is my favorite. It has chunks of avocado, fresh tomatos, a couple lime wedges, melty cheese and just enough kick to oust the rainy day blues. You're so worth the $6 and more.
author: Angelina C.

description:
I like the ambiance of this place the decor is really cute and the music is good too. The food was okay. I think it is too expensive for what it is. We got 4 tacos "nicks way" and it was almost 30 bucks! I wouldn't  mind paying this if the tacos were out of this world, but they weren't. Tacos from a taco truck or a hole in the wall taco shop would have been half the price and equally as satisfying.

Overall, I guess this place would be nice to go have drinks and hang out, but I wouldn't recommend it if you actually want to get something to eat.
author: Alicia M.

description: I like anything fried.  If you fry a wood splinter, I would eat it.  So when you fry a tasty taco with lime mayonnaise, I definitely would eat it.  I was pretty full after just one taco, but I can always eat a second one with very light persuasion.  It's only $3 each...sooooooo worth it.  On Tuesday nights, it's only $2 each.  Their chips and salsa taste fresh...their agua frescas taste refreshing...there is plenty of room to sit.  What else do you want from a $3 taco place?  For $3, I would even eat a fried wood splinter.
author: Ally W.

description:
Nick's has great, though high-priced tacos. I'm especially fond of the fish. All can be served "Nick's Way" which involves both soft and hard shells, plus guacamole. Their horchata is tasty.

Squeeze bottles of spicy sauce are around for the customer to squirt at their discretion. One bottle is rust red, the other is snot green. Both are flavorful.

If you like red velvet, you'll enjoy the atmosphere. It's basically a club with tables. During broadcast games of sport and weekend evenings, the place is packed and noisy. 

Personally, I enjoy the place much more when it's not crowded.
author: Nik D.

description: RATS!!! There are RATS at this restaurant!!!!! We ate dinner here tonight (I had a quesadilla and it was good) but at the tail-end (no pun intended) of our dining experience, a RAT ran across the floor of the restaurant. Patrons were SCREAMING as this RAT scurried across the dining room floor and ventured up to the booths. A few workers quickly corralled the RAT before it jumped on any patrons and ushered it outside as if it's something they do on a daily basis. A few seconds later, a patron YELLED as another RAT came up from behind her booth and was just a few feet away from her face. In the spirit of being honest, I witnessed the first RAT sprint across the floor but i did not see the second RAT. I only saw the horror on the patron's face and hear the blood-shrilling scream of the pour soul as she came face-to-face with the RODENT. It's unbelievable that I could be at a decent restaurant in the heart of the city and witness RODENTS crawl across the dining room floor. What amazes me even more is that the restaurant CONTINUED TO SERVE INNOCENT PATRONS when they entered the restaurant after the RATS had ran across half the eating area. I have no idea how these RATS got into the restaurant (I REALLY HOPE THEY DIDN'T ENJOY ANY OF THE LIMES I HAD IN MY VODKA TONIC) but this place should be SHUT DOWN until they get this situation figured out. IT'S DISGUSTING AND WRONG TO SERVE PEOPLE WHILE THERE ARE RATS IN YOUR BUILDING. NICK'S CRISPY TACOS - SHAME ON YOU!!!!!!!!!!
author: Thomas S.

description: About $6 for fish taco made Nick's style (which is kind of expensive for fish taco I think).  It was definitely delicious, but I've had better.. in Lake Tahoe...at Freshies.
author: Jenn L.

description:
Get the asada taco's nicks way! Was pretty damn good! The chips and Salsa were really good too and happy hour was decent.
The only draw back is that it is a little pricey for the food.
author: Jorge L.

description:
their quesadillas are out of this world.
i'm not sure what they do, but it's prepared in a way that is different then anything i've had before. 
this could be a good thing.. or a really bad thing, for i may never look at quesadillas the same again.
i would recommend the carne asada dilla. i'm not generally a meat fan but they may have just converted me forever.
we also got a veggie burrito, but that was nothing near as memorable as that damn quesadilla. 
another trip to nick's tacos is definitely in store soon.
author: Sunni B.

description:
A man sat across from me on the morning train and ran his hand through his hair 137 times in a row.  I didn't start counting until after awhile, so the correct number is actually much higher.

I looked around for a hidden camera, but couldn't spot one.  And then noticed something:  He was only massaging his head when the train was underground between stops.  His rubbing was a coping mechanism for being scared to death of dying underground.  Isn't that hilarious?! *pause*

I think we can all stand to learn from this morning's scalp molestor.  So, the next time I go to Nick's Crispy Tacos and I'm tempted to order two tacos, even though one is big enough to fill me up, I'm gonna rub my head.  Really good and really hard and over and over again.  As the line weaves through the nightclub next door, all the way up to the front of the cash register, I'm gonna be rubbing until they either, A) call the police with a 5150, or B) refuse to let me order my tacos Nick's way.

Not that there's anything wrong with paying $.95 cents for a flour tortilla and huge dollop of guac to be added to your crispy taco.  But my waistline doesn't need it.  At all.

When we order food, I think we all can learn a thing or two from guys who touch themselves on the Muni train.
author: Janney B.

description:
I made it into Nick's with some friends after long day of marching up Polk street all day for Santarchy.  A climactic end to a great adventure.   Inside, there was plenty of seating, some David Lynchesque looking chandeliers, and some inviting looking booths and tables.

Good stuff here, I ordered 2 carne asada tacos Nick's way.  If you've had tacos from a legitimate taqueria, you're probably pretty close to these.  The only difference being the crispy corn tortilla.  It's a nice twist, and the tacos are packed with beans and a lot of nicely flavored meat.

As it turns out the water coolers they have setup work out to be great for re-hydrating.
author: Eric L.

description:
NOM NOM NOM.  Whatever you end up getting, I insist you get it Nick's Way.  YUMMM.

also.. the chips = fabuloso

margaritas too :)
author: Ninette B.

description:
Ok I do like the tacos  . But I recently went there for tacos tuesday and I would advise to splurge and pay the extra for the regular nights. It had a ok scene if you like to hang out in Marina like areas of san Francisco but other than that it was very crowded , no where to sit.  Loud. And the worst part  was the service. 
You end up waiting in line FOREVER. (think night club) then you e spend  like $20 more than you normally would because he woman at the register could not hear you and added  decided to add guacamole  and a heap load of other stuff to everything and charged you about $10 for the extras. On the plus side service was fast and note that you cant get your $2.00 tacos to go so you are forced to stand and eat :| .
author: Ms. P.

description:
So there's this corn in NY that I absolutely love and drool over at just the thought.  The hubby found that Nick's had it.  Well it wasn't it exactly but it was good enough to feed that craving.

I love their tacos - the pescado and carne asada.  I can imagine biting into the crispy shell with the lime squeezed onto it with all the guacamole goodness.  The corn is really good, a bit on the spicy side but still pretty yummy with the lime and the cheese.

mmm... my mouth is watering... guess we'll have to go and make a trip here soon!
author: Marjorie H.

description: Go early or loose out on the Namesakes' main dish. We settled for was the next best option. The HUGELY cheeseball bar next door does detract from the niche-like atmosphere.
author: Tonsies S.

description: With all the hype about it, i should say not really a fan of it. We didn't finish our food.  Food is just ok.
author: JacQue S.

description: We had a very late lunch 3PM.  My tacos were decent & my friends salad was good.  Too bad they did not bus the tables.  For a large place like this someone should have cleaned up.  Other than that they were worth checking out.  Cash only
author: Carb Q.

description:
I give this place 5 stars as well as my first born child. 

WHY? It gets 5 stars for the boner-inducing tacos alone. And it gets my spawn for HAPPY HOUR TIL 10 PM!! AND...if I saw correctly, they have happy hour on WEEKENDS? God bless them. Also, when I went last Friday, they had 2 dollar Stella's! Typically when I ask bartenders anywhere else, "SO WASSUP WITH YOUR 2 DOLLA DRANK SPECIALS??," I get punched in the throat. Here, I got a Stella. 

So you must order fish tacos (Nick's way) and anything involving guacamole and salsa. The tacos are AMAZING, love them. You must try them or your entire life will have been a complete waste. 

My only complaint is that the servers were unresponsive to my requests for table dances. But no hard feelings, I'll just keep trying.
author: Mel P.

description: I had a carne asada burrito here that I found to be rather mediocre. In fact, the only reason I even came back after having that burrito was because I live so close to Nick's that it was just too convenient to not go back. I am very glad that I did return! On my next trip I had the fried fish burrito; it was probably the best burrito I have ever had in my life. I am looking forward to my next visit!
author: Thomas B.

description:
My usual order:
Grilled fish taco (nick's way)
Elote
Chips and salsa
margarita

I haven't been in a while, but the tacos are delish!  Try and avoid rush times because finding a seat is a challenge.  The margarita from Nick's (not the Rouge bar) is made scratch- no sweet n sour mix and is super tasty!
I wasn't impressed with their nachos or beans & rice, I recommend that you stick with the tacos.
author: Michelle L.

description:
I've heard too many things to pass up a chance to try a taco or two from this well spoken of joint.

I just so happened to pass by this club.. err bar.. err I mean restaurant looking for beer. I managed to squeeze a carnitas and a carne asada taco from the place that was practically oozing guacamole.

That was the trick though; the guac totally sold the crispy taco wrapped in a soft shell. I was so engrossed in the salsa and the meat, that I had all the juices dribbling down my face before realizing I didn't pick up any napkins. 

I'mma coming back for more.
author: Alfred Y.

description:
I have been hearing people rave about Nick's for about two years...FINALLY, I came to taco Tuesday. Way better than Blue Light, less crowded, WAY better food & better drinks (a tad more expensive, but still a great deal).

$4 margaritas (or 2 for $5), $2 tacos (+$0.95 for Nick's way), $2 coronas.

Nick's is in a club, with fake red velvet booths, gaudy chandeliers all over the ceiling & mirror tiles all over the place...yes, it's very tacky.

The baja fish taco was freaking delicious (fried fish over coslaw with lime mayo & beans) could have had a little less batter on the fish, but I'm not going to complain about that. The carne asada taco Nick's style (Nick's style is with cheese, sour cream & guacamole added) was good, but definitely not authentic Mexican, it was definitely pretty delicious though. I've had better tacos, but these are way above average and you can't really beat the price on Tuesdays.

I will definitely be going back to Nicks soon!
author: Elaine S.

description:
I'm a holiday Catholic which pretty much means I only go to mass on Christmas (it's the only time I can't argue my way out of going) but I do partake in Lent and that means no eating meat on Fridays.

So it's friday, what's there to eat? Fish!

Thanks to Yelp, I've been hearing left and right about this place which seemed like a perfect Lenten-Friday lunch spot because I love fish tacos. I even have an (albeit small) fish taco list! The boytoy used to try to get me to eat at messican places all the time back in Santa Cruz and I'd always say no but I do have a profound semi-secret love for deep fried fish tacos.

I ordered one (not sure whether to get one or two) pescado taco done Nick's Way and it was so so good. Like bacon, guacamole makes everything better and while one was a good size for a light lunch, I think that the sinner in me (gluttony!) can take down another. After all, there is always Confession.
author: kristin e.

description:
Whatever you do, don't get the carnitas here. All the taste, texture and consistency of week-old cat food.

The meats that go into the tacos/burritos here are bland and nothing is really that tasty. Yes, there are cheap margaritas, which I'm sure dulls the senses somewhat, but for the most part the offerings here are just ok.
author: Owen R.

description:
Mongol General: "Conan, what is best in life?"

Conan (Me): "To crush limes over fat filled tacos, see beers and margaritas driven before you and hear the lamentations of women you're ogling like a creeper while beer and fat drip down your chin in delicious rivers."

Mongol General: "That is good! You should go to Nick's Crispy Tacos and sit at the bar facing the booths."
author: Ben P.

description:
Stopped by Nick's for dinner a week or so ago on the recommendation of friends.  Did not care for the chips and salsa -- it's mediocre chips covered in pico de gallo, not salsa.  We also got a set with guacamole, which was better (though the chips were still not very good).  On the other hand, it was happy hour, so we got $3.00 margaritas.  On the *other* other hand, I'm not really sure they were worth $3.00.

We started with nachos, which were better than the chips and salsa, but it was still the same chips, which weren't good.  The cheese on the nachos was some kind of strange cheese whiz substance, which I avoided.  Otherwise, alright.

Was told that "Nick's way" was the way to go with the tacos (meaning your soft taco is encased in a hard shell & comes with jack cheese), so I got one regular pollo and one pollo asada.  Both were rather bland, through and through, though the guac almost saved them both.  The pollo asada was dry, tough, and flavorless.  The regular pollo was better -- a little more tender, and with some flavor to it.  The hard shell tasted stale.

Have to say, it's been a good, long while since I had such mediocre Mexican food in this city.  Probably won't go back.
author: Angela B.

description: The Fish Tacos "Nick's Way" are a 5, everything else is a 4 or 4.5. I usually don't even like tacos, especially crispy ones, but Nick's converted me. I still don't like crispy tacos...but I'll take Nick's crispy tacos any day.
author: Zachary S.

description: Fish tacos are the bomb... I love it. Staff needs to be a bit nicer, it gets pretty crowded after 8 that might be why staff gets so irritated i guess. Great location yummy food. Good luck finding parking though
author: Silvia T.

description:
Tacos - good but i forgot to ask if they had flour tortilla's - i tried the steak and chicken both were equally good.
-THEY USE REAL MEXICAN SOUR CREAM- it is delicious
Quesadilla - good, but i wish it wasn't fried - way too greasy for me
Atmosphere - so fun, taco tuesdays especially.
Music - awesome
People - super mellow and lots of fun.

Cheep drinks, cheep food, good music = awesome.
author: Shadi N.

description: I dont know if this should be for Nick's or rouge but we went to watch a NCAA game called ahead were told yes they get the big 10 network, then walked in there at 1 to make sure they could play the game at 3. Again we were told yes by the girl bartender working Jan 30. Come to 3 o'clock and to put on our game, they dont get the channel. Bartender is completely uniformed as well as not friendly.
author: Nicki B.

description:
As a seeker of the greatest fish taco available, Nick's has repeatedly fulfilled my (very) high expectations.

The Pescado taco (Nick's Way, of course) - is a meal in and of itself. Add some chips and guacamole and the corn on the cob, and you've got a feast!

The other tacos, quesadillas, and burritos are also delish - which will help explain the long line  at nearly any time of day.
author: claire s.

description:
One year (maybe more), 7x7 magazine called this the best meal under $10 in SF. They probably should have ventured south of Broadway before making that decision.

The carne asada breakfast burrito was enormous, flavorful, and filling. If you don't live near the Mission, have at it. If you do, this is kind of a strange choice for these goods. Pollo asado tacos weren't bad. Chips with a massive pile of pico de gallo was a bit much. It was more expensive than I'm used to, but it was good.

Nick's fills a niche, and I think it fills it pretty well around these parts if you're looking to chat with a bunch of nice-enough strangers just because, or to hook up with someone. But it is very much not my style.

I was much more excited about the 2 p.m. Sunday happy hour on a later visit. $16 for four not-bad margaritas, tip included.
author: Tara R.

description:
This place is kinda strange when you first step in. I wasn't sure if i was going to a club or a taco joint, but hey it ended up being a taco joint! 

I thought it was awesome sitting in a club eating my tacos =)

Enough about the atmosphere, lets talk tacos. I really enjoyed my tacos! I ordered the fish tacos "Nick's Way" and I am glad I did! What i did not like was the price. It tends to be on the expensive side and the cash only  thing just isn't cool.

I think what stood out to me the most was the atmosphere, which I thought made this place pretty cool.
author: monica s.

description:
*Cash only* and get here early on Tuesdays.

Get it Nick's way, which means get it crispy and with guac. I did like the fried fish tacos the first time I came here (another 7x7 special). However, on subsequent visits, I've seen diminishing marginal utility.

I'm sure one of the other 1200+ reviewers has said this, but it's really weird that this place is also Rouge.
author: Huey K.

description:
I've been meaning to get over to Nick's for years, but they close so early and it's such a distance from anywhere I ever am, so I never made it. 

Thursday I was reminded that this is one of the most attractive sections of the city.  I'm not talking about the architecture or the landscaping; I'm talking about the women.  The neighborhood was just dripping with beautiful women.  I don't get it.  Even the aisles at Walgreen's were wall-to-wall supermodels. 

Secondary were the food and beverage.  Crispy fish tacos were good, but not amazing, and sadly, a fish taco that is anything but great is lousy.  Service was fine and pitchers were $10, and they have other good daily specials, so I won't complain.  Finding a seat was the only challenge.
author: Quinn S.

description:
4 stars for the fish tacos. The cole slaw...the crunchy and succulent fish..with a splash of lime, a healthy dose of guac. Delicious!

For the carnitas, pollo asada, and ...crap..forgot the 4th taco...the meat ones were slightly dry. I like the cheese on the bottom of the taco "nick's way" though. The crunchy shell wrapped in a soft tortilla is yummy. I got to try the burrito, cuz it sounds like they are heavenly ...
author: Carol L.

description: Great ingredients, well prepared, attached to a bar with cheaper and better drinks in a cool bordello sort of space. The only thing missing was the madame!
author: Alexander C.

description:
One thing you cannot get in NYC is a good taco.  Everyone who has ever had a good taco before will tell you that.  So when I come to SF, tacos are usually first on the "what to eat" list.

This was our first meal upon arrival and it did the job well.  The fish taco was amazing -- so crispy on the outside, but lightly fried and soft and flaky fish on the inside.  It's served with a yummy chipotle sauce.  B. got the carne asada taco and pollo taco and they were nearly burrito size... but tasty!  The place is comfy with lots of seating and a bar in the middle with reasonably priced drinks.  

Note, that it's cash only!
author: Katie Z.

description:
Wait did I just walk into Club Rouge? 

My boyfriend totally hyped up the tacos. I either had to decide if they were good as he said they were or was he just making them more than they were? 

He ordered two carne asada tacos which featured a soft and hard shell. Beans, cilantro, tomatoes and guacamole just piled with ooey-gooey goodness. Every bite was delicious and sauces he suggested only made each bite as delicious as the next. The best part? Not feeling gross or in regret. Definitely have a new taco place to go to in the city for delicious tacos.
author: Jamie L.

description:
I've been warned of ordering and eating in a normally recognized club on friday/saturday nights, of the necessity to add "nick's way for $1", and that Taco Tuesdays are the times to go.   BUT, I was not warned to make sure to come here by 9pm since that is when the special ends.  Me and my boy, in a search for taco tuesday, was turned down at andalu as they ran out, and decided to come here right at 9:20pm only to find out the special was over.  

But in desperation, I sucked it up and ordered myself a delicious fish taco Nick's way ($3.25 + $.95)and a chicken quesadilla ($5.95).  For the price as is, sure it sucks knowing you could have gotten the taco for only $2 had i drove maybe a little faster, maybe even skip on andalu first, but this will needless to say, have to do.  

I'll definitely redeem myself next time the true way.
author: Vincent K.

description:
Epic, Legendary Tacos.   Seriously, the chips w/ guac, I could live off of that!!  And they share space with Rogue, a full bar /nightclub!!  WOW!  I love it.  I want a job here, I would never leave.  Fantastic food, full bar, reggae, what more could you want??   
Sometimes I will come all the way to the city just for some of Nicks tacos.  This place is just that good.  Every chance I get I am at Nicks.  Any trip to the airport, or the city, there has to be a detour thru Nicks.   Everybody I have taken there just loves it, the service is always quick even if there is a huge line, just remember to bring cash!  A+ Keep it up Nick.
author: Al P.

description:
Mmmm. Nicks Crispy Tacos are some of the Best tacos in SF. So tasty, soft tortilla and then crispy. I really like the fish tacos.  They're pretty generous here on the "meat" and fixins.  Lots of seating (it's rouge night club at night) and good beers.  

The place can get to be a scene during peak hours..so you may want to get your tacos to go.
author: Ka C.

description:
"there's still gold in these hills!"

Came here for their famous "taco tuesdays" and to be quite honest with you i didn't know what to expect. I mean, it's this little counter that serves tacos in the middle (or shall i say side) of this red walled (and by red, i mean RED) bar/nightclub thing. Completely unconventional, completely unheard of, completely hidden, all in all... completely amazing. 

I think it's the fact that the tacos are 2$:
-Carne Asada
-Pollo
-Pollo Asada
-Vegetarian 

Or maybe it's because the fish tacos are only a little more than a dollar more than the ones mentioned above, maybe. I will tell you this, whatever you choose to pay for your taco the day you stroll into Nick's Crispy Taco's its worth it, every penny. 

They stuff these little suckers into an amazing combination of soft and hard shells, top it off with some fresh pico de gallo, then add your own red or green sauce, magic... pure magic.

Maybe its because the beers that accompany your tacos are 2 for $5. Maybe its because the service is so quick, and so speedy, that your table is clean and the trash is gone by the time you say "my lord, that was good". Maybe you came in because the line was out the door, maybe you didn't. Whatever the reason you came in was, aren't you glad you did?

Tips and Pointers:
-Parking (think twice)
-Really really cheap
-Great Atmosphere
-Any taco is good for $2, seriously...try them all. 
-Service was on point and amazing

[APPROVED]
author: Eric T.

description:
Any restaurant that doubles as a club at night is a-okay in my book. Although, that's not why I go. I go for the mouth watering Nick's style tacos, $3 margaritas and cheesy chandeliers. This place is cheap, tasty and fun - a fantastic recipe for an after work stop off. Our stop offs usually roll over in to the night and include massive amounts of drinking in to the night. So it's great that we always have some hearty delicious food in our bellies to stifle our raging hang over the next day. 

Another note, the black bean and corn salad is a-maz-ing. Top it off with some carnitas and all you salad lovers will be in heaven.
author: Julia N.

description: Place is pretty good. Weird location because its located inside of a bar. I ordered a quesadilla because the tacos were overpriced for just one taco. But i didnt realized it was a large fat taco, usually places give you like the small mini ones. I probably should have gotten a taco. The quesadilla was good but tasted pretty plain and average. It had carne asada and some vegetables in it. Im assuming this place is so much better at night, drunk after 12. Eating here around lunch time is weird because you just finding a random seat in this empty dirty bar. Wasnt really feeling that.
author: Andre W.

description: Just ok if you're in the neighborhood and want decent (but overpriced) Mexican in a strange place (a nightclub at night). I'd rather go to the Mission.
author: Es E.

description:
WOW!  That is what i have to say about this place.

I mean i know the mission has the best Mexican food.  Popalote is one of my fav and there re many others, but after years living in the mission i am looking for something different.  

I chose this place for a late snack with my girlfriend and was blown away at food, service and ambiance.  I ordered their grilled fish taco and a pork taco with guacamole and it was amazing.

go there for sports events too!
author: Jai D.

description:
I had high hopes for these tacos and they are a big let down.  No flavor and really I think you have to be drunk to want to eat a lot of these.  

These don't even come close to baja style.  I don't even know what style this is, maybe the Nick's way.

We had the carne asada, carnitas and the pescado.  The pescado was the best out of all these but its still average.  

Just food actually and I don't think I'll come back.
author: Mark K.

description: Enjoyed the tacos today (11/11/10) Ordered 2 of Nick's Way (Crispy Tacos) 1 with Carne Asada & the other with Pollo (chicken). I loved the Pollo taco more than the Carne Asada. Both tacos had pico de gallo, pinto beans, jack cheese & guacamole
author: Donna D.

description:
I came here with some friends on a Saturday night before going out to try some Nick's tacos which I have heard so much about.  I got 1 fish taco and 1 steak taco both Nick Style.  I was shocked how huge they were.  They are a bit expensive for tacos, ($10 for two) but tasted really good.  They also held up very well and not much of the filling spilled out, which is what I usually hate about tacos.

We also ordered beers from the bar and they were each only $3, I'm not sure if it was still happy hour or not but $3 is a decent deal for beers.
