My one complaint was that one of the blond waitresses/bartenders spilled a beer on my friend and got it all over his jacket.  She apologized but I think he deserved a free drink since he has to get his jacket dry cleaned now.
author: Peter W.

description:
Overpriced, inauthentic, and hit or miss service. Yet I keep coming back. Why? Taco Tuesday, of course. If you want the deal, stick to the carnitas, pollo, carne asada, or veggie. 

I'm a fan of the chips and guacamole for $2, but they tend to sheist you on the guac. There is literally more on your taco than on top of your giant pile of chips. I'm sorry, but one tablespoon of guacamole does not a happy Randi make. Last time I had to say something because it was such a sad little speck :( The gentleman working begrudgingly added some more, so at least I ended up happy.

I wouldn't come for a non-taco-tuesday-time (alliteration!) because prices get quite a bit higher. I had a burrito once and it was probably a 2 out of 5 on my quite distinguished burrito scale. Stick to the tacos and taco tuesday.
author: Miranda N.

description:
I now understand what all the hype is about! These tacos rock!

I finally went to Nick's and tried the Shrimp Tacos. I ordered them "Nick's Way" which I now think is the ONLY way when it comes to tacos. There was a crispy shell and soft shell with melted cheese in between. Holy goodness!! The toppings were all super fresh and the shrimp were perfect. 

The location is interesting. It's actually Rouge nightclub at night and a taco joint during the day. The prices are cheap, around $10 per person, but they only take cash so be prepared. 

My only complaint is that parking in this hood is tough. It must be because the tacos are so good :)
author: Kandace K.

description: Terrible terrible. I dont understand why people stand in line for their tacos. I got so sick after eating here.
author: Kajal P.

description:
Once again I let the Yelpers indirectly pick where I ate. Wish I would have opted for a healthier choice after the fact. Cool location. Not good enough to go back to, that needs at least a 4 star rating in my book. The Fish taco was way better than the Carne Asada. The best thing we had was probably the Tortilla Soup. Both my boyfriend & I agreed that it would have been a much better meal if we were wasted. Maybe I am just spoiled from living in the Mission but I thought both of their hot sauces (verde y rojo) were on the sucky side. 
I can see why people like this place, it does hit the greasy spot. Maybe a little too much though: my boyfriend is already passed out in a food coma & I'll be down for the count in....
Three 
Two
One
Good night! (Oh , Shit it's only 3:41pm)
author: Paulette B.

description:
I had to try this place!!! I have been to the one in the sunset district and it was phenomenal. By the way.......... Nick is actually there now instead of here. The one in the sunset district is inside of Underdogs sports bar. 

So..........there was a wait at the restaurant, Street, which is right next door. My friends begged me not to spoil my appetite, but I had to try it. 

I ordered the baja pescado taco and it was good. It was a little on the salty side and the batter was a little dark..................meaning they should be changing their oil soon. Between the two............I would say the one in Sunset is better, but not by much. I know for a fact that Nick goes pick up the fish every morning and he preps the food. So, it's fresh everyday. 

You really can't go wrong with either.
author: jason g.

description:
This place was SO crowded! Maybe because I went during the allstar game last Tuesday or maybe it's always this crowded??
We didn't know this before arriving but you have to reserve a table like a couple weeks ahead of time if you want to sit. Luckily Adam, a super nice guy that works there, helped us out and got us one! He really is the reason I decided to write this review. He was super helpful with everything seeing that it was our first time there. 
The tacos were SO GOOD. Like ridiculously good. The pollo one reminded me of food straight out of south america (I know tacos are Mexican but the seasoning was awesome). You have to try at least one Nick's style. It is a bit overpriced for a taco place regularly so going at happy hour is a good idea. I made the mistake of getting 2 nick's style tacos and chips & guac. BIG mistake. I was SO full but saved a taco for the next day and it was STILL bomb. I love how they put a ton of guac on it.

My only complaint was the drinks waitress when we were sitting at our table. I decided to order 2 beers ($6) and my friends ordered other specials. I gave her a $10 and she came back asking how much change we wanted. Obviously I wanted all my change! I'll give you your tip after, girl. But she questioned us almost in a condescending way, like "you want $4 on a $6 drink?" Yeah! I'm not gonna tip you more than my drink was worth! We were going to tip her, we just wanted our change back. When she returned she threw our change in water and stormed off...
We dealt with this issue with Adam who was so nice about it all. 

In the end, I'll be going back. I can't make it a weekly thing since those tacos are just too good. And next time I'm going straight to the bar myself.
author: Cesie A.

description:
My heart skips a beat when I think about this place, but that's probably because after two Nick's style fish tacos my arteries start to protest.  But, alas, Taco Tuesdays here are too good to pass up - humongous tacos with battered fish, slaw, and a plop of avocado.  2 for $5 Coronas and you're set, my friend.

Cons: parking - grrr!  You end up eating your tasty, messy meal standing up because it's so packed.  Taqueria-cum-nightclub/bar attracts a hodgepodge of patrons, which can make the ambiance festive or chaotic.  On Tuesdays, I'd say mostly chaotic, so if you can spring for the extra few bucks, go on another day.
author: R P.

description:
Only thing is, CASH ONLY.

Mellow, cheap and delicious food. What more can you ask for?

Their margaritas are pretty strong. I just wish they have blended margaritas.
author: Valerie T.

description:
I'd always heard really great things about this place, so one day during my lunch hour I ran to catch the bus at 16th and took it down to 24th.

The place was pretty crowded which always makes me a bit leery because I feel that the Mexican food places people pounce on and rave about are often overrated.

I got myself some soft tacos of carnitas. My usual order at any Mexican place. My tacos were sooo good. The salsa was spicy (for once!) and their tortillas are clearly handmade corn tortillas.
author: Liz p.

description: Not sure what the hype is about?  My "crispy" tacos were not crispy at all.  They were actually a bit chewy.  The tacos are good size but lacking any real flavor.
author: Steven H.

description:
free chips and salsa with check in! 

the pescado tacos were good. finally found a place with better fish tacos when compared to del taco! 

if you get the taco then nicks style is a must. 

the burritos were also good, but i preferred the tacos.
author: Tam T.

description:
Mission: Taco Tuesday Venue 2

I love Nick's Crispy Tacos on any day of the week. When they are only $2 (not counting Nick's way, which is extra but DEFINITELY worth it) I love them even more!

Add in 2-for-$5 Coronas and you have a GREAT post-work de-stress plan. 

You can't judge the place on the decor, because it's always odd to see a nightclub in the daytime. Just focus on the sports-showing flatscreens (which they will put on any game you want if you ask nicely and help them work the remote) and dig in to your tacos.

Warning: Get there early if you plan on staying! It gets packed to the point where people are eating tacos standing up... kinda funny to watch actually.

Mmm... I'm dreaming of fried, guacamole-smothered, cheesy carne asada and carnitas goodness right now... is it Tuesday yet?
author: Shannon B.

description:
Nick's crispy tacos... yeeeah, not so crispy. Might have been due to the fact that I let my taco sit for a couple minutes while I was at the bar.  But an extravagant amount of gauc and overly seasoned tortilla shells/chips makes for a delicious meal.  Got the chicken Something about the chips, man..

And the elote!  Damn, that was good.  It was a prime piece of summer corn.  Crisp, sweet, and juicy to the point of projectile hotness splattering on friends when you bite into the cob.  

Oh yeah, and the bar is a bit slow.  But that is due to understaffing - one bartender and no bar backs, though he's good... AND he has a heavy liquor pour.
author: Virginia L.

description:
Two words. FISH TACOS!

They were so amazingly great I don't think I have ever found a place which made them so delicious...I'm drooling just thinking about it. I went with a few friends, and growing up in SF I can't believe I've never tried this place before...I wish there was more of a seating selection because this place gets packed. 

I haven't tried anything else on the menu but hey I can live with just fish tacos, yeah they're just that damn good. You also need to try the habanero sauce if you want to get that zing! feeling on your tongue and lips. Also you need to make it "Nick's way" to make it complete :)
author: Jamie C.

description: Delicious fish tacos. I'm not so into the nachos because I hate fake cheese on my nachos and almost anywhere else. This is another San Francisco fave that lives up to the reputation it's built. If you're getting the fish tacos make sure to get them NIck's way-fried. Mmmmmm. You know how much I love this place? Enough to jump on the yelp deal they ran a year ago-with out hesitation.
author: Yvonne Q.

description:
My girlfriend lives in Cow Hollow and this was the first place she took me on my first visit to see her about a year ago. Since then we go every time I'm in town. 

The tacos here are like nothing I've ever had before. We get them Nick's way, and it doesn't matter what you choose as your protein option it's always delicious. My personal favorite are the fish tacos, whether grilled or fried. The hot sauce they put on the tables is very tasty and great to squeeze onto each bite. 

They also have great margaritas and drink specials on Taco Tuesday, and if you stay long enough things get a little crazy. Overall, this is a must eat if you are in the neighborhood, or for that matter, in San Francisco.
author: Aaron R.

description:
Between every bite I couldn't stop commenting on how awesome the pescado burrito tasted.  Seriously good!  I gave it 5 stars due to that damn burrito being so tasty, but the place had some things that were a little off when giving overall reviews.

First, the atmosphere was...how should I say...unique?  I'm not sure how to describe it.  It just felt uncomfortable.  The price was on the high side for a burrito, but matched the quality of the food.  If price is a big issue, you might take away a star.  Take the same food, put it in a nicer place to eat with waiter service, and the cost is completely justified.  

I told the guy at the bar, which is where you order, that it was my first time to Nick's and he gave a great recommendation along with some free chips with salsa and guacamole.  That was really nice of him and the "enhanced chips" were some of the best I've had.  I have every intention to go back and try more from their menu.  What kills me is that I just found this place.
author: Mike C.

description:
meh, food is ok. 

scene is way overplayed. frat party meets food truck meets sloppy sorority girl.

much rather eat my food with no swarms of douchebags. 

customer service is solid, scene is weak.
author: J S.

description: I LOVE the Nick's tacos.  The fish taco nick's way is delicious.  The line moves quickly, and Tuesday is Taco Tuesday (I forget exactly what the deal is, but it is cheap).  Sometimes you have to hunt for seating, but it is never too terrible.  I give it minus one star because it is in Rouge which is a horrible experience that words can not describe.  Stay on the Nick's side and do not get there too late or the Rouge music kicks off.
author: Owen S.

description: I'll try the burrito the next time I'm in San Francisco, but the tacos are outstanding. Seriously the best I've had, and I live in Chicago. Kind of expensive, but definitely worth it. The texture of the fried tortillas is something I'm surprised hasn't caught on with other "authentic" taquerias. I can't wait to go back!
author: Zack R.

description:
Granted I think I am the only one here over 30 years old on Taco Tuesday, but I don't care. I am so into the tacos I will ignore the 21 year olds in line next to me talking about how to get their parents to give them more money for off campus food rather than campus meal plans. 

Nicks only takes cash FYI. But there is an ATM next to the front where you pay for the food. At the bar where you order drinks in the red chandelierish room, they take credit cards. Another FYI, you don't order your alcohol and your tacos from the same places. I am not sure if it's because Nicks' and the red chandelierish room are too different places ( the red chandelierish room has a door leading outside with a sign on it saying Rogue) but who knows? 

Anyway when ordering a taco, to me, the only way to go is Nick's way: which entails it being FRIED, and covered in cheese and guac. I mean, isn't that the point of a taco? I've had the tacos here once when it wasn't Nick's way and I didn't even finish it as it didn't compare. 

What else is there to say about the place? Oh on Taco Tuesdays, the Tacos are $2, or $2.95 Nicks' way. Normal days I think they are maybe $4. If it's Taco Tuesday and you are coming with more than 4 people get there before 5pm to get a table as after that you're gonna have to wait. And after 6pm be ready to wait in line for both drinks and tacos. But it moves pretty fast considering. 

It's worth it either way. So worth it.
author: Denise B.

description:
AMAZING tacos.  I tried a baja style fish taco nicks way and a steak taco nicks way.  both were delicious.


their quesadilas were good but WAY TOO GREASY it was obvious that they just deep fry them...

had a great time drinking some beers and listening to music... i recommend everyone goes out at least once to taco Tuesdays.
author: Shawn A.

description: Their fish tacos are the best especially if you get them Nick's way. The taco Tuesdays specials are great but you have to get there early otherwise you will be waiting in line forever and there most likely wont be any seats left. I hate that it's cash only but at least they take credit cards at the bar.
author: Hayley H.

description: In short...I didn't think I was going to get full on two tacos. Parking can be a pain, but I will return by bike next time.
author: Dan P.

description:
Solid, no fuss tacos. The flavorful and filling baja fish tacos are my favorite. They come overflowing with fried fish and salsa. Yum! They're also enormous for tacos, so 2 should do ya unless you haven't eaten in a week. Get yourself a solid, salty margarita from the bar and you are in business!

I'm not too wild that Nick's shuts down around 7, and the cafeteria style seating is whisked away to become a dance floor for the bridge and tunnel set, but it just means you need to get it while you can. Enjoy!
author: Kelly C.

description:
This place gets me man wet and thats a statement in itself ! One of my favorite places to eat is SF and the best place in North Beach to eat after a night of going crazy!!!!!!

The burritos are all slap your mama good and the fish tacos are probably the best I've ever had! If you have any questions the staff there are Hella cool and on top of it ALL the portions are HUGE so you leave satisfied and not broke at the same time!
author: Steven H.

description:
Yum!

Like home made. Freshly prepared crispy shell-stuffed with meat, salsa, guacamole, and cheese.  Frickin delicious.  Nice touch to put a soft shell around the crispy shell to diminish the "messiness" factor.

 Little pricey and be prepared to wait as it get's busy.  

Pleasant, cheesy, red velvet- chandelier -mexican decor...like northern Baja.  

The bar and sports tvs are a plus too.
author: Thomas f.

description: No way on earth this place is 4 stars!  Fake cheese product, doctored processed guacamole, flavorless boiled chicken, salsa from a jar, tortilla chips from a bag...there is absolutely no passion or love in this food whatsoever. My wife had the fish tacos, battered and grilled, and both were pitiful! The tortillas weren't warmed, which caused the taco to disintergrate when she tried to eat it, the nondescript fish was also flavorless and not fresh. The battered fish taco had so much chunky, unseasoned batter on the fish, it was more like a fritter with a little bit of nasty previously frozen fish inside, and the cabbage was definitely from a bag, I know Costco shredded cabbage when I see it, and it had no sauce and sucked as well. 4 stars, no way!  You're better off at Taco Bell.
author: Victor W.

description: went with my wife after her hair appt... just out for a walk and walked in... excellent fish and carnitas tacos... walk up bar service was slow.. the two ladies bartending seemed too focused on the people sitting and not seeing the walk ups from the seating area.. lots of TVs with at least 4 differnt games on...
author: JC B.

description: Best tacos in the world. Hands down. Ambiance is interesting (inside a nightclub), but it's well worth the tacos, chips & guac.
author: Katherine L.

description:
I am simply addicted to these tacos! Mmmmm! I eat here at least once a week. The Pescado taco is by far my favorite menu item (a fried fish taco Nick's way). This place is definitely more Tex-Mex, but I could care less! All the ingredients they use are fresh daily and they have daily specials including fresh made Aqua Fresca in various fabulous flavors. I'm not one to "pig out" on many foods, but on a good day I can polish off three of these fabulous tacos regardless of how overstuffed I inevitably will feel afterwards. 

Pricing is very reasonable here as well. On the days I usually visit this venue (Monday and/or Tuesday) they offer $2 Carne Asadas, $3 Nachos, $3 Taquitos, and of course my favorite, the Pescado Taco Nick's way, which is not lightly stuffed, is only $5.

The ambiance at Nick's is also very pleasant, despite the rather cheap looking nightclub decor. Nicks is located within Rouge Nightclub so there is a bar you can choose to sit at and indulge in icy cold beverages while chowing down and watching sports on multiple flat screens located around the bar. Marlo always seems to be the bartender on the days I visit Nick's and is very kind and hospitable. She will gladly change the TV's if you have a specific game you want to watch and is very attentive to your drink needs.

I can't get enough of this place, all my friends know where to find me on Mondays/Tuesdays! AT NICK'S!!!
author: Bri C.

description:
shrimp taco nick's way all the way... ~approx: $5.50 each

great happy hour! $3 draft beers til 10pm... who wouldn't be a fan?!? and you can def tell there are lots of fans for this place cuz it can get a lil crowded...
author: Kelly H.

description:
Some of the best food we had over two weeks in California! Delicious and a totally fun time.

Nick's Crispy Tacos is indeed in a nightclub - and despite looking like people who'd been walking around town all day (sneakers, jeans) we stayed quite a while and enjoyed beers as the taco fans became outnumbered by the club fans.

The only thing we didn't love were the jalapeno poppers - just too cheesy and not enough spice. But seriously the tacos were amazing.
author: Amanda C.

description:
I can't believe I forgot to review this place?! I tried this spot in late August of 2008 while a friend was visiting from LA. 

We ordered the fish tacos (baja style) and pollo asado double decker style with everything. VERY TANTALIZING! 
The place looks like a cheesy lounge during the day but the tacos are unique. They may not have the most authentic taste and the best seasoning for a mexican spot, but worth a try, at least once if you ask me.  The nachos were good, but not as good as the tacos.
author: Anna S.

description: Decent food, good atmosphere but a bit overpriced.  A fun place to go out on a Tuesday night and they actually have the best deals on Friday nights (two menu items for $5, two beers for $5 or beer & a shot for $5).
author: Robby W.

description:
This place is not perfect.  Actually, there is a lot of room for improvement (decor being a prime example).

However, I hope they don't change one single thing.  I'm not sure exactly what it is, but I can't get these tacos out of my head.  The line, the expense, the weird set up... none of that matters the moment I bite into one of those delicious tacos.  I still don't understand how the shell can be both crispy and pliable, but I'm not about to question it.  They certainly don't skimp on the guacamole either.  At most places I request (and am charged for) extra, but these tacos come with plenty.  On top of that, they're a good size.  One taco was enough for me to be full, though I couldn't resist a few of my friend's nachos - which were also delicious.

I can't wait to some back here again and again!
author: Krystal K.

description:
Nicks Cripsy Tacos on Polk and Broadway.

 TACO TUESDAYS with $2 tacos and coronas, $3 margheritas!! AWESOME happy hour, but it gets busy so get their early or you'll be without a seat. Plus it's CASH ONLY for food.
author: Meredith M.

description: Nick's crispy pork tacos are some of the best I've ever had. The steak and chicken tacos aren't too shabby either!
author: Joshua S.

description:
The crispy fish taco (pescado) is so yummy!  If I lived close to Nick's, I'd swing by weekly just for a taco fix.  I also had the shrimp taco (camarones).  Also good but not as good as the pescado.  I recommend ordering the tacos "Nick's Way", which includes guac and cheese for an extra 95 cents.

My two tacos and iced tea was $11.  A great cheap eatz.  The ambiance is dated nightclub - red velvet booths, chandeliers, cheesy bar - but totally mellow and low hassle.  Very cool place.

Service was friendly.  I asked for change for my meter and got it with a smile instead of a snarl.  Thumbs up.
author: Jen C.

description:
how could anyone give this place one star??? food is divine and you eat surrounded by red velvet and disco balls. what else could you want? This restaurant is one of the things I miss most since moving from SF a year ago
I used to go at least once a week. I may just drive out there just for the tacos!
author: Lenore F.

description:
Great prices before 10 PM on drinks - all I can remember were $3 beers and wells, $15 pitchers of margaritas. I had a chicken burrito con todo and it was pretty good.

As soon as it was 10 PM (Saturday night), the bouncers cleared all of the folding tables and chairs, and turned Nick's Crispy Tacos into Rouge, a nightclub.  My group shuffled to the bar to have more beverages and I went to the ladies room.

This is where the stars fall out of the review. If you run a restaurant or club or WHATEVER... you NEED to have a clean bathroom.  It smelled like shit, there was toilet paper all over the floor, the stall door didn't close, and there were no toilet seat covers or paper towels (which were flowing out of the garbage can onto the wet floor).  Did I mention it smelled like shit? I'm no germophobe, but a little class?  A little responsibility, people? I was disturbed.

As the night wore on, I could smell the bathroom... even near the front door, at least 25 feet away. "It smells like shit and frosting in here," said my husband.

"Yes, dear. it does."
author: Jessica M.

description:
The fish burrito was delicious.  The grilled fish, cabbage and spicy sauce went perfectly together with no rice or beans as fillers.  The guacamole was tasty too.

What was not yummy was being taken down memory lane by someone who yakked all up and around Rouge and its booths in his youngster days.   Blech.
author: Seong P.

description: Shrimp and grilled fish tacos on-target. Jury still out on whether this place is a bar, a taqueria, or a speed dating market.
author: Inigo M.

description:
I had given Nick's a bad review based on an experience that is not representative of them now.  So I am updating it.  
Last night we stopped in for a quick bite and it was incredibly quick.  And by quick I mean astronomically fast!  The service was friendly, the food was delicious and my fish burrito was healthy and full of lovely grilled pescado. 
Minus 1 star for cash only, that sucks.
Minus  1 more star for having to sit in the garish red dining room and look at the douche bags at the Rouge bar.
author: Nilu r.

description:
Ok so as far as the tacos: they're ok. Good, not TOO expensive ($3 each),  and fast. I wasn't too fond of the chicken taco because it was  really rubbery and dry, just not that good. the steak on the other hand was flavorful and juicy. A MUST! 
Now let's talk extras
Salsa- sub par. There are NO spicy options which is very disapointing to a spicy lover
Fresas-What good mexican restaurant does not have strawberry?! i mean really it's a staple
Venue- ew... As someone who has been to Rouge a billion times, seeing it in the day time and EATING in it is really gross. Take your food and eat elsewhere
author: Angel J.

description: Taco Tuesday was one of the headliners of my places to visit while in SF tour.  We walked in at about 8ish and the place was packed.  While in line we enjoyed some of Mexico's finest beverages and waited patiently.  Since I basically stalk every restaurant before I go there, I already knew what I was going to get.  We eventually made it to the front of the line and I ordered 3 of the veggie tacos and told the guy I wanted them Nick's way.  He told me the veggie ones were always Nick's way.  I gathered my food and beverage and attempted to find some place to eat.  Being TT, there really wasn't any place to eat, so after a few minutes, we just stood by a TV and ate standing, which usually takes away from the experience.  The tacos were still delicious, basically take those crappy double decker taco bell tacos and make them into edible and authentic tacos and get the picture.
author: Jason P.

description: Wow, what happened to this place?  I know Nick left years ago, but the quality didn't really seem to suffer until the last couple of months.  I live a few blocks away, and what a disappointment it has become.  The blandest Mexican food in a neighborhood that, ahem, is not known for its Mexican food.  The collapse in food quality has turned the schizophrenia of the setting (washroom attendants, horrible jazz band (what happened to the mellowing reggae?) red velvet upholstery, and chandeliers), from charming to maddeningly annoying.  RIP, NCT.
author: Warren J.

description: Too bad it's not the real Nick's. If you want the real Nick's go to Underdogs in the Inner Sunset.
author: Brian P.

description:
Pros: Horchata.  Quick service.  They use quality meats from humanely raised animals.

Cons: Cash only, which isn't inherently bad but it's pricey for being what it is.  Lack of salt on everything, and we had three types of tacos.  Chips and salsa served nachos style, so your bottom chips end up soggy.

Maybe they were having a really bad day, but I don't want to give the place another chance, and I live a five minute walk away.  We're in San Francisco.  We don't have to accept this.
author: Diana O.

description:
I could not stop laughing when I first heard that Nick's Crispy Tacos patrons dined in Rouge. Sitting in bright red booths w/ 50+ chandeliers shining above,  at a nightclub that I fake ID'ed my way into long ago, seemed like a hilarious set-up. BUT, after stopping to think about it, I realized that it's a pretty damn brilliant idea. Kudos to Nick & Rouge for saving on the cost of leasing space! 

So their food, oooooh their food! It's almost mandatory that you order any of their tacos "Nick's style", or else you'll be kicking yourself. Making your taco crispy style and having it topped w/ guac is like icing on the cake. Nick, you are a genius. I also like the way they wrap the tacos, making em' a little less messy to eat.

The Carnitas taco is a must-order. YUM! Also, make sure to go on Tuesdays from 5-9 pm for their $2 Tacos and deals on drinks. The atmosphere is fun and the food is bomb. What more could you ask for?
author: Tiffany M.

description:
Oh man, my one regret about this place is I don't live in the city so it takes me an hour to get here! Sighs.

Tried the Carnitas, Pescado, and the Camarones tacos (Nick's style of course) and the Pescado was the clear favorite. I love how they slather a generous helping of guac on every taco.

The corn on the cob was mouth watering too! Although, if you're adverse to spice I'd ask them to go light on the chili powder.

The chips and salsa with guac was really good - mostly b/c of the guac. Except they didn't put enough guac so next time I'll order extra.

The bf and I shared 3 tacos, corn, and the chips and guac (+ horchata) and it fed us pretty comfortably. I'd say if we wanted to stuff ourselves we'd go for another taco. 

Damn - writing this is making me crave a taco. Would it be so bad if I ditched work?
author: Karina G.

description: Have again: carne asada and pollo asado tacos (Nick's Way with guacamole) were delicious! Weird seating system with most all the tables reserved at specific times. We were still looking for seats when our server brought the food and had no suggestions on where we could eat. We grabbed bar stools from the order counter and moved them to a narrow ledge by the tables, which worked ok except for our third person who had to stand. It was Taco Tuesday with the beef and chicken tacos at $2 each. We would have taken them to our car, but the low price is not for take-out.
author: Keith R.

description:
Went on taco Tuesday. Amazing tacos. And I am saying that after coming back from San Diego, where I eat Mexican food every other meal.

Love the fish, carne asada pretty good. Definitely get the Nick's upgrade that makes it super crispy, cheesy, and adds a boatload of guac. Great deal on Tuesday, but I don't think I would order one at a usual price. On Tuesday, the place is packed with people drinking and socializing, so keep that in mind if you wanted a place to sit and enjoy your taco in seclusion. But it is polk after all, so you should know what you're getting into. Taco for the price on Tuesday would be 5 stars, crazy crowd I have to downgrade one.
author: Brandon K.

description: Friday $5 pint and a shot.  Not bottom shelf choices either.  Must take.
author: Ben S.

description:
Can I just say the best steak Nacho's I've ever had!  Like what my friend and I said, "There's God in every Nacho"!  For only $5-6 dollars, it's loaded with jalapeno's, sour cream, tomatoes, steak etc.  The great thing about it too is that the chips don't get soggy.  And for some reason, I didn't feel as gross as I thought I would after eating a plate of nachos.  

I tried my friends Taco.  of course it's awesome!    I'm not really into soft taco's but this taco was soft and crunchy so all worked well!  One taco is a descent size but I would order 2 because you will definitely be wanting more after eating the first one.  It's $3/taco but honestly, it's worth it.  

my official favorite taco spot!  I can't wait to come back!!!
author: Kanani N.

description:
so...this was how a nick's PESCADO and GRILLED FISH tacos tasted like:
AMAZINGLY MOUTH-WATERING AND GRATIFYING!!!

the deep-fried fish, the pescado was cooked "beer-battered" like with crunchy red & green cabbage with a dollop of this fabulous creamy sauce, while the grilled fish was done nicely complemented by some piquant salsa.

these tacos were smothered between bites by their red and green chile sauce and washed down by a s'berry fresca and a glass of coke.

by 9pm, the staff will start removing the chairs and tables to get ready for the club goers, for this taco joint will turn into a night club. no wonder the beau smelled something funky or "barfy" (which i think was a left-over scent from the previous night event) while eating his food and he kept his taco closed to his nose the whole time.

certainly a cheap place to get pleasant and decent tacos, that's why they accept cash only. 

i was glad to have dined at this place and parking will not be a problem for us, for we have a "secret" parking spot around the area.
author: Nelle A.

description:
("Nick" = the goons that kicked out Nick and lowered the quality of the place)

Maybe the tacos are good but oh my god...stay away from 
the the  Chicken Quesadillas....you hear me?   Stay OUT!

I've given "Nick" three opportunites to serve me a simple
chicken quesadilla for a quick lunch.   I just can't do it
anymore.  I just can't.

What is that secret ingredient, "NIck?"   What is that secret
ingredient that you add to the chicken quesadilla when I
come in that causes and intense need to "use the facilities"
a mere one hour later?  WHAT IS IT, NICK?  I gatta know....

Thank GOD I've always been a quick walk to the home-base-
distance away but for the rest of you....don't get that quesadilla 
if you plan on an afternoon of shopping.  Just DON'T dabble
in that stuff....it'll get ya!   Believe you me...it'll get ya.

Why "Nick?"  Why are you doing this to the Quesadilla ordering
public?  You got some gripe with cheese, tortillas and chicken?
Christ!

========
UPDATE:
========
According to Peter, the in-house "doctor" at "Nick's", my last *three* 
post-quesadilla bouts of the scoots were my fault.....

(spelling issues property of "Dr. Pete")

"I am the on site Certified  Food Safety Manager for Nick's Crispy Tacos and just to let you know, what ever caused your IBS did not come from this establishment.  The symptoms you described would be a result of something you consumed more than 24 hours prior.  The same length of time applies to food poisoning.   So while I sympothize with your condition, I don't appreciate you falsely pointing your finger in this direction."



Sorry, "Nick."  You are correct.   I did *not* get diarrhea from your food.


My fault.....You're right.  I'm wrong.   Whatever makes *you* happy.
author: K-leen F.

description:
The tacos are California-style, large and filled to capacity with cabbage, red onions, salsa and served with whatever protein (there's also a veggie taco) wrapped in a tasty little bundle either fried or soft.

psst...I suggest the fried fish fillet. The bf likes the grilled camarones.

One taco will fill you up, two will make you want to spend the afternoon snoozing in the sun with a couple of cervezas. 

The fresh tortilla chips, salsa and guacamole are a treat as well. 

We tried the horchata and watermelon drinks today. ZOMG! Dessert in a cup.
author: May T.

description:
Who is this Nick you speak of?

Because I want to meet him and lick his face.

Lick his face and then eat some carnitas off of it.  

Seriously, slow cooked pork makes me giddy.  Not like yum-this-is-so-good-giddy.  But like yum-this-is-so-good-and-I-want-to-eat-25-of- these-and-if-you-try-to-touch-even-one-of-them-I-will-literally-punch-you-in-the-ovary-giddy.

The guacamole is really good too.

Call me, Nick.  We'll "do" lunch.  And yes.  We can do it your way.
author: Rachel G.

description: Fish Taco Nick's way is the only way. I dream about these babies. The other tacos are good but I don't like that they use beans. The restaurant/bar is really fun and quirky.
author: J F.

description:
This is another Good quick meal, like " $10 bj on San Pablo" kinda Tacco.
It's good even Nick is kicked out.
Well,
when you go to this place, 
especially late Saturday or Sunday morning, 
you'll see some young white couples, a baseball cap guy who is getting bald w/ T-shirt and bare feet sandals with a ponytail blond girl w/ victoria secret's sweat pants w/ flip flops holdin' a nice small handbag. 
Maybe she was his quick $10 fix in the morning.
Pe-uw, 
Can you eat the tacco after that?
Hey,
I'm just sayin'.
author: Nobu K.

description:
Hi Nick, I'm Nico.  Let's get our drink on, shall we?

We'll start with margaritas and make our way to the main course -- fresh meat.  In a crispy taco shell, of course.
author: Nicole G.

description: There fried fish burrito are so good. If you are the mood for some tacos and burrito i would recommend coming here.
author: Anthony V.

description: Gotta get the Tacos Nick's way. Can't beat Taco Tuesday with the atmosphere and there delicious tacos. Not your avg. mission Or Los Angeles style Tacos. Two of these will fill a grown man.
author: Shawn O.

description:
Nick's way is the only way.  I love the nachos with the special cheese sauce. Also beware of the yellowish hot sauce... its pretty hot.  
Fire in the hole!
author: Clayton K.

description:
"Niman Ranch meats,
Fulton Valley Farms free range poultry,
fresh line caught seafood,
and locally grown organic produce!"

This description just screams SF.  All fresh and organic and totally humane.  Now my question is... does this really turn into a club at night?  It definitely has all the club decor... plastic-like chandeliers, red walls, velvet-lined booths, and a dirty dirty feel.  I came on a Saturday at around 2 p.m. and there was a line of about 10 people forming to order.  Luckily the food doesn't take too long to come out.  Just grab your number, get situated, and wait!  

I tried 3 tacos all Nick's Way (additional $.95 per taco for jack cheese and guacamole).
-Carne Asada ($3.25): I would get this again.  The meat was flavorful... not salty, not bland, not dry... just right.  The whole taco itself is just stupendous but a part of me feels like it wouldn't be as good without Nick's Way.  It's worth the extra $.95.  It's good with the red and green sauces on the table although I prefer the red one because it's slightly more spicy.  
-Carnitas ($3.25): A surprise to find that the pork was moist.  There was definitely more meat in this than in the Carne Asada.  If I came back, I would probably just order one meat taco since they don't stand out too much from each other.
-Pescado ($3.95): My favorite of the three.  The fish was plentiful and super crispy.  Since the corn tortilla is also crispy, this is just one big crunchy delight to your teeth.  Unlike the other two tacos, this has tomatillo, cabbage, and onions in it.  I'm not sure but I could've sworn I saw some white sauce (kinda like how they make it at Rubio's) but this could have just been the juices all mixed together.

Two tacos is really all you need.  They are HUGE, filling, and they cost practically $4 per taco!  There's a horseshoe-shaped bar with two flat screen TVs playing sports.  Tap water is free. Cash only.  I'm giving this a 5 because you cannot find a place dedicated to making quality tacos using SF-healthy ingredients.  My only suggestion is to make the bottled sauces on the table spicier unless they are going for that refreshing sauce taste.
author: Shannon L.

description:
Yes yes, eeeverybody loves Nick's. I'll be honest, I missed the boat on this one. And I can't even say it was because I had high expectations coming in to it. I had no expectations coming in and even then it was a disappointment. The 2 reasons why were:

1. The food - God..really? You thought the Taco's were good? Alright, maybe I went when they were having a bad night but my tacos were disgusting. Seriously, they tasted like they had gone bad.

2. The atmosphere - While I love that I can enjoy high energy like this on a Tuesday night, the place itself is an absolute dump. It's connected to the forgotten yet still around, Rouge. First off they have got to get rid of the cords lining the floors or put mats over them because they kept causing people to trip. Wtf guys? You'd rather keep seeing your patrons almost bite it then fix the problem? Second, the floors are sticky, the place stinks, it's a bar atmosphere with extremely bright lighting, which I'm sure we all love. This is one of those bars you never want to see lit up. When it's dark it seems cool but turn the lights on and it's a big ole mess. For anyone else not thinking back to a regrettable encounter they had when they were young, please take this moment to do so.

On the plus side, service is quick and the men behind the counter do their job well. I think this place has survived because we don't know what else to do on a Tuesday night. Lucky for Nick's because if there was more competition around this place would have disappeared years ago.
author: Shreya C.

description:
Pescado is the way to go! Everything about it is good even down to the cilantro and I, for one, am a HUGE HATER of cilantro, but I'll eat it when it's in that pescado taco. Mmmmm.

3-5pm. $1 off tacos

5-7pm Taco Tuesdays- $2! Not for to-go orders though. :T
Today is Tuesday, but I paid full price for the carne asada and pollo $2 tacos cuz I couldn't eat it there. It just wasn't meant to be...

It was still good.

Pescado!
author: Dolores L.

description:
So I had a friend on Facebook suggest the place. I looked at the reviews here on Yelp first and decided to go check it out with my girlfriend. We went on Taco Tuesday as I read some of the other Yelp reviews said the Nicks was too expensive.

The order taker did not seem to speak good 
English and I ended up with one more taco than we ordered. I decided not to complain or anything and just go with it. The crispy taco with the cheese and guacamole was good. I would give the guacamole 5 stars.

I also noted that some Yelp reviews did not really like the atmosphere of the red velvet on the wall. I did not really mind it although it did kind of remind me of one of those seedy strip clubs a little further down on Broadway Street ha ha.   I thought the atmosphere was probably better because of all of the young, attractive yuppies I saw there.

Nicks Crispy Taco were good at clearing off our table before we finished and bar waitress was good at seeing if we wanted to order drinks when we were almost done eating. Upon leaving, I was going to go to the mens room but I decided to skip it was I get a bit weirded out with the whole bathroom attendant thing.

Overall, I enjoyed food and atmosphere. The place does have a bit of a "hustle" vibe to it, but overall, it was worth the time and energy to at least go check it out.
author: Sydney A.

description:
Day time taqueria, night time club scene.
 
White people make the burritos and Mexican people eat it.

Ain't that somethin?
author: Sani S.

description:
I have been wanting to try this place for forever! I finally came here on one foggy SF night and this place was packed! There was no where to sit so I had to take my order to go! I ordered the Carne Asada burrito. I guess this place is more known for their tacos then anything else. I should've gotten a taco. 

+: very flavorful Carne Asada.

-: always packed, does this place not believe in rice or something? I got to have rice on my burrito, but all of the burritos that they have do no include rice. I guess they are conscious about their carb intake. They have cabbage in their burrito also, which was very weird. It was a little too much cabbage and I love cabbage. The restroom was also very dirty! And some of the doors didn't even lock! 

I think this place is seriously over rated. Get your tacos in the Mission! or at Rubios!
author: Janet Z.

description:
Nick's crispy crack tacos?  My name is Brad, and I am an addict.

Hi Brad.

Hi Nick.

Just when I thought I could quit you you added breakfast tacos?  Thats just not fair, Nick.  

All's fair in love and crack slingin', Brad.
author: Brad C.

description:
What can I say about this place that hasn't been said about a yawn? Yeah, yawning is kinda cool, but you usually do it when you are bored or tired, which I find represents this place. The service and people that work here are great, but the food is Yaaaaaawwwwwnnnnn. 

And if I was Taco Bell I would sue the fucking pants off of Nick, for blatantly copying the Double Decker Taco, which is far more goddamn exciting to me than the Knock-Off Nick. Seriously, how is the Hot sauce from Taco Bell, not even the Fire sauce mind you, gonna be hotter than the "hot sauce" (read: weak sauce) they use at this place. And why is the green sauce hotter than the red sauce? I have never seen that before in my life. It's like me being the most sober person at the bar-doesn't happen anywhere.  

Well, re-reading this review, I think it is the worst one I have written to date. Kind of like Nick's tacos, it is definitely a Yawn. So YOU will probably never read this, because it is a sub-par review.
author: Dave G.

description:
I love Taco Tuesdays! $2 tacos and $10 pitchers. You can't beat that!

Nick's turns a bit into a club around 730 by dimming the lights and pumping the beats so if you're still there get ready to hit the dance floor!
author: Linda K.

description:
I tried their burritos and chips w/ gauc and salsa. Chips are a little thicker than I'd like them to be, and the gauc and salsa soaked into the chips, making them wet and thus, mediocre. The carnitas burrito (no beans, no rice, gauc, salsa and sour cream) was good, and when I say good, I mean it was flavorful. However, it's very lime-y and not everyone enjoys the lime in every meat flavor. 

Overall, a good place to grab a bite, although a little pricy and cash only, but I've had better.
author: Camille T.

description:
What a wonderful lunch place!  Here I am in front of Nick's Crispy Tacos on the corner of Broadway & Polk in Russian Hill thinking I am going to be the only person when the place opens.  No such thing - there are 10 people in line @ 1130AM.

So I ordered a Carne Asada taco and a Grilled Fish taco to go.  The tacos have meat, guacamole, tomatoes, cilantro and onion.   The steak is very tender and delicious, while the grilled fish (served w/ lime slice) was healthy and also delicious.  The veggies are fresh and the amount of guacamole in the taco is humongous - it is out of this world and polished off.  I recommend trying both hot red and green sauces, which are each served in a separate container.

Probably the best thing about the tacos are the taco shell itself.  Normally I do not jump up and down about a taco shell since I always order soft.  But their taco shell is what I would consider a  1/2 soft taco shell.  It has the best of both worlds in hard shell and soft shell.  The shell is lightly fried enough for a slight crisp but still soft enough to fold and give the feeling of a soft shell taco.

Everyone is right about this place - try Nick's Crispy Tacos for yourself.
author: Janet H.

description:
These "fish tacos are the tits"
- Sydney Fife (I Love You, Man)

I'm usually not one to second the crowd and echo the same sentiments but I couldn't help but sing with the choir this one time.  

The baja-style fish tacos Nick's way are AMAZING!! 

And if you see a nice young bartender named Madeleine, try her made-from-scratch Bloody Mary's... pretty darn good for a newbie.  She would also suggest the corn-on-the-cob at Nick's - I have to try it but will as soon as I get back there.
author: Win R.

description: There's a time and place for everything.  And when your Saturday-night-turned-Sunday-afternoon hangover keeps you in bed too late for even the latest brunches, that's when you turn to Nick's.  His crispy tacos will hook you up.  The surreal, nightclub day after look is just enough to make you think that maybe the party isn't really over and maybe the hair of the dog isn't a bad idea either...and next thing you know you're human again.  Not necessarily presentable, but ya feel all right!
author: Ted R.

description:
Food is OK.  The best thing on the menu is the corn (elotes).

I would have rated this place a 3 if not for the nasty atmosphere.  The restaurant is stank.
author: Burrito M.

description:
SF taco flavored kissses coming your way...

Walked into the joint. Took one glance at the chandeliers and red velvet plushness of the place and immediately had a flashback to a bachelorette party that I attended in the same venue more than 4 years ago. Yes. Club Rouge - and it still is to this day. Sweet.

I ordered a pescado taco, carne asada taco (Nick's style) and ELOTE (corn). After devouring them all, I went BACK to the counter and ordered another pescado and would have ordered another elote - but thought better of it as the first button on my pants popped open. 

Dang Nick. Hook it up. That's some gooooood stuff. 

HOLY ISH... they have ELOTE! I'll go back for that any time.
author: Stephanie I.

description:
Solid tacos and mexican food in a neighborhood where you don't expect it.  Unlike many taquerias, they serve beer, which is a plus.  The food is better than it has to be.

Any taqueria that can morph into a nightclub when evening comes gets major props in my book.
author: Aaron T.

description:
I'm a card carrying Mexican.  (Despite this incident: http://www.yelp.com/biz/del-taco-san-francisco#hrid:NAa1tWytBkZm1h_4IhrklQ)
and if this place wasn't so cheap I'd be irritated at the "mexican" food I was given.  

Tacos Nick's style or whatever....a cripsy in a soft with Safeway guac and some tomatoes.  Mediocre at best.

The margs were HELLA sweet thank god for the ice that eventually melted and made it drinkable. 

The night was topped off with a major "I'm old" moment when I looked around and everyone looked like they were toting "out of state licenses" or their big sister/brother's passports. 

Question: Do they share the lease with Rouge? (lamest club ever: http://www.yelp.com/biz/rouge-nightclub-san-francisco#hrid:ZYIm0VuPoiubgoPYdTqoVQ)
author: Jay H.

description:
When the yelp deal for half off, I was so excited to try this place out, but my excitement was unwarranted. 

We used the yelp coupon to get nachos, veggie taco, carne aside burrito, and a shrimp burrito. 

When we first walked in, no one greeted us except for the tacky decor, super red and not unlike a cheap Vegas lounge. Our food arrived promptly, but that turned out to be a bad sign. The food was poorly executed with bland and unimpressive flavors. The carne aside was dry. The beans in the burritos and tacos tasted strange. There were barely any shrimp in the almost $10 burrito. My friend got more delicious shrimp in her $ 4 taco at Underdogs in the Sunset. The nachos' authentic cheese sauce was worse than a Lays microwaveable cheese dip. There was hardly any guacamole or pico de gallo on the chips.

The entire experience was a disappointment.   Go to the underdogs in Sunset. Way better.
author: Jen Y.

description:
Eating Mexican food in a VIP booth at Rouge with the lights on is a bit odd at first, but once you start eating these delicious crispy tacos, you completely forget that about 5 years ago you were probably sitting in the same booth getting picked up by some sleazeball. 

The fried fish tacos here are SO good! And the carne asada taco done Nick's Way is awesome. With cheese and a mound of guacamole on top of a giant taco, it's unbelievable that you don't make a huge mess while eating it.
author: Connie C.

description:
eh... I don't know what the big hype is over this place? I heard people talking about it all the time "oh my gosh you have to try their breakfast burritos!!" I finally walk into this dirty looking place, small order counter and I think there was only three different options. 

boring. I was not happy and I ended up going to the Marina Deli to pick up a way better breakfast burrito there. I will not be returning to Nick's Crispy Taco's.
author: Lindsey N.

description:
WTF?

The tacos come soft by default?  It's called Nick's CRISPY tacos.  Sure was jonesin' for a CRISPY taco.

Additionally, when I was here today, it was take-out only, and the place was a complete mess.  Either they were remodeling or this place got out of control during "bar time" last night.

Take out was good, because I got to check out Shanghai Kelly's across the street while I ate my delicious SOFT grilled fish tacos.
author: Rocco B.

description: This is a very funky place to eat and drink. The food only takes cash, so make sure to have it. But the bar takes card. I'm wondering if they are both separate. Regardless, it's a nice place with cool interior design. The food is cheap and they give epic portions while the drinks are cheap especially during happy hour. Parking will be near impossible, as I had to park almost 10 blocks away. Great place to come for cheap and good food and drinks
author: Phan H.

description:
AWESOME AWESOME tacos and burritos... just sad they kicked us out before we could have any. We sit down at a table, waiter comes by to clean it off for us. He says nothing about not being able to dine in. We get to ordering and the guy tells us we have to take it to go because they are throwing a private event... even though we are sitting at a table... One friend already ordered... they didn't tell her she had to take it to go. They just packed it to go for her. Was she supposed to stand outside and eat her taco? Kind of rude I thought. 

We were from out of town so we went back to try the food the next day. We went on recommendation of a local. Woulda had a 4... had to bring it down a star on the lack of consideration from the night before.
author: Kat T.

description:
I would put money on it that the majority of people who like this place also think that Sizzler is one hell of a great steak house, The Olive Garden is like a trip to Sicily & that House of Nanking is about as close to Mainland China as you can get without that nasty communism, organ theft & opium den problem.  OK, that's a stretch but they all have one (sorta) thing in common that no self-respecting Italian, asian, or carnivore would ever be caught dead in one of those restaurants.  Nicks, IMHO, is one small step up the culinary scale from Taco Bell as far as mexican restaurants/taqueriuas in the Bay Area go.  

With over 50+ taquerias located just a short walk, bus or taxi drive down the street, why the fuck would anybody come here?  "Oh, but they've got a really coooool, edgy attitude"  Fuck your cool/asshole attitude!  Shut the fuck up & make me my burrito & keep your attitude & supposed coolness to yourself.  So enough of their "ambiance"  the food report would be as follows.

1) Salsas tasted downright canned, store bought.
2) Are cilantro & avocados supposed to be blackish brown?
3) "Please sir, please may I have one more tortilla chip?" 
4) It's summer, find someone to sell you a fucking fresh tomatoe too.
5) Thanks, I've now just had my daily requirement & then some of salt/sodium. Good way to sell beer I guess.

Nick, YOU SUCK!

(Sorry bout all the f-bombs, it's Nicks fault not mine.)
author: Bill T.

description: Love this place. If you like inexpensive Mexican food and live in Russian Hill/ Marina, there is no other place that does it nearly so well. The crew is great and will take great care of you. Take advantage of the fact that you can call ahead and skip the line!
author: Roy T.

description:
This place is unforgettable.  Almost literally.  I absolutely LOVE Nick's.  The carnitas, Nick's way... the pescado taco, with that special sauce. UhhM, mmm, mmm!

I say almost literally because I do forget about Nick's Crispy Tacos ALL the time, because in San Francisco you pretty much eat where you shit.  Meaning if you live in the mission, you don't normally go to Russian Hill to eat at a place like Nick's... Now OBVIOUSLY this isn't always true - but kinda.  I hate forgetting about good places like Nicks and then remembering it whence you walk by the place and are like SHIT! this woulda been good for that one time I was itching for a good taco!  SF has soooo many great eating/hanging/partying establishments, I find this happens to me often.

Nick's is a very good taco place, I have never had their burritos or quesadillas because their tacos are so good.
author: Kelly H.

description:
After getting rejected at the Blue Monkey Taco Lounge in San Jose the night before (friend didn't have an ID, wtf) I was dying for some good tacos. We were in the city anyway so I made it a point to my group that we HAD to try Nick's in SF. After all, I have been hearing so much about them from my colleagues and friends alike. And besides, I've never had a fish taco (shocking!)

Right, so the parking gods must have been on my side this day (they never are), cause, i got the most perfect spot right outside the doors of Club Rouge. FANTASTIC! I put my club on (you never know these days) and ran inside, the long line was annoying but acceptable.

Being that I have never been here before I had no idea what to order. The lovely order taker/cashier register lady was quite helpful in advising me on what to get. I also asked her which aguas frescas were good, she schooled me well...

So 5 minutes later the tacos are brought to our table... oooh, i've never had a taco that's looked like this before, I'm excited to shove it in my mouth, but only after i douse it with a good helping of the sauce that's in front of me. Mmmm Mmmm!!! I was in taco heaven. This was my first real experience  eating a fish taco, and I don't know, I guess you can compare it with your first experience with sex. It was different, awkward but damn good. Sorry, couldn't think of anything else to compare this to.

Nick done did a good a job on this one.
author: Richard T.

description:
Best. Tacos. Ever.

No matter what kind of meat fillings you like, it is so much better Nick's Style.... fried with tons of guac!!

Go for Taco Tuesday, where tacos are $2 after 5pm.
author: Jen D.

description:
Here's the thing - the name of this place has 3 words.  Nick's.  Crispy.  Tacos.  This means you should order a:

1) Crispy,
2) Taco,
3) Nick's Way.

Don't order a burrito.  Don't order an enchilada.  Don't question me.  Actually, order two.  

Gas rating:  4
Nick's Crispy Tacos do contain beans.  However, I now come prepared with Gas-X Thin Strips so I can eat as many Crispy Tacos as my heart desires.  Which is actually two because even though my heart desires more, the button on my pants limits me to two.
author: Soo C.

description: Fried Fish Taco, Nick's Way--best fish taco I've ever had.  They have great breakfast burritos too, which makes this place some of the best mexican food in town.  Only downside--its expensive.  Like 4 bucks per taco, but unlike other taco shops in the city, you get what you pay for!!
author: Ryan H.

description:
Nick's way is the way to go.  

Crunchy, deep fried fish goodness.  Licking my lips, loving the cabbage and guacamole and the hard taco shell.  But where is the hot sauce????   Where oh where has the hot sauce gone?  I see sauce on the table, but in no way is it close to being hot.  I need some tongue tingles.  And for that Nick's, I give you 4 stars instead of 5.  Yes, your deep fried fish taco was magical and made my tastebuds do cartwheels, but the hot sauce would have caused my tastebuds to do backflips!  

NOTE TO SELF:  Bring habanero sauce in handbag next time you are craving an amazing taco and heading to Nick's.
author: Christina S.

description:
This morning I took a shower and realized I had a pinto bean and some rice lodged between my non-existent boobage.  That's how fast I was eating Nick's burritos last night.  If you knew how close I lived to the place, you'd be shocked at how long it took me to get a bite to eat here. 

I'm not much of a fish eater....I love sushi, swordfish, tuna and shrimp even, but everything else is a big NO NO for me.  I'll try to eat fish sometimes to appease people because they always have to know why I don't like seafood and I just don't want to rehash the childhood stories of eating nothing but pasta, salmon, sardines, halibut, and fish broth ad nauseaum.  Not to mention the one I WILL NEVER EAT FISH AGAIN moment when my mother took a big piece of fish out of her mouth (to remove the bones) and put it right into mine.  Just thinking about it makes me sicker than the thought of sleeping with pinto beans and rice in my bra.  

Everytime I thought of Nick's, I'd think fish tacos...."get the fish tacos, make sure you order the fish tacos," my friends would say.  I naturally rebelled and decided I wasn't going to order fish tacos.  As a matter of fact, I wasn't even going to go to Nick's PERIOD.  Yeah, that'll show them!  In the end, I had to have some Mexican food last night....needed to and Nick's is the only Mexican in Russian Hill.   I ordered the burrito vegetariano, filled with pinto beans and rice, guacamole, tomatoes...very good and filling.  I loved it.    

Could kick myself for waiting so long to come here.  Will return.
author: Daniela L.

description: I'm not usually a fan of Mexican food, but I couldn't stop eating my pescado and grilled pescado tacos and plowed right through them. They don't skimp on the ingredients and the portions are generous. 2 is definitely more than sufficient for each person.
author: Jennifer W.

description: I'm giving this place 2 stars because it's probably the most expensive tacos i've ever bought. I bought 4 tacos, Nick's way, and a beer, and my total tab was $40. They're bigger than average sized, but what made it so expensive was that I ordered them "Nick's Way" which was that the tortillas were suppose to be crispy and it comes with guacamole. When I got the tacos, they weren't crispy, they were just heated up and it came with a lot of guacamole, which I ended up kind of scraping off. It was messy and tasted good, but not worth $40. If you're looking for tacos in that neighborhood, I don't know, find a different place or don't be in Russian Hill.
author: Catface G.

description:
I have never, ever had a bad experience at Nick's Crispy Tacos.  Their tacos are delish...I found myself dreaming of them on my vacation in Cabo.  What does that tell you?!

Everytime I come here, I always get the exact same thing.  I order the chips + salsa, 1 carne asada taco (nick's way of course!) and their elote, which I refer to as crack corn.

When ordering any taco in this establishment, you MUST make it Nick's way.  It's .75 extra but you get a generous dollop of guacamole and jack cheese.  Yummy.

Their elote (CRACK CORN) is friggin to die for.  The corn is always piping hot and sweet.  They squeeze fresh lime on top and smother it with mayonnaise.  Then it's dusted with Parmesan cheese and paprika to give it that addicting flavor.  I had it in Mexico and they got nothing on Nick's for sure.

It's a must for all you people who have never tried it!  Parking isn't a problem if you go in the daytime and the decor is a bit shabby but who cares?  Are you eating the food or are you there to enjoy the scenery?
author: Lisa W.

description: Delicious tacos. Especially the fish! Overpriced though.. and the taco tuesday is only for eating in which isn't always what I'm in the mood for since it gets loud and rowdy. But it's a fun place and their food is good. Their salad is really good too.
author: Misty M.

description:
Nick's crispy tacos is the epitome of what tacos should be. Huge, stuffed, and every bite includes the wondrous mixture of guacamole, salsa, sour cream, cheese, and lime juice. You have to get them Nick's way (w/ all the guac & sour cream & the fixins), because without it, your taco will be naked and embarrassing, ashamed of its small stature and petite body. 

Skip the grilled fish taco, unless you got a badunkadunk that you want to get rid of. Unless the rice, cheese, and beans made you look like Oprah in jeans. Unless you got dumps like a truck (truck, truck), thighs like what (what, what). Unless you're 36-24-36... and 5'3". 

Go for the fried fish taco. Throw some of that chili sauce on there and you got yourself a taco made for a king. I also got the Elote corn on a cob, which was pretty good with all the cheese they smear on there, but unfortunately it's steamed corn and not grilled corn. Steamed corn, regardless of what you put on it will always taste like water. Yo Nick -- grill that bitch!

Place looks like it belongs in Tijuana. Colorful, but with peeling paint and faded colors. Loud and PACKED, but with drunk fratboys who are celebrating the C+ they got in algebra. Especially on Taco Tuesdays. So even though it's cheap as hell on Tuesdays, I recommend you go on Normal-Price but No Douchebag Wednesdays.
author: Roy C.

description:
I gotta say, this place was totally overhyped to me, and therefore gets a resounding MEH.

I hear Nick doesn't even work here anymore, he works at the pizza place next door.  I don't know if the crispy pizza is better than the crispy tacos, but they very well might be.  These tacos are boooring.

And I always thought deep frying something was a surefire way to make it better.  Actually, since I didn't have the non-deepfried tacos, it may very well make them better.  Deep fried, they didn't taste like much.  And I ordered like 4 of them expecting to love them.

Between these tacos and the twinkies at butter, i am really questioning my deep fried theory.  Now, all I have is the cream cheese theory.  MMM, cream cheese tacos, now there's an idea.
author: Steve S.

description:
wtf - Seriously, I am questioning Yelp reviewers mass opinions at this point, w.t.f.

First, if you have never eaten Mexican food before, I could see how this  might be acceptable to someone that has no taste-buds.

Second, I should have known not to try a 'Mexican' restaurant named after a guy named 'Nick' - there is nothing Hispanic/Latin/Mexican about the name 'Nick'.  My own fault.

Third, I have been on about a month long search for decent (would prefer great) fish tacos - still have yet to find them, but alas, someday I will.  However, Nick's is not the place for fish, definitely, definitely not. No.  No.  No.

Fourth, and almost most important - I've never been here before, but this isn't an excuse: If you are going to call your restaurant, "Crispy Tacos" - the tacos themselves better come crispy.  Si, por que, no.  They didn't - the tacos at Nick's aren't crispy tacos unless you ask for them crispy.  W.T.F?  Your restaurant is called, "Nick's Crispy Tacos" but I have to ask for my tacos crispy?  Umm, okay, I can see the rational behind that - actually, I can't. at all.

So, my grilled fish and camarones tacos (I like mixing it up) were soft and dry - not crispy, like the name of the restaurant indicated.  The tortillas they did come in were tasteless and I'm relatively sure, store bought from the Walgreen's adjacent.  Tia Rosa much?

I couldn't even eat my tacos - they were so thick with dry, pasty tortilla that they reminded me of cardboard, no - newspaper, yeah newspaper.  I got a total of three shrimp, which is the only thing I ended up eating.  They had no special sauces for their grilled fish and I'm pretty positive that their grilled fish came right out of a Long John Silver's frozen dinner.  Bitchezzzzz.

This place is a rip-off, I'm really glad I wasted money.  At least I rolled by during happy hour so I could drink my dinner instead.  Which I have to add, the margaritas were good.  That's what that one star up there is for.
author: Lauren G.

description:
I want to drop a star for the cash only policy, but since I give Nick's six stars, it still gets a solid five.

Holy f*&$ing s&*%, these tacos are good. I'd heard so much hype about Nick's. Usually when something is hyped up that much, the only result can be disappointment because your expectations are so high.

Not so with Nick's. Nick's tacos are every bit as finger-licking, ecstasy-inducing and addicting as people say they are.

Chips with salsa and guacamole are a must. They're just better than any chips with salsa and guacamole you've ever had anywhere else. Pescado taco, Nick's way, is a soft taco shell wrapped around a hard taco shell overflowing with huge juicy pieces of batter-fried fish, lime mayonnaise, cabbage, cheese and topped with a generous dollop of guacamole. I can't begin to describe how perfect a food the pescado taco is. 

Para chuparse los dedos!
author: Deb I.

description:
What was the appeal of this place? It can't be the food, or service, and definitely not the price.
Oh right, it's so white people don't have to go into the Mission.
author: Jason D.

description:
Hate that I have to even give one star after the experience I had the other night. Im usually a HUGE fan of Nick's and go there pretty regularly. So for my birthday I had a group of people go on Monday night.

DONT EVER GO ON A MONDAY. Unless you want to be a part of an impromptu comedy show in which you will be totally verbally assaulted and harrassed.

This awful hideous man who was the host called out our table and started attacking us and saying how he bets our boyfriends beat us based upon our bitchy faces, how we have demons inside of us, that he guarantees weve been single for our whole lives based upon the way we look...oh and my PERSONAL favorite "damn you must have been raped and beaten as a child based on how angry you look." Hilarious? This guy was the biggest asshole I've ever met in my life, and I honestly dont know why they let him put on a comedy show. NO ONE was laughing, everyone was uncomfortable, and he was attacking and being MEAN to everyone. He was the farthest thing from funny and had nothing else to do but be hideously mean to me because it was my birthday. When i would ignore him he would attack me more and tell me how awful my face is and he hopes my boyfriend beats and rapes me on the regular. 

Thinking of filing a suit and calling the manager....
author: Michelle A.

description:
This place is great... the food, the atmosphere, the drinks, oh my!

My order of the crispy fish "Pescado" taco was so tasty. Also for the price the chips, salsa and guacamole was a large serving, great to share at the table. The other tacos I tried were all good as well. This place has so many great reviews.... what else should I say. It is amazing food!

The booths can accommodate large groups and the happy hour drinks are cheap! My margarita was just okay, but for $2 can I really complain??
author: Natalie N.

description:
My friend told me about this place. She says they have the best tacos. So we planned to make a trip to SF with our family. I must say the carne asada tacos (nick's way) was good & pretty BIG). We also order ELOTE which is corn on a cob with some chili powder and cream cheese?!?.. that was pretty tasty. 

I gave this a 4 stars since my daughter didn't like this place so much. Although she is a picky eater, It's kid friendly.
author: Janet C.

description:
Nick's Crispy Tacos is in the old Club Rouge space and apparently Nick has done little to modify the dining room to fit the new business. Other than hanging a few sad pinatas from the chandeliers and tacking a couple of sombreros on the wall Club Rouge is unchanged. But you don't come for the stale atmosphere. Hell, you don't even come for the burritos. If you want a burrito go to the Mission. Duh. You come for the tacos. If you get them Nick's way they come with a crispy tortilla shell wrapped in a soft tortilla and guacamole.

This is a yuppie/Marina crowd kind of place. Not only will you not see any Mexicans eating there you won't see any Mexicans WORKING there. Usually this a red flag situation and normally I would turn right the fuck around and head to the Mission but I had heard good things so I stuck it out. 

"Hey, these are pretty GOOD!" Personally I think they're hiding the Mexicans because I would hate to think white people are making tacos this good. 

A few drawbacks though. 

Cash only. That's so 1992.

You have to pay for chips and salsa($1 no big whoop) but they put the salsa right on TOP of the chips. Eat 'em fast or you'll have tortilla soup.

The depressing dining room and clientele. It's like rundown French cabaret meets Mexican border town during spring break. Whooohooo!!
author: Josua P.

description:
Taco Tuesday is surprisingly packed here.  The line at one point was thirty deep.   I take it as a sign that the economy is doing poorly that so many are desiring these tacos.   

Since people are chowing down on tacos in a night club it's kind of an odd vibe here.   Some people are here trying to look good.   (Yes you, the booth full of bottle blondes.)  Some are just here to eat.   As a result there is less mingling than one would expect when $3 margaritas are available.
author: Beau G.

description: This is my favorite taco spot in the city.  The tacos are generous and filling, with fresh and wholesome ingredients.  Love that it's one of the few CASUAL taco places where you can also get booze!  woo hoo!  And killer tacos.   Funky, cool atmosphere.  A bit retro, obviously a converted lounge.  Wish it was a little less dark.  As MF said on 9/21/12, parking IS an issue in this area.  But that's nothing new in this city.
author: Steve S.

description:
What's better than watching the LA Lakers get smashed?????  Watching it while eating a Nicks crispy taco with a margarita in a fun atmosphere.  

This is a really fun place to come with friends.. especially on $2 taco tuesdays when tacos and coronas are just $2... what a steal and its a big place so you can bring lots of friends.
author: Megan L.

description:
I live around the corner from NCT and last night was the first time I had THE EXPERIENCE!  Hello!!  I had a $2 all organic chicken taco with, um, yes, big chucks of chicken meat and a yummy not watered down $3 margarita.  Ok... the scene... it was like, Saturday night on a Tuesday... and the crowd was mixed... not the Marina 'mixed crowd' but the crowd where you can show up in sweats and a t shirt or a suit and still have fun, drink, eat and feel comfortable.  For a busy night, service was amazing... I did not have to wait forever at the bar for someone to acknowledge me... 

Nick's is HANDS DOWN A SF INSTITUTION!
author: Nezza F.

description:
My mouth just waters thinking about this place. I can't believe I haven't written a review about it yet but I just went here today and wouldn't mind having it again tomorrow. I've never ate inside this place and always ordered it to go and it's still SOOOO good. 
My coworkers and I used to have a tradition of going every Friday but we ended up going any day. I need to come one day and eat inside when it's just made. I don't know how much better it can get. 
My FAVORITE: Pescado Fish Taco and DEFINITELY NICK's WAY baby.

They also have Nick's Crispy Tacos on 19th & Irving formally known as Under Dogs sports bar but now called Taco Shop. This place is also very good and their spicy sauce is to die for.
author: Deb C.

description:
I went during their Taco Tuesday happy hour, where tacos are $2 and margaritas are $3.

If you want cheese and guac the tacos are $2.95, and you have to order at least 2-3 to fill your appetite. They're okay, not particularly great, but they get the job done. Margaritas are $3 but quite tasty and rimmed with salt. Coronas are two for $5.

The most frustrating part of Taco Tuesday was the ENORMOUS number of people there. It was a perfect storm of dinner time, happy hour, and an all-star game, so seating was virtually non-existent. If you can get a booth, I can see it being absolutely fantastic- cheap drinks, lively location, good company. But we stood for over an hour, munching our tacos, and said booth (or even a stool by the bars) never became available.

Not saying I won't ever try it again, but I'm not eager to go back any time soon...
author: Allison S.

description:
What can I say about Nick's that hasn't been said already?....
First of all - don't be a fool and order a burrito your first time here, it's called Nick's Taco's for a reason! (though once you've tried their taco's their burritos aren't that bad either)
Though I must say their chicken salad is pretty tasty and very filling if you're going for a lighter version of the taco. 
Their service is super fast, but just a heads up they close at 9...and they mean business, they're kicking you out at 8:50 whether you like it or not!
This place has made me look forward to Tuesday's from here on out...but go early if you're not a huge fan of waiting in line!!
author: Kristy M.

description:
I did not know that the infamous Nick's Crispy Tacos was in Rouge! Haha.

Finally tried this place last week and the tacos were great! I had the fried fish taco and the carne asada taco, both Nick's style. I don't think I got the happy hour tacos, but it doesn't even matter. The two tacos were filling and sooo good! The combination of soft and crunchy shells, tons of guac and onions, lime, and the meat/fish were perfect! All the while, a dj was spinning some great songs (hot, current ones and bringing back some good, old ones). Surprisingly, it was better than the music I've heard here on club nights! Very curious to check out the new location...
author: Diana Y.

description:
I don't get it.  After all the hype of 4 stars and over 800 reviews, I thought surely, Nick's was going to hit the spot.  After trying beef, pork, and fish tacos, Nick's style, I left wanting to hit up the taco truck.

Perhaps my fellow yelpers have yet to try the goodness real tacos?  Nick's tacos completely failed to fill my taco craving and fell short.  

Where's the crispy in crispy taco?  I expected a crunchy crackle, but all I got was a stale bite that was hard to chew.  The steak and Mr. O's pork wasn't marinated very much, lacked flavor.  The battered fish taco had no taste - none.  I drenched it with the sauces on the table, but it still failed to please.

I will say that they stuffed those tacos.  The best thing about the meal was chips and salsa with guac.  The servers were nice guys, refilled my drink without me having to stand in the incredibly long line.  

$25 for 4 tacos, chips and salsa w/guac, and 1 large coke...wasn't worth it.   And so my search for the perfect taco in the city continues...
author: Stella K.

description: Taco Nick's way, been there done that.  I'll praise the lesser-known tidbits that make this place so legit.  Want to watch football on a Sunday at a spot you can ACTUALLY order food within and drink for a reasonable price?  Yeah, this spot.  $2 drinks and all the mexican food you can shake your 49ers sombrero at.  Get there sometime early in the day and have their breakfast burrito.  I think that might be my favorite thing off the menu.  Sure, bacon, sour cream, cheese, and whatever else you asked me if I wanted sounds delicious.
author: William B.

description:
My unni just arrived from NYC and I asked her what she wanted for lunch. FISH TACOS she exclaimed! Ok then. Fish tacos we shall get. Well, no fish tacos for me since I'm allergic. But I got the carnitas taco nick style and a prawn taco nick style. 

Meh... Too much veggies, not enough meat. But they were tasty nonetheless.
author: Jen D.

description:
Looking to shave off a good couple years off your life?  Become a regular here.

And I'm almost quite sure ordering your taco Nick's way cuts off another good 5 years.

That said, it's SOOOOOO worth it.

And thank you Nick for introducing me to the "elote"... actually, make that a sarcastic thanks.  Sadly, life will never be the same and the roasted corn at fairs just won't be enjoyed as much without the delicious grated cheese and spices that come with your version.
author: Melanie P.

description:
Gotta get it Nick's way!  Super good crispy tacos full of guac n fillings. The salsa is great as well.  Super tasty.
