Plus they have cheap beers, and the bar connected to it has great deals all the time.

Bring cash.  Only downside is you get two tacos Nick's way that is like 12-13$.  Not bad but kinda pricey for 2 tacos.
author: Chris L.

description:
The taco that I had gets 5 stars, but the set up of the restaurant brings my rating down one star.  Be prepared to wait for parking (if you're driving) and in a longer line once you're inside, but it's definitely worth it.

My boyfriend and I weren't sure what a "crispy taco" meant, but they are soo good.  I guess it is a corn tortilla pan-fried to make it cripsy, and then a softer corn tortilla around that?  Kind of tough to explain..  I had the carne asada (and added guac & jack cheese) and it tasted just like the "authentic" Mexican food I love so much in Orange County.  Next time I'm in the city I'm definitely going back.
author: Betsy D.

description:
This place is soooo awesome. The decor is really funky and I'm loving the red velvet booth. 

The best part, the food of course you silly! The shrimp tacos are to die for! I will I will I will definitely come back!!
author: Perry S.

description: A go-to in our neighborhood. We often dine-in and also take-out. It's great to watch games and hangout with groups. I would avoid it on Tuesdays, unless you really want the experience. The cripy fish burrito with everything is my favorite!!!
author: Cheyenne C.

description: The food is nothing to write home about but if you visit on a tuesday night you will be pleasantly surprised with the funky  and social atmosphere.
author: Hannah A.

description:
I walked in here, and thought I was in the wrong place.  With the chandeliers, red booths, etc, it looks like Nick's was once a dance club.  From the reviews posted here, I think it was.

I was craving tacos, and on my way to pick up my roommate from work last night, I stopped by.  Many things are available, but, since you're at Nick's CRISPY TACO'S, I didn't see the need to get anything else.  I was not disappointed, but I've still had better tacos in the Mission.    You should know by now to get them Nick's Way, with guacamole and jack cheese.  I didn't taste much jack, but the rest was good.  The tacos came with Carne Asada, (what else for me?), pintos, salsa, and the guac and cheese.

But I was crazy for the Elote.  Corn on the cob, served with cheese, and chile power.  Note that it's CHILE powder and not CHILI powder!  The cheese has a sour-like taste that went really well the the corn and chile.  Get it.

All in all, it looks like a nice place to eat in, with the booths and all.  Good food, good service.  But know it's CASH only.
author: Michael M.

description:
I think they've slipped since they first opened.  Nick isn't even there anymore, which is kinda bunk.  The tacos are good, but I'm disappointed when I go there now expecting to experience the transcendentality I once did from their food.  Last time I went there, the balance of ingredients seemed to be all off.  So much guac it overshadowed everything else, and my pescado Nick's way didn't make me want to stand on the table and do a little dance while singing its praises like it used to back in the day.

Tip:  If you find the red and green salsas on the table to be too mild for your taste, they have bottles of orange behind the counter that actually are spicy.  Just go up and ask.
author: daphne w.

description: Great crispy fish tacos nicks way. Good to have with a beer from next door. This place is a staple if you want good food and entertainment. Highly recommended.
author: Chris L.

description:
I have been hearing about Nick's forever and ever and finally got the chance to check it out tonight... I had the Baja-style fish (read: FRIED) burrito which was absolutely wonderful. I asked for "lite" on the cheese and they followed my request. It came with a tangy slaw which matched the fish perfectly. The fish was super fresh, lightly breaded, and not too heavy. The verdict? Absolutely delicious!

I know they're known for their tacos but I'm a burrito-girl, so what can you do? Maybe I'll try the tacos next time.... maybe :)
author: Jill M.

description:
Come for TACO TUESDAYS between 5-9 pm:

$2
-carne asada, pollo or carnitas taco
-cheese quesadilla
-chips with guacamole and salsa
author: Katie K.

description: Other than the fact that I left my cell phone here (and it was never found), Nick's has some damn good tacos!  It's a good thing I don't live in SF otherwise I'd be 20 lbs. heavier from eating here to often!
author: Dana D.

description:
The Story of Nick's Crispy Tacos
Along time ago, my brother in law and Nick went to New York Culinary School together . They sliced, diced, wrapped, rolled, cut, and chopped it together about their vision for the future. They dreamed of a owning a nice, lil spot serving fresh, real mexican style tacos.......
Years later, Nick ends up in San Francisco and my brother in law married my sister. But Nick's Crispy Tacos was born....
Traditional, simple, fresh tacos made by a mexican family 
Nick's spin on it...add guacamole and cheese (Ask for your tacos Nick's Way) 
Nick made his dream happen, but with the high rent prices in San Francisco has to convert to a nightclub in order to make enough money. He sacrifices atmosphere for high quality fresh food and to remain true to himself. Tacos are unbelievably on point too good to be true, completely worth your money, outstanding! Go live the dream with a taco(s). 
The End.
author: Daniella B.

description: Must try the Poscato taco. I'm not really a big fan of fish but I was curious so I tried it and never turned back.
author: Jeffrey P.

description:
one star off for big lines and not answering my calls!!! 
now to the good part....the food I LOVE! I once got poisoned by their fish burritos, but as soon as I recovered I went back and got  the same  borrito again because it was that good! 
p.s. lots of handsome men working there....mmm...delicious...
author: emma s.

description:
Food is a bit pricey in my opinion, even on Taco Tuesday (but that's only if you get it Nick's way - which you must, and if you get the fish tacos - which you must).

Decor is pretty awful.  Dim, and it's part of a club so it gets fratty/bro-y.  Think pastel polos and sky high heels with mini dresses.

Line is uber long on Tuesdays, but hey, what do you expect.

Four stars are for the food.  It. is. delicious.

Now read my review in Morgan Freeman's voice.
author: Amber M.

description: Cash-only cheap taco joint serving inexpensive pitchers of beer and margaritas.
author: Anne D.

description:
This place only gets 2 stars: 1 for their music, the other for the happy hour special.

The space is really open which you'd think would be good for most businesses but I actually believe that when architects design bars, they design the space so it's very intimate, with plenty of opportunities to very casually rub arms with your handsome neighbor. AND, even when it's not that crowded, it appears as though it is because the space is designed to crowd people into small spaces. Anyway, so my point is that the space is SO open that it looks completely vacant and frankly, lame. If I were a passerby outside, I would have walked on by. But, I've heard a lot about this place and because we were going for a work event, I figured it was a great opportunity to give it a try.

So, the food sucks. I can't testify to their "crispy tacos" because I don't eat them, but the burrito I ordered was so bland and blah. And they put way too much pico de gallo and I like pico de gallo. It was so much that the tomato juice was dripping down my burrito and just making it kind of soggy and yucky. 

Speaking of soggy, those lame asses dump salsa and guacamole over their chips so that after literally 10 minutes, all the chips with the unfortunate fate of suffocating in pico de gallo and guac are just shit outta luck. I won't eat them. Gross. I hate soggy anything.

The music was great, however. I loved most, if not all of the DJ's choice tunes. And, the happy hour is pretty damn good. The margaritas were great and only $2. That's a fantastic deal.

If you're looking for a cheap, quick buzz without a crowd and shitty food, this is your place.
author: Kristin R.

description:
I went here with my current crush after she took me to my first Yelp party. We'd stopped by here the night before only to be met with CLOSED sign. Be warned: they close at 9PM on weekdays.

The only thing I've tried here is the shrimp taco. I was surprised that it wasn't crispy. But it was really, really yummy. What made it really special wasn't the shrimp or the salsa...It was that they included a lime wedge...wrapped in the foil with the taco. Lime makes everything taste great, especially shrimp.

Now that I'm visiting her neighborhood more often, I am hoping that we can make our way to this lounge red velvet and delicious food. While one taco was enough, I'm sure there's much more I'd like to feast on.

When will we go again? I'm sure it's not going to be soon enough. I think Nick's Crispy Tacos has already started to invade my dreams, if not my waking thoughts.
author: Dave B.

description:
Probably the best fish tacos I've ever had.

Everyone will say to order the tacos "Nick's Way."  It gets you a ton of guac and both a crunchy and a soft shell.  It's good, but unfortunately it's not very cheap ($5/taco) unless you go on Taco Tuesday.

Atmosphere is a bit weird when the restaurant is empty, since it uses Rouge Nightclub's tables.  Food is ordered at the counter and tables are open seating, first come first serve.
author: S L.

description:
415.409.TACO (Nick's number)

This is taco heaven.  

Grilled fish taco had a large slab of fresh (seasonal) fish, finely shredded crunchy cabbage, large dollop of delish guacamole, warm corn tortillas (I actually don't like crispy tacos.  They fall apart and are a big mess.), salsa (could use a bit more salsa) and cilantro.  I could see myself eating this at a taco stand in heaven and I would also be sitting under chandeliers in a red velvet booth.
author: Lolia S.

description:
I'm totally going to back into this review.

Don't go here at night, especially Wednesdays through Saturdays, unless you really like long lines and smelly, overdressed, obnoxious people, the ones you'll have to endure as you wait forever to order, then a little longer to get your food.

Also, when you order chips and salsa, don't expect ... well, chips and salsa. Instead, you'll get a basket of otherwise delicious chips simply topped with about 2,000 pounds of mediocre pico de gallo.

Whew!

Now that that's out of the way, you can take your finger off the "kill this guy" button.

Everything else about my experience at Nick's was kickass. First, the fact that they grill the tortillas, as opposed to steaming them, makes for an automatic win in my book. This is how the place achieves its "crispy" distinction.

Service during the day, despite a moderate line, was speedy and very friendly, and the food was really, really good. Tara got a carne asada breakfast burrito, served to us at around 3 p.m., and it was one of those rare times when it all comes together -- an item with a large number of ingredients, and somehow, nothing overwhelms anything else.

$3 margaritas (which aren't that good, except for the fact that they're $3) only sweeten the deal.

And then, there's the salsa. The red is above-average, only slightly spicy, and not too-roasted-tasting, but just right. The green is among the best of its verde rivals in the city. I recommend applying about a teaspoon to every bite you eat at Nick's, no matter what it is you're eating.

Decor is awesome, from high ceilings and chandeliers to red walls and red horseshoe-shaped booths.

Okay, can I come out from under the table now?
author: Jeff H.

description:
I must say that I am pretty picky when it comes to foods and by reading all the great reviews on Yelp about Nick's, I had to go try it for myself.  
We went there last night for dinner and ordered a Carne Asada Taco & Nachos, with a Watermelom drink.  
The Taco was very tasty and the meat was tender and juicy, I liked the way they wrapped it so it doesn't get as messy as it usually would.  
The Nachos were plentiful and they didn't go chinzy on all the toppings.  Even after all the chips were gone, the bottom of the plate still had plenty of the fixin's to finish with a fork. Yum!  The watermelon drink was like any other I've tried, kinda ordinary.  
Overall I had a great experience and was actually quite full so we walked around the area and there were lots of people in the Cafe's, Bar's and Restaurants.  I would definitely go back back again. Thanks yall.
author: gordon g.

description:
If you want to hang out with meathead fratboys nursing a hangover from their wild night on Union Street, then this is a great place. 

I am perplexed by people who think this place is anything but average.  I guess for people who just moved to the Marina after graduating from the University of Kansas, this place is great.  Otherwise, try going to the Mission to La Palma or La Tacqueria for better (and cheaper) food.

Hate to be snarky, but was incredibly disappointed in this place after hearing glowing reviews for the last few years.
author: Zk K.

description:
A fish taco done Nick's Way is 10x better than anything you'll find at Slanted Door or Zuni; not to mention about 10x cheaper.   

And if I could rate the decor at Nick's I would give it 6 stars.
author: J P.

description: Let's dissect their tacos.  The fish is pretty good, but the taste of the fish is hidden by the uncooked tortillas.  Not bad, but definitely not standout.  The space is really weird.  Not your typical decor for a Mexican Restaurant, but I don't really think this is a Mexican Restaurant, it's more like just a taco place.  If you're in the area, I would give it a shot.  I don't think i'll be going again.  Plus, I was overcharged.
author: Justin F.

description:
So really why do people like this place?  
It's pretty mediocre.
So what you can get crispy tacos -- they aren't that good.  
Taco Beezies taco supremes are better.  
I guess if you've never had LA Mexican food or Mexican from San Diego, than Nick's might seem good.
Other than that, I'm not impressed. 
I'd rather hit the border than throw away money buying some of these weak tacos.
author: Kat R.

description:
I swear I've eaten here every Tuesday for the last 3 weeks straight -- it's that good.  The tacos, when ordered "Nick's Way," are served with all the standard stuff, plus cheese, guac, beans, and a crispy taco shell.  A single taco ($3.95 Nick's Way) is a a pretty healthy size; two of them are definitely a meal.  The chips and guac for $2 is also a good deal.

There are four meat choices available on $2 Tuesdays -- Carne Asada, Pollo (stewed), Pollo Asado, and Carnitas.  You can find better carnitas and pollo elsewhere, but the pollo asado and carne asada isn't bad.  Beans are just right and the crispy shell adds just the right amount of texture to an otherwise soft and chewy taco.

Cons:
- It's a zoo on Tuesdays -- standing room only.
- Cash only
- No takeout for $2 taco specials (except after 8:30).
- The red velvet walls make me feel like I'm in a horror movie.
author: Andrew C.

description:
Chips and Salsa done right for $1.00.  Its a perfect marriage of hot, salty, thicker than usual chips and sweet, slightly spicy pico de gallo that really tastes like tomatoes from the garden.  They pile the salsa on a pile of warm chips that just get moist when you hit the bottom of the basket.  

You may spot me, I'll be the one licking the salsa juices from the bottom of the bowl.
author: Tracie P.

description:
Worth the hype? I'm not sure. Worth being on the 7x7 100 things to eat before you die list? I guess...it was definitely okay.

Finally tried it and was pretty stoked we could walk here in 15 minutes from Pac Heights so taco tuesday's should be better from now on. 

Tried the pescado, grilled fish, and camarones. I'd opt for the grilled fish, as I wasn't so stoked about the pescado (not enough added flavor or crunch to make up for the grease). The camarones were way over-grilled so they were chewy. But the grilled fish was definitely worth coming back for when a taco craving hits.

I wish they fried the inner tortilla a bit better and at a more appropriate temperature in order to use frying as a cooking method to crisp, not simply a dunk in a grease bath. Next time I'd ask for one tortilla instead of two.

It's certainly good enough to try once.
author: Abby Z.

description:
$2 Taco Tuesday's, I LOVE YOU!!

I usually get the carnitas tacos, nicks way but my friend convinced me to try their fish tacos because it's "sooo good".  Well guess what my friend, I am convinced that is it the bomb! The fish is fried and with every bite i take, the fish is so juicy and silky. The guac and the salsa makes it extra special.  I am a true believer now and will definitely get the fish tacos every time. The carnitas are also very delicious and juicy, too. 
We also ordered a pitcher of margarita but the first round, it was salty- and it's not because of the salted rim on the glass. There were too much ice too so you better request to have less ice to get more alcohol in your system! The second round, it was sweeter even though we asked our server to make it a tad stronger with less mixer. But overall, it was a great experience having our meal at a booth bc it was hard to find a table at 6:30pm. You have to call and reserve the booth ahead of time and you will be able to have the booth for 2hrs.
author: Irene L.

description:
UPDATE!!! - great breakfast burritos!!  I had the egg, bacon, potato and jack cheese one and it was just what I needed that morning.  Only downside is that they open at 11:30.....by then I'm kinda in lunch mode.  It really hit the spot though after my 11am workout.  

The best tacos in Russian Hill.  I will say though, aside from the tacos and soup AND the salad, I'm not that impressed with their burritos or quesadillas.  BUT you have to have their chips with salsa, tacos nick's way or their soup.  After a night of drinking, it's all i can think about.  Pretty cheap too if you get their tacos and super filling.
author: Kirsten M.

description:
Nutshell: Inexpensive food, but medicore service

While the food is inexpensive, the atmosphere seemed different, and the vegetarian burrito I ordered was okay.

However, that didn't make up for other aspects.

The mojito that I ordered was tolerable, but I doubt I'd order it again.

We had a large group, and the staff wouldn't let us sit together in the empty closed off area with plenty of seats, even though we asked nicely.  Instead, they instructed us to find our own seats, and we ended up splitting up into 2 different groups.

Also, they messed up the order of someone in our group, and it took two rounds to resolve the issue.

Granted, Nick's isn't a place where one would go for service, the staff at Nick's could have put in more effort.  That being said, it isn't the worse that I've observed service-wise though.

Since I've only been to Nick's once, I'll give it the benefit of doubt and give it 2 stars for now.

Perhaps it's better suited for take outs, than a sit down place?
author: Lloyd C.

description:
OK, so I'm not hopping on the Nickwagon about how rad this place is.  Fair enough, I DID go on Valentine's Day with a friend who was single for the night, like me. (Oh, you just wait til tomorrow!!)  But part of this rationale was, who the hell would take their woman here on the day of LOVE?!?!?  Girls, let me tell you who:

   I did not expect the crowd of highly perfumed and quasi-smelly Marina folk who seemed to be making up for all the expensive dinners they eat every other night of the year by dining on the cheap today.  I had to wade through a Lambertson Truex vortex before I got to the front of the line.  Perhaps they were just waiting for the taco curtains to close, and the hipster, coke-blowing, Gucci ones to open in their place.  I don't know, but I'll take Nick on Broadway any night of the week except Saturday! 

   It was sad to watch the military approach to the breaking-down of tables that happened as we ate.  Our trays and napkins were whisked away pre-finish to make room for the "exclusive" club that happens here at night, Rouge.  

   In addition to the fact that my taco was far from "crispy", which I believe I paid extra for, I think that might be salsa on my boots.

   Cleanup on aisle 5.
author: Lea N.

description:
YUMMO! Came here for dinner around 630ish on a Friday. Surprisingly not that busy for the moment but it did as we sat around and figured out what to order. 

I got the carnitas taco "nick's way" and the carne asada tacos regular. DELISH! and very filling for what doesn't look like to be big tacos at all. Nick's way was delcious...i took off some of the guacamole because they do put alot of it on there but yummy nonetheless. Drinks were good too. $3 margaritas how can you go wrong?!  Their happy hour prices are pretty good even on well drinks and beers (2 for $5 Dos Eques..or however you spell it). Definitely will be coming back!!!
author: Jazmine S.

description:
Disclaimer:  I lived in San Diego for 4 years.  I am a taco snob.

I ordered a chicken taco & a carne asada taco, both "Nick's Way," which means, of course, that they come adorned with jack cheese, guacamole, and two corn tortillas--one of which has been gently fried in oil to make it a crispy, oily little treat.  My companion got two carnitas tacos, also a la Nick.  

Now, overall, these were extremely well-made tacos.  For one, anywhere that gives me generous globs of guacamole (even though you had to pay extra for it, as is standard) is going to make me a happy eater.  Plus, they were pretty--a bright slash of green right down the middle, and a neat paper wrapper around each of them, to make the hand-to-mouth transfer that much smoother.  

As with any taco, however, the devil is in the details.  Can you taste the lime juice-cilantro-salt orgy when you bite into your carne asada?  Does the rich, assaultive taste of lard come through when you hit a bite full of pinto beans?  Is the pico de gallo fresh and summery, or has an unripe, mealy tomato entered the scene?

My Nick's Crispy Tacos passed each of these tests--except, surprisingly, the carne asada test.  The meat was clearly of high quality, and certainly wasn't overcooked--but I had to keep resorting to the (lovely) salsa verde to give the thing a little kick.  And, being somewhat of a purist, I question the use of pinto beans in my taco--I mean, really.  Beans are burrito fare.  We all know this.  

Some things, however, are easily forgiven*--and in this case, the overall end product was so fabulously fresh and well-presented that I know I'll be back.  

(*Unfortunately, the mirrored walls and red velvet booths aren't one of them.)
author: Ann M.

description:
wow, ok, I have to sort out where to begin on this 1-star review. deep breath... here it is..

- Venue is CORNY AS HELL. Red walls, dust-laden chandeliers, and FILTHY mirror-lined walls from which you can see where the condensation of sweat has dripped from many a steamy night from ROUGE party goers (ROUGE? Now that is a whole 'nother review unto itself)

-Taco Tuesday special was not so special. Granted the tacos were big, I still didn't appreciate the aggressive up-sell for "Nick's Way" of which I was asked about 4 times total before my transaction was complete. I can't justify paying an extra $1 for guac and adding a hard taco shell to a taco. Those are basic standard taco entities am I wrong?

- $3 beers, $3 margaritas. not bad, not great. definitely not Taco Tuesday worthy. 

-Because it gets crowded, late-comers tend to hover around your table, casting intentional glares to make you feel uncomfortable and rushed to get out of there. Even the staff who came around to collect our empty baskets kept asking "Oh, are you done yet?" When clearly, my friend and I had a full beer each in front of us trying to enjoy each others company. 

-And here's the kicker: When it came time for my friend and I to leave, we needed some foil wrap to take our extra taco home because we had over-ordered. I asked the girl who came around if I could have a to-go bag, she mumbled something about going to the front register as she pointed and walked away, eying our beers to see if we were finally done yet. I go to the front to ask for foil and the guy has the audacity to charge $1 for a piece of foil and a paper bag! To my disgust, I crease my brow, cock my head and insist "Well, that's pretty cheesy. It's just foil?" He then tries to explain that because it's "so cheap" on Tues everyone over-orders and needs foil...blah blah...they "barely break even"...blah blah. By this time, I'm just over the whole thing, go get a $1 and get my damn foil and get the hell outta there. 

IF you've ever experienced a Taco Tuesday the way it should be done, i.e. $1 Tacos, $1 drinks, a FUN, non-boring, hum drum crowd, and way better service, you will notice that this is a shame to the name of Taco Tuesdays everywhere.

This is quite the rant, I understand. And thanks for bearing with. Consider this; I live 2 blocks from Underdog's on Irving where I frequent Nick's Taco Tuesday specials as well as filling a Mexicana food craving any other day of the week. I LOVE that joint. Staff, service, food, great deals, primo location. My experience at the original Nick's. it was horrendous.This review has no reflection whatsoever on Nick's @ Underdog's which I absolutely adore. Loyal I shall remain, however, Nick's Crispy Tacos of Russian Hill? NEVER AGAIN.
author: Janet C.

description: I don't really get the craze. No real complaints, except when I wait on the 15 minute take-out line and they give me somebody else's order. Who actually orders a breakfast burrito at 5pm on a Sunday anyway? Back to the food - it's good, but nothing spectacular. Pretty standard quick serve Mexican if you ask me. I've tried the tacos, quesadillas, and burittos but was never really blown away.
author: Steve V.

description:
Taco Tuesday is the best thing ever if your favorite thing is amazingly delicious tacos and beer for a good price, while packed shoulder to shoulder with a crowd of similar enthusiasts.  They play decent music and the Taco Happy Hour ends at 9:30. The drink happy hour lasts longer.

When you order a taco, you have to get it Nick's way (unless, for some reason, you don't like guac).  Nick's way gets you two tortillas - one soft and one hard - and a huge dollop of guacamole.  

The decor is incredible tacky.  There are more chandeliers in there than would ever be necessary.  But I guess this is part of the charm.

I heard they do stand-up comedy on Mondays, although I have yet to go.
author: Kelley W.

description: I totally love this place!  They have awesome tacos - the chicken is white and moist, and the fish is light and tasty.  It's unique, in that it's a low cost taqueria, but you can also get a drink there to go with your tacos!  (not just beer, but a full bar)  The interior is very unique - I think it used to be a bar that they've converted to be both a taqueria and a bar.  There are TV's above the bar area.  It's a huge space, with lots of seating.  There are great large booths.  The entire place has a very quirky and retro feel.  My only negative - the word is obviously out on this place, because almost every time I've gone there there's a long line.
author: Sam O.

description:
How odd it is to be eating tacos during the day in a nightclub? Once you get over that you start realizing that the tacos, done Nick's way, are insanely good. Now it's not your ole run of the mill taco. The crispy shell is not your usual crunchy cornmeal shell. When you get it Nick's way you get a taco in a crispy, fluffy shell topped with gauc and jack cheese. It's that shell that does it all, but yet really hard to explain. Trust me, this taco is a rare find around here. Just go try it and tell me I'm wrong. I dare you to tell me I'm wrong. I just wish they would move out of Rouge!

MUST HAVE: Pescado taco done Nick's way. Fried fish in a fried shell topped with cheese and guac, what a combo! Add a side of chips with their fresh salsa, and an agua fresca. Or a cerveza!
author: Al L.

description:
You MUST go on a Tuesday!!!
Can't beat $2 tacos (soft shell, crispy shell, meat, beans) or for 95 cents more -- Nick's Way which is just loaded w/ salsa and deeeeelicious guac. It's a must. YUM.

I have tried the chicken taco which wasn't as good as their steak taco. I think that's the best. Gotta also order it with a side of their $2 chips which is loaded w/ salsa and guac again. Yum. I most definitely have to go back to try their nachos, and since today is Tuesday, I shall go tonight. 

Minus 1 star for CASH ONLY and the weird funkish smell of the place. Must be a collection of dust, partying, alcohol, and a hint of sweat. It's weird...
author: Heidi C.

description:
Tacos Nick's Way is so good and messy.  I love the deep fried shell and oozing guacamole.  

The chips with salsa and guacamole is generous and delicious.
author: HY L.

description:
The inside is like your insane, rich, gothic, grandma's parlor. Or at least if you had one, it would be like this!

The other day I was heading up to the Golden Gate recreation area for some night photography. I was on the Polk bus and I recalled a conversation I had with my friend a few weeks ago (note - adam used to live here, but he moved out to boston to become a marketing professor :().

Me: I had a good meal out in the marina last night 
Adam: There is only one good thing about the marina
Me: Eh? No really I had a good meal there!
Adam: The only good thing is Nick's Crispy Tacos.
Me: What's that?
Adam: Well, it's not really in the marina. But it's close enough. It's uhm... let me google this.
Me:...
Adam: Polk and broadway. Surprisingly good mexican food for outside the mission.
Me: Ok, if I'm ever in the area, I'll check it out.
Adam: Yeah, don't go out of your way to go here, but.

So, I was on the bus, and I remembered this, and I popped off at broadway and headed in to Nick's. I already described the inside. It being 6PM on a wednesday, there was plenty of seating. I placed my order, and sat down with my book to wait for my food. Before I had read  5 pages my dinner arrived.

Nick's style is crispy and gooey and good. If you don't like those attributes in your taco, don't get Nick's style.
author: neil c.

description:
Margaritas are weak... but the food makes up for it.  The freshest salsa in town, well it's more like tomatoes, onions, and cilantro.  It's not like your regular mexican salsa.  
 I hate the ambiance, it doesn't make any sense.  Taco's and tacky burlesque.  
But I love the chicken burrito's.
author: amanda v.

description:
Good tacos, but what's up with the restrictive closing time??  We got there at 8:30 on a Saturday, informed that only take-out orders were being taken, and were kicked out soon before 9.  This conflicts directly with the First Law of Taqueria Dynamics: The amount of potential taco business on a two-dimensional city map at time k (which we will call N(i,c,k)) is directly proportional to the amount of alcohol consumed in an evening (which we will call B) multiplied by the number of minutes after 8PM (which we will call L), multiplied by the Riemann Mexican food constant O and the number of bars in the surrounding area W.  In other words:

N(i,c,k) = BLOW
author: Mike O.

description:
NCT Observations:
1) The name is Nick's CRISPY Tacos - why does he charge you 75 cents more for a taco that is advertised in the name of the restaurant?
2) Two corn tortillas on a taco are one corn tortilla too many.  
3) The "crispy" taco was not really crispy - it seemed to have been merely passed through hot grease for about 10 seconds less than it should have been.
4) The meat was good (carne asada) and the tacos were wrapped well so as not to drip too much.

I was disappointed in this place.  It was definitely adequate food, but if I'm paying $3.50 for a freaking taco it had better be delicious.   Someone in this town needs to open a real taco joint with real crispy tacos.
author: Suze C.

description:
Growing up in Southern California spoiled me, I thought an abundance of good Mexican food was available to everyone when ever they wanted. Moving to San Francisco has taught me that this is not the case. 

I have been on a quest for quality taco's and nachos ever since my little white pick up truck crossed the Bay Bridge with all of my stuff in it over 2 years ago. I call it a quest because it is never ending and very serious. Much like saving the world from ending in the Lord Of the Rings Series (that my friends got me addicted too) I would travel far and wide to seek out a quality taco. 

Okay, maybe a smidgen over dramatic, but as a Mexican food snob I can vouch that this place has excellent fish taco's and the cheese that they put on the nachos is actually made from bits of Heaven. Yes, yes, it isn't your local taqueria where you can order a chile relleno and a tamale, BUT they come close to perfection in what they do offer: Quality Cal-Mex!

Taco Tuesday's rock my socks off (well, if I wore socks), anyone who doesn't like a taco for 2 bucks I wouldn't be friends with and wouldn't like this place, so I suppose my review wouldn't really matter to them.

Ambiance is funky and fun, little metal tables and chairs that they can take up and down for when the night club opens, booths if you have a large party, silverware in a tray if you need it, and awesome bartenders that whip up a tasty margarita! Ole Nick's! Think I will go there tonight.
author: Jessica R.

description:
Tasty tacos!  However, not into the gourmet style interpretation.  I like the straight-up Tijuana style.  These guys have another location in the Sunset.. 19th n Irving where I live.  Kool place for checking out games.  I do however would reccomend this place to certain people and friends fo mine...  But to a straight-up Mexican or any of my Mexican friends... NO WAY!  Would I go back??  Only If I happen to be around it after bar hoping and my Marina/Russian Hill freinds drag me in there.  I also want to add that this place is pricey.  

Check out a real taco master at work below:D

http://www.youtube.com/watch?v=VVS5eaMwak8
author: Demanding T.

description:
This place has been reviewed to death so I'll just throw my $.02 on the pile.  I think the food is excellent, the tacos and burritos are fresh and tasty but they, as many people will point out, do not compare well to the very best of the Mission.  However, Nick's more than makes up for this in convenience.

It's also co-located with Rouge bar / nightclub, and that's where you have to watch out.  Rouge is, I think, one of the Harry Denton's clubs, and lives up to the superficial flossy glitz and glamor that his name implies.  However, it does make for great people watching on the corner late at night as ladies in cocktail dresses twitter among the Polk street torn jeans crowd.

If you go here for Taco Tuesday (no special deals, just a popular night... if you want discount yet tasty tacos on Tuesday go to Blue Light on Union), the place is PACKED.  It also becomes all about scene and not really about the food (which will take forever to get and you'll never find a place to sit).  It also looks, worryingly, more and more like the popped-collar crowd is invading. 

Bartenders have generally been friendly and as prompt as the crowds allow.  However, on this last trip I was served 3 chipped/cracked pint glasses in a row.  You'd think after, you know, 2 in a row you might want to check?!?  I think I went down a notch in the bartenders eyes for bringing this up but whatever.  

Pros: good vibe, great food, friendly service
Cons: food is cash only, it goes insane on Tuesdays (this could be a good thing if you're a scene-watcher).
author: David K.

description:
Sometimes Yelpers become Yappers which seems to be the case with some of the reviews of Nick's Crispy Tacos.  People, you have to understand the certain weird, wacky, and often rude charm of a place like Nick's.  This is not Gary Danko, by a long shot.  This isn't even your friendly neighborhood Peet's.  Oh no, this is a cheesy night club by night and a damn good taqueria whenever the owner damn well pleases, thank you very much.  

Yes, oftentimes the service sucks and is non-existent.  (That said, I have often had a busboy come and remove dirty dishes and clean the table so at least they do that even if it is in an effort to turn tables.)  Yes, they only take cash--get over it, that is what ATMs are for.  Fine, their prices are higher than Taco Bell, but the quality is a whole 'nother world--I would never put Toxic Hell in my body, would you?  

For the non-believers and the Yappers, the trick with NCT is to order the right thing.  And there is only one right thing on the food menu.  Pescado tacos, Nick's way.  If you order that, you will not go wrong.  I don't care what anyone says to the contrary.  These things are laced with crack and mighty fine.  Let me explain: piping hot, crispy fried fish laid on a perfect bed of cabbage slaw with Nick's special sauce atop two tortillas the inner one is crispy, the outer soft to catch all the drippings, topped with cheese, and avocado which can be a good or less good interpretation of guacamole.  My only real complaint about these is that they are not spicy enough.  There is hot sauce available on the tables, but I could still use more kick.  I would love the option to add some jalapeno dice to the top but what can you do?  

My mouth is watering right now.  Good thing I am getting some NCT tonight!
author: Emily H.

description:
I never thought I would step into this space again, but how easily one is fooled when a hungry stomach beckons...and how different places can look during the day time! If i hadn't been so famished, perhaps my mind would have been more alert to the fact that Nick's is in fact Rouge. Yes, the same Rouge that is known for bad crowds, bad music, and a bad time.

Some things you may notice prior to tasting the food:

-This place smells funky. Too funky to ignore. It's not the smell of food, much less good food. Could be the scent of a poorly ventilated night at Rouge? Oh gosh, I don't want to know.

-The decor paired with the dimly lit dining space kind of grosses me out. It served as a constant reminder that I was eating at a nightclub and a dirty one at that. Had to keep reminding myself to focus: Just Eat. Don't Think.

-The menu ain't cheap. Don't come here expecting the Mission's pricing. Prepare to bring a good wad of cash too. Plastic is not a word spoken here.

But all of this won't matter, not after you dig in to one of those tacos. I have to admit that I didn't have my taco crispy, but even so, it was still delicious. I had two (grilled fish and chicken) and was pretty stuffed. The rest of my party had just about every taco on the menu (and in every variety that they came in), and they gave big thumbs up to everything that they ordered. That leads me to conclude: crispy or not, nick's way or not, the tacos are top notch. 

So, Nick, you are my new amigo. You alone will keep me coming back no matter how far away I want to be from Rouge.
author: Rona J.

description:
I'm a 13th generation Californian; my family lived in California when it was still Mexico so I feel I have "some idea" what a good taco should be.

This was not just a **bad taco** but, some of the most **flavorless** food I've ever had.

At first I thought I ordered the "wrong thing," until I remembered that I ordered one of each of the tacos on the menu and that after rapidly attempting to find any remnants of flavor within any of them, I was at a net loss.

I shouldn't be too surprised at how hyped these tacos were considering that their target audience is probably a drunk fraternity kid or his cheap date stumbling up from the Marina district but, -holy shit have these guys even **had** Mexican food before?

Drive, bus, taxi, or run to the Mission district and walk into **ANY** of the taquerias you see on **ANY** corner and save yourself from the atrocity that is Nick's Crispy Tacos.




P.S. I'm livid that 1/5 stars is the worst star rating I could vote. Consider this a 0/5 star rating.
author: Curtis S.

description:
These are the worst tacos I've ever had. This is California, it used to be a part of Mexico. You can pretty much get good Mexican food anywhere. You'd think the place with killer reviews would have great tacos. I think not.

I tried almost every taco on the menu and only the fried fish taco was any good. The other tacos were flavorless and dry. The shrimp in the shrimp taco was overcooked and I took one bite of the chicken, steak and carnitas tacos and couldn't bare to eat anymore.

This was a highly disappointing meal.
author: Mira S.

description:
We had to check this place out after we saw it on Check Please Bay Area. On Saturday evening, we just beat the dinner crowd. Very casual, family friendly environment, and easy on your wallet. We ordered the quesadilla with carnitas and steak and chicken crispy tacos. Unlike other Mexican restaurants that drown your food in the rice and beans, they don't do that here. The food was fresh and service was on point! I'll pass on the margaritas which was too sour for my taste.

Parking is b*tch though! We circled the block several times and finally caved and parked at a lot. Lots of swanky shops and bars in the area.

I'll definitely come back for $2 Taco Tuesdays!
author: Nikki N.

description:
Love the chips and salsa!  They are so good!
Get a chicken taco, Nick's way.  
Cheap and tasty.
I moved hoods, so I have not been able to get there recently - so sad.
author: Catherine B.

description:
Killer!
Get them 'Nicks Way" and make sure you order three because you will want to stuff yourself!
author: Johnny F.

description:
Edited 2/5/08-
So a few weeks after this review I get the following e-mail from the manager of Nick's:

"Next time you decide to write a review you might want to try a more truthful approach. You flat out lied about my response and furthermore, you never even gave me a chance to fix the situation. So I can't say I really give a damn that you wont be back.

FYI we just won 7X7's readers choice award for best meal in S.F. under $15 ..."

A)  Thanks for calling me a liar.  Why would I lie?  There's no reason.  We told you because we thought you should know that we've noticed a decline in quality and service.  We weren't asking for a freebie or anything.  We just wanted to let you know that we noticed.  I know if I were running a business I would want to know if my long time customers weren't happy so I could work to rectify the situation to keep them coming back.  But apparently you don't give a damn.

B)  Nick's Crispy Tacos should really think about starting a PR firm.  This was handled so well.  I can totally picture how you would have handled something like the Exxon Valdez incident.  "You flat out lied that this ship dumped all this oil in to the ocean.  I can't say I really give a damn about this environmental catastrophe that is going to stain the earth for many many years to come.  By the way, what are you going to do with all these dead fish?  I've got this little taco stand in SF that might be interested in taking them off your hands..."

C)  Congratulations on your 7X7 award.  Apparently you're very proud of it since you took the time to inform me about it in your lovely message.  Keep cutting corners and treating your customers like crap and your little award will be short lived.  

1 star- wish I could give negative ones.
(end edit)

We've  been going there since it opened and I have to say it's not even as good now as it used to be.  Not sure what happened but we used to love this place.  We stopped going for a while because I got sick from a fish taco.  Decided to give it another try and my wife found egg shell in her breakfast burrito and the potatoes tasted like they were two days old.  When we brought it to the attention of the server, he was indifferent and actually asked if we wanted to wrap it up to take home.  "Yes sir!  I would love to take your crappy burrito home to eat later."  We weren't looking for a freebie or anything but having been in the food service industry, I know that the right thing to do is to offer to either replace or comp the item.  We told Pete, the manager, and he said "No body else seems to be complaining."  Nice response Pete.

The lady from table next to us ordered a soft drink with no ice.  They served her drink a little less than 3/4 full.  When she asked to have it filled up, they said they would not do it because that's how much drink would be in it if she had ice.  What's the difference to them between a full drink and a 3/4 drink?  Something like five cents????  Most places have bottomless drinks these days and they are worrying about the difference between a cup with ice and one with no ice?  Lame.

Definitely not going back which is too bad because we live so close and I loves me a good taco.  They used to have them, but not anymore and their customer service stinks.  Seems like they are more concerned with cutting corners these days than keeping the customer happy.  Used to be 5 stars, now I'm having hesitations about even giving them 2.
author: Marc H.

description:
Since I'm not a taco fan I ordered a Chicken Quesedilla, which was good but could have used more cheese.

My boyfriend ordered a taco "Nick's Way" and was disappointed that it wasn't as crispy as he had thought it would be. Seemed like he got 2 soft tacos instead of 2 crispy ones.

Other than that, the atmosphere of the place was quite hilarious--it looks like they just bought an old bar/lounge and kept the decorations the same. There's a disco ball, red walls, and columns with little mirrors glued on them. Totally wasn't expecting that from a cheap taco place, which makes it kinda unique and campy.
author: Erica S.

description:
Some of the best fish tacos I have had.  Would definitely rec. it if you are in the area.

Downsides:  cash only, long line, and no place to sit (too crowded).
author: A S.

description:
I can't believe these tacos weren't overhyped, given how much my boyfriend obsesses about them, but they really are as good as everyone says.  I had one fish, one shrimp, both "Nick's way."  I actually preferred the shrimp, but I'm kind of addicted to shrimp, so you can probably disregard that.  Anyway, they were both AMAZING.  Oh and you HAVE to get the elote.  I'm pretty sure they inject it with extra butter.  So, so, good.

If the ambience/decor were even vaguely acceptable, I would give Nick's 5 stars.  But they're not -- they're actively terrible.  The taco place is attached to/part of a very seedy, gross sports bar with dirty velvet furnishings and a loud, creepy clientele.  I do NOT understand why they don't keep the two establishments separate.  I do not need to be creepily stared at by gross, drunken football fans while I'm just trying to eat my damn taco.  Next time I'm definitely taking out.
author: Sarah B.

description:
Eeeew. 
First off because its at the Rouge. Second, because my Baja Fish burrito was flavorless and greasy. It was like 2 overcooked pieces of VanDeKamps. The white baja sauce was nothing special, and everything fell out of the bottom of my burrito.
What a mess.
I'll stick with Amante's fish tacos.
author: Karlee D.

description:
UPDATE 12/13/07 - i wanted to add a little something about nick's weekly deals... i know they have taco tuesdays, and i went for wednesday when they have deals on enchiladas and my choice, the burrito mojado (which means wet burrito, kind of sounds dirty but is really tasty!).  the bar also has $2 margaritas which were delicious.  i have to up my rating to 4 stars based on this experience - fun, cheap, and great food and drinks!! 

original review:
finally went to nick's for the first time! i only had 1 taco, and my friend had a salad.  it was very affordable, and i would like to go back and try more stuff.  being a total mexican food addict, i was all about their guacamole and the chicken on my taco was delicious.  definitely a no-frills atmosphere, but whatever.  i was there for the food!
author: Carolyn B.

description:
I tried to eat at Nick's crispy tacos FOUR times and was turned away each time at how DISGUSTINGLY hard parking around this area is.  Seriously, NO spaces whatsoever.  And one of those times was in the pouring rain on a Sunday night.  Makes no sense. 

But tonight.....the bf and I were determined....and we drove like savages on the streets of Russian Hill looking for a parking spot and we found one in less than 10 minutes.  Miracle. 

So we walk into Nick's....and instant nostalgia....its like whooooa...I know this place....I've danced on that bar before.... I've danced in this itty bitty little dance floor before...I've.... yeah okay.  More than my fair share of drunken nights at Rouge.  But as a restaurant, this place STANK.  Like literally had a foul smell upon entering the door.... probably bc it's a club and they clean floors with dirty mops and people spill drinks everywhere....but hey, whatever.  We order the tacos (carne asada, Nick's way) and they came relatively quickly.  They were huge...piled high with guac and stuffed with tasty carne asada.  And for the price ($2.95 I think), they weren't bad at all. 

Beer and well drinks for $2 was a plus, although I didn't have any.  Seating is a little weird...limited tables, booths, and bar.  The whole idea of having a taco place inside of Rouge is just weird.... but I guess...whatever works. 


But um....our meal ended up to be $29.....HOW the hell did we end up spending almost $30 on tacos?!...... dur. 

So yeah, after so many attempts, it somewhat lived up to the hype...it was tasty. I'd come back, sure, if someone else drove, and they got that nasty stench out.  For now, taco trucks in Oakland near my apt will hafta do.
author: Peggy W.

description: This place is ah-may-zing!  So good... I don't just crave tacos... I get cravings for Nick's Crispy Tacos.  They are *that* good.  You MUST get the chips and guacamole and whatever you do, be sure to get your tacos "Nick's way."
author: Chloe M.

description:
One, the tacos are amazing --  and giant and filling. Nick's Way all the way.
Two, Tuesdays nights are a serious meat market, take it or leave it. I never thought I'd see so many sultry stares over shoving your face with guac, but it happens here.
Three, I have no idea what time you ACTUALLY have to get here to get a booth on a Tuesday. I imagine it's sometime Sunday.
author: Abby P.

description: Great place for quick Tacos on Polk Street, especially late at night when you've had a few drinks ;-)
author: Patton C.

description:
Nick must be a fabulous gay man drunk on tequilla.  The pinnaple and finding nemo pinatas hanging from the chandeliers are an authentic mexican touch.  

but lets talk about la comida.  I'm into this corn on the cob they have and they sprinkle cheese and some goodness on top.  The tortilla soup is ok, but i'm diggin on the tacos like the rest of the crazy kids.
author: Chrammy D.

description:
I lived in San Diego for 6 years and can appreciate a good taco. Whenever my friends or family come into the city to visit, I like to bring them here for cheap, yet tasty, eats. There is something off-putting about eating Mexican food in a tacky club in broad daylight, but it adds to the Nick's experience. 

If you haven't ordered your tacos Nick's Way, then you haven't lived.

The burritos are so-so, but come to think of it...why was I hanging out with someone that would order a burrito there anyway?
author: lindsay w.

description: One of the best fish taco's I've ever eaten.  Make sure you ask for it Nick's way.
author: Brent S.

description:
Cheap delicious eats!! 
Not over run by Marina Douche Bags or Douchesters (Douche Hipsters)!!
Funky awesome vibe and the staff is pretty cool too.

Try the fish tacos Nick's way and wash it down with a beer, you won't be disappointed!!
author: Nathan J.

description:
I came up from Los Angeles for the week for a big job interview.  I was on the hunt ( in a vehicle) for something tasty and quick for lunch. As I drove past Chinatown and the Transamerica building I ended up on Broadway and started to get a little hungry. Right when I thought I would never move to SF because of the lack of drive thru's I came upon a vibrant looking Nicks Crispy Tacos, conveniently located next to an open parking meter space. Being quite a fan of tacos and fish tacos in general I had high hopes for something glorious from the bay. I ordered a battered fish taco resting in a burrito blanket, filled with tangy baja style sauce, lettuce, tomato, and a heaping scoop of fresh guacamole on top all nicely cradled in a crispy taco shell on the outside. It was delicious and I was definitely impressed. My taco came out to be somewhere around $6.00, quite a bit more than your usual taco at "Baja Fresh" or the like down in LA or OC, but I would say it was worth the price all the way because it was a large size portion. I will definitely come back here again, perhaps taco Tuesday. I've decided i'm not writing off moving to SF after all because the longer I stay the more I discover and the more I don't want to leave. 

Cheers!
author: Jasmine G.

description:
Meh. I've got a love/hate relationship with this place. Wasn't expecting an authentic taqueria with a Mexican joint called "Nick's" (maybe it's short for Niguel?) but at least some delicious Tex-Mex maybe. Walked past the tacky red velvet curtains to order a few different tacos, carne, carnitas, pescado which turned out to be mediocre at most. Ordered my tacos "Nicks Style", which was a hard shell inside of a soft shell (reminiscent of Taco Bells Double Decker?) with a dollop of gauc...was left with a bad greasy after-taste in my mouth which could only be washed out by half a bottle of Mexican soda....
Do come here for: 
- Good drink specials during happy hour and Taco Tuesday (although be prepared for a major line for $2 tacos)
- Nice sized TV's to watch the game at the bar (have on occasion hit the bar solo for a Stella and NCAA basketball game)
- Good young crowd
Doesn't hurt that this place is less than a block away from me and so I'll  be back soon (next time just for the margarita's, beer, and chips)
author: Mahsa K.

description:
Happy hour meets sloppy hour... Got off work late and decided to grab a bite with a couple of friends. Ended up here, hungry and wet from the rain. Couldn't find a place to sit because apparently its connected to Rouge (a Bar/Lounge). 

Ordered a couple of fish tacos (cashiers recommendation) and stood and waited for a few drunk happy people to stumble out the door. Finally got a nice dirty seat and our order arrived. Pleasantly surprised the fish tacos were quite good. Fried golden brown with good flavor. Loosely wrapped in tin foil with lettuce and sauce everywhere (no napkins) I dive in getting most of the taco on my shirt and pants. It is good I must say, but not worth the mess and the wait for the bathroom to get cleaned up. 

So, in short if your looking for a traditional Mexican restaurant or taqueria this ain't the place. However, If your looking for a cool happy hour and want a few beers and a fish taco this might fill your void.
author: Howard C.

description:
Ahh, crispy tacos, how I love thee.  There are only a handful of places that I have found that serve crispy tacos in San Francisco, and Nick's tops the list in tastiness.  Their guacamole is ever so creamy as is their yummy horchata.  Their pescado and their grilled fish tacos are mouthwatering as are their chips and salsa with guacamole.  This is the kind of place that you don't want to stop eating even after you are fuller than full.

On top of the delicious food, the service was stellar.  Add to that the fact that they were playing both sunday's football game (go niners) and grooving reggae, and I can't wait to go back to this place. YUM!
author: Julia H.

description:
I came to the famous Nick's Crispy Tacos to try a crispy taco and the baja fish tacos.  What can I say, both were just okay bordering on bad...weird sauce and mildly fishy taste (if it reeks through batter and oil..that's very bad). 

I'd consider going back for more if a taco didn't cost almost 5 bucks (each and tiny to boot) and if the staff weren't dubious and attitude ridden...nothing major just a sense of snarky punkdom.   

You know, if the tacos were $2 bucks, I'd shut up and eat. However pricey way below average tacos for nearly $5...nada.  Next time I want good Baja fish tacos I'll just wait until I go to SoCal or Baja. For everything else like carnitas...there's 500 places better in SF. 

Will not go back, ever.
author: milo a.

description:
If the place was called Nick's Greasy Cheap Tacos, then I would give them five stars.

Since it's called Nick's Crispy Tacos, they only get one star.

The carnitias and guacamole was rather good, but you can't sell tacos under the guise of being crispy and not deliver that selling point. I got my food to go. I didn't want to wait until I got home to test the crispy taco shell, so I tried one in the car. The "shell" was soggy with grease. They probably crowded the pan (or whatever they use) which then brings down the oil temperature. Any savvy cook knows that you need to keep the temperature consistently at xx degrees to keep food from absorbing the oil. Come on mi gente en la cocina...work it out.

The only thing crispy at Nick's was the money as it came out of my wallet. Not that it costs a lot to eat here, but this business is incorrectly named for sure.

If you're willing to drive out to Berkeley for some REAL crunchy tacos, then check out the reviews on my page. I would not send anyone out to the East bay for food if it was not worth the drive from the City.
author: Chris P.

description:
First of all, I can't stress enough to people who have heard of Nick's Crispy Tacos to BRING CASH.  I think my friends and I have all had the random craving for the baja fish tacos and we found ourselves standing in line counting the amount of cash we had in hand (and trying to calculate how much we could order).

As other reviewers have attested, the tacos are tasty - they're jam packed with ingredients and are basically overflowing with goodness.  Just be warned that they may not be as crispy as some of the other crispy tacos in your life.  

When it's a busy time it's kind of frustrating to find seating, but patience is both a virtue (and, well, the only way you'll find seating in a busy place).  The nachos at Nick's are also decent, but definitely the thing to try are the fish tacos.
author: Shay F.

description:
yeah...people say it was good..and i finally got to try..but first...what the heck...nick's crispy tacos is inside rouge?..what a surprise....the dining area is the rouge dance floor...o.,o...

to the food..quesadilla....do they actually use real mozzarella cheese?...or is it their toasty flour tortilla?...it was "different" from other joints..but in a good way.....moist and delicious...ah...got it!...do you steam your tortilla before you put the quesadilla on heat?...nick..is that right?.if nick is your real name.....is that why it's so moist and "different"?..

burrito...carne asada...again...it's "different"...it's very wet inside..very beany, meaty, saucy...never had a burrito like this...i still prefer socal all-meat burritos...but nick's burrito was pretty tasty....

chip and guacamole...again...it appears they use real guacamole....chips were thick and crunchy...(deep fried)....tasty...quacamole appeared fresh and real....i believe they actually use quality ingredients at this taco joint...surprise surprise...
author: Hen A.

description:
WTF? $10 for two tacos?  I was already confused by a number of things I'd seen walking into the shop:

- No cell phone zone?
- Red walls and flowey curtains?
- Disco ball and chandeliers?
- Reggae music? (a good thing actually)
- 15 dudes dressed as various characters such as Scooby doo, easter bunny, "intergalactic" Beastie Boys, cowboy, strange cone head dude...

"Huh?"

It all made sense when my two burrito-sized Nick's way tacos arrived.  

"Ohhhhh!"

Grateful tears were shed.  BMI increased.  God bless you Nick's Crispy Tacos.
author: Donny C.

description:
I originally had 4 stars for this place.  Only because I suffer after I eat here!  But that is my own fault.  I stuff my face with their crack laced (of course they are not laced with crack but it makes you crave their tacos) goodness.  I overeat and suffer the consequences.

TACO TUESDAYS!  You must come on a TUESDAY!  Starting at 5PM you can get TACOs, quesadillas, and chips and salsa for $2!  $2 makes me holler, TACO TUESDAYS!!!

I highly recommend the NICKS special carnita tacos!!  You pay a little more, I think $1?  But it is soo worth it!

The bar next door (I can never recall the name) has drink specials too!  Coronas, margaritas, well drinks for $2!!
I told you $2 make me HOLLER, TACO TUESDAYS!!!  WOOHOO!!!
author: Elisa O.

description:
I want to give this place 1.5 stars.

Those that know me, know I am not a NICK'S fan (food and person).
This place is totally overrated. 

I have been here a bunch of times bc my sister used to live across the street and she was friends with Nick (the human). The food here sucks BUT the "nick's way" tacos are decent. The Guac is watery and nothing to brag about. Maybe it's because I am a Mexican food snot - being from San Diego and all - but seriously, it is not that great. Good yeah, ok, yes but great , no way. 

At least they serve Mexi drinks and you can make fun of the shitty Rouge decorations. Extra .5 star for good use of pointless daytime space. 

FYI - 2 nicks way tacos and a diet coke is $10. CASH ONLY
author: Jessica L.

description:
The queso corn... the queso corn..... I dream of it. Sometimes I get it and I feel like my lips are burning off, but still, I cant' stop having it...

Nick's crispy fish tacos also rock the planet.

Minus one star because once I was in there and ordered and they seemed to just forget about me. So as pennance they brought me some fresh guacamole and chips. Their guacamole is AWESOME.
author: Roxmarie M.

description:
They're tacos.
They're crispy.
They have 2 different kinds of fish tacos which is something that I
and someone I know can both appreciate.
And there's beer, Mexican, but still glorious, beer.

They may or may not have something to do with a guy named Nick.


Regardless of their level Nickosity, or Nickoliciousness, they're pretty 
damn good, even though, in the end, it's just a taco. I'd come here 
again, just  not every day, or every week. I'm just not that into tacos,
even if there is beer involved.
author: Max R.

description:
Quick lowdown on Taco Tuesdays: 2$/taco (pollo, carne asada, carnitas). 1$ extra for Nick's way: crispy with jack cheese and guac.  Also 2$ for chips and salsa w/ guac and cheese quesadillas. 

Nick's way isn't that much crispier than non-crispy but the guac sure is good and they're quite generous with it. I found the carne asada tough but the pollo was super yummy and juicy. For a non-alcoholic drink alternative, skip out on the horchata (thick tasting yet diluted flavor at the same time) and go for the lime juice instead. 

If you're ever in the mood for tacos on a Tuesday, go here rather than Blue Light. The line may be long but it goes by rather fast (and the food comes to you quickly), it's not as cramped and not as loud as BL. Yes, atmosphere is funky but I guess we don't always need to eat tacos in places with pinatas and rainbow colored paper hanging from the ceiling. ;-)
author: Annie W.

description:
Recently I've only been for Taco Tuesday, but so worth it (clearly, since I keep going back). Yes the line for tacos is long, but if you're waiting with a friend then who cares. Cheap, good, and surprisingly filling tacos for $2. Chips, salsa, & guac is also $2. That mixed with some drink deals makes for a fun & cheap night.

(The fish tacos are not included in the $2 deal, so I get the chicken)
author: Caitlin B.

description:
This place sucks because
1) cheesy decor
2) sorta awkward location in the city
3) totally non-authentic food

HOWEVER.....

I stop here when I can (often when Im heading to/from the GG bridge) and make a special effort to get here on $2 Taco Tuesdays. I like cheap.

The fish tacos are just about all I eat here. Do not like their carnitas. Their salsas arent amazing, but they seem tailor-made for the fried fish tacos.

I'm Mexican and can honestly say the food here is inauthentic (tacos should not be fried or even this large, or have beans; get tacos de cabeza at tonayense, thats closer to what you'd get in mexico). 

The fish tacos are more LA than Mexico. But thats ok, I dont *really* discriminate, as long as its tasty.

And they are. So so so crispy-greasy-creamy-fantabulous. 5 stars for scratching that baja fish taco itch.

PS) Skip the horchata, that sucks too.
author: Dama J.

description:
This place is pretty amazing. Not only are the tacos great, but the prices are incredibly reasonable. Tacos range in price from about $3-4 per taco and they're very generous with the fillings. THIS is what people who aren't in California are missing.

I've tried the carne asada (Nick's way -with guacamole and jack cheese- is best on those) and the pescado. Both have been excellent every time. Plus, the salsa squeeze bottles on the table are actually complementary to your taco and totally delicious. The only reason I can't give Nick's 5 stars is because Tacubaya in Berkeley still makes a better fish taco. Nevertheless, I love it here.

Also, chips and salsa are around $1.25 or something, which I greatly respect. You know they could charge anywhere up to 4-5 dollars without getting flak, but they don't because we all know so many places just rip you off when they charge for chips. My only real gripe about Nick's is that it was super crowded last time we came here... the seating arrangement is weird. Our food arrived and we didn't even have a table yet. Oh, and cash only... sigh.
author: Amanda C.

description:
I love the combination of the bizarre location inside a red-velvet and chandelier-y nightclub and good, cheap tacos.  We've gone a couple of times during the day and it's definitely a key lunch spot if you're in the area.  

Just place your order, pop a squat at a table or one of the banquettes, and yummy food (and margaritas in plastic cups!) will come to you.  I like the incongruity of it all and really enjoy the fish tacos there.

After reading these reviews, it looks like I will need to swing by sometime for Taco Tuesday...hee.
author: Jaimie M.

description: Get the tacos Nick's way -- hard and soft shell with some guacamole. Yumm!
author: Karin Z.

description:
solid tacos (ive had the carne asada and fish).. good flavor, great texture on the tortilla shell (even though it is a bit oily for my liking)

chips and salsa.. great texture on the chips but the salsa was bland

guacamole is just average
author: jo jo j.

description:
He was craving a great simple crispy taco.  We drove all the way over to Russian Hill just b/c of the reviews.  Had I known it shared a space with Rouge, I would have passed.  It has faint smells of barf.  Not too appetizing when you are trying to eat.

Tortilla soup is bland.  Crispy taco is just a soft taco lightly fried.  Most of the tacos were in need of a little flavor.  Not worth it.  Chips and salsa had the most flavor out of everything.
author: Denice L.

description: Delicious fish tacos nick's way - guacamole with a crispy taco inside a soft shell. Loved the green salsa on the tables. Came here for a quick and cheap bite to eat before going out and left with my stomach fully satisfied. Waited around 15 mins in line on a crowded Saturday night. Next time will try the yelp check in offer for free chips n salsa!
author: Joyce H.

description:
Nick's Crispy Tacos [is greater than] Bluelight  
[for Taco Tuesday, at least]

Why do you ask?  Let me count the ways...

1.  The Food
Nick's: delicious everything.  the quesadilla is the best i've had, possibly ever.  usually went with the cheese, recently tried the chicken -- bad call, the pollo was dry and there was hardly any cheese.  but the cheese quesadilla...mmmmm melty cheesy goodness.
Bluelight: remember "Taco Day" you had at your middle school cafeteria on wednesdays?  yeah, their tacos are reminiscent of that.  slapped together, usually soggy, and overly salsa-ed.

2.  The Service
Nick's: you line up, pay [cash only], get a number, [hopefully] find a seat, and wait.  i've waited from 2 - 15 minutes for the food to arrive, depending on how busy it is.
Bluelight: you try to find/flag down the waitresses that are umbrageously dressed like you and i, give your order, and hope for the best.  you wait for about 20 minutes and once the waitress machetes her way through the crowd, they [usually - 80% of the time] give you your food; how they remember who ordered what is beyond me.

3.  The Beer Selection
Nick's: Corona and Corona Light for $2 [but you have to go to the bar bar for the Corona Light's]
Bluelight: Just Corona for $2

4.  The Prices
Nick's: Tacos/quesadillas/chips+salsa+guacamole are $2, and are worth every one of the 200 pennies.
Bluelight: Tacos are $2, and worth about 70 Abe Lincoln's.

5.  The Scene
Nick's: pretty menagerie, hailing from most every nook of the city.
Bluelight: douchebaggery at its finest [which is coincidentally also at its worst].  i once saw a guy here push a girl aside [and almost over] who he loudly proclaimed was not pretty enough to be in there.  so terrible.

In short, if you love sub-par food and shallow rock and republic-rocking company then by all means, Bluelight is all yours.  But if you are into tasty treats and fun(ner) people, then I'll see you at Nick's on Tuesday :)
author: Kat S.

description:
Ok, so I was visiting SF and it was my friends' and I last night.  I found this place in a magazine and we made our way there.  I had the suggested pescadero (fish tacos).  I did not have it Nick's way...something about guacamole and cheese on fish tacos makes me cringe.  I think its blasphemy!!  I prefer the baja style with cabbage and yummy sauce.  

That day the soda fountain was out of order and they had no more mexican Coke.  I was disappointed.  They could have atleast gone to the store and bought some canned sodas.

I do agree with other reviewers that the place was a little dirty.  My group sat at a table near some couches that seemed to be used as a storage area.  Not cool.

Definitely would recommend as take out.
author: Allison B.

description: Taco's are excellent, and large. Probably just need two to fill you up. Cash only and kind of wacky atmosphere.
author: Carl C.

description:
Nicks has such great food - the fish taco's are just amazing!!!  Remember to bring cash though if you dont there is an ATM outside.  Great place for a snack or to stuff your stomach until you cant stand.  

Nacho's are really good also!
author: Julie C.

description: My favorite tacos! I work at 7th at Townsend and will make an effort to trek over to Nick's for their heavenly goodness stuff wrapped with yummy crispy-ness. It's a good idea to try them all but my favorite are the fish and carne tacos. Make sure you get it Nick's way with cheese and guac. Their chips, salsa and guac is also a great starter.
author: Jackson N.

description:
The setting is interesting...nightclub at night apparently.  

Food is overpriced and just ok.  Ordered 2 Pescado Tacos, 1 Pollo Asado, 1 Carne Asada and chips and salsa. The guac is barely passable and the pico does not go well with the tacos.  Scooped out the pico from my carne asada taco and it tasted much better.  The fish tacos were ok.  They were really oily and heavy.  Also, mayo on a taco is a travesty...meh.

Oh well.  Glad I tried Nick's but I guess it is not my cup o' tea.
author: Tysen C.

description:
This is probably the funnest place you can get yummy tacos at! Taco Tuesdays are the best deal and it's like a party in there! So great to have a  casual dinner with a couple of stiff margaritas at the bar and feel like it's a big night out. 

I've only had the carne asada and pollo tacos, but both done "Nick's way" and both were delish.

Unfortunately, today they were closed for a private party- but!! they were still serving food to-go. A kind Nick's patron eating at one of the outdoor tables said that Nick's has a good relationship with the local bars, so that we could order and take our meal to, say, The Buccaneer and have our Taco with a Corona and lime... which is exactly what we did. 

This isn't my 'hood so I don't come here that often. But if I was nearby, I can see myself coming once a week. That's why Little Chihuahua gets all my love =)
author: Nina H.

description:
I had great expectations for this weekend.  With the missus out of town, I'd planned a road trip to Reno with the pug.  Little gambling, little skiing, it was gonna be a great father/pug weekend.

Instead, I found myself rolling around in my own filth all week, down with the flu, and taking a big bite out of my stockpile of sick leave at work.  Reno's off the table, the apartment's a disaster, and my sinuses are still angry.

So today I dragged my sad sack up and down Russian Hill and treated myself to a burrito at Nick's, a welcome diversion from the toast, crackers, and water I'd enjoyed all week.

Nick's is comfort burrito for me.  I've never even tried the crispy tacos here.  I find them too confounding to even order.  I typically stick with the carne asada burrito, which is stuffed with enough meat and beans to send shockwaves through your digestive tract.  To this you may add cheese, sour cream, and/or guac, if you dare.  

Take a seat inside at the simple tables and frail chairs, surrounded by the red velvet draperies and faux crystal chandeliers of the doppelganger nightclub.  And dude standing there waiting for your to-go order:  it's waaayyyy too early in the day to be bobbing your head along to the reggae playing in the background, so give it a rest.

There are two sauces available at each table.  I have no idea what they are, savvy food critic that I am, but I love them both.  One seems spicier than the other.  And please make a point to your fellow diners, as I was sure to do, that you are not touching the tip of the dispenser to your germ-riddled, partially eaten food--I think at least a four-inch buffer zone between tip and germ pit is appropriate.

Yeah, this was so much better than Reno would have been.  Guh.
author: Daryl E.

description:
You just can't beat this place.  Best spot on Polk Street.  Been going since the day they opened -  Grilled fish taco, Nick's way. 
The lines are getting longer and longer so consider calling ahead for take out.
author: Damon M.

description:
Cognitive Dissonance.

That the City's best taco house should squeeze its ass onto Russian Hill's Polk Street is just another of the pleasant quirks of the City by the Bay that make you raise your eyebrows, tilt your head and say, "aaiiiiiiight."

For best results, order the amazing chicken tacos Nick's Way (crispy and soft shells), and douse it in salt and green sauce (at the tables).  The chicken is simmered in spices and sauce, so it's nice and juicy.  Each bite is guaranteed to put a little post-orgasmic glow on your face.  Not the best margs in the city (Tommy's, La Barca, Mamacita's), so stick with cervezas.

You'll leave smilin'.
author: Scott W.

description:
When you walk into Nick's, you will be confused.  There are red velour booths, 20 huge chandeliers, a disco ball, a big bar with people sipping on cosmos and white russians, a sign stating "no cell phones", and picnic tables with sunflower-designed tablecloths.

Aside from the random decor, Nick's offers up some delicious food.   The standard chips and salsa are great.  The chips are fresh and crispy.  The tacos are fantastic as well.  They are huge and perfectly wrapped for easier eating.  I opted for the carnitas taco ("Nick's way"- guacamole and fried shell) and the original fish taco.  The carnitas taco was yummy, the fried shell and fresh guacamole really made the taco one of a kind.  The only thing that put me off was a lot of fat in my carnitas.  I found a few huge pieces in my taco :(  However, I moved onto my fish taco and it was GREAT.  The pieces of fish were fried, came with a white sauce, and it was filled with red cabbage.  The fish was my favorite.  Everyone at the table was loving their tacos...they got the carne asada and chicken.  

I would definitely come back again.  3.5 stars.

----------

Update 4/13

We came back again and I tried the carne asada taco Nick's Way and it was sooooo tasty.  yum.  I even had a morsel of my friend's quesadilla and it was surprisingly good.  The tortilla is crispy and light and the filling is great.  I have to upgrade Nick's from a 3.5 to a 4!!!
author: Vivian W.

description:
THIS is what everyone has been talking about? 

Now I know why....these are sooo good, my mouth is watering just thinking of the one I had today.  I scarfed a pollo taco "nicks way" in about 2 minutes.  I wasn't that hungry but I've wanted to try a taco from Nick's for a long time.  

It was weird to be in there during the day because I'd been to Rouge a few times a couple of years ago.  It makes the experience more interesting to be surrounded with red velour and crystal chandeliers while ordering tacos.  I love that they have beans in them, and that sauce on the chicken!  

I can't wait to have another, and several other things on the menu.
author: Elizabeth W.

description:
Tacos for gringos, hey!

Their elote (roasted corn with butter, cheese, lemon juice and spices) was pretty good though.
author: Jasmine W.

description:
This place has pretty good food.  Not the best Mexican ever, but seeing as though it's like the only place in the Russian Hill/Upper Nob Hill area, it will suffice.  I actually love their guacamole, fish tacos, and carne asada.  However, get the food to go or eat quickly because they have absolutely the worst service and rudest people I've ever met here.

UPDATE 7/23/2007:

From 3 to 4 stars.  I'm here all the time.  All the time.  The staff knows me.  So I feel I have a to up my rating.  They must have gotten rid of the rude people that work here because it seems that everyone is pretty nice now.  Although a few of them could smile more.  Anyway, LOVE their salsas, nachos, tacos, and I rarely get a burrito, but they are good too.  And this place is cheap to boot!  I will admit I now love Nick's Crispy Tacos.
author: Vanessa Z.

description:
Oh, so you didn't know the best way to enjoy some tasty Mexican food is by surrounding yourself with red pleather booths, huge glittering chandeliers and mirrored discoteque columns?  Hahahaha.  Silly you.  

I know - the first time I walked into this place I was all, "Whaaaat?"  It was the antithesis of a taco joint and thoroughly confused me.  Until I tasted my first chicken adobo taco, Nick's way.  After that, nothing else mattered.  In fact, I love the weird night-club-on-hold vibe; makes it that much more unique.  The Jarritos and chips with pico de gallo salsa and elote (corn on the cob with cheese and chili powder) are all must-eats, too.
