You know what they say - never judge an awesome taco place by its.... dance floor.  Obviously.
author: Kate M.

description:
Came here for dinner tonight with my buddy.

Cash only. -1 star
We actually were short 15 cents though and the cashier covered us from the tip jar.  +2 stars.

I guess that little bit balanced itself out.

The real meat and potatoes here is about the crispy freaking tacos.  Holy cow.  And the guac.  I am a certified guacamole FIEND, so you know I totally obliterated the pile of chips, salsa and guac.  It was a tad mild, but then I'm also a wuss when it comes to spicy food, too.  There, I said it.

I ordered a Pescado taco (fried fish) and it was so good and juicy with the lime aioli (that's fancy mayo for you non-foodies).  I literally went through a napkin with each bite.  They probably had to restock the napkin dispenser after we left the table.  I wonder how many tree deaths I was responsible for with that single mouth-wateringly delicious, but messy fried fish taco.  I was tempted to get it done Nick's Way, but I needed to make sure I wasn't carted out in an ambulance for a coronary.  Maybe next time...I'll just make sure to run a few miles first.

In summary:  The food was absolutely delicious, cool dining area/club, fast service, MEXICAN COKE (another huge bonus), and really great people watching.  I'll definitely be coming back.
author: Daddy O.

description:
When it comes to Taco's, I like "Tijuana style."  That's a dollar taco, small, on a hand made tortilla, with just the perfect meat, spice, and a sprinkle of onion and cilantro.

That said, these Taco's sucked, for me.  And as mentioned by others, "Nick's way" will give you a lot of guac, but if it weren't for all the salt in it, it would have no flavor at all (crappy guac).  On the up side, there are plenty of chips and salsa in the basket for a buck, but eat fast... the salsa is more like a chunky tomato sauce and will get your chips soggy with the quickness.

The atmosphere leaves me wanting for olden days with a big band and people dressed up and dancing (with some style and taste).

For a bar / night club with Taco's, I guess the Taco's fit the bill.
author: Dan M.

description: Good but not floored. I know people rave about this place. I like it sure but not crazy about it. Plus the atmosphere in there is not quite there for me. Good for groups. Strong following for sports events. It gets to be a bit manic in there given the lay out of the place.
author: Nelson C.

description: The tacos here are phenomenal! ...and so are the quesadillas...deep fried to perfection. The environment is great for throwing back a couple beers and grabbing some good grub with friends.
author: Kristin H.

description:
I hate to say it, but I don't see how coming here and eating tacos is remotely worth the price unless it's Taco Tuesday, when, according to what I've heard, the lines are long.

Maybe if I visited late at night and stumbled in happily drunk, I would be more likely to not care that 3 tacos set me back $13. But I was not, and therefore, very unamussed that I paid that much for tacos that, while delicious, had not filled me up in the least. The burritos are a better buy, but then again, they are very average burritos, not bad, not great.

Maybe I'm being cheap ... when I was in Guatemala I got chicken tacos of comparable quality for 25 cents a pop.
author: Brian B.

description:
The food here is really adequate ... please don't come expecting authentic mexican food -- it is russian hill afterall (go to the Mission for that stuff) but it provides a good fix, nonetheless.  

The burritos are decent and so are their tacos.  Fish tacos especially ... pretty good.  A step above Rubio's definitely.  I'd stray from their soup, though b/c it wasn't that good.  Definitely go w/their standard dishes ... it's what people come here for.
author: Roni R.

description:
One of the best fish tacos I've had outside of Baja Mexico. The fish is crispy, light, and fresh. Huge too. A bit pricey, almost $4 for one. But it is completely worth it. The chips and salsa is excellent too. Fresh and guacamole on top of crispy fried chips. The location is weird...a little taco stand in the corner of a bar/lounge. But who cares, you're there for the tacos.

If you like it spicy, ask for the spicy sauce...it's not on the table. I believe it's a habanero based sauce.
author: Jun W.

description:
I walked into the notorious Nick's Crispy Tacos with high expectations yesterday. I had heard about them from friends, and of course, how can you go wrong with a Taco shop that claims "Yelp likes us" (via fancy sticker on their door).

So here's the deal. I admit, I'm a yelper. I like this site, it's so fun. But sometimes I have to wonder. Do yelpers love Nick's Crispy Taco's, or does Nick's Crispy Tacos love yelp? Does this place have five stars all around because they serve it up right, or because everyone else thinks they serve it up right?

I'm not into this idea that yelp can make a restaurant- I think it should be the other way around. I know I should appreciate these damn advertisements and announcements from the sponsors... but I don't. I want yelp free of persuasive shit like that.

Anyway, about Nicks: I ordered an OVERPRICED prawn taco and a coke. The taco was good, but not incredible- it kinda lacked flavor. The atmosphere was different than I expected it would be. I knew it wouldn't be a typical taqueria, but I didn't realize that this place turns into a club at night (with a full bar, booths, etc- it's called Rouge). Now I get why there is an appeal to my 20-something friends, and I understand the trend.

Anyway, I'd return if I were in the area, but the trend doesn't appeal to me enough to seek it out. I'd rather go hit up a not-so-trendy taqueria in the Mission and have it served up right!
author: Erin M.

description:
I will add another .5 to make 2.5 stars for the really good camarones taco I just polished off (how co-dependent am I?) Well, it was good today.  No promises about tomorrow.

Three's not the charm, apparently with Nick's. After two good or pretty good visits, the one yesterday was just not good. I think part of the problem is that when it's get really busy here -- and I waited about 15 minutes to order, the quality slips significantly in the interest of time.  Maybe the turnaround was too quick.  I got two grilled fish tacos and two chicken quesadillas for a friend and myself. Smelled pretty good, although the fish did smell a bit fishy for my tastes (something that happened last time, too, but I let it go. But twice? Ugh.)

My friend bites into his fish taco. Disaster.  He bit into some bones, which he removed, but it put him off considerably and we threw the rest out. The chicken quesadillas went over better, although they, too, suffered from a too-quick preparation -- flavorful, but really soggy, seemed overly grilled - fried? and just disappointing.

Diagnosis: Bleah. You had me at hello, but now it's goodbye for now.
author: Melissa G.

description:
Nick's oh Nick's. You really know how to treat a girl. 
I wouldn't exactly call myself a regular, but I do frequent this place pretty often. Too often lately, if you ask me. And I only say too often because this means that I'm a.) hungover b.) gorging myself on chips and guac unnecessarily.

My favorite is a crispy taco with tons of guac. That is until I tried the breakfast burrito and breakfast quesadilla. Completely ridiculous. Oh sweet Jesus - take me home.
author: Jenny S.

description:
Tuesday Taco Night rocks and the place was packed!  Got there shortly after 7pm and there were no seats left.  We were debating if we should take it to go but decided to stick around and wait for a space.  

Not sure if there are always this busy or the Tuesday Taco night drew everyone in.  $2 tacos - carnitas, carne asada and pollo only - but $2, that's CHEAP!  We decided on 2 each of carnitas and carne asada and a margarita - cashier asked if we wanted the margarita from there or the other side at the bar - difference is top shelf at $6 there or $3 at the bar across the room.   We got the taco Nick's way (see previous post for description) and it comes to ~$18 - that explains why the line gets longer and longer all the way to the other side of the dining room. 

Luckily, a table of 4 was leaving while we were waiting.  Before we even sat down - the waiter came by, dropped down our baskets of taco and took our number away.  The tacos did not disappoint at all - the mass of guacamole is just the perfect topping.  I must say that I'm a fan of the carnitas and will only order that from now on.

Finger licking good and absolutely delicious!
author: Gloria H.

description: Among the best Mexican food I've had. Carne asada was delicious. I got the burrito, so, so good. I would definitely go back again and again.
author: christine c.

description:
The fish tacos are really good.  The others are okay, pretty good I guess.  When you read all of the yelp reviews and hear how most rave about this place, you just expect a little more.  But like I said, the Pescado Tacos are really good.  The extra .75 for Nick's way is not really worth it.  The guacomole seems to mask the great taste of the tacos.

They have a no cell phone policy, which is whatever.  I'm just as annoyed  with the douchebag screaming on his phone in public but seriously, it's a taco joint, in a bar......who really gives a shit?

A credit card machine would be nice as well.
author: Jamie B.

description:
When I think of Good times in San Francisco I think of Nick's Crispy Tacos (NCT).  Excellent atmosphere make this place unlike the Mission district Taco joints--where the food is good but the tables are movie-theater-floor like--sticky.  

Notes: 
-Order 2 fried fish tacos and a order of nachos.  
 
-Leave NCT before they hand the restaurant over to the white shirt button up club goers of Rouge.   

-Go out afterwards on bars on Polk for drinking good times.  

-Bring Cash.
author: Bill B.

description: I came here last night with my friends for $2 Taco Tuesday :) It was awesome! we had so much fun! $3 margaritas that were so strong my grandpa would say  "those will put hair on your chest," LOL ;) We got Carne tacos "nicks way." The verdict: YUM, My friend and I ordered 3, one for each of us, and one to share. My little pig of a friend ate our "shared" taco when I was'nt looking!!! LOL It was THAT good. I learned my lesson- next week Im gonna order 2 for myself! but come hungry because theyre HUGE.
author: maria K.

description: 3.5 would be more accurate a rating. Had a table reserved and drove down for Taco Tuesday last night. There was quite a line to get in and it took a good 20 minutes for them to clear our table so we could sit down. The tacos are pretty decent. Nothing to write home about. Beer was fairly priced. It's pretty cool inside with the whole red velvet and chandelier thing going on. Definitely not somewhere you'd expect a taco place. Overall it was fun and would think about going back to.
author: Anthony M.

description:
I enjoyed my grilled fish taco here. The piece of fish was humongous. My husband loved his crispy fish tacos and nachos. We will be going back.

I was here one evening a couple years ago at Rouge. Eating tacos at a night club/bar during the day does ruin the mystique a bit, but hey, the food is good.
author: Lindsay B.

description: For a whole the tacos started to suck  went back recently and they were good again.
author: Penny W.

description:
Pescado taco Nick's Way, and the pescado burrito are my 2 staples at Nick's these days. 

And the place is always packed, which is always a good sign. Seems like a lot of regulars. I've never been in there for drinks after work yet, but it's always poppin.

The prices are decent and probably about right for the area. If you want cheap mexican the Mission district is the place for you. Oh Taqueria Cancun how I yearn for you.

All in all I recommend Nick's and would happily take others there. I find myself in Pescado bliss atleast once every 2 weeks these days. And the craving is getting worse.
author: Arash M.

description:
Pretty darn good tacos for the yuppier side of Polk. Gotta go Nick's way or it's just another aight taco. 

Taco salads, pescado and fresca's are all solid, but once again - Nick's way! 

Sadly, Polk street in general doesn't have the best Mexican food. But Nicks is 2nd on the list of 3 (Super Burrito, Nicks and Pancho's).
author: Mike C.

description:
I don't know how they do it but their fish tacos are sooooooooooooo gooooood.  Get the mahi mahi tacos, Nicks way.  I usually get one fish and one shrimp for take out.  Mmmmm one regular taco shell, one crispy... I have not eaten in house but will someday when I'm rarely stumbling around the Marina.  

Minus one star for being so damn pricey.
author: Margaret L.

description: The waitress recommended the exact same tacos that I was considering myself which I knew was a great sign. The lime drink was perfectly refreshing on a sunny day.
author: David S.

description: The place is a dive but the food is amazing! Get's tacos Nick's way and you will think you are in Mexico heaven. The most delicious fixings. FYI - it turns into a club at night so be careful if that is not your thing! Highly recommend take out too! bring cash, the togo bar does not like credit. Here's to great food!
author: Laura A.

description:
Absolutely amazing tacos!  Definitely get it "Nick's Way" with the crispy shell and guacamole.  So delicious.  I would also highly recommend the fish tacos.  Really something else.  We also came for $2 Taco Tuesdays, which is an incredible value.  I had 2 tacos and nachos.  yummmm

Come early though to get a table!
author: Robyn F.

description:
Tip #1: Get your tacos "Nick's Style", which includes delicious Niman Ranch beef (if you indeed are getting the beef taco), along with hearty guac and sour cream.  These are substantial tacos, so they don't disappoint.  The $3 House Margs were also fabulous.

Tip #2: Avoid going to Nick's Crispy Tacos on Cinco de Mayo.  The Douchebag quotient exceeded my greatest expectations, and one mother-effer seriously got into my face and was ready to fight me due to the limited space inside (I mean, I'm talking like 40 douchebags deep inside this place!).  He apologized for yelling at me when he turned around and realized that 1) I was taller than him, and 2) I am female.  I am kind of wishing he had tried to assault me so that I could bring his pu$$y-@$$ to court for assault and battery.  

So, 5 stars for the comida, and zero for the lame crowd.  That doesn't really average out to 4 stars, but the tacos were that good.
author: Kira K.

description:
Oh my goodness.....this place is a bastion of perfect taco/burrito-ness.  I am a dedicated follower, proponent, and researcher of good San Francisco style American-Mex food, and this place currently has the crown for me.  Let me elaborate.....

If you order a taco 'Nick's way', here's what you get:  the place fries a tortilla until crisp and then wraps a soft tortilla around the fried one and subsequently stuffs it with what you order.  The Pescado is my favorite, for instance, and it comes with a piece of fried fish/awesome guac/cheese/sourcream/and cabbage.  Exemplary mofo taco.  I am full right now and am still salivating. The vegetarian is another favorite of mine, it comes 'Nick's way' standard.

This place is actually in Rouge, a night club in Russian hill that doubles as Nick's during the day and then converts at 10 or so.  It feels like it when you are inside during the day.  But, the food easily overtakes the downtrodden vibe.
author: TJ D.

description:
I came into Nick's, thinking I would get a taste of heaven based on the Yelp reviews, but it was more like a taste of purgatory.  Not amazing, not horrible.

Likes:
Nick's way 
Deep fried fish goodness
Glob of guacamole

Dislikes:
Horchata (VERY GRANULAR AND SWEET!)
TNS (Taco Neck Syndrome)
Cash only
Almost got into a car accident with Nick B. looking for parking

Don't get me wrong, it was good, just not orgasmic.
author: Christine S.

description:
Can't see what the fuss is all about. Tried their bean and taco salad. Rather ho hum and LOTS of onions for my liking. Also felt something smelt a little stale. A rancid weird smell which I couldn't shake off. 

Sampled the veggie burrito which was better than my salad but nothing superlative. 

Would most probably give them a skip. Also, this is a cash only place.
author: Natasha I.

description: Definite fan.  I didn't know what to make of this place when I walked into it.  It looks like the past 3 decades collided and ended up the way it looks.  Good music, interesting vibe, nice mexican food  and a good happy hour that goes onto 930 most days.  Definitely be back for some more taco's and beer.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Basically the best fish taco you can find in San Francisco. Nick's is one of those local spots that only locals hear about. Be sure to order this way: 

- Salsa
- 2 Pescado Tacos Nick's Way
- Aqua Fresca

You can't go wrong for a quick and delicious taco meal, right on Polk street.
author: Dave M.

description:
Where better for my first yelp review than the place that makes me love going out to eat in San Francisco? No matter what anyone may tell you, it's not the red velvet couches, it's not the connection to Rouge, it's not the amazing pico, and it's not the super-tasty-yet-super-cheap tacos that make Nick's one of the best places to visit in the bay area.

It's the way that all of those things combine into one friendly restaurant. Essentially, Nick's Crispy Tacos is a lot like Captain Planet... just not in that dorky, lame "superhero" kind of way.

Try the pescado and pay the measly extra dollar for the chips and salsa, you won't regret it!
author: Ryan L.

description:
I have to admit, I have only ever ordered a crispy fish taco, nick's way (you have to order it nick's way, its the best!) It's just so good that I can't bear to try anything else in case I don't like it as well.

Getting a fish taco with a cold beer after a long day is absolutely delightful. This is NOT the place to go if you want to be waited on, however. You can order a beer (small selection, but there is modelo) when you order your food, or go during HH when the bar in the Rouge (they adjoin) is open and you can have a $2 margarita! 

It's also ideal to go earlier (5-6) and score one of those retro looking booths.. so comfortable!
author: Valerie W.

description:
Recently I went on a tour of a few establishments that offer Taco Tuesdays to see which was the best.  I'm sad to report that all the ones I went to are mediocre or worse.  The loser in the competition was me for spending time and money at each.  The winner was any establishment at which I spent money.

Somehow I thought I stumbled into a time machine and now I had ended  up getting tacos at some club in Miami circa 1974.  I expected Scarface to walk in any minute and mow down the line of people at the bar.  

If you can get over the kind of weird decor, I found Nick's to easily have the best tacos of the places I went.  They were more like small delicious fried meaty pitas than tacos, but given the price and size of the tacos I couldn't complain.  The beer situation was a little annoying, since half the beers were like $2 but then the other beers were regular price but then you couldn't get both in the same spot so then you had to walk from the little counter to the bar to order beers and meanwhile everyone is staring at your chair as hungrily as you are staring at your tacos.

The experience is ok.  I really wish this place was open later since a few Coronas definitely greases the wheels for some tequila and then next thing you know it's Wednesday morning.  The cheap chairs and tables seem like they were stolen from someone's yard.  I guess they wanted to  make sure no one hangs around too long.  This place ends up getting so crowded people end up sitting on the stairs (or anywhere they can put a buttcheek) and the joint ends up looking like a Thai bus stop.  The bathroom also looks like some too tiny room that was rented to a junkie and then once the owners kicked him out they noticed how really small it was and turned it into a bathroom.

In summary:  Good tacos, good prices, crappy venue.  Best recommended for if you come early, order a boatload of tacos, eat them fast and go.
author: Steven R.

description: Food is great! Love the tacos Nick's Way & the seafood burrito! Layout of the place it cool - connected with a bar - Only thing is that I can get really crowed on certain nights. but that just means people are liking it :)
author: Rah F.

description: GREAT Tacos!!! Probably one of the best I've ever had. Great service and bar tenders and a fun atmosphere. The furniture is a little tacky, but you end up kinda liking it by the time you leave. I would definitely recommend it to anyone who lives or is visiting the area. And taco Tuesday's they have great deals!
author: Tashi K.

description: A nice spot.  I admired their guac, so I paid for the add-on to my carne asada quesadilla.  It was nice and slightly crispy.  Good amount, pleasant music, nice lighting, friendly service, not too crowded on Thursday.  That and a well margarita, nicely mixed, ran $12 with tip.  Not bad.
author: Marc S.

description: Great food and really cool red, velvety interior. My favorite: The carne asada taco!!
author: Felix L.

description: Good food but...The setup of this place is totally whack. You cannot even order food from the bar! There's a counter just to order food but the line for that is just a free-for-all with dumb people trying to cut in all over.
author: Shooter M.

description:
Smells like old booty.
Still I came back for some more
Tacos from heaven.
author: Lana B.

description:
This review is for the tacos-nick's style. We had both the grilled and fried fish. Both were excellent but the fried fish was a bit over cooked and therefore a bit dry. However we did not knock off any stars because despite this little issue the tacos were so good! The nick's style tacos are huge-two kept our hunger at bay for many many hours.

We couldn't believe we had not been to this place sooner but we definitely will be back.
author: Romeo And Lola K.

description: YUP! That's right, this is like my favorite taco place besides  San Diego (read my rav about South Beach bar & Grill in Diego). This place is like home away from home. Although they have their own flare, it comes close. Not as many selections as SBB&G but like i said, it's a close call. The atmosphere is great! Anything on Polk street is great. I just love that street. People are so friendly, and the whole entire place is red. I would go here for a date, bc its fun, light, young, hip. The tacos are really good, they are topped with red cabbage, a spicy lime mayo, and onions. I didn't get the burrito, but from the looks of looking onto other ppl's plate, they looked really good. EXPECT me to come here again and def making it my staple.
author: Shante E.

description: Honestly-- I'm NOT a taco/burrito person.  (I'm the type that goes in to a Mexican restaurant and gets nachos.. I know.. lame).   But-- I thoroughly enjoyed every bite of this place.  Tried 3 different types (Carnitas, Camarones, and Grilled Fish) and all were DELICIOUS.  The "crispy" comes from the light crispy inner shell.  I really like the cool vibe of fun and unpretentiousness.  Its a great hangout spot to grab a cocktail and munchies when you just want to chillax.  Would definitely go back to try some more.
author: Sun M.

description:
Pretty much consistent with everything already here.

This might be the best taco I've had in San Francisco, even though it wasn't anything incredible; if you think about it, most taquerias (which Nick considers this to be) put all the effort into their burritos and just have tacos as a lower-priced option to burritos that just taste kinda meh.

Great specials and ambience.
author: Mark A.

description: YIkes, I gave them 4 stars last time.. I live in the mission where there are delicious tacos.. Nick's is pretty good, but definitely not authentic.. and the fish tacos are kinda greasy..
author: Monica S.

description:
I am not a big fan of Mexican food, but I find it worthy of recommending. Nightclub-like atmosphere and music while having the great food that costs you few dollars only!! 

You should give it a try too!!!
author: Chiqui H.

description:
I once wrote that another Mexican food joint had the best chips/ salsa/ guac in the city... I stand corrected. This place is fantastic. Maybe I just have a special place in my heart for Taco Tuesday, but the food here is exceptional. And on Tuesdays, you can't beat nice big $2 tacos and $2 chips and salsa/ guac baskets... or $3 margaritas and 2 for $5 beers.

I suppose the downfall would be the long line and limited seating. But that's just a Tuesday thing, and the line moves pretty fast. But it's a big place and it always gets busy enough to have a great energy. And if Taco Tuesday isn't enough for you... try Wine Wednesday or Tequila Thursday. It's quieter on those nights compared to Tuesday, but still a good time. Love this place :)
author: Kim B.

description:
I just got to SF, and the first thing I did was head over to Nick's.  The fish tacos Nick's way are just plain ol' awesome.  The only thing missing was some Malta, but I haven't yet been able to find a place here that serves it.

The cocktail lounge part was a bit grimy, with sticky tables and food on the seats, but I guess that's what happens when you merge a taco stand with a cocktail lounge.
author: All C.

description:
In one word: de-friggin-licious.  Nick, I don't know who you are or where you learned to make tacos, but you deserve a nobel tortilla prize.  

In a city with such a huge selection of authentic mexican food it says a lot that people are going to a tacky night club in nob hill and waiting in a huge line to buy tacos from a guy named Nick.  Try them and you will believe.

Note: Avoid the neon green melon aguas fressca.  I don't what melons this stuff came from, but they aren't of this world.
author: Trevor F.

description:
I can't ever decide if I absolutely love this place
...or if its just that place that someone(inevitably) always suggests and you go only because you can't remember if you love it or hate it, and you're just too lazy to think of somewhere better.

Either way, food - pretty damn good.  Not off-the-richter, call every Mexican friend you know, tell every whiny So-Cal'er that this is the best Mexican food ever...but its pretty good.

I do think the venue--inside "Rouge"-- is slightly disgusting.  I kinda want to hurl everytime I go in.
Nevertheless...
Taco Tuesday is pretty rad, $2 tacos and $2 Margaritas.  Makes for good mingling and possible awkward work outings.  I actually ran into a dude I went to college with who looks like PJ from that show "Goof Troop."
+3 unintentional comedy points for that.
author: Ryan R.

description:
I am so hungry right now.  And all I want are a couple of crispy, oily, melty-cheesy slightly spicy tacos.  Unfortunately, I want them done "Nick's Way" and Nick's is way over on the other side of town.  So, sadly, my urge will go unmet, and I will have to write about them instead.
Yum - little fried corn tortilla bundles of taco heaven.  If you have not yet had the experience, go go go...but be wary of the fact that once you do, no  other taco will ever satisfy in quite the same way.
Oh Nick, why so far away?
author: Becca V.

description:
Monday I had the day off so I went on another one of my eating marathons-- it's where I plan out an itinerary of all-day eating and drag along a buddy to be gluttonous with me.  Nick's Crispy Tacos was a part of my adventure.

Like a good little Yelper, I put Nick's Crispy Tacos into my bookmarks after seeing its good reviews, looked at the location on Yahoo maps and waited patiently for a good time to try them.  The decor was kitschy cute, the people dining there all really good-looking for some reason, and for a taco place, this joint is really effing clean.

Okay, so the only thing that I thought was good at Nick's was the Pescado Taco.  We also tried the Carne Asada Quesadilla (decent, but not great) and the Carnitas Taco which was an abomination.  Hands down, the worst taco I've ever had.  The carnitas pork had no flavor, a firm texture and was generally a pretty big insult to all the tacos in the world.

If it weren't for the great fish tacos, I would throw a Yelping fit.
author: Diana Y.

description:
Well, they were right. You were right. These tacos are a breed of their own.

With guac pouring over the sides, meat marinated to juicy perfection, and the freshness of the salsa, these tacos are a SF must.

Came here for lunch last Friday, after wanting to visit for quite some time. Not too bad of a line, and I was able to get my order fairly quickly. One downside... they don't take cards. I hate that.

But I'm not judging this place on their form of payment but for their ridiculously good tacos. My bud got a burrito which also looked damn good.

I love that Nick's stays true to what they do. Make tacos. Make damn good tacos.
author: Mike K.

description:
Every time I heard "crispy tacos" I had images of Taco Bell-style hard shells in my mind - you know, the kind you can buy in multiples at the supermarket. Stupid, stupid me.

"Nick's Way" means that your soft tortilla will be magically made crispy (maybe it's flash fried?), and guacamole and cheese will top your meat of choice. The carne asada, carnitas, and chicken are all delicious, but my favorite is the pescado. It's deep fried fish, and your taco won't be crispy in this case, but it's YUMMY!

I sure hope Nick excuses me for even mentioning Taco Bell here. I'll never do it again... unless I'm talking about what NOT to expect!
author: jenn h.

description:
I'm really glad parking is horrible in this neighborhood. Otherwise I'd be at Nick's every night (and maybe for lunch too), washing their chips 'n guac down with a Mexican coke. 

Minus one star, though, because they keep weird hours and seem to close a lot for private parties, frequently without even offering take out to the poor schleps who are out of the loop and show up after 45 minutes of muscling for a parking space only to discover they've been shafted by Bunny's 40th or whatever.
author: Hannah Q.

description:
This is place is like a Disneyland of Mexican food...

I'm not talking about the fact that it shares space with Rouge next to it (though I have to admit I get a kick out of ordering tacos with big chandeliers hanging and red velvet banquettes abound). I mean that this place is as Mexican as The Haunted House ride is like New Orleans, Country Bearland is like the country and Main Street USA is like a modern day Mayburry. In other words, its Mexican in spirit but is not truly Mexican. Hey as much as I don't "look it", I'm brown inside and out and I'm better off if I admit it. Needless to say, I enjoy both Disneyland and this place and find them both fantastic for a simple diversions to day to day life.

This place isn't too adventurous with its menu but still delivers with simple flavorful dishes. As suggested by its namesake, the tacos are the highlight and looky looky only $2 on Tuesday! Not a "true" Mexican place but definalty a place to stave off a craving unless you have an "abuelita". You'll know what I mean by reading that.
author: Veronica G.

description:
i'm a stickler when it comes to mexican food, but i don't consider this traditional mex.  i come for the fried fish tacos.  and i personally prefer them regular, NOT nick's way.  but the fish tacos are THE BEST around.  the camarones (shrimp) tacos (also NOT nick's way) aren't bad either.  

the full bar and flatscreen tv's on the rouge side of the house are added pluses.  

DONT FORGET, CASH ONLY.  but if you do theres an atm right next to the register.
author: dan a.

description:
Please - for the love of all the is HOLY AND GOOD...
go to Nick's and get a taco Nick's way.
We like to joke that there is crack in them because no matter how often you stumble in...nothing makes you happier than a taco from Nick's & a margarita. 

Last time we went...my friend asked me "What the hell is in this?!" and no joke - the guy behind the counter said "Crack." (he was joking and being  funny)

Now, although I'm sure there really isn't crack...there is something sinfully addicting about these morsels of deliciousness.
PLUS - the bar next door often has drink specials at the same time you're sitting down for dinner...take advantage my friend...take advantage.
However...if you go for a margarita - drink special or not...only get it from Nick's...the bar doesn't use fresh lime.

Deliciousness...like whoa.
author: Katy A.

description: Taco Tuesday is awesome.  Delicious tacos $5 Jamie shots, $10 beer pitchers, $18 magarita pitches (which should only be ordered from the lovely latina, Marlo).  I had 1 fish, 2 carnitas, and 2 carne asada with a side of chips and fresh salsa, which were all very delicious.  But dont let the last taco sit for too long, they lose their warm, moist charm.  Lastly, the best aspect of this place is truly the people.  Nicely mixed crowd, locals and out of town visitors.  Enjoy your Taco Tuesdays.
author: E H.

description:
So my friend had a groupon type thing for this place and neither of us had ever been before, but decided to give it a go.  First off the decor is really out there, in mostly a good way.  I guess the taco place shares space with some sort of late night hipster club/bar and really the two spaces mesh really well together.  I mean most taco places have essentially the same decor, with mariachi music playing and painted murals of a cancun sunset or some such nonsense, but not Nick's!  Here you get a bunch of flat screen TV's (good place for sports) with bar seating and a lot of extra smooth red velvet.  Woohah.  Hipster paradise to be damn sure.
The food is good, a bit overpriced for tacos, but large and filling enough to justify the extra money.  There is a bunch of meat choices, and I think I got a few different ones all made "crispy style".  The "crispy style" is actually deep frying one of the two soft taco shells (the inside one), and although I was initially skeptical of such a blatant disregard for such a cultural food item such as the taco the result actually tasted really frickin good.
Okay, so I don't have anything bad to say about Nick's, but definitely some notes to help you out.  First off the line for the tacos can get pretty long and also moves comically slow, why?  I think the guy taking orders may have been the most stoned person in SF on the particular day that I visited....if he wasn't then he has no excuse for taking forever and a minute to write down orders.  Second, finding a table was a bit of a challenge, so if you are with a group send one person to lay claim to a spot while the rest of the party wait in the never ending taco line.
author: Kenneth H.

description:
everyone is recommending the pescado, and i was somewhat disappointed.  fish was not as tasty as i was hoping.  mix of textures was excellent though.

i preferred the carne asada taco.  nick's way, of course

i tried the quesadilla, and it was more like a stuffed sandwich. it is very filling, and different in my opinion.  i liked it a lot, but i'd recommend it with steak rather than chicken.

note that the taco place is attached to a bar, and you can get happy hour prices for drinks there, but not at the taco counter proper.

overall this will be a neighbourhood favorite for me
author: T L.

description:
Where else can you eat double fried tacos in the atmosphere of a night club? 

Nick's is one of my favorite hangover cures -- deep fried tacos with all the fixings. Get it Nick's Way. 

Once you order, you can enjoy hanging out in half of 'Rouge' nightclub. A very unique experience. 

The food is great -- although I wouldn't waste your time with the burritos since the tacos are where its at.
author: lindsey l.

description:
I have always hesitated to actually come in here and I wish I would have trusted my gut feeling and have NOT entered. Maybe the fact that its in Rouge didn't give it away but I'm sure that when I found something in my food is what gave it away that I would never eat here again. The food wasn't great at all...maybe if I was obliterated and beyond drunk. You couldn't pay me enough money to eat here again. 

As for Taco Tuesday...I'll just skip on down to the Marina to the Blue Light
author: Valerie F.

description:
From sacramento, and looking for great mexican food. Got the veggie taco's, the guacamole was worth it, best I've ever had.
plus awesome beer prices,
author: Ryan M.

description:
My rating is reserved solely for the grilled fish crispy tacos.

And certaintly NOT for the fried fish crispy tacos.
author: Lindsay B.

description:
I love Nicks. I always end up ordering carnitas tacos. When I first went there I didn't understand that "Nicks way" deal (the guy at the cashier murmured that if I want x?*& way and I thought it's like another "supersize" or "combo with drink and chips" type of scam and said no.) and had the regular tacos, but I liked that too, especially the chopped lime inside! 

Nowadays I go for both ways.

(M)
author: M.S. C.

description:
I've been going to Nick's since the week it opened and it was fairly undiscovered. It's an addiction that will not be cured. 

Everything tastes fresh, it's fast, bathroom's a little funky from time to time but once you start eating it's not like you're leaving the table anytime soon anyways. 

The place is booming during lunch hours and since it's being converted to "The Rouge" after hours the picnic tables and plastic chairs in the middle (if you're not lucky enough to get a booth) are hard to assume the food coma position in.
author: Kristen R.

description:
I was lucky enough to come to Nick's for my first time on a Tuesday afternoon. Turned out that on Tuesdays they offer $2 tacos and $2 drinks! Can't beat that! I suggest coming early...the place gets pretty crowded after five, and you might have to wait in the loooong line. 

One thing that made me laugh about Nick's is that there are two choices of seating; indoor picnic tables or the plush red booths. 
I can't recommend the margaritas, they're just way too sweet.
author: Zoe W.

description:
Let's get serious. I love food.

Almost to the point where I would marry it. But since I'm a swinger, I won't marry it. I'll just give it a call when I am ready for it.

But yeah...

Nick's Crispy Tacos are another word for orgasm in my freakin' mouth. Seriously!

My friend took me here, and she was like, "You'll love them. I love eating here. They're great." Well, I will say that the one thing I was so sad about was that they didn't take credit cards. WHY?! WHY MUST YOU BE THOSE PEOPLE! I honestly hate businesses that don't take cards, and I was so close to just walking away and saying "Fuck ya'll!" But you know what? It was worth it. I walked my happy little self across the street to the drug store and got some gum and cash back. And then I got my taco on!

2 chicken tacos, Nick's Way. Now, I jokingly said, "My way" and they were confused. It's cool...they didn't know my name was Nic. No worries.

I nearly died. That good. Seriously...that good.

THAT GOOD!

If you haven't found this place yet, you've obviously never taken your tongue out for a tasty Mexican treat. Do it. Yeah...just do it. No seriously, do it. Why won't you do it? Just...yeah...come on...go.
author: Nicolas H.

description:
Really, really good tacos...and you have to go "Nick's way".  The fish taco was by far my favorite...crunchy pieces of fish, cabbage, this amazing little sauce, awesome fresh salsa...duh.

But this place drops a star for being cash only.  COME ON, yo!  I often get accused of not carrying cash, which is true.  And even today when I went for lunch, I had to borrow a few bucks from a friend because I didn't prepare well.  But $14 for three tacos and a coke?  Come the eff on, that's a little steep.  Tacos are $3-4 a pop, plus another $1 for Nick's way, which is a ripoff for me because I don't "guac this way".  They're good, but not $5 good.  

Another dropped star for the weird-ass decor (in a night club), with cheap picnic tables, and blaring 80s music.  At noon.  Ugh.

Other than that, yeah, it's a good taco.
author: Louis M.

description:
Taco Tuesdays is a must!
Yummy $2 tacos, what more could you ask for?
I dream about Nick's Carnitas tacos Nick's way!
author: Ryoko Y.

description:
Good carne asada tacos (nicks way)...but dont expect too much...they're not as crispy as some may hype it up to be...but the huge pile of guac on top makes up for it.  Overall a good place to go on taco tuesdays.  Their $2 beer during happy hour is also a bit limited...but if you're fine with Lime Flavored Bud, then you're good to go.

Cool atmosphere. Its Mos Def a place to see and be seen.  Its tough to get a seat, try to squish on the couches in back...those are usually a good last resort.
author: Gladys D.

description:
Nick, if you're listening...baby, I want to tell you how great this relationship is for me.  You're everything I ever wanted in a boyfriend.  Convenient, reliable, you make a decent margarita, you let me hang out with my girlfriends, and you make a mean taco.  Even my dad likes you!

Some advice to all the other sluts out there on Yelp...stay away from my friggin tortilla soup.  It's MINE!
author: Jill H.

description:
This place gets ridiculously packed on Tuesday nights but after a long day of work and school, I'm kinda just craving tacos. However, fish unfortunately isn't discounted, and getting them Nick's way is pretty over-priced. Delicious, nonetheless

Their drinks, on the other hand, are pitiful. Not sure if it's just that single bartender that makes them that way week after week, but you could barely taste any alcohol in them. What gives?
author: Kirstie R.

description:
Wow, I'm surprised by the high rating of this place.  

I ordered the beef taco and my husband ordered the beef burrito.  Basically, our food tasted exactly the same way, drenched in beans.  He just had more to eat than I.

I must say though that I was really envious of all the people eating the fried fish tacos and burritos.  Those looked hella good.  So until I can get my hands on those fish tacos, I'll have to stick with the 3 stars.
author: Maricar M.

description: This place is amazing! the tacos especially the pescado taco nicks way is the best taco i have ever had. I love coming to Nicks!
author: Swati K.

description:
I have traveled the world in the search of the perfect Fish Taco... well my search is over. This hole in the wall, tacoria inside a dingy bar/night club may just have the best fish tacos this side of Baja itself. 

Heres a few hints for the perfect Taco experence:

1. Bring cash - this is a cash only joint and the ATM outside has a rediculous surcharge of like $3

2. Dont drive - the parking in this area of town is downright sinful, though you can park in the Walgreens lot across the street for more then you would actually pay for your tacos

3. Go on Tuesday.... but go with some time to spare. Taco Tuesday has some great discounts... but everyone who loves this place knows about it as well and the line is often out the door. Send a scout for a free table.

4. Order your taco "nicks way" - the guac and cheese rock

5. Order your drinks from the bar/nightclub, not the taco stand. Prices are better

Enjoy!
author: Aaron W.

description:
The ladies are all up in arms about having it Nick's Way. I suggest you take their word for it.

Also...as if the tacos weren't awesome enough, the decor is hysterical.
author: Adam M.

description:
best griled fish tacos in the area. Nick knows the key to my heart!
Last time I went I had their Elote. What's elote?, you might ask. (was that punctuation correct?)

Elote (at least Nick's version) is a big ear of corn on the cob, slathered in queso fresco and sprinkled with chili pepper. It's the most delicious way of taking something healthy and making it unhealthy I've ever tasted. Great job, Nick's!
author: Melissa C.

description:
I made a long journey to eat here and it was completely worth it.  I've only had one thing off the menu, but it was so delicious that there is no reason to order anything else.  Goddamn, those were the best fish tacos I've ever had.  In fact, they were the ONLY good fish tacos I've ever had.

Usually when one orders fish tacos at a restaurant, one gets some sad lil' pieces of soggy fried cod in a store bought corn tortilla with some shredded cabbage and tomatillo sauce for 15 bucks.  You get your money's worth at Nick's.  The fish tacos are large and flavorful, and the name of the place is no case of false advertising - these tacos are crispy as all get-out.  Fucking fantastic.    

If you're looking for authentic Mexican food, look elsewhere.  This is California fusion type stuff.  Oh, and apparently this place is a club by night which seems really silly.  My friend went there after hours and said that there were more security guards there than patrons.  Silly stuff.

Order two Pescado tacos, and make sure to order them "Nick's Way."  Oh, and beer.  Because you know...beer.
author: Michael H.

description:
I dont know why this place has gotten more and more busy.

Good honkey tacos, a nice change of pace sometimes from the delicious tacos from the trucks of International Blvd.
author: christopher a.

description:
We came here this past weekend and overall I would defiantly return.

About 20 of us met here for a Sunday birthday brunch. The restaurant was nice and open with every football game on a different TV. The breakfast burritos were good, a little large in portion for me but they were very tasty. All in all the crowd was friendly and the best part was that they offered bottomless mimosas! I would like to return to taste more of their menu and of course have another mimosa. ;)
author: Christine S.

description:
Ah gawd I can't stop the bleeding and it rips my heart out to write a negative review about Nick's but I'm sorry you pigfuckers you have fallen from greatness.

Background - Nick's was formally chefed by Nick and was absolutely terrific. Innovative menu items like the tacos Nick's Way, the baja taco with cabbage, and quesadilla's stuffed with goodness and fried to a crisp, cool people worked there, and you got to eat inside Rouge, which just made it funny. Then Nick got into a spat with his partners and left the biz. And it sucks now.

There are now plastic cups by the water cooler instead of glasses. Lame people work there. They try to upsell you on everything. My pork quesadilla, my regular item, was so salty and buttery I could hardly eat it. 

This is one of those situations when the intangibles that made it great floated away, and the tangibles followed in their wake. The food, service, and ambience have all plummeted from their former glory.
author: Dibital N.

description:
I've been to Nick's a few times. Until the last time, I'd eaten nothing but tacos, plus chips and salsa. This last time, I decided to try something different. The menu on the wall, after all, devotes just about as much space to burritos as tacos, so I decided to try my first Nick's burrito. I'm sorry to say that despite my affection for a Nick's taco, this burrito was the worst I have ever had in San Francisco in memory. I do not say this lightly-- this was an effort not quite worthy of the distinguished appellation "burrito." But, it wasn't all Nick's fault ...

My first mistake might have been going for a burrito at a place with "Tacos" in the name, but again, almost half the menu is burritos, so it's fair game. My second mistake was ordering the grilled fish burrito. Fish is tricky to do in a burrito, at best, though some places-- La Corneta, for example-- handle it with ease. It's hard, but not impossible. My favorite version of Nick's tacos are those with grilled and fried fish; for a burrito, I thought the grilled fish was a better choice. My third mistake was assuming that this burrito didn't come with tomatoes-- not salsa, not pico de gallo, just chopped tomatoes, thrown in. I'm not a huge fan of the tomatoes. The menu didn't list them, I didn't expect them, but there they were.

But even with my mistakes, their were problems on Nick's end. Despite my best efforts to squeeze out the accompanying limes, and my vain use of not one, not two, but three types of Nick's salsa, this was one flavor-less burrito. The fish tasted about as plain as possible, leaving cabbage as the dominant flavor. Mmmmm, cabbage burrito! The beans were fine, but in this company, it didn't matter. And yet despite the lack of flavor and salsa in the burrito as-served, it was incredibly wet and drippy. Something in this burrito was leaking a fairly clear, nearly flavorless liquid from the start. My attempts to add taste via the lime and salsas didn't help. My guess is the tomatoes or cabbage had too much water on them when they were put in, hard to say.

In all, this was a bad experience. I'll be back to Nick's Crispy Tacos (note the name is not Nick's Soggy Burritos), but only for the tacos. Making a good burrito, even one with fish, is not something to be taken lightly in this town. I hope they either improve it, or better yet, just take it off the menu. The flavorless fish, the random tomatoes, the dominant cabbage, the drips-- this burrito, sadly, was beyond redemption.

And yet, despite this being such a bad burrito, I'm still giving Nick's 2 stars overall- the tacos and salsas are ~4-star-good. I could even see bumping this up to 3 stars after my next crispy taco, but for now, my faith is shaken.
author: Daniel M.

description:
Man, I wish I was eating a Nick's crispy taco right now.  They are so freaking good.  If I were at Nick's right now, I would order myself one chicken, one steak, and one carnitas taco, all nick's way.  Nick's way is the best; this means they put avocado and cheese and a whole bunch of other good things.  These are freaking fat tacos.  Last time I had 3 nick's tacos in a row, I didn't eat for a day, I was so stuffed.  Man, these are great tacos.

As a side note, the decor of this place is awesome too.  I have only been here during the day, but I hear at night, they turn half the place into a night club; freaking awesome!
author: kim l.

description:
To sum it up in one witty line:

"its a party in my mouth and everyone came!"

The nachos are where its at! its a huge mountain of food for under $10
if you and a friend is straped for cash then the nachos are what you want! very shareable unless you can eat like half your weight in mexican good-ness
author: Nate C.

description:
Large tasty tacos. Limited seating. This is NOT your traditional taco if that's what you're expecting. It's basically a well prepared Ameri-Taco.

I walked in and check out the space. Then I said to myself, "Hey...this place looks a lot like Rouge....*gasp*! wait.... this IS Rouge!!!"
author: benjamin c.

description:
Two levels above Baja Fresh's baja fish tacos.
Half a level below Wahoo's in South Bay and So Cal.
Not even close to baja fish tacos in Baja. Oh how I miss Baja being just an hour drive................ :(

The fish its self is light and flavorful whitefish with an excellent crispy batter.

However the down fall is the excessive amount of lime mayo that is put on these.
author: Sara K.

description:
I don't really need to say much, The crowd speaks for itself. The taco's were de-licous and cheap. Long line tells you how popular these things are. For 2 corona's it cost 5 bucks + 1/2 tip, which is a steal. Tons of hotties and good music for the ladies (classic 90's). I'll be here again.

YUM!
author: David C.

description:
Lured in here by a sign board that stated there was a $2 drink happy hour, the bargin hunter in me could not resist just a quick peek inside. I was expecting a greasy little hole in the wall taco stand.  I was instantly taken back by just how cavernous it is inside.  The interior is warm and festive in a shabby chic way.  It's like a dance club mated with an "Old Spaghetti Factory", I love that kinda thing though.

The crispy tacos with chicken were tasty and so were the $2 cocktail selection.  They had four drinks to choose from at that price and I had of of each. A cosmo, kamakasi, margarita, and a martini.  I left full and happy on the cheap.  I want to bring back my cousin and his crazy girlfriend next time.
author: Izzy Z.

description:
This place has pretty amazing tacos. I don't know if they're the most authentic, but when I'm hungry I care less about how "genuine" food is and much more about how it tastes. Make sure you order "Nick's Way", which will get you a nice dallop of guacamole and an extra crispy shell to go along with the soft one. Also, as a guy that always goes for steak or chicken in about 99% of restaurant situations, I have to say the fish tacos are the best thing you can get here. All of the ingredients and components here are super fresh - even the chips and salsa is a must have for the awesome big tomato chunks and cilantro flakes. Finally, I'd recommend topping anything and everything with the green salsa. Not the spiciest salsa, but incredibly addicting and a nice little acidity to cut through the richness of the food. Oh, as for the other stuff: the burritos are solid but not amazing; the salads are huge and filling and are my second choice if I'm not feeling tacos; and the quesadillas are just okay.  

The food, as far as taco/Mexican joints go, is probably a solid 8.5/10. I knock this place a star because the night club during the day thing can be kind of smelly/weird depending on the time. Also, $5+ a taco isn't too egregious for the neighborhood, but is certainly not the best value when compared to some places in the Mission.
author: John K.

description:
I liked these a lot. I had a Pollo Nick's Way and a Grilled Fish regular. Both were good. The Chicken Nick's Way was kind of but not super crispy. Also, the salsa verse they have at the tables was excellent.

It's set in what looks like an old night club. Everything is red and there are a bunch of fuzzy red booths in which to sit. It's very cozy. There's also a bar with a bartender and a few TVs showing sports. I didn't get a drink or sit near the bar so I can't say much about it.
author: Raj T.

description: Awesome tasting food. I just try not to think about the atmosphere because I kind of hate it. PITA to get over here from my neighborhood, too. The food is so good though that it's still 5 stars.
author: aaron f.

description: Loove the horchata, not too grainy! My favorite is the burrito de camarones! Definitely should check it out.
author: Austin B.

description:
Stick to the basics:

DO: Get the taco, nicks way, chips w/ salsa and guac., and a margarita with salt. 
DON'T: Be lured by the much cheaper and much much grosser margarita's at rouge, 40 steps away.
DO: Give props to the great new manager (well relatively - its been a few months).
DON'T: Get there after 8:19 pm

Follow these simple rules and enjoy!!
author: Arundel M.

description:
I am most absolutely definitely seriously for reals going back here!  The tacos were excellent and true to the name crispy.  The atmosphere is amusing (the restaurant attached to the nightclub part).

I thought the location was kind of random, but I enjoyed finding a place so close by.  

Best part:  I saw one of my favorite TV show's celebrities there, waiting in line and enjoying their crispy tacos with their family just like the rest of us.  Great experience.
author: Chris L.

description:
First I just want to say that the earlier reviewer, who said these taco's are better than any in the mission, may not be thinking clearly.  Sure, these are damn good tasty tacos but we are talking different styles altogether.  Nick's are more of a Russian Hilelite I want to appear semi healthy sort of taco, made with all great fresh ingredients and pretty damn tasty.  However, when you want a good mission taco, nothing is going to stand up to one... not even Nick's.  

With that being said, let's move on and talk about their tortilla soup which I think hasn't gotten nearly enough coverage on the reviews.  Let me describe it for you.... tender white chicken floating in a grease less broth (big plus) and chocked full of tender diced carrots, onions, tomatoes, lots of Nick's fresh tortilla strips and finished off with a hand full of chopped avocado, a lime and cilantro.  This soup is absolutely delicious and consistent.  I would suggest that you get an extra side of chips and keep adding them to the soup as you go.  It makes for one great meal and with the recent rainy days, it sure warms your tummy.   I look forward to the rainy days just to have a bowl.  Definitely a 4 star bowl of soup in my book.  

Another reviewer mentioned that they were going to bring their own habanero sauce next time.  As a side note, they only have the medium and green salsa on the tables, however, they have the fire behind the counter.  Just ask, they are more than happy to share it with you.  

The last thing I would like to mention about Nick's is the margarita scene here.  If you want a cheap margarita don't order at the taco counter.  Instead, walk over to the bar and get your 2 dollar margarita.  However, just remember, you are getting a 2 dollar margarita.  So when they pour that fake sweet and sour shit in it, don't whine.   If on the other hand you want a heavy pour margarita made with fresh lime juice, you must order it at the taco counter.  The cost is a little higher than the bar and worth it.  They use Hornitas instead of the cheap shit the bar uses.  (Rouge has the crappiest booze selection I have ever seen).  

Since the lines at the taco counter can get long and you think you might want two margaritas, order them both when you place your taco (or soup) order.  After having a decent margarita, you sure don't want the second one to be from the shitty bar.

I quit drinking -  but damn -  just typing this review sure makes my mouth water.  So do me a favor and next time you go to Nick's try the margarita at the taco counter and have one (preferably two,three) for me.  :p  

Try the soup!!!! too.  :)
author: Kathleen K.

description:
Have been in this fine city for over 8 years, and throughout most of my tenure here, I was told about this odd little taco joint crammed in the corner of Rouge -- you know, the place we all accidentally went to at least once when we were 22 and didn't know any better.  

Finally ended up at Nicks - just like I once ended-up at Rouge - and was disappointed, especially after all the hype.  To echo another Yelp reviewer, what was I to expect from a taco place...in Russian Hill?  

Well, I ordered two signature Nick "crispy" tacos; one fish and one chicken.  Trying to eat both led me to think of what cold rubber might taste like.  I went here on a slow Sunday night, and the place wasn't terribly crowded, so I'm lost on why the tacos tasted so crummy.  

Note to self: don't trust any "Mexican" (Alta California) food north of Bush Street.

((sigh!))
author: A.D. A.

description:
Unfortunately, when you're treated with rudeness, I have to bring my Yelp review down a notch.

My boyfriend and I went out to Nick's for drinks with friends one evening. He left his favorite hat in the booth we'd been sitting in. It was a brown budweiser hat (from the brewery), with a leather front, and stained with sweat. Not something I would imagine someone else would steal, but if you know of its whereabouts, please let me know!

Anyways, when he realized he'd left it, he called Nick's and received a rude response about lost items. The guy on the phone wouldn't take a look around for it; he just said that stuff got stolen all the time there, like cell phones. My boyfriend said this wasn't something he thought would get stolen, would they please check? But they wouldn't, so he went over there in person to look, and received anger and more rudeness from the staff about it.

This has nothing to do with their food, drinks, or ambiance, but rude and angry people definitely turn me off to a place.

RIP Budweiser Brewery hat
author: Sonya Y.

description: Yummy!  I have heard about Nick's but have been too lazy to try and go to Russian Hill.  I finally bit the bullet on a Monday night and went.  Ordered tacos Nick's way which is SO DARN GOOD.  And to my utter surprise...it was open mike night.  It was amateur stand up comedians that came up one by one and were given time limits which were enforced and it was a great Monday night for us!  I have been back several times.  YUM!
author: Deal G.

description: Loved loved loved the Pescado (fish taco) -- yummy yummy for my tummy and cheered me up on a not-so-good day for me.  I am definitely going to check out their happy hour soon -- a margarita sounds good right about now actually!
author: Maile N.

description: I'm sad that your nachos were better than your namesake.  The meat in the carne asada taco was a little tough and pretty bland.  Maybe it was an off-day, or maybe I should've ordered the fish or prawn tacos, but I was unimpressed with my first visit there.  At least the service was fast and the people watching was entertaining.
author: Jenn C.

description:
Three and a half stars. Love the booths, love the booze, the food and salsas are very good but pricey, the chips are fresh, and the guac is the bomb (and I don't even like guac). Not nearly as good as "La Taqueria" in the Mission though.

The fish tacos are the way to go here.
author: Adam Z.

description:
Had a solid carne asada burrito here for lunch with all the fixins (guac, sour cream, salsa). They held the rice per my request, and it was pretty solid in size, think nurf football. 

The steak was grilled and I could tell it was cooked to order because it took about 15 mins to come out from the kitchen and it was steamy, sharred, and juicy, not dried out beef. I sat at the bar and had a Negra while I waited. They don't have waiter service lunch, you wait in line, are given a # on a silver thing-a-ma-jig, and seat yourself. 

I'd come back and try the namesake next time I'm back in the bay.
author: John L.

description: Very overrated. Fish Tacos Nick's Way are excellent and are absolutely worth getting. Otherwise the rest of the menu is okay at best. Come early on a Taco Tuesday grab a couple beers and grab some tacos before things get busy. The tacos are on the large side so 2-3 is typically enough.
author: Dave C.

description:
I gotta say I'm a fan of a good burrito. The burrito craving comes on like caffeine withdrawal, and suddenly I need a tortilla filled with steak, beans, rice, pico de gallo, cheese, guac and sour cream, stat!

I was heading back to Mike L's apt with some vids and it suddenly hit me that I needed a fucking burrito. Not just a burrito. A fucking burrito.

I walked down Polk, figuring it was like Sears -- there's more for your life on Polk, seriously. Great strip over there in Nobb Hill/Russian Hill area. I stumble across Nick's Crispy Tacos and I figure they probably got a fix for my craving.

I head in and I'm struck with two things: 1) whoah this place is RED! and 2) it's BIG with BIG chandeliers... like it's a night club or something. Am I in the right place? Sure enough there's a line of people ordering their food. I get in line, grab a menu and wind up with a Carne Asada "Todo" burrito (with all the fixings including sour cream, guacamole, etc) and a Chicken burrito with only guacamole added on for my bro.

It takes a few minutes, so I sit at the bar and rap with the girl with the rad shoes next to me ("I got them at Payless!" Nice find.) I get my burritos and opt for the optional Green and Red sauce in separate containers. DEFINITELY GET THE SAUCE!!!!!

I head back home and we break into our burritos. I start dribbling green sauce on mine, Mike is dribbling red sauce on his. HOLY CRAP. First off, the burritos are good, the fixings are fresh and the meat is tasty. Second, the sauces are REALLY good, they add some good flavor that makes the burrito that much better.
author: Will L.

description: Taco Tuesdays! SOOO good. You have to get here early though (before 6pm) in order to even be able to get some of those delicious tacos!
author: Georgina G.

description: I worked across the street from here for three years and was always happy with the crispy tacos.  The only reason this isn't five stars is that one time the hexnut from the salsa dispenser ended up in my food.  I found it by biting full force into it.  They offered me a $20 coupon for my troubles.  I went back for more tacos and thankfully they didn't have metal in them.
author: Chris D.

description:
Ok, who am I kidding? It was only a matter of time before I would admit that I love these glorified TB double decker tacos. I was trying to fight my craving for that whipped creme guac, but I'm really not strong enough. 'Ritas are obviously the biggest perk (seriously, where can I get a margarita + fajitas in the TL? HELP), but the sickest part of all is that I'm starting to crave those little crispy fuckers. 

How many do you people eat in one sitting? My bf and I each got two to play it safe (really we're just kinda poor), but I felt like I could have taken on maybe one more?
author: Brittany L.

description:
What is it about these damn tacos?  Yes, I agree that they're not the best tacos in the universe, and are undeniably a cracker's idea of a taco.  And yet...they are so highly addicting and fill some deep dark need in my soul that calls for crispy tacos.  The chips and salsa are also pretty bueno, the salsa being fresh and non-soupy.  The few times I've had a margarita there it was rather strong (to the point of my bf boycotting it), but I've also seen an elderly woman down one after another, which made us both feel a little less manly.

In any case, try the crispy tacos at least once - you won't gain any street cred, but you may find yourself an addict.
author: Tanya N.

description:
Anything Nick's way is amazing. My bestie and I will walk all the way to Nick's just so we can justify ordering fish tacos, the corn on a stick, and lots of chips and guacamole! 

Amazingness! 

Plus, enjoying tacos while sitting amongst all the crystal chandeliers from Rouge makes a girl feel pretty important!

**cash only
author: Marta C.

description: Great tacos! Had the carnitas taco nick's way. Yum!
author: Ines C.

description:
Yeah, Nick's just ain't Nick's anymore since Nick flew the coop. Back in the day when he did run the show he ran a pretty tight ship and it was tasty-orama. I told everyone I knew about it and used to go on a regular basis. But now he is gone and its gotten a bit slack.  The bloom is off the rose as they say.

It's still a good option in the hood for cheap tacos and not-so-cheap but good margaritas. When in season be sure to get the Mexican style grilled corn. That's a tastebud pleaser. I do miss the days though of the food being perfect and Nick yelling at someone in the kitchen or sometimes even in the restaurant....memories.
author: wendella a.

description:
Quick and Simple:
These are the best tacos I've ever had -- do yourself a favor and order them "Nick's Way".
author: Edward Y.

description:
Coming from San Diego, it is really hard for me to find any good Mexican food in SF. Luckily, Nick's is right down the street from my house.  Although Nick's isn't "traditional Mexican" their carnitas quesadilla is one of my most favorite things ever. If you get there on a night with Happy Hour you can sit in Rouge and have $3 drinks.

I only wish they would open earlier make breakfast burritos, but then again maybe not because I would probably start pushing 5 hundo.
author: Katie M.

description:
One of the only two meals on Polk that don't disappoint me (the other being Tai Chi).  I crave Nick's ... not just on a hungover Sunday afternoon (though especially so) but I pretty much need my fix on a weekly basis.

You need to know what to order - much of the menu is mediocre.  Order the pescado tacos (not the grilled but the fried ones) and the carne asada quesadilla.  Both are off the charts.  Try a taco Nick's way every once in awhile but realize that two is probably more than enough.  Order chips and salsa every once in awhile but realize you will surely spoil the rest of your meal.  They also have great agua fresca.

They can be inconsistent, and they are surely overpriced.  But, I still need my weekly fix!!
author: Jenny S.

description:
After going for a run in Crissy Field, we felt that we deserve a taco and thought abt trying out Nick's. We saw the sign that they were only offering take out service so we didn't get to sit on the velour couch under the chandelier. :(

We ordered the pollo asado minus "Nick's way" and it turned out just ok. It contained whole beans instead of the refried beans version that I was used to, not so moist and pollo isn't quite the same as beef or carne. I would have love to try the fish tacos so will be back the next time. For now, it has room for improvements to increase the star rating upon my next visit. And also getting Nick's Way.....
Hasta La Vista! I'll be back.....
author: Yan M.

description:
I love this place! Serve me up a Camarones taco Nick's way.  Their fish tacos are great as well -- with a choice of fried or grilled.  If you are a meat eater, the Carne Asada is quite good, too.  The guacamole here is awesome.  I could down a whole basket of chips and guac.  Also, try the watermelon agua fresca to help wash down those tacos.  Sweet and refreshing!

The atmosphere is a little weird since it shares a space with the club Rouge.  But, that doesn't really distract me from the food.  They always have an interesting selection of music -- have you heard the reggae version of Dark Side of the Moon?

The prices are a little high, but we are in Russian Hill and not at a Mission taqueria.  So, set your expectations appropriately.
author: Katie M.

description:
I LOVE!!! I LOVE!!! I LOVE!!! 
Ok, let's get real here. We are talking tacos, chips/salsa, horchata at the bar. C'mon now. If you are coming here for lunch then you obviously have to be in the mood for mexican food and let me tell you....Order it NICKS WAY!!!! Holy smokes, it's just perfect. 
You have to remember, this is a casual place (before it turns into a crazy nightclub at 10ish) If you are out strolling down Polk St on a warm summer day, it's the perfect place to drop in for lunch. (Hey, that sounds like a song) LOL
I give this place 5 stars because it is exactly what it tells you it is. Nicks crispy tacos-have it  his way and you get the soft shell as well... Yummmmmmm! 
Guacamole and the sauces on the table. Hey, it's cheap, it's good, it's fast, it will fill you up and make you a happier person. :)
author: Audrey S.

description:
Funky atmosphere is 100% casual, which is good because when I find myself at Nick's I'm usually hungover and wearing sweats. 

I would probably get it to go if it wouldn't compromise the crispiness of the taco shell and there was an awesome park across the street where I could leisurely enjoy my tacos while lounging on the grass. Ahhh... wouldn't that be nice?

Anyways, my favorite thing here is the fish taco "Nick's way" which means it has a crispy taco shell AND a soft taco shell AND they add guacamole. Mmmm.... yummy.
author: Aimée G.

description: Love the pescado taco nick's way --- it's the besttttt. The fish is perfectly fried and they are generous with the guacamole. Fun environment -- they play great music and they have tvs to watch sports.
author: Shivani S.

description:
one word...pescado taco....make that two. that's right. i'll have 2 pescado taco with everything on it. 

each taco is about $5 and it's huge. have one and you're set for lunch. fish batter was light & crispy while one of the 2 tortillas was deep fried making the taco super crispy. not to mention fresh crispy lettuce. CRUNCH CRUNCH CRUNCH. yummy!

this place is CASH ONLY!
author: Cindi N.

description:
Don't get me wrong. The fish in the taco was crispy and I love the fact that they put lots and lots of guacamole on the taco but the taco shell itself was not crispy. When I heard Crispy Tacos, I was thinking deep fried tacos! Haha ... maybe I was confused or ordered the wrong thing. Tell me if that's the case and I'll change that rating. 

If you've been to LA to eat that Tito's tacos, that's what I mean by crispy tacos. This is why I think I've experienced better. But nevertheless, the fish tacos and the nachos were awesome!!

If I had any complaints, it would be because the place is sort of tacky: red velvet chairs, chandeliers and in general has this weird mood for a taco place. I think it's because it is inside Rouge (a club I guess) or maybe cos I went at night.

But other than that, great tacos! Probably shouldn't be in the 100 restaurants to try before you die, but nevertheless, good food.
author: Brian P.

description:
You know...I've been a fan of Nicks for over a year now, but it's really hard to be a fan of a place that you never can count on if they are open or not!  

7:30pm - Wednesday, Oct. 1st - WTF???  I was sitting with my bf across the street at Kelly's watching the Red Sox (kick some ass) and got the craving for a burrito!  Begged him to run over there really quick and get me one.  He said no at first as he can't stand the fact that the place is confused and has that lame ass nasty ghettoish club attached to it and is just not a place for a good quality Mexican restaurant to be located.  I agreed, but still begged him to go over there for me.  He went and guess what???  It was fucking closed!  Really?  Are you kidding me??  The last few times I've been over there, they have been closed.  

Sorry Nick's (but not Nick as he no longer looks over that place), but you guys suck major ass!
author: Ayrn H.

description:
I miss living in San Diego for various, and obvious reasons - the sun, the warm beach, and of course, the baja-style fish tacos. Go to South Beach in Ocean Beach and you'll know what I'm talking about. 

Fortunately, Nick's Crispy tacos is the one place in SF that comes close to serving as delicious surf tacos like the ones in SD. Not really mexican, and definitely not healthy, but full of flavor goodness. One giant pescado taco, Nick's way - with cheese and guac - plus a margarita next door at Rogue is the best dinner under $10 (especially on Tuesdays, when the tacos are $2 or Wednesday nights when the margaritas are $3.)
author: Kelly R.

description:
5 stars for the fish taco! 1 star is taken away from the decor at Rouge...
It's never a good idea to walk into a club when the lights are on - the couches are covered with dusts, the paint is chipping off, the mirrors on the wall are just really messed up. 

However, the baja style fish taco is really that good! I had it nick's style and it was just PERFECT!!! It has all the texture: crispiness from the taco, crunchy from the cabbage, the perfect deep-fried fish (crispy outside and soft and fresh inside), with the yummy guacamole & cheese... I just love it! 

The tacos are huge. I was full after eating a couple. But I also tried the vegetarian and beef taco and they were really good! I haven't had a chance to have the burrito yet...maybe next time...(but I feel like I can have the baja fish taco every single day for the rest of my life. lol!)

I think it's better to sit at the tables set up on the dance floor than the VIP booth...The dirt/dust/mysterious black stuff on the couches is a bit disgusting. I guess I won't sit on the VIP booth again if I'm ever in that club...ha!
author: Michelle L.

description:
I've seen this place after moving back into san francisco and didn't think much of it until I was hungry during a shopping excursion.  I love their baja style fish tacos.   It is divine.  Who knew?  You know, after all my years of thinking mexican food wasn't all that great, this is the second place (the other one being in NYC)  that's made me quite happy.  And yes I've eaten the burritos and many other items in the Mission.  I may be having a change of tune regarding mexican food.   

I also like the kitsy  gaudy set-up of the place and don't even mind that it's in the part of Rouge/formerly red devil lounge.  They also have mexican coke - it contains real sugar instead of the high fructose corn syrup the US cokes contain.  It costs much more than the regular cokes, but it's nice to have that option.  

The lines can sometimes be long and they have been forgetful before with bringing my entire order, but i was so happy with the delicious fish tacos, I didn't mind waving them down and waiting for the other items to arrive later.  

Just be aware, the pescado fish burrito is not as good as the pescado fish tacos.  Once turned burrito style, the batter around the fish gets a bit mushy.  Me, I just stick with the tacos.  

I also prefer this place to all the taquerias in the Mission.
author: Animal K.

description:
Could i get some fresh avocado slices on my fish taco??? YES YOU CAN that's how the tacos roll at this trippy little gem of a spot.
When you walk in you may be hit by deja vu .... but that's just because you are actually standing inside of Rouge....
There are so many reviews ... I'll keep it short...
Crunchy,fresh,tasty,moist,saucy,inexpensive,not-greasy-YUM!
author: Jeremy R.

description: Six of us had dinner at Nick's this past Wednesday and it was fabulous.  Great food, great margaritas, lots of fun people, happy place to eat. Will definitely come back.
author: Stephanie M.

description: Great food and fantastic happy hour (all day basically) with outstanding alcohol prices. Bar ownership and restaurant are separate, so (1) you have to wait in a separate line to order and (2) prices for the same beer are different depending on if you order it at the food stand or at the main bar. That's odd. Order all alcohol and drinks from the bar. Service is nice at both restaurant and bar. Great place to watch a game...lots of large TVs, including sports packages and a cooperative bar staff who will put on a game you want to see.
author: BayArea A.

description:
Food/Quality: Both the carne asada burrito and the chorizo burrito with eggs and spinach were delicious. I found both items to have the right amount of spiciness. The chorizo item had a lot of flavor, was very moist.

Atmosphere: It is unique that Nick's Tacos is located within a nightclub decorated 70's style with disco balls and chandeliers. There was a steady stream of customers ordering food while I was enjoying my food in a red velvety booth.

Service: Everyone who worked there that I encountered was pleasant to deal with. 

Value: The total for two people for burritos for a quick lunch was inexpensive.

Overall this was a unique place to wander into for a quick bite to eat in a neighborhood I don't know too well. I will definitely return.
author: Cynthia D.

description: My favorite tacos in SF - and the Red (salsa-like) Sauce they have on the tables... YUM.
author: Alison M.

description:
Nick's is such a gem for this neighborhood. Seriously - it doesn't get better than their fish taco, a margarita, the BEST chips and guac in town and red velvet seating to top it off. 

The theme is super chillax and you can get a damn good meal for less than $10. The carnitas are great too. 

Eat it up Russian Hill.
