I wish they served later. I hate settling for NY pizza.
author: Erin M.

description:
are you still really deciding whether to go or not? 

http://www.yelp.com/biz_photos/ziVej4oW2JpUConTE_Y_mg?select=ZHf_XryF68E7rtNxmkQcGg

pescado is the way to go. nick's style!
author: Alex C.

description:
Once  upon a time there was a man named Nick who wanted to share the gift of Crispy Tacos with the people of San Francisco-- and by proxy, the world.  Nick and co-partner Howard had a dispute and somehow Howard won Nick's Crispy Tacos away from Nick.  Let's face it, Howard's Crispy Tacos sounds more like a dive strip club than a fresh taco joint, so Howard screwed Nick, Nick bounced and now we're left with Howard serving Nick's Crispy Tacos.

All that history aside, Nick's Crispy Tacos are amazing.  Being from Los Angeles, I am a fan of fantastic tacos a la Titos.  Nick's recipe is essentially to take a Tito's-esque taco and fry that pig.

Goodness.

The result is certainly neither low-carb nor healthy however it is the tastiest taco I have had since leaving Los Angeles-- aka 'The Cradle Of The Taco'.

The ambiance of Nick's is quite strange as it's a taco counter, a bar and a velvet lounge.  There are no 'regulars' at this place, however it is one of the only places in the world I have been to where in a single night, you can pound a crispy taco, kick back with some Courvoisier and see some fool from Santa Rosa make bad jokes... yet somehow everyone laughs.  Probably because they're all elated with the decadent wonder that is The Crispy Taco.

Four stars baby four stars.

It would have been five but seriously what kind of taco place closes at 9pm?  F-that.
author: John R.

description:
I had heard of this place here and there throughout my time here in SF but I unfortunately had not the pleasure before last week to dine at NCT.  I was pretty excited to stumble upon it on a random afternoon stroll.  I was again excited to learn they had fish tacos as I am always in search of a good fish taco and my closest taqueria doesn't cut the salsa verde in this realm.

Anyway so the fish tacos were good, the tacos of course were crispy and plentiful and the service was quick and friendly.  I intend to return to sample more of their menu on a regular basis to get more fish tacos.
author: Derek D.

description:
Taco Tuesdays are my friend. $2 tacos - and some margaritas, cannot be beat.

The texture is interesting. I can see how you might not like the tortilla part, it does taste a bit like cardboard but for some reason, that does it for me. The inside is yummy and they have super fresh (looking at least) guacamole on top for an extra buck (to make it Nick's Way). 

It is a good place if you don't feel like cooking or spending a ton of money.
author: Jess K.

description:
It's a good place to have ur time crunching lunch.
But for some reason, as in that song " It dont impress me that much".
Delicious yet messy tacos. Decent home-made guacomole, but greezy chips.
Prices are affordable, staff is pseudo-friendly.
author: Cat of a Donut J.

description: You've already read it here, but the tacos are good, the crowd is fun, and it has plenty of TVs around to catch the game.  I actually avoid Taco Tuesday at all cost because it's a total sh*t show of people.  Any other night it's a great place to catch a cheap meal, have a beer, and visit with friends.
author: Kevin D.

description: Great service. Food is good as well. Good price. And the vibe is laidback. I recommend the quesadillas.
author: Paul S.

description: As a vegetarian, I appreciate the vegetarian taco option.  They are so good with sour cream, although I feel guilty for not being vegan.  Also, the horchata is so good.  I highly recommend it!
author: Amy M.

description:
I had the FISHIEST fish taco here. Seriously.  Fishier than your moms hooha.

I guess I could go back and try other non-fish tacos but I think I might automatically gag when I walk in, in rememberance of my first visit.
author: b s.

description: Pretty awesome. Their grilled fish tacos server Nick's way (with guac, fried) are damn good. Their quessadillas are incredible - try the carnitas.
author: Shawn W.

description:
Such a great local spot. I always get 1 taco and chips and guacamole and it's easily enough to fill me up and share my chips. I love the guac & chips because it comes with a layer of salsa as well. I've had chicken, Carnitas and baja fish tacos and all are delicious and sizable. 

It gets really crowded and it's often hard to find a table, if you find one at all, but I still go back. On Tuesday's most of their taco's are $2, as well as $2 beers - and without a doubt you will find a line out the door. 

It's a quick, easy, delicious meal. It's cash only but there is an ATM right outside.
author: Michelle L.

description: The black bean taco salad is awesome and they have great TVs for the games. I do love an occasional breakfast burrito from here as well although they don't open until 10:30am :(. If you are ever hear in the evenings be sure to look for the "transition"! Taco shop by day, full club by night!
author: Amanda H.

description:
Try this place on a tuesday, special prices.
The taco;s are tasty, I was told to have them "nicks way".  I guess nicks way is extra guacomole. It was very good. The place could use some slight "odor "adjustment but the food was good. It doubles as a club/bar some nights so I recomend going tuesday and getting the best price, and I don't know if the open club means Nicks closes but I asume it would.
author: Andrew W.

description:
If only yelp would let you give half stars, this place would get a 3.5 stars from me.

Tacos/Beer = 4 stars
Atmosphere/Margarita = 3 stars

The food is great, that's where the 4 stars comes in.  I came here for Taco Tuesdays, and boy, were those tacos good.  Each taco is piled with meat, beans and is pretty much a mess when you try to shove the food in your mouth.  Whatevers, having food all over your face is a small price to pay.

The place and atmosphere, was not so great.  Because of their $2 taco deal, the whole place is beyond packed.  If you're planning to come here to eat, drink and hang out, you'll probably need someone to camp out for a spot 30 minutes before you even order your food.  Most folks are literally standing against the bar, chowing down on their tacos.  So be prepared.

And you're in the mood to drink, I recommend skipping the 2 for $5 margaritas and head straight for the $10 pitcher of beer.  The margaritas come in the small cups bars use for cocktails, and it's filled with the mix.  There's pretty much no alcohol in it.  The $10 pitcher though, totally worth it!
author: Maggie L.

description: Best mexican food in SF! Its a Mexican restaurant and a sports bar.  Food is delicious, lots of alcoholic beverages available.  Great atmosphere!
author: Grant T.

description: So yeah, best baja style fish tacos in the bay area... but do they ever play anything other than reggae or bro-rock? I realize we're close to the marina, but can we mix it up a bit?
author: J. W.

description:
The first time I went to Nick's was lunch time on a weekday so the decor did strike me as odd.  The second time it was the same building but instead of Nick's Crispy Tacos it was a club called Rouge.  It all made sense.

Let me tell you, I think it is a much better taqueria than a club.  I love a carne asada taco Nick's way.  And the excellent pricing on Taco Tuesday is really just an excuse for me to eat more of them (and drink cheap beer of course).
author: Maura B.

description: Tacos are delicious... one remarkably rude staff... yummy margarita pitchers... hard to get a table. This place has it's ups and downs.  So it's getting an a-ok rating from me.
author: Lainey D.

description: The best fish tacos I have ever had. Order them Nick's way with elote and some guacamole with fresh chips. I came here at least a dozen times never with more than a month in between visits. Try to stop in if you are ever in SF!
author: Chase R.

description:
It's so ridiculous that it's taken my fiance years to try this place.  Admittedly, admosphere is definitely lacking...  It's Rouge nightclub, and there happens to be a bar at which you can order tacos...  But the food is so good.  YUM!  

I''ve ordere the carnitas tacos "Nick's Way" and loved them, but my fiance is convinced that the pollo tacos are way better.  Either way, the guac is smooth and creamy and I love how fresh everything is!  (I heard that NIck's has actually been on KQED's food show and has scored really well - they said that everything is organic).  

I've tried the tostada just to see how it is (it always looked so good when everyone else go it) but I defintely regretted it as I watched my fiance eat the tacos...  The tortilla soup is OK (too many chunks in it for me; I appreciate the fresh avocado and all, but I want a soup, not a mexican stew) and I haven't tried a burrito yet.

If this is your first try at Nick's - I definitely recommend trying the tacos "Nick's Way".  They are absolutely the best, freshest, tastiest tacos I've ever had!  So goood!!!!
author: Stephanie P.

description:
Nick's... how I love thee. It's 2012 and I am the 2012th review!

Shrimp and carne asada tacos, Nick's way, ALL THE WAY!

And the corn is pretty tasty too. Still prefer Cafe Habana in NYC, but this is an excellent fix for it!
author: Jasen E.

description:
There are so many reviews is seems sort of redundant to write one BUT:
I'm from San Diego and kind of a Mexican food snob. I cant figure out why it is so hard to find a good taco shop here. I am always getting rice burritos with grissly chicken EW.
Then in steps Nicks. It is very far from home- but I manage to get there once or twice a month. I have found the food to be consistently good. The staff always seems a bit overwhelmed but they have never been rude, and the food gets to me while its still hot. The fish tacos Nicks way are my fave. I kinda like eating my cheep food under chandeliers. It has always been worth the trek!!
author: Melissa B.

description: although the name of the restaurant highlights "crispy tacos," my fiance and i love burritos more. fiance asked the waitress if that was ok, and she assured him that the burritos are also amazing - she was right!  the two of us shared the carne asada burrito and the fish burrito. this definitely isn't your typical grease-laden, fast food mexican. these burritos were crammed with fresh, flavorful ingredients. i loved all the textures in the fish burrito best - crispy battered fish, crunchy cabbage, creamy mayo, soft tortilla wrap. YUM!
author: Tiffany L.

description:
Nick's Crispy Tacos looks like Elton John had too much red felt carpeting and leather so he opened a taco bar with red booths, red felt carpeted walls, crystal chandeliers and some awesome tacos.  We were told at Nicks' you have to have the Grilled Fish Tacos.  We ordered a bunch of those, a Shrimp Taco and a pitcher of beer.  Nick's puts a nice big piece of fish in the taco, which is what seems to keep bringing everyone back.  What I loved about Nick's is their three salsas.  They have a verde, a red and habanero.  The verde and the red taste great and are medium spiciness.  The Habanero is a tearjerker.  It's really tasty but it's fuckin' hot.  I was ballin' by the end of the meal.  If you mix the three of them together and splash a lime wedge or two into the taco you get the tastiest result.  I'd go back to Nick's for tacos, the salsas and also because when we ordered a second pitcher of Blue Moon and five hard liquor cocktails for our friends it only cost $27.  You can't drink for that in LA. 

-LAFoodGod
author: John S.

description: So when you go inside, go straight to your right to order. You will order and then find an open table/seat. There is a water station at the very back and a full bar on the other side. After you sit, you will enjoy incredible tacos/burritos/etc. I personally recommend Nick's famous tacos (crispy taco shell, cheese, guac, meat, yum.
author: Tif L.

description:
I have been here before, but after last night's experience I felt compelled to Yelp this place.  Here's why:

I met up with my (cough*championship*cough) kickball team to talk about how awesome we all are and how much ass we kick on and off the field.  The place was pretty full but we still were able to score some prime seating right in front of the tv so our die hard Sox fan teammate could watch his team dominate the Indians.

Nothing extraordinary happened, but nothing horrible happened either.  The $2 margs were legit, the quesdilla I ordered (as well as everyone else's food) came out really quickly, AND the guy included a lot of sour cream with my 'dilla.  BUENO.

The reason I was compelled to Yelp Nick's today, was because it is a consistently fun place to get tipsy off margs and eat greasy 'dillas or tacos or whatever while chatting with friends for practically nothing.  

Great place to just chill out on Thursday evenings and welcome Friday with open arms and a belly full of tequila and chorizo.
author: Erika C.

description:
Great spot! The chicken quesadilla in puff pastry is awesome. The tacos are great. Service is fast and friendly. This place is pretty tough to beat.

Getting your taco's Nick's way is also a good option.

They will even rush your order if you double park outside.
author: Jeff W.

description: Was pleasantly surprised by the tacos, Nick's style. They were more filling than expected and pretty good. Not a big fish taco fan, but the fish tacos here are really good. As much as I liked the tacos, I was not a huge fan of the quesadillas. For takeout, there may be a line and they only take cash.
author: Rami R.

description:
They are serving weekend brunch now!  Breakfast burritos, breakfast tacos and breakfast quesadillas.  

Don't miss the corn on the cob!

The chips with salsa and guacomole is delicious.  Big chunks of tomatoe and solid guacomole.
author: Wakako U.

description:
I've been hearing about Nick's taco goodness for months now and Sunday morning I was FINALLY able to experience the joy that is Nick's.  

I actually ordered the breakfast burrito which was full of bacon, eggs, cheese, potatoes and guac (I asked that to be added).  I had every intention of getting an actual taco after that but alas, I was far too full to partake.  But based on their BB, I can only imagine how great their tacos must be!

Great location if you're in the Nob Hill area...we actually walked from Fillmore & Sacramento and it only took about 20 minutes.  It's a bit of a funny place to eat as it doubles as Rouge nightclub in the evenings.  So you're chowing down on your Mexican grub under fancy chandeliers, disco balls and in art deco booths. But I will go back there again...oh yes, my next trip is Saturday and I can hardly wait!!
author: Melanie N.

description:
We came here on Taco Tuesdays. It was very crowded and finding a seat was impossible. Granted it was also Inauguration Day as well. 

It's interesting to have a taco place inside a nightclub. The chandeliers and red walls were nice.

I got two tacos, the carne asada and the pollo asado. The $2 taco special did not include the pescado or grilled fish sadly. I got them Nick's way (the tacos are made crispy with jack cheese and guacamole). They were alright. I had a $3 margarita right before so I was a bit tipsy after I ate my 2nd taco. Oh yeah it's cash only.
author: Helena H.

description:
It's hard to not give this place 5 stars just for their chips and salsa alone! BY FAR THE BEST CHIPS I'VE EVER HAD! Yes I said it and I'm not taking it back! I believe they're home made chips, lightly salted with a fresh mountain of tomato salsa. I always order a bag of chips to go for later.

As for the Taco's they're pretty awesome as well. You need to get everything Nick's Ways with guacamole, whether it's a taco or a quesadilla. It's just so delicious! The Prices are a little steep just for some mexican food, but every now and then I just have to eat here. Quesadilla's are pretty huge, and I'm still waiting to try their breakfast burrito's. If they're anything like breakfast burrito's in Socal then I'm sold!  I hear they sell Nick's Crispy Taco's at under dogs on Irving! Haven't been yet but excited to cause it's closer to home! Deuces!
author: Kazuaki K.

description:
MAKE IT "NICKS WAY"

Best 75 cents you'll ever spend.

Wish they had Pacifico.
author: Cathleya G.

description:
Not to be missed.  I heard about this place for years, then walked by mistaking it for the nightclub that is Nick's at Day, nightclub at night.

The only food my huz misses from San Diego are Baja style fish tacos.  First came Rubios, and then Nick's which is the absolute real deal.  Pescados or grilled fish, and an excellent chicken taco.  Sounds boring, be prepared to be VERY amazed.  

And don't forget a side of Elote, (corn on the cob with butter, parmesan cheese and chili powder), cut it in half and split with a friend or date.  Chips and guac and fab.  The girl behind the counter remembers our orders, even every variation of our orders.

Nick actually regrettably has nothing to do with the place anymore, he is next door at the great pizza place.  Fortunately for us, the food hasn't suffered at all.
author: Enzo L.

description:
Well, this will be the 536th review of Nick's Crispy Tacos and there really isn't anything to say.  I'm more of a burrito guy, buy at my friends insistence, I tried the pollo tacos, Nick Style, and they were some of the best tacos I've had.  They were very liberal with the guacamole, the chicken was perfectly cooked, and they were just plain yummy.  

The one thing that did suck is the drinks were small and they only take cash.  In the day when you can use your AMEX at McDonald's you should be able to use one anywhere.
author: Zakk D.

description: The first time I went it was soooo good. But I also had a couple drinks in me. The next couple times it was just ok. Guess I shoulda gotten a drink.
author: Andi H.

description:
Good band last night Nick's.  My complaints still stand, but good band.  I'll give you a star.

Second update:
Redeemed in my book.
author: Cole W.

description:
Dude. Tuesday night here is WAY better than Bluelight. Why?

1.) not totally packed with douchebags
2.) DELICIOUS food...and at $2 a pop for loaded tacos, HUGE quesadillas, and the fact that the chips comes with salsa, sour cream, and guacamole...whoa.
3.) good mix of young and not so young folks

Bring $15. more than enough for a bus ride here, two tacos, a plate of chips, and a beer. Then maybe a short cab ride home, if need be. okay okay. Bring $20. and don't spend the change on beers...which may be necessary to wash down the tasty food.

Instructions: 
1.) find friends to come with
2.) send two of them to reserve a table (open seating)
3.) get in line, order food
4.) food brought to table
5.) say thank you - don't be marina snob and *expect* delivery of food
6.) proceed to eat food and drink beer...smile...do at least one thing stupid
7.) enjoy
8.) repeat
author: Aaron F.

description:
Nick's Tacos are like crack.  I used to live a few blocks away on Polk St and used to eat there at least once a week.  I now live in the Sunset and seriously jonze for tacos.

The staff is always friendly and fun.  Kudos Peter, Lisa, Reno et al.

What to get:
- THE TACOS (Nicks way of course)
- Margaritas - I think among the best in town and cost efficient (e.g., Tommies are $$$$$$).  Don't order them from the bar.  
- Carnitas ordered by the pint
- Breakfast burritos
- Fish salad

Well drinks and beers are always $2 at the bar.  Nice for the recession sensitive folks like myself.  Taco Tuesday is a GREAT deal but can be pretty crazy.

Tip: Sometimes you can call in an order when it's crowded.  Don't tell them I told you.

Oh yeah.  Peter always does a great job decorating with creative flower displays.
author: HapaPower S.

description:
It was a decent fish taco.
It looked bigger than I expected it to look but it filled me up less than the "biggness" suggested that it would so was really deceptive in terms of the overall satisfaction factor. Looked like you got a lot, tasted like you got a little. I guess that it an equation for good food but it was just a fish taco and I can't rate that more than 4 stars, I am taking away one star because the horchata was toooooo damn sweet....
author: Brandon T.

description: As a vegetarian, most of the time I encounter really lame veggie tacos with barely any filling...just filled with dissapointment. NOT at Nick's! The veggie tacos are AMAZING! bursting with filling and guacamole....oh my goodness! Additionally, the Cheese Quesadillas is OUT OF THE WORLD. They also have this green sauce (don't know the name) and it's pretty out of control too. And top that all of with $2-3 coronas? HELLZ YA!
author: Lillian S.

description:
NIck's introduced me to fish tacos and I will never turn back. 
The only good thing at this place is their pescado tacos.....and their crispy tortilla chips.
Fish fish fish.
not carnitas.
not carne asada. 
FISH. 
only. 
with the green and the red sauce to top it off.
don't order a drink, they have free water.
if you want good cheap horchata head to the mission.
author: Brenda S.

description: Kind of a creepy spot because it's in a slimy looking club/bar, but the seriously delicious tacos make the strange ambiance a non-factor. They staff are efficient and respectful. The tacos (get then Nick's Way) are uniquely flavorful and a must-eat when you are in SF. This is one of the first places I take friends who are visiting from out of town.
author: Oscar B.

description: If you've read more than 3 reviews about Nicks and aren't on your way there, I'm seriously confused. These tacos are to die for ** MUST BE NICK'S WAY **, I LOVE them!! Thankful to my friend Mona A. who devirginized me on Nicks, I always get a few whenever I'm in SF. Luckily, I am moving into the city so I will have to limit myself (if at all possible). Love their margs, a great place to meet friends for drinks or to watch a game.
author: Donna H.

description: Went here for lunch with a friend, it was so good I had to come back around dinner time. The Nicks ways for tacos is absolutely delicious. Great service, GREAT food. The chips and gauc was .... unbelievable. Hands down one of the best place i had been to.
author: Mike Z.

description:
Obviously there are still taco places to try here, but this is easily my favorite of the ones I've experienced so far. The tacos are made of quality ingredients packed with lots of flavor. They are also quite large because of Nick's signature taco style that involves one crispy shell that creates a platform for lots of fixings and a soft one wrapped around it for keeping it all together. Thumbs up.
I usually get one carnitas and one fish taco. Both are top notch! Aside from the good food, the service is aways good which goes a long way. Tuesdays seem to be hit and miss as far as how busy it gets. Been there on Tuesdays where there's already a gang of people walking around with food in their hands looking for a seat and I've also been there when it's only moderately busy.
It's paired with an awesome bar that has possibly the lengthiest happy hour in existence. Good drinks, good food, good service. How can you go wrong?
author: Nate P.

description: The tacos here are good, although the real reason to come here is for the full Taco Tuesdays experience!  Great neighborhood spot; I would recommend coming when you are ready to sip a few beers and enjoy a lively atmosphere.
author: Mike G.

description:
San Francisco style baja fish tacos.  

The mexican food here is some of the best I've had, but it comes with a caveat.  One, it's expensive (for mexican) and two, it's a translation of true baja fish taco's; but not necessarily the real thing.  I didn't knock it down a star for it.  They're still excellent and the tortilla soup is amazing as well.  But it's a slightly gentified version.  Try grilled fish taco's, nick's way.

Good Thursday happy hour, though expect a wait.  

They won't take phone orders to eat in, and they're cash only.
author: Evan A.

description:
I was suspicious the moment I entered.  You think tacos you think taqueria, maybe a stand, maybe a few seats and some neon lights.  You dont think cavernous 1980s, boudoir themed dance club come mexican restaurant, which is what Nick's is.

Dont get me wrong I love me some crispy tacos.  When I heard about this place visions of Tito's in LA flashed through my mind.  Crunchy shells, day glo cheese, a smattering of lettuce mmm.  Used to wait in the perpetual lines and get em by the dozen in a big cardboard box for like $15.

Nick's also has a perpetual line in which you wait for your tacos, but the similarities end there.  I got TWO freaking tacos with guacamole for like 9.75.   Whatever though, these are the best tacos in SF right? After an extended wait I found out: not so much, just your standard fish tacos.  I guess youre paying for the Barbary Coast ambiance?  The sweet sound system and dub beats? Are the tacos dusted with gold?  Something special in the secret sauce?
I dunno man i dunno.
author: Codester H.

description:
For those of you that haven't been to Nick's (or think you haven't been to Nick's), guess again...recognize the red couches? It's the same place as that nightclub you stumble out of called Rouge. I'm not even going to get into the fact that this place closes at 9pm to get ready for the club...ok maybe I will, Nick's could make a killing if they were open late night!

Regardless of their hours and the sometimes horrendous long line or that sometimes they only allow takeout, Nick's is a destination for some good Mexican food. It's not trying to boast being super authentic like some of those taquerias you'll find in the Mission but it's still a winner in my book. You've gotta get it Nick's way which is cheese, sour cream, and guac. I think the quesadillas are the best thing on the menu - crispy on the outside, gooey cheesy on the inside. The burritos are very solid, which btw, they just added rice to the menu so you can now have it with rice and beans. The tacos are their speciality and not like any other taco you'll have. If you make it early enough for breakfast, try out the carne asada breakfast taco - nick's way. You won't be disappointed!
author: Josephine H.

description:
I can't understand all the rage about this place. WHY? WHY? WHY? Don't these people have tastebuds?

The tacos are fine but nothing special. I'd rather get some in the Mission. The decor is over the top plush red velvet with lots of chandeliers, but that's the only special part.
author: Marina N.

description:
LOVE THIS PLACE! Best taco place in the city! They have GOOD food, the restaurant is AWESOME inside, it turns into a club on weekend nights, but you can still get food at the window, so the inside is fabulously decorated. 

I've had quite a few things here, and I've liked them all, but crispy tacos "nick's way" is by far the best ever!
author: Brenna R.

description:
Does anyone know why cell phone usage is prohibited in here?  It really didn't seem to matter to the guy in the business suit yamering away.  This would have spoiled my visit at other places but not at Nick's.

As far as the atmosphere I believe this place turns into a night club, which is clearly evident by the red velvet interior, and thumping music.  All of which created a very comfortable place to have a quick bit to eat with some company.

I ordered two cripsy tacos one carne asada the other pollo, and I have to admit this place can quite possibly have the best pollo taco "nick's way" i've ever had.   Good place to go for a casual lunch.
author: mario S.

description:
Dreadful.  Tortilla was raw, and I didn't know that could happen.  There was no flavor in any component of this SD style burrito.  I was displeased.

i feel I have to say something further on the matter, so I will:  Way back in the day, I wrote the first review for Nick's, and it was glowing.  I have no idea if they changed owners or something, but Nick's flat out sucks these days and has been going in that direction for awhile.  True for crispy tacos, and true for SD style burritos.  But OMG the Walgreen's across the street is to die for!

Again, I will not give less than three stars so Nicks's Crispy Taco's gets three stars despite Nick's Awful SD Style Burrito's.
author: Paul M.

description:
During a spring outing in San Francisco, my friends pulled out their YELP app and found this local hot spot.  When we got there at noon, the line inside wasn't long, but the tables were all taken up.  

When ordering you need to go "Nick's Way" or the Highway.  The carne asada and shrimp were good but not the best ever.  If you come here looking for authentic or cheap Mexican you will be disappointed.  

4 out of 5 and next time I am in the city and craving some tex-mex I will stop on it.
author: Ian C.

description:
If it's your first time here, make sure to get them Nick's Way. YUMMMMM. This means fried, with guacomole and cheese. 

If you are looking for brunch, they also have breakfast burritos that are hugely filling and that could slay even the mightiest of hangovers. Ole!
author: Sharon H.

description: All I can say is yum! Yum! andddd Yum!!!! The BEST fish tacos on the planet, make sure you get it "Nicks way!" I also love the corn!!! Just remember they only take cash. If you forget that don't worry there is a Walgreens right across the street you can simply by gum or something inexpensive and get cash back!
author: Zilika O.

description: This restaurant turns into a dance club when the kitchen closes.  I was there last night and in the VIP roped off section there were a bunch of topless chicks.  WHAT!? Boobs everywhere.  I asked the bouncer if this was normal and he said yes.  Still not sure what sense to make of this, but if you want to eat delicious tacos and then maybe see naked chicks without changing venue, this could be a winner.
author: Miguel C.

description:
my wife and I go here weekly.

Awesome! Imagine a Taco Bell, but with REALLY REALLY fresh and tasty ingredients. 

The service is on the ball and the salsa is always fresh, that for me is the key indicators. Everything else is sour cream.
author: Jon C.

description:
american bar food-type tacos

For any taco here, you can't settling for anything less than "nick's way" (soft and crispy shell + the guacamole and cheese). It's the signature. Otherwise, you might as well go elsewhere. That being said, the guacamole is so scrumptious that it kind of suffocates the taco. 

The first time I went here, the pescado (fried fish) was the way to go. But I find myself preferring the non-fried one at this point. I wouldn't go with the pork (way too sweet) - it reminds you how much the carnitas at the humble taco truck down the street still wipes the floor with the american version.

The decor is a bit jarring the first time around. Parking has always been awful and finding a seat is even worse, particularly during the post-dinner pre-clubbing rush. The experience of eyeing tables while waiting in line is already uncomfortable as is the nomadic existence I find myself leading while clutching my number and waiting for seats. What makes it far worse, however, is the high ratio of inebriated douchebags lording over empty glasses and trays while they leer at the fairer sex... if only fewer girls would return those glances, I might not have to always eat my food standing up.
author: R L.

description:
I tend to think a guardian angel was looking out for us when we went to this place. It was a pretty good sign when we found a parking spot right across the street from Nick's. 

I had the carne asada burrito with all the works--cheese, rice, guac, sour cream--and a lime aqua fresca. The girlfriend had a fish taco, a carnitas taco--both Nick's Way-- and a margarita. My meal was a little better than average, I've had better burritos and a lot more worse ones in my lifetime. The aqua fresca also wasn't all that special. Granted, that's what I get for ordering against what the name of the place is. The bite I had of the carnitas taco was very good. It's the way the shells were done that made it. I've always had a thing for double-decker Tacos from Taco Bell, and that's what this was only with pork and ingredients that are better to the nth degree.

The decor is what made this place though. It was way cool spending $25 on a meal for two people and eating it in something that looked like you were stepping into a Swinging 60s sort of bar.

You'll find better burritos in the Mission. But this place is worth a visit, for sure.
author: Joey J.

description: Tacos here are amazing. I especially like their Fish and Carne Asada. -1 star for the ambiance, long lines and awkward looking red interior.
author: Nesh C.

description:
Amazing tacos, but not enough seats. 

I don't understand why they can't open up the roped off section and let people sit there when there are people waiting with food for others to leave their tables. 

Besides that, just sooo good. You have to get the Nick's style or you're not really living. The chips and salsa are a great deal too. Too bad they close at 9--this would be a great post drinking spot.
author: Jesse E.

description:
I'll confess right up front that I've never had a taco at Nick's Crispy Tacos. And now, I'm going to write a review for it. Surely, I will burn in taqueria hell for this.

I went there cos my friend Linda, ever the consumate networker, told me about their $2 tacos Tuesday happy hour. Of course once I got there, I proceeded to order my favorite quesadilla with steak and everything on it.

O
M
F
G

It was abso-freakin'-lutely delicious! The tortilla was slightly and flaky. It wasn't a burnt-to-a-crisp piece of barely recognizable carbon, nor was it nominally-crispy-but-actually-soggy from the stuff they put in there. The tortilla walked a fine balance between the two. In fact, it was just... it was just right.

The meat was a little unusual. I was expecting little chunks of beef, but what I got was more along the lines of ground beef. It tasted pretty damn good, not as jawdroppingly good as the tortilla, but definitely palatable and more than able to hold its own.

The setting... oh my oh my... I do NOT like the red walls, red floor and red everything. For some reason, I felt like I was already burning in hell. But maybe that was a precognition about things to come after I finish posting this review...
author: Derek L.

description:
I have been to Nick's Crispy Tacos a number of times...enjoyed the tacos (of course). Today, I went for the Fish Tacos and could not have been happier or so my tummy tells me. The Pescado Fish Tacos are now my new favorite...yum!

I also used my Yelp Deal today and might I add, it was a breeze doing so. And I don't feel like the food or service was compromised as sometimes does happen when you do these sort of deals. Thanks for keeping it classy Nick's!! I will be back.
author: Kim M.

description: Stumbled in here with a friend and thank goodness!  This place is part taco joint, part bar, part lounge and full part awesome.  The ordering side and bar only take cash, but that's the only downer. This  place is hip and fun. The food is delicious. We happened to be there for happy hour and enjoyed some margaritas. I tried a chicken burrito and it was delicious and filling. My friend tried the tacos and loved them. The bartender was super cute too, so that was an added plus. They also have fun booths around the bar area so you get the taqueria feel, but also a fun clubby vibe. Marley was playing on the stereo, so that was also nice. Can't wait to go back.
author: Theresa N.

description:
I've walked by this place dozens of times and never thought of going in...spent the day with friends and they recommended it for an early dinner...sooo happy they did!

I tried regular soft taco and crispy Nicks style...both were pretty good...

The indredients are fresh and tastey!  

I would recommend this place for a fun evening..it also doubles as a bar after hours, so would could be better than hanging out with friends, eating good food and drinking a  $3 margarita!

The one downside, i would say is the staff wasnt very friendly.  The waiter came up and kind of threw our food on the table and left...

Other than that...very good
author: Ripley B.

description:
I must say, their vegetarian tacos are SO good! They're so generous with their guacamole...SO good! I recommend Nick's to anyone who'll listen. I recently had a friend from out of town try it out and report back that they were the best tacos she had ever had! So the food is great.

That said...

Taco Tuesdays totally suck. Sure, the tacos are only $2, but it's almost impossible to find a seat unless you got there ridiculously early or late. The annoying part is that you end up standing while you eat these fully loaded tacos...trying not to spill all over yourself and all over the floor. Trying to avoid another stain disaster, a couple friends and I found a spot standing at the bar. The bartender told us we couldn't have food at the bar and that we had to go sit at a table or booth...which was absurd because half the booths were filled with people only drinking. If you don't want us to eat at the bar, tell that guy with the single beer taking up an entire booth to go stand at the bar so we can sit down! Needless to say, I'd rather pay the extra couple bucks and get tacos on any other night of the week.
author: Rachelle R.

description: Stopped in for Tacos Sunday afternoon, read some reviews about ordering Nick's style and I wasn't let down! I had a pollo and a carnitas, both were excellent.  The guacamole is great too
author: Leigh P.

description:
In the immortal words of Journey, "Any way you want it
That's the way you need it" and when you need a hell of a taco or burrito, Nick's is your place!  So tasty, so fantastical....mmm, mmm, mmm!  Sure, they only take cash, and the weird ass pinatas hanging from the room are a bit...creepy, but take out if it bothers you!
author: Matt L.

description:
Tacos were delicious. "Nick's Way" was a bit too greasy for my taste but yummy none the less.

Be sure to try one of their kick ass margaritas!
author: Mandy L.

description:
Excellent way to defeat a hangover...please read the sign outside and order the Crispy Tacos...don't bother with the other menu items.

Important Note:  never come here at night...the place turns into a club and the Crispy Tacos turn into assholes.
author: Josh W.

description:
I like Nick's but I'm not crazy about it like so many other people are.  I think it's sort of cool, and also sort of weird that it's in a club space, especially during the day.  My biggest gripe is that there is a crazy line all the time and no place to sit, but most people are just sitting and drinking, not even eating anymore.  I think calling ahead and getting to go might be a good bet.  

I went after a Giant's game (and a couple of bars) a few weeks ago and just simply did not have the patience or the energy to stand in line waiting to order and then wait and scout for a table and then wait for the food.  

Once the food arrives though, it's pretty darn good.  I like it Nick's Way, but that's a lot of food.  I won't order the Nachos again though because they use the type of cheese that you get at 7-11.  Just stick with the tacos.
author: Brian L.

description: Seriously, these tacos are bomb. I mean, where else can you get a crispy taco that tastes like heaven? Its kind of strange how it is in a bar, but still good nonetheless. We also ordered the quesadilla, which was alright. Tacos all the way!
author: Natalie G.

description: LOVE LOVE LOVE!!  I come for Sunday football.  Bottomless mimosa's! And who can deny what is the AWESOMENESS of BONNY.  Their mexican corn on the cob is delicious!  It is a fun place to enjoy your friends and TRY to control your intake of booze.  Bottomless is dangerous =)
author: Anna H.

description: Fish Taco, Nick's way! Grilled or battered is good. Love the extra corn tortilla. One fried, one regular. With guac in between. Good but not amazing. People like their carne Asada but I don't think there's anything great about it. Don't get their burritos either. Tacos are the way to go.
author: Julie T.

description:
Nick's tacos are by no means the traditional meat/onions/cilantro items you get from a Norteno taco wagon or on 24th street, but anytime you take a corn tortilla, grill it, melt cheese on it and slap another steamed tortilla to it before stuffing it with pinto beans, pollo asada and guacamole, you're going to live through it.

The first year or so when Nick and Pete ran the counter the tacos were addictively crispy and fresh. While they still use Niman Ranch meat and stock up with really nice prawns now, the overall finish on the tacos is not quite what it used to be. A little less meat/fish and more filler, a little greasier, but still epic snacks. An 8 instead of a 10. 

Oh, and don't try and go Thur-Sat between 6:30 and 8:00. You'll walk away hungry it's so crowded. 5:00-6:00 is the perfect time. I'm going today at 3:00 though... chicken burrito (no pico, extra cilantro) and a taco salad is a really tasty lunch.
author: Colin J.

description: sushi hand roll style + Mexican Ingredients = Nick's crispy Taco's Nick's Way
author: Mon D.

description:
Yum!  I got the breakfast taco, with eggs, cheese, potatoes, and pico.  It was good...although i would have preferred that the yolk was cooked, instead of runny.  It was good though! :]

go here for good food!
author: Nikki C.

description: Had the Pescado burrito for the first time. So....damn....good. This place never, ever disappoints. Ever. Great staff.
author: Chris R.

description:
Nick's fish tacos make me purr.  And sadly/strangely I'm not kidding.  I used to go to Wahoo's Fish Tacos in LA and never thought I would have a fish taco that could hold a flame to the deliciousness that they never failed to provide.  Wahoo's made me smile.  Wahoo's haunted my dreams.  But alas, Wahoo's never made me purr. 

I took my mom in on Cinco de Mayo - where we each enjoyed two fish tacos and three margaritas.  Now, I have an appetite that would put the vast majority of you to shame.  I'm that girl that you take on a date, and 9 times out of 10, I will out-eat you.  I will do it proudly.  I love food,  I'm a true eater, and after 2 tacos I was stuffed!  Granted I snacked on chips & guac beforehand, but not much - because as good as their chips are, you just want to save every crevice in your stomach for the meal ahead.  But they're hefty, so if you're really hungry then limit yourself to two - you can always order more later. 

My friend Nikki calls Cinco de Mayo "Cinco de Drinko".  The best part of it?  It doesn't mention May.  So, it would be fair to assume that you can see me celebrating "Cinco de Drinko" right here, on the fifth of every single month.  I'll be the blonde purring through her taco in the corner.

Purr...


Puurrrrr...
author: Whitney H.

description:
These are good. Not taqueria good, but can be stuffed into your face nicely. And they're messy, which is always great for a jackass like me, who ends up wearing it.

Can I tell you what bothers me? Ok. Shouldn't the standard tacos BE Nick's crispy tacos? Oh but they're not. The regs tacos you buy are not crispy. I think that's weird. What else is weird is how the dining room doubles as some sad meat markety club by night, therefore, I am dripping sauce on the same banquettes where who knows what kind of panty situations sat the night before?! it makes me queasy, a little.
author: Shannon V.

description:
What i love best is how they wrap their tacos so you aren't faced with an open faced, over stuffed taco (where you have to eat most with a fork and not in a yummy package). 

one grilled fish one camerones taco is my standard order, always fresh, always delicious. oh yea the chips and salsa are gooood too. 

see you next week nick!
author: Sarah G.

description:
-Bring cash
-Order everything "Nicks Way" (crunchy, sour cream and guac) 
-Portions are huge 
-Order the carnita taco Nick's Way
-Prepare to wait- if you're getting it to go, take a walk across the street to Walgreens and go shopping while you wait. 


For some reason, every time I am there, they have run out of tequila!
author: Noel H.

description:
They have some of the best tacos around.  I recommend the pescado tacos (for fish they also have Grilled Fish, but pescado is the way to go).  

Order your tacos "Nick's way".  This is a must, not a suggestion.  

This place is rad because you can take a table in Rouge (the 2 places are connected), order a drink there, and your tacos will be delivered to you.
author: Pete S.

description:
elote + taco salad + 2 tacos Nick's way = brilliant

Despite the fact that I always end up full like a water balloon ready to burst, Nick's is my comfort food.  Need a beer or rita? Why not? The beer on ice behind the counter is amazingly appetizing, and the aqua frescas are refreshing.
author: Carissa C.

description:
i walked into this place thinking tacobell was a fine establishment for tacos, boy was I wrong...

I don't know if there is sprinkles of crack or something in these tacos, but whatever they do to them they are freaking awesome...I really do like randomly think about how they tasted sometimes...

The scene inside is actually pretty cool too, the bartenders look like huge sluts, which is awesome, because nothings better than looking at barely clad ladies, with a drink and a good taco.  Definetly an awesome place.
author: christopher h.

description: Better than NYC Mexican food, but doesn't stand out amidst a ton of other good options in SF. Chilayo, anyone? I DO, however, like the location of this place on Polk Street, a stone's throw from the Bucc, Cresta's, and other bars that don't serve food. The only problem is that you walk into a bar with something from Nick's and a swarm of hungry drunk people will suddenly line up to be your best friend.
author: Duncan G.

description: Fast, fresh and delicious!  Been coming here for a few years and must say that the tasty tacos NEVER cease to appease my appetite!
author: B K.

description:
Went to Nick's with Lauren Y and Brooke G for happy hour a couple weeks back.  It was a great way to kick off the night.

-- Well drinks are $2 before 9pm and they don't skimp on the booze (much appreciated!).  Did you hear that?  TWO DOLLARS.

-- Try the corn on a stick!  They put butter or cheese or something on it and I think it's divine. It's like being at a carnival- a classy carnival.

-- The red velvet, metallic tiles, and crystal chandeliers on the darker Rouge side make you feel like you're eating inside a Russian musicbox.

-- The line for tacos was extraordinarily long.  It extended from the counter, through the other side of the restaurant, and out the door.  Long wait, but as long as you have a friend to keep bringing you those $2 cocktails, you'll be happy as a clam.
author: Erin L.

description:
I don't know what it was about when I lived in San Francisco but I never went very far from home. I feel bad about not taking advantage of the city more because I would've been here all the time had I known. I love fish tacos. I love em crispy and well these are pretty kick ass. I don't much care for the set up or how you have to order and then go sit down. It's just a weird dining experience. Either take my order from my table and serve me. Or let me pick up my order from the counter after I order.

At night Nick's turns into a club of some sort. Isn't that weird too?

But the tacos people. The tacos are undeniable. If you don't get a taco you are a fool. If you don't get a fish taco you are a fool times two. Great for snack or dinner! Crispy (duh) and still tender fish on the inside.  Great flavors all melding together to create an excellent T-A-C-O. Mmmmade to order. Great guac. Get it Nick's Way. Pick up a napkin and enjoy.

And on the off chance that you're reading my review from the 600 something written prior to ... tell them Lauren sent you. Won't matter to them, but it'll make me feel special :)
author: Lauren S.

description:
Believe the hypey. Hands down the best Baja style fish tacos in the city.
Theres a full bar aswell,  what else can you ask for?
(its funny how they put a one mexican flag in the corner to signify that you are eating a mexican meal cos you look around you and nothing is mexican about the place)
author: Tak H.

description: Friday happy hour is 2 selected food items for 5 bucks and change.  I was so happy with my purchase and stoked to find such a great quick fix that was more then worth the charge. I will try to go as often as I can.  Good cheap food doesn't get better than this but don't get too crazy and get fat over indulging now.
author: D B.

description:
If I could have everything in life "Nick's Way", I would.

[Although from the sound of things...thisTaco Nazi always has it his way.  I'm just glad for scrumptious vegetarian tacos, so I'm keeping my trap shut.]
author: Beth G.

description: I ate here a few years ago and thought the tacos were the bomb, but I had them again on taco Tuesday and it seemed different. Still good, but not as good as I remembered. Maybe cuz Nick is at Underdogs now, but still tasty and for only $3 - not bad... not bad...
author: Minh V.

description:
Carne asada tacos and Pescado tacos done Nick's way of course.. happy hour is fun here, it turns into a club at night..ROGUE. 

but DO NOT ORDER THE HORCHATA!
author: Oh So Fresh B.

description:
I was totally pleasantly surprised by this place, being located where it is and all....

Not that I think good taquerias are solely in the mission, as in my experience there is a lot of average type stuff over there as well. I prefer the excelsior for my burrito and taco fix usually, but I digress......

Anyway stumbled into this place as was in the neighborhood looking at apartments.  I didn't really like the apartment I'd checked out, but eating here, I was thinking "but if I rented that place I could hang out here a lot", it kind of made me think more highly of the apt than I really did.  Anyway, I'd been out of town for a few months for work, and this was my first day back.  I wanted mexican food, obviously!  I walked in and it looked totally cool, red velvet booths, a full bar in the middle, pretty big- not like your average mexican place- all all!! Plus they use nieman ranch meats, line-caught seafood, etc. I like this, as usually at mission and excelsior places I order fish or vegetarian stuff only as I have a serious aversion to dodgy cheap meat on all levels.

I got a grilled fish taco (they also have baja style fried fish ones) with rice and black beans on the side.  It was a little pricier than other neighborhoods (this is to be expected), however the portions of rice and black beans were extremely generous!  The grilled fish taco was yummy, and a lot of fish was given.  Everyone in this place looked happy, and was lounging enjoying it- not like a rush and leave vibe you get at most other mexican places.  You could easily spend many hours here, especially with full bar.

Where it loses a point for me is that they charge for chips- I mean come on, really? On one hand it is kind of a good thing as you end up not having that super full post-mexican food coma you can get after you scarf an entire basket of chips plus your main meal.  On the other hand it's just kind of cheap and tacky, especially at the prices they charge for their food.  Also, no salsa and condiment bar.  They give you three salsas on your table, but none of them had the wow factor, at all.  Nope, totally average- which in this town should not cut it.  It just doesn't cut it.  They need better salsas, more variety, and a condiment bar with fresh limes, pickled veggies, etc.  My fish taco would have been much happier with several more limes worth of juice.

But overall dig the place and will come back for some of their specials.
author: Carlin S.

description: This place is awesome. Great enormous burritos, even better margaritas. This place gets it. The red decor and chandeliers sealed the deal for me.
author: Carl N.

description: They have really good quesadilla and you have to get it nicks way which is everything in it. The portions is good enough for me to split it with someone and still feel really full. its so good that the sauce is like dripping down my elbow. I really like the chips and salsa too. Its freshly fried and i see the grease stain on the bag.Their tacos are really good too. still didnt get to try their fish tacos yet but i will come back to try it..
author: Lisa D.

description:
Delish fish tacos, beef tacos, and wonderful mexican corn on the cob!
Love the food!
author: Martha N.

description: They offered a deal on Yelp.  Pay $10 and get $20 worth of food, no expiration.  I went Sunday and was told that's over.  They gave me the cash value only of the coupon.   Food was mediocre.    Glad I'm over Nick's.
author: S W.

description:
Um....
It was between "alright" and "pretty good" - I dont know what the big hype is about....

3.5 stars.
author: Jane A.

description:
YUM-O! ; ) Sorry.

Seriously though, these tacos are awesome. I actually don't like anything here other than chips and the crispy tacos. My mouth is watering just thinking about tacos. 

The negative is the fact that the staff simply put are often rude jerks, but since I like the tacos so much, I'll deal with it. Definitely check it out. 

*Taco flavored kisses for my Yelpers*
author: Anita B.

description:
Best fish tacos I've ever had! Gotta get 'em "Nick's Way" with guac and sour cream. I'll gladly do some extra time at hte gym for these tasty muchies!

The interior of the restaurant is really lounge-y with red walls and giagantic chandeliers. Makes sense that the place is a club after hours.
author: Shannon B.

description:
These Tacos are great. A huge surprise to me when even thinking of eating mexican food in this part of the city.....

If you love mexican food, especially tacos. This is a MUST EAT. 

I will be going back for more ALOT.
author: Jimmy L.

description:
If you like red, this is the place for you.  It has enough red to last you a month.  The ceiling, walls and floor are all red.  Can you handle that much red??  This is where you can go to find out.

I must admit that the lack of taco crispiness did not please me.  The tacos were fine, but the place is not called Nick's soft tacos.  What's that all about??  How about a little truth in advertising?
author: Dan C.

description:
Vermin! Yes, vermin in the kitchen! I saw with my own eyes. I don't know if they were forced out from the place next door which burned down or what...but vermin!

I am also kind of biased against Nick's due to the way that the shyster owner screwed his business partners over. I don't like to reward bad behavior on any level.

All of that said, the tacos were not crispy (pretty soggy actually), the carnitas was not even up to South Dakota mexican food standards, but the portions were rather large.
author: Richard H.

description:
Good food. Good service. Good prices. 

Interior might seem random, but it's a club at night which explains why it might not seem like usual restaurant decoration. 

But yeah, it's a good, solid place to get good tacos and burritos.
author: Raymond P.

description: Nick's Rocks hands down!! I always get the chicken taco nick's way with a side of sour cream & chips and salsa( the chips are fried and lightly salted loves them), for the 10 mins Im eatting Im in complete taco heaven. If you're a Mexican food lover  than this place is def worth the try. Pros its fresh, tasty and mmmm good. Cons eat your taco fast or it gets soggy ;(  and on a side note I have a crush on one the cashiers lol he's such a cutie!! So I go regularly!!
author: Rae W.

description: The most delicious tacos ever at dirt cheap prices in a swanky night club atmosphere!  What's not to love?  Plus this place doubles as my go to sports bar.  I've been at least 25 times and I never get tired of it.  Hell, now I feel like heading over there tonight.  The only drawback is that it gets really crowded on Tuesdays but you can't fault them for that.
author: Paul W.

description: Pescado Taco Nick's way all the way! Too bad taco tuesday doesn't include Pescado taco. Kind of a tad pricey for a taco.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I can honestly say I have never been any place quite like Nick's Crispy Taco's. 

Both the Taco's and Burritos are good, the atmpsphere is great, kinda tacky, but it grows on you... They have flat screens to watch a ball game, good music, (Raggae when I was there last), just a good all around vibe.

A couple minor hiccups... the salsa was kinda 'eeh' and I felt like everything you'd typically want on a taco cost extra... Guac, Sour Cream, etc... 

Overall it's a great place. Looking forward to going back.
author: Blake W.

description:
Today, I had the opportunity to try this much over-rated restaurant. I visited this restaurant today, not knowing that on a Tuesday, you wouldn't be able to sit down anywhere for most of your meal. The place was so packed people that were sitting all over the stairs and anywhere they could find to sit down. It was so crowded, someone even spilled black bean sauce on my friend's purse and she didn't even notice until after she got home.

Anyway, you get into the restaurant and you have to wait in a really long line to order before finding a seat. I finally arrived at the counter and wanted to try the Nick's Way of crispy tacos, which comes with globs of guacamole and jack cheese. The way that the wrap is served is also deep-fried and crispy versus the normal style. I wanted to order it Nick's way, but without the guacamole. I asked twice for this without the guacamole, but the cash register person was so incompetent that he didn't get that I kept saying "yes, but without the guacamole." So my order came out as just a regular taco. 

The taste of the food was just alright. Nothing special. The atmosphere was a good one, but if I ever go back here again, it won't be on a Tuesday. It's worth paying the extra $2 per Taco and Corona to have a seat on another day.
author: Katherine F.

description: I get it almost 1600 reviews and everyone loves this place. I can't believe that I never came here before even after spending a majority of my life in San Francisco. Yes the fish taco's are to nom for! But. It's hella overpriced. I mean, in this economy I want a lunch to not suck a $20 bill from my wallet. I enjoyed the atmosphere but unless I was really in this area a lot I wouldn't go out of my way. I think planning a trip here for happy hour or taco tuesday and dealing with the crowds would be the way to go.
author: Alia D.

description: At Nick's Crispy Tacos, there is no other way than "Nick's Way." A soft tortilla enveloping a layer of fried tortilla gives the Taco Bell double decker a run (past the border) for its money - and on that note, a run for my money for a total of $2.95 a pop. And don't even bother getting a fish taco as the prices increased "due to the Gulf oil spill." Paying more than a dollar for a taco is highway robbery, but chase away the wallet pain with pitchers of margarita and good company and all is forgotten.
author: Maybelle M.

description: Great food, great price, would have given them a 5 if they accepted credit cards.
author: Michele M.

description:
Stumbled upon this place purely by accident whilst in the neighborhood.  Though not terribly fond of Mexican cuisine, I thought the food--particularly, the pescado tacos & chips/salsa--was fantastic.  Best tacos I've ever had?  I'd certainly say this place is in the running.  Reasonably priced & especially filling--the boyfriend & I ordered two tacos each, totaling ~$20, and were more than satisfied with the meal.  

The atmosphere resembles, as others have pointed out, what one might expect from a scene dedicated to delivering lively nightlife.  Appearing to be a small joint from the outside, the interior is actually quite spacious, with brilliant red walls and dangling chandeliers.  Apple red booths surround the outskirts of the place, with movable tables and chairs everywhere else.  During our visit (a Saturday night), the place was bustling with a line nearly out the door.  The restaurant blasted loud dance music, and restaurant-goers were, sometimes drunkenly, swaying their hips to the music as they made their way across the room to their tables.  Though hardly conducive for a nice conversation, the atmosphere was fun and, needless to say, social.  The cashiers and servers were friendly and efficient, taking orders for drinks as we stood in line waiting to order and pay for food at the bar (orders are only taken at the bar; utensils, water, etc. is self-serve, though they bring you the food via an assigned number).

I'd visit this joint again just for their pescado tacos.  I didn't try "Nick's Way" and opted for the default soft shell--but that seemed to be fine enough for me.
author: Joanna K.

description:
I'm a huge fan of the Carne Asada Taco, "Nick's Way."  Also the chips are surprisingly good, and I love the guacamole.  It's not authentic, but I live a block away, and I just can't stop eating there.  

I only wish they stayed open past nine and accepted credit cards.
author: Carolyn H.

description:
So i have lived in the neighborhood for years and finally tried Nick's about a year ago. I was immediately hooked on the Nick's Way tacos and refused to even try anything else (except for the top shelf margaritas!). Until a friend ordered the chicken quesadilla, which was stellar.

I love the overdone night club decor contrasted with over-sized pinatas. It's a bit humorous and odd to see a night club with all the lights on.
author: Brad C.

description:
I agree with a lot of the other reviews on Nicks.  I work close to Nicks tacos and so I go there from time to time for lunch.  Overall, the food is pretty good.  The fish tacos are done well and the tacos "Nicks way"  are also pretty good  with generous amounts of guac and carne.  

There are a few problems with the place.  First, the food is overpriced.  You are definitely paying a lot more for the tacos than most joints in the Mission.  (Basically you are paying La Taqueria prices, but La Taqueria can get away with those prices because they are truly fabulous.)  Second, the space sucks.  Nick's tacos uses a night club (rouge) so the space is too big and the ambiance is way off.  And third, they only accept cash.  Lame.  I have had to run to ATM's several times to buy these damn tacos.
author: L A.

description:
This is not "authentic" Mexican food, but its good. Its difficult to get good Mexican food in San Francisco outside of the Mission district, but this place comes close.

Everyone raves about the Baja tacos (which are good), but honestly? I come here for the Tortilla Soup. Nothing cures the morning hangover like a nice hot bowl of tortilla soup with lime and chiles. Yes! It is quite difficult to find a good Tortilla Soup - and this one measures up.

Beer is reasonably priced too.

I only come here in the day. I have seen the bar they occupy by the day, and its enough to let me know I don't want to be there at night. You'll have a much better experience if you come during the daytime hours.
author: Jay M.

description:
best elote i've had in SF! holy jeebus. i ate 3 last night... so. frackin. good. 

the rest of the food was pretty standard.... but the elote is worth 4 stars alone. i wish they would start an elote truck.... hint hint.
author: Ashley A.

description: Get the "Nicks Way."  Although different, they are delicious and filling.  Very fresh and tasty
author: Jordan S.

description:
K says: Indeed, the quesadillas are worth their weight in gold. The burritos are plain. Gotta try Nick's Way tacos next time!

J says: Mmmm, carnitas quesadillas... drool...
author: Jen Ken H.

description:
I don't want to be that girl who disses Nick's Crispy Tacos, but it's ok. I'm accepting it. I'll be that girl.

Nick's Crispy aren't really that crispy. Nor are they that tasty. If they were my student, I'd give them a B- and ask them to try harder next time, to add a bit of creativity, to spice it up. Nick's Way - which everyone raves about - doesn't really add that much except for an unbalanced salsa (I say unbalanced because any salsa that has more onions than tomatoes really needs to find its "center" point) and some (dare I say it?) tasteless cheese. Sure, they give you two shells (one supposedly crispy, but usually moreso soggy) but all it does is make it harder to get into the real prize, the meat concoction inside.

While we're on that topic, I have a suggestion for the fine folks there (note that I'm not being sarcastic; the staff is truly hard-working and friendly) - work on your carnitas. The pork is dry, flavorless and - forgive me for this - flaccid. 

Gross, right?

Don't get me started on their quesadillas. Just avoid them. You'll thank me.

But I remain hopeful - they've recently introduced breakfast burritos that negate most of what I said above...they're flavorful, fresh, and have the right combination of meat vs. egg vs. salsa. YUM. 

Now if they continue to make improvements in a similar vein, I'll change my story and start singing Nick's tune again. In the meantime, I'll venture over to their new neighbor, Escape from New York Pizza, and get a satisfying meal. Sorry, Nick, we're on a break.
author: Aubrey S.

description:
New deal - Fridays - Beer and shot of Jameson for $5!  sweeet

I heart Nick's Crispy Tacos on Polkers...

(Rouge nightclub)..just down the way from Starbucks and across the street from BOW WOW MEOW..I always manage to do the 3-way..

It's the same order every time..Carne Asada Crispy Tacos-Nick's Way, babyyy!  

Scrum-diddly-umptious!!  I would hold off on the beans and onions though.

Oh, and don't miss out on their infamous Taco Tuesdays:
$2 beers + $2 tacos +$2 enchiladas = a whooole lotta fun!!  5-9pm.
author: C Q.

description:
I went to school in San Diego, and I've been to Mexico, so I know all sides of the "authentic" cheap Mexican food debate.  The bottom line is that while the burrito is inauthentic in concept, the San Diego version that comes loaded with greasy meat, guacamole, and salsa is the champion of the $3 bracket.  No rice, beans, or lettuce necessary.  Sometimes your carne asada will be 60% fat and cartilage, but it doesn't matter.  As much as I love San Francisco, I cannot vouch for anything in the Mission that matches this late-night, drunken college student's salvation.

Here's the thing... there's also a step up in quality, where you can expect higher-quality meat, devoid of bones & joints, and possibly some vegetable content for $6-7.  I don't not deserve yuppie classification for enjoying this level of "Mexican" food.  Rather, think of it as an entirely separate genre of culinary delight... does anyone say, "Fuck The French Laundry because Thomas Keller doesn't cook chicken like fucking KFC"?  No.  Maybe you're the racist for suggesting that Mexican food can't be good unless they charge less than $5.  What do you think about that?!

Where am I going with this?  Oh yeah... upon moving to SF, I didn't really have a favorite taco/burrito spot for a long time.  But Nick's Pescado crispy tacos ("Nick's way") are the some of the best things I've tasted in the city.  Their guacamole is incredible.  Don't give me shit because Nick's is on Polk St., and it's located on the inside of a velvety nightclub.  Maybe I want an appletini with my fish tacos - I bet I couldn't get that at 24th & Mission. 

(Author's Note:  I don't really want an appletini with my fish tacos.  Are you fucking kidding me?)
author: Joe K.

description:
It's got a fun atmosphere with great happy hour deals on Tuesday.  The $2 "Nick's Way" tacos are a steal!  I was so full after 3 tacos and chips/guac/salsa.  

The line was really long, but luckily there was a waitress delivering beers to people in line.  2 Corona's for $5.

The only reason they got 4 stars instead of 5 is because the beers weren't that cold.  My friend and I think its because it forces you to drink them faster and order more.  Not a bad idea on their part....
author: Aaron L.

description: I had a quesadilla here and it was definitely yummy but the atmosphere is so yucky! I've had better mexican food elsewhere and it's not exactly taco-stand price. However, if you are around this part of Polk, it doesn't hurt to try.
author: Jennifer C.

description:
I've gotten it down to 11 words; 12 if you include "please": 

"Two Fish Taco's, Nick's Way, Chips and Guacamole, and a margarita- please." 

Definitely my favorite tacos in San Fran thus far... but stay tuned because I am a Mexican food eating fiend.
author: Kaitlyn G.

description: Excellent Mexican food on Polk St., with a bar conveniently attached.  Tacos 'Nick's way' are definitely the way to go.
author: James B.

description: I've  had just about everything on their menu.  Their tacos are good, burritos not so much.  Make sure to get them Nick's way.
author: Juan R.

description: Great customer service, the staff was super friendly and knowledgeable. We weren't very sure what we wanted and the staff "hooked us up" with a steak taco. Amazing! They also gave us a free basket of chips with delicious pico de gallo and freshly made chips. The restaurant is really cool lookin and turns into a nightclub called Rouge. I definately recommend this place for anyone who likes mexican style food.
author: Emily D.

description:
2 fish tacos, 2 carne asada tacos all "nick's way", chips&salsa and 2 large drinks = $27.50.  

..not bad, but of course you can get cheaper elsewhere.  Service was fast and the ambiance was pretty cool because I've never seen Rouge in the daylight before.

The best way to get your tacos is by doing it "Nick's Way" with the crisp, guac, and cheese.  2 tacos already filled me up and it was good...a little pricey, but worth the experience...especially the fact that we ate at a booth like the one we once ordered bottle service for at this mexican eatery-turned-nightclub-at-night-called-ROUGE.
author: Raymond L.

description: Filthy, expensive, and the wierdest conversation I ever had.  I think it is a popular place bc it reminds people of tijuana, gaudy, loud, and many of the chicks are likely under 21.  No matter how many bouncers are there.
author: Tim M.

description:
Tasty....burritos.  Their shredded chicken is the best.  I prefer black beans but okay with pinto (sans lard or bacon) the way Nick's does it.  

Fish tacos are decent.   But seriously, how is it that we are a mere 350 miles from So. Cal and not a single kick ass fish taco to be found in NorCal.  

Please someone explain or better yet prove me wrong.   By prove me wrong I mean find me a baja style taco with mahi (not halibut or salmon----and please don't say Paciifc Catch), cabbage and the works.....anyone who has spent some time south of LA knows exactly what I am talking about.

btw--there are only three problems with SF (purely my opinion) crappy summers, dirty homeless & no good fish taco!!!!!!!!
author: Solbiato S.

description:
I can't believe it took me this long to eat here.  It's the kind of place that's been on my list for about 6 months, and I just now got around to heading in.

Came here on a Sunday night-- ordered up some tacos and a burrito for the GF and I.  I opted for carnitas and carne asada tacos Nick's way, while the GF went for the pescado burrito.  The tacos were good.  The guacamole was very tasty, and while I was expecting a little more "crispy" from a "Nick's Crispy Taco", the meat, guacamole, onions and tomatoes all managed to come together and pull off some tasty, greasy grub.

The staff was great too, handling an order mix-up with the GF's burrito with speed and humor.  She liked her burrito quite a bit, and like any respectable gentleman I was obliged to help her finish it.  The fish was tasty-- salty and crispy even after soaking amongst the other burrito fillings for 10 minutes before I got to it.

The decor is a little wacky, seeing that it shares space with Rouge.  And the soundtrack of live Fleetwood Mac and 90's R&B was so bizarre that it actually worked.  I will definitely be back.
author: Zach A.

description: This place was OK. It had been built up to me so much, and though it was good, I really I don't see why there's so much hype. I mean, yes, great tacos, but not out of this world. It's a fun place, good food, lively atmosphere. Bring your friends. I had fun. But nothing to rave about in my opinion.
author: Masha S.

description: Really unique place to be eating tacos, but i guess they have night life. But tacos are to die for! get it Nicks Style!
author: Jitty A.

description:
Not sure how sanitary this place is...saw a roach on the counter.  I don't think I'm the only review here concerned about sanitation.

Anyway, place is overhyped.  Anything can taste somewhat decent when piled on with guac.  The fish was more batter than meat...felt the crispy'ness came from the fish batter only.  

So you're all wrong about this place and I'm right...there. :-P
author: Jarjar B.

description: Bomb dot com.  With a complete mouthful of Nick's way pollo asada taco I exclaimed, "Man, this taco is goooood."  And then, "I can't WAIT to eat these when I'm drunk!"
author: Laura B.

description:
pescado tacos nick's way with chips and salsa!

enough said.

now eat!
author: Jay C.

description:
So i went to Nick's right before i came to a show at the Great American, and now I'm standing here waiting for the show to begin and fantasizing about more tacos.
Hands down amazing mouth watering tacos. I ordered the pescado and the camerones both nick's way, slightly crispy and smothered in homemade gaucamole.....I almost ate my hand off trying to devour every last morsel.
Cash only folks so leave your plastic at home. 
I will now be planning my schedule around my taco feeding times, and looking for future employment in the area.
Aside from the most delicious tacos ever, the ambiance and old school decor is awesome. Love the chandeliers and large round booth seats. the decorFeels like taking a step back to the 1940's....I wanna have my next birthday party here.
Cheesy top 40's pop music though.....maybe a DJ for evening would be cool.....a DJ that doesn't play cheesy top 40's pop that is. 
All in all the tacos was better than the show.....Should have stayed and gorged myself on tacos.
author: Kelle K.

description:
They have the best Tacos I've ever eaten. Two of them will leave you satisfied. My first time there, I just had one to be safe just in case I didn't really like it. So by the time I was done with my taco and licking my lips in amazement, I wanted another. Sadly I didn't have a whole lot of cash on me.

I had a Pollo Taco Nick's way. The guacamole was really good. It was the only thing that made it worth spending an extra dollar for Nick's Way since it wasn't even all that crispy, It might just be because of all the salsa and sauces. The chicken was a little chewy but the flavor and juices were bursting until the very last bite.

The only thing I didn't like was that the place looked dark and the furniture and mirrors looked old and dusty. The chair I sat on felt like it would collapse if I sneezed. Just treat yourself to a couple of tacos to go and ENJOY.
author: Mark E.

description:
I had to create and account just to review this place.

1:  THE TACOS AREN'T CRISPY and are really ho-hum

2 Way too expensive for a street taco you can get anywhere for $.99.

I see these raving reviews and I wonder who is eating this bland overpriced food and is happy with it?  Either they are drunk/stoned or they just haven't been exposed to real flavorful Mexican food.  As the little Disney rat say's "You can't just hork it down!"
author: Paul T.

description: The service is always crisp, friendly and if you call your order in-in advance you can bypass the long lines at lunch time.  My only criticism is NO CC!  Not cool people, not cool at all.  The food is consistently good.
author: Melissa P.

description:
Not authentic Mexican, but definitely authentic!!!

This place is one-of-a-kind. The restaurant is located in the back of Rouge nightclub, and is decorated with dangling pinatas. Nothing like enjoying a basket of tacos in a plush semi-circle booth. As 9pm approaches, Nick begins to shutdown and the club-goers start to appear. This ambiance only adds to the authentic experience you get at Nick's.

The food is extremely satisfying and fresca drinks (especially the watermelon) are refreshing. I love the fish tacos and carnitas tacos made  "Nick's Way"...soft + crispy shells with melted cheese. The chicken quesadillas are ginormous and burritos are stuffed. Chips and salsa are nothing special but always fresh.

Taco Tuesdays are one of the best deals in SF...delicious tacos for $2. Be prepared for a short (but worthy) wait and bring cash.
author: Mike L.

description:
there simply isn't anything bad that can be said about nick's, except maybe the ridiculously long line to order food!  i headed here after work one tuesday night and it was taco tuesday!  the super delicious tacos were TWO dollars and the margaritas were THREE dollars!  i had an amazing time, the atmosphere is laid back and fun, the staff and bartenders are extremely nice.  

a word of advice: get there before 6pm if you venture here on tuesdays!  the next time, i went after 7pm and the line stretched across the entire restaurant and there was not one seat left in the house.  as i stood there inhaling my basket of the crispy, flavorful tacos, with guacamole and beans dripping from my fingers, a mountain of tissues in front of me, and people pushing all around me,  it was still sooooo worth it!  and you must get it nick's way!!!!
author: Irene W.

description: Tacos!!! Pescado (Nick's way) + Sour cream!!! Love the food here, and doesn't take long before your food is here. Only reason im giving 4 stars is because its hard to find parking around the area, lil bit pricey for a taco, and a pretty long time sometimes. But i continue to come here for tacos!
author: Bruce L.

description: Got Veggie Burrito for only 4.50! And it's HUGE! Sooooo GOOD! Must get the Haberneo Sauce. LOVE!
author: Danielle M.

description: Very good fish taco. The price is slightly high, the clientele a little gringo, and the environs are a little off. But, good fish taco makes up for it.
author: Andrew K.

description: 4 stars for the carne asada crispy taco but I'd give the pescado one 6 if I could.  Heaped w/ guacamole, fresh lettuce, and a delicious piece of fried fish equals the hands down best fish taco I've ever had.  I didn't even care for fish tacos until I had this.  The lime agua fresca was also good as was the chips/salsa.  The decor is strange...it's a sleazy looking old-fashioned nightclub atmosphere...plush sofas, lots of red felt, mirrors.  Next time I'm in the area, I'm going back.
author: Derrick C.

description: Great atmosphere here came in with some co-workers for a drink and tacos and was suprised at the size of the tacos great food great staff ill be back
author: Chris G.

description: I waited much too long to give some love to Nick's. I'm a Marina dweller, and the burritos in my neighborhood leave much to be desired.
