When I don't mind getting in the car, but I'm too impatient to drive to the Mission, Nick's is the place to go. Grilled chicken burrito con todo, with some squirts of hot sauce along the way. Divine.
author: Ranjit S.

description:
Nick's definitely has a fun vibe. It is a Taco shop in a bar, can't really complain about that!

I sadly was not partaking in the bar and was just grabbing take out however I could totally see this as a fun place to go grab a few drinks and a bite with co-workers or pals.

The food was tasty. Nothing spectacular to separate it from other Mexican food though. I had a Pollo Asada burrito and a pal had the Pollo quesadilla. The quesadilla was not what I was expecting. It was 2 very thick pieces. Tasty all around though.

The service was pretty quick as well. The line was pretty sizable yet it moved along pretty steadily and once my order was placed the food was up in a jiffy. Much quicker than I was expecting which makes me happy.

So all in all, Nick's is an ok place. Good location, fun atmosphere and classic food.
author: Crystal C.

description:
The food was incredible, as was the space.  Lots of big round comfy booths, huge bar, loads of big HDTVs.  Decent beer/liquor selection.  I got a fish taco (way bigger than I thought it was going to be, the piece of fish was huge and juicy) and the carnitas burrito with everything - it was massive and I brought half of it home with me.

Head's up, order the taco's 'Nick's style' and they put a crispy taco inside the regular small flour tortilla.  I guess that's where the "Crispy" in Nick's Crispy Tacos comes from, and I didn't realize that until it was too late.  My fish was crispy enough though, and I'll definitely be back many times for more crispiness.
author: Brandon M.

description: Not quite 5 stars but very good!!  The address is wrong. It's 2101 Polk St.
author: Kevin W.

description: i don't care that is gets lame and awkward with the club inside at night. i just like their tacos.  nothing else to it.  and i don't care that tacolicious and all those other taco spots are more popular these days.  nick's crispy tacos are deelish. just eat it.
author: Annster L.

description:
It's just ok.  Had the carne asada, pollo and pescado tacos Nick's way as everyone recommended. I felt the fish had too much batter and couldn't really taste the fish.  Other than that, nothing special.  The service was good and lots of seating so that's a big plus.   However, I don't really see myself going back there anytime soon.  We should have stuck to our original plan of going to the Mission. 

Lastly, it's cash only.
author: danny m.

description: I love their pollo asado tacos, Nick's Way (a soft tortilla with a crunchy taco shell over it)!  The guacamole is delish!  And their margaritas are made with fresh lime juice....none of that yucky mix stuff.  Great prices too.  YUUUUUM!!!!
author: Rosie S.

description:
Their tacos are pretty good. Actually, just starting to write this review is making me crave one...I wonder if I can stop by on my way home from work.

I like that you can eat your tacos in Rouge either at the bar or in the booths while drinking. This is a great place to grab a quick bite/drink. 

You can't even mention the word "taco" without my current roommate screaming Nick's.
author: Jackie G.

description:
Im sorry but I have to laugh at Angnes Comment.  

I love the burritos here but after finding out what happened Nick whom I know fairly week and party with on rare occasion I feel like I have to shun this place.  It was his baby and now its over.  He had the pizza shop next door but I never found out why he closed it.  It was doing so well... sad... this place is kind of a dive but they have good burritos that make you want to pass out...

and whats with the pinatas... seriously...
author: Harry H.

description:
This is a cool love shack.   Nick's turns into a bar at night, and when you are eating there for tacos, the velvet booths on the side give you pictures of the previous night's debauchery.  It feels a bit like an abandoned Club Med bar.  A ghostly bar area is closed off and a big open space with colorful plastic table cloths and benches is designated for eating.  If this place were outside it would be so so cool.  Inside, it is so cool.  There are also a few small tables outside for eating on a nice day.

The tacos are really good and the ingredients are fresh.  I like the small corn tortillas.  They have carne asada, grilled fish, battered fish, carnitas, burritos, and more options.  There are a few beers to choose from and aqua frescas for the more adventurous.  I can eat at this burrito place and not feel sick afterward which is prime.  No need to schlep to the Mission for tacos when you can come here.
author: apple r.

description:
Long after I've moved away from San Francisco, I will still crave Nick's fish tacos.  And truth be told, the decor will hold a special -- but strange -- place in my heart as well. 
It's a rookie move to go for the burritos -- stick with the tacos and you can't go wrong.  
Bonus points because they *finally* added black beans to the menu!
Call ahead (409-taco) and avoid the line of hungover 20somethings craving a snack.
author: Heather C.

description:
3.5 stars.  Food's not bad, it's filling, but not really Mexican and a little overpriced.  Maybe if they called it Nick's Gringo Tacos I would have gone in with lower expectations and been pleasantly surprised.  
On the plus side Rouge was having happy hour, so beer was cheap, though it was a little strange being inside a club with all the lights on.
author: Mike U.

description: Was there the other night after a happy hour winefest at Amelie, had the bean burrito and a beef taco, and holy moly!! The bean burrito was HUGE. Maybe it was the gallons of wine I had beforehand (not really), but for some reason the burrito just really didn't have much flavor to it, and the taco was drippy and fell apart in my hands. For as much as everyone raved about the place, I wouldn't go out of my way to go there just for mexican food. There are other places around town just as nice... though I will admit that the guys at the counter were nice, and the proximity to the Rogue place was nice, too. Just wasn't incredibly WOWed off my feet by the food.
author: Eric P.

description:
An institution in Polk St. drunk food...the PO (that's pizza orgasmica) of the Polk Corridor.  "Nick's style" mimics Taco Bell's double-decker idea, but the outside's crispy.  And the taco's not shitty like Taco Bell's either.  

Apparently, Nick doesn't like credit b/c no plastic is taken.  You've been warned.
author: Robby T.

description:
I had the carne asada tacos "Nick's Way" last night.  They were pretty good.  Two were more than filling (and 4.75 each), so it was a decent but not completely inexpensive meal.

The atmosphere is pretty interesting for a taco joint.  There are probably 10-12 chandeliers in this space, and the walls are very red.  I didn't notice if it was paint or some kinda velvet wallpaper thing, but the point is that the motif of the interior is quite different from the food.  Nothing wrong with that.

I would go back, but I wouldn't call this a destination restaurant.
author: Nelson W.

description:
Ordinarily I would give this place 5 stars but I really can't stand the decor. Located inside a place that is a nightclub on the weekends it has some of the tackiest decor I have ever seen. It's something that really just shouldn't be seen by sober eyes and with the lights on. 

That said though, the food is awesome. I prefer the tacos over anything else there. So good it makes my mouth water just thinking about them. Make sure to include the guacomole, makes them that much more yummy.
author: Heather L.

description: We stopped in this place on a Friday night during vacation.  The tacos were decent but maybe that is the best SF has to offer.  They were a little too greasy for me. However you cannot beat the drink specials on Friday nights at this place.  This is definitely the spot to get your buzz on before heading out for the night.
author: Brad G.

description:
What is there to say that hasn't already been said?? The tacos are two thumbs up and so are the burritos. I love the corn. The nachos are yummy. Definitely not authentic mexican but then again, this is Norcal. On Polk St.

Plus super cheap beer! YEAH!!!

I've eaten here probably more than 20 times and Nick's continues to deliver. But a few words from the wise: If you can't handle messy food, this may not be your place. Also, if disco balls give you the hebejebee's or chandelier's aren't your thing, stay far far away.
author: Claire G.

description: Love this place, esp Taco Tuesdays.  Elote is wonderful!
author: Gee R.

description:
Make sure you get a taco 'Nick's Style', it's the only way to roll!

Sometimes it takes a little while to get through the line and get your food, but it's well worth it.  The tacos are good and the margaritas are actually quite tasty.  The atmosphere leaves a little bit to be desired but I suppose that's what happens when you share space with an awful night club...
author: Craig E.

description:
The Taco salad is my favorite...with a side of Elote.

Yummmmm!!!!
author: Monika M.

description:
If you want an awesome taco at an awesome price.....go here.  By day it's Nick's Crispy Taco's, and when darkness falls it becomes a nightclub.  The first time I saw it was at night and I thought it was a strip club.  But alas, I was wrong.  It was a yummy taco joint in disguise.

Go here, you will not regret it!!
author: Ruth B.

description:
Pescado tacos!!!!! Okay, this isn't a fancy place, and the tables are covered with gaudy plastic table cloths, but the fish tacos are soooo good. Having two or even one and a half tacos is already filling and they're only $3.95 each. I went in on a Thursday afternoon, and practically all the tables in the restaurant were taken. The restaurant itself may not be visually appealing (red popcorn ceiling and dusty chandeliers), but the food makes up for it.

I ordered Mexican Coke (another name for bottled Coke made with pure sugar), but they ran out. They also ran out of Mexican iced tea too. Poo!
author: Audrey T.

description: I don't get the hype, I think you should stick to the Mexicans.
author: eric w.

description: Cash only!! But our cash wasn't needed on a Friday night here at Nick's Crispy Tacos. It was confusing as hell when we tried to figure out the entrance to this place, since it's a club (Rouge) at night. My bf and I were wearing sweats and gym clothes so when we entered by the club side, we felt very underdress, but whatever, we've always wanted to try this place. While we were checking out their menu, the staff at Nick's asked and offered us free food! I guess they were leftovers from a party-We were ecstatic from our free food! We ate their tacos and burritos. Mmmm, delightful! I can't wait to go back again and order what we really want!
author: Jojo N.

description:
Yes. I do like this place! 

It smells like a dirty swimming pool and they sometimes like to loop & crank cheezy, outdated dance music that is bad enough it should act as a warning to most people in SF to "Stay Away!". However, there is something about the food here that makes it unavoidable if you are near this section of Polk. The fish taco's "Nick's Way" are more than enough to numb the senses to the point where you will completely ignore the ambiance. 

Quesadillas are huge. Tacos are huge. Everything is bigger here! Ordering any more than 2 items is too much for most, so keep it simple or you will be challenging yourself to finish everything.

Happy hour is happy too....good prices on beers & margaritas.
author: Nick V.

description: Ok, San Francisco. I read your reviews on Nick's and I had to try it, being a taco lover and connoisseur. I had really high expectations after reading such glowing reviews of this place. I guess it's just not my thing, or I expected actual CRISPY tacos. But I was really disappointed. I went a 2nd time with a friend, wondering if I'd just had a bad experience, and still wanted to give the infamous tacos a chance. But no, the 2nd time was just as bad if not worse. I did enjoy my margarita though, but I'll go somewhere else next time I want a taco, crispy or not.
author: Morgan M.

description:
I likes Nicks not because it is a mission style treat but in SF and the Bay Area it is rare to find a crispy taco-- this is a soft corn taco town.  Nick's way is a nice way to enjoy your taco.  It is in a strange set-up --in--next to--part of...proximate to a overly decorated bar-- too many chandeliers.  

Buen Provecho!
author: Jaime Patricio M.

description:
Interesting. I opened the door and I walked into the back room of Rouge. HUH? I use to go "clubbing" in the back room and order drinks from this bar. Now, I'm ordering tacos and eating it in the middle of the floor where we use to get our "freak" on. WEIRD!!! It was actually quit funny. We ordered a much of stuff. The bean and corn taco salad with chicken, chicken taco, grilled fish tacos and chips and gucamole. 

The salad was huge! Tons of chicken and the salad was very tasty. The tacos were delicious!! I think it's my favorite taco place now. They are very fresh and simple. The chips were freshly made and I loved the gucamole! Very good prices too! This is my new take out spot. (Rather eat at home than in the middle of "da club!" hehe....
author: Denise L.

description:
Quite simply put: Best Restaurant in San Francisco! Ha. Well, probably not really, but "Best" in the same way that True Lies is the Best movie of all time. It's not the most quality food, but you crave it, it's incredibly awesome and you leave feeling oh so satisfied.

I've been going there religiously for about two years now, and it's funny because I've been introducing it to my friends and now it's a tradition. It's like, oh man, Joe's coming to the city today, you know what that means...NICK'S CRISPY TACOS!

My main recommendation: get the pescado taco. Even if you don't think you like fish tacos, get the pescado taco Nick's way. Something else may sound better - I've made the mistake myself several time - but it's not. Once you've had it, there's no going back.
author: Ben R.

description:
To start the tacos are AMAZING!  Fresh Niman Ranch beef smothered in a creamy spicy sauce, in a tender yet crispy flour tortilla with guacamole on top.  Or the pescado taco just melts in your mouth.  The fish is so tender and the batter is just right- light & crispy, not greasy at all, and the baja sauce makes it complete!  Their horchata contains a pleasant kick of flavor, never watered down.  They also have beer.  Also friendly and helpful staff, although you order at the counter, they serve it to you and bus your plates!

Major plus for being in a nightclub, it feels like walking into the movie Scarface... in a good way.  It looks just like the nightclub scene anyways.  Huge red velvet booths line the wall, mirrors and chandeliers everywhere, disco music is often playing.  Five Stars!!!!
author: Jes S.

description:
Everyone has to try Nicks. I am snobby about my Mexican food. I don't think Northern California Mexican stands a chance against Southern California Mexican but Nick's is my exception. 

You have to get the tacos Nick's way, which is a slightly fried corn tortilla inside a normal soft corn tortilla. They are absolutely amazing in original form but Nick's way takes them out of this world.  I think I was addicted to these tacos for 4 weeks in a row after I had my first one.  My next tip would be to order two. You think one will be enough but it is never enough and the line will be a 30 minute wait when you turn to get another. 2 for $5 Coronas and $3 margaritas are the perfect companions to the tacos. 

One thing to note is that Taco Tuesday gets WAY crowded. Get in before 6 if you don't want to battle it out for a table. You can stand and eat but it is dangerous since there is a high chance your knees will get weak when you take your first bite.  Nick's also has great happy hours on drinks and other yummy items (like their quesadillas) all week long so there is no need to just go on Tuesday. Drink and food specials all week long. Gosh I love this place.
author: Molly S.

description:
This is it! This is the BEST taco in all the land! Love it love it love it. 

I will always order the same thing- chicken taco, crispy/nicks way. 

AND the guac is tasty and VERY fresh. 

Salivating now.......

Also, this is a miracle cure for a hang over. Works like a charm!
author: pat s.

description: Walked by this place a dozen times and couldn't figure it out.  Decided it was not our scene.  But after a wine tasting in the area we were looking for something tasty to eat and checked it out.  SO glad we did.  The line was long but enough people watching to keep us awake.  Had to scrounge for seats.  Carne asada, chicken and fish tacos were excellent.  To top it off found that the Rouge place adjacent to Nicks had $3 margaritas.  What's not to like!  My new favorite place.
author: Ash A.

description: I love my pescado taco, nick's way! The best thing ever!!!
author: Lauren M.

description: It's a hipster burrito joint didn't even see a Mexican, needs to accept visa, but; liked you can choose tortillas. The food's better than most Mexican places tho
author: Clarence B.

description:
I have to say, 

Being from Texas, I'm a little bit weary about eating Mexican food here, but I think Nick's does a pretty good job.  I absolutely love their shrimp tacos, and 2 of them usually fill me up.  The fish burrito is really delicious as well.  Don't get the Mexican rice, though. Cash only just FYI, and they do have a few beers and margaritas. 

You definitely have to make it there for Taco Tuesday's and Rouge (the bar sharing the space with Nick's)  has happy hour drink prices to match.
author: Courtney M.

description:
This place was not what I expected at all. From the name alone, I was expecting some dirty, greasy hole in the wall taco stand (which still would have been awesome). What I saw instead was a nice place with quaint booths and a large bar. From the size of the place, you can tell it was built to hold a good amount of people. It's like they knew Taco Tuesday was coming before it was even invented.

The tacos themselves were amazing. Carne Asada Nick's Way was probably the best taco I have ever had in my life. Previously, that distinction went to a taco stand outside of Porky's nightclub in Tijuana, where for $1 a piece we just got a little tortilla, meat, and guac. Brilliant in its simplicity. Nick's takes that formula and just makes it more awesome, gooey, filling, delicious, positive adjective, positive adjective, positive adjective
author: George D.

description:
Went here on a Sunday just as they opened, so the spacious interior was nearly empty. Tried a fish taco and a carne asada taco, both "Nick's Style." To me, it seems pricey at $3.25 each, but it's cheaper than some of the other places.

Nick's Style meant having a huge glob of guacamole atop the taco, which made it that much tastier. The fish tacos were incredible -- fried crispy on the outside, but soft meat on the inside. Also, the sauce bottles that accompany the tacos have some great stuff inside, even though I don't even know what they exactly are.

Awesome eatery, with an awesome set of Blue's Clues/Spongebob pinatas.
author: Ryo M.

description:
I actually met the Nick behind Nick's Crispy Tacos at Tortilla Heights and he had them make us some tacos nick's way.  They were delish.

Update: Now they are on the menu at Tortilla Heights so you can get them anytime.  Yay!
author: Rosie F.

description:
If you are hung over, get the tacos.  Nick's way.  If you are not, get them anyway.  The food here is amazing.  And fast!

The best part is sitting in the converted nightclub during the day thinking, GOD this place looks like crap with the lights on!!  Really?? Red walls and mirrored chandeliers?  And are those PINATAS??

wow.
author: Alison R.

description:
I can't believe I've seen anything lower than 4 stars for this place.  It truly gets me, hurts my heart even.

Where else can a girl get a taco in Russian Hill, or Nob Hill for that matter.  This place was a taste of heaven, and I'm from L.A. (a.k.a. land of tacos).  Granted they are a little pricey, and yes, my tacos are better, and crispier, but these are still so good.  I mean for all those who know a taco...you KNOW that you if you are going to make a true deep fried, crunchy taco, you have to heat up the tortilla to soften it, then lightly fill it, then insert toothpicks in the soft tortilla before deep frying it, to hold it from opening and loosing it's contents (a lot of steps), soooooo...there is no way to do that with Nick's tacos!  They are stuffed to the brim, so they just wrap it in a crunchy tortilla and then wrap that in a soft one.  And still, you can't hold that sucker closed!  

P.S.  They are plenty tasty, but since the salsa they serve isn't too spicy, you should travel with a mini bottle of tapatio - seriously!  Woo, does the trick EVERY time!
author: Jennifer H.

description:
Two Words: NICK'S WAY!!

You have to order it Nick's way, it's the only way. Believe me!

-1 for the take out server always getting my name wrong. He gets my friend's name wrong too. I was called Alejandro and him, Jorge. It was funny and fun at the same time!
author: Lester L.

description:
I finally came to Nick's to see what all the bally-hoo was all about.  And I must say that it's not without it's charm.  
I would've given this place 4 stars, but there was so much hype about it, so my expectations weren't met, even though the crispy tacos were pretty damn good.  They probably have the best tacos on this side of Market St, but they definitely don't hold a candle to the Mission, in terms of taste and price.  I paid about $8 for 2 tacos, which didn't really fill me up.  I probably could've had 4 of them.  
But yeah, the tacos are good! The carne asada is juicy and the guac is creamy and tastes freshly made.  Mmmm...
author: James C.

description:
So I was day dreaming and all of a sudden I remember tacos. My last taco experience was so so. 

Its so rare can you expereince a place that has everything going for it. Nick's has it. In a city that has plenty of good mexican food, Nick's stands superior kind of, I don't want to speak to soon and tomorrow someone takes me some place better, but for now Nick is champ. 

The fish tacos are the best I've ever had. All the the chicken and fish there taste so fresh. And to add to the great food, is the quirky ambience of the place. Who'd have thought to put a Taqueria in a club with velvet booths? 

It's great. All the people that work there are friendly as well. On my first visit, I was on a first name basis with the people there. It's a must go to place as a local or just visiting.

Oh and try to make it by for happy hour for the $2 drinks and a basket of tacos.
author: Karim R.

description:
A thousand chandeliers... plush seats and a full bar -- 

Not your typical taco place in San Francisco. JD recommended the fish tacos, Nick's way - so Holly and I got that an the nachos to share, which JD also recommended. 

The taco dripped ALL over her jeans, luckily, I had a SHOUT wipe to save the day - but that didn't spoil our dinner at all. 

The burritos were HUGE - and overall, satisfying. You definitely get your monies worth AND get to sit in some fancy smancy seats which you enjoy your taco truck priced food. 

Why it doesn't get 5 stars, it's in a random location...
author: Lisa L.

description:
I miss this place with all of my taco-burrito loving heart. Definitely one of my most favorite places to grab a bite to eat. 

I really enjoy the nightclub turned Mexican eatery decor. I love how a few hanging pinatas and sombreros make it authentic. Make sure you get there before 9...or else it's Club Rouge time (never been...I refuse to taint my location experience with a nightclub when I'm so in love with the food)

I highly recommend ordering Nick's way...yum...damnit, SF, one more reason why I'll end back in the 415
author: Carly C.

description:
I can't believe I haven't reviewed this place already.  Years ago I had a brief sublet up the hill from this place, and during one of my famous "I need to eat now or I'll kill you" modes, I ran into this place.  I was extremely confused;  is this an ugly bar or an ugly restaurant?  Well, it's both.

I reluctantly ordered, asking what was good.  They recommended the fish tacos done crispy, I say fine.

Then something miraculous happened... something so unexpected that I still talk about the moment to this day:  I bit into the best fish taco I've ever eaten.

Growing up in the Mission and being Latina, I've had my fair share of tacos.  This place is truly the holy grail of crispy fish tacos. That delicious sauce must be made from crack.

So you may wonder why the four stars.  Its totally related to the fact that they mess up my order just as frequently as they don't.  The other food items are great, but I only want one thing from them.  When I don't get it, I'm sad.  They are so packed most of the time, I just deal with it.  The crowds are probably what screw them up a bit.  This place is ridiculously busy sometimes.

If you're not in the area, I totally recommend a bus trip over.  It's worth it.
author: louda l.

description:
I know there are already like seven hundred thousand reviews here, but I HAVE to add my two cents (I can hear my mom's eyes rolling now). 

Eh. One and two.
author: Annie B.

description: I love it Nick's way please! This place is a lunchtime favorite for me! How can you beat cheap, fast, veggie tacos? The staff is very friendly and were quick to become familiar with me. I can't say enough good things. Every once in a while my food seems to be prepared differently, maybe by another chef, but I still eat every bite!
author: Thomas Nathan S.

description: tacos are always amazing and though you can't beat the great deal you get on tuesdays for taco tuesdays... things get a little crowded. despite the crowd, tacos are served within a reasonable amount of time - hungry happy hour patrons like ourselves very much appreciate this!
author: Nadia I.

description: Nick's inside the nightclub Rouge is killer. The guac alone is worth the effort. These aren't Mission or Mexican street style tacos... more like a close cousin. The atmosphere is cool in a slightly bizzare throwback lounge kinda way. Order at the back counter (not the bar) and bring cash. Fun place.
author: Mikey D.

description: PESCADO PESCADO PESCADO! Their baja style fried fish is oober delicious. I've tried their pescado tacos and absolutely loved them. This time around, I was in the mood for a burrito so of course I got myself the pescado burrito. When our order came to the table, I almost had a heart attack when burrito was plopped in from of me, it was almost the size of my forearm!! Just by looking at it I was already defeated... could feel the arteries beginning to clog. Well, i was only able to finish a quarter of it, but that quarter was absolute delight!!
author: Pauline T.

description: Scrumptious tacos at a good price!  Loaded with all the fixings, I couldn't eat these slow enough. And the quesadilla... yummy grub.  The "tortilla" almost looked and tasted like the frozen naan you can buy at the Asian supermarkets : soft, crispy, flaky, buttery, good..   Along with the beer and lovely company, I'd go again.  Gets crowded fast, so get there early.  Fortunately, a couple of the people I was meeting up with snagged a table for four.  I swear, people would have started paying for our real estate.  Thankfully, we bought all our food before the never-ending line commenced.  A major plus: I love avocados, and the tacos had a heaping pile of guac on top!!
author: Rachel B.

description: Nicks tacos rock.  I can eat a bunch of them.  The food is so tasty the problem is waiting in line but i guess you can't blame them for that.
author: Susan T.

description:
I'm rating them purely for the food, not the location.  Seems understaffed and tables were dirty, they seriously need to do some cleanup better.

Other than that, we got our tacos nicks way (crispy) and it was GREAT.  It was stuffed completely full and a fun mess to eat.  Nick's way gets you a huge amount of guacamole and cheese.  No al pastor, so I got a fish and a chicken taco and the fish taco was SOOO good.  I bought some mimosas from the bar to enjoy with the food.

The chips and salsa were YUM...we had two baskets between me and the SO...royally stuffed afterwards and had to walk it off around the area.  There can be a long line at random times, and all the more reason to try it.  A soft taco shell wrapped around a crispy one, what more can you ask for?
author: Patrick C.

description:
*Attention food snobs!  Don't come here looking for authentic Mexican food.  Obviously, you would head to the Mission for that.*

Nick's provides the following:

-Delicious tacos at a reasonable price (especially on Tuesdays).
-Fun atmosphere with lot's of young people.
-Cheap drinks and friendly bartenders across the room in Rouge.
-Good Times.
author: Patrick N.

description: Loved this place! Went for lunch with friends around 3pm on a weekday and it was totally room-ey. Great food, reasonable prices, and a great time. :-)
author: Melinda S.

description: Had the most amazing pescado taco here..delicious! I tried it both Nick's Way and plain. I preferred plain, as there was too much guac for my taste with Nick's Way. But either way, they were still the best tacos I've ever had. I will forever crave Nick's tacos
author: Sue C.

description: Love Nick's! The decor is hilarious and confusing but the food is amazing. Fried fish tacos 'nicks way' are the way to go!
author: Lauren Y.

description:
Great place to grab a quick bite to eat...take-out or eat in the restaurant.  Just beware the restaurant shares the space with a night club.  So, the restaurant shuts down at 10pm.

Recommend: Baja fish tacos, guacamole
author: L R.

description: After being told the wait time at one of my favorite ramen houses, Katana-ya, was going to be 30 minutes, I turned to Yelp for the next alternative.  As I skimmed through   looking for the next best restaurant, the 2000 reviewers at 4 stars stood out, so I decided to make the long journey on foot to Nicks Crispy Taco's. If you are expecting to come and be seated and served, this is not the place. What you can expect is bland tasting Mexican with over priced tacos.
author: samantha m.

description:
After my friend heard a rumor of a good taco place and half hour convo. with her mother on the phone we found NICKS! 

WOW they are filling and GOOD. Nicks way all the way. The only down fall is there not as great togo because the guac gets brown. Icky...

BUT awesome.
author: Miray V.

description: We popped in here during the blues festival to cool off and get lunch.  I've been wanting to try Nick's for a while since it gets rave reviews.  I felt like something on the lighter side so I ordered the grilled fish tacos.  They were good , the tortillas seem like they could have been a bit fresher?   It was a much healthier option than all the deep fried battered stuff at the festival.  If I go back I will try the crispy one.
author: anne m.

description:
Pescado burrito; love it love it love it!  

And all the people that work there are great, even when it gets hectic, and it often can because the food's so good.
author: J C.

description:
holy crap, the pescado (i.e., "fish" for all of you who failed Intro to Spanish) tacos ordered "nick's way" (i.e., "crispy" for all you nick's virgins) here are amazing. no wonder they're on 7x7's top 100 list of 'must eats' in sf. these tacos are perfectly crispy, flavorful, and oh-so-addictive. the bad boys come with two crispy tortillas, battered fish, guacamole, salsa, mayo, cilantro, cabbage, and quite possibly crack. they're a bit expensive at just under $5 each, and believe me, you'll still be hungry even after eating two. but don't let the price deter you, you're paying for some gourmet mexican food like you've never had before.

while the pescado tacos are incredible, unfortunately, the rest of the menu is a bit of a miss. the carne asada tacos are not quite as good as those you'll find at a taco truck in the mission, and in no way worth double the price. the quesadillas are pretty good, but a far cry from the heavenly 'super suiza' at el farolito. and i swear that the nachos taste a wee bit like kitchen sink water. not to mention, the ambiance of this place is a bit strange. although rouge is a respectable night club after hours, it looks a bit cheap and dingy with all the lights on.

oh well, the fish tacos alone are worth the four stars. definitely give 'em a try if you haven't already!
author: Joseph F.

description: Best Taco place outside of the Mission. Must try the Tacos - Nick's Way. Get's pretty packed around dinner time, expect to wait about 10-15 min in line to order.
author: Landon Y.

description:
the fish taco nick's way sends me into taco bliss... if there is such a thing.

i don't even mind that i'm eating in a night club with the lights on.  everyone knows that everything in a nightclub looks uglier with the lights on.  except nick's fish tacos.  loaded with fresh guac.  mmmm... cilantro.
author: Christine P.

description: Good but not great food-- I had quesadillas and my friend had the crispy tacos with guac-- but you get a lot for the price. I was disappointed by the cash-only policy, and because I only had $9, I couldn't try a margarita. The place itself looks like a slightly run down dance hall (complete with mirrored walls and chandeliers) and we ate in a dirty booth off to the side. The restaurant is connected to a bar, and a cocktail waitress continually checked up on us to ask if we'd like to order drinks. Bottom line: If you're in the area (and have cash on you), it's not a bad place to grab a bite, but not worth going out of your way.
author: Lauren S.

description:
I had a damn good experience there this evening. I was planning on a trip, and I wanted to eat here objectively, and I pretty much tried everything with a few friends. Had the pescado, pollo and carne asada tacos all nick's way from the suggestion of my friend. I was definitely not disappointed and it was well worth it. I tried the burrito, and it was good. Not too much tortilla and lots of filling. 

I saw my friend drinking her large cup of the tortilla soup, it didn't look particularly appetizing, but that was just me. I came in early after the drag of 9 to 5, and it was pretty quiet until 7pm.
author: Michael C.

description:
The best crispy tacos on this side of the city. Parking isn't too bad around here, and I thought it was kind of surreal that it's technically inside Rouge [where I'd had many an interesting night previously].

If you're close to downtown, go to Nick's. If you're towards the mission, go to La Taqueria.
author: Charles C.

description:
The tacos are good. I will go back. Muchas Gracias.

Cheers,
La Gordita
author: Jamie G.

description:
Stop putting so much goddamn cabbage in that burrito! 

They really are not so good.  But maybe I'm super cautious agains "gourmet" versions of food which usually costs under $5.

And when I told them "a little less cabbage please", the guy taking my order told the kitchen "no cabbage", like we had a communication problem.  It still wasn't a good burrito.
author: Argonaut A.

description:
I LOVE Nick's.  Its definitely a guilty pleasure as anything that is "crispy" is not usually healthy.  But I always get the tacos Nick's style.  The inside of the place is awesome.  Kinda trashy sheik.  Love it.  

I went there a few weeks ago with friends and we got nachos---pretty gross.  They use cheese sauce instead of real cheese.  

I've heard the burritos are pretty good but have never tried one.  

I'm getting hungry just thinking of it though.  Yay Nick's!
author: Angela S.

description:
Night club by nite, and taco joint by day.  It kind of caught me off guard for a minute when I walked into the entrance on Polk Street, and didn't realize until I sat down for a good 10 minutes bobbing my head to the spectacular sound system, that I was sitting at Club Rouge.  

I am always scouring every Mexican menu for fish tacos.  At Nick's, they offered a grilled fish taco with pico de gallo & shredded red cabbage on 2 corn tortillas.  It looked better than it taste.  It was kind of borderline bland. Their sausage breakfast burrito on the other hand, was killer.  It was a mix of perfectly scrambled eggs with chorizo, pico de gallo, and potatoes all rolled into a fresh pressed flour tortilla.  The best part of it is that the breakfast burrito doesn't leave that heavy feeling in your stomach.  It's a great alternative to the traditional Sunday brunch.

I wouldn't ooh ah at the ambiance unless floral picnic table covers is your idea of class, but this place definitely has good beats and cheap good eats.
author: Nancy G.

description:
Went here for lunch on Saturday with my fiancee. We ordered way to much food, it would have been nice if the cashier told us we over ordered but oh well.... 
I didn't know how big the tacos would be, but 2 per person should be enough.. They weren' t the best, but they weren' t the worst. I thought it was a little overpriced. We had 5 tacos, nachos with out meat ( BTW they use cheese sauce not real cheese on the nachos) and 2 drink and it cost us $30.
author: Kelly P.

description:
Brilliant business plan. Nick's by day. Club by night. 

I heart Nick's. A chicken taco Nick's way with chips and gauc to share makes for the perfect lunch. Mmm...I want one right now.
author: Annie Z.

description:
I loved this place.  Simple menu, strong blend of flavors for the crispy tacos.  I had the Baja fish and grilled pollo crispy tacos with guac and it was amazing.  I'm dying to try some of the other stuff on the menu soon.

The only thing is eat in if you get the crispy tacos.  For obvious reasons, when I took it to-go, it wasn't so crispy anymore when it came time to eat.  Still yummy, just soggy.
author: Susan C.

description:
What do you get when you mix good mexican and a fancy club atmosphere...you get Nick's Crispy Tacos. There's nothing like eating a super burrito while sitting in a club setting.

Food is pretty good. Everything I've ever had was good, from the salad, to the quesadilla, to the tacos (Nick's way with jack cheese and guac).

The corn is really good (Elote, which pepper and cheese), but be careful that it's so juicy, you might spray people near you with hot corn juices accidentally when you bite into it.
author: Eddy N.

description: Best Tacos in the Whole Bay Area..... It's not the cheapest but it is the tastiest. This place is in the same building as a sports bar so while you enjoying your tacos you can also get a couple of drinks.
author: K. D.

description: Best Fish Tacos in Northern California hands down. Damn fine Carnitas and Aqua Fresca and the swanky, velvety lounge atmosphere make this a most visit for anyone living or visiting SF.
author: Greg C.

description:
after a long time away, nick and i are re-acquainted and are having a hot affair.  sure the booths seem a wee seedy but the food is always solid.

this place is hopping.  maybe it's the dire economy, maybe it's the football games on the screens at rouge, and maybe it's just the darn good tacos that draws people in.

i'm addicted to the strawberry drink but the watermelon is a close second.  so nice and refreshing while downing two pollo asadas nick's way plus a dollop of sour cream.  with $3 nacho mondays and $2 tacos tuesdays it's cheap and quick.

even years later, nick and i are still going on strong.
author: Anh V.

description: As good as people say. Probably the  best fish taco I've ever had. The baja fish nick style. The burrito was a little soupy but still excellent. The quesidilla was awesome. So were the chips. A must do.
author: M L.

description: I don't have to say much other than that they have the best fish tacos ever!!  Crispy, fried fish is always good but the way they put it together with the cole slaw and sauces, it's absolutely delicious!!  The only drawback is the venue...it's a club at night, which I had frequently visited when I was younger, so it's a bit strange knowing the makeshift tables are on the dance floors and the "table service" tables are a bit too familiar.  But the fish tacos are SOOO GOOOD...
author: Jessica T.

description: SO good! The fish tacos were absolutely delicious. Almost made me wish I liked mayonnaise, just so I could try the whole package. The chicken quesadilla was fabulous. More of a chimichanga than a quesadilla though, and the outside is crispy. Extremely fast service, and the guy behind the counter was so friendly. We got our entire order in less than five minutes. A little pricey, but it was worth it.
author: Jenna H.

description: Nicks way is the best way! Yummy quick bite and hilarious venue dirty mirrors and all.
author: Jen K.

description: Went in for lunch. Got a steak burrito, it was good , but small for the price which was $10.00 . For $10 where is the chips and salsa?  Fast service and clean, but expected more.
author: Veronica R.

description: I love their Taco Tuesdays. $2 each for their delicious tacos, nachos, n quesadilla... their tacos r hella good. Plus happy hour until 10pm...$3 well drinks n beers. What's not to love! BUT make sure u get here by or b4 6pm because it gets packed. D line to get tacos goes out d door n u will end up standing while u eat so make sure you get here early to get seats!
author: Jennifer M.

description: Tuesdays. Obviously this place is usually a nightclub, so the atmosphere is great the tacos are amazing, and inexspensive I think like 2 dollars...so good!!
author: Paula B.

description: Fried fish taco kills it. But Rouge is pretty trashy. Combined- still a good Taco Tuesday.
author: Erica A.

description:
I went to Nick's when I was apartment searching in the Russian Hill neighborhood.  It's funny b/c I was so bogged down with planted ideas about how expensive the city of SF was from friends' input, that my discovery of Nick's was truly a breath of fresh air; wallet-wise that is.

The prices were dirt cheap including happy hour drinks and tacos, chips and salsa, and other hefty apps at the cash-only bar.  The atmosphere was gothic lounge meets college frat party.  Everyone in the bar after work was young and basically looking to get hammered.  Hey, the heavy drinking and cheap eats wasn't a problem for me, but the fact that it was frat party-esque was.

Three stars for the cheap factor and oh yeah, a lot of room to move around.

Cheers.
author: Ryan R.

description:
I live a stone's throw away from nick's crispy, and it has nursed me through many 'morning afters'. carne asada and pescado tacos- you are my savior. the red salsa is my elixir, oh sweet healing nectar

also FYI, because of the oil spill in the gulf, you have to pay an extra $1 for any fish dish you get.

basically, a drunk text at 2am from a friend sums this place up the best: "Nicks crispy come now"
author: VL K.

description:
Very good!  I spent 7 years in San Diego and believe that I have had tons of mexican, from seafood in Old Town to waiting in the drive-through line at Sombreros.  

Sooooo Rubio's consider's itself to have invented the fish taco.  Now they may have been the first to mass produce a piece of fish wrapped in a tortilla but to go so far as to say they invented it is quite a statement.  Personally I'm sure there was some Mexican fisherman way off in the boonies that did it way before they did.  

Anyways, Nick's fish taco beats any fish taco that San Diego/Tijuana/Rosarito establishments had to offer.  Definitely get it Nick's way and smothered in guacamole, I'm salivating just thinking about it.

5 stars for the fish taco.  4 stars because they keep kicking me out of an area seemingly restricted by a velvet rope.  Why boot me from this area when there are no waiters, or any other reasonable explanation.  Oh yeah, it could be a little cleaner, bigger cups for water and readily available salsa.  

Regardless, go for the fish tacos, you won't be disappointed.
author: Micah W.

description: BEST FISH TACOS IN CALI! Mexico doesn't have shit on the food here! The Nick's way is the only way to have them and they are huge. They come fried with guacamole, shredded lettuce and cheese. The hot fish with the cold guac is a nice contrast and a melody of flavor! Be prepared and bring cash but there is an ATM next door if you forget. They also have a full bar which is a huge plus. I try and eat here whenever I'm in the city by the bay.
author: Casey M.

description: The tacos are pretty good here, but I think Nick's was a bit too hyped up for me, so I was expecting taco perfection.  The salsa and guac were a little gringo-y for my taste, but I appreciate any mexican food I can get on this side of town.  It was crowded on a Taco Tuesday, but we weren't really expecting to get a table. The Rouge decor makes the bar vibe fun, and I thought the dj was good.  Fun mixes, and I liked that when Miley sang that a JZ song was on, he mixed in a JZ song :-)
author: Laura B.

description: I had heard great things about taco tuesdays at Nick's, but never had the time to go.  I was finally able to go, and the night I went, there was a line out the door and the place was packed!  When we finally made it in, I took a good look around.  The place is old and run down, and not very clean.  I imagine due to the hugh volume of people it is hard to keep the place clean.  There were people standing around with numbers, waiting like hawks to catch a table when it became available.  The line moved relatively fast.  We ordered Pescado tacos nick's way, chicken quesadillas with sour cream and guac, and some nachos.  Everything was delish!  Always get the tacos nick's way.
author: M S.

description:
little pricey for tacos...chips extra....so so quality 

if your in the area stop by but I would not make a special trip also parking can be hard to find.
author: Star F.

description: I love the Nick's Way Fish Tacos. As long as they leave out the guacamole, cause I can't digest it, I am fine! Expensive for two tacos but it is worth the wait. Sometimes there is a long wait during happy hour especially on Fridays and weekends. I use to come here when I would visit my grandma around the corner but I would come out here all the way from where I live out of town to have some when I am in the mood!
author: IM P.

description: The fish taco, Nick's Style (a large amount of Guac)! Was the best fish taco I have ever had! Would definitely go again just for the fish tacos and their hot sauce!
author: Simon L.

description:
What a pleasant surprise. When I got to Nick's, I had this feeling that I had already been there before. Then I realized yes, I have been here before, very drunk. Nick's is in the back of Rouge, which looks like a dirty brothel. You know, when you see a club in the daylight and go...uuuggghhhh....that feeling. But bad decor aside, Nick's had some pretty damn tasty tacos. I got the fried fish taco "Nick's way" - with guac and crispy taco. It was delicious. I should have gotten 2 or 3 but the line was so long so I couldn't go back for more. Hot sauces on the tables were also very good, I am more of a fan of the red sauce (kind of smoky flavor) vs the green sauce. 

Nick's, I will be back.
author: Matt K.

description: Nick, your food is pretty tasty, but my beef with you is that you NEVER get my order right. In my last five visits, my "con todo" burrito arrived "sans todo" 4 times and half-todo the 5th time. One of those times the filling wasn't even right (it's the bean and cheese burrito. It's on the menu. The cashier shouldn't have to ask me what's in it when I order it). During one of those 5 visits you completely lost my order and I waited 25 minutes for a burrito. The system seems to be broken - fix it and I'll be thrilled to write a 4-star review and give your food the credit it deserves.
author: Kate R.

description: Yelp tells me that I have four check-in at Nick's already, yet no review? Blasphemy! As all the other reviewers have clearly already discovered, this place is a fantastic little go-to. Inexpensive, good food in a cool space. I always go for the grilled fish tacos since I'm not a meat-eater but they all smell amazing! I vaguely remember trying the veggie taco once and kind of liking it, but clearly it wasn't overly impressive. I've typically gotten them 'Nick's Way' (with a hard and soft taco with guac between layers) but have since decided to back off fat-assity and just go for the normal soft taco. Still delicious, mind you, but the guac really does add a magical touch. Nick's itself is cash only but Rouge, the attached lounge, takes cards and whips up some pretty good margaritas to help wash down those tacos. Seating can be rough, so be prepared, but if you're okay with standing/mingling go in for Taco Tuesdays!
author: Shannon E.

description:
The first time I came to Nick's, I got all L.A. and ordered dos de asada and dos de carnitas, Nick's way. The problem with that was that they weren't L.A. tacos at all, more like Tacos 2.0 the future. 
The crispy tortilla with the beans and guac and a little red sauce make this explosion of flavors in your mouth. The asada was really good and the carnitas had enough crispy/buttery softness. I took two asadas and one carnita down they way your supposed to and forked out the last taco, all washed down with a Bohemia. 
I like Nick's and you should too!
author: Hector A.

description:
The room this taco counter resides in is full of chandeliers and red fabric. I suppose that would matter more if the food sucked, but it doesnt. I tried this place last week for a fish taco (fried).

Yes. The fish taco was so perfect, so crispy-hot, with mouthwatering spicy sauce and cabbage shreds, I felt more relaxed, happy, and satisfied than after a minor orgasm. Shane could tell I was really feeling it, so he ordered one. I watched him get more and more excited himself with each bite. We sat at the table a long time, deliberating whether to get another.

We were back within the week, even though it a pain in the ass to get out to Broadway, and had the same experience. Just typing this, I think I might have to make a trip back today.

I recommend the fried fish taco. Not Nick's way.
I also tried the veggie taco and the grilled fish taco and they were only OK. I think Shane liked his (pre-fish) pollo and carne asada tacos, but now he's on the fish.

Big, beautiful tacos, just floppin' in the wind. Holy-jeez I just want to lick'em. Anybody want to go? Please call me.
author: Jenny H.

description: Had a burrito here on Friday with my friend, Gary.  It was pretty good.  And very reasonably priced.  Service was quick and friendly.  I thought the decor was funny until I realized that it doubles as a night club.
author: Kevin M.

description:
Pescado Tacos Nick's way is the best fish taco you will ever eat. It's hard to find good Mexican food (even in the Mission) compared to LA (where I spent my teens) but, this place does it right, plus I can walk there.

Tacos are the way to go here. Friends have tried the carne asada and chicken and, claim they are good but, for me I'll just stick with the Pescado Taco, and done Nick's way when I need extra crispy badness.
author: L P.

description:
for those of you that go partying at Rouge. Nick's Crispy Tacos can be found at the little bar in the back corner of the club. what a pitty they don't serve them after hours... It's only open during the day!  So, to find the tacos... enter on Polk Street.  
It has one of the best quesadillas... i love the steak!  the chips, salsa & guacamole are good too! everything is fresh and nummy!

tip - it is cash only!
author: kiko v.

description:
I eat here at least once a week (its three blocks from my place) and I highly recommend it.  The food is always good, is made pretty quickly and I am in and out in a flash.  

The only disappointing thing is that the original owner is in a lawsuit over the place.  He is now at Nicky's pizza right next door which I also recommend.  Go here when you need some quick delicious tacos or burritos.  Hova.
author: Nick H.

description:
I like this soft and crispy taco combination.  
This is one of my favorite taco place.

You should make line!
author: Hiroko S.

description:
5 stars for their baja style fish tacos and corn

2 stars for their impatience with the recently re-located who after coming here with friends braved it by herself to try to order without too many questions or confusion

We all have a first time, people!
author: Nicole A.

description:
Funky space, great food (ya gotta get the crispy fish tacos Nick's way and tortilla soup!) and friendly people! Hooray!
Actually, get two tacos while you are at it.
author: Scott H.

description:
Ugh, their burritos taste like cardboard! The bar connected to it is fun, 
EDIT- Okay, I tried their tacos and they are YUMMY!  Maybe I just went on an off day.
author: Rae H.

description:
I love a good taco so let's get this straight. These aren't real tacos.

But that doesn't mean they're not good. Make sure you order yours "Nick's way" which has a crispy outside. Get extra napkins cause they can get pretty messy. Speaking of the "restaurant" is actually located in Rouge, a Russian Hill bar. It's a little too revealing for me in the daylight so I like take my food to go.
author: Angela K.

description:
I love Mexican food; but this is one of the few places I have to remind myself.. "Watch what you eat." 

I can easily go overboard ordering something to eat right there and there, and another one to go.

I can't continue writing this... too much drool on the keyboard.
author: Cristoper C.

description:
Love the chicken quesadilla and the carnitas tacos done Nick's way.  The chips are thick and crispy, the elotes are awesome and it all goes down great with a nice ice cold dos equis. Not the most authentic mexican (jack cheese, sour cream, burritos...) but it's so delicious that who gives a sh**t?  I don't, and I'm mexican...

I like the seedy atmosphere of the old decrepit Harry Denton bar with the dusty chandeliers and the wilted red booths. It's a great juxtaposition with the cheery little pinatas and the cheap plastic patio chairs in different colors.
author: cecilia g.

description:
TACO TUESDAYS....CHECK
HUGE PORTIONS OF FOOD....CHECK
AMAZING MUSIC ON TUES NIGHTS....CHECK
$$2.00 MARGARITAS.....CHECK
CHEESY RETRO BOOTH SEATING....CHECK

**No it doesnt compare to Mexican food in So Cal but hey...nothing in the bay area ever does...for a fun night,cheap eats and great music NICKS is the place to go..now Ive only gone on Tuesdays...I cant say too much about any other night of the week...but hey TACO TUESDAY is a tradition...it sure beats BLUE LIGHT in the freaking MARINA...Come on people...that place blows!!!

The bar accepts cards but not the food part but hey your probably only gonna spend about 10 bucks on yummy madness so hey...splurge a little...add guca guca ;o)
author: Kokoa L.

description:
Que Fantastico!  I've been meaning to write a review about this place for so long, and I am finally getting around to it.....i was reminded yesterday as I was inhaling by chicken burrito.

Everything I've ever gotten from there is fresh, well put together and more than enough to satisfy.  I would give it 5 stars, but the seating area is kinda weird.  Great margaritas and chips as well.
author: Mike F.

description:
tacos get 5 stars, the burrito gets 3... meaning the overall score is a 4.  I was watching game 6 of the Stanley Cup finals at Greens where they didn't have a kitchen but allowed us to bring in food.  So my friend and I decided to each get a taco and split a burrito.  I've heard about this place before, most memorably at a poker tournament I was at where I overheard the following conversation:

Person 1:  I love Nick's Crispy Tacos!  They have the BEST TACOS EVER!!!
Person 2: Where were you born?
Person 1: In the midwest, just moved to the city about year ago...
Person 2: That explains your first comment

Anyhoo, if you are in the area, grab a taco but skip the burrito.
author: Brian A.

description:
This is a really odd place, at least during the day.  It reminds me of places I have eaten in Mexico City, not really a restaurant and not really anything else, with the food in the corner.  I don't think any of those places were nightclubs though, and I haven't been here at night.

But the food is really fresh, including the chips, and especially the salsa fresca, which is not "fresca" in so many places.  I hate the salsa "bars" where everything sits out all day with people sticking their fingers in and stuff.  

The taco was terrific with a good portion of meat.  The guac on it ("Nick's style" or whatever they call it) was good and the tortillas were excellent.  The strawberry agua fresca was good also.  And the price was great, considering the quality.

After all the second rate taco joints I've eaten at in town, this was a great find.  I think I've walked by it at least a couple times a month without even noticing, but I never liked the look of the nightclub (not my crowd), so I never noticed the entrance for Nick's.

Second visit - as good as the first.  Tried the fish tacos, definitely worth buying.  Also tried the margaritas, which are fine for the price.
author: Spike S.

description:
I'll give NIck's another chance, but my first experience was merely OK.

Went for lunch on a Saturday and stood in line for awhile waiting to order.  I was surprised that, because it's called Nick's Crispy Tacos that the tacos don't automatically come crispy unless you order them "Nick's Way," which also includes a huge dollop of guacamole.  Of course, this all costs an additional .95 cents per taco.  My guestion, and I should have asked: What if I wanted  a crispy taco sans guacamole?  Still an extra charge?

The tacos were big, wrapped well, and full of toppings.  I had one carnitas and one chicken, and, honestly, they tasted exactly the same.  Mostly like pinto bean.  

The salsas on the tables lacked punch, but I liked the space and the Dos Equis lined up in an ice cold bucket behind the counter.  The menu is large and varied and has all the good things I would want from a taqueria.
author: Cory G.

description: Review #1425. Sunday lunch in the city we expected to spend 40 bucks and up somewhere else. Let's try Nick's as we've walked by there a hundred times. $11 for food and $6 for margaritas later (happy hour, who knew?)  We were stuffed and happy to walk down the street for lattes which cost near as much as lunch! Carne Asada Nick's way was great, husband said. Fish taco very nice, if a bit greasy. Chips and salsa muy bueno. Fish and seafood $1 more than listed per the BP disaster...We watched the Giants game at the bar and worked hard to get the disinterested bartender's attention (she was reading Elle or Vogue or something).
author: M F.

description: There is a lot to love with Nick's Crispy Tacos, from the endearing name, relatively low prices, high-kitch old San Fran juxtaposed with casual Mexican food to the fresh deliciousness of that food. I used to go down to the Mission for burritos, but upon finally venturing into Nick's, no longer find that to be necessary. I usually order the veggie burrito with black beans, no rice (once had with rice and it tasted stale to me) or the fish tacos, and appreciate the fresh vegetables - cabbage, guacamole, and tomatoes - and the intensely seasoned bottled salsas. My husband says the carne asada is the best he's had at that price point, but the pollo asada and carnitas are not as flavorful. Nick's is like the funny, unpretentious, shy smart boy you can't help but adore.
author: Eliza S.

description:
A sure fire winner!  Love the tacos, love the drink specials!  It's great if you can bag a booth, but it's worth coming even if you have to squeeze in and munch your tacos at the bar too!  

And like everyone says, get 'em Nick's way!
author: Nick S.

description:
i just can't bring myself up to give them 5 stars ONLY because i paid $5 for pretty good tacos. they were awesome, but they didn't knock my socks off. also, the sauce on the elote was heavy on the lime... and sweetness of the corn overpowered the other flavors. 
     what i ordered:
         - 2 fish tacos, Nicks Way ($3.95 + $0.95 for Nick's way)
        - 1 elote 
Total: $17
Oh, and add $2 for 1 hr parking.
author: Mayson J.

description: This place is worth coming to on Tuesday's for Taco Tuesday's, definitely get there early because if you don't the line will get out of hand quickly. You can call and reserve a table/booth, highly recommended. Get the Taco's Nick's Style, they wrap a soft tortilla over a crispy shell. Pitchers of margarita's are $18 and the place turns into a social scene. All in all it's worth the trip.
author: mehul p.

description: Wow, the fish taco is insane!! I ordered the chicken taco which was really good too, but when I tried my boyfriend's taco, wow, it was so yummy!! They put lots of guacamole and stuff your taco with all kinds of yummy. I've yet to try their other foods but this place is so far a winner in my book. Not only were the tacos insane, the bartenders were awesome and the cheap margaritas were off the chain! Definitely going back soon.
author: Jacqueline C.

description:
Taco Tuesday ROCKS. Come around 6p.m. to get a booth or stop by after 9p.m... this place can get packed on Tuedays. Order your tacos "Nick style" for cheese, guac, and crispy. The nachos are tasty, and fish burritos aren't too bad. 

I love the ambiance at Nick's - a great place for a group of friends looking for a midweek get-together. 

The red light in the bathroom is unexpected and cool.
author: Virginia S.

description: Easily the best Carne Asada Quesadilla I've ever had.  Packed full of meat and Pico de Gallo.  Paired with a tasty pint of Big Daddy IPA, it doesn't get much better (although a Union Jack or Lagunitas IPA may have been better).  We went on a Tuesday night around 7:00pm and the place was jam packed for Taco Tuesday. Besides that, all round fantastic experience.
author: Justin A.

description: Nick's is my absolute favorite spot for good Taco's when I am home in the city. The fabulous decor adds to it's atmosphere though I would have given 5 stars but feel they could "dust" the velvet curtains and disco mirrored finishes. Maybe I am just a fanatic but dust is dust people! Always a good quick, cheap meal and a fun place to entertain a visiting guest who wants to grab a bite and chill in fun surroundings with a cool kat crowd.
author: Joey C.

description: I've been multiple times for Taco Tuesday, this place is legit!  Only way to get the tacos is "Nick's Way".  The pollo asado and carnitas are my favorite.  I've had the burrito once, nothing to write home about.  Will only eat/come here on Tuesdays for $3.50 "Nick's Way" tacos and a good time with friends though!
author: Timothy S.

description: The carne asada taco - Nick's way - is a must try.  I wouldn't go out of my way to get one, but I certainly wouldn't pass it up if I'm in the area and you shouldn't either.
author: Laura L.

description: Everything here tastes so fresh! Happy hour is great and the restaurant itself is unique and pretty. Have tried it all- nachos, quesadillas, burritos and have never been disappointed.
author: Siobhan M.

description:
Scrumdiddliumptious

Random bar location which feels a bit weird at first but gets kind of groovy after a while.

And the Tacos were Yummy.
author: Michael R.

description: STICK TO YOUR FAVORITE TACO TRUCK. After reading reviews, and seeing pics we thought we'd give a go...We had an early dinner here, lastnight. Off the bat-probably, not the best night to bring my toddler. It was definitly, a hangout spot, the huge bar to the left 'Rouge' was filled with people watching college football. Anyways, back to the restaurant. My husband ordered us two Pescado 'crispy' tacos (Nick's way), two steak tacos, nachos, and a quesadilla for my kid. Total came out to $40 (red flag#1). They charge for every.single.thing! To make it 'crispy' -they charge??! Wait...what is this place called again...'oh, yea nick's CRISPY tacos!' Why the 'F' would you charge for ppl to have a crispy damn taco-_- So, the nachos were OK (they use that cheese queso sauce,shredded chicken, the works), the fish CRISPY pescado taco was OK (too much guac everywhere, 'crispy' taco was more like stale/hard-azz-almost-chipped-my-vineer front teeth,quesadilla got soggy, and the steak taco was OK. Sheesh, don't come here if your looking for great tacos, or good value. Come here if your looking for a cool bar.
author: Ane T.

description:
while nick's is famed for its taco's, nick's style, ultimately my favorite menu item is the carne asada quesadilla. 

unlike quesadilla usually served or made at home, nick's version is a completely different breed. first off, it is rectangular-wrapped, in this layer of flaky and soft. inside, flavorful steak, cheese, and guac and sour cream! making it a juicy explosion of tastiness. drizzle some salsa on top, and it is quite divine. 

they also serve some mean pitchers of margarita at the bar. it is nice to see the bartender doing a 30 second pour of that tequila down my pitcher!
author: Fiona S.

description:
This place is nothing special, but the PACKAGE is what makes it great.

Definitely a good place to roll into on Sunday to grab a taco and a margarita to both fill your belly and help cure that nasty hangover.  The lounge next door ROUGE, is open for seating.  WIth their large booths/plentiful bar space, and a half dozed LCD's this place is a nice place to kick back.

Better than average tacos (ingredients/presentation/taste), chill atmosphere, reasonable price (unless your comparing to taco bell..jokes).  Worth checking out if your in the neighborhood.  Happy DiNNing...
author: Nader A.

description: Never thought I'll find a decent mexican joint in SF. Boy was i wrong. The Fish tacos (nick's style) won my heart!
author: Jenny J.

description:
Great Russian Hill spot!  The carne asada and baja fish tacos nicks way are standouts.  I also like the super quesadia; the tortilla is fried more than usual and packs a lot of flavor.  Decent spot to grab a drink on a weekday if you dig an ecelctic atmosphere, it also turns into a nightclub past 10pm.  That leads us to my biggest quarrel with this place, it's only open 'till 10!  WTF!   If you're the only burrito spot in the vicinity, you have to stay open a little later, especially because the bulk of your customers are in their 20s and 30s and like to drink and eat late.  

My suggestion, or compromise if you will, is to use the takeout window until at least 11pm, that satisfies the dilemma of needing to eat a burrito semi-late at night and leaves enough time before the club crowd takes over.  I digest, anyways, this is a great place to get tacos in a funky/eclectic atmosphere.
author: Adam S.

description: This place is awesome! The food is amazing the only bad thing is you can count on a wait 99% of the time. I always get the carne asada tacos Nick's way and they have never dissapointed. They load on the guac and the carne asada is always flavorful. Worth the wait for sure!
author: Adrienne P.

description: Went to Rouge last night to watch the Saints kick the Patriots ass and drink a $10 Sierra Nevada pitcher (I swear I shared some of it!). Attached is this little mexican food place, Nick's Crispy Tacos. We were all pretty hungry so we ordered chicken tacos, steak nachos, and a quessadilla (again....I swear I shared!) They served us right at the bar so we could happily enjoy our pitcher and food. The tacos were to die for! Sooo crispy and delicious! If not just for the 90 year old drunk singing man at the bar, I will be coming back to Rouge and Nick's Crispy Tacos for more! YUM!
author: Casi C.

description: Haven't been back in a while, but wanted to note that they're still the best tacos I've had in a while, AND the cheap corona makes me happy. If Tuesdays weren't dedicated to LOST at the moment, I'd be there more often :)
author: Krystha B.

description: Fish Tacos!  I was personally not a fish taco fan before I went to Nick's tacos.  The 4 stars is for the price.  It's a little overpriced and how can you not get "Nick's Way" on your taco?  A taco with no Guac is no taco at all in my book, and a fried tortilla? Please!  So there's another dollar you have to tack on each taco you get.  I got two tacos my first time and yes they are filling but I'm a big guy and I could have easily taken down another taco.  Let's see that would be about $15-$20 bucks on 3 tacos! A little much but I think it is worth it once in awhile if you're going to splurge on tacos.  But then again I would want to splurge on sushi or a steak.  A must try though, definitely go with the fish tacos.
author: Darren A.

description: Love this place. It's nice to be able to get take out when I'm solo, or take a bunch of friends and have a raucous time. I love the creamy lime dressing on the tacos, and how full they pack them.  The gilled fish are the best--very fresh. The quesadillas here are unlike anywhere: very thick and juicy...delicious! The menu is very extensive so everyone can find something they like. Try the horchata too!
author: Mithra H.

description: Hmmm.  They used to be awesome and mind-blowing.  Now they are just kinda...well....stale.  Still have great flavor.  Maybe I had my taco craving on a bad night?  Maybe its because our table was actually in the "next door" lounge?  You know, Douche...I mean Rouge.
author: Ryan S.

description: There are so many other reviews on here, I don't really need to go into much detail: deLIcious tacos, especially the the fish tacos.  My one complaint: it can be quite cold in here on cold days, especially because they leave the doors wide open.  I'd just wear an extra layer and order an extra taco!
author: Zsaleh H.

description: Very tasty tacos... I recommend getting the tacos Nicks Style. My favorite was the Carnitas Burrito. It is HUGE so bring an appetite. We also had some chicken nachos that were really tasty. The line was a short one (I couldn't believe it for a Friday night) The chips were a little soggy by the time I got home, I will remember to get some extra chips.
author: Miguel V.

description:
Ive been here a few times but took my food to go. The food is good...pretty much what u expect from an american-mexican spot. not necessarily better than rubios or baja, but its a nice change from the food chains.

the nachos are nice and filling. i love that theyre not shady with the jalepenos. i had a carne asada burrito which was ok. the problem is you have to get them "nicks way" to enjoy it. thus, the nachos or burrito would cost almost 10 bucks. 

ive had the carne asada, carnitas, and baja tacos. theyre a good size but i need to eat 3 to be satisfied. 4 would probly put me where i wanna be after mexican food. again...add a dollar to these to have em nicks way and we're lookin at 5 bucks for a taco. 

seems like it would be a nice place to stay and eat, i just havent had the chance. the people are nice and they serve alcohol. theres good music too. ill probly stop by for taco tuesdays.
author: JeF m.

description:
They actually use the same space as Rouge.. kinda confusing, maybe on weeknights only (bar to the right from entrance). Anyway, lots of patrons on a Thursday night, there's a bit of a wait too (=freshness?). They have two kinds of fish tacos, one is a bit healthier. That's the one I tried. Pretty gross, as far as flavors, not a whole lot. I doused the taco with some hot sauce (green guac based) but it didn't help much. The fish, which looked like chicken, had not fish taste whatsoever. It was actually like some really nasty white meat.. ok maybe not. There was a bit of char but that's about it

Friendly staff and food is cheap, about $4. Fish tacos? I'm not impressed at all. Previously I stroke out on a fish burrito from El Toro

PS girls are hot in Russian Hill
author: xo x.

description:
Yummy! The tacos are super good and perfect for a hangover. The salsa could use some spice. Must try them Nick's way. 
Yummy!
author: Kimberly C.

description:
A Mexican joint... inside of... ROUGE? Are you kidding me? I guess it makes sense, given that Rouge is that weird mishmash of people: Marina girls, Bro-sef dudes, Asian chicks and Russian mobsters. Even weirder decor: chandeliers and pinatas? Uh, okay... got it, got it.

The tacos are on POINT. Got the carnitas, fried fish and grilled fish tacos done up "Nick's way" (guac, jack cheese). Dang it was like Spring Break at Rosarito Beach all over again! 

Grab a fistful of napkins because the guac becomes your new lip gloss. Gets everywheres!
author: Genevieve R.

description:
Only had 2 vegetarian hard shell tacos, but they did it RIGHT! 
Good sized, crispy-soft, flaky shells, fresh & plentiful ingredients. YUM. 
It's true I live in the Mission and what more would I need taqueria wise? But still wish this place was closer to me b/c these tacos came with their own flare.
author: Autter Pop ..

description:
When I moved to Nob Hill/Russian Hill in August, the roommate and I took a stroll down Polk Street. Enticed by the ...tacos in a bar...we discovered Two Dollar Taco Tuesdays and were hooked! For three straight months we were there every Tuesday. Though of course if you want it Nick's way (which to me is the only way) with a massive amount of guac and melty cheese inside it costs you a little extra..but is so worth it.
That and a chips special to split ($2 chips and guac) makes my Tuesday nights.

Only issue is that over time, this place has gotten so crowded! There were several weeks where we had to stand and eat our food. And the people eating there are so rude!! Tables full of guys who finished eating and just sitting around and chatting while girls try to eat their tacos standing... spilling out chunks of meat on the floor with a basket of chips in the other hand, while they sit and digest? Can't they do that standing at the bar or better....at home? There's only so many tables, please, be courteous, I'd do it for you. (either that or they need signs up that during busy hours to not hog tables!) So with that...it's best to arrive early and if you do, be kind to the new fellow taco eaters who would like to seat and enjoy their taco....Nick's way.


*edit* went on another night besides Tuesday. I couldn't believe I paid $4.25 for one taco! Tuesday night (though its probably crowded enough) is the only night worth going. Unless you are really craving it....
author: Whitney F.

description:
I'm addicted.  The pescado (fried fish) taco's with guac & cheese (nick's way) are amazing!  I like them so much that I've never had anything else there...I need to have the fried fish.  I always ask them to hold the cabbage and cilantro and never once have they messed it up, which is more than I can say for any other place I've ordered fish taco's from.  Margarita's are also good.

Check out Taco Tuesdays for a great deal on taco's and drinks!

It's fast, it's good and living 4 blocks away doesn't hurt.
author: Laura J.

description:
Four words:  No Cell Phone Zone.  If their tacos tasted like ass, I would very likely give them my business anyway for those four simple words.  Fortunately for me and everyone else, their tacos don't taste remotely like ass, unless your ass happens to be meaty and delicious and covered in tasty guacamole.

Thanks, Nick's.  I love you.
author: Earline A.

description:
I've driven by Nick's Tacos on the way home too many times without stopping by, so today decided to have lunch there with some colleagues. First, I must mention that I feel awful for not ordering Nick's Crispy Tacos, despite being intrigued by the name. But somehow I could not bring myself to purchase a $4+ taco. Instead, I ordered a carne asada burrito with sour cream, guac, and cheese, which was  rather tasty and almost bordered on the "wet" style. 

The on-the-spot reviews of Nick's Crispy Tacos from my colleagues were positive. The pescado (fish fried in batter) tacos were huge and pretty good, according to one colleague. She ordered two but said one was enough for lunch. Another ordered the carne asada tacos, Nick's way, and said they were rather awesome. 

I'll definitely return to Nick's, next time for Tacos Nick's way, possibly on a tuesday to take advantage of $2 tacos. As for the other aspects of the restaurant, service was very friendly and efficient (the girl taking orders was rather attractive too, and that always helps). We also seemed to beat the lunch crowd, so perhaps the experience could be different when the place gets hectic. Also, one negative thing to mention was that from the moment I walked in all I could smell was whiskey, as if a wild party-til-morning in the name of Mr. Daniels spilled over to the 11:30 opening time.
author: Jonathan L.

description:
Okay, I had a LOT of margaritas the night I visited this place, so my review may not be that accurate. I remember...

- a very un-Mexican atmosphere. I guess they share the space with a club. The fabric and lighting made me feel pretty fancy. 

- incredibly tasty drinks (made with lime and sugar instead of yucky, high fructose corn syrupy mix) 

- a delicious vegetarian taco with cabbage. I usually hate cabbage but this taco was magical or something. I wish I could have tried a few other types of tacos, but I had to save room for margaritas. 

Go try this place and let me know if my drunken memories are accurate.
author: Adrienne T.

description:
Updated...

On another one of those rare San Francisco heat wave days, I went to Nicks to give it a second chance. I had a shrimp taco Nick style. It may be the best taco I've ever had and I will definitely go back. 


----
Old review...
On one of those rare San Francisco heat wave days, I was stuck in my non air conditioned apartment studying for the bar, sweating away at my computer. The only thing that kept me going was the thought of tacos and beer at the end of the day. So we trucked to Nick's only to find that it had closed early for a private party. Boo.
author: Sarah H.

description:
Nick's Crispy Tacos the the Northern California version of my beloved California Chicken Cafe (CCC). Their menus or decor don't resemble each other in the slightest, but the food is wholesome, delicous and always a great value. Oh, and did I mention that I eat here so much I should be on the payroll? Here are my favorites:

veggie taco 
tortilla soup
veggie burrito (I am a carnivore, but for some reason, I think the veggie versions are tastier than the meat versions)
chips and salsa ($1 dollar... holler!!)
chicken quesadilla
author: M T.

description:
Definitely will be back, great tacos.

Kind of an odd location as it's actually inside the neighboring lounge/nightclub...Not exactly a taco stand vibe, ya know?

Food itself is great, IMHO...They have the standard 'Niman Ranch' meats and everything tastes fresh.

I'd highly recommend the camarones (Good sized & good tasting) as they had the best flavor, 2nd would be the mahi mahi tacos.
