Only real complaint would be more like an observation, the salsa is nothing special...Considering great salsa can be memorable from some mexican taquerias, this place has pretty forgettable salsa.

Still, I'll be back for the camarones!
author: Barca F.

description:
Nick's is definitely the best burrito in the bubble (russian hill, marina, pac heights).  All of the ingredients are high quality and the place is clean (a top notch Yuppie burrito place).  Additionally the service is great and the atmosphere is unique (to say the least).

Pretty much everything on the menu is great.  The beef and pork are better than the chicken.

The only downsides are long waits and no credit cards (both very annoying given they could easily be solved with more staff and a credit card machine)
author: Trevor T.

description:
Nick's tacos are amazing and I am glad I finally got to try them. 
Are they the absolute best? I would have to say they come pretty darn close except for the fact that I did try better last year, in Panama ( and half the price). As far as what is around the bay area, they will do the trick to satisfy my craving.
I had the carnitas tacos done Nick's style and these things were ginormous. Maybe next time I won't get the Nick' style considering I could barely fit them in my mouth.
author: Kehaulani K.

description:
best fish tacos i've ever had.  

cool space but crowd gets unruly & obnoxious as the night wears on.
author: Noah C.

description:
Back in the day, I was all about the Crispy Taco.  No longer.  Someone instead opted for the Gnarly Asscrack.  It started off great, and hit the wall.  Hard.  And the experience has shattered like a crispy taco.  Pity.

(I'm actually not trying to be funny here, it's been substandard for years and I'm disappointed).
author: keith k.

description: Crispy tacos... Had the carne asada and fish taco. It was aiite... I think the salsa plays a big part in your taco game. Salsa game wasn't on point to match with the tacos. A word of advice for nick's tacos. Step up ya salsa game!! And it be much better. But definitely decent spot for the price. 3 stars y'all aint nuttin too crazy.
author: El D.

description: daaaaaaaamn these are  some good tacos.  my friend introduced me to nick's a couple of years ago and i have been a fan ever since. I gotta have those crispies at least one every couple of weeks or else someone gonna die. I usually get 2 tacos: 1 carne asado taco and 1 chicken asado taco both nick's way....bomb...BOMB!  If you do go you have to get them nick's way to enjoy the full flavor experience.  The people there are always friendly and helpful, after you order your food they bring it to your table and everything .  Since the spot they are in is a bar/club at night they always have plenty of seating.  The only thing that sucks is that they only take cash which can sometimes be a pain but no worries i'll still be back.  man....writing this review make me wanna go there right now.
author: Zack K.

description:
Who knew we could find our favorite tacos not in the mission, but in Russian Hill? I've been going to Nick's for years, and I usually keep enough cash on me to be covered here (cash only) in the event that I spontaneously crave their guacamole. I always tell people Nick's has a way of making the best pico, even when tomatoes aren't in season...they pile the pico atop a mound of wonderfully plump guacamole and fresh tortilla chips and there you have it: my favorite treat in town. The fish tacos rock here, but my favorite is carne asada "nick's way" (with cheese melted between two tortillas and guacamole as an extra boost of flavor. Ooh lala. 
I have also enjoyed their oversize burritos (love the pork), tortilla soup, and quesadillas. But the tacos take the cake! Great place to go Saturday for lunch...
author: Catherine P.

description: Don't be put off by the tacky bordello interior, the food is great!  I had the grilled chicken tacos (soft), and did my best to eat every bite.  Beans on the tacos were a little odd, but still good.  Chips and salsa were terrific and they had an additional selection of salsas available.  Service was quick and friendly.
author: Kat S.

description: Excellent fish tacos and tortilla soup, as well as the elote, cooked just right! The atmosphere was a little funky for my taste, as well as funky table set-ups and not the friendliest staff, but the food makes up for this, definitely worth going here. YUM! I was surprised by how delicious their food was, because the outside of the restaurant does not do a great job of enticing you.
author: amy s.

description: Convenient and a fun atmosphere.  Get the chicken taco "fully loaded" to experience this place.
author: mimi n.

description: Had a crispy fish taco, nicks style - perfect, especially with the green sauce.  One fried toritlla, one soft tortilla -- it's like a foodie's version of the double crunch from taco bell (e.g., 100 times better).  Only minus one star for the price - nearly seven bucks!  (Though to their credit they charge $1 b/c due to rising cost of seafood resulting from the BP oil spill).  I wish there were cheaper fish taco places in the Bay that could do the Ensenada taco pescado justice.
author: C T.

description: I really haven't ever had anything here that I don't like.  Tacos, yum!  Burritos, yum!  Nachos, yes please!  It can be a bit crowded but it is so worth it.  I would not suggest going on a Tuesday or around dinner time.  I would suggest going after the lunch rush and before dinner.  The customer service is fairly good.  The only time I have ever been unsatisfied with the service has been during their busiest times.  They tend to think people know everything about their menu, so be ready to order as soon as you get to the counter.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Tacos Nick's Way are the BEST tacos I've ever had! The quesadillas are also remarkably crispy and delicious too. Great texture and flavor on everything I've tried there. Points lost for lack of seating in Rouge, especially if you come with a big group. Really random restaurant but so good!
author: Louise S.

description:
i may have waited too long before composing this review, because most of what i remember of the one meal i had here is that it's fun to watch chicks outshoot their boyfriends on the basketball game and that the waitpersons screwed up my beer order and ended up giving me a second one for free because of it.

the tacos were ok but mostly, they were just bigger than i expected them to be for the price.
author: Will R.

description: All I have to say is: CARNE ASADA! We got the quesadilla with carne asada and we were in HEAVEN! Not only were the portions for the quesdilla huge, they were so good we ate the whole thing! We also tried the fish tacos, which were also pretty good, but if you have to choose a meat, definitely go with the carne asada.  They also have great drink specials and if the place is pretty empty, the bartender will hook it up!
author: Bela M.

description: We got the fish and carnitas tacos (Nick's style of course) and the nachos with steak. Good food and football. Nuff said
author: Man S.

description:
Nick's tacos were the best fish tacos I've ever had.  In fact, they were the ONLY good fish tacos I've ever had.  I highly recommend the NICKS special carnita tacos!!  You pay a little more, I think $1?  But it is soo worth it!

Minus one star for the atmosphere
author: Sheila N.

description:
the two things i order here are the fish tacos and the corn on the cob.  both of which are absolutely yummy!  enough said!
limited parking is the only drawback.
author: Serena L.

description: All I can say is epic. I don't frequent SF restaurants as I live in Sonoma County, and can't take the traffic, but I would brave the lunatic taxi drivers as a pedestrian to get these tacos. (Specifically the Baja style fish tacos...) Unfotunately, they were closing for a private party and we only had a half hour (make that about 10 minutes, they took nearly 20 minutes to prepare...) to enjoy and savor the tasty taco-liciousness, but it was well worth the wait. At $4.00 a taco, Nick's is pretty pricey compared to your run-of-the-mill taqueria but it's certainly not outrageous. The tacos are filling, and I left satisfied. If you're from outside of SF make sure you stop here. If you're from SF, I can't believe you haven't been here yet.
author: Chelsea P.

description: Great tacos, reasonable drink prices, and a nice classy layout. Best tacos in San Francisco.
author: Marcos R.

description:
When it comes to tacos, burritos & all things Mexican food, Nick is not a traditionalist. That said, I've set up some rules.

RULES FOR NICK'S CRISPY TACOS:
1. You must pretend that you've never eaten burritos in the Mission. Matter of fact, pretend you've never even been to or heard of the Mission.
2. You must overlook the fact that you will likely be called 'bro', 'chief', or 'boss' by someone either while waiting in line or while ordering at the counter.
3. You must not dwell on the deep red colored walls, round velvet booths, or sticky dance floor (this place morphs into a striped-shirt w/the collar popped wearing b&t-crowd on weekends).
4. You must let Nick do his thing here. This can be accomplished by allowing them to make your food "Nick's Way".
5. If you are eating in-house, really focus in...concentrate on the eating. If you are taking your meal elsewhere, shoot for a quiet place & someplace close. I will stress again that it must be close. Walking long distances with a bag full of goodness hitting your nostrils is dangerous, & you don't want to be that person sitting cross-legged on the sidewalk scarfing down food in public. That is indecent.

If you follow these instructions, Nick's is an almost perfect non-Mexican taco/burrito experience. When the place is almost empty (ie. early), it's quite possibly the best cheap meal in Russian Hill. The fish tacos (Nick's way, of course) are highly recommended.

It's one of the few places in town where I'm willing to tolerate a quick blast of extreme broishness.
author: Pete J.

description: OMIGOD! The BEST tacos in the world! I swear! Everything is so FRESH! The PESCADO is my personal favorite...Make sure to get it "Nick's Way" The chips... So light so crispy... We love this place...Plus it is so affordable...
author: Mrs. B.

description: Be still my heart! Nick's Crispy Tacos are my favorite tacos in the city. At first glance you may think it's crazy to stand in line for $6 tacos ($7.50 for "Nick's way" -- which is a must), but just wait until you take your first bite. YUM, these tacos are out of this world, and well worth the wait & price. First timers, try Taco Tuesday... it's a great way to try the tacos and a cheap drink from Rouge Nightclub at the same time.
author: Tyler C.

description: Best baja style (or any type of taco) pescado tacos ever made. I walked 10 blocks each for for three days to eat here on my vacation.
author: Fat T.

description:
people who think this place is expensive need to move away from san francisco. actually, just move out of california. seriously. this place is cheap. you are retarded if you think otherwise.

there is mayonnaise on the fish tacos and i don't think i need to say much more about that. $15 pitchers of margaritas and delicious chips with guacamole. sure the crowd is a bit douchey and i got a lot of dirty looks from girls who try too hard and the table situation is a bit stressful, but the food is outstanding, the staff have the patience of saints, and i will definitely be back.
author: Rachael S.

description: Great taqueria and a club style bar in the same place, totally great idea. Stay late and bring some friends to create your own dance floor.  Don't forget to bring cash for tacos!
author: Mike W.

description: TACO TUESDAY'S..... Gotta go on those nights... $2.00 tacos.... don't forget to ask for it "Nick's Way"..... SOO GOOD!
author: E S.

description: A true San Francisco classic, tacos Nick's Way - two shells with beans and guac - are spectacular.
author: Gregg W.

description:
Taco Tuesday = Waste-case Wednesday.

I was visiting the west coast for the first time and my friend (a local) suggested taco Tuesday for our last night in the city. I love tacos and I sure as heck love tequila so this seemed like a great idea. The line was super long to get a table for tacos so we forewent the staple food and hit up the pizza place next door, about a half hour later we stopped back in and the place was less crowded, this is where the liquor consumption began. Strong margaritas for only $3? I must be in heaven! A lie it was not, a round for my friends cost me what a single margarita might back home. The crowd seemed cool, one girl came around from the other side of the bar and told my friends that we were her musical soulmates because we all seemed to love/hate the same songs as they came on. The only strange one we met was a guy that when asked if he lived in the neighborhood went on a rant about how he lives in the marina and drives a porsche...um, overcompensating for a smaller package elsewhere? I think so...

All in all a great experience from an out-of-towners perspective. The following morning's drive down the PCH through Big Sur was a little touch and go, but will definitely visit again when I get back out that way.
author: Rebecca S.

description: ok just  a few words. the food is ok.  the place i dont have no comment for it.
author: Cesar E.

description: I go here often because I love the fish tacos, black bean and grilled corn taco salad with grilled fish, the chips, salsa and guacamole, the margaritas, and their nice attentive staff. I also like the booths.
author: Alisha A.

description: love the tacos, nick's way, of course.  the quesadillas with the chunky meat fillings are good, too.  i prefer to call in to order take-out as the line can sometimes be long and unfortunately for me, when they're totally slammed, they won't answer the phone for orders, which means i either have to go place the order in person, wait (anytime between 15min - an hr) and call back, or go with plan b.  none of them are really options if all you're craving is a nick's taco.
author: Jenny Q.

description: Ended up at this place by accident but so so glad I did.  Very yummy and very inexpensive! I had Carne Asada tacos - Nick's way. Absolutely delicious!
author: Shelly H.

description: I really enjoyed this place; it's best with friends on a Sunday afternoon when the line is short.  The food is delicious, especially when ordered Nick's Way (with lots of guacamole and pico de gallo).  Service is fast and friendly, and there was a decent amount of seating.  (The place also turns into a bar/club on Friday and Saturday evenings.)  I'll definitely be going back soon for some pollo asado tacos.
author: AJ M.

description: Four stars yes... For one thing only - the star of the menu : the fish (pescado) burrito or taco.  Get it with guac or NIck's style.  Its the bomb.
author: Randy C.

description: The best tacos I have ever had. You have to order the crispy fried fish tacos. They are by far the best; however you can't go wrong with any of them. Also, make sure you get the Elote, corn on the stick, for dessert.
author: Will U.

description: I had a yelp deal (similiar to a groupon) for Nick's so I headed over with a friend to finally check out what all the buzz was about. The tacos "Nick's way" are definitely the way to go, they taste delish! But not sure that I'd go as far to call them the best taqueria in the city. I think there are plenty of spots in the Mission that would win that award. Props to the bartender on thursday nights who serves up happy hour margaritas, on the rocks, with salt, that are strong! One tip to keep in mind, they don't take credit cards, so make sure to bring cash.
author: Carla V.

description: Love the happy hour on Tuesdays!  Prices are still a little steep for not-so-good tacos.
author: Michaelrutherford L.

description:
What can I say...walked into Nick's and felt that I was in Scarface the movie.  Was afraid that Al Pacino and Michelle Pfeiffer were gonna walk in and blow up the place.

Food and Margaritas were cheap, filling and zummy.  Not the best but certainly one of the few joints in this city that knows how to make a fish taco -- I'm from San Diego so that's a compliment.  

Bonus:  they try to use sustainable ingredients.  That alone makes it worth a trip.
author: Dee Dee N.

description: Loving the longer hours. Still one of my favorite gringo burrito joints (get the stewed chicken with everything, but the taco's nicks way is great too).
author: Neil K.

description:
The tacos are good, but  ...ASK FOR A RECEIPT and CHECK YOUR CHANGE!!!

The cashier SHORT-CHANGED me ON PURPOSE at lunch on Friday, 4/1 ...its was not an April fools joke!  

My guest and I ordered our food, the  cashier (male) looked at the register, quizzically, and said "...oh, $22 even, I like it when it does that!"  

I looked at the receipt and realized that he had short-changed me, on purpose. ...the receipt CLEARLY showed the correct amount of change that was owed to me.

I confronted the cashier and he said "...oh, it was only a few cents, I thought you wouldn't mind."    To say I was extremely upset at this cavalier attitude about MY MONEY, is an understatement.  

NO MATTER how you look at it, it's attempting to steal money from a customer ...pure and simple stealing.  NOT GOOD BUSINESS at all.

So, Nicks Tacos, no matter how good your tacos are, I WILL NOT BE BACK and I will make certain other people are aware of this practice.
author: Ted R.

description: Great cheap place.  Tacos Nick's way the only way to go.
author: Alex P.

description: Really good... try it "Nick's way". Chips and salsa are very good too, but you'll have to pay for chips (they're worth it). Often out of beer at lunchtime when the bar is closed... a huge bummer.
author: Mark W.

description:
The decor is something to get use to but the tacos are fabulous. Get the grilled fish instead of the breaded, healthier and better tasting.

Excellent Salsa.
author: Alesha G.

description:
BEST NACHOS EVER.  If you can be patient and wait in the 30 minuet line, then the 15 minute to get your food, just try them...they are unreal.  Word to Nick's bud who stole his restaurant from Nick, GET ANOTHER CASH REGISTER.

The staff can be pretty brutal though at times.
author: Jared P.

description:
Hmm.. applaud them for being different but the Mission still claims the best Mexican food.

I recently decided to be bold and not get a taco (nick's style of course) and had the chicken quesadilla for the first time.  It was pretty good and had a good amt of chicken which went well with one of their hot sauces. They actually fry the outside which I guess shouldn't be too surprising given the "nick's way".  Overall, I agree with others that this is really made for a pre-game polk street bar crawl night.  (*note the $2 margarita's at the bar which is golden)
author: Ken S.

description:
I don't know why people rant and rave over this place, but on a Saturday evening, my buddies forced me to give it a try.  I was hoping to be wowed by the food, but sadly, the chicken and fish crispy taco's "Nick's Way" were mediocre at best.  We got there right before closing, so that may have had something to do with it.  The margarita's on the other hand were great.

In any event, if you are looking for great taco's my favorite, La Taqueria in the Mission is by far much better.  I guess if you are looking for a more hipster environment, then I guess Nick's is your place.
author: Vince S.

description:
4 stars for the out of this world fish tacos, nick's way!

3 stars for the price.

2 stars for the cheap seating.

1 star for the tacky decor and the yuppie location.
author: Riri S.

description:
Just had Nick's for a lunch meeting. We had all types of tacos - including Nick's style - and burritos, as well as chips and salsa. The tacos were pretty tasty, the burritos to me were mediocre. 

I've never been to the store front so I have no clue what it's like there. But as far as lunch fare it was a pretty good meal. Our order for around 50 people arrived on time and hot.
author: Michelle B.

description:
It doesn't hurt that it's right across the street from my apartment, then again, it certainly isn't helping my waistline.

Pescado taco "Nick's Way" 
Chips with Guac and Salsa
Dos Equis (make it 2)

nuf said.
author: Caitlin D.

description:
I Love This Place... I figured I would go ahead and echo what many have said, but it's true. I come here regularly and I think the Pescado Taco is awesome! Sure it's not "authentic mexican" but who cares??? Its great food! I have also had several other tacos and the nachos on the menu and still I find myself gravitating to the fish taco. Just remember to get the Tacos Nick's Way. 
The restaurant is located inside of a night club, so if you go here for dinner you can only get take-out. 
The chips and salsa are also really great!
author: Dash H.

description:
Gotta go Nick's way baby.  A taco here without going Nick's way is just an injustice.  But I really go here for the chips, they're INCREDIBLE.  

The decor is pretty cool.  Nick's by day and club Rouge by night, it's all posh in their with chandeliers and red velvet seats so it definitely makes for a unique experience.
author: Gordon B.

description:
I don't know why everyone's hating on Nick's either.  It is my favorite hangover meal!  The tacos done Nick's way are amazing - carnitas is the best (I can't speak for the other menu items).  I REALLY love the pinto beans in the tacos, and the guacamole is really fresh and delicious.  

If you're there on a weekend, try the breakfast taco.  They put an over-easy fried egg in there.  The first time I tried it, it was totally unexpected and wonderful.

It's not super cheap, but it's San Francisco - what do you expect?  The tacos are hearty - I can't finish 2... so you can get a pretty good size meal and a beer for less than $10.
author: Erin D.

description:
The famous Nick's Crispy Tacos, is definitely a diamond in the rough snuggled in the side of rouge night club.  The decor is fairly tacky but the tacos are unbelievable.  I would say the one ingredient to die for here is the guacamole.  A basket chips and guac feed about 3 (1 if your hungover), and the Tacos are the best in town.  The only downside are the hours, they close early because they share space with Rouge night club - I would have given this a 5 star if they were open late night and I could snag some on my way out of the buccaneer!

-CSE
author: John G.

description: Prepare to be wowed because Nick's crack corn tacos are friggin ridic. Greasy, crispy, amazing. NOM!
author: Alex H.

description: If you need to read a review on Yelp to decide whether or not you should go to Nick's, you're doing it wrong.
author: Charles G.

description: For my money, the best tacos in the city. The pescado never fails to be amazing, and the carne asada -- Nick's Way, of course! -- is always great as well. Half-priced Taco Tuesdays is more for those looking for a fun night out than an easy and cheap meal. Never disappoints!
author: Jenna W.

description: Taco Tuesday is ok. Really wanted to like this place after hearing all the rave reviews from friends/yelpers. First of, its way too crowded and felt like a meat market inside. Waited in line for about 25 minutes for crispy fish tacos and turned out to be a bit on the soggy side. Having to wait for that long in line for tacos, I was expecting a little better than what I got. Maybe there was a huge demand might of downscaled the quality of the tacos, but would give it another shot, maybe on a different day.
author: Maria V.

description: I wasn't in love with this place.  I went here for happy hour/dinner with some of the girls on a wednesday night so it wasn't super crowded and service was quick.  I had a carnitas taco and carne asada taco.  Both were not as warm as I would've liked for them to be, though the flavors were pretty good.  oh and did i mention $3 margaritas and $10 pitchers of stella? I'm not sure I'd make this one of my regular taco places since theres so much good mexican in SF, but i definitely had a great time.
author: Lisa C.

description: Let me add this place is not cheap mexican if you think it would be. I dropped a good $20+ after drinks, quesadilla, taco, and chips. The quesadillas are good too! Fine take my money!
author: Karen T.

description:
Feels like you are eating a european brothel, no joke!

The tacos are staright YUM, The Pescado is the best as well as the Carnita's. You can get full here AND have a brew or a 'rita for about $10, if that isn't a steal, then I don't know what is.
author: S A.

description: Awesome food! Vegi quesadilla rocks!
author: Khyati J.

description: Daytime taco stand, night time club -- it's a weird experience but it's clearly working because this place is a SF institution.  You've got to try it at least once.
author: Teague A.

description: I don't like tacos but I love this place! I'll go there any day. You def have to try the tacos nicks way, and the chips and guacamole are bomb.
author: Kirsten D.

description: Awesome tacos prepared instantly. It's converted to a bar after hours, so get there before they stop cooking!
author: George D.

description:
The best mexican in the city...

A chicken taco Nick's way is a little slice of heaven.  The people are always helpful.  

This place is a once a week venture for me, and if you're smart, you would be wise to do the same.
author: Aaron M.

description: You get 4 stars purely for taste. I had Nick's fish tacos and they were faaabulous! However, after living in LA for years you just can't compete with the SoCal flavor and price. CMON! $5 for ONE taco? Saaad. I'll go broke before having my fill of tacos at this taco joint.
author: Erin M.

description: Nicks Tacos are awesome. Some of the best tacos I have had to date. They do not skimp on the meat at this place. if you are fortunate enough to be here for happy hour then you will not have any complants about this place. Where is my cerveza?
author: Marty M.

description:
This place has really gone downhill over the last couple years....I used to be a huge fan, but the quality of food has really detoriated, especially for how ridiculously high priced this place is. 

Case in point - Last week, I paid $20 for a bean&cheese burrito, soggy nachos smothered with cheese whiz (not real cheese) , and 2 small sodas. If that's not convincing enough, add a 20 minute wait and having to deal with arrogant workers who think they're amazing for working at a high-end taco shop. 

Love, 
Disgruntled Julio
author: David S.

description:
thi place is hellza good
get nicks style tacos

checkeein or fish or steak all hella good

stak nachos hella good

sometims when i get burritos i barf afterswards but like i barf a lot so thats noso bad

they also have drink specials sometimes so thats pretty solid

like tuesdays are a clusterfuk so like id rather not go. like all 20 something marins kids who like listening to hip hop my roommate when i was a freswhmen listend to... like really bad
author: Cristopher K.

description: Great, 3.5 almost a 4.. quality food, great taste.. parking a bit of a challenge.
author: Troy S.

description: Friends very frequently like to drop by San Francisco on visits, and I always like to give them a tour.  One of my best stops is assuring them they will taste "the best tacos of your life."  I then follow up by saying it is a paradox to have something crunchy and yet at the same time soft, but still delicious.  Bottom line remains: great tacos, great service... Taco Tuesdays are after 5:00, $2 tacos, $2 beers, DJ, and the place gets craackin! A bit pricey, but definitely worth the food... fresh salsa and great guac.... get any taco Nick's way, it's worth 99 cents more
author: Antonio C.

description:
Only in San Francisco... a Mexican place that turns into a frou-frou dance place after 9:00 PM... but let's go back to the food.  I fell in line (a long line) to order and the guy at the counter was really helpful and friendly because all I knew was that I wanted fish tacos, but they had more than one kind.

I asked the guy for a recommendation and without even thinking twice, he said "fried fish tacos, Nick's Way".  Nick's Way means it's crispy all over.  I was in TACO HEAVEN!  The shell was crispy and the fish was seasoned right.  Not oily at all and topped with sour cream and guacamole.  I am already craving it as I write this review!!!  Back to the taco, it is also inexpensive... $3.50 per taco so I had to have two!  :-)

I am definitely going back!  Parking isn't that great but it's unique, it's good and that's all it takes.
author: MJ A.

description:
Taco Tuesdays are great. This place can get insanely crowded, but not a bad scene if you are looking to meet someone new. Food was good, but man Taco Tuesdays.. expect a line. Definitely a fun place though. Although I don't know if it's because of the atmosphere, but Taco Shop at Underdog's is my preferred venue.

Favorites: Carnitas, Carne Asada, and Baja Fish Taco - everything Nick's way!
author: Jeannette L.

description: I like a good, simple, mouthwatering fish taco... which is very hard to find in SF. Nick's version didn't really satisfy me like everyone else.
author: Patty P.

description:
I just returned home from eating at Nick's, and am shocked I haven't got the runs!!! wow!!! Truly a miracle!!!

The place was nicely filled, a deceiving sign that all is well and edible....  WRONG! Seat yourself after ordering at the bar counter. Take a number on a stick so the guy knows where to toss the food when ready. 

I ordered a root beer and it tasted like water. Had NO taste of root beer or anything else. It was yeeck, not yelp. My sister complained about her iced tea....  it went to worst quickly. The carnitas taco I ordered was warm, and the meat was either microwaved too long to heat it up, or just plain over-cooked; it was terrible and with or without sauce, the stringy meat had NO flavor, no taste and no substance. The beans were cold - the menu states: BRAiSED shredded pork...  well, if this was braised perhaps they used an oven that resembled the engine of a Ford? The bean & cheese burrito my sister had was steamed - so she says - and had no flavor also. However, on the one tiny good point, the poppers she ordered was steaming hot out of the deep fryer and she liked that! YUCK. As I waited for sis to finish her "food", I watched as two guys at the bar tried to order but couldn't attract the attention of the gal, too busy chatting with a friend and laughing so much she couldn't hear these two guys calling her from 10feet away. 

The place reeks of a Las Vegas nightclub nightmare, and is the first place I've ever seen in my life with red carpeting on the ceiling. Looks like nothing is spent on maintenance of the place, so they'll use the location till it falls down and then a bit longer. They could try cleaning the place WELL, other than wiping everything onto the seats and floors.

It's truly the FIRST place I've been to during my two-year time in the states where I wish I hadn't walked into the place. For a moment I thought I was in a slum-house in the Tenderloin and not on Polk Street - not much difference I guess. Stay away if you want real food.
author: Tony L.

description: best tacos ever!!!!!! get them done nicks way!  i'm craving them right now!!!!  affordable and delicious...
author: Nirat C.

description:
I will preface this by saying I think Nick's Crispy Tacos are delish. Tacos or burritos, they have a bunch of good types. I am partial to the camarones burrito but hear the fried fish taco, nick's way, is also awesome.

But I am giving the bad score for service - something I have little to no patience for. My boyfriend and I wanted to go here last night after getting back from a day at the beach.  I check the hours online and it said it was open until 10. We finally got starving and headed over around 8:45 and the guy at the counter was mouthing off that he had "things to do" and was closing the kitchen at 9 because he felt like it. We ordered our food just in time, but then he was turning people away behind us. After we got our food my boyfriend decided he wanted a soda and went to ask the guy for a Coke. The guy said they were closed and he couldn't get him a soda. It was 9:02. They were still letting people sit and eat and drink at the bar, but he couldn't get him a bottle of soda.  I'm sorry you have things to do, but we are customers and it wouldn't exactly inconvenience you to hand a soda over the counter.
author: Katie W.

description: Food - good. Attitude - a bit anal retentive and nickel/dimey.
author: Raul L.

description: It was, ok. I have some friends that really like this place but for me, it wasn't anything special. I had it on a few occasions just to make sure it wasn't me, but i honestly don't see why this place is better than another other place making fish tacos. I had expected something better considering how other people talk about this place, but i don't think i set my expectations that high either. Just doesn't do it for me, but at least there isn't a crazy wait, so i would come back if i'm near by.
author: Bennie H.

description:
anytime i've wanted a taco from here they were always closed.  my first encounter with nick's crispy tacos was from their second kitchen in the underdog; the taco shop.  after shopping at the appel & frank chic summer soiree, us four hungry girls cruised on over to NCT.

i enjoyed their tacos as i always do.  i ordered the camarones and pescado tacos, nick's way.  my girlfriends got tacos, and the elote con queso.  that was some serious tasty corn, and i had to steal bites from all of them.  

it's funny that the restaurant is in the night club.
author: Sheri N.

description: The fried fish taco Nick's way is the only way to go.
author: Liz M.

description: So perhaps not the epitome of authenticity, but it IS a fantastic hangover food. One taco is actually pretty filling.
author: Natalie S.

description:
This is a pretty good local place to go for a quick bite and a beer with friends, but I don't think the food is quite as good as it is made out to be in reviews. The Taco's are pretty good, but not amazingly flavorful or large. As I mentioned in my La Taqueria review, I might just be biased by the fact that I am more of a burritto and quesadilla fan personally. 

Still, good to have it in the neighberhood. Not much other Mexican food in Russian hill..
author: Andrew D.

description: It was odd to step into Rouge to find these popular crispy tacos...looking around at the inside of the club during the daytime is quite horrendous. I won't lie. You can smell the ickyness of alcohol from the night before and see the black stains on the walls, grounds and booth chairs...but despite the scene from the night before, I sat there and enjoyed every bite of  my Nick's deep fried fish tacos with guacamole and creamy white sauce stuffed inside a crispy shell and then stuffed inside a soft tortilla. It was 1 hell of a taco.
author: Oanh N.

description:
i have been wanting to come here for a while now... i've been wanting to see what the fuss was all about regarding the tacos.

i finally walk through the door and what do i order??? a breakfast burrito. YUUUUUMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMMM. i will be back.

i have a date with a taco in my future.
author: jamie b.

description: Incredible Tacos!!!  Huge, hearty, and the carne asada is excellent.  Also, its Nicks way, or hit the highway.  Nicks way an addition of beans, and guac if im not mistaken.  Makes a big difference.  If you go on Tuesday night there is a heard of young fun people and good drink specials.  And if you go on weekend nights the place turns into a night club, which isn't my cup of tea.  Go to nicks for the awesome food, but do expect to pay for it.  The food is great, but not cheap!!!
author: Michael H.

description: The Food is great and the margarita pitchers are great too! Tuesday is the spot to be seen, but I warn be ready to drink and be ready to deal with yuppie white people right out of college. Other then that, you will have a great time if you are with your friends. Oh and one more thing, on tuesdays its cash only for Tacos and be ready to stand in line.
author: Leslie C.

description:
I really wanted to love this place, I really, really did.   As a SoCal transplant, I like my taco shells crispy and I'm fine with a bit of vegetation inside my taco or burrito.  Having gone out of my way to give it a try, it's with regret that I must say it wasn't worth the time or energy to do so.  

This isn't to say I wouldn't go back.  The carne asada from Niman Ranch is of high-quality and rather flavorful, and the crispy taco shell appears to be homemade.  The guacamole and pico de gallo were a bit lacking in spice, but easily spruced up with the available hot sauces on the tables.  My only real complaint about the taco is the fact that the crispy shell wasn't all that crispy by the time the food hit my table, but that's a minor thing for me.  Overall, the tacos get a 3, and they'd get a 4 if they weren't $3.95 each.

I did appreciate the fact that they have rotating flavors of aqua fresca (last night's were mango and watermelon) and access to a full bar.  Not many taquerias can boast a full bar, and it's nice to enjoy a margarita with a taco.  Customer service was a little bit slow, but friendly - I did have to ask for the soda I ordered as they didn't bring it over with the food, but it happens.  

My main disappointment was the burrito.  I recognize that these are my own tastebuds talking here as there wasn't anything technically wrong with the burrito, and it did come as advertised, although...did cabbage have to mean red cabbage?!?  Seriously, red cabbage?  The menu mentioned there was cabbage in the vegetarian burrito, and I was genuinely looking forward to the textures and the potential interminglings of guac, cabbage and sour cream.   But not red cabbage!!!  I happen to love red cabbage, but it's a lot denser than regular cabbage and has a different flavor.  I'm willing to bet it would have been better in a fish taco, but I don't like fish so...oh, and, er, parsley.  Waaay too much parsley.  The parsley to cilantro ratio should have been a lot smaller if it had to be in there at all.  Yes, they're related plants, but they taste as different as well, red and green cabbage.   Neither the parsley nor the red cabbage belonged in that burrito.

I'll gladly sip a margarita, munch on a crispy taco, some chips (those look homemade too) and give the quesadilla a try the next time I'm in the area.  However, I'm not making a special trip and I'm staying the hell away from their vegetarian burrito.  

2.5 stars.
author: Sus... B.

description:
Amazing spot.  One of my new favorites in the city.

So Nicks tacos is basically inside the rouge night club (which is more like a bar with red walls and chandeliers). Grabbed a seat at the bar while a friend got in line on the other side of the place at the Nicks taco bar.  Got a number for our taco order and worked on the drink at the bar while watching a Cubs game (this is getting better and better),
Tacos came pretty quickily, maybe about 5 mins.  PHENOMENAL tacos!  I got one shrimp and one baja style fish taco- both 'nicks way' which is something about a soft taco wrapped around a very thin crispy tortilla shell.  Still not sure which was my favorite, as they were both super tasty.  Both tacos had this amazing shmear of some sort of guacamole spread thing that was delicious, and then I drenched it in this mouthwatering cilantro-y not overly hot hot sauce and was in heaven.
I love the idea of this place - go order some food and take a number to the table, but not in that boring old diner/deli way, but taking that idea and elevating it to a cool lookin' bar with badass tacos.
Warning - the night we went was comedy night, and before 10 they have to make sure their routines are clean, and I guess that is a real stretch for comedians, it was pretty lame.
Will absolutely be back (in fact can't wait to go back!)
author: meg p.

description: I take back my criticisms. I am now a believer. One bit of positive advice: Try saying your order en Espanol.
author: Evelyn B.

description: I crave this place all the time....its naughty.  Their tacos are so dam good....but you have to have them Nick's Way.....its fried goodness I tell you.  I always get the fish tacos and they never disappoint.  Be sure to have plenty of napkins around cause you'll look like a hot mess if you don't.
author: Natacha M.

description: Drink...drank...drunk...what next?  Tacos, of course!  Pescado tacos y carne asada tacos...yummmmmm
author: Michelle G.

description:
I absolutely adore Nick's crispy tacos. I go there at least once a week! no joke...

I start off with the chips, salsa, and guac!! you can not find chips and salsa like here! Believe me i check everywhere i go! They're homemade and seriously melt in your mouth with goodness.

I used to get the fish taco, nick's way (as it is the best), but have moved on to getting a carne asada burrito with everything (except beans) and extra meat sauce! lol oh and wrapped in a tomato tortilla! YUMMMM i seriously love it and even crave it! 

Nick's has a great environment, good food (organic and free range supporters!), and interesting people! 

BTW, Nick's and Underdogs are not run by the same owner. Nick's is the original restaurant, Underdog's is just an imitation and in a gross bar. Unless you like sitting in a 2x4 space and being drenched in the alcoholic infested nastiness.
author: Shanna C.

description:
Fantastic tacos at a for a decent price.  My husband and I went there for dinner on a Saturday night.  Even though it took us 20 minutes to find a parking place, it was totally worth the effort!
We both had two tacos each and an order of chips and salsa.  The chips were deep-fried and crunchy (this is not your typical tortilla chip, people) and had a nice spread of homemade pic de gallo on it.
I had the carne asadas nick's way and felt it definitely hit the spot.  It was hearty and delicious and perfect.  I also had the camarones taco...this one was good, but I definitely liked the tacos done Nick's way better and will order them like that in the future.  There was something about the red cabbage that they put in the regular taco that just seemed strange to me.
At any rate, this was a great way to satisfy my  taco craving.  Between the two of us, we ordered 4 tacos, an order of chips and salsa, a beer, and a Coke, and it came out to be less than $30 with tax.  Sweet deal!
Also, the interior is totally cheesy, but I love it: big red velour booths with large elaborate chandeliers.  It was abuzz with activity, with people laughing and having a good time. You seat yourself, which adds to the chill, laid-back vibe of the place.  Good times.
author: Nina B.

description: WHOA THERE...   One of my favorite meals, until yesterday, when the people at the booth next to me were served a plate of nachos with - wait for it - A COCKROACH IN IT!!!!   Makes me sad because their food is so good, but I won't be back for a while.
author: Sage S.

description: Great place to go after being out with friends...I ordered the fish burrito and it was huge.  The flavor as it was served was a bit bland...but the sauces they have on the table are a little bit o' heaven.  Once I slathered every other bite with a bit of what I believe to be the tomatillo sauce I was in heaven.  The odd thing was that I literally had an entire fish fillet in  my burrito, it was not broken up but thrown in the burrito as it was, which made eating it an interesting thing.  If I was in the area I would certainly go back, but not sure I would go out of my way to go there especially with all the AMAZING taquerias in town!
author: Adrienne B.

description: Why hello yummy, vegetarian tacos! If only this place was cleaner and had better seating. I always feel like a hawk waiting for a table at this joint! Points for being cheap and close to my house, subtraction of points for having sticky floors and dirty tables...
author: Kalie M.

description:
It's close to where we live so it's a nice walk down Polk when we're running errands and want some quick mexican for dinner. When ordering to go, call ahead so you won't get stuck waiting in line. 
Also portions are inconsistent, sometimes I have more beef fillings when I take it to go, sometimes I don't. I've ordered extra cheese on my nachos and it didn't seem to make any difference.
author: Diane M.

description:
Yum!  I go to Nick's more often than anywhere else in SF (at least once/week and for my bday dinner with a group the last 2 years).  

I usually get a pescado (fried fish) taco Nick's Way (but any of the meats works long as it's Nick's Way which has cruchy & soft tortillas and guacamole).  Other good lunch/dinner options include carne asada quesadillas, chips & salsa for $1, and (surprisingly) corn on the cob loaded with spices.  I've also started getting their enormous breakfast burritos or quesadillas on Sat & Sun (11:30a-3p), which are awesome.  I usually combine a couple to get steak, bacon, egg, cheese, and pico de gallo.  Mmmmm.  

Happy hour with $2 drinks and deals on food.  If you're getting a margarita, go with the one at the bigger bar (not the food counter).

It has a couple outdoor tables and a TV inside if you're watching a game.  Just try not to get shut out or turned off by the unique red decor as it closes at 9 when Rouge opens up.  Definitely worth the wait if you get there at peak hours.  Mmmmm, think I'll have to go there again tonight!
author: Eric K.

description:
Delicious tacos with fresh guacamole and only about $3 a pop?  Whats not to like?!  

Sure its a taco stand, and sure its in a room draped with red velvet curtains and tacky chandeliers, and yes you might be surrounded by many forms of "that drunk girl" trying not to fall off her bar stool while waiting for "the transformation" when it turns into Rouge nightclub ... just soak it all in and consider it the entertainment portion of your dinner.

Get them Nick's style and prepare for a meal of deliciously uncomfortable fun.
author: Carrie B.

description:
The tacos are great, however it is a bit too crazy for me on Taco Tuesday's. Plus they charge you extra if you get it to go...ugh, I would stay if I COULD! Having said that, I told the cashier this last time I went and he only charged me the $2...the service is fast even though the lineups are insane, we usually get our tacos in 5 mins tops (to go of course). 

Too bad there aren't more seats, or else I'd be there even more often...have not yet tried Blue light, it's next on my list.
author: C B.

description:
I love NCT's!!!  these things are fresh, crispy, and delicious.  This is not were I would go out for a true dinner, or dining experience, but if you're on the run, heading home, or hungry at the half (the later assumes you're watching the game at The Buckanier or Kelly's) this taco joint is da' bomb!

Cane asada Nick's way is my personal favorite.
Grab a cold one and enjoy!
author: Don D.

description:
cinco de mayo!! 
what a blast, bottomless Mimosa for $7 and you receive a huge pitcher (barely finished first pitcher, between 2 people)
and Nick'sCrispy Tacos couldn't get no better! but it HAS to be NICK'S WAY!
..in addition, to all you yelpers! Once I checked-in, I received a free coupon, courtesy of Yelp, thanks!..
...beware for the coupon is time-sensitive, so before you accept the  "use now" option, make sure your atleast near the front of the line..
author: LoLa L.

description:
Transplanted to San Francisco from Boston for a mere two days, I decided to find my local Mexican food joint.  After a good hour of research on Yelp, I decided on La Mexicana.  But when I arrived it was closed!

So, of course, I had to have Mexican food.  Not wanting to head back to my lonely apartment to scout out another place on Yelp, I tried to backtrack to a Mexican restaurant I'd passed by the night before when going to Sushi with my brother.  After I marveled at the funny name and strange interior my brother informed me that some consider Nick's Crispy Tacos to be the best Mexican food in the city!

After the disappointment of La Mexicana, I couldn't wait to get my hands on a delicious, and crispy, taco.  But the taco was not crispy!  It was soggy and oil-drenched.  The soft tortilla seemed to serve only as a container for all of the grease.  Yuck!  I thought Boston Mexican food was bad, but the bland, slimy mess that is Nick's crispy taco is even worse.

Maybe it was the anticipation that made my dining experience so bad.  Maybe it was the realization halfway into my taco that I'd been there 12 hours earlier (unhappily) when it was Rouge.

Which leads me to my other big problem with Nick's.  I think a nightclub/Mexican Restaurant is a cool concept except I hate Rouge.  I hate the mirrored columns, the millions of chandeliers, the plush velvet booths.  I can tolerate mediocre food, but the decor of Nick's is even harder for me to swallow than the food.

I would go back to Nick's if I had to, but I will never go back to Rouge.  But I should save that, I suppose, for another review.
author: Paige C.

description: Best Fish tacos in the Bay! hangs down. The place look dirty but the food great.
author: Alexei D.

description: God bless Mexican-America. Perhaps above all other contributions to society is the invention of the fish taco, and the pescado taco at Nick's is the archetype. The fried fish is great, with plenty of crunch, and it has all of the standard stuff: cabbage, cilantro and lime sauce. Nick's way, with cheese and guacamole, is just another step towards taco heaven. Also, give the red salsa a shot. It's not too spicy and is a great, smokey flavor to add, probably to any taco they serve up.
author: Art Q.

description: Yum, Yum, Yum!  First time I came I got the fried fish taco.  I ate it in the car.  I fell in love!  Second time I came I got the same thing.  I ate it in the restaurant in one of those giant red booths.  I fell in love all over again!  Fried fish + salsa + lime = love in my book
author: Michele F.

description: When I tell people that they must go to Nick's Crispy Tacos, I always forget to tell them that yes, it turns into a nightclub later in the evening. Most people think that it is going to be a taco truck. Nick's Crispy Tacos is by no means your typical taco joint. This is defiantly a place you can go drink a pitcher, or two of margaritas and get down on some awesome tacos. I usually stick with the pescado and a margarita but Ive snuck a bite or two from friends and nothing disappointing has hit my mouth.
author: Jes V.

description:
#10 on the "Big Eat SF"

made the mistake of going on Taco Tuesday, late...crazy crowded, and felt stupid for paying full price for the baja style fish taco when all other tacos were 2 bucks!!

but totally good. if you're a socal fan of rubios, it's much crispier. and "nick's style" means a LOT of guac!
author: S V.

description: Get the fried fish taco with Nicks style !! Best taco ever !
author: Thomas N.

description:
i'm a pescaterian so i had a pescada nick's way (really good but really messy) and a grilled fish taco. it's really the grilled fish that earns the four stars. best fish taco i've ever had. (that's what he said)

in other news, this place looks like an emo music video. 

eat in--you'll love the decadence that doesn't match the fare. red velvet seatbacks and chandeliers. eat your heart out, jared leto.
author: Diana R.

description: I'm still not quite sure how this taco shop by day bumping disco bridge and tunnel club by night fits together, but Nick is one smart guy! If one little corn pocket is the perfect holder for taco fixings, two is an even better idea, particularly fried up Nick's way! You'd think that would mean you wouldn't then break the shell and have finger licking drippings all over your hands, but alas, there is much finger licking goodness to be had!  Can't go wrong - pescado, pollo, carne asada, and of course the carnitas are of the hook flavorful!  Generous amounts of guac adorn the crispy corn shells - not a delicate I'm on a first date and not going to eat much kind of place.  Just go for it - you will be happy!
author: Danielle R.

description: Very tasty fish tacos, yummy drinks. If you're bored and had too much fun the night before, bring a fellow hangover sufferer and drown your sorrows away. Make sure you want to avoid sunlight and you're ready to mingle with has-been bros and hos.
author: Y K.

description:
I really like this place, always fresh, fast and good.
Fried Fish Tacos are where it's at!
Tortilla soup really good
author: Dee L.

description:
Believe the hype. 

Seriously. Delicious food and a fun, casual atmosphere. Get the tacos Nick's way and an order of chips and guacamole.

Not every place lives up to their reputations, but Nick's delivers! Ole!
author: Leslie T.

description:
I used to go to Chevy's (gasp! keep it on the down low) for my crispy taco cravings but those days are over.
Savor tasty tacos, elotes, and cheeps while lounging in a red velvet booth under a dusty piñata.  You'll think your in a fine Tijuana restaurant.  
Me gusta mucho!
author: Vivienne B.

description:
I've only had the carne asada tacos, but they are some of the best I've ever had! Quality ingredeints for sure; the steak in the taco is primo!

Atmosphere inside is so so - find an outdoor table.
author: Danny O.

description:
If you want a cheap post-happy hour place to eat on Polk, this is the way to go. The fried fish tacos are fantastic and if you get tortilla chips, make sure to have a side of guacamole.

However, I'm truly unimpressed with the service. On multiple occasions I have been ignored by the owner's son at the register, as well as rushed, pushed out of the way, and overall treated poorly. I understand that this is not a high end establishment and service is not catered to a $40 tip. But basic customer service is vital to create returning customer support. Their bad taco energy put me in slightly grumpy moods after each time I visited. 

And, I was less-than- drunk to boot. Be wary of evil-eyed servers at this place.
author: Jaclyn C.

description: EXCELLENT TACOS. I've had these before at the Taco Shop, but I love the idea of them being $2 and also totally worth my time. When I went we had to wait in line, but it went by really fast and our tacos came out super quick. The kind of service I like, and the kind of tacos I adore. This is now where I may stop all the time for Taco Tuesday. Like first. And maybe last, just to end the night on a bang.
author: Caroline L.

description: Trendy and busy but they have GREAT fish tacos and are super cheap.
author: M E.

description:
i don't know if these are the best fried tacos (pescado) i've had...they are decent though.  the quality of the fish fillet is great, but the batter is a little bit bland for my taste.  i doused my tacos with lime and the red hot sauce to add more flavor.  don't wait too long to eat these, they get soggy very quickly!  

the nachos were blah.  chips with some nacho cheese and salsa on top.  i wouldn't recommend ordering these.  

be prepared to eat in a night club kinda atmosphere.  nick's crispy tacos is inside rouge (night club).  kinda strange eating tacos on the same bar top i danced on...way back when!
author: Wendy S.

description: Convenient if you want a gringo style taco or burrito, but if you are looking for an authentic Taqueria style meal, you probably will be better served if you head on down to Pancho Villa's on 16th and Valencia...
author: Dan K.

description: I can't fathom comparing these crispy bits of heaven to Taco Bell. I was making some strange sounds on the first bite, and then quivering of my body seemed to slow down as the tasty morsel madness melted in my mouth. The texture and consistency of the tacos are unlike any other taco I've found here in SF thus far. Muy bien!
author: Braden B.

description: A great place to come for taco tues, but only if you come early.  The place gets PACKED!  My large group managed to find two booths right next to each other and waiting around for people to leave.  I love their chips and salsa.  I love their nachos.  I love their tacos.  But I don't love their tacos Nick's way.  I really don't need the extra fried especially after I ate an order of chips and salsa to myself.  I know, I know, then why do I go there?  Because I love tacos and I love them on a Tues. or any day!  Their super hot sauce isn't half bad either.  If you can't handle it, then a drop of two will do.
author: Rosalind S.

description: WOW those fish tacos are to die for!!! DELICIOUS!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! They are a bit expensive for my liking. $4 a taco, and took me 2 1/2 to make me stuffed, but completely worth every penny! im drooling just thinking bout the tacos!
author: Sara C.

description: The best tacos! Really fast too! We went here the other night and ordered  40 tacos. They were ready writhing like 8 minutes.  Yummmm
author: Jasmine C.

description:
ok. i'm a fan.  the goodness of tacos is clearly measured by their messiness, and i had these guys drippin all over my jeans, so i knew i'd stumbled upon something great. 

I had me a carnitas and carne asada, done nick's way.  The guac was legit and each taco had a heaping dollop, rather than a meager spoonful.  The overall taste was right on, and the quantity of fillings crammed into these things is impressive.  i came in quite hungry and was satisfied with just the 2 tacos.  plus the prices on tuesday nights can't be beat.  

only downside is the lack of seating the later it gets (at least on taco tuesday).  we ended up eating outside, which was actually really nice b/c we could hear each other talking and weren't surrounded by people waiting to snag our seats.  but i'll be back to try all the flavors of tacos...and maybe i'll even venture over to the other menu items.
author: Anne Marie B.

description: nicks is bomb!!! not authentic at all but still really good. i like the fish tacos nicks way. i love guac on my tacos!!!!! anything nick's way is great too. this place can be really really packed on taco tuesdays so its best to reserve a table. the line can be an hour long. the drinks are strong and they have really specials on different days. its also really nice to go on sunday and get mimosas. they used to be $5 but now they are  $7. its still a great deal for bottomless alcohol. just watch out for that 8pm champagne hangover. it will get ya
author: Ashley H.

description: So whomever was the taco maker that was in the kitchen today at 5:34... you my friend are the taco master.....Most amazing vegetarian taco ever!
author: Jennifer B.

description: This place rocks.  Great food (best taco's in the city), go with the fried fish taco NICKS WAY.  Next, the service at the bar is amazing.  Beer is super cheap!  And lastly, go to there on a Thursday night for some of the best live music in the city.   The house band really rocks and people always seem to be always having a great time.   Best happy hour bar in the city.
author: Philip K.

description:
A great start to our $22 Tuesdays. 

These Taco's were filled with flavor and filled us up!

We ordered: 3 Chicken tacos Al Pastor Nick's Style, A cheese Quesadilla, and 2 coronas. 

All said and done it amounted to less than our budget. The tacos were definitely tasty and filling - the toppings tasted fresh.

Less one star for lack of seating.

Would go back but would find it more fun with a group.
author: Cynthia J.

description:
my favorite = pescado tacos nick's way vs regular pescado tacos.

the line is always long, but the wait is so worth it!  i honestly have cravings for the pescado tacos every couple o fmonths and sure enough i walk in and there's 10 people in front of me feeling the exact same way.

i've gone both during lunch and for dinner and while i think the eating environment is less than appetizing, the food makes up for it!  the pescado taco nick's way is about $41/2... the difference between the pescado and the pescado nick's way is they add guac and other sauces that make the taco taste even more delicious.  

they also have regular carnitas/pollo tacos for about $3... cant remember exact prices but its reasonable priced and worth every bite!  

at the tables be sure to add the chipotle sauce and other fixings to make a complete meal :D

Hope you enjoy as much as I do.
author: Sandy L.

description: I'm a really picky eater and I just started eating Mexican food. I really liked the chicken taco's Nick's way  (without Beans). Ordering without the beans really pissed the man off. I'm sure he spit in my food. The Taco was amazing it got all over my hands and I had to use lots of napkins. This of course made me nervous. I hate it when food gets on my hands. I also think this is a sign of a good food. The messier the better. Even though the food is good and  really cheap I hate having to get my own drinks, napkins and forks. I think they need to at least place the settings on the table.
author: Michelle W.

description:
yeah, this place is definitely overrated and geared towards a particular demographic.  albeit I didn't go during the renowned "Taco Tuesday" (which, as others have remarked, is not all that unique in-and-of-itself), the experience wasn't all that memorable.  

I ordered one pollo and one carne Nick's Style taco along with a horchata and suffered through poor service alongside a hefty tab.  the employee automatically charged and served me the larger horchata, i.e. the more expensive drink - I never order a large drink, so asking the patron which they prefer would have been the appropriate thing to do.  

it's your typical Americanized Mexican food, which is what I was expecting, but for $12, I was painfully underwhelmed.  

I'd go back, but not of my own free will, though this feels like the type of place that your one or two friends just can't seem to let go of...
author: Mason S.

description:
This place is OVERRATED! I agree that the people who love this place must not have too much experience eating real Mexican food. The food here was just ok. I got the Chicken and Taco de Pescado both Nick's way. I expected the tacos to be crunchier, but they were just crunchy on the edges and the rest was just soft tortillas. They also just dump way too much guacamole on the top, not very authentic. 


The decor and ambiance was nice, but the crowd was mostly full of the typical white yuppies and hipsters of SF. However, I have to say this place is considerably cheap. Also, are there even any Mexicans working here? Oh and btw you call it "Taco de Pescado" not "Pescado Taco," this is a clear cut sign that this restaurant is basically white-washed.
author: Luis O.

description: I love this place.....so far it's my fav taco place in the city. I pretty much have not had a better vegetarian taco anywhere. That might seem sad but it was worth the wait. I love that they are incredibly cheap! The whole taco joint/club thing is a little weird, but it works. It was fun to eat taco's under chandeliers....
author: Kelley D.

description: I am vegetarian and I LOVE this place.  I get the same thing every time - 2 vegetarian tacos...NICK"S WAY!!!!  Will never get sick of it - awesome  & fresh ingredients and super good.  Just keep in mind that they only take cash...
author: Amy P.

description:
A good taco place to go in SF! after I came back from SD, I am always looking for a good mexican place, and now i finally found one (even tho still can't compare with my fav in sd). 
Good: 
my girl friend and I had nachos covered by carne asada, cheese, and salsa. its soooo good. Only suggestion is, if they can come out with the same dish but switch to fries, it would be so much better!  and I had carne asada taco with nick's way. I have to say, their carne asada is the best, very tender, not dry, and flavorful! I am very satisfied after i ate there. The fish taco is fresh, juicy, and crispy, but not as good as carne asada. 
Bad: 
I dont have too much to say about the bad, overall it's pretty good, but kind of overpriced, a taco with nick's way can cost u almost 5 bucks, and their chips(i know its not the main dish) have a lot of room for improvement. 
Overall:
A good place to go, nice environment, and def a good place for group, and i will go back for sure!
author: Kevin T.

description:
I love this place! I've been going here for years and have seen it change from basically a taco stand in the corner of a terrible nightclub to total domination of said terrible nightclub. 

The food is consistently great, the staff are always as pleasant as they can be - given how busy they usually are. And you can take your delicious tacos and sit at the bar, get a beer and watch sports - it really doesn't get much better. 

I will keep coming back to this place (those fish taco and quesadillas are incredible!), it might be a bit more expensive than the taco truck - but I don't mind paying a couple of extra dollars if it means that I get to sit in a cheesy red velvet booth and watch some football.
author: W L.

description:
Wasn't sure how I would feel about the food after stepping inside for the first time. I felt like someone rescued Bimbo's 365 little brother and turned it into a taco joint by day, night club by night.

Fish Tacos are great! Food in general is great, I wish they would do something different with the space. Imagine ordering Wan Ton soup from a portable Mexican food van, it wouldn't seem right.
author: Brian C.

description: Nick's, oh how I crave your guacamole, your tasty chicken tacos, your scrumptious perfect salad. On cold nights your soup hits the spot, and wins the nose running test! Sitting in your velvet burgundy booth while sipping water from your classy clear plastic cups. Occasionally I cheat and get a happy hour drink from Rouge, sorry, just getting warmed up, not a fan of your margaritas, too sweet, need more booze! Mondays your nachos make my mouth water and my fingers lick-ably tasty.  Bottom line, you're heaven and I'm in love.
author: ERICA E.

description: Delish!!! Taco tuesday is the popular hangout ($3 Mexican beer/margaritas, $2.50 tacos), and despite the long waits for tables, the food comes out very quickly. Definitely worth getting them Nick's way and spending a few more minutes at the gym tomorrow. Closes early- around 9pm- then Nicks turns into "Rouge," a makeshift nightclub with a lot of out-of-towner party bus attendees and decent DJs.
author: Rachel B.

description: I've only ever been here for lunch, and I think the tacos are really good. I love the soft shell taco outside the hard shell, it the best of both taco worlds. My boyfriend has had the misfortune of meeting a friend here for tacos and beers and he said the scene is pretty clubby and annoying. So unless you are looking for a pick-up scene, stick with lunch.
author: jen w.

description: probably the best fish tacos in sf.  order them nicks way (guacamole, sour cream etc). u will be back ill tell u that much
author: Bilal S.

description: Oh Taco Tuesday, I could marry you...but I would probably cheat on you during the week, so I will just keep you as a tastey tastey lover.
author: Kat R.

description: one word, DELICIOUS!!! My wife ordered the carne asada tacos (Nick's Style) and by fare they were the best. I had the chicken and pork. Yes the tacos are very messy so you will do the taco bend a few times. Quite a little gem in town plus it's a great place to get away from the tourists. The line was out the door when we went for lunch but we had no problem getting a booth. Yes the decor is quite bordello like and cheesy but I'm there for the tacos not the chandeliers.
author: Roger P.

description:
Nick,
    I am sorry and I gave you another chance after my last mediocre experience and you just didn't come through.  I even came early to avoid the yuppie crowd and to get a table.
     It is hard going to Nick's Crispy Tacos for their $2 NON-CRISPY tacos like last time.  So I shell out the extra $1 to get it "Nick's Style".  And the "crispy" shell that I paid $1 more for was not even crispy despite looking like a hard shell.  I'm sure it WAS... but since it tasted like it was fried that morning and left out all day, it just lazily gave in as I bit in, as opposed to exploding in greasy goodness.  I know you're thinking, "but the juicy piles of fatty meat probably soaked in, therefore rendering the crispy shell un-crispy."  To that I reply, "NO."  You see, the low quality carnitas and carne asada that was pre-cooked was also hella dry, so there was no possible way it soaked in (pollo asado was better).  The dab of guacamole was underwhelming.  Time to change up the style, Nick.

     Also, I need three tacos, so that's $9 for 3 tacos that still aren't crispy and don't do that much for me.  For $6, I can go anywhere and get the same volume of Mexican ingredients (tortilla, rice, beans, meat) and be full (and said ingredients would be put together HOT, not premade and piled on).
                                                           Sincereley, J
author: Joey S.

description: ELOTE!!! I hate corn but was tempted to try their Elote. Hits the spot. Absolutely SCRUMPTIOUS!!! Fresh corn, kick of spicyness and juicy! Must try item. Gotta have their Carne Asada tacos "Nick's Way." Quesadilla was kinda messy but yummy. Burritos are huge. Parking really really sucks! Worth driving around the block a few times.
author: Bernie C.

description: The tacos are pretty good, but unfortunately cash only. They are at limit of reasonably priced. The tuesday deal is not worth it - you don't really save that much money and the place is way too packed. Come on any other day and you'll have a better experience. The margaritas are great.
author: Lars E.

description: The ambiance of the old discoteque red velvet threw me off at first, but the funky music and fish tacos definitely loosened up the strange atmosphere. Shouldn't have ordered two tacos, one filled me right up. Weird early afternoon emptiness didn't bother me one bit... just slightly expensivo for this girl.
author: Tyler A.

description: this time i was a smarter man, i ordered a third taco.  as i noted in my last review, TWO WILL NOT DO.  not because they are small or whimpy, these tacos are anything but.  it's just that they're so freakin good, two tacos won't satisfy my craving.  it's like i'm a taco vampire, and nick has the key to my thirst.  the more i eat, the more i want- it's sickening really.  one of these days i'll order the elote (corn), but i really can't break away from taco deliciousness.  nick's is definitely a "need to go" place every time i'm in the city.
author: Sean L.

description:
I wish I knew how to quit you.

Update-April 18th.  This is how I quit you.  
I went to Nick's tonight and had the most unbelievable experience.  Let me walk you through it.

I meet up with my friend Joanna and we snag the lone outdoor table, since I had Willie with me (fresh from a bath, he smells great!)  I go inside and wait at 15-20 minutes in the longest line I've ever seen at Nick's (can't fault them for being busy, good for them)  Finally, get to the front, order some tacos, chips and guac and a couple of Bohemias.  Ask the guy helping me (I'm pretty sure it was Nick but can't say with 100% accuracy) if they'll bring the tacos outside-he says I can't take my beers out. 
Me -"Oh, ok, then I don't want them"
Taco Boy- "Well they're already open"
Me - "I'll put them in a plastic cup"
TB - "That's against the law, you're gonna have to eat inside"
Me - "I have my dog with me" (plus there are no tables available inside)
TB - "Tie him up"
Me - "I'm not going to do that, can't I have my money back?"
TB - "No, they're open...you can try and sell them to someone in line" 
Me - "Uh, that's ok"  
I could see that the conversation was going nowhere so I gave up, not wanting to be attacked by the crowd of hungry people in line behind me.

A couple of things....

1) I didn't see a sign anywhere saying that alcohol couldn't be brought outside.  Hell, there were people sitting outside of Nick's pizza place next door (which I hear sucks, BTW) with wine.

2) The guy is making money hand over fist...would giving me my $6 back really be that big a deal to him?

3) Hey Nick, your tacos kick ass but keep treating your customers like shit and that long line won't last.
author: phil h.

description: You gotta go.  Order the taco's "Nicks Way" and try the corn on the cob.  Good stuff.  I've been there with friends, family and well worth the visit.  When I can get good food in the City for under $10 with friendly service...... like I said ... gotta go.  Still one of my favorite "Cheap Eats" !
author: bob f.

description: I paid a visit to Nick's Crispy Tacos/La Rouge for the first time this past weekend and it was love at first sight and taste!  My friends and I came in just as Nick's was transitioning into "La Rouge" for the evening, and we enjoyed some awesome chicken tacos and margaritas while mingling with the increasingly lively patrons.  The red walls and vintage chandeliers made me feel like I was in a hip Parisian restaurant-bar, when really I was just in a hip San Franciscan restaurant-bar.  Highly recommended.
author: Monica M.

description: So so good, yet oh so crowded.  Tuesday Taco Night is such an amazing deal.  $2 tacos is not too good to be true, it's just too good!  Go early because the earlier you get there, the shorter the line is.  By 7pm, the line is out the opposite door near the bar.  The drinks were good and reasonably priced, too.  I'm just sad that so many people know about it because you can't get a seat to save your life. :)
author: Melissa L.

description:
Diet-bustingly good.  If you're on WW, worth all 35 of those extra points.  I do cook-offs with my friends, and I submitted a close approximation of a fish taco, Nick's way for the taco competition, and won hands-down.   Anything close to those crispy fish tacos is heaven.  The fish isn't too fishy, the sauce has this heavenly tartness, the shredded cabbage and guac just fill out the flavor profile, and that crispy exterior... MMM!

Only thing bad about Nick's?  They make these oozing, drippy, fantastic tacos, and give you these tiny, stamp-sized pieces of see-through paper called "napkins" to mop your hands up with.  Bring paper towels with you.
author: Klu K.

description:
yummy, funky tacos in a slimy, pretentious lounge.  as incredibly tasty the food is here-- nick's way carne asada and fish tacos, chips and salsa/guac, corn on the cob w/some creamy crack-like spread A-MUST--just not feeling the location...seems like they have something going here but too cheap to split from chode-ville Rouge..i still smelled sweaty balls in here from the other night lingering.

it wasn't me you damn comedians!!  i shower!!!
author: omar b.

description: You haven't had fish tacos until you've had fish tacos from here, and you must get them Nick's way, or else why bother? The place is called Nick's, so you gotta figure Nick's way is the way to go. It's not like they called it "Nick's sometimes preference" or "Nick's predilection." It's called Nick's Way, so don't be a punk.
author: Jarrod B.

description: One of my local eating and watering holes! My hubby and I can often be found catching up on a good sports game while downing our favorite fish tacos and carne asada quesadilla. We love the tequila and margaritas. Great place to take people visiting from out of town or just go when you need a bite to eat when you roll out of bed.
author: Alex S.

description: Great atmosphere. Love the red and the chandeliers.  Food was cheap and the portions were quite satisfying.  We over ordered.  I recommend the nachos
author: Mike N.

description:
now, i'll try not to let my then-state of intoxication to obscure my five-star review, but it really is five stars. relatively.

driving in a cab down broadway on a tuesday night after happy hour in search of sushi, we pass nick's. 'stop the f'ing cab!' and out we went to grub on some grubbin' food. feeling slightly over-dressed in my business attire yet stumbling in.. i immediately ran to the counter to order as many shrimp tacos as my little tummy could handle.

now, let's get one thing straight: i am a shrimp whore. love it. i love shrimp tacos, burritos, cocktail, con huevos.. put a g'damn grilled shrimp with any entree of mine and we'll call it a day. but it's all in how the shrimpies are cooked. charbroiled? they got 'em right..

the only little blunder i would have with this heaven-sent taco hut is that they charge extra for an order of chips & salsa--ehhh.. it's worth it. all-in-all for under $40 three drunk chicks were able to scarf down two grilled fish taco salads, three orders of chips & salsa and about 5 tacos.
author: Nancy P.

description:
I am not always a huge Mexican food fan, but when I get the craving there is no stopping me. I went to Nick's on Taco Tuesday with some friends, and I was in for a treat. Maybe is because it wasn't super authentic, but something about these tacos makes me consider coming here every night I try to figure out what to make for dinner.
The place was absolutely packed, so we started off with some margaritas while waiting in line. Not the best margarita ever, but I did not come here to really drink, so I wasn't too disappointed. I got to the front of the line and ordered three tacos all for $2. It took awhile to get the food (and find a table) because it was so crowded, but the food was amazing. I ate my three tacos in no time, and wished I had ordered even more. Since I didn't know about the famous fish tacos, I didn't order one. Luckily, one of my friends had and let me try it. To say it was delicious is an understatement. I would recommend this place to anyone, especially on Tuesdays when most of the food is discounted. If you are willing to wait in the line then you will not be let down.
author: Brady C.

description: Personally, I don't like beans. And my first thought about mexican food might not be a good idea (for me) but i was wrong. This place was awesome. I had a fish taco which was really big portion size(for me) great fresh fish, tasty really. Also guacamole with chips was good too.
author: Sasitorn O.

description: I have been Nick's a dozen or so times and it never disappoints.  From the chips and salsa to the quesadillas to the most awesome Fish Taco (get it fried), the food has always been top notch.  The atmosphere is eclectic, but we are talking about a taqueria...let it go.   Will go back whenever I am in the area.
author: Jenny T.

description: Great for chilling, watching some sports at the bar while eating tasty food and having some beers. Can be kind of a mob scene, but generally, fun, chill, good times.
author: Dan B.

description: This place seems to be all hype. The server at the counter couldn't have been less interested in taking our order - which proved out when we received the wrong food. Though the portion sizes were generous (1 taco could definitely suffice as a meal), I've had better. This place is alright, but not deserving of the 4 and 5 star ratings that it's been given.
author: Steve B.

description: Love nick's - definitily a neighborhood favorite, I'm wondering why I haven't reviewed this before now. I love the fish tacos "nick's way" which adds cheese and guac. I also like the veggie tacos and their salad is awesome too.
