Tuesdays they have $2 tacos but it doesn't apply to the fish ones so unless you want to hang out with a huge crowd and lack of seating, don't go on a Tuesday. Also get your drinks at the bar that's actually part of rouge - they always have $2 beer specials - you'll pay more if you get your drinks at the Nick's counter.
author: Lindsay A.

description:
Let's start with the decor - soooo wonderfully tacky and gawdy it makes me wish it was in the Castro! The space is amazing and spread out with a full bar and cozy plush booths to kick back in. 
Now the tacos - whoa, like whoa! First off, they are HUGE, I would suggest starting with one. The chips and salsa cost, which is redonk, but they give you a good portion covered in a yummy salsa. One basket kept 3 of us busy while we waited on our tacos. And there are two different sauces at every table. As a person who loves condiments, that's right I said it, I loved adding the extra sauces to things throughout the meal. 
You do have to order at the counter, but they are quick and bring it to your table when it's ready. I ordered a baja fish and a grilled fish taco. The baha crispy taco was so damn good! The batter was not too overwhelming, perfectly crispy and the piece of fish itself must have given the fisherman an issue! I usually prefer the grilled fish tacos, but in this case I have to vote for the crispy. I finished that one off and only got halfway through the grilled version. Order any of them "Nick's Way" and you will get a bucket of guac and cheese on top. 
One of my friends ordered the nacho plate and it did not come with beans or rice = downer. But she ordered both on the side and the portions were enough to feed 4! 
Overall, the baja fish tacos were fantastic - it's no Rosarita street version, but it will more than suffice when one can't jaunt on down to the border. I will def go back.
author: Shannon K.

description: When I think of Nick's tacos, I want to touch myself. Outstanding taco.
author: Mike B.

description: Love the tacos.  I'm there like twice per week, at least.  I like that the bar is hopping like every day during happy hour now...fun stuff.
author: Cameron M.

description: When my roomie suggested we eat here I was like, "yeah, yeah, we can get some tacos, whatever."  From the sounds of the name, I expected a dive joint (which I can definitely appreciate) and some mediocre food. As a New Mexico native, I am very picky about my tacos and I have to admit I was pleasantly surprised.  Shrimp tacos.....good.  Fish tacos.....good.  Carne asada tacos.....even better!  And on Wednesdays (we lucked out by showing up on this particular day), chicken taquitos are $3.  Don't forget to order your tacos Nick's way (crispy with cheese and guacamole).  I wouldn't recommend the red salsa (thought it tasted like marinara), but the green salsa was yummy.  Oh and one last thing, don't be fooled by the size of the margaritas.  They look small, but are definitely kickin'!  One trip to this joint and I am now a regular!  Mmmmmmmm.......my mouth is watering just thinking about it.
author: Nicole W.

description: Such good crispy little tacos ... mmmmmm margaritas...  must try the elote!
author: Miss P.

description: One thing to admit, my fellow Russian Hill mongers... I was afraid, I was very afraid to try out this little Taco joint that seemed to coincide with a very moulin  Rouge Brothel style club. I felt like a timid child walking in to order a steak taco, not knowing what to expect and... to my dismay, I felt like I discovered a whole new world! A new world of yumminess and tasty delights... Where was I, I thought... Moulin rouge rouge, a brothel, Mexico... I didn't care...  But when I ran into people I knew, I had to admit this has become a favorite stop by before the bars. It has opened my horizons and forced me to try new things for I am in a city full of diversity. Heehee... To top it off it is a cheap date! :)
author: Dee C.

description: I ordered a fried fish taco for takeout since I keep hearing about it.  It had a nice large piece of fish, but the fish was obviously refried.  Growing up in a restaurant, I know exactly what refried and recooked food looks like (not that we did that...::cough::).  I'm always disappointed when I notice that.  Maybe it was because I came in at 5:30pm and it wasn't busy.  Rule of thumb, food is more likely to be fresh when a restaurant is busy.  It also oddly tasted like chicken, or maybe I oddly tasted chicken when it's fish. I admit I often taste, or don't taste, flavors that others don't. Still, costing $5 for "Mexican" food, I expected a lot more food.  I plan to give it another try, but I think I'll stay in the Mission for Mexican food.
author: Yan E.

description: I have to say Nick's Crispy Tacos is as good as it gets! They have BY FAR the BEST crispy fish tacos I've ever had, and since I really love fish tacos, I have tried a lot of 'em. You have to make sure and ask for "Nick's Way" to get the extra loaded toppings. And you can't beat the atmosphere of plush velvet, red tones, and crystal chandeliers for something about as casual as you can get. Its super cool.  I used to live in walking distance to this place and have since moved and miss it terribly! I try to get over there every chance I get.
author: Carol B.

description: I don't know if it's good mexican food but I do know one thing: The food is delicious!  That's all I got for you.  Try this out.  Go to the ATM, get some cash, order something on the menu, eat it.  That's what I do and I haven't been disappointed yet.
author: John B.

description: When people talk about fusion i am not sure this is what they had in mind but they definitely should have. Really good tacos and a bar with comfortable booths to sit at. Apparently Tuesdays are the night to go.. Probably has something to do with the fact that it is $2 taco Tuesday night. Fabulous idea if you ask me. You can even get two beers for $5. I mean who wouldn't want to go and get really yummy tacos and beer. Genius. Check it out. Totally worth it and it won't break the bank. Be prepared to hunt for a seat however because there are alot of people there on Tuesday nights and personally I think sitting while you eat is a better way to enjoy the yummyness of Nicks Crispy Tacos.
author: Kylie L.

description: One time I was making love to a woman and for a good 7 or 8 minutes all I thought about was a cripsy fish taco Nick's way.
author: zach o.

description: The Nick's Crispy Pescado taco done Nick's way is perfect. To get a fish taco and margarita made with fresh Mexican limes for about $10 is amazing. I've never had a bad taco here.  Words cannot describe the medley of textures and flavors of the crunchy fish, Mexican cream, tangy lime and hot salza, there is nothing like it anywhere.
author: Renee R.

description:
one word: alote.

if you have not tried this delectable treat, you must try asap. 

i call it crack corn.  (of course you can go to the mish and get sum, but nicks does it proper as well!)  

so many other things at nicks are muy delish... the chicken tacos, the pescado tacos - regular or nicks way.  the salad with the grilled pescado on top! so fresh, so healthy, so filling.  we walk there all the time and enjoy to stay or take away.... they make a decent margie, but not our fave. (he makes z best ones at home!) 

heart the kitchsy ambiance of nicks... we sit and munch and laugh.....somehow we are eating mexi food inside a has-been niteclub called rouge.  wtf?  it works though. been coming here for a long time and we love it!
author: Caroline S.

description: Not only do I like this place because my glorious boyfriend is named Nic (without the k. is there a K in Nicholas? I don't think so! snap snap!), but the tacos are freaking unbelievable. It's true, they're more like crunchy (but not too crunchy) personal sized burritos. They include beans and cheese which make them sooooo special. They also make this cantaloupe juice that makes me want to cry it's so good. I love the strange decor, i.e. disco balls, chandeliers and red velvet...it just works well with random Mexican food. Don't order chips and guac, because although they're really good, the tacos are huge and you want room to eat two of them.
author: Sammy S.

description:
So we get in later Sat night (8:30p or so).  We get a seat (table not clean yet), waiter comes and cleans the table off.  We get in line to order and the same waiter that cleaned our table told the guy at register we could not eat in the main seating area due to a special event at 10p.  The guy behind the register says...take a seat at the bar.  We oblige.  As one person in our party gets done ordering, the waiter then tells the register that we cannot sit anywhere inside the restaurant.  Take out only.  It was cold this past Sat. night and we were not willing to sit outside.  I asked the waiter if he could just let us order and finish up pretty quickly.  He said no due to the event.  30 minutes is all we needed.  Hell, we had been seated already and they did not tell us we could not sit until we were in line ordering.  I wasn't happy and left without food.  I really did not want to come back, but the next day my friends really wanted to go again.

No mishaps... walked in, ordered and sat down.  What can I say... even though I was not happy the night before... the tacos and burritos were pretty good.  I could have given this place a solid 3.5  if it had not been for the bad experience.
author: Guillermo C.

description:
nick nick nick................

i never knew a taco could be so scrumptious!

i came here for $2 tuesdays and if you had it nicks way, its gonna cost you.........$3 which is not bad considering they load up the taco tons of meat and stuff! yummy!..........seating arrangements are on a first come first serve basis, so if you see a seat....grab it...other wise you'll be standing at the bar or standing somewhere eating your tacos.  

unfortunately you don't have the option to take it to go, and quite frankly its not really authentic Mexican food....but its still good!
author: Shirley H.

description: This may be Mexican food for white folks, but it is damn good Mexican food for white folks.  The tacos are huge and fresh and tasty.  I highly recommend it.
author: Jessica H.

description: I am a pretty big fan of Nick's tacos (if you don't do it 'Nick's way' don't even bother) but something that I think gets overlooked is the Tortilla Soup and the Black Bean & Grilled Corn Taco Salad here. Definitely worth trying! Also, a trick is to order over the phone before you get there. If not you are standing in a long line during peak eating time (usually 5-8 pm)
author: Bri V.

description: I think I just found my favorite Mexican restaurant.  Granted it's a night club turned restaurant by day, the seating was a bit uncomfortable for me.  Super roomy booths with tiny tables is an accident waiting to happen.  So don't wear your favorite outfit. Anyhow, food here is mucho tasty. I can't wait to come back to try out the rest of the menu.!!!
author: hello k.

description: For what it is, five stars. A taco Nick's Way is absolutely outstanding -- the slightly crisp texture of the tortilla, the flavorful meat of your choice, loaded up with cheese and guac. I really can't describe how tasty these things are, so you might as well go check it out yourself. I had a carne asada taco and a carnitas taco -- I prefer ed the carne asada but they were both excellent. $2 Taco Tuesdays.
author: m t.

description: Everything has already been said, but the tacos here are amazing. Fun ambiance, reasonably priced drinks and decent happy hour. Taco Tuesday is fun but be sure to come early to get a seat. Be sure to order your tacos nicks way (adds Guac on top) and you won't be disappointed.  Also - get the guac and chips to pass the time while you wait on your order (can take up to 15 minutes).  On the downside, I find the margaritas to be small and rather boring. Stick with beer.
author: Gary C.

description: Taco Tuesdays at Nick's Crispy Tacos is one of the best things that could ever have happened. The carne asada tacos(done Nick's way) here are ON POINT!! BTW, Nick's way for anyone who doesn't know, is when the tacos are made crispy and they throw in some Guac and jack cheese. You can not have a taco any other way. Anyhow, the best part about taco tuesday is that the tacos are $2 from 4-6pm. AWESOME! Though, get there early because the place gets PACKED!
author: Jenny L.

description:
Nick's Crispy Tacos? One word: NASTIFIED.

Okay, so I know that going to a burrito place on Russian Hill was kind of asking for it ANYWAY, wow. I mean, wow. As in my stomach actually hurts. 

Save yourself the drama of trying to explain to the people taking your order what exactly you want or don't want; you're better off going to Taco Bell. And this is coming from a vegetarian.

Seriously!
author: ray b.

description: Awesome burritos!  I'd say the carnitas is preferable to the chicken, but that's just me.
author: Lauren C.

description: Delicious variety of tacos....don't leave without trying the namesake 'crispy' taco!  The decor doesn't quite match the low key food, but for some reason I love it anyways.  Beware:  Make sure you bring cash or you will pay outrageous ATM fees onsite.
author: Sarah M.

description: The Mission rules for burritos but for the single best version of the taco you have to head up to Broadway and Polk. Nick's is always hopping, and there's plenty of seating. Order your tacos "Nick's Way" and you will be in heaven.
author: Nish N.

description: Mmmmmm, crispy.  If I were a taco, I would want to be crispy.  'Cuz then people would want to munch my crispy taco self.  And then they would exclaim "Mmmmmm, crispy"!
author: Kiki G.

description: best tacos ever, seriously. you can see and taste every ingredient, which is important.  i also tried the jalapeno poppers which were so tasty!! this place is good for just a quick bite or even a sit down lunch/dinner. i docked one star because it's more of a younger crowd place, not so much for 40 somethings...other than that, awesome food!!!
author: Nancy D.

description: They may not be authentic, but these tacos are damn good.  Especially when ordered "Nick's way".  The corn on the cob is also not to be missed.  The space is a little random - it is in Harry Denton's Rouge after all - but one bite of these tacos and you'd forget if you were in a Turkish prison.
author: Erica G.

description: Nick's scares me.  It's not that the food isn't good - it's fine.  I just think there's something inherently wrong with a "Mexican" restaurant attached to a club like that.  I don't know what it is, but for me it's creepy and a little surreal.  And the fact that the bathrooms are awful doesn't help.
author: Alyssa W.

description: I've been going to taco tuesday's on and off for the last year and let me just say I find that more frequently I enjoy the pescado taco above any other taco I've ever had!!! And 3 dollar drinks SCORE not stiff, but fair for 3 bucks!!! Minuses are it's usually really packed some of the bitches there are annoying, but the bartenders are truly AMAZING!!!
author: Rhea F.

description:
Never thought I'd say this, but there is a Mexican restaurant in Russian Hill that deserves 5 stars.  They accidentally gave me a pork burrito to start, and it didn't take long to figure out that I was not chewing on the famous fish that I had ordered.  Once the real thing came, it was on.  The fish was outrageous: light, crispy, with a nice sauce...mmm mmm mmm.

What's with the Mexican hookah/sports bar decor, though?
author: Daniel S.

description:
This is the place you go for burritos if you're with people who would not be comfortable anywhere near the Mission.

The food is OK.  The service is good.  They bring the food to your table.

The decor is very nice; it's a nightclub in the evenings.  It's the only taqueria I've ever been to where I've felt slightly under-dressed.
author: Alex M.

description: Pretty Awesome. I love the Pescado Burrito. I order it on a wheat tortilla. The green sauce is the bomb. I always call ahead and come and pick it up so I don't have to wait. It's  fun to eat there too, if you can snag a big comfy booth.
author: Tara M.

description:
after coming back from socal, i noticed a shortage of taco tuesdays in the city. thank goodness for nick's. tuesdays are jam-packed. i always get everything nick's way which everyone else talks about. 

the funniest part about this place is that it's same place as the club rouge.
author: Dennis L.

description: Best $2 taco Tuesdays in the city. $3 beers, lively atmosphere, fast service, best-looking crowd in a restaurant/bar, and most important: the best tacos! Go figure. I'd hold them up next to any taqueria in the mission.
author: Andrew K.

description: Well, I finally made it over to Nick's and I have to agree, the place is pretty tasty. We ordered the chips and salsa, which is really chips with Pico on top. I had the carnitas burrito and it was packed full of meat. I could only manage to eat half of it. I think the prices are very fair and the place is pretty cool. The staff could have been a bit friendlier, but hey, it was a Sat monoring. Perhaps they were hung over??
author: Lisa A.

description:
Oh man, oh man! I waited so long to try this place out... and boy was I disappointed. Here's what went wrong...

-To start, the meal was $30 for 2! For freaking tacos (and other items.. we had 4 tacos, a plate of taquitos and one agua fresca)! WTH? and this is why...
-.95 extra on top of the already $5 taco for Nick's Way which means guacamole and cheese along with a crispy taco which I didn't even notice.
-The guacamole was salty. It did not compliment the fish AT ALL.
-The lime mayonnaise and the veggies in the taco are wayyyy too overpowering - too much lime flavor! 
-The fish was flavorless... It looked good but it didn't impress. The meat was dry and the batter was tasteless.
-The chicken taquitos... the meat was even drier than the fish. Huge chunks of dry and bland chicken in a too crunchy shell. Horrible.
-The orchata my friends had tasted like liquid bubble gum. Gross.
-The agua fresa we had was not sweet enough - it's like they made the juice out of unripened strawberries. 
- anyone ever heard of complimentary chips & salsa? =/ Guess Nick didn't get the memo...

What went right...

+The cheesy, spicy corn was A-OK for my friends (I didn't have any since I am not a fan of cheese)... the only enjoyable part of the meal. 

Much better places for tacos... Nick's is overhyped and overpriced. Sad.
author: Christine C.

description: Now THAT'S a carnitas taco! I'm normally not into the "gringo" fried tortilla taco, but Nick's spin on it is deelish. A good size, too. The veggie burrito in a tomato tortilla is also really tasty. Bonus star for sharing the space with Rouge, where I can get a Blue Moon on tap, watch HD basketball, and ogle at the hot bartender (multitasking at its finest)...
author: Maximillian M.

description: I didn't feel totally comfortable eating at Nick's knowing all the dirt that happens there at night.  can a meal really be enjoyed with that tinge of jagermeister in the air?  the smell brought me back to nights of drunken dance floor make-out sessions followed immediately by a little Q-T with the toilet in the men's room.  You know you've hit rock bottom when you're tickling your own tonsil with one hand while trying to keep the bathroom stall door closed with the other as thoughts of seppuku dance through your consiousness as your body punishes you for that 12th shot of tequila.  As for the taco's, they're pretty mediocre.  definately not worth the 7 bucks or the flashbacks.
author: J M.

description:
only had fish tacos nick's way

wasnt a fan of the cabbage and fish combo
didn't find the flavor all that great

however, the size was filling
author: J L.

description: What the flip, Nick? Why?  Why'd I have to try the "Nick's way" chicken taco? I can never go back to the value menu at Taco Hell now!  Thanks for ruining me.  Thanks to you and your lust-inducing chicken and guacamole.  Dangit!
author: M A N I K.

description: I just like tacos.  But I really like Nick's Crispy Tacos.  It's sooooooo messy but damn good.   But  anything worth eating can stand to be messy every now and then.  At least it's not Carl's Jr.
author: Andrea R.

description:
Honestly, I don't know what all the fuss is about. I think maybe it's because SF is so lacking in quality mexican food that this place gets any attention at all. 

The first time I went here I thought the atmosphere was so crass. Everything is so dirty and dingy-- it looks like the place NEVER gets cleaned. It just feels unsanitary to eat there! Both places we sat down (we had to move because the first place stunk so bad) we could smell rotting garbage wafting over from an open trash can. Why they don't cover their trash cans and leave them next to tables-- I will never understand that. 

So the next time I came here I refused to eat-in... I decided the experience would be much more enjoyable if I took my food to-go. I ordered their most famous taco- the fried fish taco, "nick's style". Nothing special. It was fine.

Definitely not a place to make a point of going... I would recommend going for a yummier place where the atmosphere isn't so vile... like Colibris. Just my opinion, though.
author: Vanessa B.

description: While I liked my food, my friends had some issues with theirs.  Of course, this could be because my friends are some indecisive motherf**ckers and so they probably just confused the staff.  I enjoyed my fish taco and the chips and salsa for a buck?! GRUBBIN'!  Cheap, good eats.  1 taco + 1 order of chips and salsa + 1 beer = $6.
author: Jill D.

description:
I like it crispy...that's right Nick...I like it YOUR way.
Oh, sorry folks, I can't help feeling a little dirty when I am in Rouge, even if it's still light out. I made a special mental note while eating at Nick's for the first time that the bar counter would NOT be the best place to eat...what with the barely-dressed dancers that prance around on them in the late evening.
I really enjoyed my tacos. I tried the carne asada crispy taco and the fish regular taco. Both were superb, though were lacking a bit of spice. I was pretty generous with the pico de gallo squeeze bottle, pretty much dousing each bite with a little extra somethin'somethin'.
The fish and the beef were both of high quality and everything was super fresh.
I really wanted a margarita and was informed by the folks at the Nick's counter that I could order from the bar and get a cheaper happy-hour price. That sounded like the way to go...boy was I wrong. After waiting for nearly twenty minutes at the mildly crowded bar I gave up after being skipped by the singular bartender for the third time. When I got back to my table, my tacos were barely warm and I was in a BAD mood. Luckily the food was good enough to distract me from my disappointment in not having a cold beverage to sip.
author: Jessa B.

description:
This place has been a staple of mine since I stumbled upon it it 2 years ago. I have watched it blossom into the bustling Mexican food stop that it has become. While I don't necessarily like it's merger with Rouge, I think it was a great move on their part given the amount of business they get on Polk street and definitely a good move for Rouge. It is also pretty awesome to be able to grab a cheap drink and stare at some fantastically ugly decor. 

Nicks provides great Mexican food at a good price (especially on Tuesdays). If you do happen to stop by on a Tuesday, I would suggest getting there as early as possible to avoid the rush.
author: Murray M.

description: I was so excited to eat there. They got my entire order wrong and i paid a lot of money for them to do that. Thanks for nonthing.
author: Annie S.

description: So I have always heard of Taco Tuesday so I thought I would give it a shot and it was quite a scene! I arrived at 6pm and there was already a huge line, good thing my buddy was already in line so we grabbed some corona and waited patiently to order. Finally it was our turn got 2 carne asada  (nick's way) and I was impressed. They really filled that taco to the limit and for $3 its a good deal. Now are the taco's worth the wait...probably not...but if you want to check out the scene..there's pretty good talent all around so overall a good time..
author: Kevin B.

description: So basically, i love this place.  Their chips and pico de gallo, are from where i am sitting, pretty much the food i would ask for if i was on death row.   I love thier margaritas.  They are fresh and two will get me giggling and loving my chips even more.  CHEAP prices.  It gets pretty crowded around the 6 oclock time.  But you cant beat the ambicance of plush leather couches intemigled with picnic tables and folding chairs placed in a room with sponge bob square pants pinatas hanging from gorgeous chandeliers.   People have complained about the burritos there- i think there fine, but there tacos done "nicks way" make you wonder what else you might like Nicks way.
author: Mary R.

description:
I have been wanting to try Nick's Tacos for a while now. After a couple of tries,  I finally made it there this past Saturday for lunch with 11 others.

I liked the ambiance.. it was a bit funky.. tacos in the middle of a club.

 I ordered a Pollo taco nick's way and sat down with everyone else waiting to taste the taco..and waited.. and waited and waited..  Everyone else in my group (6 of them who had ordered after me) received their order.

So I went to ask the lady at the counter what happened.  She just said.. it's not ready yet.  After a couple more tries I found someone who went to check on it for me and said they forgot my order and he will bring it to me.

A few minutes later I received it and bit into it (of course its such a small taco one bite means about half a taco) and realized it wasn't chicken.. it was steak.  And I don't eat beef.  

So I go back again and tell them that I don't eat beef and that I had ordered chicken.  They seemed very frustrated with me and by that point I wasn't even sure if I was going to get another one.

About 10 minutes later, I did receive my taco but by then everyone else was done so I had the taco packed up.

I can't even comment on the food because by the time I got home it wasn't so "crispy" anymore.

I am sure it was tasty.  Everyone else seemed to enjoy it.  I don't even mind that they were late with my order or gave me the wrong one.  What frustrates me is the frustration they showed me from the first time I went to ask them about my order.  It wasn't my fault they forgot it or gave me the wrong order.  If they had been a bit nicer to me when they misplaced my order and then messed it up, and shown some good customer service, I wouldn't have come home and created a yelp account so I could write this review.

I am giving it 1 star because everyone else seemed to like the food and the salsa was good!
author: Meena A.

description: I was fairly reluctant of this place, as it appeared to be a Mexican food joint moonlighting as an after hours club, (which I guess for all intent and purposes is what it is) but I ended up being totally blown away by the food, plus the staff was super nice as well. I will definitely be back. (Perhaps not at night, but for lunch, it can't be beat.)
author: Stevil K.

description: This place is just fair.  From the sheer quantity of reviews, they obviously do a brisk business.  However, there is nothing particularly special about their tacos.  I had a taco salad thing here that was positively worse than the salad at McDonalds.  But a burrito was OK.  Not any better than an average burrito place in the Mission.  Not sure where they get their "Best Taco" brag from.  They certainly aren't cheap.
author: Rose Q.

description: Had two carne asada tacos.  Overpriced, overrated, and nothing special.  Recommendation: if you want an authentic mexican taco in SF visit one of the taco trucks on the street.
author: JR P.

description: It's damn near impossible to get me into a taqueria and order something besides the coveted burrito, but I had heard so much about the tacos Nick's way I had to try the carnitas variety and OH MAN! The next time I'm anywhere in this vicinity, I'm all over this place. And they're as cheap as any place in the Mission.
author: Michael E.

description: Since i'm on a yelping spree i'd figure i'd give some input on Nick's. Yes it is inside Rouge which is kinda odd but pretty cool at the same time. I've only had the Crispy fish taco's and the grilled fish taco's both are great. To be healthier i suggest the grilled one but if your not so concerned the crispy one is amazing (especially with the green sauce) the only other thing i've tried are the nacho's which are well just nacho's with lots of toppings haha. One of those places you just gotta try.
author: mitchell l.

description: The most unique thing about this place is that its inside one of the worst bars in San Francisco: Rouge; a horrificly gaudy bridge-and-tunnel joint that is packed wall-to-wall on weekend nights with skankified East Bay bizzels in sequined halter tops.  This place takes up the space of a portion of the club and is only open when the club is closed. The tacos are quite tasty and they serve beer too.  Don't come anywhere near here when Rouge is open though. Yuck.
author: Rick H.

description: This is one of my favorite places in SF. The tacos are awesome (Nick's way) and so are the salads. One of the only spots in SF you can eat and drink for under $20 and be totally satisfied.
author: Kristen R.

description: I have never had a taco like the ones here! They are definitely different, but in a very delicious way. I have tried chicken, beef & my fav, the carnitas...hands down you HAVE to order them "Nick's Way". Its like a soft taco inside a crunchy taco...with layers off alllll the good stuff like their guacamole, which is AWESOME!  I will keep coming back when I'm craving it Nick's way!
author: Genie M.

description: I ordered their salad (they just have 1 on the menu) and had chicken added. It came with a big glob of guac on top - yum! I pulled off the tortilla strips and some of the guac to share with Carolyn B. but the salad itself was a great late-day snack. While strolling on Polk St, I'd definitely go here again and grab a salad- the chicken on top was generous and tasty too!
author: Diane S.

description: Every time I am in this place I think about Johnny Loves.......does anyone else remember that bar? I know it's a different place at night now.......but Johnny Loves was good times.....back in the day! Oh yeah....I pretty much thought the food sucked!
author: tom h.

description: wow is this place great or what??? If you want real tacos that actually taste good then come by nick's.  yes it's crazy when it's taco $2 tuesdays!  I'd say go via bus if it's a Tuesday.  Fish tacos are delish and service was awesome.  Nick's is actually inside bartop rouge so it was a bit weird to not be drunk and stumbling around in the dark there.   Anyways... Yummy yummy yummy!! you need to stop by this place and have a few tacos!
author: Allan T.

description: Came here with a group of friends on a Sunday morning before going to Circa's bottomless mimosa brunch.  They'd all been here before, so I was excited about all the talk about tacos and nachos and quesadillas.  We pretty much covered the whole menu.  I had the carne asada and deep fried fish taco Nick's Way.  Granted, I washed these tacos down with a Margarita (which was delicious btw), but these tacos were really tasty.   The breakfast burrito and quesadilla were pretty good according to my friends, and if you like  "nacho" cheese on your nachos instead of shredded cheese, then these are the nachos for you.  Check it out, but bring cash, cuz I'm almost sure it's cash only.  Peace!
author: Elijah S.

description: Fantastic pescado tacos....the real deal!
author: lisa l.

description: I came to Nick's on a Saturday night, around 7:30, with a group of 6 friends.  We quickly found a table and didn't have to wait too long to order our food.  I had one carne asada taco (Nick's style) and one chicken taco (also Nick's style).  I prefer the carne asada.  These tacos are fully loaded with goodies (sour cream, lots of guacamole).  The tacos are deep-fried goodness.  One of my friends ordered fish tacos, and she said they were amazing.  We also had a few pitchers of margaritas.  Not the strongest drinks, but not overpoweringly sweet (I hate when margaritas just taste like sweet juice - they give me a bellyache!).  Easy-going, casual crowd - lots of people were watching the football playoffs on the TVs in the bar.  LOVE the building - the décor is awesome.  Service was decent.  After we finished eating, it definitely seemed like the waitress was trying to hurry us on our way.  Fine by us - we were heading off to a few more bars anyway.  One warning - check the lip of your glass before taking a swig.  I unknowingly drank from a broken glass, which resulted in me finding glass in my mouth.  I'm not one to make a stink, so I just asked for a new glass - problem solved.  If I'm in the neighborhood, I'll definitely go back to Nick's (but I don't get over to Nob Hill very often).
author: Jenna C.

description: The tacos are great (if you aren't taking with you and waiting 15 minutes to eat them, because then they are soggy).  Additionally, i have had a few of their burritos and they were all better than average (especially given the lack of stellar Mexican joints in the Russian hill area).  It is hard to argue with the crowd that always lines up to get  a taco or three at this place.  Try it out.
author: Robert R.

description: Nick's is okay as far as Mexican food goes. You want really delicious Mexican with a variety of options- head on over to the Mission. For an inexpensive, decent taco, go to Nick's on Tuesday. Taco Tuesday prices are great (2 beers, tacos, etc. for $5-) and the food is pretty good with beer. I recommend ordering the taco Nick's way-- soft taco wrapped up with a crispy taco. Get there early, the place fills up and you risk eating your order standing up.
author: Kelly S.

description:
Ya know, ok, I don't get it.  Everyone loves this place, but I don't think it's that great.  I'd rather go to El Farolito in the Mission.  Been to Nick's several times, but I find the tacos tasteless and bland.  They do use really good, fresh ingredients, and the atmosphere is great... but...

I'd love to love you, Nick, as everyone else does, and I've tried really hard, but I don't.  I'm sorry.
author: jessica d.

description: ADA Violators! Forced to leave with a California State registered service dog. Lawsuit to follow...
author: aryele d.

description:
Three Stars for the Food

Minus One Star for the Attitude

My husband and I tried Nick's.  It was a rainy Friday and as we stepped in we were trying to figure out if we needed to wait to be seated or not.  We figured out we had to place our orders at the counter.  Before we could head over, an employee comes up to us and says "could you put your umbrella in the bucket" and as he walks away mumbles "so you don't drip water all over the floor".  Well, to be honest, that place looked as if it could use some water on the floor.  The floor and the dingy tables  all looked like they could use a good scrub down.  After we place our order, I noticed there were buckets on the floor to catch drips and someone was mopping up water.  The roof is leaking and someone is getting bent out of shape about wet umbrellas?  On to the food, my husband ordered one carnitas taco, one carne asada taco - "Nick's Way" and I ordered two fish tacos.  Per the Mister, the carne asada was OK, but the carnitas tasted funny.  "I think they used the same oil to fry the fish and carnitas" he said.  My fish tacos looked like two huge blobs.  Too much breading and greasy.  

I think the next time I have a fish taco craving I'll stick to Del Taco.  Not as greasy and no attitude.

Update 11/14 - the REAL Nick is at The Taco Shop At Underdog's - much better.
author: Sabrinasmom S.

description: Top notch tacos, great selection of meats (the grilled fish makes me want to cut someone, it's so good), great sauces and guac...I'm sure there are better tacos out there somewhere, but i don't want to know about them.  If i ever cheat on Nick's, it's going to have to be in Mexico where it doesn't count.
author: Patrick B.

description: Do it Nick's way and do it often. This is the best use of that flashy over hyped spot. These tacos rule! They are a bit more pricey, but you get what you pay for. Carnitas not as dry as I like it, but that's just me. Had a killer lunch with a pal of mine last week. Rocked the house. Go. Go now. Enjoy.
author: Ian M.

description: This Taco is delicous.  You have to get it Nicks way.  The grilled cheese and Guacamole make it a great Taco.  The Carnitas and Carne Asada are delicous.  The Tacos are a definite 5 but the Burritos are not great at all.  Nothing specila to write home about.  The Taco salad with Meat is also very good.  The salsas are okay.  The green sauce is good but the red sauce tastes too much like tomato sauce to me.  Anyways Nicks is a great place with great Crispy Tacos.  Always get your Tacos Nicks way.
author: Harry E.

description: Have you ever wanted to eat a burrito with plush red velvet under your backside while a Chandelier hangs over your head? Come to Nicks and you can.  Oh yes, and if you want to dance there, go  at night.  I thought I was in another world; mexican food with a discoteque next door.  Odd yes, but true.  The burritos were rolled tight so you could actually pick it up with one hand and eat it like a hot dog.  The filling?  Tasty flavorful with light spice.  I would go back.
author: Geoffrey B.

description: YUM! Crispy fried fish tacos Nick's style & a solid margarita.... holy hell it doesn't get much better than this (unless your in the Mission of course)!
author: melissa g.

description: One word... Excellent! If you want to know where I will be on Tuesday nights... it will definitely be at Nicks. Great atmosphere, fun people, good food, and did I mention cheep alcohol? HaaAmazing.
author: Megan B.

description: Had a couple of errors on the order, but the owner/manager was quick to make it right and even offered to comp the tacos and a drink.  It was no big deal, the food was really great, and the place is pretty cool inside.  I hear it's more of a lounge by night, I'll definitely be back for more! Thanks Nick!
author: Ian K.

description: This place LOOKS like it should be cool, but relatively unimpressive. The burritos were dry, the clientele was pretty cheesy to boot. The prices were very reasonable, but not really worth it.
author: Andy S.

description: I came here last week for taco Tuesday and it was AWESOME! The food was cheap so was the beers and drinks! I will most definitely be coming here more often and telling my friends/family about this too!
author: Carmen C.

description:
i wish that there was a way to combine this review with one for Harry Denton's Rouge so that people would know before they go that they are basically the SAME PLACE.  it's really quite an ingenious idea: cheap-ish tacos and simple mexican food ordered at a take-out style window, and then enjoyed in a red velvet booth under the chandeliers of a swanky martini bar.  a study in contradictions.  

i want give it more stars, as i love the idea, and happy hour is a deal not to be beat ($2.50-$3.50 tacos, $2 margaritas).  if you get there early enough (they open at 5), there isn't a line and you can grab a choice booth before it gets more crowded and becomes more of a scene.  

however, the food itself was only ok.  the fish taco (of which i consider myself something of a connoisseur) was fresh but a bit bland.  and the parking situation in that area is bleak at best.  therefore, three stars: solid effort, fun idea, decent execution.  

if i could rate the guac alone, it would have stars exploding off the page.  order several.  delicious.
author: Kirsten F.

description: When I first walked into Nick's I had weird flashbacks of dancing in club Rouge in the late 90's. Makes sense because Nick's is actually in Rouge when it's not acting as a dance club. But placing the atmosphere aside Nick's is insanely good. After making my way through a shrimp crispy taco and chicken taco made Nick's way I struck the motherload - the steak quesadilla!! Holy guacamole that thing is good and huge. The perfect mix of tomatoes, guac, cheese, steak and an indian-like flat bread crisped in butter? which has a texture that is crispy and chewy and tastes like mexican crack.
author: Brady K.

description: With all the bars in the Russian Hill area, Nick's Crispy Tacos makes for a great happy hour snack.  I like the way the tacos are slightly crisp and overflowing with ingredients.  I had the carne asada and pollo tacos (for those not fluent in Mexican food terms that means steak and chicken tacos).  The meat was great, and by having it "Nick's Way," you get guacamole and jack cheese on the taco as well.  I recommend watching a Celtics game at The Buc, having a few beers, then grabbing some Nick's Crisp Tacos, and you will go home satisfied with calling it a night by 9:00PM.
author: Josh K.

description: This place is AWESOME. You walk in and on the right is where to order they do have a bar as well. From what I understand it is a night club at night as well. Dancing and tacos??????? Chips and salsa with guacamole are outstanding. I usually judge a place by the chips and salsa well they have done it. I ordered 2 carne asada tacos which is plenty. They were juicy, with a good helping of verde salsa, not hot and very good.
author: Chuck G.

description: Full of douchebags and NOT good mexican food. why does everyone like this food? eww, go to the mission for some real food. These tacos are anything but crispy. and it's actually taking place inside of Rouge, one of the tackiest clubs in all of SF. but I think they have a drink special, which I always enjoy.
author: Natasha F.

description: This place was amazing. The tacos are so delicious with a hard tortilla and a soft one fully loaded with chicken salsa and quacamole. I visited. this restuarant during the week and it is casual and totally fun. I did go last night on Cinco de mayo and what a Blast!!! The place was packed and we had the best service. What a great place to get together with friends and family.Watched the sharks game and the basketball game on the big screen at the bar.The bartenders were festive and the mararitas were amazing!!(good times)
author: michelle m.

description: Nick's is my guilty pleasure that I can't explain. I'll be having a disciplined week of having already gone to the gym 4 times, eating oatmeal for breakfast, a pitiful salad for lunch, and passing on the pasta at dinner and then BAM! I'm hit with an undeniable craving for their deep fried crispy fish tacos Nick's way . . . and game over. The next thing you know, I'm marching in a trance-like state down to the corner of Polk and Broadway, and ordering not one, but TWO, fried fish tacos . . .and I don't even like Mexican food! Like I said, I can't explain it . . .but I do know how good and bad it makes me feel afterwards. It's a very conflicting experience, but the $2 margaritas do a good job in making me feel better.
author: Alice P.

description:
Not discovering this place sooner is its only downfall. I feel like maybe I heard about it, but never made it over there, which probably saved me a few pounds.

But now I can relax and know when I crave an amazing taco, it's only a  drive away. And I do crave them. I mean really, I've been eating Mexican food and tacos since I can remember. It's right up there with Sushi for me. Their tacos Nick's Way are so damn satisfying and filling. The fish is good, but I prefer the carne asada. It's seasoned well and not fatty. I doubt I'll ever try anything else on the menu. 

Oh the atmosphere, well, I can look past that for the amazing food. I usually get my food to go. But I wouldn't mind eating there with friends and some beer.
author: Samantha L.

description: Food was kinda bland.  Salsa needs some kick.  Slightly overpriced.  But damn it's good when you're hung over.
author: Aldo K.

description: Have been coming to Nicks for a couple of years now,might be the last time.today I got the steak quesadea to go and when I got home I was shocked at how little filling was in it.Hardly any meat at all and very sloppy veg mixture.This place used to rock,but if they start cheating on their portions the only way is down for them.You cannot screw over the customer,especially on polk st,where there are literally dozens of other options within 1/4 mile.Should have taken a pic and downloaded it,but I was so hungry.It was a good ride while it lasted.
author: terence r.

description: Their burritos definitely do not compare to the Mission, but they are still delicious. The chips and salsa are yummy. The Horchata is amazing.
author: Syd V.

description:
nick's crispy, i miss you.

it's been too long since i had anything nick's way, and that's sad. how i miss the light chips and good salsa. how i miss ordering a chicken AND a fish taco (2 kinds by the way, try both, v. different) how i miss cozying up in a nightclub booth to shove tacos in my face and enjoy your seemingly endless happy hours on thurs and fri nights. your salads are great too, never had your burrito, but only because i have strict allegiances in the mission to adher to.

i'll be there soon, crispy, i need the love.
author: shaine h.

description: Definitely order the tacos Nick's Style - it's worth the extra dollar.
author: Brooke N.

description: Order a grilled or fried fish taco Nick's Way.  Turns a bad day at work into a very good one :)
author: Annie R.

description: I really wish I didn't crave these tacos.  It is such an ordeal getting food from this place.  The line is always long.  The service is slow.  Even if you phone in your order (that is, if you don't get a constant busy signal), there is no separate pick up window for Take-out.  Take-out is supposed to be quick.  What's the point in ordering in advance if you still have to wait in line for 20+ minutes.  The staff is also not that friendly.
author: Miss Purr fec t.

description: I actually heard the same story Nate relayed below. While I think this is the best taco stand north of market, it's really unfortunate how Nick, the founder and originator, was squeezed out of his own business.
author: Shannon C.

description: Without question, the BEST tacos and burritos I've had outside of Mexico.  My favorite is the Pescado ... the taste instantly transports me back to Puerto Vallarta.   The decor is funky - deep red and mirrored walls, with pinatas hanging from antique crystal chandeliers ... think Cal-Mex meets New Orleans bordello.  With the best burrito/taco place so close to my home, I'll never waste my time making the trek into the Mission again.  Bravo Nick's.
author: Chris A.

description: This place has excellent tasty and indeed crispy tacos. I love the dinning room and bar set-up at this place. Doesn't appear to have changed since the disco era. Great prices on food and alcohol. Beer selection is very nice. I will return for quick meal in the future. Get there earlier in the evening to avoid a long line but throughout the time I was here, it seemed to be pretty smoothly moving operation. Not an excessive wait.
author: Jeremia F.

description: This is the only yelp review I have ever written. the fried fish taco nicks serves is the best taco i have ever had. ever... sorry mom
author: Daniel B.

description: Interesting atmosphere. Had the pollo tacos Nick's way, and they were delicious!  Plus, they carry Mexican coke in bottles, which is worth the price of admission.
author: Chris L.

description:
Taco tuesdays are the best!  You need to come before 7pm because the lines go out the door and you probably won't find an open table.  Seriously yummy tacos for just $2 and 2 beers for $4!  Ordered 2 chicken soft tacos + nachos and was surprised when I received them - the tacos were stuffed and the toppings on the nachos were so fresh.  The way they wrapped the tacos, seriously made them look like a burrito...ammmazing!   
It's definitely interesting because my friends and I had come here on a saturday - and it's a club!  We went looking for Nick's because we knew it was around the area and when we found the sign next door - looked inside the window and discovered that, GASP -THE CLUB WAS IN FACT NICK'S!  
Restaurant by day, club by night (my ideal superhero).  Definitely makes for an interesting dejavu.  The atmosphere of Nick's is so chill - great place to hang out after work with your friends!
author: Karen T.

description: LOVE Nick's Crispy Tacos!! We have ordered catering from them for parties several times, and it's always a crowd pleaser. I recommend confirming your order the day before you need it though... last time, my order got lost.  ;)
author: Lyla R.

description: I guess I never reviewed this place because I remember the ol' saying "if you don't have nothin' nice to say keep yo' trap shut", but I saw some listing of Mexican places to try in San Francisco and somehow, erroneously this hellhole was on it. I use the term "hellhole " with consideration 'cause they are some strong co-joined words, but Nick's earns it. Lousy food in a horrid former nightclub. I mean this space was a downer when Memphis Minnie's was here, and although they didn't have great 'que, it was still 'cue and that transcends all environments (see Smitty's in Lockhart Texas). So, my take on this place was that I just had the wrong thing. I work a couple of blocks away and know sane people who go here and like it. So I figured I was just ordering wrong. I was thinking it was like a taqueria, and expecting at least a decent taqueria type experience. So I retried the place ordering what seemed to be a consensus pick. Fish taco. Nick's style, with the extra crap. This meant a fried fast food style tortilla with a unfried industrial style tortilla that apparently was just pulled out of the tortilla bag and wrapped around the fried one (?-why?) and filled with decent fish, and the world's most expensive guacamole ( I think it was 2 bucks for a tablespoon of the precious green substance, but I could be wrong, they might have provided some other "upgrade" as well. Whatever it was, 2 tacos and a beer, a couple of bucks in the tip jar, and out about 15 bucks and sitting in what has to be the ugliest eating environment in the city, so 1 star and my own little nickname for the place Nick's crappy tacos.
author: James T.

description:
this is my usual go to place for a carne asada burrito. i enjoy the space nick's has during the day since it turns into the Rouge nightclub in the evening. 

with that said, nick's is cash only and has limited alcohol options, but if you walk over several feet, you can pay with CC at a full bar for drinks.
author: Bonnie Y.

description: I like this place because the tacos and atmosphere remind me of some of the places I have eaten in SoCal. If you have spent any time down south you know what I mean.
author: Drue C.

description: Bombass Fish tacos! Get two, and be sure to get them "Nick's Way"!!! Only bummer, CASH only, and its a little pricy, but you'll be stuffed!
author: Audrey K.

description:
"Uh... isn't this Rouge?" Apparently best known among friends as a nightclub, I surprised them with Rouge's day job transformation--a hipster run taqueria, complete with red walls, plush seating, several chandeliers and one lone sombrero to denote that indeed Mexican fare was served in this night club.
This had been on my bookmark list forever since Satyan P. touted another Taco Tuesday place for us to explore and offered this as a challenge to our regular Blue Light hangout. The tacos we got looked exactly like the pictures, but I have to say... the pescado taco? No bueno. Maybe it was just wrong timing but, it was super fried to the point that the fish was not really soft whitefish anymore, but more like dehydrated tuna jerky, ew! Additionally, it is not part of their Taco Tuesday special, which only include carne asada, pollo and carnitas but, my friends, stay within those bounds because those are really the only ones we found worth it! It's $2 per taco, and $5 for 2 Coronas; my advice, get a few carne asada and pollo, and a round of Coronas. You'll probably average the same price as Blue Light, but be better filled; I'd say, average out 2 to 3 tacos, and one $5 set of the beers should satisfy nicely. I think it's worth it to get it Nick's Way on at least one taco, but... not necessary. The guac is fantastic, and for a $1 more it isn't too bad but then... you think about it... $3 a taco? Hmm...
That said, I still like Blue Light better, even though there is more space to stand and eat (yup, Nick's is not free from seating issues), and dignified order to Nick's Crispy Tacos (note though, the wait is still pretty long, but since they have a line-ordering system you're safe to know what the approximate time would be to get your taco...). With better pricing at Blue Light, libations seem easier to come by and the nights extended with chaotic life.
All in all, it was okay, and for a group of Taco Tuesday regulars, it was a better atmosphere and ordering experience. I would say, not overwhelmingly better than Blue Light but not bad either. I would come back but no, I'm not in love. (Think I was really was put off by that fish taco, sigh.). There is one other plus for Nick's: Turn around for seating doesn't seem too bad as the clock ticks towards 8, the reverse effect of Blue Light.
Still, it's all about having a good time, and I think I'm just not in-sync with Nick's vibe.
author: Jessica L.

description: So good! Battered fish tacos Nick's way is definitely the way to go. Order a corona or 12 and you have yourself a nice well balanced meal.
author: jung j.

description: This place is lots of fun for taco tuesdays!  The food is pretty good especially after a few beers and there is always a good crowd.
author: Rachel Q.

description: Holy burrito this place rocks my face off. It bugs that they only take cash, but their burritos are so good I don't care. Their margaritas also look quite delish (and strong), although whenever I'm at Nick's its usually because I am trying to get rid of the alcohol in my body, not replenish. I don't know who this dude Nick is, but I love him.
author: Kristen D.

description: Mmm, crispy tacos. I'd heard a lot about this place and finally tried it, and it was worth the drive from the south part of the city. No need to have a burrito -- I was there for the namesake item. The ad hoc taqueria atmosphere was a little weird, and the somewhat stark lighting and fuzzy reggae music weren't necessarily ideal, but the food was fantastic. Deliciously thick homemade chips with bright pico de gallo made for a great start, and the tacos were tip-top. I had one chicken taco and one pescado (battered fish) taco, both "Nick's way" (using fried tortillas and including cheese and guacamole). They were giant and filling and yummy. Go.
author: Tara M.

description:
i stopped by nick's for lunch takeout in between a hellish workday. 
i double parked the beater and hit the hazards. 
scampered into the joint with my little legs and 2.5" heels.

got me a fish taco, a chicken taco, and a (err..) DIET coke cuz yo man, i'm on a diet.

the smell beckoned. i ripped the fish taco open and devoured that shit before i hit van ness, paying no mind to the shredded cabbage handlebar moustache i was rockin. 


busted out the chicken taco. juicy, ginormous, crispy beany goodness. salsa and guac running down my forearm through the crevice made by clasping the taco firmly in one hand. i call this the taco juice spout.

looked down at the empty paper bag. the ends of my mouth quivered with both deliverance and anxiety. no more. 

no.
more.
tacos.
wait what?
no more tacos?
NO MORE TACOS????

red light.

i glanced left, then right.
slowly lifted my taco shovel of a hand.
quickly stuck my tongue out and licked the taco spout trail.
oh yes, i soooooo did it. 
and it was fucking righteous.

had anyone seen what i had done?
the guilt and paranoia set in. 

rearview check. side mirrors check.

whew.
the things you do alone in your car...
author: Vanessa D.

description: So, I think my expectations of Nick's were exceedingly high. Every person I encountered who had been here had the most amazing things to say, so I expected an orgasmic food experience. This is not what I got. However, it was still delicious. The ingredients are fresh and you can taste it. Additionally, they use Niman Ranch meat, which makes a huge difference. The tacos have a clean taste (I hate that oniony lingering aftertaste that often accompanies Mexican food) and I found that two were sufficient  to fill me up. Also, if you come in during happy hour, you can get $2 wells and margaritas, which go excellently with your tacos. Overall, very good.
author: Veronica W.

description: The burritos are great. The tacos, not so much. I know they're all about the crispy tacos but they are just dripping in grease. It's kind of gross. Stick to the burritos. Also, call ahead and order before you get there unless you want to wait in a line 20 people deep. That is, if you can get through. Sometimes they don't both to answer the phone or they leave it off the hook so you get a busy signal. Very frustrating.  But for 8 bucks, it's a good burrito.
author: S M.

description: Good tacos, weak burritos (but still delicious), great fresca, and serve your own pitchers of water (bubbly OR flat!)  The feel and ambiance of a classy fast food restaurant, they bring you your food, employees were very nice, and I come back often!
author: Allie L.

description: Perhaps I'm a bit of a yuppy, but I prefer Nick's Crispy Tacos to any taqueria in the Mission.  They use whole pinto beans and don't put any rice in the burritos, so they're very juicy. My only complaint is that their napkins are super thin and wimpy.
author: Allison S.

description: I'm a carnitas aficionado, and Nick's does it up right.  Nicks's Way is the proper way to complete your taco.  The carnitas was bursting out of the taco and it was juicy and flavorful, actually, my mouth is watering as I type this out...excuse me, I'm suddenly craving for a freakin taco. bye.
author: Ryan P.

description: This place is right next to my work so it's a regular lunch spot. They have the best tacos. I also like their pescado burrito and their crispy quesadillas are yummy too. However, they are cash only and you have to pay extra for a basket of chips and salsa. Also, their water tastes kinda metal-y.
author: Jane C.

description: I would say that Nick's has an unusual vibe to it, being super low-key but having a separately named bar in the middle of the dining area. The picnic table decor, order at the counter service, and huge portions are a nice adjunct to the sassy bar located inside. Seriously, it is so random. But, I just can't help but love the food. It's really that good, and a great weeknight casual dining spot.
author: Jamie C.

description: Ok, there is something seriously wrong with a Mexican restaurant laid out in red velvet (courtesy of rouge) but hey, in Russian Hill, beggars cant be choosers when it comes Burritos. You get any cuisine under the sun in this neighborhood but for south of the border, this is basically it.  So getting over my aversion to plush red, the food is actually decent. The Burritos and Quesadillas wont disappoint. It is a bit pricey and doesnt quite measure up to my favorites in Mission or East Bay but I will come back again and again when I just absolutely want Mexican right away.
author: Jan Michael K.

description: 4.5 - This place hits the spot when I want a good crispy chicken taco at a very good price.  The spicy, buttery corn on a stick is awesome - my husband and I recommend it.  We love going here for dinner about once a month.
author: Rise G.

description:
My favorites
1. Guacamole - one of the best i've ever had
2. Salsa - it comes w/ the Guac
3. Tortilla chips - they're fresh and tastes great w/ #1 and #2
4. Quesadilla - really big
5. Fish tacos - don't mess up ! i forgot to order it Nick's way when I brought some friends here.  They weren't impressed.  I forced them back in again to give it a second chance, and this time ordered it Nick's way.  Now they love it as much as me!
author: rien d.

description: Carne asada tacos, I've had better in the drug pusher/homeless frequented taquerias around 6th and Market.  I didn't get them "crispy."  Maybe next time.
author: K W.

description:
yummy fish tacos. def the best thing i've tried there so far..and cheap!

-1 star for being cash only.
author: NF T.

description:
This place is awesome.  Cash only and definitely don't go late on the weekends.  It turns into some weird night club.  

Nick's way is the only way to get the tacos.  Margarita's are pretty weak sauce.
author: Peter F.

description: Utterly brilliant.  Great food everywhere on the menu and reasonably priced.  And you can eat it and get completely hammered with Tequilas of all sorts and Mexican beer in the symbiotic drinkerie next door.  In fact, the eating and drinking are more conjoined than symbiotic.  The plush seating has a kind of soaked in last night at the boozer smell that reminds me of home.  Ahh, home.  Guadalajara and Southend twinned?  Watch this space...
author: Nick J.

description: I love the tacos. They are definitely the best we have ever had. The pescadero taco with gucamole, lime mayonnaise was fantastic!!! The fish is soo fresh and flaky. My hubby got the shrimp and grilled fish, which was also very good...but the pescadero is the bomb!
author: Shaheen L.

description: I was in SF for a basketball tourney and while I was here I wanted to try to check off as many of my 7x7 the Big SF Eats... Nicks Crispy Taco's was on the list.  I ordered two taco's: 1. Pascado Baja Style and 1. Grilled Fish, both Nick's way. The bf ordered one Chicken Taco and one Been and Cheese Burrito.  One things for sure these are good size Tacos. As for the taco's themselves they were delicious! I really loved how they made the inside tortilla crispy while leaving the outside one soft. The guac is definitely clutch. I did get these tacos to go, so I think they were a little more soggy then they were supposed to be but overall it was an excellent meal!
author: Courtney Y.

description: They had a proper blended margarita ready for me when I needed one. Complete with salted rim. Very reasonable price too, considering it was well past anything resembling a happy hour. Great flavour options! (my friend had the strawberry variety).
author: Alex B.

description: Good Tacos but I am lazy and I hate waiting in queue.
author: Marcus R.

description: Tacos "Nick's Way" and Pitchers of Margarita has kind of turned into a ritual with my group of friends.  The booth seats are great because if more people show up, everyone just has to scoot in, and the people on the outside have to buy the next pitcher.  I don't really understand the transition to night club though.
author: Lizzy G.

description: Oh Nick - why do you have to make such delicious fish tacos.  Go glutinous style and get it Nick's way.
author: Kenny H.

description: Man-O-Man does Nicks hit the spot! nothing like the carne/pollo tacos nicks way to warm your belly. Not bad Margies either.
author: Luke P.

description: The tacos are hit or miss, sometimes soggy but sometimes so good that you want to crawl back into that tiny kitchen and eat every last bit in sight.
author: Ana C.

description:
ok finally i've been to this place enough for it to deserve a review from yours truly.
if you want to eat tacos in a reggae club atmosphere and hob nob with marina folks who decided to break free and come to russian hill for a mexican getaway then eat here. do what i say. order two baja tacos and soak them in whatever sauces they supply you with for your taco pleasure. do. it.
author: alexi c.

description:
Holy crap batman!  Cheesy nightclub by night.  Server of heavenly delicious goodness by day!  The fish tacos are the best I've ever had.  Use the red squirty bottle hot sauce and taste heaven.  Like some other fellow yelpers, the bar was set by Wahoo's in Southern Cal, but man oh man does San Francisco, specifically Nick, know how to make an awesome fish taco.   The corn with cheese on it is worth a try too.  Delicioso.

p.s.  Am I the only one that think "fish taco" sound dirty?
author: Jane M.

description:
MMmmmm.....

Taco Tuesday Nick's Way!!!!!

No need to say any more.

Only reason for 4 stars versus 5 stars is because of the nasty smell coming off of the 50 year old beer soaked plush red booths.  I always sit as far away as possible or take out!!!
author: Adam L.

description: Awesome tacos on Taco Tuesday....two beers for 5 bucks...pretty awesome all around. MINUS the fact that its hard to find somewhere to perch to eat this mexican yumminess...(its kind of claustrophobic, kind of a meat market) but i really enjoyed my tacos and the people watching. It is a great place to be a young professional...i dare say i didn't see anyone over 30. Fun, good food...could prob see myself going there maybe one tuesday a month.
author: Jess V.

description:
Two words: Pescado Taco

Just eat one and you'll be stuck coming back here once a week for all of eternity.
author: Mike C.

description: I prefer Pancho's over Nick's. Pancho's has better tortillas, meat, and salsa.
author: Carlos L.

description: Finally made it to Taco Tuesday and loved the ambiance, food, drinks, and prices!  Will be back!
author: A B.

description: So far I've only had the tacos, but I must say they were mighty fine.  I would go there all the time if it were closer.
author: Russel S.

description: I ordered a taco and chips. The taco was very yummy indeed, but the service was SUPER SLOOOOOWWWWW.
author: Sue L.

description:
I'm a very strong advocate of the Mission-street taquerias, and I've had the best in the South Bay as well, so I was pretty skeptical.

Russian Hill? Why would there be good tacos in Russian Hill?

But oh man, I was wrong. I do have room in my heart for another favorite taco...a crispy one.
author: Asdf A.

description: Damn it.  I went for 8 years only vaguely aware that this place existed, but now that's shot to hell.  I finally went in and tried their tacos, and oh, YUM!  I had a Carne Asada with black beans and guacamole and I think it's my new food crush.  I even ate the pico de gallo, and I am not a tomato fan.  Great, now I'll probably be craving tacos all the time - just what I don't need.
author: DD B.

description: This is the place to go when you are jonesin' for a taco/burrito and can't make the trek to the mission. Before I moved out of the neighboorhood to the east coast, I brought dinner here for a week, literally.
author: Julianne M.

description:
It would be a criminal act of hypocrisy for me to give Nick's anything but five stars given how often I eat there. I live a few blocks away and that is no accident or coincidence. When considering a few different apartments, this was the conversation my roommate and I had. 

Me: The place in the haight was really big, and has a spot, and is something like half the price of the other one. 
Rm: Yeah, but the place in russian hill is by Nicks.
Me: Good point. 
Rm: So that's it then.
Me: I guess so . . .  (reflecting in amazement that a taco shop can have so much sway in such an important decision)

It was thus decided we were to live here. 

So the other reviews have it pretty well covered. The chicken tacos Nick's way are tough to beat. 

I feel compelled to mention that the Monday special on nachos is particularly amazing. Seriously, I consider myself something of a nacho expert, kinda like Beavis in the early years, and I swear to everything holy these are the greatest nachos I've ever tasted. Home made chips, fresh guacamole, and the grilled chicken will blow your mind. Enjoy.
author: Jake C.

description: Not only can you get an orgasm in your mouth, you can shoot the shit with the bartender at Rouge who's getting ready for his shift while getting dizzy from the mirrored walls!   This place is so ecclectic and downright amazing.  Just bring cash and an empty stomach as you're about to stuff your face with amazing fried tortilla/guac/steak goodness.
author: Kathleen B.

description: Sinful! Thanks to my brother's suggestion, I got crispy fish tacos "Nick's way" fried and with guac on top. Adding a side of chips w/guac and a margarita just totally rocked my world that night. I could easily see becoming addicted if I lived closer. Definitely the sassiest Mexican joint I've ever eaten in, since it's a nightclub late night. I might dare to compare it to Bake Sale Bettie's chicken sandwich in Oakland...
author: Jessica G.

description: I am definitely going to be returning to this place.  In the beginning I was skeptical about how great a joint that serves tacos could be- boy was I wrong.  They have a nice selection of foods to choose from; quesadillas to burritos, to tacos.  The service was quick, and the atmosphere in this place was to die for.  Very lively- at night the place turns into a lounge, called the Rouge.
author: Anthony L.

description: I know this annoyingly yappy girl who crashes our couch all the time.  Pretty much, she's the last person I would ever want to hang out with.  But, when she offered up Nick's Crispy Taco's, I walked the 6 blocks there, listened to her obsess over my upstairs neighbor and her other yappy annoying small talk, all for two scrumptiously Nick's ways tacos.  Soooo good - with the crispy and soft shell... and seriously what makes it even better is that it actually turns into Rouge at night!  One day I was there sooo hungover and going god this place looks familiar...yup.  I was actually there with my dancing shoes the night before....
author: Sloane R.

description: I had another Chicken burrito from Nick's today...tasty but expensive, that's the wrap on this place. And I'm not so big on the fact they use white meat chicken.
author: Jason R.

description: The hands down best mexican food I've ever eaten, anywhere.  The pescado taco "nick's way" is culinary perfection.  The red sauce and the green sauce on every table are both exceptionally good.  I would love to buy those sauces and take them home.  Amazing.
author: Lloyd W.

description: This is the spot. This is not authentic Mexican from the Mission. This is NIck's ecclectic bad ass tacos! Get em "Nick's Way' and enjoy the casual laid back red room.
author: Peter N.

description: Delicious!  Absolutely best nachos (doesn't get soft from the melted cheese) and pescado taco i've ever had in my life.
author: Jennifer H.

description: Mexican food is the ultimate comfort food and when you upgrade the ingredients & preparation style, you have a hit. The bar/lounge area is a good place to spread out with some cocktails. It's a bar with a taco stand, so don't let the bad service upset you, it's supposed to be that way (they bus food to you and if you need something else, get off your ass and order it!). Quesadillas are the best I've had but don't get carried away, this place can unexpectedly become a night-ender.
author: David C.

description: Was visiting the SF area with some friends and decided to take a stroll down the street to see what I could find to eat. Saw this taco joint and decided to stroll in. Was busy because it was a Friday night but none the less still good. Long story short, was great food for great prices. Make sure to get them Nick's Way. Hopefully will be able to return.
author: Jay F.

description:
i thought this place was overrated. its called crispy tacos, but the taco is barely a 3 on the crisp-o-meter. a crispy taco's crunch is supposed to reverberate throughout your mouth and frame as you bite into those little air pockets that release the aroma of fried tortilla. At least, thats what I think of when i hear "crispy taco". (one of the best crispy tacos i've ever had was in an el torito in tsukuba, japan, but thats a different review).

I ordered a pescado taco and a carne asada nick's way, but the guac just seemed cloying and overly messy. My first two bites of the pescado taco were all fried batter with no fish. It wasn't bad, it just wasn't great. The carne asada taco was better, with more flavor in the meat and beans, but still not wowing. The fried chips were pretty good, but they cost monies...in my book, tacos and free chips are like steak dinners and free bread. you just expect it. but i have noticed a trend to charge for tortilla chips wherever i go lately...another aside.

the horchata was sweet and good though. i think after all the hype, i just prefer other fish tacos to this one.
author: Jade L.

description: I wish I could eat this food every day for every meal. It's that good. The grilled fish taco and chips and salsa are ridiculous. Just try it. Nicks way or not, I think this food is incredible. Also, $3 margaritas from rouge before 9pm!
author: Corinne R.

description: The tacos are good and filling. Grilled fish is my favorite. I only get them Nick's way, which is the crispy version. The last two times though, I have to say, the tortillas haven't been as fresh... Good hot sauce!
author: Luis A.

description:
Great fish tacos!

Good drinks at the bar too...

It is a sort of dive-bar with crazy couches... 

It is not your typical taqueria, so some in our group didn't get the concept...

Since it was on the "top 100 things to do in SF b-4 you die," others had too high of expectation... but I got what I came for: the fish taco's and tried an al pastor taco I think which was good as well.

Its a good taco at a dive bar setting... how bad can that be? Is it as good as a fish taco on the beach in Mexico, no, but it is a solid fish taco.
author: Matt D.

description:
Yes I know Nick's Crispy tacos has 579 reviews and counting, but I just had to do it. 

I grew up in the Mission district of San Francisco. NO! Not the outer Mission. NO! Not the SF downtown mission. I am talking about straight up 24th street and Mission area. Throughout my grade school days I frequented the Mission district quite often, so I know a thing or two about good Mexican food. 

So when my co-worker told me about "the best tacos ever," I was surprised when he said I would find these tacos on Broadway (an area known for other things, if you know what I mean). He told me to try out the Pescado (baja fried fish) Taco, but I had to have it Nick's way (w/ jack cheese & guacamole). And I actually have to give it up to my homie. Why? Because today I ate the most awesome tacos ever. If it's you're first time going to Nick's, I suggest trying out the Pescado. This is the taco that will keep you coming back for more. I also had the carne asada tacos, which were pretty damn good too. I haven't tried the other things on the menu (burritos, quesadillas, etc), but why come to Nick's Crispy Tacos if you are planning to order a burrito. You don't go to Mitchell's Ice Cream and buy a smoothie, right? Well, I hope you wouldn't. But anyway, I guarantee you will be a very happy camper when you're done with that yummy taco. =)

Recommendations: 
Pescado Taco - Nick's Way 
Carne Asada - Nick's Way 
Watermelon Auqas Frescas

PS: Nick's Crispy Taco's is Rouge nightclub after hours.
author: Lisa T.

description: This is worth the hype. Grilled fish and baja fish are so good nicks style. Love the reggae too.
author: james j.

description:
if the disco balls, shimmery bar and roomy crimson booths dont draw you in, then the promise of tasty tacos should. who doesnt love a good taco?

as a child i loved the movie gidget -- you know, that film with sandra dee, a real square, who wants to get respect from the local surfer boys who all live on the beach and have raging clambakes [that she's never invited to],  so she learns to surf? she spends all day hanging out on the beach in so-lame-its-hot bathing suit, shirking jobs, potential husbands,  an ivy league future [or is it secretary school? can't remember] ....the point is, that bitch just wants to get laid by moondoggie! and he won't give her any play! and at some point they eat fish tacos. so yeah, i've always wanted to surf and then eat fish tacos, and its the only place i've ever found tacos so delicious i wanted to scream. plus they have a bangin hot sauce.
author: leona ..

description: Nick's crispy tacos rock!!  Make sure you get them "nick's way" for a baseball sized dollop of guac on the end.  The quesadillas are good too -- tons of meat and very filling.  One to two taco's is all I need.  Soak up the club atmosphere while you wait for your food.
author: Kumar D.

description: Pretty darn good.  I was kind of surprised since it was a Russian Hill Mexican joint but the taco's done Nick's Way hit the spot.  Nick just goes for the obvious hit with a grip of guac on a soft taco.  Works for me.
author: Tom K.

description: I can not even walk by without stopping in for a  fish  taco.The problem is I always over order and eat it all.Good for  my taste buds, not so  great for body.
author: kristie l.

description: Only been once but it pretty much blew me away. Simple, satisfying and totally delicious. I will go here any time I'm in the 'hood.
author: Charlie C.

description: Great tacos -- especially Nick's way.  Love this place -- very funky and never disappointed in the food.  Taco Tuesday is cool -- although the lines are not worth it.
author: Phil C.

description: Holy heavens, the camarones taco, Nick's way - that is as good as it gets. The seat arrangements and salsa options are not as good as it gets, but I cannot wait to get back there. The chips are fantastic, too.
author: Stephanie C.

description: Great Hangover food.  Be sure to get any one of their tacos NICK'S WAY!  That's the way to get them.  Also note, they are cash only!
author: Danielle V.

description: All I can say is "order it Nick's way."  To be honest, I've only ever tried their pescado tacos (Nick's way), and their strawberry fresca.  But I am so impressed by them, I order them every time.  Whenever I make the 45 minute drive to the city, I do my best to swing by and grab a couple of the famous tacos.  Warning: completely addictive.
author: Raegan T.

description:
I was pleasantly surprised when I stopped by Nick's with a few friends on Taco Tuesday. Instead of a taco shop, I found myself in a restaurant/bar/lounge, courtesy of the Rouge nightclub, which is connected next door. It's really simple: line up, buy your tacos (or whatever else you want), take a number, and wait for them to bring your food out. It was incredibly busy at around 7:30PM (Taco Tuesday runs from 5-9PM), but the food still came out suprisingly fast. Within five minutes, my three Nick's style (with cheese + guacamole) tacos were delivered straight to my spot at the bar. It was actually so busy that when we got there, it was standing room only and we had to scout around before we finally found a table that could seat us. The music was great, the drinks were cheap ($2 bud/bud light, 2 coronas for $5, $3 margaritas), and the atmosphere overall was unusually awesome.
