Definitely a suprisingly great find and an amazing place to pick up some cheap and delicious food while enjoying a lounge-esque feel.

The most hilarious part had to be the guy they had working in the bathroom - they have a guy in a nice suit standing in the men's restroom who turns on the water for you and pulls the lever for your paper towels. Next to him is a shelf full of little goodies like Starburst, Jolly Ranchers, and random lotion/perfume products which you are "free to use," but of course, you're expected to tip in the bowl  in the center. A little awkward, I must admit, but pretty hilarious. Totally out of place in a joint like this but something to remember the place by. Nick's Crispy Tacos is a winner!
author: Willy C.

description: Taco Tuesdays are fun, and beer specials are always good, but the tacos themselves didn't blow me away. Maybe I need to give it another shot? Standing up while eating two tacos and holding a beer is also pretty difficult. Next time I'll be arriving earlier or trying harder to secure a table.
author: Amanda R.

description: Really good tacos trick is obvi Nick's way, the pescado is my fave also the taco salad is really good everything is fresh and tasty. Taco Tueday go off here so join in if you like cheap tasty tacos and drink specials. Be warned cash only in this place so don't get caught ordering up a storm and reaching for the plastic :)
author: Olga P.

description:
Fish burritos definitely recommended.

Dos Equis 2 for $5 happy hours. 

A perfect combo.
author: jason e.

description: The fish taco was okay but the carnitas was a lot more better. Tacos are $3.25 each then its extra dollar to make it Nick's way, which comes out to be about $5 each taco. Get it Nick's way because the guacamole and cheese makes all the difference in the world.
author: Robin L.

description: awesome! awesome awesome awesome! the food tastes excellent, very fresh and the price is right. I am nor crazy about the decor but who cares if you don't even notice it because your food is divine?! I would recommend everything "Nick's way" (with guacamole and cheese/sour cream) because it's super delicious. The two salsas on the tables are fantastic as well!!!
author: Oyo S.

description: I LOVE LOVE LOVE Nick's Crispy Tacos. OMG, why I didn't write a review on this sooner, I have no idea but I'll call it "pregnancy brain." Their fish tacos are the bizz-omb and you must order it Nick's way otherwise it's just a regular ole fish taco and you might as well get it from La Salsa. Don't get me wrong, La Salsa has some good fish tacos as well (the Baja style), but we're talking Nick's here. And a fried tortilla that wraps around it? C'mon, you must be joking when you think it ain't all that. I love it Nick's way and the Pescado taco is delectable... YUM YUM YUM. I just ate dinner and my mouth is watering for Nick's Crispy Tacos and would you believe that my favorite food is NOT Mexican? I'm laughing my arse off just thinking how crazy my salivation gets when I'm in line to order my food. By the way, if you're wondering why it only get's four stars and not five, it's because I usually run into these semi-long lines and if anyone knows me, I have absolutely no patience at all. Does anyone know a hungry woman? Well think of a hungry pregnant woman with no patience.
author: Sharon B.

description:
I don't really know why I'm reviewing a place with a billion reviews, but I'll keep it short and simple. 

Why Nick's is super good:
1. Tacos are amazing
2. Prices are very good.
3. Great happy hour, which combines #1 and #2.
4. Good TVs and atmosphere.

Why it's not 5 star:
1. Gets way too crowded, and no places to sit
2. Parking is hard. 

Bam.
author: Jeffrey V.

description: One of the best hangover spots in the city - order it "Nick's Way" and you cannot go wrong.  I lived 2 blocks from Nick's when it first opened and was proudly one of their first patrons.  At the time I had never had a taco made the way Nick made them...Nick may not be involved anymore, but the taco's are still legit.  Order the chips with salsa - amazing, and the red sauce is so good its almost drinkable.  2 Chicken taco, Nick's Way, please!  Yumm.
author: Jessica T.

description: Baja Fish Tacos - Nick's Way - WOW!  I've been on the search for the best fish taco for a few years, and this one is as close to perfection as i've found in a number of years.  My friends loved the corn on the cob, but I came for tacos.  Try for yourself.
author: Nick S.

description:
this place makes my nipples hard with excitement and satisfaction,the Carne asada burritos are damn good.The Elote's are amazing equivalent to the lil mexican lady street vendors in l.a.
i've took my mom here a couple times she approves!
we get glutness when we come here

p.s-and its cheap!
author: David c.

description: The tacos are amazing and there's something about the salsa that is extremely addictive.  Contrary to some other reviews, I thought the service was great, the guys that worked there seemed friendly.  Can't wait to go back for more...
author: ellyk E.

description: When they decided to call this place "Nick's Crispy Tacos" they must have known they were going to make pretty delicious, crisp tacos and that they do. They really are delicious and totally inexpensive because one is enough to fill you up. My attempts at other items on the menu (burrito- dry, nachos- easy squeeze cheese) have been well below delicious. When in the neighborhood, looking for a quick bite, I will devour their tacos. I wouldn't come out of way to eat here, partially because it just doesn't compare to my beloved Mission taco stops.
author: Alicia J.

description:
yes, like everyone else, i really like nicks.
fun place to casually get an evening started.

definitely get it nicks way... tacos that is.

the burritos are just average. also, they do not serve mexican rice here, and i tried calling to get take out around dinner time, and no one answered the phone!!!  Answer the phone Nicks!!!
author: shaun l.

description: Good, not great.  Although their guacamole is the real deal, and could easily get 4.5 stars.  Also, their burritos are a tad smaller than the behemoths in the Mission, which is also a plus in my book.  I've been there about a half-dozen times (and one of them on Cinco de Mayo, lord help me):  2 times was 4 stars, the rest almost 3 stars, so I think it averages out to a solid 3 stars.  Was disappointed last time when I got chips and salsa and guac to go.  Opened the container, thought "wooo-weeee, that's a lotta guacamole!" only to discover that it was about 4 chip scoops and then a container full of pico de gallo.
author: darla s.

description: !Delicioso! I loved the fish tacos & the beef taco - Nick's way.
author: Sally M.

description: Very good and quick Mexican food.  No-frills approach to silverware-less dining.  Nick's Style is the only way to go.  Try the fish or carnitas tacos.  Seating is usually limited to nothing in the evening, so the earlier the better.  Also, get out of dodge before it turns into the super metro "Rouge" club.  Unless you're into that sort of thing.
author: Sean M.

description: After reading the latest review on Nick's to try it for the first time, I was a little weary of going here(a few were not impressed). But after trying some I was actually surprised...they weren't that bad at all infact they were hecka!!! good. Started off with some chips and salsa with guac and that was goooood!!! Then had some carne asada tacos Nick's way and they were awesome...downed it with a bottle of Coke...what could be better...great Mexican food with a cold glass bottle(not plastic) of Coke and reasonably priced...loved it!!! I highly recommend Nick's Crispy Tacos!
author: murs.one ..

description: Yummy yummy yummy in my tummy!!  This place couldn't be any cooler.  The margs are amazingly tasty, but make sure your order them with your food and not the second bar in the joint where I would recommend that you order a cheap happy hour beer.  I love me some Mexican food, despite all of you who think that I only eat Italian food (which is true some weeks).  But their chicken burrito with gauc, and sour creme is delicious.  The reggae music sang straight to my heart.  The whole experience was amazing and I can't wait to visit again.
author: Michelle N.

description: I always order the tortilla Soup or the taco salad, both are great! Usually take out, but the food is much better if you just take the extra time and eat there.  The Sponge Bob pinata is pretty amazing too!
author: Lisa D.

description: Mm. Tacos. I lived about a block from this place for something like 5 months before finally venturing in.  I had originally looked at the place and thought, 'any food prepared in Rouge must surely be contaminated by the smell of cheap cologne and Chlamydia.' Finally, though, I succumbed to the hype machine (dude-all the cool kids eat there), and I have never been so pleased with a taco. I've only had two kinds, fish and vegetarian, and I love the veggies so much, I refuse to try anything else.  Warm, crunchy, covered with mounds of fresh guacamole. HEAVEN.  I recommend calling ahead for your order if you're going at peak taco-eating time.  And bring cash. Nicks is not plastic-friendly.
author: Amanda B.

description: I love Nick's!  I used to live two blocks away and could not stop eating there.  It is definitely not authentic but oh my is it delicious!!!  Their fish tacos are amazing, they have the best chips ever (and with a side of guacamole they become to die for) and their carnitas is great.  Reasonable prices and generous portions too.  I only wish they accepted credit cards and were open later.  Since I moved to Noe Valley I have really missed this place and try to make it back there whenever I can.  But at least El Farolito is close so I can get my Mexi fix!
author: Jen S.

description: Came here the day after a night on the town... Great place to cure a hang over. I like the idea of having to order your food first and then grab a seat. Although I got a funny look because we didn't realize it was like this until nobody helped us for 15 min. Geeze, out of town-ers!!! Anyway I ordered the chicken taco and they were to die for! And Id like to think I'm somewhat of a chicken taco extraordinaire. I give it 3 stars because everybody failed to notify us that you needed to order first, and that the decor of Rouge (which is the same rest/building)was kinda run down looking during the day. Other than that you can bet Ill come back when in town again... Of course after trying some other chicken tacos for comparison!
author: Renee B.

description: I came here on a Monday night at 5pm because I had a Scoutmob certificate, and I thought it would be a good deal with 50% off.  Plus, I had come here a few years ago, so I knew they had pretty good fish tacos.  Well, they were out of fish tacos by 5pm, so I can't review that.  But instead, we got 2 pollo asados, 2 carnitas, and 2 camarones, all done Nick's Way.  Even with $10 off, the bill came out to be $23.  Without our discount, that means that each taco would average out to be over $5 each.  For that price, they better be some damn good tacos.  But alas, they were just ok.  They weren't bad, but I wouldn't run all the way to Pac Heights for them.  Plus, the place was packed by the time we left, with the line for people waiting to get tacos almost to the door.  That's way too much of a wait for kinda expensive tacos that were good, but not great.  Maybe the fish tacos are great, but I didn't get to try them this time.  I do hear that they have $2 tacos (besides fish) on Tuesdays, so that may be the time to come for cheaper tacos, but I also expect the line to be twice as long (and it was already long on Monday).
author: Tyler C.

description: A friend of mine suggested this place for great taco's while we were catching some college football on the TV's at a sports bar down the street (Green's). These tacos are legit! The combination of soft and crispy tortillass is really what sets these apart  from other tacos I have tried in the city. Gotta order them "Nick's Way". The carnitas and chicken were juicy and flavorful. The texture of meat was tender and was complimented by the crunch of the hard shell tortilla and the creaminess of the guacamole. I can't wait to find a reason to be near this place again.. if I cant find one soon enough I'm going to have to make a special trip!
author: dan m.

description: This place went downhill after the ownership changed.  They cannot figure out how to bring out the tacos while they are still hot.  I have tried it several times and the one thing that is consistent - cold tacos!
author: P T.

description: Not the best taqueria in town, but it might be the best in Russian Hill (which is like being the coolest kid in a magnet school).  They should stay open later instead of becoming crappy Rouge at night.
author: Andrew C.

description: Yes, the tacos are great, and having it "Nick's Way" is superb, but BEWARE! Don't come to this place for a late-ish dinner (like 8 pm), because they close down shop to re-open as a club, and they will kick you out! Even if you say, "I'm meeting a friend and we would like tacos", they will still kick you out! Not very smart for business...
author: Jessica W.

description: Cash only, often long line/wait but the fish tacos are delish! and so is the Tortilla soup.  Not a big fan of Rouge but Nick's Crispy Tacos is great. Love this place on Saturday/Sunday afternoons to cure hangover! Plus their Tacos for Taco Tuesday are WAY better than Bluelight!
author: Cassie B.

description:
I must say that I've truly been spoiled all of my life while living in California, because Mexican food is all around you and its delicious. Case in point, I live in Davis, which is about 8 miles from Woodland, a town whose residents are predominantly Mexican and make the most amazing foods I've ever savored. I will always be a Guadalajara Taqueria girl, so I am a biased reviewer I guess when it comes to Mexican cuisine. However, being hungry after volleyball practice on Tuesday evening wasn't going to stop me from trying some place new for crispy tacos. 

Everytime I've ever been by Nick's, the place is absolutely PACKED which would indicate that something must be pretty damn good about the place. The line always seems to be 10 back, but it moves quickly as the cashier punches in orders and hands out numbers all nite. The bar is also close by which is a plus, so your wait will never seem that long. Once you order, good luck finding a place to sit. Good thing tacos are a great handheld food and small enough to devour quickly. On my visit, I went with a carne asada and a carnitas taco prepared Nick's style with guac and cheese of course. Carnitas will always have a special place in my heart, so I can never talk bad about it. It was fantabulous! The crispy shell of the taco seemed to be wrapped in another tortilla that seemed not so crispy so that was a small turnoff, but other than that, the tacos were A-OK especially since they were only $2 each on Tuesday!
author: Christina N.

description: Taco heaven!  Taco Tuesdays are insane!  The line is outrageous, but moves right alone.  Tables are hard to get...you must be aggressive if you want to eat your mean sitting.  FYI-get your tacos "Nicks Way."
author: JEN H.

description: This place rocks- must get the Nick's Way with homemade guac and qall the finxings reminisce of the ones in TJ while you eat out front.   Get the Melon drink as well to wash it down...MUST ask for the Habanero sauce- they olny give it to those who dare...no rookies
author: Rob C.

description: Yes we can say overrated...but what makes up for the boring Mexican good is the assortment of sausages that frequent the joint.  It sort of makes waiting in line more pleasant...
author: Amy Z.

description: I love the grilled fish tacos, Nick's Way. I hate the ambiance......the cheesy chandelers, couches and velvet and the patio furniture, HUH? I know it is a club at night.....but I always just feel really weird when I eat here.....
author: Adrienne G.

description:
I went with a friend on a Sunday night. We were staying at the Hilton, and we drove over to try the crispy tacos. Took a while to find parking(being from out of town never helps; if you were near there last Sunday, we were the ones driving poorly that you could peg as being tourists from two blocks away).Great atmosphere, in the funky kind of way. Giant glass chandeliers, red leather and velvet for most of the seating (some chairs, loveseats, booths). I bet it can be a pretty good scene on Fridays and Saturdays.
 Didn't realize they only took cash, so we went across the street to Walgreens, bought a $1 bottle of water and got $40 cash back. 
You order at the counter; the younger counter guy was friendly, patient, and efficient. Tipped him $3 on $37 for counter service... I can sure rack up a bill for a cheap taco place.
We each got a margarita for $5.50. Fully worth it. 
We got an order of the chips, salsa, and guac. for $3.50. The chips and salsa alone, without the guac, are $1.50. I always hate paying for chips, but at least these were really good. Crispy, on the thinner side, just enough salt, covered in chunky, tasty salsa fresca and decent/good guacamole.  Ate the whole damn basket. 
We each got two of the pescado (battered, deep fried fish) tacos done "Nick's Way" (fried tortilla inside the soft one, with jack cheese and guacamole). Big fillet, good amount of cabbage, tasty sauce, jack cheese inside. more salsa fresca and big dollop of guac on top. It was a taco that felt like a 1/2 lb. burger in my hand.  I think I'd like this stye with the grilled fish or chicken, but with the heavily battered fried fish, be prepared for an absolute fry-fest. Two of these gut bombs was more than we could handle on top of the chips and guac. I'd definitely like to go back and try other things next time I'm in the area. I'll just make sure my eyes aren't bigger than my stomach.
author: James P.

description:
After reading tons of great reviews about this place, we were finally in SanFran for a wedding last weekend and dying to try it out. 
Living in Chicago, a fish taco is a rarity (it's all about carne asada tacos and gorditas here) and I was definitely looking forward to trying this taco!
We got to the place on Thursday around 7pm (8/10) and the tables were full, including the bar, with a decent-sized line waiting to order. 
It is a no-frills kinda place. You wait in line, place your order of food and drinks, pay, take your number and find a table. 
Once you've surveyed the place for a table, you may end up where we were - at the tiny "bar" seating that awkwardly faces the booths against the wall. 
Ok, so it wasn't so bad - we just turned our chairs to face each other while we drank our Modelo Especial's and waited for our order. 
The hubby and I both ordered pescado tacos "Nick's way" and also 1 grilled fish taco, just to see what it was like. 
This taco... is heaven. Warm tortilla, filled with a crispy HOT fish fillet, guacamole, shredded cabbage and some yummy mayo-type sauce. It was honestly delicious. We barely talked to each other while eating it besides mumbling "Mmmmm" in-between bites. 
I'm not sure what the plain pescado taco is comprised of... but just go with the "Nick's way" option. Their guacamole is reason enough. 
These are pretty big tacos too, at $4 each... and worth every penny. 

Oh - this place is also really pretty. There are chandeliers hanging throughout the restaurant, and lots of cozy velvet booths and red paint. Turns out, after 10pm it turns into a lounge/club... so if you decide to stay, there ya go! 
We were in and out, as it was the day we flew in, but it hit the spot! We will definitely be back, and recommend it to anyone visiting SF!
author: Candyce P.

description: Here's the deal: Get the fish tacos "Nick's Way". You must. The chicken burrito is also really good.
author: Johnnie M.

description: I've had just about everything on the menu.  Stick with the tacos "Nick's Way" and you won't be disappointed.  I've learned the hard way that they stop taking orders at 9 pm sharp, and they take away the outside seating at about 8:30 pm.
author: Karen R.

description: I didn't want to like this place. Seriously. There was just something about the place and the people who go here. No. I was certain that it wasn't for me. Then I ate there, and couldn't deny it, the guy has figured it out! Damn, he makes a good taco. Nick's Way is the move here, do that and you've got a pretty necessary introduction to the fascination and satisfaction that IS the crispy taco.
author: M S.

description:
FYI...I just received this information regarding the smell

About 7 months ago, there was a fire at a restaurant 3 doors down from Nick's Crispy Tacos and they just started renovating the space the day of my visit  (it had simply been sealed closed after the fire and no one had set foot in there until now)  Well,  the construction workers found 3 refrigerators packed with food and without power for the last 7 months (nasty). Anyways, the smell is dissipating and will hopefully be gone soon.
author: Karla F.

description:
awesome! i think its a few more tacos away on being a five-star Tues dive place..

Carne Asada "nicks-way" is definitely the way to go. 

Need to go in a bigger group and grab a table + try a few more things on the menu. Music is great + mix crowd, but def more of a Russian hill/Marina in-flux of people. 

and $2.00 beers also... Corona Lite for the gf.
author: Jon N.

description: Put the crisp in crispy. Genius Mexican food in an unlikely area (we live in the Mission.) Never a shred of disappointment.
author: Virginia A.

description: Ok, now I'm a big fan of their asada quesadilla with guac and sour cream. you have no idea... still not a fan of tacos...
author: Mercy G.

description: I think this place has the best tacos and margaritas for a good price.  If you want to have a quick bite, then this is the place to go.  The parking kinda sucks, but it's worth circling around for.
author: Jordan S.

description: This is the one place I suggest you begin your gastro-tour of San Francisco.  The sites along the way combined with the feeling in your tummy after eating one or five of Nick's Crispy vegetarian Tacos will only leave you wanting more of what this city has to offer!!
author: joel P.

description:
umm, can we say over-rated?

it's hard to f*ck up a taco.  it really is.  tacos are like sex.  even if they're mediocre, it's still pretty good.  however, nick's found a way to screw up a taco.  i even ordered teh vaunted "nick's way."  just not a tasty production.  booo to the place that screwed up tacos.  this review sucks.
author: Mike C.

description:
I've been here three time.  The first two times were delightful and I truly enjoyed the excellent burritos.

The third time I had their carne asada breakfast burrito and I got food poisoning.  I hope this was just a fluke, but hard to say.
author: David K.

description:
i have a love/hate relationship with taco tuesday. i LOVE tacos. um, duh. specifically the carnitas taco with some guac on the side. and i LOVE the price. duh again. $2 / taco = fantastic = a great meal for $4-5. and i LOVE how close it is to my house, the cheap cerveza and how fast the food comes out.

but alas, i HATE the lines, the thumping music, wrestling the blonds for a table (or even one bar stool, split between two people - yes, i've been that desperate), and especially the smell of disinfectant that pervades the place and manages to overshadow the aroma of tortillas, beans and carne. i mean, i know they have to scrub the place after a raucous saturday night, but cmon, it NEVER smells right in there. 

oh nick's, why must you torture me so? i've decided, as after every time i forget my decision and go back, that takeout is so the way to go. the beer is free at my house!



on a day other than tuesday, especially if you're eating your feelings, get your tacos nick's way. you won't regret it.
author: Sara C.

description: This place was very interesting. I only went into the first part of the place to get my baja style taco to go but you could still see the decor. There are mirrors all over and it's a wacky looking place but looked like a fun place to hang out with your buddies and get some grub. Maybe since I've been to Baja before, I thought the taco tasted like it should have. Meaning, I guess I didn't expect anything less than what it tasted like. Given that I don't live in SF and parking was kind of a bear in that area, I wouldn't drive up there just to get a taco but if I lived in that area, I would probably try it again.
author: Vivian L.

description: the line gets pretty long but never was it hard to find a table. the space is pretty big.. it is inside of a club. i usually get carne asada taco nicks way. my fav. also some nachos to share.. it's a pretty big portion gets you full quick!
author: Anita L.

description: Nicks was not kidding when it said bottomless mimosas. I had the pleasure of trying this place out on New Years day which fell on Sunday and was happy to continue the festivities from the night before there. We ordered food at the counter and recieved a number and stamp for $7 bottomless mimosas. Before we sat down and ordered our drinks our food was there- they serve like cali-mex! The burrittos are huge and their tacos are delicious when you make it Nicks style for an extra $1.  Even though the place was packed our pitcher was constantly filled and the bathrooms were really clean for how many people were there. They had the game on and it was a really fun and inviting atmosphere. Youll make plenty of friends with 4 hours of endless drinking! About $16 for a supreme sunday funday!
author: Amber S.

description: I'm giving this place four stars for the ambiance alone. Nothing fancy, just calm, on the quiet side, plush booths, dark interior but in a get-out-of-the-sun way. And my fish taco was tres Baja.
author: patrick g.

description: Mmm, anything you order on the meny is to die for, especially if you've been drinking!! I know the name is Nick's Crissy Tacos but you have to get the chicken quesadillas, mmmmmm!!!!
author: Lisa H.

description: "Cheap and very delicious tacos; had a great meal for less than $8. Quite a variety of tacos, burritos etc. Bottled Coke imported from Mexico. Funky place; turns into a club/ lounge at nite..."
author: Jocelyn L.

description: The tacos are outstanding. FOR SURE.  Eating inside of an icky bridge and tunnel club (Rouge) in the off hours is just weird and kinda gross and no amount of kiddie pinatas is gonna hide it.  I really do love me them tacos though.
author: Val G.

description:
I've been a regular customer at Nick's, and willing to put up with the strict and arbitrary rules that govern this small pseudo-Mexican fiefdom, but enough is enough.  Don't get me wrong, the Taco's are great, but the management runs the establishment in a way reminiscent of, oh, dare I say it, a certain Seinfeld episode... that's right, they're... TACO NAZIS!  Let's take a look at the rules shall we:
1. No cell phones (not that anyone follows this one)
2. Cash only (thankfully there's a Walgreen's across the street, but it's pretty annoying having to buy a 99 cent item just so I can get cash back every time I want a taco)
3. And this just in, no bringing in a slice of Pizza from "Nicky's" next door, even when in line as a paying customer.  When I had the misfortune of committing this cardinal sin on my last visit I was sternly warned by one of Nick's acolytes that "I had better not do that the next time around".  Or what?  I'll have to pay 1/3 the price at Gordo's?  Some one please steal their recipes, I've had it with these clowns :)
author: Alexander N.

description: Some of the best tacos Ive had, I got two carne asada Nick's way, and Im hooked. Im moving down the corner from here, and Im concerned Im gonna be here way too often. Its kinda funny that its in the same place as rouge. Overall cheap good food, sign me up!
author: Chris P.

description: Fish Tacos were AWESOME.  We stumbled across this place while visiting from Dallas.  The fish tacos were the best I have ever had.  I thought one taco and sharing a basket of chips would be enough...not true I had to go back for seconds.  They only take CASH and do not order while your talking on your cell.
author: Nicholas M.

description: Do not go to Nick's on a hungover Sunday morning if you expect to do anything even remotely active that day. The breakfast burrito will make you feel like someone dropped a load of bricks in your pants, but its well worth a day of indigestion. For example, I tried to go on a two hour mountain bike ride immediately after ingesting one of those bad boys, and it was all bad. That being said, If I know I'm going to be hungover as shit anyway, Nick's is the best way to ease the pain. Get the one with bacon...so so so much bacon, which can never be a bad thing. My only real complaints about Nicks are 1)  the salsa needs to be a lot spicier, and 2) why aren't they open later serving breakfast burritos? Goddamn I so wanted one the other night at 2 am.
author: Kristin B.

description: These tacos make me sing the song Cartman sang when his hand was Jeniffer Lopez! They are crispy and delicious!
author: sweat p.

description: Decent food, but I CANNOT stand eating there!  I'm not even a clean freak, but the only thing that runs through my mind as I sit on those dirty red clubbing booths is, "how many people have barfed on, peed on, and desecrated my seat??"
author: Eddy L.

description: Back when I lived in the TenderNob, every free Saturday or Sunday morning when I had the time I would make a trek up Polk just for the carne asada breakfast burritos at this place. especially extra awesome when you get there right at the start of breakfast time and there's no line. in and out of there in 5 minutes. i'll have to figure out the quickest commute there from Cole Valley now.
author: Stu C.

description: This is place is pretty good, but it's also a little on the pricier end for what it is. The fish tacos are great. Not Mexico great, but it certainly helps to fill that void.
author: Kien L.

description: i live down the street from this place and couldn't ask for a better taco place nearby. I've  had everything from fish tacos, carne asada, pollo and nachos - its all good.  Good selection of mexican soda and beer too.  Dig the casual ambience and cool chandeliers.
author: Aryakaz K.

description:
dear taco, 
i like you with red sauce.
i like you drenched in red sauce.
i like you drenched in red sauce with some good guacamole on top.
I'll be at work thinking about having you for lunch with chicken nick's way and  then for dinner with carne asada. my friends also have  a love affair with you taco. we all think about you, you are one damn good taco.
author: J A.

description: One word: pescado. I am not impressed with anything else they have but this item - possibly the best fish taco I have ever had.
author: Stacy H.

description: Finally made it here after hearing all the great reviews about it.  Yup, definitely a strange place to eat tacos (club decor inside).  I got chicken and steak tacos and was quite disappointed.  Bland, mushy and not memorable.  I didn't get them crispy though.  But I did have some fried fish tacos that the bf ordered and oh man they were so good.  I'm no taco connoisseur but having grown up in SoCal I think these were the tastiest   fish tacos I've had around here (except for the new Wahoos' in Palo Alto but I'm a big Wahoo's fan). Definitely will order these next time.  Pricey tacos but there's not much around here and it's Russian Hill so oh well.
author: Emiko M.

description:
the place:
for one, nick's crispy tacos apparently shares a space with harry denton's rouge, so when you walk into this taqueria with garish velour couches, it makes a little more sense.  the sombreros and faux crystal chandeliers with pinata-type things hanging off them, plus reggae music, however, does not.  

the ordering:
like any ol' taqueria, there's the big ol' sign with the list of food items and prices, and a counter.  unlike most taquerias, however, the guys who take your order are not speaking in spanish and they bring your food to you.

prices:
are cheap cheap cheap!

the food:
i ordered a carnitas taco "nick's way" (with an extra crispy shell and guac) and a carne asada taco the regular way.  the carne asada taco was alright, but kind of bland, but i really loved my carnitas taco.  the added crispy shell and guacamole was a great mix.  the chips we had were also great -- a little thicker, with the right amount of crispiness.

conclusion:
a perfect antidote for these rainy san franciscan days!
author: Jill k.

description: Great, cheap food with nice people waiting to take your order. And if you're riding home with Todd, and happen to go through the Broadway tunnel, this is what's for dinner. I love the green salsa and the tacos are to-die-for.
author: Amanda C.

description: The vegetarian tacos are a great, cheap eat in the neighborhood.  Minus one star for having the world's smallest cups for water.  I'm hoping this was just a fluke, but I'm not sure since I think I was drinking Coke on all my prior visits.  Anyways, today I went with water.  I didn't know water was a drink to be served in shots.
author: Squirrel L.

description: Really?!  I don't understand the appeal here.  Granted, I didn't try a taco, but a taco wouldn't have satiated my hunger pangs.  Instead, went with a carne asada burrito which was decent, but nothing special.  Either I got ripped off here or they need to be clearer on the pricing as my $5.95 burrito somehow cost me $8.05.  Sure I said "Everything on it" but usually that just means to include everything that's usually included on it, right?  Anyway, I may go back one day, but when I can get a taco with "everything on it" in the Mission for $1.50, why bother?
author: Allan H.

description: I went here because some of my friends said let's go somewhere different for Taco Tuesday. So I thought good idea, lets venture out. So away to Russian Hill we went. I had no idea that this tacqueria/restaurant took over the whole old club called Rouge. Is Rouge still open and is it Rouge only at night now? Weird. There was a very long line for tacos. Thank god my friends were there early and got a booth so we could sit otherwise we'd be standing. The line did go quick I must admit, but the tacos were just so so. The ones at Triple Crown are way better and much closer to me then RH. Oh well, I tried.
author: Caroliina F.

description: Quite simply... heaven. I often dream of the chicken quesadillas, the flaky wrap, and the spicy green stuff they keep on the tables. in fact, I think I will have to head there tonight I am salivating at my desk already...
author: Julie K.

description: The food here is great...especially the tortilla soup and the chips and guacamole...the salsa is great...but I like fresh tomatoes and mild salsa.  The chicken tacos (Nick's Way, which means they're crispy) are another great item.  The only thing is a quick lunch can add up if you're not careful and it can take a while for the tortilla soup.
author: Amy C.

description: Amazing tacos, friendly people, a neighborhood classic.
author: Christin A.

description: I've had a few fish tacos in my day, but Nick's hands down has the best I've eaten so far. The fish tacos are so good that I haven't even bother looking at anything else in the menu. If you've ready some of my other reviews you know that I like fish. I like it raw, cooked, fried, you name it. If it's in a taco I like it at Nick's. Be sure to get some hot sauce and if you're gettin' it to go call ahead as the line can get pretty long.
author: Russ T.

description:
this night club no? rouge?  this night club, yah?  taco? horchata? lets do it. 

get the fish taco, nick's way.  deep friend fresh catch of the day, gauc the worx, in a crunchy taco that they panfriy... or whatever is that mexican restaurants do to corn tortillas to make it crunchy and delicious.  

dont forget to get the chips and salsa.  i always throw a fit whenever a texmex joint doesnt serve complimentary chips and salsa... but this my friend, is worth the 1.25.  the orchata aint bad either.  too bad this isnt closer to where i live...

edit. every since nick has released his helms, the tacos are greasy and the service is just one notch above the bartenders afterhours.
author: Doug ..

description: Love the decor, food and drinks!  Maybe not the most authentic Mexican joint in the city, but if you're looking for a fun delicious place to meet friends for food and or drinks, this place is great!
author: Britta D.

description: Seriously how good is this place Nick's Way? Ignore the cheezy decor of the shared space with Club Rouge and embrace the napkin dispensers on the plastic tablecloths! Honestly writing about this place makes me want to get up and go have a crispy taco right now.
author: Jessica K.

description: This place is my go-to when friends are in town.  Affordable, easy, and delicious, it always hits the spot.  Don't forget to order your tacos "Nick's Way"; it's the only way.  The only bummer is that they are cash only.
author: Lacy T.

description: Tacos on polk.  Doesn't sound right, and doesn't taste right either. Two different fish tacos, both nicks way. They were overstuffed and messy, like those all over your face burgers. Corn on the cob had great potential, but really messy too. I am all for diving into your food when it is good, but everything was just ok. The only thing not just ok with this meal was the agua frescas. They were horrible. I should have just ordered water, actually, I should have skipped this place all together.
author: Justin N.

description:
Good but not great. 
Came often as lived a short walk away but wouldn't trudge any further to eat it.
Fish tacos are probably the best and the grease in the quesadillas is probably what kept bringing me back.
The woman likes the frescas here but not the horchata (the difference is imperceptible to me). 
Long lines due to a) people who are ordering nine completely different tacos and b) one slow order taker that doubles as the take-out name shouter who for some reason hasn't completeley learned the new cash register that was installed 18 months ago.
Price is reasonable but certainly no bargain. 
Don't get guacamole to go, it's combined with salsa so is very watery.
author: Nate S.

description: Crispy fish tacos - Nick's way.  Yes, they are bad for you but sooo worth it.  I crave them - often.  Too often.  Add the green sauce.  Funny place overall - being part of the Rouge night club.  But a great place to come for a casual evening out.  The margaritas are better at the taco bar than at the main Rouge bar - be warned.
author: Jennifer C.

description: Tacos, gotta get it crispy.  Their veggie taco an burrito are pretty fantastic.  My bf thought their taquitos were so-so, and the fish taco was fantastic.  And you gotta try their extra spicy sauce (it's actually spicy, and this is coming from someone who can down a bottle of tabasco in one sitting) -- a little of that and a lot of the green, DELICIOUS.  Probably one of the only decent mexican joints near nob hill.  Gotta get there by 9 though -- they close way to early.
author: Latef X.

description: Nick's was a decent burrito, free soda refills and no frills nightclub type of place.  Try it, you'll probably like it.
author: John B.

description: Best fish tacos ever! Every time I think of of this place I can't wait for the next time I go.  Just writing about it right now makes me crave their fish tacos.  I've tried fish taco elsewhere and nothing compares to this place! I would recommend it to everyone if I could!
author: Michelle T.

description: Yummy in my tummy!  Get a fish taco Nick's Way and you wont go wrong.  The only person I know who didnt love Nick's ordered a burrito... hello? why do you order a burrito at a place called Nicks Crispy Tacos?!?
author: Mary S.

description: Their chips and Pico de Gallo are phenomenal. Green sauce and red sauce are really all you need to make your fish and steak taco, and steak burrito become supreme.  I could literally just suck the red salsa bottle dry and be content with Nicks. Avoid the chicken taco unless you prefer stewed chicken over grilled. I don't know how good the tacos really are; because like I said before, I really only eat there just so I don't look weird taking shots from the salsa sauce container..
author: stash e.

description: Nothing like a Chicken bone in your burrito to make it a place that I will not return to.
author: Dan G.

description: The tacos are good but the fish tacos really RAWK. They sometimes have a line of dorks.
author: Gary B.

description: Love these crispy tacos.  The best in SF in my opinion.  Cool, quirky place with great chips/salsa, good menu and great carnitas. But...seems like the tacos have gotten smaller recently and the salsa amount too has dimished...guess the economy has gotten to everyone, even Nicks.  Awesome place with go-out-of-your-way-to-get food.
author: T B.

description: Went here today with my friend Travis because he lives near here and got a groupon from them ($10 for $20 worth of food), so he got two tacos, nachos and I got a burrito.  The pollo asado burrito was very filling, and the nachos were really crunchy and a great way to finish everything off.  I have to come here on Tuesdays someday.  But overall, I was very impressed.
author: Jim N.

description: Had the crispy tacos here once, really good, but for the full experience, you've gotta get all the toppings. Would definitely eat here again.
author: annie s.

description: Everything I've had here has been good, and a few things have been great.  Try the  tortilla soup - and whatever you do, order your taco "Nick's way".  You can't beat the really strange decor/interior.
author: Alison P.

description: I dream of Nicks taco's all the time. The atmosphere is a little weird but maybe only because I know it is a club by night. The tacos Nick's way are delish and their chicken soup is so good and healthy (to offset my crispy taco). My only complaints would be that they are cash only and the staff is kind of rude - but once my taco shows I stop caring. Be ready for a food coma!
author: Michelle A.

description: Love Love Love the food.  The tacos and enchiladas are so tasty and delish. The combination of all the ingredients is heavenly.  You just gotta try it.
author: Annie S.

description: Came here to meet my brother and sister-in-law for dinner one night after being downtown at my sister-in-law's hair salon, and wasn't quite sure what to expect.  But I figured, if my brother and sister-in-law says it's good food, then I'm sure it is...  And they were right...  Nachos...  AWESOME...  There's actually pieces of steak in the Nachos...  And the cheese is very REAL TASTING...  none of that processed stuff...  Fish tacos...  Equally delicious...  although I could have gone without the onions, but still very tasty...  And the bestthing about it...  is it's VERY REASONABLE...  Check it out if you have time,...
author: Cheryl N.

description: My friend described the decor as "how you might imagine Madonna's uterus" . . . funky space, dark, wall-to-wall red, and decked out with garish chandeliers.  The fish tacos (two satisfied me) with the guacamole were excellent.  I also had a margarita.  Apparently if you get your marg from the Nick's stand they're $6, but use top shelf liquor.  The margs at actual bar are apparently cheaper, but use a syrupy mix (this is second hand info, I didn't try them at the bar but felt inclined to pass this along).  Nick's is everything it promises, I'll be back.
author: Justin S.

description: Don't go to Nick's expecting authentic taqueria food. Go to Nick's and order their specialty, the crispy taco. Their service is quick and friendly, and the crispy tacos never disappoint.
author: Katherine L.

description: I cant describe to you how much I loves the pescado taco here! You must have it Nick's way. I saw this place on KQED, so I decided to come by and check it out. It was delicious. This is a fun place to come with friends for a casual day or just pick up some food to go. It is located inside a night club so it looks a little tacky during the day...if you see the inside during the day you'll know what im talking about...but so what! This place is the best! But you must try the fryed fish, very fresh and flavorful. I also enjoyed the fresh strawberry juice, very good! oh by the way...this place is cheap! and on tuesday its only $2
author: Azizi A.

description: The tacos here are good, but not $4.00 a taco good. However, if you come on the infamous Taco Tuesday, you can get those same tacos for half the price. This place is definitely worth a Tuesday visit, so long as you don't expect to find a seat. Tacos + Seat + Beer = A Good Tuesday.
author: Jonathan M.

description: Had a couple delicious tacos on a very busy night.  There is an odd dynamic between the club/bar and the taco place.  But it works.  Tacos were very filling; I had two and was stuffed.
author: Jason S.

description: My bff and fellow yelper Shannon K. introduced me to this joint after a long touristy day of visiting some SF sights.  Want a soft taco, but crave the crisp of a crispy taco?  Have no fear, Nick's tacos will save the day!  I have never known that you could straddle both sides of the proverbial taco wall by savoring the Pescado Taco Nick's Way!  I can't wait to bring my fiancé, a fellow taco lover to nom away.  The decor reminds me of being in the Fillmore with its numerous chandeliers, but with an added implosion of red velvet everywhere.  It has a very "vibey" and "cool" feel to the place.  I hear it also becomes a nightclub at times, and I can totally see that happen in this space.  The bar takes up the majority of the center of the restaurant!  Give your order to the cashier at the front, and grab a table number.  It's like an upscale Rubio's, and  I mean that in the very best way since I loved Rubio's growing up.
author: Eleen W.

description: YUM I love this place. Its a taco place inside this night club which sells tacos during the day. Their specialty is their crunchy tacos and if you get it loaded the guac is so good. The tacos are medium sized but stuffed to the brim with all the trimmings and tables have their spicy yummy sauces. The Tacos are not cheap, I think about $5 each loaded or even more but I think if you are not a huge eater getting one and sharing some chips is more than enough. Parking is  ahassle in this neighborhood so go early to get yellow zone parking!
author: Petri Y.

description: I absolutely love Nick's Pescado Tacos (Nick's Way Of Course).  That taco is seriously the bomb.  I don't see myself trying any of their other tacos because my instinct tells me that this is the best taco they have.  But Nick's will definitely see me soon again.
author: C L.

description: The dirtiest tacos in SF! Go for the Pescado taco aka fried fish "Nick's Way" = they add guac & cheese & fry up the inside taco. It will make a big mess but it's so good it's bad. I love the ambiance ...reggae beats, cool chandeliers against an all red back drop. All this for just $5 each. Everything is fresh & I've never seen anyone eat more than 2.  "$2 taco Tuesday" is nuts. Go on a different day and pay a few more bucks to actually find get seat. Cash only!
author: lauren j.

description: So I ordered everything the way it was recommended to me (even managed to get that mayo like substance on the side), and had the fish tacos baja style, and carne asada nicks way, and was extremely dissapointed. I had such high hopes for this place, and maybe that was the problem. For one, it was really weird eating inside Rouge before the club opened. I can only imagine how weird it would be to be in there during the day. although they do a good job of not smelling like day old alcohol in there. But that's besides the point. My tacos were definitely NOT crispy, and by the time I had my third bite, the whole tortilla fell apart from the sogginess of the sauces. and mind you that was my taco WITHOUT the mayo sauce. My friend did say that it is either a hit or miss at that place... I must've hit a miss day. will update if I bother going back.
author: Marina K.

description: Nick certainly has shown us the right way (order 'em "nick's way") to do tacos!  A girlfriend of mine had told me so and invited me to go down there the other night.  It was quite an eating experience, everything from the chips, tortillas, guacamole, carnitas, pollo, beans, salsa and margaritas.  Even the atmosphere is quite interesting with pinatas and stuff inside the "rouge bar" place during daylight.  As fancy as it gets for a cheap taqueria!  If you eat here during busy meal times, there's almost a social scene as well since the place becomes so crowded.  If there's a line, it's worth the wait!  Each time I visit I want to go back and order a 3rd or 4th taco each one is so tasty.  They do their best to make them easy to eat since well made taco's (like sandwiches) should be edible by hand without making a complete mess.
author: P H I L H.

description: If I'm in the neighborhood and in need of a tasty morsel, I'll head to Nick's but their tacos still don't hold a candle to my Mission faves...
author: Kyla B.

description: Absolutely love this place. I love the chicken quesadilla with the guac inside. I love the $2 cosmo specials for happy hour. I love the margaritas.  I don't know if its all the crazy red decor for Rouge, but eating at this place just makes me very very happy.
author: Lauren Y.

description: Maybe it's just me...and it probably is, but I really don't see what the big hype is with this place.  I've been here several times, and I have not been impressed with the chicken tacos. I haven't totally given up on Nick's, but I'm not eager to get back there on taco Tuesday.
author: Julie F.

description: The fried fish taco is pretty good! It's very different from the fish tacos that I had in other places. We didn't want to go inside at the first time because the restaurant looks kind of dirty, but actually the food is good though....
author: Julie H.

description: Nick's Crispy Tacos are just plain yummy.  I speak the truth here, and any review that begs to differ is simply way off base.  I've been here numerous times.  And I am getting in the mood to return quite soon.  A definitive fan of Nick's tacos, I advocate going all the way--the Nick Way, that is. What you'll get is a tortilla fried crispy layered with one soft--it's a perfect pairing.  Choose the filling that suits your craving, but consider the shrimp tacos.  I've had both shrimp and fish, and I've finally decided that the shrimp are the most fabulous.  And it really is all about delicious and fabulous, isn't it?  And if you can get both in one fell swoop, then all the better.  The toppings are fresh and the guacamole tasty.  Don't go on Tuesday unless you want to wait in a line.  They have a special that night.  Or what the heck, go on Taco Tuesday at Nick's. It's worth the wait.  And I have an admission:  I really like the decor of Nick's.  Call me crazy.  I don't care. There's just something about a bunch of funky, vintage, non-matching chandeliers that brings a smile to my face.  It's unavoidable.  Bordello or taqueria?  Who cares? As long as the food is good, and the service personable.  Yes, on both counts. Nick's is crispy.  Nick's is yummy.  Nick's is fabulous. Nick's is worth checking out.
author: Shadi G.

description: MMMM.... this place is always busy but great tacos Nick's Style. Ad a little drinky drinky for a quick buzz and you are all set.
author: Alyssa C.

description: Great, cheap tacos. The closest place to get a quality taco fix without wandering into the Mission.
author: Todd J.

description: YUMMY! I love the fish tacos Nick's way. The tortilla soup is also unbelievable. Call in an order ahead of time if it's to go because the line can get backed up. Also bring cash - cash only folks! We usually do takeaway because the atmosphere is a real riot, but quite an experience if you stay, throw up a Spongebob Square Pants pinata and suddenly it's not longer a nightclub! :) Hard to beat this meal for the price in this city - seriously, check it out!
author: Sarah R.

description: I liked this place a lot, especially the guac and the crispy factor! I thought it was a tad strange that it turns into a night club (the sombreros and pinatas come off the wall). but well worth the trip.
author: rukshan b.

description: Great crispy-style taco, quesadillas are amazing, margaritas are strong, only negative is its cash only and there's not an ATM for several blocks. Chips and salsa is also mandatory.
author: Noelle Q.

description: When I moved to the Russian Hill area, countless friends exclaimed "Lucky you! You're right by Nick's Crispy Tacos." The way they talked about Nick's was that it was practically a religious experience to eat there. Needless to say I was excited to go. I got vegetarian tacos which can be summed up in one non-word "Eh." Not especially flavorful, but not especially bad either. Maybe it's my fault for not eating meat, maybe it's Nick's fault for giving me a soggy taco with bland filing. I'm not here to point fingers. While I won't go back any time soon, I won't refuse to go when my friends are drunk and needing a snack.
author: Rebecca H.

description: Heard about this place a few years back and finally got to try it.  I got the fish taco and a beef one, I think.  Both were decent, but I thought it was a bit overpriced.  Other than that, nothing too memorable. Oh, and the steak quesadilla was good, but waaaaaaaay too greasy.
author: ML N.

description: Best fish tacos in San Francisco.  Get the fried ones Nick's way, they are soooo good!  If you don't get that then get the carne asada quesadilla.  Don't forget the chips with salsa and guac.  Also great!  Taco Tuesday is crazy busy and there is usually a line of 7 or 8 people on Saturdays at lunchtime.  I don't dig the inside too much, it's  all bordello-ey with chandeliers and a bar/club that opens at night, so I usually get it to go.
author: JOHN G.

description: No one has mentioned the corn which is awesome when it's in season.  Nick's carne asada is done just right.
author: T-Bone L.

description: I can't contribute anything that hasn't already been said...but I can add to the testimonials praising these tacos. They are the best, no doubt. You would suspect, however, that being all the rage for the past 3 or 4 years Nick would have raised enough $$ to expand into something other than a "taco stand by day, night club by night" establishment. But then again, maybe he's just trying to buy a humble pad in SF to live in.
author: Matt H.

description:
So I here this afternoon and bought a carnitas taco (nick's way), chips and salsa, and horchata. I have to say that I was pretty disappointed after all of the hype. 

The taco wasn't really that crispy, although it had a nice helping of guac on it, seriously the meat was lacking. I paid $3 or $4 something for the taco... there was hardly ANY meat, and where there was some it didn't do it justice. It was pretty dry and flavorless. 

The chips were really good actually. If my taco was as crispy as my chips it would have been well worth it, even with the meat lacking. The salsa didn't have any kick, but there was a generous amount of it on my chips.. 

The horchata was okay. Too sweet and mealy for my taste... and for $3 it should have been a way bigger cup.

All in all, it wasn't spectacular I've had better in many other places, for the lack of meat, size/price of the horchata, and ugly decor I don't think I will frequent this place often. I will however, probably try one of their burritos and chips again!
author: Aris Y.

description: Decent neighborhood place to grab a beer and a taco or burrito.  The ambiance is a bit odd but the food is quite good.  I like the tacos "Nick's way".
author: Tom H.

description: Delicioso!!  Had the pescado taco and the chicken quesadilla.  Haven't tasted better tacos or quesadillas! ...yuuummmmmm!!!  Happy hour margarita was refreshing but a bit watery.
author: Redloci R.

description: Bravo to this place.  Great beef tacos (only kind I've eaten) and especially nice to have a couple of tacos and a modelo on a hot summer day.  And of course, the people watching is excellent too.  People are right that the decor is not exactly mexican, but it is definitely mexican food,  Believe me.  Great quesadillas too.  Cash only, so use the ATM next door to look prepared for your date.
author: Amir B.

description: The fish taco was to die for! It's definitely worth the bad parking situation!
author: yeana j.

description: Yum, yum, and more yum... I have only been there once, and had a couple of fish tacos... They weren't perfectly done, but they tasted great! On a side note, it was very strange to be inside Rouge during the day... LoL
author: Lindsey S.

description: Just seeing the inside of a club during the day is enough to make anyone depressed.  The taco is excellent and I would definitely recommend "Nick's Way" when you order.  Also, I would recommend this place for anyone that doesn't have time to go to the Mission but, if you do, why would you not go to La Taqueria (for tacos) or El Farolito (for burritos)?
author: Steven M.

description: MMMmmmmm... their fish tacos will have you making "OOoooOOOO" noises. I'm serious. Otherwise, just don't mind me.
author: Andrew W.

description: Nicks has been changing. It reminds me of the Soup Nazi on Seinfeld...they know their crispy tacos Nick's way are so good that they can do mean things to their customers and get away with it. Like on the night I finally got to the front of the line and they decided it was takeout only when I wanted to eat in. Or when I ordered one of their to- die-for margaritas and they said I had to order food with it...but I wasn't hungry.
author: Jess H.

description: I tried to stay away, I really did.  But my arm was twisted and I gave in.  Two pescado tacos nick's way w/ chips and guacamole.  Poured on the red sauce and I was good to go.  Burppity burp burp.
author: Lisa C.

description:
flavorful, crispy, hot, inexpensive, fresh, delicious tacos.  all the others are right - get it  "nick's way" for 95 cents more

mango juice, and the chips/guacamole were yummy.

i actually liked the funky red walls and chandeliers - and music too.  i've never been here at night and can't vouch for that.
author: Dora F.

description:
A great place for lunch, It's dark mysterious and WHAT is that smell? Things smell a little rough round these parts but it's not the food. 

Very fresh the fact that they don't have refried beans is even better, if you order the beans thats what you get a bowl of beans.  the grilled fish burrito while not easy to eat (you may need a bib and lots of napkins) is delicious!

This place won't break the bank but make sure you hit the ATM first CASH only.

nothing new to add that hasn't already been said over 500 times but keep it up NCT!
author: Scott S.

description: I was SO excited to try this place!  I had heard good things, read good things, and so, so, wanted good things.  But, to be honest, I just didn't think it was all that!  I had a fish taco and a shrimp taco and...well...whatevs...ok, at best.  Growing up in San Diego, I guess I just got so spoiled by being that close to Mexico and having access to the best, cheapest Mexican food.  Such a bummer.  Props to the counter guy, though, who gave me a craploud of hot sauce as requested.  Usually places get really stingy with that stuff!
author: Susan L.

description: I freakin' LOVE these tacos!!!  I want one every week for my whole entire life. Thanks Jonas for the tip!  As far as tacos goes, definitely Jonas Approved.  My only complaint is that it's cash only and there's a funny smell to the establishment - plus the vinyl tablecloths look and feel dirty. Oh, also, it's cold at Nick's so bring a coat.
author: Allie C.

description: Their carnitas nacho's are pretty good. I wouldn't order it everyday though- unless you like buying queen size pantyhose!
author: Jessica O.

description: Not as good since Nick left (he opened the pizzeria nearby) but still pretty tasty. Try the fresh fruit  juice or the margaritas.
author: Meredith G.

description: Good carne asada tacos, I tasted good quality steak meat. The breakfast taco not so much- thought the egg-french fry potato combo was gross. The taqueria/club vibe was most welcome to folks partaking in the $5 all-you-can-drink mimosas.  The walk to the bar to get a refill, however, makes one feel conscious. Are people looking at my already empty flute that I finished after only 1 1/2 mins? Or are they jealous that I am able to get a buzz AND get a month's supply of vitamin c at the same time? Haterz.
author: Ron S.

description:
$2 Bud lites at the bar at all times and they are always very cold.

I get the Pescado burrito every time But don't let them add in the extra stuff or else it get's too big and they charge another couple bucks.

Wifey don't eat Mexican but she eats at Nicks and loves it too.
author: ny s.

description: Seriously one of my favorite places in my neighborhood where I go to satisfy my hunger, organize Taco Tuesday and to nurse any bad case of jjakksarang.  It's really one of my favorite places to go.  And Walgreens is right across from it so you can buy Pepcid before you indulge in all the Nicks your stomach can handle.
author: Sarah C.

description: i love tacos, and these are on my favorites list! The tacos are a good size, they are crispy and juicy, and tasty!  My only complaint is the place smells a little musty and like alcohol.  I think because this place is a club at night.  The interior is very interesting and I would have never known they sell tacos here.  Great tacos though!
author: Jen C.

description: love this place. good for cheap, tasty mexican!
author: L H.

description:
3 stars for taco tuesdays... not only can you not find parking (that's how sf but still, it takes super long on tuesdays), there is a long line for cold tacos. the sauces are runny (the ones that are in the bottles on the table) and you should bring a lot of people to reserve a table while some people stand in line and some people buy drinks. all in all, such a huge hassle for mediocre tacos. 

perhaps they're better on days other than tuesday but i've had better tacos from rubio's and wahoos.
author: Joyce D.

description:
the tacos i had were sooo good! and cheap!
make sure you get them nicks way!

great atmosphere too! red couches and big chandeliers...
author: Chelsea H.

description: Love their crispy tacos, Nick's way of course!  Eat here at least once a week to satisfy my Mexican food cravings
author: chris p.

description:
honestly, the best tacos i've ever had. that sounds like a big compliment but i had a pollo taco today (nick's style) and it was DELICIOUS.

the interior is very crazy, but it certainly gives it charm, and also makes it more unique.
author: Ashley F.

description: Fish tacos "Nick's Way" are delicious. The crispy shell really makes a difference.
author: Steve C.

description: When I first heard of their crispy tacos, I thought about Taco Bell's double decker/mega gordita crap tacos. However, I gave in to some friends and decided to give the local joint a try. Let me say, THEY'RE GOOD. They've got a street taco flair because you can order from among chcken, carne asada or carnitas. Whichever way you go with, go the 'Nick's Way'!
author: Macy R.

description: Burritos are lacking, but the tacos and chicken quesa- are awesome!  Try the Horchata, it is my favorite soft drink in the WORLD!
author: Max C.

description: Finally, you can get a decent taco north of Market Street.  Nick's is a little hole in the wall place that draws a regular lunchtime crowd.  Be sure to try the tacos "Nick Way" for that little extra something that makes it delish!  A true gem on Polk Street.
author: Annabel G.

description: Nick's can't be beat for inexpensive, delicious tacos. (My favorites are the pescado and carne asada tacos.) Make sure you ask for it "Nick's way." My only complaint is the line is usually long, they aren't quick, and if you want another margarita you can't bypass the 15-minute line to order a drink.
author: Allison B.

description: The ambiance in this place is TJ meets SF with the cooky pinatas and mexican hats.  The fish tacos are real real good.....once I had a quesadilla and it was a little greasy, but what do you expect with white flour and cheese?
author: Tracy M.

description: The best place to grab mexican out of the mission. I usually get the carnitas burrito, quesdilla or the taco salad.
author: Raymond M.

description: Ordered two Taco's Nick's Way (one carnitas and one fish; probably should have just ordered one, as they were huge). I wasn't expecting the beans on the carnitas taco, which kind of took away from the amazing taste of the pork. The fish combined with the tons of guacamole, sauce and cripy/soft taco was tasty. I want to go back and try the steak
author: Nicolas H.

description: Nick's Crispy Tacos by day and Rouge (the monster cheese ball club) by night.  What a business model.  I had hesitation about this place, but all was good when I bit into the taco done "nick's" way.  Oh so delicious.  Chips and salsa are special but the red and green salsas will knock your socks off.  I love using silly cliches.
author: Tom C.

description: Some of the best tacos in the Bay Area. Taquerias included. Order a carnitas, a chicken and a fish (Baja style  (!) or grilled) taco (all "Nick's Way" of course), grab one of the few sidewalk chairs out front, squirt on the hot sauce, and you'll be happy, happy. I've been to Nick's several times but just can't bring myself to try anything but the tacos. Maybe next time... I always say that.
author: Chris O.

description: Isn't this just the PERFECT place for a one hour run in run out lunch on Friday with the work buddies? Because you can drink some dos equis and eat some tacos and it's just so great! I have had many a good Friday lunch and drink fest here! Yummy yummy and I don't even like tacos!
author: Shelley M.

description: I didn't know how much I wanted to eat huge portions of delicious mexican food in the middle of a dance club . . . until I found Nick's.   My  burrito would have been fab on its own but eating it under the giant glass changdelier made it just that much better.
author: Valerie D.

description: Not bad.  I've walked past here so many times but never gone in.  Now I wish I'd ventured in earlier.  I had a burrito, not a taco.  Oops.  Guess the name was lost on me.  It was really tasty though.  Pretty fresh ingredients and quick counter service.  Cool decor too.
author: Courtney B.

description: I love me some fish tacos and Nick's has some bomb a$$ grilled fish tacos!  I've been here like 4 times and I've only gotten the grilled fish tacos b/c they are so freakin' good.  This last time I was ordering and noticed this interesting looking corn on the cob on a stick with what looked like butter and cheese on it..... With my interest sparked and my hunger level high, I impulsed some corn action.  It came dusted with some spice and crumbled cheesey creamy stuff.  HOLY SMOKES!  New favorite item.
author: Chard M.

description:
weirdest but most genius business model... taco stand by day, club/ lounge by night. 

great food and they always play reggae music inside, which is def nice when you're hungover and can barely stand long enough to get to the front of the line. tacos nick's way is the only way to go, as others can attest. 

decor is oddly charming (folding tables, plastic tablecloths and pinatas hung from fake crystal chandeliers). 

one thing to remember: they close at 3:30 pm on the 2nd sunday of every month. somehow i never remember that!
author: jaja w.

description:
Friend: "Hey, wanna try this taqueria that turns into a club at night?"
Me: "Cool... huh?"

I love me some taquerias, so I'm always down to try a new place (although I usually stick to my favorites). My friend (as well as everyone else on Yelp, apparently) highly recommended the tacos here.

But I am a burrito man. Remember how Uncle Angelo on "The Golden Girls" was a butt man? (It was the hurricane episode, and he was describing the woman whom he left the priesthood for.)

I'm a burrito man. So, I usually end up trying out a burrito at a new taqueria, even if I'm in the mood for a quesadilla. (Or a taco, or a ceviche.)

I got the pescado burrito because I've never had fish in a burrito before.

I really liked it.

I don't think I'll ever go to the club, though. The atmosphere isn't really, um, me. But I like that the taqueria calls the club home by day. It makes for interesting ambience. Also, the staff is nice. They seem to have a good sense of humor about running a taqueria in a club.
author: Joseph R.

description: This place is really really really good!!! they have the BEST quesadillas i have ever had in my life. and i am mexican, and I know what a good quesadilla should taste like. these guys are awesome, and you NEED to get the chicken quesadilla!!
author: Christopher M.

description: I love Nicks Crispy.  The food is awesome.  I have food dreams about the quesadillas.  I find the quirky atmosphere of a taco stand within a club charming.  I absolutely can't get enough of this place.
author: Cari N.

description: I could eat here every day of the week!  Super fresh salsa & guacamole.  I had the chicken taco, nick's way (w/ Guac) and split the chips & salsa, which were a meal on their own.  It's quick, filling, & fabulous!
author: Lauren C.

description: I like the food for what it is, but the decor/ambiance makes me feel like I'm sitting at a lame club, waiting for the party to get started.  Really, it's kind of weird.
author: Mandy S.

description: My mouth starts watering just thinking about this place. Their tacos are to die for- the carne asada and pescado being two of my favs- make sure to order them Nick's way (w/ guac and cheese). They are this little hole in the wall taco stand inside a bar, but seriously the best tacos outside of mexico that I've ever tasted. And they are are cheap so you can afford to hop on over to the bar for a margarita and still have cash leftover.
author: Alison W.

description: Stick with a Nicks Crispy & you're golden. Golden I say!
author: Rhubarb M.

description: Crispy, and yet soft. Funky place that I guess is night club in the twilight hours. Food is good, but kinda messy so eat carefully. An odd array or seating choices make balancing your taco difficult from the couches, aim for a table with chairs.
author: Mel H.

description: This place is where it's at! The best tacos in the city by far, gotta get them Nick's way though. Its also nice to know what Rouge looks like during the day. Who doesn't love crunchy taco-y goodness in a fake chandelier and sticky floor decor! If it weren't for Cancun's in Berkeley this place would be the best in the Bay Area. One drawback . . . CASH ONLY! Even McDonalds takes credit cards now. Come on Nick, upgrade to a phone line and a credit card reader! Call me, I'll even pay for it!
author: Ryan M.

description: I only go here when I'm around the area which is usually to go to Lombardis, but I've been here a lot lately due to the snow season and gearing up. all the times that  I've been here, I tried the grilled fish tacos and grilled fish burritos. omg. best ones I've ever tasted. cheap and good! what more can you get?! Nick's Crispy Tacos will always be my favorite.
author: Rhonda H.

description: Two Carne Asada Tacos Nick's Way Por Favor! I watch my Arizona Wildcats down the street at Greens Sports Bar and when half time rolls around I already have phoned in my Nick's order and its ready for pick up, THANKS! I have gone Carne Asada Burrito many of times, but its the Tacos that keep me coming back. I like to mix my tacos up from time to time, chicken and fish, but you cant beat the Carne Asada. Enjoy, this place has a great vibe and some great Tacos!
author: Michael G.

description: I've only been here for breakfast burritos which is funny since they're not open for breakfast. I'm willing to wait until brunch hours though to have one of those decadent burritos when i need something to soak up the earlier nights debauchery.
author: jen v.

description: Wow - I had the fish taco. It was so yummy. I got it the Nick's way with guac and cheese and it was even better! The fish was grilled and oh so tasty. One taco was almost $4 but it was worth it.
author: Wendy B.

description:
mmmm pescado tacos nick's way with cheese and guacamole, a nice big elote (corn on the cob with butter, cheese and red stuff....i crave it right now just thinking about it) and a tall horchata to share at one of the big red booths with the tiny tables with my boyfriend. awesome.

oh yeah, and stars for $2 margaritas during happy hour! i think they were 2 bux....
author: Melanie C.

description: Given that our food was still delish by the time we got home 45 minutes later since they kicked us out (this place closes at 9 SHARP on a Sunday)... it must be pretty darn good indeed when fresh and piping hot.   I wasn't even really hungry and my tacos still vanished in a flash.  Pretty snazzy decor too (um, WTF???  Can anyone explain?).  Minus one star because my taco was way light on the camarones-- there were, count 'em, FOUR lousy little shrimp in that sucker.  And they're good sized tacos loaded with trimmings, especially if you go for the crispy style.  However, the pescado was heaped with fresh, perfect... well, pescado.  I'll be back, earlier and hungrier than I was this time around.
author: Marie K.

description: Hit this place up on Tuesday for their specials.  They use only the freshest ingredients (Niman Ranch, Free Range, etc.).  It is fantastic in terms of quality and taste. The place is sharing rent with The Rouge, which describes the decor.  Aside from that, I wish it was open late night - it would kill it.
author: Dan Y.

description:
This place was recommended by a friend who lives in the city. Thank you Rob! 
Love the funky decor, and LOVE the crispy fish taco Nick's way. Messy and scrumptious!
author: angela h.

description: OMG, we went to Nick's and the food was crap.  The nachos were soggy and the tacos were terrible.  What happened?  We loved this place?  Perhaps they are getting cheap with ingredients.  Major bummer...
author: M K.

description: Think Drake x The Karate Kid and you get "The Best I Ever Had Around" thats how good the pescado tacos are!!! Make sure you get it Nicks Way and its a done deal!!! The service is outstanding... The atmosphere is great... I always recommend this place to all my family and friends and they love it... Its worth the trip and if haven't ate here your missing out!!!
author: Danny V.

description: I ordered a taco salad via phone today and specifically told the woman on the other end that I was a vegetarian and the last time I ordered a salad with NO meat there were 2 (at least that I found) pieces of steak hiding among my lettuce.  (I wouldn't have been so upset had the first one not found it's way to my mouth!)   She assured me there wouldn't be any meat this time around and sure enough, there was another piece of steak in my salad!  I know this sounds like no big deal to you carnivore folk, but to someone who hasn't eaten meat in two years, a piece of beef can ruin the day.
author: Eryn M.

description:
memories. like the corners of my mind. 

i had been to nicks a few times before and usually frequented the joint after spending time at one of the various watering holes nearby.  i do not make it this far north on polk often so when i do i usually try to make it to nicks. 

yesterday, as some of you may know, was superbowl sunday.  i spent the day with some friends at greens. we most definitely took advantage of the three dollar coors lite special (?) and by the end of the game (well when the saints intercepted peyton manning for six) a few of us were starting to get raaaaather hungry.

"we should go to nicks crispy tacos" i suggested, "in honor of the saints victory". in hindsight i realize that i would have suggested nicks if the colts won as well. i guess i just really wanted some tacos.  my friends, thankfully, obliged.

as i previously stated i had been to nicks a few times before. i remembered it being amazing. in fact i remembered it being one of the best tacos i had ever eaten.  now i am not sure if they were having an off day yesterday or they were pumping out tacos as fast as they could because it was the superbowl and they were probably packed all day, but nicks just wasnt as good as i remembered. 

i usually roll with the carne asada tacos because i used to be boring when it came to tacos. not anymore.i got a carnitas taco and a grilled fish taco. a friend and i split the chips with guacamole.  the tacos were alright, the tortillas fell apart almost on first bite. i may be nitpicking but the tortilla just didnt seem 100% fresh.  the carnitas were a little underseasoned. the  grilled fish was really tasty however so next time ill probably just get two of those.  the chips were really good. crispy and salty and oh so tasty. there was way too much salsa fresca and not enough guacamole, however, which was a little disappointing. overall a good, not great dining experience.

i will gladly keep coming back to nicks, because, well lets be honest, i will be back in the area spending a day or night at a local watering hole and will inevitably get the craving for some tacos.
author: Jason B.

description: cant believe this is a night club at night. Was rather reserve when my friend wanted to eat at this place and knowing it's a night club. Then i order the grilled shrimp & fish crispy tacos & the mexican style corn...immediately changed my mind. love this place! Agua frescas that i've gotten, which was strawberry flavor aint interesting. food's recommended here. will definitely come again when i have mexican food craving.
author: Linda T.

description: I love you Nick and I love your tacos. And your burritos. And your guacamole. And your green sauce. I get a burrito and the guacamole and salsa and bring it home and you never get it right (guac and salsa in separate containers, please) but it's okay (except the time you forgot to give me chips, not cool man). Your pescado and you carne are delicioso in the most gringo of ways. I will double park on polk for you once a week.
author: Hilary F.

description: Jesus H. Christ, the pescado (fried fish) tacos are so friggin' good, I can't believe that I haven't tried them until just now! i think i have a new favorite! the chips and salsa were sorta meh (chips are too thick and the salsa is sorta bland, plus they didn't put enough of it- all of which are more like personal opinions I suppose); at least they were only a dollar because of the cinco de mayo day specials.
author: Jeff M.

description: I've been here many times, and it's usually packed, loud, with a long line to order. So that's a good sign, right? Service is OK, sometimes it drags with confusion at the register (have your order together and your money out, people!) sometimes bc of the staff (Headband guy needs frequent help from Ponytail guy) but pretty reasonable and friendly overall.
