My favorite items include the black bean and corn salad and the fish tacos. Their veggie burrito needs work in my opinion; it's kinda bland. On the weekends and evenings, probably best to order your food to go unless you like squeezing onto a tiny table or standing with your food (the booths are cool, but usually taken). If you order over the phone to pick up food, speak loud and clearly (music/sports blaring in the background with the order taker yelling over it) and when you go to pick up your order, don't wait on the line, just get one of the non-register dude's attention - Oh yes, I should mention it's cash only, so put that card away, it is of no use to you here.
author: Barbara K.

description:
this it the kind of place bourdain would be down on.  $4 individual tacos (nick's way price) which have lost their way from their true authentic brethren.  but there's no denying the pescado is very tasty.  what distinguishes these crispy tacos is that they are very light on the crisping.
the outer soft tortilla is partially crisped just perfectly, and the large juicy fish piece is very lightly battered and thus not too fried.  of course, the additives like mayo based baja style cabbage only enhance the flavor
the carne asada with cheese and guacamole also are nice
thus i think i can do these crispy tacos (usually i don't like crispy ones)
tacos are large
agua fresca heavy in pulp.
the decor of the bar during the day time makes one feel like those times when clubs close and turn on the "ugly lights"
the tacos are $3.50 with 0.95 more for nick's way -- hmm getting real pricey.  that being said, the pescado is still very tasty and messy.
tried the camarones also.  if someone else can make the inner crispy taco like this for the dollar taco street size, i'd be there.
author: Rob C.

description: A fantastic place to get a pricy but amazing taco! Its totally worth it and totally delish!
author: Nicole F.

description: I'm usually a burrito man, but when I'm in Nick's I have to go for the tacos. They are surprisingly delicious. I'm going to echo everyone else; get them "Nick's Way". It's also worth pointing out that this place makes their Margaritas strong, and the staff is really personable.
author: Evan K.

description: This is my favorite Mexican place in the city - there's no atmosphere, they have strange operating hours which I can't seem to figure out, and the parking is a nightmare BUT I will keep going back for the ridiculously delicious quesadillas, tacos, and beers.  AND it's ridiculously cheap.  Share a quesadilla b/c the 1/2 of the fried goodness is enough to fill a person up.  I have yet to try the whole menu, but everything has been fantastic so far!  No atmosphere, so it's not ideal for a date.
author: Christina S.

description: Fish tacos "Nick's Way" and a margarita.  Amen.
author: Dawn J.

description:
I know it's all about the tacos, but I had a fish burrito that really satisfied my cravings.  I also ordered a carnitas taco to get an idea of the full spectrum of the menu.  After eating 3x more than I needed to, I left quite content.

The interior, which doubles as a night club after the restaurant closes, was covered in red curtains and mirrored pillars.  It was completely gaudy, but totally cool for a taco place. 

I typically prefer real Mexican food, but Nick's is perfect for those times that I crave a Cali-Baja sort of thing.
author: t l.

description: After spending 4 years in San diego, and now living in the marina I've yet to find good cheap mexican food with identifiable meat parts. Nicks sure fits that bill if you are in the mood for tacos, I love the tacos so much I can never get myself to try a burrito yet. Get the tacos nick's way, crispy with lots of quacamole. yumm They also have good fruite quenchers and a good beer selection. I just wish they were open later, they opperate in harry denton's starlight lounge during the day. The best time to hit up nicks is during the week, lunch time. Easy to find parking and little line, but nicks sure does work wonders on the sat/ sun hangover
author: Samantha S.

description: Awesome.  I went here with a bunch of friends and it was a totally casual, fun atmosphere.  Food was great.  Reasonable prices.
author: Alex C.

description: Nick's Crispy Tacos is yummy after too many drinks while watching football across the street at the bar. I have never eaten there completely sober but I have smelled it sober and it's not as appealing. The taco's may be yummy at times but I'm not sure how much I trust the food cooked in that whole in the wall of a night club. I give it three stars for feeding my taco cravings after the bar ;-)
author: Alexia P.

description: The Burrito Con Todo!!!...Yes indeed.. The fish tacos are a winner for sure here as well. If you're one of those who likes smoke coming out of their ears, try the "Diablo Sauce", and approach with extreme caution...! A place not to be missed if you are partying in Pac Hites and your taste buds are screaming mexican...!!!! So hi to Chloe, Fernando, Memo, and all the crew...!!!
author: Sven S.

description: Love this place. I must admit I've been here at a zillion times and have only had the vegetarian tacos, the chips with salsa and guacamole, and those powerful little margaritas...soo good every time.
author: T V.

description: You get what you pay for a $2 taco on Tuesdays. I had go back and pass up the deal and get a Mexican salad. Next door at Rouge I washed it all down with a couple of grey goose and tonic's $7 each.
author: Marie G.

description: Best Mexican food outside of the Mission. Period.
author: Tim B.

description:
After a long day of work and just wanting to grab a quick bite to eat, I thought I would just head over for a few tacos with a friend as I have never tried Nicks before.  Little did we know that we had stumbled into Nick's in the midst of their "Taco Tuesdays" feeding frenzy.  

For those who have never been, Nick's is literally a counter in front of a small kitchen off to one corner of what is essentially ROUGE Bar/Lounge. The entire palace was filled with people, I became a little nervous about finding a table.  As we stood in line and the night wore on -  "Taco Tuesdays" was coming to an end, tables became more readily available.

I ordered the beef taco, chicken taco, and the Elote (grilled corn on the cob with cheese and seasonings) all ordered "Nick's Way" (otherwise why bother?) All were VERY good, and fresh!  The best part of the meal was my drink - I ordered the Blood Orange punch, it was great. Very refreshing and complemented my meal well.
author: Caryn L.

description: Very good Mexican place. They use all fresh ingredients and I love their Quesadillas. I've eaten there many times for take out and you just can't beat them for quick take out comfort food when your tired of everything else.
author: Adrian J.

description: Good stuff!  Tacos that are soft yet crispy at the same time.  Not to mention that they are huge as far as tacos go.  Forget those dinners at taco truck!
author: Erica D.

description: Is this place a techno club, a bar or a taco place?  The only indication that it serves tacos are the two sombreros they tacked up on the wall.  Fried fish taco was good and if it had been hot and fresh it would have been  better.  I think they fry their chips like 3 times b/c they are super crunchy, yum.   If I'm in the hood and need a quick taco fix, I may come back for taco Tues with $2 tacos and $2.50 coronas.
author: Jones D.

description: I want to marry this place,its so delicious.the pescado with the works (jack and guac) is the jam.One star off because as Christina S stated,that "hot sauce" is BULLSHIT
author: Lauren V.

description: Great food, which is not to outdone by the great and friendly staff!  It should be in your regular "rotation."
author: Thom P.

description: Love these tacos - need a little more spice but that can be taken care of with hotsauce.  The atmosphere is downright creepy but the tacos are the best.
author: Lucy L.

description: HUGE burritos! I still love this place. You can eat and drink cheaply!
author: Carly W.

description: Nick's is more Tex-Mex style than authentic mexican tacos in my mind, and that's just fine with me. It's in a fairly tacky bar and the music is usually pretty foul. They make pretty good margaritas and the tacos are great! I've tried just about all of them and haven't been disappointed yet. I like to get them "Nick's Way", which essentially makes it a super taco with guacamole and cheese. They're fat and tasty little tacos! I usually order one so I can still walk home, but order two if you're hungry. These are not taco truck style or "authentic" (yawn), they are casual little nuggets of pleasure! I have to take a star off for the bartender mopping the floor with stink juice while people were in there eating though. Really. WTF.
author: Tyler H.

description: Delicious, huge veggie burrito. Not just limp lettuce, rice, and beans like some places. The crispy cabbage added a nice touch.
author: Cora Z.

description: Food was good. Place is cold and drafty. Seats are dirty and uncomfortable.
author: Damien T.

description: Come to Nick's for $2 Taco Tuesdays!  The tacos are overflowing with juicy ingredients and very, very good.  Get'em "Nick's style" to add a little crunch and extra flavor.  Cool little taco joint atmosphere as well.  Check it out.
author: Karl B.

description: STAY AWAY!!!  HORRIBLE! I got nachos which tasted and looked like something you can get from your child's PTA afterschool fundraisers. No one in our party was satisfied with their meal. The place is dirty and run down. The managment is rude and  does not know what customer service means! I have never been treated in such a rude manner by any establishment. If you want to have a good time and eat good food find another place to eat. DO NOT waste your money!
author: L. C.

description:
I've heard such great things about this place and their fish tacos that I decided to finally venture in here.. Werid that it turns into a nighclub at night...the only good thing about htis palce is their pescado tacos nick's way......the burrito version is also really good with guac and sour cream...however when we heard about their taco tuesdays we came back and we sadly disappointed... Ordered the carne asada tacos and the didn't have any taste.

I also usually get their salsa and guac which is really good or their fruit drinks...but that has gone downhill...my bf is scared of this place...it's full of white people....
author: Crum B.

description: Nick's rocks. It's real easy in and out. The tacos are phenomenal, a very original taste to them.
author: Christopher R.

description: Just moved back to Philadelphia from San Francisco.  I thought I would miss the wine, the people, the bars.....but in the end all I really miss is my Nick's and Zushi Puzzle.
author: Scott W.

description: Echoing many of the reviews, order your tacos "Nicks Way" and you won't be disappointed.  The quesadillas are just as yummy.  Make sure you get the chips and salsa with guacamole.
author: Keith S.

description: Skip the burritos, quesadillas, chimichangas, etc... The only reason to walk in the door is the amazing tacos, Nick's way. By far the best taco in the city when they're on; the problems lie in their inconsitancy. Plus, the aquas frescas are severely watered down. But those tacos.....
author: Ron A.

description: The best carnitas quesadilla you will ever have.  Nice to have as a local joint and will rival any place in the Mission.
author: George K.

description: call me crazy, but I order the quesadilla every time I go there. It is very delicious and I hear the taco's are good too. ;-)
author: Tabor, S.

description:
First of all, and this is a very antagonistic way to start, but STFU about your "authentic" Mexican food from the Mission.  Burritos are American food.  If you must have some  pedigree for your food, I believe the tacos are San Diego style, so try calling it that to satisfy your snobbery.

The tacos Nick's way are DELICIOUS.  This place is a blessing on the neighborhood.  They use Niman Ranch beef and pork so you know the meat is clean as well as tasty.  (Niman Ranch actually raises heirloom hogs).  The fish tacos are savory and filling.  The Carne Asada burrito is perfect to sneak into the movies, as long as you wrap it in napkins.
I am a fan of the reggae music.  One time they switched to 50s music, with disasterous results.   Lately it takes forever to get your food so the distraction is nice.
I almost always get my food to go cause it is a bit of a yuppie hell hole.  
I wish people actually followed the no cell phones rule.
Cash only is my favorite kind of establishment.
I think it is a very smart use of space; by operating out of Rouge they circumvent both high San Francisco rent and the draconian liquor license application process. 
I am sad to hear that Nick is no longer on the premises.

***Have to update:  the lines are now REALLY REALLY long, and the food is inconsistant.  I have gotten downright yucky tacos in the last few months.  This makes me very sad.
author: Flemm F.

description: Pretty good tacos.. great for the area. Service could use a little attention as I easily noticed how people are treated according to their mood. Decent experiences are to be had here.
author: Eugene G.

description: Nick's Tacos rule!  Get anything Nick's way (guacamole, sour cream, and cheese) and it's even better!  It's really cheap and you get your food right away.  Happy Hour on Thursday and Friday nights 7-9 p.m. are great cuz where else can you get yummy mexican food and $2 dollar margaritas,  $3 dollar coronas or cosmos.  I've tried the soup, tacos, quesadillas, soup and even the salad.  I can't decide which I like best because everything tastes good!  And for you healthy folks, fish tacos aren't too bad and the grilled fish salad with no chips and dressing on the side is phenomenal.  Only downside is that it is cash only but they have an atm nearby.
author: Michelle F.

description: God Bless Nick and his crispy tacos.
author: Gina L.

description: Fantastic.  Baha style, Nicks way, every time.  It's like going on a vacation.  I will wait, and wait patiently, for this little slice of heaven, served in a cheap red basket with a slice of lime.
author: Lena J.

description: Ok, first of all, mad props for being affordable. You can't find much in this city for under $10, let alone food that's actually GOOD. I found this place when I was playing tour guide to my friends from out of town. We came in and ordered, and to my suprise, our food arrived just two minutes after we had all squeezed into a fabulous red velvet booth. And not only did we get our grub fast, but it was HOT and delicious! (kinda like the guy behind the counter) Also, the food was in pretty large portions. You totally get what you pay for. Best chicken quesadilla I've ever had. I came back the next day on my way to class to have another one. Oh yeah, and those tacos ARE crispy as hell.
author: Adrienne F.

description: Over 300 reviews already!  'Nuff said.  FYI, I go here an average of twice a week, and I *always* get the grilled fish taco with guacamole (unless it's a special occasion, in which you gotta go Nachos).
author: Shan K.

description:
it is my belief that until you go to nick's you aren't san francisco.  you're just staying here.

we found it years ago by googling "the best fish tacos in san francisco"

it's true. and last night was no different.

*some sound advice*
(order two margaritas at once)
author: marin m.

description: Nothing to write home about. Their burritos are better than their tacos, which can be a bit dry. Go here if you're in the neighborhood and need a quick fix for your Mexican craving. Otherwise, take a short hike to Pancho's.
author: Stu M.

description: Nick's is great for a quick, cheap meal!  If you are getting a taco definitely order it "Nick's Way" but personally I prefer the quesadillas over the tacos.
author: Jessica R.

description:
When I was hotel-living, I was staying right around the corner from this place.  When I first walked though the doors... cheeeeeeeeeeeze interior!  They have some ugly looking pinatas and chandeliers in that joint.  Thankfully, I didn't go for the ambiance.  The people inside seemed like tools as well, but then I realized where this place was located..

The tacos here are unbelievable, and every day I am in the office I contemplate walking the 15 blocks it would take me to get to Nick's.  I'm not a big walker, so it has never happened, but nevertheless.. the thought is there.

A word of caution about the chicken burrito- it is crap.  I can't speak for the other burritos, because I haven't had them, but the chicken burrito was not impressive..  Stick with the carne asada or the carnitas.

However, on a more pleasant note with my taste buds, the chips & guac are awesome, and the carne asada tacos are some of the best I have ever had.  This place has perfected white-washing Mexican food.  If you don't order your tacos "Nick's way," you are a tool.  It would be like going to Starbucks and ordering a small cup of black decaf.. 

All I'm saying is that if I'm paying $5 a taco (or for a cup of coffee for that matter) it better be fun to order it, and I better feel like I'm "in the know."

Now go order your "flying dutchman" at In-N-Out..

-edit-

I actually did walk from the financial to Nick's today, and aside from the fact that I couldn't find an empty cab to save my life, I made it there in about 45 minutes.  Those hills are killer!

Anyway, long story short, I got some tacos and some chips and guac.  They cold and a little soggy by the time I finally managed to find a cab and make it back to my office, and these were still some of the best tacos I have ever had.

I stick by my rating- Nick's is tits!
author: Jason B.

description:
These are the most amazing dreamy tacos in all of SF! I hesitate to say how good they are and how fresh and quality the ingredients are because then maybe the line will get even longer than it already sometimes is.

Sure you can go to the Mission for "authentic" mexican food if thats the ambiance you're after. I would way rather go to Nicks than go to La Taqueria where half the meat is made up of gristle and you go home with stomach cramps because they drench everything in cheap oil but hey, you got your authentic mexican food, right?

You have seriously got to have a major screw loose if you don't like this place! And IF you don't, then good...that just means more tacos for me!
author: Randall F.

description: I like Nick's crispy tacos. I don't think I can go as far as best  in the city, I would need to do more research. Great place to go for quick, good food though. I've only tried the vegetarian and chicken crispy tacos and both are consistently good, not sure about other stuff on the menu. Also I love the interesting decor, what goes on there at night anyone know?? It seems like an awfully large place for a taco joint.
author: christina C.

description: OMG this place is awesome. Try the Pescado tacos "Nick's Way"...I have never been able to find anything better on the menu (but I hardly ever try anything new since these babies are so damn good!). Be forewarned however, sometimes they are closed on Sundays!!! So be sure and check to make sure they are open before you get yourself all worked up about it. Overall, a fab taco shop!
author: A B.

description: Why all the hate lately?!  I just went today and had two very awesome tacos made "Nick's way".  It was the perfect combination of crispy and chewy with two very tasty salsas (red fire-roasted and green spicy).  I love how it's smothered in guac and oh so messy to eat.  I hear the tacos are $2 on Tuesdays and Thursdays...even better!!
author: Nina L.

description: This is one of those classic places you must go to if you live in SF.  The taco's are tasty but the real treat is the ordering from a random bar stuck in the corner of Rogue, the night club it shares space with.
author: Andrew N.

description: Love the fried fish tacos, Nick's way. Plug your nose because it often smells like ass... totally worth it though. Taco Tuesdays is really fun too and a way to get a price break because their tacos aren't exactly cheap.
author: Carolyn C.

description: Inconsistent.  The Nick's way tacos are basically awesome, but they aren't the same whenever I go here...so I stopped.  Their sister spot (is it a sister spot?) in the Sunset district is way more consistent.  Go there
author: jacob s.

description: my friend and i refer to taco tuesday as amateur night.  if you're looking for short lines and plenty of seating, go any other night but tuesday!  they're known for the fish taco nick's way but i also really enjoy the carnitas nick's way.  added bonus is any place that has elote!!!
author: Helen T.

description:
The tacos are good, not really crispy like deep-fried, but grilled until the tortilla shell is crispy-chewy.  The fish tacos, Nick's way, are very good, though not as good as the Cabo tacos at The Whole Enchilada in Moss Landing.  The carne asada tacos are also very good.

The salsas, served in squeeze bottles, are rather anemic.  Nick's is good, but not so good that I would go out of my way to eat there.
author: Richard C.

description:
Nicks is the tacohouse equivalent of a Cougar: 
the facade is a bit  cragly and run down from one too many parties but after a couple of margaritas the fish taco starts looking pretty good.

Tasty.

Points if you can remember even half the bars this place used to be.
author: Jeff E.

description: I always order the vegetariano tacos "nick's way" and I am always impressed. These tacos are packed full of delicious ingredients and served with the most delicious red and green salsas. I applaud this restaurant for it's consistency and pricing.
author: E J.

description: Love their fried fish taco's, Nick's way.  And they serve Coke, which is essential.
author: Ryan C.

description: quesadilla was awesome. so were the nachos. but the tacos are wayyy over priced.  if you get tacos "nicks way" you're paying $4.50 per taco - only 4 bites -  worth it o try once, but i'll stick with the quesadilla.
author: Sean S.

description: I don't even know how to express my utter love for this place. And believe you me, I have had some ammmazing Mexican food in MX and San Diego, well not that there is much difference. On the DL I seriously have not so appropriate dreams about their tacos and sour margaritas, just like I like 'em. I even love the funky, old pink decor but then again I'm kind of funky myself. Go to Nick's. Change your life.
author: Nik S.

description: This is possibly the best informal quick lunch spot in the neighborhood.  Great food... reasonable price, not inexpensive by any stretch, but delicious, great ambience, nice staff, great room, and sidewalk seating for those sunny days!
author: H.A. ..

description: Great plae for cheap tacos on Polk Street. I travelled in Europe for 2 weeks and craved Nick's tacos the whole time I was gone.
author: Jennifer A.

description: Get the Nick's Way Tacos.  They aren't the best crispy tacos in the city, but they're not bad.
author: Michael F.

description: My favorite thing on the menu is the taco salad with carnitas.  This salad is awesome!  Lots of guac, carnitas, and shredded cabbage.  I get extra green and red salsa to pour over it.  Such a great meal!  I order it to go after the gym, and enjoy the help-yourself water for hydration while I wait.  The line can be painfully long however, and all items on the menu are not especially delicious...
author: J O.

description:
While I love the tacos, I am a big fan of the carne asada burrito!!! It makes my mouth water just thinking of it!!!! The chips with salsa and guacamole is so good too!

If Rouge sold Nick's tacos after the bars closed, I'd be there eating the burrito. hmm, SO GOOD!
author: L S.

description: Funny that my favorite thing at a place called Nick's Crispy Tacos is their quesadillas. Their quesadillas are different from what you'd expect. They're quite thick, with big chunks of chicken (or whatever you get in them) and are cooked so the tortilla is crispy - great combo of flavors and textures. The burritos, nachos, etc were just decent otherwise. I've noticed that this place becomes a nightclub at night which is hilarious.
author: Sung P.

description: I grew up on crispy tacos, but for the longest time I was told these were for Taco Bells in middle America.  Not so at Nicks!  The food is excellent, the atmosphere is quirky and appealing.  Problems: Hit it at the wrong time, and you will find it crowded as hell, and of course, parking is teh suck.
author: Peter V.

description: Forget the tacos!  Get the SALAD! MMMM... not that the tacos are not good, cuz they're delicious... but, I'm telling you ... the SALAD is BOMB!  I seiously eat it at least 2 times a week!
author: Noneya B.

description: I usually don't write on Yelp but felt I had to about Nick's Crispy Tacos.  Went for the first time last nite.  Taco Tuesday nights.  So good!  so cheap!  they don't skimp on anything.  Actually, maybe I shouldn't write about this since I don't want others to know but then if not a lot of people go then this place might eventually close (unlikely).  Oh the reviewer's dilemma!
author: Maple L.

description: Make sure you order a crispy taco, if you order anything else you just wasted your money. Crispy tacos at Nick's.... everything else, go to el farrolito on 24th and mission.
author: danny e.

description: We're always looking for good Mexican food, even if it's not traditional.  This place was very disappointing.  Even my eleven year old, who will eat anything described as a "taco" thought this place was lame.  I would only eat here again if I was with someone who loved it, and even then I'd only eat enough to be polite.
author: Jennifer T.

description: I'm a fan of the tacos, get them Nick's Way (crispy) they are pretty effin' good, and more filling than they look.  I'm a big eater and two tacos and some chips and salsa is all I need.   Don't order anything else here, the other food is pretty sub-par.  But go for the tacos and you'll enjoy them.   I mean, the Mission is still the place to go for tacos and burritos, but this place ain't bad.
author: Big Toe ..

description: I am a fan, I love the tortilla soup - mmmm sooo good. And I am very picky about my guacamole and this place does it right, no filler. What I don't like it that sometimes it smells like bathrooms/disgusting vomity bar. One time it was so bad that we had to leave and go to Miller's East Coast West up the street instead. But the food, amazing!!!
author: sarah k.

description: For me, Nick's nachos are my favorite. I'm sure they're super fatty, but man that cheese sauce is killer! I am also a long time fan of Reno and staff!
author: kristen n.

description:
Not quite sure what to make of this place. The weird nightclub ambience makes you feel like you're in for munchies after an all-night bender. 

Coming from San Diego, I hold a high standard for cheap Mexican eats. While the tacos and burritos are fair, its not worth the price in the grand scheme for the quality. You're better off with a taco truck. Altogether, not a bad place if you're really craving Mexican (not a whole lot of those in Nob Hill or Pac Heights), but not a destination unto itself by any means.
author: Deuce B.

description: I usually forget about Nick's since it's not within my day-to-day circle of home to work. However, I try to go out of my way to go there when I can. There are lots of tasty items on the menu, but my favorite is the shrimp taco-topped off with some delicious guacomole. Add a mexican coke to that and i'm good to go!
author: Kelly M.

description: I wanted to love this place. I really did. The taco just wasn't that good. Bland. The service was REALLLY bad. The spot is fun and cute, I have to say. Maybe I was there on a bad day :(
author: Pink G.

description:
I've been living in San Francisco for 5-years and have been going to Nick's almost weekly.  When I first moved here my roommates and I would go on Tuesdays for reggae and Mexican food.  It was crowded but not terrible.  

In the past year Nick's has been capitalizing on the bridge and tunnel crowd and doing a R&B dance music "taco Tuesday" night which has drastically changed the atmosphere.  If you're looking for good Mexican food to go, I'd say Nick's.  If you want to be in a crowd of early 20 somethings with fake stuff (you know what I mean) Tuesday night is your night.  

Two years ago I would have rated this a 5.  Now it's a 3 solely for the atmosphere.  The food is still great, don't get me wrong.
author: Amber T.

description:
give me a pescado taco "nick's way" & a three dollar margarita and i am a happy, happy girl.

seriously, those fish tacos are just too delicious for words. oh yeah, and the chicken nachos pretty much rule too.

if you haven't been here, i feel sorry for you.
author: Jana G.

description:
Pretty good food at Nicks.  However, it smells like barf because its also a bar called Rouge.  

So Nicks should get its own store to counteract that factor.
author: Richard C.

description: so after waiting half an hour for my fish burrito, taking it home only to realize that they used a defected tortilla that is missing one giant hole in the middle and the fish is falling out causing me to eat it with a fork, and then getting violent food poisoning that made me miss work for 3 days, i have come to the conclusion that i will not be returning to nick's salmanella-laced tacos.
author: Sami B.

description: Close 2nd to La Taqueria.  Order the tacos "Nick's style" - they are fabulous.  Don't miss the elote - corn done up Mexican style with cheese and lime.  So yummy!
author: Teresa H.

description: i love their fish tacos- however i do not like MAYO.  Which is bad because when it comes with their baha-sauce (their *zesty* lime aioli)  it's SMOTHERED. I've asked for it without sauce and sometimes they get it right....most of the time they don't :(  We always get their tacos to go while at work- and most of the time they arrive not so cripsy.  I actually sat down in person to see if it was crispier- and there wasn't much of a difference!    if you want a place to go on a hot summer day.... a place where you can have something fresh paired up with a nice beer- this is it!
author: Tracy B.

description: Ah, Nick's! Who would have ever thought eating in a night club would be this good? The taco salad, the tortilla soup, the burritos...it is all fantastic. You can never go wrong here and you can't beat the price!
author: A D.

description: I love love love the carnitas taco, baja fish taco, and veggie taco, all done Nick's way.  YUMMY I want one right now....
author: L C.

description: Oh yeah. OH YEAH. everything said is true. I only had the tacos, but I loved them. Nick's way (makes you wonder wy its called "Nick's Crispy Tacos" if you have to order them that way specially) is great. Yum.
author: Adam L.

description: Having eaten at Nick's on several occasions, I just can't wait to go back! What a delicious deal!
author: J G.

description: I used to really like these tacos, craved them ... or maybe they just satisfied my fried food quota.  ?  Whatever it was, the feeling has faded.  The tacos are still better than a lot of shops in the city but they just don't WOW.  The restaurant has this weird sort of energy too ... I can't really explain it.  It might help if the staff smiled more.
author: C C.

description: Nick's is americanized tacos.  As long as you're fine with that, you'll like this place.  If you want more authentic mexican, go elsewhere.  The tacos here are okay, nothing remarkable.  If you like guacamole, then get them nick's style, because they plop a buttload of it on.  The best part about this place are the cheap drink specials during happy hours.  You can get some good and strong drinks for cheap.  It can be difficult to find seating in this place.
author: Justin S.

description:
I recently took a friend from nyc here, and as always was challenged to take her somewhere that showed off my city.  We were going for a casual, late afternoon haven't eaten since last night kind of a place.  When you first walk in it does feel  a little like a club with all the chandeliers and velvet rope - there's even a chandelier in the creepy painting.  The people that served us were friendly and it was mildly busy.  We got our taco order pretty fast and decided to share some nachos with the group.  The tacos were insanely good with the "crispy" living up to the name - and I especially loved the slab of guacamole they put on them.  
What made the meal complete was the nachos - they don't skimp on the toppings and I couldn't stop eating them even though my meal was enough.  I was able to send my friend off to nyc envious of my newly found taco joint.
author: Kristina C.

description: ohhh myy godddd. this place was amaaaaaazing. i made a yelp account just so that i could review this place. found it on yelp. made my way there (eff muni for taking 83434439535 hours) on taco tuesday. the place is so cute inside rouge's bar. looks like a good place to go with a group as well and have some beer =]! cash only, bleh. crispy fish taco... 8O [WOW]. also equally amazing carne asada taco. fresh! yummy! hot! made to order and far from the likes of SFs other taco destinations. this place DOES NOT DISAPPOINT.
author: Miss Piggy C.

description: When I crave for some really good tacos the first place I think of going to in the city is La Taqueria in the Mission BUT since I'm always about trying new things I suggested Nicks Crispy Tacos. It was about 8PM on a Friday night and thankfully we found parking within 5 minutes and just a block away. There was a short line to order your food at the counter. As we were waiting in line I just realized where we were....it was club Rouge! Now I don't know if this place is still a club later on at night but I do remember coming here with the girls for a drunken night of fun. I remember the chandeliers and the big bar...what a strange place for a taco spot! Anyway, the hubby and I each got 2 tacos. He had 2 carne asada (one Nick's Way w/cheese & guac and made crispy and the other regular soft). I ordered 1 carnitas and 1 pollo asada (Nick's Way). We grabbed out number and looked around for a seat or for people who looked like they were about to leave. We ended up sitting at the bar. As I looked around it seemed like a fun place for a casual dinner with a small group of friends. Alot of these small groups were ordering pitchers of margaritas....ahhhh margaritas sound so good.....too bad I can't have any for at least another 3 months. Our tacos came and they looked yummy. First couple of bites I already knew that these could not compare to our favorite La Taqueria tacos. The hubby strongly agreed. Not even close! They weren't bad...but just not as flavorful. I'm not even sure if I would go back for the food. I mean maybe if we were meeting up with some friends there for some drinks as well but definitely not just for the food. Looks like La Taqueria is still #1 on my list...
author: BrElla4eva H.

description: I love this place! This is by far the best Mexican restaurant I've been to. I recommend the steak nachos (my usual), quesadillas and of course the tacos. I come here once a week since its a few blocks from my place. It gets crowded on Tuesdays because of the discount they offer, so there is usually a line. So, on Tuesdays the best time to go is before 6pm. Besides that, this is place to go if you're hungry and want consistently good food.
author: Robin T.

description: i love tacos! i love nicks crispy tacos even more! ..... great tacos, great prices, great drinks, friendly staff ... what more can i say? i come here as often as i can! salsa is delicious and the carne asada is off the chain! beware of lonnnnnnnng lines during lunch and dinner!
author: Frankie L.

description: Even though Nick "borrowed" some recipes from La Taqueria on 25th and Mission this place is bomb. If you know anything about Taqueria's in the city  you know that not many do taco's the crispy way with one tortilla soft and one crispy with melted cheese in between. La Bomba!!! The Pescado taco Nicks Way is probably the best taco I've ever had and the tortilla soup is great too! Even though Nick is no longer affiliated with the place Pete does a great job of keeping the food true to it original style. For food on upper Polk that is delicious as well as a great bargain this is the place to try!
author: Robert S.

description: Finally! NO RICE in my carne asada burrito. i almost thought i was back home in San Diego!
author: benjamin c.

description: Although 3 stars is actually a pretty good rating (something akin to a C+), this place has one HUGE flaw:  NO SCALABILITY.  It takes WEEKS to get an order in.  Are the tacos THAT good?  Frankly: Yes.  However, if some smart fellow decided to open a moble taco joint on the corner of Polk and Broadway....  hmmmmm....
author: Doug F.

description: Well, I didn't see no vermin in that thar kitchen, but if there were, they made one hell of a fried fish burrito.  I suggest getting in con vodo (w/guac & sour cream) and be sure to top it off w/the avacado salsa.  my friends were also equally happy w/the quesidilla, carne asada and grilled fish burritos.  Maybe we all ate rat, I don't know, but it tasted good to me.  I also suggest the Modelo especiale.  Beunos eatos!
author: Jimmy G.

description: Best tacos I've ever had - get them 'Nick's Way'.  So happy this is in my 'hood.  The place is dark and cosy and perfect for a hangover.  Also love the fact they serve Mexican coke.  Can't handle the sugar content in the American version - ugh.  I love how rough around the edges this place is - so refreshing to not dine in a chain-restaurant, especially when you're chowing down on tacos.
author: Cathy B.

description: I had heard great things about this place, so we gave it a try. The crispy tacos were good, along with the chips and salsa. However, I ordered without the cripyness and it wasn't so good- very bland. It is funny being in a place decorated with the chandeliers and how it transforms into a nightclub, eating cheap tacos. Makes it interesting. Glad we tried it, but probably won't return.
author: Heather I.

description: Great tacos! I love the tacos' "Nick's way." Great tacos, margies, salsa and guacamole. Extremely fresh, and yummy. I just wish it was closer to home.
author: Garrett J.

description: Thank god for this place. Came with high hopes on a Tuesday, left with a cured hunger from about 8 excellent taco's, a bunch of cheap Corona's, a couple good stories and a girl's number that was under "Amy Taco" when I woke up. Sweeeet.
author: Jeff P.

description: Simply outstanding.  Unreal burritos and chips & salsa.
author: Jake B.

description: Oh dear, they once got my order wrong and tried to give me the food for free!  They also gave me free nachos and drinks!
author: Fatloft B.

description: I like this place a good amount. Tacos Nick's Way are the way to go anytime after noon. Before noon hit up the breakfast burritos or tacos for a legit treat. Two reasons I didn't give the place formerly owned by Nick five stars, is their prices are a bit steep and they can get a bit overcrowded. I live a block away and pick up a crispy taco or two every couple weeks. Nice.
author: Eric W.

description: I haven't found a better place in the city. The decor of the place is a hilarious juxtaposition--looks like a nightclub but the plush red velvet is kind of fun.  besides, you're there for the food, which is amazing. The crispy tacos and burritos are fresh and well prepared. The guac left a little to be desired, but I'm admittedly picky with such important matters.
author: Tyler W.

description: This place has great cheap tacos. Make sure you get it Nick's way? I think that's what they call it. The only downside is that its only take-out.
author: Whitney R.

description: This is overpriced, inconsistent Mexican.  Sometimes it is OK, sometimes soggy and terrible.  And as another reviewer mentioned, sometimes it is just not even open, which has happened to me too - one night it looked like they had some private party on so it was closed up.  Pretty short sighted way to run a business.
author: James R.

description: the tacos are filling but they lack in the claimed "crispy" department. ordered nick's way, the first tortilla is fried to a hardly crispy state and then it's surrounded with another flimsy flappy normal tortilla. no thanks. but i would come back just for the elote. grilled corn on the cob with a heavenly blend of who knows what (mayo? and chili pepper or something?). i could just eat three of those while you eat your tacos.
author: Regina C.

description: Around from my hood, just had dinner there. Can't beat them after a long nite. Crispy is always better. Just hate the lines to wait for my food. Oh wells, lunch time is better.  Love the salsa.
author: kel w.

description: Nick's Crispy Tacos used to be right down the hill to where I used to live in SF. I used to go here all the time and I have to say they make some really tasty tacos! I really like their chicken as well as steak tacos in particular. Oh, and the hot sauce is delicious, particularly the green one. This taco place has a different feels than more typical South Bay Mexican spots but it's fun. It's got an older feel to it and is a popular bar spot at night. It's definitely a place to try out. Make sure to take some cash! (they don't accept debit/credit cards)
author: Priya P.

description: We first got introduced to Nick's Tacos by a cabby who made us wait in the cab, while he got a togo and was munching through it whole way, raving how good it is and we ought to try it soon. Good thing is she didn't make us pay for the wait time. Having said so, we had to try this place and boy...the Nick's crispy taco w/ grilled  chicken is just out of this world!!!!
author: Milli G.

description:
this place is alright if you like meat but don't go if you're vegetarian and/or don't love to eat a hunk of grated cabbage. really disgusting and little flavor. i don't know who makes the food but it's doesn't seem to authentic to me. it's sort of like people who like thai food and they think they can make something good and it just turns out bland and with the wrong ingredients. dude, who eats raw cabbage in mexico? i've never had cabbage in my taco in mexico. 

yeah, yeah, i know that everyone loves this place. that's cool. it's just poser mexican for me and i'm happy to hold out for something better. 

also, the "scene" at this place is really lame. it can be amusing to check out the frat boys and the trampy-attired ladies but ya know, it would be better if the food wasn't so bad.
author: joseph j.

description: Food mediocre at best.  What makes it horrible is bugs and it smells like a sewer.  On top of that the service SUX.  For whatever reason the owners think it is really cool to have only one person working the counter so everyone can wait 15 minutes so it appears to be crowded.  Forgot to mention I saw some drunk guy on Sunday pissing in the sink because he couldnt wait.
author: John H.

description: "It's a Tuesday! Why is it so packed?!" Well, indeed it was the infamous taco tuesdays and that's exactly why we went here.  I read the reviews for this place and they all said that it could get packed.  But my ignorance led me to believe that there's no way it could be that packed on a cold night in November on a weeknight.  We decided to just stay and give it a try.  So for the first timers--you stay in line, order your food, and they give you a number.  If you go on a Tuesday, expect to stand or wait at least 15-20 min for someone to get up from their empty pitchers of margaritas and empty food baskets.  The food was quick.  I ordered 1 carne asado taco, and 1 pollo taco-both nick's way.  Definitely worth it for $.95 more.  They have 2 for $6 coronas and I was satisfied with that.  The tacos are $2 and a pretty good size.  Honestly, I wouldn't mind going on any other night just to get a good seat and not feel like a huge dork standing next to all the hot guys stuffing my face w/ a guacamole covered taco asking them to pass the salsa.
author: CeeCee W.

description: i love their Fish Tacos,Elote...it's so damn good!good service and generous food serving!i will definitely eat here again.
author: Ces T.

description: Food here is great, although I think it used to be a bit better, but very tasty all the same. I wish they'd put soap in the bathrooms and keep them cleaner!!!
author: Jason E.

description: I came to Nick's today after having eaten across the street at Little Thai (yet again) to meet up with some friends. The decor is really wacky. Red lights, chandeliers, and disco balls add to the funkiness. Definitely a happening place. But then again, it was Taco Tuesday, where you get tacos for $2 or something like that. In any event, there was a line nearly out the door (which is extra crazy, because the counter is very very far away from the door) and absolutely no free tables. I would guess, that everyone participating in this mad feeding frenzy was under the age of 30. Well, give or take a few years. Anyway, you get the point. A good mix of Marina/ Mission crowd. Probably because it's Russian Hill, the perfect hybrid. I ended up having a margarita, which was decent. I tried samples of the extra crispy (and overly oily) chips doused with salsa and guacamole. Not bad, not great. I am not really a big chips and salsa fan so I am probably overly harsh. I do like the hot sauce they put on the tables though. I would probably squirt that stuff down my throat if I were drunk enough. Luckily it didn't quite reach that point. So why just three stars? First off there were not enough tables to accommodate the taco craving masses. We were actually forced to share a table with strangers (gasp) and converse with them (double gasp). Not that I mind meeting new people, but seriously, if they are going to have Taco Tuesdays, they should provide more tables! Another issue I had was that the waiter kept trying to take away the hot sauce bottles on our table, even though I was clearly enjoying squirting the stuff down my throat....
author: Kate A.

description: Not good, and this is coming from a Mexican.  If there was a zero star option they'd get that.  Burrito was horrible (I only ate a third of it before I decided it wasn't worth eating), as was their salsa, mushy tomatoes are not ok in summer, I strongly suspect the salsa was from a bottle or can.  Soggy rice, beans were bad also, I strongly believe these were from a dented can.  Will definitely not eat there again.
author: D C.

description:
some san francisco foodie snobs like to bag on us yelpers for supposedly reviewing only hole-in-the-wall, cheap, "ethnic" joints.  what the heck?  are we only supposed to review posh, michelin.starred establishments?  the ritz carlton only has so many restaurants, you know?  so who _are_ these anti.yelp wannabe restaurant critics?  i'm not sure.  however, i realise there _are_ other places to hear about restaurants.  now, i can't say if they're better places to hear about restaurants or not.  well, one place i sometimes find out about restaurants is on pbs kqed's _check_please!_ television show.  my wife watches more tv than i do.  i had watched this show in the past, but i rediscovered it while sitting around with my wife at home during my lunch break from work one day.  yeah, i'm blessed with living close to work and thus can often eat lunch at home, a five.star establishment.  anyway, in case you don't know on _check_please!_ three, normal, non.professional restaurant critics get together and pick three restaurants to introduce to the group as well as the viewing audience.  i suppose you're supposed to pick a restaurant that isn't too obvious.  usually, the group is nice to the first person that introduces his/her restaurant.  then as the show progresses, they start getting meaner and meaner.  then by the last of the three, they're totally bagging on each other's tastes in food.  maybe it's because they drink wine as they talk, and that loosens up the lips over time or something.  in the past, some of my friends said i ought to go on that show.  if i were to go on that show, i really wonder which restaurant i would pick.  in order for it not to be too obvious, maybe it ought to be a santa clara koreatown restaurant.  however, i'm sure the other two in my group would be philistines that don't understand korean food.  after all, i watched a desi guy try to introduce an indian fusion restaurant and some dude that thought he knew indian food tried to rip him up just to be a jerk.  i'm glad that doesn't really happen on yelp.

anyway, i found out about nick's crispy tacos from an episode of _check_please!_.  one girl introduced the restaurant, praising its tortilla soup and well... crispy tacos.  i thought they said each taco had two tortillas, one crispy one within one soft one.  immediately, i thought about the taco bell double decker taco.  ah, crud... now, the san franciscan foodie snobs are throwing their arms up in the air and then pointing at me, shouting and screaming, because i dared mention "taco bell" in the middle of a restaurant review.  hey, i'm not the first on this page!  uh, did i dig a deeper hole?  anyway, the other two; since this was the second or third of the three restaurants on the episode; started to bag on this restaurant, saying that the food was messy and nothing special.  from the show, i knew that the restaurant was located in club rouge niteclub.  i knew it had the whole red, palace theme (not "red palace," all one word.  that sounds like some place in russia or china... oh, but a wiki says it's a place in birmingham, england).  i think i also heard on the show that this is a cash.only joint.

well, this past saturday, my wife had us go to a training session for the academy of friends annual gala.  we worked there on sunday night, selling drink tickets to guests of this black tie benefit for aids/hiv research; apparently, a huge san franciscan tradition on academy awards night.  well, after the training session, we strolled around the marina and then drove over to nick's crispy tacos.  god granted us a prime parking spot right in front of this joint.  the restaurant looked just as it had on tv.  just as i had remembered from the show, they were cash.only; and i never carry that much cash.  i'm a credit card kind of guy because i like to monitor my spending on mint.com.  i realised my limited cash supply would place a firm ceiling on my lunch experience.  i only had $15 to feed the both of us.  since we weren't super hungry, i agreed with my wife that we could just share three tacos.  i ordered one carne asada, one carnitas, and one grilled fish taco.  the polite, young woman behind the counter asked if i wanted them nick's way; but i couldn't afford the additional 95 cents.  aw, crud... now the san franciscan foodie snobs are again jumping up and down and pointing at me.  yeah, i must admit that it's hard to experience an eating establishment fully if you can't buy a complete meal, etc.  thus, i must preface the rest of my review by saying that i hope to return to get the full experience and write a better review.  well, the menu just said that nick's way would add guacamole and cheese to my tacos, and i figured i could do without those for now because i had ingested plenty of homemade guacamole the night before.  i did _not_ realise that forgoing "nick's way" would eliminate the double decker taco feature!  oops! (continued in the next entry and on benomix.com)
author: beno h.

description: Lazy weekend, watching the Patriots as Randy Moss is on my 1st place Fantasy Football team.  A break in the action, let's see, I can be green and slow foodie if I walk a few blocks to Nick's and I am sort of craving a Pescado Taco, "Nick's Way."  Yesterday was a superb Swan's Crab Salad to go, I was in Shanghai, China last weekend so I'm upping my local faves and my old stand by, a Pescado taco and a carne asada burrito TO GO.  It's around 7:15, the place is packed but the ordering line moves reasonably briskly, staff knows how to handle ... then I get home and my order is 100% INCORRECT.   The receipt is right, but when I get home it's 2 carne asada TACOs Nick's Way ... Aw, bummer dude ... do I want to just make the best of a sad situation, eat the incorrect order, no Pescado taco cravings addressed and no carne asada burrito which I paid for ... nope, I'm not going gas up the Lexus just to go a couple of blocks and deal with the crowd but really, bummer dudes, I had my heart set, you've never, well once before a long time ago, did you mess up on a take out order so blatantly ... I did check that there were 2 items in the bag but it was hecka crowded and I guess that should be a tipoff to REALLY verify your order but really, is that my job?  Ahahaha ... will take it up with Nick's next time ... maybe I should have gone for the pizza with the 2 for 1 coupon next door?  Ah Nick's you really let me down on my kick back, watch football and bask in the Shanghai last weekend afterglow with my Pescado ... OH NO !!!
author: Terry A.

description: i'm really glad nick's is not convenient to either work or home, otherwise i might develop an addiction and need to spend years in rehab recovering.  actually, spending a few years in rehab might be nice.  unless i had one of those psycho roommates who goes off the edge and stabs you with a hairbrush in your sleep.  that would suck.  no, i'll stick to my occasional visits, thank you very much.  nick's is good, but it isn't stab me with a hairbrush good.
author: Samantha W.

description: Best Tacos in SF for sure. Amazing chips and salsa! Excellent beer specials (even on Friday nights). The decor, although slightly too much disco-velvet for my taste, is great and very comfortable. My ONLY complaint is that the place is closed on random nights (like every other sunday evening) for events and it is difficult to know when they are closed. The restaurant also closes early at night to become a nightclub so it is not a place for late night food (at 9 or 10 - I think). Parking is moderately tough, though i never have to park too far away.
author: casey f.

description: Should re-name to Dirty Crispy tacos!  The tacos are greasy and this place feels so dirty.  If you need a taco go to panchos on polk street instead.
author: jena h.

description: again...this is a special trip for me to experience mw's recommendations in  yelp...really miss him alot because he is great company  in so many ways...lovethierwarm fishcrispytacos.Iwish i can be in places again where he had suggested and new more places he discovers......
author: cecille p.

description: Went for Taco Tuesdays last week and will NEVER go again.  The bus boy ignored our three attempts to get him to wipe our table, then we realized he didn't speak a single word of english. Seriously.  When we ordered our food, they gave us eight individually wrapped tacos with NO label or way to differentiate chicken from beef etc.  The problem was that one of the people in our group has an allergy to cilantro.  We went to the counter to ask them to help us and they very snidely replied that 'this has never been a problem before.'    The tacos were mediocre at best and the staff was very rude.  Don't waste your time.
author: Maryke D.

description: More on the American side of Mexican food, but I really liked it. The steak quesadilla and nachos are my favorite of the things I have tried.
author: Zak M.

description: atmosphere sucks...it was werid when i came here b/c i'm so use to seeing this place as a club only. the fish tacos nick's way is to die for. the best i ever had. nachos were only okie, but after having the fish taco i just keep my mind off of it. it's a small taco, but very fulfilling.
author: Karen H.

description: i LOVE their fish tacos..... and get 'em Nick's way
author: Joanne H.

description: i love the tacos here "nick's way" which is basically a crispy taco w/ a soft taco shell wrapped around it and includes guac and sour cream, yum, yum.  get the guac and salsa w/ chips, and you will not be disappointed.  also good are the quesadillas, which are definitely unconventional.  i like the quesadilla here, b/c i am not a fan of cheese, and i did not taste any cheese at all.  the tortilla is also very buttery and flaky and almost pastry-like.  the only downside of this place is that it closes at 9 pm when rouge opens.  i always end up getting here at 855, so i have to get carry out rather than eat there.
author: Helen T.

description:
go on a Tuesday, have a few beers, get some fried fish and chicken tacos and be happy. (only nicks way)

life is easy to over think...this place keeps it simple and gets it right.
author: Andrew P.

description: been missing it for so long!  the fish taco's amazing!  and they had a really hot waitress there a couple years ago w/ a shanghainese accent, oh wait, that's my sister.  oops.
author: Eric A.

description: I'm intimately familiar with Mexican food, so I didn't expect much from Nick's. I was pleasantly surprised first, at the interior design and second, with the food quality. The inside was comfortable and kitschy and the tacos were tasty with a choice of two completely different salsas. A very welcome experience for $3.00 a taco!
author: P K.

description: Probably needless to say among all the other reviews but this place is awesome. The tacos are good (albeit a bit expensive) and it's a taco stand inside a cheesy red velvet night club. Gotta love the pinatas hanging from the chandeliers.
author: Brenda S.

description: good tacos and burritos.  seating is kinda dingy and dark b/c it's a club at night.
author: Aaron S.

description: after wandering by about a zillion times, i had me the fish tacos, ooooh baby, a new love, fresh, tasty morsels of filet down my throat ... the steak taco two days after missed the mark, but a quick bite before or after work washed down with a ice cold one is hard to pass up ...
author: tim y.

description: YUM. I love the extra-greasy quesadillas, super good salsa, and chandeliers+picnic tables decor. Exquisite.
author: Jessi C.

description: my 2nd kitchen -- Keep the reggae rollin and the steak quesadillas flowin.  tacos are great, get em nicks way.  sunday happy hour is very nice  -- give me a marg and a beer please.  fin
author: J I.

description: This review is probably just pouring it on.  Great Mex-American Mexican food.  Everybody loves the chips, salsa & guacamole.  Get your tacos Nick's Way, Get your Horchada on, just get yourself to Nick's...NOW.
author: The P.

description: This place couldn't have been named any better.  I'll give it a full 5 stars for the name.  Ok ok.  Honestly it's about 4 stars.  Great food, great prices, great service.  The fried fish (pescado) and the grill fish tacos were both great.  I actually think I like the pescado more.  Next time a little lighter on the mayo though.  The carnitas taco was also good.  Nice big chunks of pork.  The tacos here are stuffed so full, there's no way to eat them without having any of it falling onto the table.  Good stuff.  5 tacos 1 coke de mexicana, and a bottle of water for a little over  20 bucks.  Killer deal.  Only better fish tacos I've ever had are at New Moon Natural Foods in Tahoe City.
author: Nick H.

description: The fish taco was pretty good, but not amazing. The veggie taco was boring. They were out of margarita's at the Nick's counter so we got them from the bar. Weird. Reasonable food, reasonable price, but nothing worth going out of your way for.
author: Susie M.

description: I took an out of town visitor here late last year and now we are both a big fan of the fish tacos, baja style (Nick's Way).  The mahi mahi is deep fried in a thick golden brown batter and topped off with cabbage, salsa, fresh pico and wrapped in a corn (or flour) tortilla.  It's good stuff, and basically filling with just one, but if you're really hungry go ahead and get two.  They're really cheap -- about $4 bucks or so each.  I tried the tortilla soup and didn't really care for the flavor, but the soup ingredients were fresh and had hearty portions.  I tried the fish burrito baja style, and the batter clumped together and got really mushy before I was halfway through the burrito.  I also tried a chicken dish and wasn't a big fan of the texture or flavor.  The atmosphere and decor are a bit cheesy, from the floating fish pinatas to the large and gaudy chandeliers, but the waiters and cashiers are down to earth and usually pleasant, so it all makes for a pretty laid back place to grab a bite to eat.  If you go, I recommend the fish tacos (I'd definitely give them 4 stars).  For the restaurant as a whole, I'm going to have to go with 3 stars, since I'm not as excited about the other menu items.
author: LaSha G.

description: The carne quesadilla is so dammed good I sometimes dream about it at night. I don't let anyone speak to me while I eat this treasure so I don't overload the senses.
author: Chris W.

description:
realy like the mexican food here.  deep fried fish tacos are really genuine.  i love the gucamole and chips as well.  high-calorific foods.

prices are great.  parking is tight but not impossible.  place is huge but not too sanitary.  lunch crowd queue can be long.
author: tc h.

description: The food is good but it's too crowded now.  4 years ago Nick's had 6 tables and 3-4 people in line at the busiest times.  It was fast take out  and perfect for nights I didn't want to cook or wanted to eat out quickly. I'm glad business is good but it's time to open another cash register.  15-20 min lines for tacos isn't worth it.  And the phone is always busy if you call ahead.  Either open up more cash registers or hire servers and leave the counter for take out.
author: Ben D.

description: if heaven could be folded into a deep fried tortilla, nicks crisp would be it....
author: Colette V.

description: Nick's has gone downhill the last few months.  Last couple of times I was there the tacos were a soggy mess, and the ingredients did not seem to be as fresh as they used to.  Also, the counter service ranges from indifferent to rude.
author: Richard M.

description: if white man invented mexican food this is what it would look and taste like. this place blows goats. yuppies everywhere are PUMPED.
author: Tim B.

description: i give nick's a 3.5. tacos were tasty...but i like my ethnic food in ethnic enclaves at ethnic prices. ya dig?
author: sarah i.

description: amazing pescado burrito.  picked it up quickly to-go, friendly service. this will be a frequent stop for me from now on.  highly recommended.
author: Matt M.

description: I wouldn't exactly call 'em crispy... More like greasy, but they were still really really good. You have to get em Nick's way, otherwise they are kinda bland, basic tacos.
author: jenny s.

description: Ugh. I like this place and eat here occasionally. I stopped in this afternoon to pick up some late lunch for myself and my gf. It was smooth sailing until I got home and three bites into my burrito, I discovered a clothing tag in my mouth. I kid you not. I thought it was a T-shirt, but it was size 26 (and made in Pakistan), so I think that it's a pair of pants. It didn't taste very good. I called over there to let them know that I found a tag in my burrito and they were very nice and offered to make it up to me, but the remainder of my burrito and the gf's tacos went in the trash. This place still gets two stars because of positive experiences in the past.
author: local c.

description: I was in town for a few days from Chicago, and Nick's came highly recommended. I got the fish tacos, nick's way, and I have to say that it was amazing! They load it with a whole lot of fish and a nice serving of guacamole on top. Great portion size. I could barely eat two and I have a pretty hefty appetite for small little girl! Get there early, if you're trying to take advantage of their specials on Tuesdays ($2 tacos, $2.95 if you want it Nick's way) because the line is LONG...but it does move fairly fast. The long line, crowded atmosphere and lack of seats may discourage you, but it's well worth the wait. Another minor downside...I would pass on the horchata and grab a corona instead. It was extremely chalky...and to be honest, difficult to drink. But who knows, maybe it was just a fluke and perhaps a bad batch. Also, take note...if you go on a Tuesday, the special doesn't apply to the fish tacos nor to "to-go" orders. Overall, it's a place you have to try!
author: Mar S.

description: Notice that most of the people who aren't giving Nick's four or five stars are not getting the Pescado Taco Nick's Way.  The lime juice on top of the fried fish combined with guacamole and  whatever kind of sauce they use is a great combination.  My only complaint is that it is a little pricier than it should be.
author: Luke P.

description: go watch "I Love you Man". then remember that scene with fish tacos.... "they have the best fish tacos here!"
author: Victor W.

description: Went to Nick's for the first time last Friday evening - ordered the nachos with chicken, and it was absolutely disgusting.  Cold chicken bits over chips covered in what looked and tasted like store-bought nacho cheese out of a jar.  Honestly, gross.  This review is solely based on the nachos - haven't yet tried their highly spoken about tacos.
author: S S.

description: The tacos and burritos are real good and cheap but what really caught my attention was the style. As soon as I stepped in it knew the place had nightlife. There's big chandeliers hanging and there's a spinning table for the DJ off to the side. It was definitely a cool place to eat tacos.
author: Jacob A.

description: This should have been the first review I wrote on Yelp, and I'm ashamed to say it took me several months to get around to it.  My roommate and I stumbled upon Nick's while we were still in apartment-hunting mode, and for several months before we could move in, we conjured up grandiose happy hour plans involving $2 drinks and famous crispy tacos.  When we finally took up residence (right up the road, conveniently), we began a Thursday evening Nick's tradition that took on a life of its own.  There is something about the combination of neighborhood taqueria juxtaposed against sleazy crushed red-velvet that makes the Nick's experience totally unique.  The tacos and burritos are delicious, and if you linger long enough over your $2 drinks, you get to watch them transform the place from Nick's-crispy-tacos to Rouge-the-nightclub. This fascinating process involves removing the dining room tables from the dance floor, taking down the sombreros hanging from every wall, covering all the booth tables with white tablecloths, dimming the lights, and of course, jacking up the drink prices. It is quite an interesting experience (further enhanced by four hours of happy hour drinks under your belt), and if you ask nicely, they'll let you linger in your booth without having to re-enter or pay a cover charge.
author: Chelsea R.

description: great food at a great price. The dining area is a step back in time, perhaps to the '50's.
author: J J.

description: a taco in a club, a club with tacos.. margaritas in a club with tacos, tacos with tacos, grrrrrrrreat tacos. love this place, really nice people who work there. def get them "nicks way"
author: Scott K.

description: Big, tasty tacos for a couple of bucks?  I had the pollo asada, pescado, and veggie.  All equally delicious.  It's dirty, and the woman begging me for change in the bathroom was beyond sketch, but the food is good and cheap, atmosphere fun, and drinks are just a short walk to the bar.
author: laurie r.

description: nick's...russian hill wouldn't be the same without you! i like the vegetarian tacos and the weird cabbage-y goodness that lies inside. the vegetarian burrito is okay, but it's not crispy. i guess  it's called nick's crispy tacos for a reason.
author: Oleya P.

description: yum! went on a friday night and there was no line.  service was quick.  i had the chicken taco's nick's way and was not disappointed.  can't wait to return!
author: Lauren V.

description: white-people mexican food at it's finest.  the only thing i ever get here are the soft tacos, NICK'S WAY.  i've tried the chicken, pork and fish and the chicken is the best.  the burritos here are not great.  stick to the tacos or just go to the mission
author: Natalie H.

description: 5 stars for the tacos, no question.  have to take one star off because we went here friday night and got kicked out of our table at like 8:30 because they were preparing to bridge and tunnelasize the place into rouge...it was actually pretty funny, they were bringing out all these buckets for champagne and putting cheesy little chocolates on these crappy tables.  oh, but the two dollar margs were pretty tasty even if we had to stand up and chug them before we went across the street.
author: Michael N.

description: pretty tasty nachos, carne asada quesadillas and carne asada tacos...definitely get it "nick's way"... went here after boozing it up in Sonoma....so it definitely hit the spot...only problem is the lack of adequate amount of chairs and tables...and the line was crazy...but definitely worth it...
author: Christina L.

description: Love the Nick's style Crispy Fish Tacos. The quesadillas are yummy, although a bit greasy. The service isn't the friendliest and the prices are kinda steep, but I still find it worth it! I wouldn't recommend a margarita though ... it was small and nasty. Coulda been a bad 'bartender,' I suppose.
author: Devin P.

description: i don't get it.  from what i can tell, this is a slightly subpar greasy taqueria that for some strange reason shares space with a skeevy nightclub.  it smells vaguely of cleaning solution and the bathrooms are unacceptable (worse than a real taqueria, even.  more like late-night at a club).   i enjoy the booth seating and full bar, but for my dinner, i'd rather go to the mission or even la parilla.
author: nicole l.

description: I don't get the big deal about Nick's Crispy Tacos. I've been going here on and off for years because everyone else seems to love it, and everytime I wonder why we keep coming back. The tacos are mediocre and bland and they almost always get the order wrong. I always find it a little unappetizing to see the inside of a club with all the lights on - you see the dirty finger print smudges all over the poles, mirrors, etc. and have to worry about how sanitary it is to be eating there. It's really cold inside and one night we were all shivering so much that it really detracted from being able to enjoy each other. One good thing going for them: there are always good looking men coming in and out of this place, so for all the single ladies, it may be worth putting up with a less than stellar meal.
author: Cher E.

description: pretty good stuff. better than panchos thats for sure. they use to be kinda yuppie styled burritos and tacos but I think they learned and grew since the old owner sold it. (hated that guy!) But the chips are the best and teh fish tacos are great. they increased the size of their burritos and its pretty good.
author: Gordon L.

description: Can't go wrong here - especially with $2 tacos on Tuesdays!  Yes, a bit of a scene - but still worth it.
author: Callie C.

description: Man this place is great....for all of you saying Oh these tacos set me back $9 buxs...eh...thats about what you'll pay for some crappy taco in the mission.   These tacos are by far the best I've ever had...they are big, delicious and well worth the $3.  Forget the mission....go to Nick's Crispy Tacos!!!!!!! Way to go NIck
author: Maria L.

description: Can't give any more than 3 stars to this place. The tacos were ok but nothing more. Service needs improvement and the way orders are placed when it's your first time is really confusing...kinda of half ass way of doing things. Don't plan on going back.
author: John C.

description: the tortilla soup is of greatness most days but sometimes it tastes like lime juice.   fish tacos (pescado) are outstanding.  their other tacos are great too, and i'd recommend trying one done nick's way.  also, it's a unique space cuz it's one and the same place as Rouge, which explains the red walls, red upholstery, chandeliers and the u-shaped bar.  Always good reggae and good margaritas goin on too.
author: Jonny L.

description: it's not authentic, but it's really good!  make sure you get the tacos "nick's way".  they really need to improve on their hot sauce though, it's so mild, no kick whatsoever.  coming here during the day will also show you just how beat up club rouge is (becomes a club at night).
author: R K.

description: Not to be the downer here but the food is awful. They two stars are for the guys that work there, they are pretty cool. Also, Nick's doubles as a nightclub at night which throws me off because 1 side of the place is decked out in picnic tables and such and the other side in plush red velvet booths. Quite the awkward setting for a restaurant. because of that, you really can't and shouldnt take Nick's seriously in terms of a good place to eat. Another positive though is that when the club/restraunt....the bar we'll call it, has happy hour, you can get pretty sauced for really cheap, and I mean REALLY  cheap!
author: Sarah I.

description: Price was decent, food was ok, atmosphere not great (kinda dirty, since it's a club at night).  Tacos are quite big.  I would recommend just getting one first, try it out before ordering more.  Also, get the Nick's style, so you get the big-o slab of guac
author: grace C.

description: My lady pals, and brad took me here for the traditional birthday lunch. i was very impressed. the fish tacos are delish. the pollo one... somewhat bland.. but still ok. we got them nick's way which means there is alot of guac and two shells. i will be taking the boyfriend there next.
author: Rhonda Y.

description: the pescado taco nick's way is one of the best tacos ive ever eaten!
author: Molly C.

description: The wait can be intense (especially on Taco Tuesdays), but it is so worth it.  The atmosphere is fun and high-energy, and the decor is interesting.  Tacos Nick's Way are yummy yummy, the quesadillas are gooey cheesy deliciousness, and the chips/salsa are pretty good too.  A fun happy hour spot with great Mexican food.
author: Jesha C.

description: Theres only one way to eat a taco here: Nicks way or the highway! Stop being a cheap ass and pay that extra dollar for the most orgasmic taco ever, which is only heightened by the red and green sauces they have out on the tables. During happy hour they always have beers for $2. What more do u want besides tacos and beer!?!? I once tried to be different and got a burrito and was highly dissapointed. Stick to the tacos. plain and simple. There guacamole is great too. If u don't want to make the trek all the way out to the mission and possibly be infected with swine flu for some bomb ass Mexican food. Nicks is the way to go!
author: Kush P.

description: this place is great. good prices, delicious food, and excellent service. not much else to say, really. fun menu, good drinks, great staff! highly recommended. great mex food.
author: Matt C.

description: Been coming to Nick's for a long time.  Love the carnitas tacos w/cheese (not quite "Nick's Way") and the quesadillas.  I'd give the food 5 stars, but the staff gets 2 stars.  Aside from the guy who manages the place (I'd give staff 1 star if it wasn't for him) it seems that most of the people who work there couldn't give a crap about the customers.  Plus, they invariable screw up orders that really aren't all that complex.  Maybe we have been unlucky, but it seems that we almost always catch something that we didn't ask for.
author: Ramsey G.

description: Great Saturday spot after you've had a few drinks the night before. Service is quickk and their quesadillas are the best I've had in SF. Don't forget to ask for the red and the green salsa.
author: CK W.

description: Nick's uses fresh ingredients.  I love the soup, and the salad and the drinks are always fresh and tasty.  Huge burritos.  Good fish tacos.  I woudn't call this authentic, but it is good.  Bathrooms could be cleaner.
author: Grace R.

description: my order here every time is the elote, a cheese quesidilla and pescado taco.  cant be beat.  i would give five starts but sometimes (last night) the cheese quesidilla was more like a buttered tortilla, but the elote and taco were delicious
author: B H.

description: only get the fish taco's nick's way here.  the meat is just average but the fried fish is phenomenal.
author: a g.

description: been a regular for 5 years. they memorized my order. i love the food here, place is a club a night.  staff is cool, food came out fast. no problems with this place ever.
author: Tony P.

description: Awesome fish tacos. Probably the best fish tacos i've had. The crispy friend fish, with the guacamole in a crispy taco shell .. mmmm
author: Aloke F.

description: Good stuff at Nicks. One of the few truly convenient places to eat well. Stop in, order some tacos ( I prefer the fried fish Nick's way) and get out all in under 20 minutes. Atmosphere is strange as it turns into a club at around 9 when they will pretty much kick you out. They have discounted tacos (Taco Tuesdays) and drinks/beers on Tuesdays but only for basic tacos and the place becomes an overcrowded madhouse. The City needs more places like Nicks. I've never had anything but the tacos and two of them are plenty for one person.
author: steve g.

description: came here for taco tuesday and had really low expectations for the food; i was mostly excited for margaritas. i was expecting like those taco bell hard taco shells, but they were actually freshly fried corn tortillas. yummy! and with guacamole and sour cream, i'm in heaven. i recommend the carnitas and carne asada tacos. i would even go there sober!
author: N. M.

description: okay, i've only been once, but the amount of guac they pile on the chips and then on top of the tacos is just great. in my opinion, you really cannot go wrong with a place that makes their own chips. and thank god the menu is more than burritos...
author: Rachel L M.

description: We have eaten here at least 25 times and it is ALWAYS good, I mean the definition of consistent. I wish it was a little cheaper, but that is only because I am poor and I want to eat here more.
author: JA C.

description: Dude.........the tacos here make me smile each time I devour them. They're soooo good. Try the chicken and steak taco. They're my favorite.
author: Jimmy T.

description: After reading all these reviews, I feel very gringo saying it, but I like Nick's. No, it's not a Mission taco, but I don't pan Mission tacos because they're not LA tacos, either. Bottom line is I'm willing to drive to and park in Russian Hill to have the grilled chicken tacos Nick's way. The ingredients are not rocket science, but who else puts 'em together this way? They're uniquely good (the burritos and non-Nick's way tacos, feh, not so much). Also like the tortilla soup on a cold day, and the tawdry nightclub ambiance suits my mood on many a hungover Sunday.
author: Midori S.
