description: i always order the pescado, nick's way.  it's a great place to grab lunch when i work from home.  there are always people and the food comes out pretty quick.  super yummy.
author: Jennifer K.

description: Great food all around.  I'm a fish taco person and their grilled fish tacos are tasty and excellent (even if you're watching your calories)!  Their burritos, tortilla soup and even their quesadillas are phenomenal.
author: Heather T.

description:
Love Nick's food ... BUT here's an ALARMING maragarita related discovery ... on Friday night we went to grab some drinks before heading out ... the Nick's side was packed so we went to the ROUGE SIDE ... we ordered 4 Patron margaritas and sipped away happily UNTIL - ( dun, dun dun ... enter movie music ) we asked for the check ... the bill read $40.00 ( ok no biggie, we live here - we're no strangers  to the $10.00 drink  .. I get it ) but then we noticed an additional  $6.00 sur charge at the bottom of the bill??  Hmmm that's odd, we thought - so we asked the bartender about it and he said - "I don't make the rules and besides - I only charged you a  $6.00 surcharge, it shouldve been $8.00"  ( $2.00 per drink)"  Reeeally, for what exactly??? Let me get this straight, we're already paying for the top shelf booze but now you're bending us over because we bought it??  Hmmm there's a SOLID  business strategy ! He tried to placate us with  "for happy hour on the Nick's side, the well drinks are only $ 3.00."  yeh well, the thing is pal - last I checked, it's not happy hour and I'm not paying $3.00 per drink in this example - so explain why this is helpful? 

My question is  - how many happy go lucky, unsuspecting boozers are paying the additonal cash w/o even realizing it?? Obviously this is not a bank breaker it's just the principle ....  I'm sure this adds up over the course of a weekend ... the question to management is, why are you being shady to customers who support and love you and your margarita's ??? In the future I'll think twice before buying a margarita on the Rouge side again ...  Tommy's anyone?? ;)
author: Aimee J.

description: Good tacos! cheap price !! especially for Happy hours. they have every day $2 for Beer and well drink for $3..
author: Grace C.

description: I love this place, the taco's are always so good. Nick's way is the best combo cuz the guacamole is soooo good. My favorite is the fish taco. The only negative is the prices are kinda high.
author: Stella G.

description: Definitely the best crispy fish tacos I have ever had! They pack on the Guacamole and the taste is so savory!!! This place is a must!!!
author: Kristen T.

description: Yes, it's not exactly the most authentic Mexican food but it is freaking delicious!!! I no longer live in SF but every time I am home, I go out of my way to eat at Nick's Cripsy Tacos. I prefer to eat in vs taking out as the food just tastes better to me that way and you get way more chips and salsa. The chips and salsa are amazing as are the salsas they have on the table. My favorites however are the breakfast tacos (only on the weekends) and the carnitas tacos, Nick's way. And yes, Nick's Crispy Tacos is in a nightclub - it's genius.
author: RC H.

description: I HEART NICK'S.  I live a few blocks from Nick's and could eat there a few times a week.  The Pescado buritto is the best buritto in SF.  I also like the fish taco nick's way and the cheese quesadilla.  Ask for the spicy sauces.
author: B K.

description: A taco stand in a night club.  I went during the change over so there was only take out.  I got a grilled fish taco.  It was good once I got it but it took a log time and at $4.30 was a bit pricey.
author: Melanie -.

description: Totally kickass fish tacos. And the salsas are rock star delicious.
author: Sarah Y.

description: me thinks this is a strange place. it is the most wonderful strange place in all the land. a lounge-ish laid back bar with a part time taco stand on the side. the best tacos ever. tijuana street vendors got nothin on these. the only thing that would make it better is later hours and the acceptance of plastic. they taste the best when eaten down the street on the small brick wall in front of the nail salon that sells shoes. that place is weird.
author: Ben L.

description: Fabulous tacos!  Especially "Nick's Way" deep fried fish taco (Baja) and carnitas.  Try the margaritas at the bar during happy hour, $3.  The ambience is straight out of a Fellini movie.
author: Raquel M.

description: Red velvet interior, thumping music, and $2 tacos/chips/quesadillas/beers on Tuesday.  This is awesome cheap mexican food in a cool setting.
author: Robb M.

description:
sooo good! 

first time you go you are hooked and cannot stop thinking about the yummy tacos and corn.
author: n. h.

description: Great tacos and Mexican food in the neighborhood. Atmosphere is not great though but you have to remember that it is a nightclub too.
author: Paul R.

description: Oh my God! Soooo good! I just had a chicken and then a carne asada taco, "Nick's way" (crispy, with guac and cheese). The best tacos I have ever had. Good size and alot of meat.
author: Natalie F.

description: i give NICKS three stars based on overall experience.  theres a lot to like about this place.  decent food, great location, and cheap!  sorry to say the staff there isn't the brightest, but i have a problem regularly with people not getting "it" especially when i'm very clear.  moving on.  my first time there was irratating.  the menu states at the bottom for X amount more you can get it "nicks way"  which includes "crispy".  DON'T try to identify whether non nicks way means the tacos are soft because bottom  line is they can't tell you lol!   and i've come to find there is no difference.  just order the meat you want and the topping you want and you'll be fine.
author: misskim f.

description: This is my favorite place to get taco's in SF.  I live in the Marina and will walk up to the hill to get taco's from Nicks!  Fresh flavor and great prices!  I recommend the the taco's "Nicks Way"!!
author: Sally S.

description: Nick's Crispy Tacos is a great place to eat and have fun. They have great carne asada tacos and pollo asada tacos. They have the best chips salsa guacamole in town!!!!! I often go to Nick's and pick up food to deliver to friends who work in the food business and think it is also a 5***** taco place.They have very nice friendly people working there and great Latino chefs. I can't wait to go back.
author: lisa c.

description: This place has some pretty good tacos, but it smells like a wet dishrag in there. Very unappetizing. Also, they only take cash. Not a good business practice.
author: Brian R.

description: Why isn't anyone talking about the rice!? I love love love rice at Mexican restaurants, so my boyfriend and I had to order a side of it last week, our first time at Nicks. It was really overpriced and seriously tasted like it was cooked in toilet water. It was horrible! How do you mess up rice?! I searched all these reviews and saw nothing bad (or good) about the rice so maybe it was just a fluke, but it was really disappointing. The chicken tacos Nicks Way were pretty good but nothing too amazing.
author: Yvie O.

description: Great fish taco, but horrible burrito.  My wife and I lived in the neighborhood for almost four years and after having one burrito here, we never went back until about a year ago.  We had heard about the fish tacos and once we had them, we went a couple times a month.  They are some of the best I've had.  Don't forget to order them "Nick's way"
author: William S.

description: On taco tuesday get to Nick's early! I went there last night and there was a long line to get food and all the tables were completely full. Happy hour starts at 5, that is a good time to get there; it seems like most people get there early and don't give up their table until the place closes. The food looked good though and the atmosphere was nice, great place to hang out and get a few tacos. Im definitely going next tuesday!
author: Brieanna S.

description: Ahhhh Nick's we've had some good times haven't we?  We've laughed, we've cried, well I've done those things at least, you're just a strangely decorated restaurant inside a bar with creepy piñatas hanging from the ceiling and over-sized sombreros hanging on the wall one of which fell on my head while I was eating a delicious veggie taco.  That was a run on sentence but you don't care, do you Nick's?  You love me anyway, and even though I've since left the neighborhood, and broke up with the boyfriend who shared my love of you, you'll always have a special place in my heart.  Fantastic tacos, that I always ordered too many of (seriously, if you ever see me in there remind me that no matter how hungry I feel, I can only eat 2).  Your salsa was always fresh, I still dream about your wonderfully greasy chips.  Maybe one of these days I'll stop in for old time's sake, until then Nick's....I'll never forget you.
author: Jennifer V.

description:
this place is Great.  and since that's what basically every other review here says, i won't waste your time babbling about the quick service, amazing sauces, tvs with relevant sports matches appearing upon it, and abundance of colorful pinatas (oh wait, i just did).  here's my schtick: while it's called nick's crispy TACOS, i truly believe you should purchase a queasadilla.  seriously.  you'll get SO much more bang for your buck, and they taste better than the tacos, anyway.  if you're really feeling beholden to my advice, get it carnitas (aka pork) style.

i know, i know.  we're getting into specifics.  but when it's so clear you're going to go anyway, we might as well get down to biznaz.  so, to review/add some new points in a summarized fashion:

*carnitas queasadillas.
*everything is better with guac and sour.  cough up the extra $1 or whatever.
*the pinatas are nice but do not punch at them.
*this place turns into rouge at 10 pm.  keep this in mind--sometimes you can't order and sit past 9:30.
*it's cheap.
*go there.
author: Mia A.

description: The place is basically mediocre relatively inexpensive Mexican food. They have $2 tacos on Tuesday which is an OK deal, but Nick's way (with guac and cheese) is extra. The burritos are decent because they don't load them up with rice and beans like some burrito places.
author: Varun B.

description: best deep fried fish taco!!! Rouge at night and rest. during the day...the seats are kind of gross...but good food and fast.
author: Vickie W.

description: yay! finally some decent mexican food! coming from sothern california, i've become this sort of  spanish connoisseur. in my humble opinion, most places in the mission don't even compare. there are themed nights pretty much every night-- "fat" tuesday ..."wet" wenesday ect ect. seating is a little rough, but expected when they are selling delicious $2 tacos and margaritas.
author: Jessica U.

description: i gotta say im feelin this place. i figured it'd be a wack taqueria for whiteys made by whiteys but the food is good. well i only get one thing when i go here, the carne asada quesadilla and its the bomb. i need to try something else someday but i dont know if i will. pretty cool atmosphere in here.
author: Wats C.

description: I could give Nick's 5 stars just for the breakfast burrito.  Or I could give them 5 stars for their amazing $2 ($3 nick's way) tacos on Tuesdays.  Well maybe that would be 4 stars because the wait can be pretty bad.  But they are just so tasty with the crunch shell, mouthwatering meat, and heaps of guacamole.  And you KNOW I would have to give them 5 stars for all of the times I managed to make it to the end of 'taco time' and got to witness the transition to rouge.  I have seen people smashing tacos in their faces at one table stopping only to wash them down with bud lights while the next table over had a white tablecloth and a bunch of girls with bottle service going on.  WHAT?!  Gotta love it.  I could also give them 5 stars for their accessibility for football games on Sundays!  You can eat awesome mexican food, drink $10 pitchers of anything or $2 bottles of buds while watching an array of assorted games on their 5(+?) tvs.  Sometimes you don't want to stand up watching an entire game with that drunk guy constantly elbowing you in the back for his own balance sake, and you should come here when you want to avoid that.  I don't know if its a blessing or a curse that I live a block away from here.
author: Kelly O.

description: i've really tried to figure out what the big deal is about this place because all my friends love it.  the tortilla soup isn't bad, but other than nick's crispy taco, i'll take a trip to the mission any day over this.
author: M D.

description: I had to open an account just to rave about Nick's Crispy Breakfast Taco.  I have long been a fan of all their tacos Nick's way, and their amazing quesadilla's, but this morning I experienced the breakfast taco for the first time.  It's a crispy corn shell in a soft corn shell with an egg over easy, Spanish potatoes, cheese and salsa.  I added carne aside and guacamole.  Oh My God, it was heaven!  Not since the Cantina from my UCSB days have I been so utterly thrilled with Mexican food for breakfast.  If you've ever eaten at the Cantina you know that's a strong statement because the breakfast burrito is easily 7 out of 5 stars.  I also got a side of beans because they went well scooped into the the taco as well as with the stuff falling out of the taco.  They also have a breakfast burrito and quesadilla but I have not tried them.  Don't know if I will get the chance because the taco is that good.
author: Pamela M.

description: the food was really good, but not as orgasmic as i expected. i guess my expectations were just too high after reading all the reviews. ah well! my friend and i shared the nachos w/carne asada and the pollo and carne asada tacos (nick's way). worth trying if you're in the area, but i wouldn't go out of my way to eat there.
author: Haim C.

description: ahh the crispiness of nicks tacos. this is a great place to go if you're really drunk and want some tacos. it lives along side a ton of russian hill bars. going with a group is tons of fun. it also turns into a bar at night - strange.
author: Miss O.

description: great fish tacos.  nick's way is the way to go!  yet, the charge extra for the upgrade, which i think is just a way to get a buck out you.  i got 4 fish tacos (2 nick's way) and spent 21 dollars.  wow!!  only draw back at this place is the prices.  oh yea, the seating is extremely poor.  so better get to go.. or sneak it into ny pizza next door.
author: Indira M.
